original: arahattamaggena…pe… na paccāgacchatī”ti, na ca puthujjanānaṃ dassanena pahātuṃ sakkuṇeyyā
analyzed: na paccāgacchati iti na ca puthujjanānam dassanena pahātum sakkuṇeyyā
translated: the defilements that are abandoned by the path of arahatship are not re-abandoned, not re-entered into, not re-approached” .🔽And it is not possible to say that they are not abandoned by the vision of the worldlings,

original: itaresaṃ na kenaci paccayena paccayo hontīti sakkā vattuṃ “diṭṭhiṃ assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: itaresam na kenacid paccayena paccayaḥ honti iti sakkā vattum diṭṭhim assādeti abhinandati
translated: and that they are not conditions for the others by any condition.🔽“He delights in the view, he approves of the view,

original: taṃ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi vicikicchā uddhaccaṃ uppajjati. Vicikicchaṃ ārabbha
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi vicikicchā uddhaccam uppajjati vicikiccham ārabbha
translated: and on that account lust arises, and view, doubt, and agitation arise. On account of doubt,🔽doubt, view, and agitation arise” .

original: vicikicchā diṭṭhi uddhaccaṃ uppajjatī”ti diṭṭhivicikicchānaṃ uddhaccārammaṇapaccayabhāvassa🔽vuttattā. Ettha hi uddhaccanti uddhaccasahagataṃ cittuppādaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Evañca
analyzed: vicikicchā diṭṭhi uddhaccam uppajjati iti diṭṭhi vicikicchānam uddhacca ārammaṇa paccaya bhāvassa  vutta ttā ettha hi uddhaccam ti uddhacca sahagatam cittuppādam sandhāya vuttam evam ca
translated: Because it is said that view and doubt are conditions by way of object for agitation,🔽for in this passage “agitation” is said with reference to the consciousness associated with agitation.

original: katvā adhipatipaccayaniddese “diṭṭhiṃ garuṃ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṃ garuṃ
analyzed: katvā adhipati paccaya niddese diṭṭhim garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum
translated: And thus it is said in the description of predominance conditions: “He delights in the view, he approves of the view, he esteems it,🔽he decides upon it,

original: katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjatī”ti ettakameva vuttaṃ, na vuttaṃ “uddhaccaṃ
analyzed: katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati iti ettakam eva vuttam na vuttam uddhaccam
translated: and lust, and views arise,” but it is not said that agitation arises. So although what is to be abandoned by seeing and by development is threefold as past, future, and present,

original: uppajjatī”ti. Tasmā dassanabhāvanāhi pahātabbānaṃ atītādibhāvena navattabbattepi🔽yādisānaṃ tāhi anuppattidhammatā āpādetabbā, tesu puthujjanesu vattamānā dassanaṃ
analyzed: uppajjati iti tasmā dassana bhāvanāhi pahātabbānam atīta ādi bhāvena na vattabba tte pi  tāhi anuppatti dhamma tā āpādetabbā tesu puthujjanesu vattamānā dassanam
translated: the state of their not arising should be sought in the kind that is to be abandoned by seeing and by development.

original: apekkhitvā tena pahātuṃ sakkuṇeyyā dassanena pahātabbā, sekkhesu vattamānā bhāvanaṃ🔽apekkhitvā tāya pahātuṃ sakkuṇeyyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā. Tesu bhāvanāya pahātabbā🔽sahāyavirahā vipākaṃ na janayantīti bhāvanāya pahātabbacetanāya nānākkhaṇikakammapaccayabhāvo
analyzed: apekkhitvā tena pahātum sakkuṇeyyā dassanena pahātabbā sekkhesu vattamānā bhāvanam  apekkhitvā tāya pahātum sakkuṇeyyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā tesu bhāvanāya pahātabbā  sahāya virahāḥ vipākam na janayanti iti bhāvanāya pahātabba cetanāya nānā kkhaṇika kamma paccaya bhāvaḥ
translated: In the case of ordinary men, the defilements that occur are to be abandoned by seeing, since they can be abandoned by that when it is given attention in the way beginning “When what exists, what is due to conditions coming to be does not exist? With the cessation of what does what cease?”🔽In the case of those in training, the defilements that occur are to be abandoned by development, since they can be abandoned by that when it is given attention in the way beginning, “When what exists, what does not exist? With the cessation of what does what cease?”

original: na vutto, apekkhitabbadassanabhāvanārahitānaṃ pana puthujjanesu uppajjamānānaṃ sakabhaṇḍe
analyzed: na vuttaḥ apekkhitabba dassana bhāvanā rahitānam pana puthujjanesu uppajjamānānam saka bhaṇḍe
translated: The defilements that are to be abandoned by development do not generate kamma-result when the companionship of the defilements that are to be abandoned by seeing is absent. So the condition by way of kamma-result of the volition that is to be abandoned by development is not stated.

original: chandarāgādīnaṃ uddhaccasahagatacittuppādassa ca saṃyojanattayatadekaṭṭhakilesānaṃ
analyzed: chanda rāga ādīnam uddhacca sahagata cittuppādassa ca saṃyojana ttaya tad ekaṭṭha kilesānam
translated: But in the case of ordinary men, the lust, etc., that occur in their own property, and the consciousness accompanied by agitation, are fetters. And the three fetters, the single remaining inherent tendency,

original: anupacchinnatāya aparikkhīṇasahāyānaṃ vipākuppādanaṃ na sakkā paṭikkhipitunti uddhaccasahagatadhammānaṃ
analyzed: anupacchinna tāya aparikkhīṇa sahāyānam vipāka uppādanam na sakkā paṭikkhipitunti uddhacca sahagata dhammānam
translated: Because they are not cut off, it is not possible to deny that they give results when their associates are not exhausted.

original: vipāko vibhaṅge vuttoti.
analyzed: vipākaḥ vibhaṅge vutto ti
translated: So the result of the states associated with agitation is stated in the Vibhaṅga.

original: Yadi evaṃ, apekkhitabbadassanabhāvanārahitānaṃ akusalānaṃ nevadassanenanabhāvanāyapahātabbatā
analyzed: yadi evam apekkhitabba dassana bhāvanā rahitānam akusalānam
translated: If that is so, then it follows that unprofitable consciousness, which is not to be abandoned by seeing and by development,🔽is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development.

original: āpajjatīti? Nāpajjati, appahātabbānaṃ “neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā”ti vuttattā,
analyzed: āpajjati iti na āpajjati appahātabbānam na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā ati vutta ttā
translated: It does not follow, because it is said that what is not to be abandoned is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development.🔽And because the unprofitable is incompatible in nature with what is not to be abandoned.

original: appahātabbaviruddhasabhāvattā ca akusalānaṃ. Evampi tesaṃ imasmiṃ tike navattabbatā
analyzed: a pahātabba viruddha sabhāva ttā ca akusalānam evam pi tesam imasmin tike na vattabba tā
translated: If that is so, then it follows that these unprofitable consciousnesses are not to be mentioned in this triad.

original: āpajjatīti? Nāpajjati cittuppādakaṇḍe dassitānaṃ dvādasaakusalacittuppādānaṃ dvīhi🔽padehi saṅgahitattā. Yathā hi dhammavasena saṅkhatadhammā sabbe saṅgahitāti uppannattike
analyzed: āpajjati iti na āpajjati cittuppāda kaṇḍe dassitānam dvādasa akusala cittuppādānam dvīhi  padehi saṅgahita ttā yathā hi dhamma vasena saṅkhata dhammā sabbe saṅgahitā ati uppanna ttike
translated: It does not follow, because twelve kinds of unprofitable consciousness shown in the section on consciousness are included by the two terms

original: kālavasena asaṅgahitāpi atītā navattabbāti na vuttā cittuppādarūpabhāvena gahitesu
analyzed: kāla vasena asaṅgahitā api atītā na vattabbā ati na vuttā cittuppāda rūpa bhāvena gahitesu
translated: “by seeing” and “by development.” For just as all formed dhammas are included by the term “formed dhammas,” so too the past, though not included by the term “present,” is not therefore said to be not to be mentioned in the triad of present dhammas.

original: navattabbassa abhāvā, evamidhāpi cittuppādabhāvena gahitesu navattabbassa abhāvā
analyzed: evam idha api cittuppāda bhāvena gahitesu navattabbassa abhāvā
translated: So too here, because there is none that is not to be taken up among those that are included by the presence of the arising of consciousness,🔽the fact that it is not to be taken up should be understood as not stated.

original: navattabbatā na vuttāti veditabbā. Yattha hi cittuppādo koci niyogato navattabbo
analyzed: na vattabba tā na vuttā ati veditabbā yattha hi cittuppādaḥ koci niyogataḥ na vattabbaḥ
translated: For where there is some arising of consciousness that is not to be taken up by appointment,

original: atthi, tattha tesaṃ catuttho koṭṭhāso atthīti yathāvuttapadesu viya tatthāpi bhinditvā
analyzed: atthi tattha tesam catutthaḥ koṭṭhāso atthi iti yathā vutta padesu viya tattha api bhinditvā
translated: there is a fourth alternative there too, as in the cases stated.

original: bhajāpetabbe cittuppāde bhinditvā bhajāpeti “siyā navattabbā parittārammaṇā”tiādinā.
analyzed: bhajāpetabbe cittuppāde bhinditvā bhajāpeti siyā paritta ārammaṇā āti ādinā
translated: So he should divide and make it fourfold in the arising of consciousness that is to be divided and made fourfold thus: “It may be not to be taken up, with a limited object.”

original: Tadabhāvā uppannattike idha ca tathā na vuttā.
analyzed: tad abhāvāḥ uppanna ttike idha ca tathā na vuttā
translated: But because there is none that is not to be taken up, it is not stated here in the way stated in the triad of the present.

original: Atha vā yathā sappaṭighehi samānasabhāvattā rūpadhātuyaṃ tayo mahābhūtā “sappaṭighā”ti
analyzed: atha vā yathā sa paṭighehi samāna sabhāvattā rūpa dhātuyam tayaḥ mahābhūtā
translated: Or just as, in the case of the materiality aggregate, the three great primaries are called “with impingement” because they are of the same nature as what impinges,

original: vuttā. Yathāha “asaññasattānaṃ anidassanaṃ sappaṭighaṃ ekaṃ mahābhūtaṃ paṭicca dve
analyzed: vuttā yathā āha asañña sattānam anidassanam sa paṭigham ekam mahābhūtam paṭicca dve
translated: according as it is said: “In the case of the non-percipient beings, there are two great primaries with impingement dependent on one great primary that is not to be apprehended as either with impingement or without impingement,

original: mahābhūtā, dve mahābhūte paṭicca ekaṃ mahābhūta”nti. Evaṃ puthujjanānaṃ pavattamānā
analyzed: mahābhūtāḥ dve mahābhūte paṭicca ekam mahābhūtan ti evam puthujjanānam pavattamānā
translated: and there are two great primaries dependent on two great primaries” , so too here,

original: bhāvanāya pahātabbasamānasabhāvā “bhāvanāya pahātabbā”ti vucceyyunti natthi navattabbatāpasaṅgo.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabba samāna sabhāvāḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbā ati vucceyyuḥ ti natthi navattabba tā apasaṅgaḥ
translated: and the lust, etc., that are similar in kind to those to be abandoned by development would be called “those to be abandoned by development.” So there is no risk of over-extension.

original: Evañca sati puthujjanānaṃ pavattamānāpi bhāvanāya pahātabbā sakabhaṇḍe chandarāgādayo
analyzed: evam ca sati puthujjanānam pavattamānā api bhāvanāya pahātabbā saka bhaṇḍe chanda rāga ādayaḥ
translated: And when this is so, then it is established that the lust, etc., occurring in worldlings in regard to their own property,

original: parabhaṇḍe chandarāgādīnaṃ upanissayapaccayo, rāgo ca rāgadiṭṭhīnaṃ adhipatipaccayoti
analyzed: parabhaṇḍe chanda rāga ādīnam upanissaya paccayaḥ rāgaḥ ca rāga diṭṭhīnam adhipati paccayo ti
translated: are a condition, by way of decisive support, for the lust, etc., occurring in regard to the property of others, and that lust is a condition, by way of predominance, for the views that are rooted in lust.

original: ayamattho laddho hoti. Yathā pana aphoṭṭhabbattā rūpadhātuyaṃ tayo mahābhūtā na paramatthato🔽sappaṭighā, evaṃ apekkhitabbabhāvanārahitā puthujjanesu pavattamānā sakabhaṇḍe chandarāgādayo
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ laddhaḥ hoti yathā pana a phoṭṭhabba ttā rūpa dhātuyam tayaḥ mahābhūtāḥ na paramatthataḥ  sa paṭighā evam apekkhitabba bhāvanā rahitā puthujjanesu pavattamānā saka bhaṇḍe chanda rāga ādayaḥ
translated: But just as the three great primaries in the form element are not really obstructive because they are not objects of the tactile consciousness,🔽so the lust, etc., occurring in worldlings in regard to their own property, are not really to be abandoned by development because they are devoid of the contemplation that is necessary for that.

original: na paramatthato bhāvanāya pahātabbāti bhāvanāya pahātabbānaṃ nānākkhaṇikakammapaccayatā
analyzed: na paramatthataḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbā ati bhāvanāya pahātabbānam nānākkhaṇika kamma paccaya tā
translated: Therefore, the lust, etc., are not stated to be a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the states to be abandoned by development that arise at a different moment.

original: na vuttā, na ca “dassanena pahātabbā bhāvanāya pahātabbānaṃ kenaci paccayena paccayo”ti
analyzed: na vuttāḥ na ca dassanena pahātabbāḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbānam kenaci paccayena paccayo ti
translated: And it is not said that the states to be abandoned by seeing are a condition, by way of any condition, for the states to be abandoned by development.

original: vuttā. Ye hi dassanena pahātabbapaccayā kilesā, na te dassanato uddhaṃ pavattanti,
analyzed: vuttāḥ ye hi dassanena pahātabba paccayāḥ kilesāḥ na te dassanataḥ uddham pavattanti
translated: and the rest are stated. The defilements that are to be abandoned by seeing are not found after the seeing has occurred.

original: dassanena pahātabbapaccayassapi pana uddhaccasahagatassa sahāyavekallamattameva dassanena
analyzed: dassanena pahātabba paccayassa api pana uddhacca sahagatassa sahāya vekalla mattam eva dassanena
translated: But the restlessness associated with the defilements that are to be abandoned by seeing is only the absence of a companion for the seeing.

original: kataṃ, na tassa koci bhāvo dassanena anuppattidhammataṃ āpāditoti tassa ekantabhāvanāya🔽pahātabbatā vuttā. Tasmā tassa tādisasseva sati sahāye vipākuppādanavacanaṃ, asati
analyzed: katam na tassa koci bhāvaḥ dassanena anuppatti dhamma tam āpādito ti tassa ekanta bhāvanāya  pahātabba tā vuttā tasmā tassa tādisassa iva sati sahāye vipāka uppādana vacanam asati
translated: The seeing does not cause the arising of the restlessness. It is not brought to the state of non-arising by the seeing. Therefore it is said that it is to be abandoned by development alone.

original: ca vipākānuppādanavacanaṃ na virujjhatīti.🔽Sāpi viññāṇapaccayabhāve yadi apanetabbā, kasmā “samavīsati cetanā”ti vuttanti tassa🔽kāraṇaṃ dassento āha “avijjāpaccayā pana sabbāpetā hontī”ti. Yadi evaṃ, abhiññācetanāya
analyzed: ca vipāka anuppādana vacanam na virujjhati iti  sā api viññāṇa paccaya bhāve yadi apanetabbā kasmā cetanā ati vuttanti tassa  kāraṇam dassentaḥ āha avijjā paccayā pana sabbāpetāḥ honti iti yadi evam abhiññā cetanāya
translated: So the statement that it produces a ripening when it has a companion of that kind, and that it does not produce a ripening when it does not have such a companion, is not contradicted.🔽If that is to be excluded from the state of being a condition for consciousness, why is it said that there are twenty-three kinds of volition?🔽Showing the reason for that, he says, “But all of them are due to ignorance.” If that is so, then it should be said that there are twenty-one kinds of volition together with the volition of direct-knowledge.

original: saha “ekavīsatī”ti vattabbanti? Na, avacanassa vuttakāraṇattā, taṃ pana itarāvacanassapi
analyzed: saha ekavīsati iti vattabbanti na avacanassa vutta kāraṇa ttā tam pana itara avacanassa api
translated: No, because the reason for not mentioning it has already been stated. But the reason for not mentioning the other kinds of volition is this:

original: kāraṇanti samānacetanāvacanakāraṇavacanena yaṃ kāraṇaṃ apekkhitvā ekā vuttā, tena🔽kāraṇena itarāyapi vattabbataṃ, yañca kāraṇaṃ apekkhitvā itarā na vuttā, tena kāraṇena🔽vuttāyapi avattabbataṃ dasseti. Āneñjābhisaṅkhāro cittasaṅkhāro evāti bhedābhāvā
analyzed: kāraṇam ti samāna cetanā vacana kāraṇa vacanena yam kāraṇam apekkhitvā ekā vuttā tena  kāraṇena yat ca kāraṇam apekkhitvā itarā na vuttā tena kāraṇena  vuttāya api avattabba tam dasseti āneñja abhisaṅkhāro citta saṅkhāro eva ati bheda abhāvā
translated: “Reason” is a synonym for “cause.” By the words “the same reason” he shows that the reason for which one is mentioned is the same reason for which the other should be mentioned, and that the reason for which the other is not mentioned is the same reason for which the one should not be mentioned. “The formation of the imperturbable is the formation of consciousness” because there is no difference between them.

original: pākaṭoti na tassa saṃyogo dassito.🔽Sukhasaññāya gahetvāti etena taṇhāpavattiṃ dasseti. Taṇhāparikkhāreti taṇhāya parivāre,
analyzed: pākaṭaḥ ti na tassa saṃyogaḥ dassito  sukha saññāya gahetvā ti etena taṇhā pavattim dasseti taṇhā parikkhāre ti taṇhāya parivāre
translated: “Reason” : by the word “reason” he shows that the reason for the statement of one is the same as the reason for the statement of the other, and that the reason for the non-statement of the other is the same as the reason for the non-statement of the one. The “unshakable formation” is the same as the “mental formation” , so he does not show a “formation” for the unshakable formation because it is not obvious.🔽“Having grasped it as pleasant” : by this he shows the occurrence of craving. “Surrounded by craving” : surrounded by craving,

original: taṇhāya “sukhaṃ subha”ntiādinā saṅkhate vā alaṅkateti attho. Taṇhā hi dukkhassa samudayoti🔽ajānanto “aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ vā sahabyataṃ
analyzed: taṇhāya sukham subhanti ādinā vā alaṅkatā iti attho taṇhā hi dukkhassa samudayo ti  a jānantaḥ aho vata aham kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā khattiya mahāsālānam vā sahabyatam
translated: “adorned with craving” is the meaning. For craving is the origin of suffering.🔽Not knowing this, he forms formations thus: “May I, with the breakup of the body, after death, be reborn among the wealthy noble clansmen,

original: upapajjeyya”nti saṅkhāre parikkharotīti. Amaraṇatthāti gahitā dukkarakiriyā amaratapo,
analyzed: upapajjeyyanti saṅkhāre parikkharoti iti amaraṇa atthā ati gahitā dukkara kiriyā
translated: or among the wealthy brahmans or wealthy householders.” The difficult practice undertaken for the sake of immortality is the austerity of immortality,

original: devabhāvatthaṃ tapo vā, dukkhattā vā maro mārako tapo amaratapo. Diṭṭhe adiṭṭha-saddo
analyzed: deva bhāva attham tapaḥ vā dukkha ttā vā maraḥ mārakaḥ tapaḥ amara tapaḥ diṭṭhe a diṭṭha saddo
translated: or austerity for the sake of the state of a god, or because of suffering, is the austerity of Mara, the austerity of death. The word “not seen” in the verse

original: viya maresu amara-saddo daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: viya maresu amara saddaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: Or else austerity is Mara because it is suffering, and the austerity of the immortals is the austerity of the immortals, that is, of the devas, for the sake of becoming a deva. The word “immortal” should be regarded as like the word “unseen” in the passage, “The seen, the heard, the sensed, the cognized” .

original: Jātiādipapātadukkhajananato marupapātasadisatā puññābhisaṅkhārassa vuttā. Ramaṇīyabhāvena
analyzed: jāti ādi papāta dukkha jananataḥ maru upapāta sadisa tā puñña abhisaṅkhārassa vuttā ramaṇīya bhāvena
translated: The merit-making formation is said to be like a precipice of Mara because it generates the suffering of the fall of birth, and so on.

original: ca assādabhāvena ca gayhamānaṃ puññaphalaṃ dīpasikhāmadhulittasatthadhārāsadisaṃ,
analyzed: ca assāda bhāvena ca gayhamānam puñña phalam dīpa sikhā madhu litta sattha dhārā sadisam
translated: And the fruit of merit, which is taken as pleasant and agreeable, is like the flame of a lamp or the edge of a sword smeared with honey.

original: tadattho ca puññābhisaṅkhāro taṃnipātalehanasadiso.
analyzed: tad atthaḥ ca puñña abhisaṅkhāro taṃnipāta lehana sadiso
translated: And the merit-making formation, which has that as its object, is like the tongue that licks the honey.

original: “Sukho imissā paribbājikāya taruṇāya mudukāya lomasāya bāhāya samphasso”tiādinā sukhasaññāya
analyzed: sukhaḥ imissā paribbājikāya taruṇāya mudukāya lomasāya bāhāya samphassa uti ādinā sukha saññāya
translated: “Pleasant is the touch of this young nun’s tender, soft, downy arm,” and so on.

original: bālo viya gūthakīḷanaṃ kilesābhibhūtatāya kodhāratiabhibhūto asavaso maritukāmo viya
analyzed: bālaḥ gūtha kīḷanam kilesa abhibhūta tāya kodha arati abhibhūtaḥ maritu kāmaḥ viya
translated: The fool, like one who plays with excrement, and the man who is overcome by lust and hate, like one who is overcome by anger and grief and wants to die,

original: visakhādanaṃ karaṇaphalakkhaṇesu jigucchanīyaṃ dukkhañca apuññābhisaṅkhāraṃ ārabhati.
analyzed: visa khādanam karaṇa phala kkhaṇesu jigucchanīyam dukkham ca apuñña abhisaṅkhāram ārabhati
translated: and the man who wants to die, like one who eats poison, undertakes the demerit-making formation, which is disgusting and painful in its outcome.

original: Lobhasahagatassa vā gūthakīḷanasadisatā, dosasahagatassa visakhādanasadisatā yojetabbā.
analyzed: lobha sahagatassa vā gūtha kīḷana sadisa tā dosa sahagatassa visa khādana sadisa tā yojetabbā
translated: Or alternatively, the demerit-making formation should be construed as like playing with excrement in the case of that accompanied by greed, and as like eating poison in the case of that accompanied by hate.

original: Kāmaguṇasamiddhiyā sabhayassapi pisācanagarassa sukhavipallāsahetubhāvo viya arūpavipākānaṃ
analyzed: kāma guṇa samiddhiyā sa bhayassa api pisāca nagarassa sukha vipallāsa hetu bhāvaḥ arūpa vipākānam
translated: As the state of being a city of demons is a cause for the perversion of pleasure, so too are the immaterial resultants

original: nirantaratāya anupalakkhiyamānauppādavayānaṃ, dīghasantānatāya agayhamānavipariṇāmānaṃ,
analyzed: nirantara tāya dīgha santāna tāya a gayhamāna vipariṇāmānam
translated: because their arising and falling are not noticed owing to their uninterruptedness, and their change is not noticed owing to their long continuity,

original: saṅkhāravipariṇāmadukkhabhūtānampi niccādivipallāsahetubhāvoti tesaṃ pisācanagarasadisatā,
analyzed: saṅkhāra vipariṇāma dukkha bhūtānam pi tesam pisāca nagara sadisa tā
translated: and because they are a cause for the perversions of permanence, and so on, though they are in fact suffering due to the formations’ change. So they are like the city of demons,

original: tadabhimukhagamanasadisatā ca āneñjābhisaṅkhārassa yojetabbā.
analyzed: tad abhimukha gamana sadisa tā ca āneñja abhisaṅkhārassa yojetabbā
translated: and the volition of the imperturbable is like the going towards it.

original: Tāvāti vattabbantarāpekkho nipāto, tasmā avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ paccayoti idaṃ tāva siddhaṃ,
analyzed: tāva iti vattabba antara apekkhaḥ nipātaḥ tasmai avijjā saṅkhārānam paccayaḥ ti idam tāva siddham
translated: The word tāva is a particle expressing the speaker’s desire to say something more, so what is meant is: “Granted that ignorance is a condition for formations,

original: idaṃ pana aparaṃ vattabbanti attho. Avijjāpaccayā pana sabbāpetā hontīti vuttanti
analyzed: idam pana aparam vattabbanti atthaḥ avijjā paccayā pana sabbāpetāḥ honti iti vuttam ti
translated: but there is this further point to be mentioned.” The words “but they are all present when there is ignorance as condition”

original: abhiññācetanānaṃ paccayabhāvaṃ dasseti. Cetopariyapubbenivāsaanāgataṃsañāṇehi paresaṃ🔽attano ca samohacittajānanakāleti yojetabbā.
analyzed: abhiññā cetanānam paccaya bhāvam dasseti cetaḥ upariya pubbenivāsa anāgataṃsa ñāṇehi paresam 🔽attano ca sa moha citta jānana kāle iti yojetabbā
translated: show that the conditions for the kinds of consciousness beginning with direct-knowledge consciousness are ignorance and the rest. The words “knowing the minds of others and his own with the knowledge of penetration of minds and with knowledge of past lives and with knowledge of the future”🔽should be construed as follows: “knowing the minds of others and his own that are accompanied by delusion by means of the knowledge of penetration of minds and by means of knowledge of past lives and by means of knowledge of the future.”

original: Avijjāsammūḷhattāti bhavādīnavapaṭicchādikāya avijjāya sammūḷhattā. Rāgādīnanti rāgadiṭṭhivicikicchuddhaccadomanassānaṃ🔽avijjāsampayuttarāgādiassādanakālesu avijjaṃ ārabbha uppatti veditabbā. Garuṃ katvā
analyzed: avijjā sammūḷha ttā ati bhava ādīnava paṭicchādikāya avijjāya sammūḷha ttā rāga ādīnam ti rāga diṭṭhi vicikicchu ddhacca domanassānam  avijjā sampayutta rāga ādi assādana kālesu avijjam ārabbha uppatti veditabbā garum katvā
translated: “Because of delusion’s confusion”: because of confusion due to the delusion that conceals the danger in becoming, etc. “Because of greed, etc.”: the arising of delusion should be understood in the case of the relishing of greed, etc., associated with delusion. “Taking it to be weighty”

original: assādanaṃ rāgadiṭṭhisampayuttāya eva avijjāya yojetabbaṃ, assādanañca rāgo, tadavippayuttā🔽ca diṭṭhīti assādanavacaneneva yathāvuttaṃ avijjaṃ garuṃ karontī diṭṭhi ca vuttāti
analyzed: assādanam rāga diṭṭhi sampayuttāya eva avijjāya yojetabbam assādanam ca rāgaḥ tad a vippayuttā  ca diṭṭhī iti assādana vacanena iva yathā vuttam avijjam garum karontī ca vuttā ati
translated: should be construed with the delusion associated with greed, etc., and the relishing. And since the relishing is greed, and the view is associated with that greed,🔽it should be understood that the words “relishes” include the delusion stated above, which takes it to be weighty, and the view.

original: veditabbā. Rāgādīhi ca pāḷiyaṃ sarūpena vuttehi taṃsampayuttasaṅkhārassa avijjārammaṇāditaṃ🔽dasseti. Anavijjārammaṇassa paṭhamajavanassa ārammaṇādhipatianantarādipaccayavacanesu
analyzed: veditabbāḥ rāga ādīhi ca pāḷiyam sarūpena vuttehi tad sampayutta saṅkhārassa avijjā ārammaṇa āditaṃ  dassa iti anavijja ārammaṇassa paṭhama javanassa ārammaṇa adhipati anantara ādi paccaya vacanesu
translated: And by the words “greed, etc.,” he shows the object, etc., of the ignorance associated with the formations stated in the text in their own-nature.🔽In the case of the first impulsion, which has no ignorance as its object, he says “whatever” in order to include all that is not stated in the words “object condition,” “decisive-support condition,” etc., and also what is stated.

original: avuttassa vuttassa ca sabbassa saṅgaṇhanatthaṃ “yaṃ kiñcī”ti āha. Vuttanayenāti samatikkamabhavapatthanāvasena vuttanayena.
analyzed: a vuttassa vuttassa ca sabbassa saṅgaṇhana attham yam kiñci iti āha vutta nayena ati samatikkama bhava patthanā vasena vutta nayena
translated: “In the way already stated”: in the way stated under the abandoning of the fetter of being.

original: Ekakāraṇavādo āpajjatīti dosappasaṅgo vutto. Aniṭṭho hi ekakāraṇavādo sabbassa sabbakāle🔽sambhavāpattito ekasadisasabhāvāpattito ca. Yasmā tīsu pakāresu avijjamānesu pārisesena
analyzed: eka kāraṇa vādaḥ āpajjati iti dosa ppasaṅgaḥ vuttaḥ aniṭṭhaḥ hi eka kāraṇa vādaḥ sabbassa sabba kāle  sambhava āpattitaḥ eka sadisa sabhāva āpattitaḥ ca yasmā tīsu pakāresu a vijjamānesu pārisesena
translated: and because it entails the absurdity that everything would be of the same nature as that one cause.

original: catutthe eva ca vijjamāne ekahetuphaladīpane attho atthi, tasmā na nupapajjati.🔽Yathāphassaṃ vedanāvavatthānatoti “sukhavedanīyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati
analyzed: catutthe eva ca vijjamāne eka hetu phala dīpane atthaḥ atthi tasmai na nu upapajjati  yathāphassam vedanā vavatthānato ti sukha vedanīyam bhikkhave phassam paṭicca uppajjati

analyzed: ca rūpa manasikāra ādīsu cakkha ādi saṅghaṭṭana vasena cakkhu samphassa ja ādi vipariyāya abhāvato
translated: and in the case of the kinds of contact beginning with eye-contact, because there is no such thing as a non-concomitant of the impingement of eye, etc.,

analyzed: añña paccaya sāmaññe pi phassa vasena sukha ādi cakkhu samphassa ja ādīnam oḷārika sukhuma ādi saṅkara abhāvato
translated: and because there is no confusion of gross and subtle, etc., in the case of the kinds of contact beginning with eye-contact, pleasant, etc., by means of contact, even though there is a commonality of other conditions.

original: bhavo”ti iminā suttena taṇhāya saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvassa vuttattāti attho. Puna tassāpi
analyzed: bhavaḥ ti iminā suttena taṇhāya saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvassa vuttattā ti atthaḥ puna tassa api
translated: The meaning is that the cause of formations is stated by the sutta to be craving.

original: avijjā kāraṇanti dassanatthaṃ “avijjāsamudayā āsavasamudayoti vacanato”ti āha. Taṇhā
analyzed: avijjā kāraṇanti dassana attham avijjā samudayā āsava samudayo ti vacanato iti āha taṇhā
translated: In order to show that ignorance is the cause of that craving, he says, “because of the statement, ‘With the arising of ignorance there is the arising of the taints.’ ”

original: vā caturupādānabhūtā kāmabhavadiṭṭhāsavā ca saṅkhārassa kāraṇanti pākaṭāti suttadvayenapi
analyzed: vā catur upādāna bhūtā kāma bhava diṭṭhāsavā ca saṅkhārassa kāraṇanti pākaṭā ati sutta dvayena api
translated: Or else, craving and the taints of sense-desire, becoming, and views, which are the four kinds of clinging, are the cause of formations. This is clear. Therefore the two suttas show that ignorance is the cause of formations.

original: avijjāya saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvameva dasseti. Assādānupassinoti hi vacanena ādīnavapaṭicchādanakiccā🔽avijjā taṇhāya kāraṇanti dassitā hotīti. Yasmā avidvā, tasmā puññābhisaṅkhārādike🔽abhisaṅkharotīti avijjāya saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvassa pākaṭattā aviddasubhāvo saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvena
analyzed: avijjāya saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvam eva dasseti assāda anupassino ti hi vacanena ādīnava paṭicchādana kiccā  avijjā taṇhāya kāraṇanti dassitā hoti iti yasmai a vidvā tasmai puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādike  abhisaṅkharoti iti avijjāya saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvassa pākaṭa ttā avidda su bhāvaḥ saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: For by the words “contemplating pleasure” ignorance is shown to be the cause of craving, since its function is to conceal the danger .🔽Since the unknowing person forms the formations of merit, etc.,🔽it is clear that ignorance is the cause of formations. Therefore the unknowing person is mentioned as the cause of formations.

original: vutto khīṇāsavassa saṅkhārābhāvato asādhāraṇattā ca. Puññābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ sādhāraṇāni
analyzed: vuttaḥ khīṇāsavassa saṅkhāra abhāvataḥ asādhāraṇa ttā ca puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam sādhāraṇāni
translated: The formations of merit, etc., are common to the worldling and the noble disciple. But the formations of the noble disciple are not the cause of suffering, because he is free from the taints. Therefore the formations of the worldling are mentioned as the cause of suffering.

original: vatthārammaṇādīnīti puññabhavādiādīnavapaṭicchādikā avijjā puññābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ🔽asādhāraṇaṃ kāraṇanti vā attho daṭṭhabbo. Ṭhānaviruddhoti atthitāviruddho. Keci pana
analyzed: vattha ārammaṇa ādīni iti puñña bhava ādi ādīnava paṭicchādikā avijjā puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam  asādhāraṇam kāraṇanti vā atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo ṭhāna viruddho ti atthi tā viruddho keci pana
translated: The meaning may be regarded thus: the ignorance that conceals the danger in the meritorious, etc., kinds of becoming, etc., is a condition for the meritorious, etc., formations, as their specific cause.

original: “paṭisandhiādīni ṭhānānī”ti vadanti, evaṃ sati purimacittaṃ pacchimacittassa ṭhānaviruddho
analyzed: paṭisandhi ādīni ṭhānāni iti vadanti evam sati purima cittam pacchima cittassa ṭhāna viruddhaḥ
translated: Contradictory in its basis: contradictory in its non-existence. But some say that “the basis is rebirth-linking, etc.” If that were so, then the preceding consciousness would be contradictory in its basis to the succeeding consciousness,

original: paccayoti na idaṃ ekantikaṃ siyā. Bhavaṅgampi hi bhavaṅgassa anantarapaccayo, javanaṃ
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti na idam ekantikam siyā bhavaṅgam pi hi bhavaṅgassa anantara paccayaḥ javanam
translated: and it would not be a condition in any instance of rebirth- linking. For the life-continuum is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the life-continuum, and adverting is for the functional.

original: javanassāti, na ca sippādīnaṃ paṭisandhiādiṭhānaṃ atthīti na taṃ idha adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: javanassa ati na ca sippa ādīnam paṭisandhi ādi ṭhānam atthi iti na tat idha adhippetam
translated: And skill in crafts, etc., has no basis in rebirth-linking, etc., so that is not intended here.

original: Kammaṃ rūpassa namanaruppanavirodhā sārammaṇānārammaṇavirodhā ca sabhāvaviruddho
analyzed: kammam rūpassa namana ruppana virodhā sa ārammaṇa anārammaṇa virodhā ca sa bhāva viruddhaḥ
translated: Kamma is a condition that is contradictory in its individual essence as a condition for materiality, because of the contradiction between bending and being bent, and because of the contradiction between having an object and having none.

original: paccayo, khīrādīni dadhiādīnaṃ madhurambilarasādisabhāvavirodhā. Avijānanakicco āloko
analyzed: paccayaḥ khīra ādīni dadhi ādīnam avijānana kiccaḥ āloko
translated: Milk, etc., are a condition that is contradictory in its individual essence as a condition for curds, etc., because of the contradiction between the individual essences of sweet and sour tastes, etc. Light, whose function is to reveal,

original: vijānanakiccassa viññāṇassa, amadanakiccā ca guḷādayo madanakiccassa āsavassa.
analyzed: vijānana kiccassa viññāṇassa a madana kiccā ca guḷa ādayaḥ madana kiccassa āsavassa
translated: is a condition that is contradictory in its individual essence as a condition for consciousness, whose function is to know, and sugar, etc., whose function is to refresh, are a condition that is contradictory in its individual essence as a condition for a laxative, whose function is to purge.

original: Golomāvilomāni dabbāya paccayo, dadhiādīni bhūtiṇakassa. Ettha ca avīti rattā eḷakā
analyzed: goloma avilomāni dabbāya paccayaḥ dadhi ādīni bhūtiṇakassa ettha ca rattā eḷakā
translated: The cow’s hair and the contrary hair are conditions for the grass-blade, and the curd, etc., are for the earth-powder. And here the word “cow” is used for the cow’s hair.

original: vuccanti. Vipākāyeva te ca na, tasmā dukkhavipākāyapi avijjāya tadavipākānaṃ puññāneñjābhisaṅkhārānaṃ🔽paccayattaṃ na na yujjatīti attho. Tadavipākattepi sāvajjatāya tadaviruddhānaṃ taṃsadisānañca
analyzed: vuccanti vipākāya eva te ca na tasmai dukkha vipākāya api avijjāya tad avipākānam puñña aneñja abhisaṅkhārānam  paccayattam na na yujjati iti tad avipāka tte pi tad aviruddhānam
translated: And since they are only results of kamma, it is not proper for ignorance, which is the result of pain, to be a condition for formations that are not its result, that is to say, for the meritorious and the imperturbable.🔽But although they are not its result, ignorance is a condition for the unprofitable formations and for the formations that are similar to it, that is to say, for the meritorious and the imperturbable, because it is blameworthy, and it is not a condition for the others.

original: apuññābhisaṅkhārānameva paccayo, na itaresanti etassa pasaṅgassa nivāraṇatthaṃ “viruddho🔽cāviruddho ca, sadisāsadiso tathā. Dhammānaṃ paccayo siddho”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā tamatthaṃ
analyzed: apuñña abhisaṅkhārānam eva paccayaḥ na itaresan ti etassa pasaṅgassa nivāraṇa attham viruddhaḥ  ca aviruddhaḥ ca sadisa asadisaḥ tathā dhammānam paccayo siddhaḥ ti vuttam tasmā tam attham
translated: In order to prevent this misinterpretation, the words “contrary and not contrary, similar and dissimilar” are stated.

original: pākaṭaṃ karonto “iti ayaṃ avijjā”tiādimāha.🔽Acchejjasuttāvutābhejjamaṇīnaṃ viya pubbāpariyavavatthānaṃ niyati, niyatiyā, niyati
analyzed: pākaṭam iti ayam avid jāti ādim āha  viya pubba apariya vavatthānam niyati niyatiyā niyati
translated: So he makes the meaning clear by saying “Thus this ignorance” ,🔽and so on. The “coalescence of determinations” is the coalescence of determinations that have been defined by the order of sequence, like the “uncoalesced gems” in the Acchejja Sutta .🔽The “coalescence of determinations” is the coalescence, the coming together, of determinations that have been defined by the order of sequence, or it is the coalescence of determinations that have been defined by destiny, or it is the coalescence of determinations that have been defined by destiny itself.

original: eva vā saṅgati samāgamo niyatisaṅgati, tāya bhāvesu pariṇatā manussadevavihaṅgādibhāvaṃ
analyzed: eva vā saṅgati samāgamaḥ niyati saṅgati tāya bhāvesu pariṇatāḥ manussa deva vihaṅga ādi bhāvam
translated: With that coalescence of determinations, the states that have reached maturity as human beings, gods, birds, etc.,

original: pattā niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇatā. Niyatiyā saṅgatiyā bhāvena ca pariṇatā nānappakārataṃ
analyzed: pattā niyati saṅgati bhāva pariṇatāḥ niyatiyā saṅgatiyā bhāvena ca pariṇatāḥ nānā pakāra taṃ
translated: and it has reached the state of being determined by the conditions of destiny, kamma, and so on. It has reached the state of being determined by destiny, kamma, and so on.🔽They say that the meaning is this: “It has reached the state of being determined by destiny, kamma, and so on.”

original: pattā niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇatāti ca atthaṃ vadanti. Etehi ca vikappanehi avijjā
analyzed: pattā niyati saṅgati bhāva pariṇatā ati ca attham vadanti etehi ca vikappanehi avijjā
translated: And by these speculations ignorance🔽makes the mind unwholesome and occurs in any of the three ways beginning with merit.

original: akusalaṃ cittaṃ katvā puññādīsu yattha katthaci pavattatīti imamatthaṃ dassento āha
analyzed: akusalam cittam katvā puñña ādīsu yattha katthaci pavattati iti imam attham dassentaḥ āha
translated: Showing this meaning, he said

original: “so evaṃ avijjāyā”tiādi.
analyzed: saḥ evam
translated: “So, through ignorance” and so on.

original: Apariṇāyako bāloti arahattamaggasampaṭipādakakalyāṇamittarahitoti attho. Arahattamaggāvasānaṃ
analyzed: apariṇāyakaḥ bālaḥ ti arahatta magga sampaṭipādaka kalyāṇa mitta rahitaḥ iti atthaḥ arahatta magga avasānam
translated: The fool who has no guide: the meaning is, he is devoid of a good friend who is a candidate for the path of arahatship.🔽Or else, knowledge ending with the path of arahatship

original: vā ñāṇaṃ samavisamaṃ dassetvā nibbānaṃ nayatīti pariṇāyakanti vuttaṃ, tena rahito
analyzed: vā ñāṇam sama visamam dassetvā nibbānam nayati iti pariṇāyakanti vuttam tena rahitaḥ
translated: is called a guide because it shows the right and wrong and leads to nibbāna. He is devoid of that.🔽He has no guide.

original: apariṇāyako. Dhammaṃ ñatvāti sappurisūpanissayena catusaccappakāsakasuttādidhammaṃ
analyzed: apariṇāyakaḥ dhammam ñatvā ati sappurisa upanissayena catu sacca pakāsaka sutta ādi dhammaṃ
translated: Having known the Dhamma: having known the Dhamma that reveals the four truths through the support of a true person, such as the sutta that begins “Bhikkhus, all is burning” .

original: ñatvā, maggañāṇeneva vā sabbadhammapavaraṃ nibbānaṃ ñatvā, taṃjānanāyattattā pana
analyzed: ñatvā magga ñāṇena iva vā sabba dhamma pavaram nibbānam ñatvā tad jānana āyatta ttā pana
translated: Or else, having known nibbāna, the supreme state of all dhammas, through the knowledge of the path. But because the other realizations of the truths are dependent on that knowledge,

original: sesasaccābhisamayassa samānakālampi taṃ purimakālaṃ viya katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sesa sacca abhisamayassa samāna kālam pi tam purima kālam viya katvā vuttam
translated: they are spoken of as though they were prior, even though they are simultaneous.

original: Saṅkhārapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅkhāra pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Description of the clause on formations concluded.

original: Viññāṇapadaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽227. Yathāvuttasaṅkhārapaccayā uppajjamānaṃ taṃkammanibbattameva viññāṇaṃ bhavituṃ
analyzed: viññāṇa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā  yathā vutta saṅkhāra paccayā uppajjamānam tad kamma nibbattam eva viññāṇam bhavitum
translated: Description of the clause on consciousness🔽“The thirty-two kinds of mundane resultant consciousness are included” .🔽But in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”

original: arahatīti “bāttiṃsa lokiyavipākaviññāṇāni saṅgahitāni hontī”ti āha. Dhātukathāyaṃ
analyzed: arahati iti bāttiṃsa lokiya vipāka viññāṇāni saṅgahitāni honti iti āha dhātu kathā ayam

analyzed: pana  saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇena ye saḷāyatana paccayā phassena phassa paccayā
translated: in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”

analyzed: vedanāya ye dhammā vippayuttā te dhammā katihi saṅgahitā te dhammā
translated: in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”

original: asaṅkhataṃ khandhato ṭhapetvā ekena khandhena ekādasahāyatanehi ekādasahi dhātūhi
analyzed: asaṅkhatam khandhataḥ ṭhapetvā ekena khandhena ekādasahi āyatanehi ekādasahi dhātūhi
translated: in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”

original: saṅgahitā. Katihi asaṅgahitā? Catūhi khandhehi ekenāyatanena sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā”ti –🔽Vacanato sabbaviññāṇaphassavedanāpariggaho kato. Yadi hi ettha viññāṇaphassavedanā
analyzed: saṅgahitā katihi asaṅgahitā catūhi khandhehi ekena āyatanena sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā ati 🔽vacanato sabba viññāṇa phassa vedanā pariggahaḥ kataḥ yadi hi ettha viññāṇa phassa vedanā
translated: in the “Questions on the Unrelated” in the “Description of the Unrelated” in the “Questions on the Aggregates, etc.”🔽in the “Questions on the Unrelated

original: sappadesā siyuṃ, “vipākā dhammā”ti imassa viya vissajjanaṃ siyā, tasmā tattha abhidhammabhājanīyavasena
analyzed: sa padesā siyum vipākā dhammā ti imassa viya vissajjanam siyā tasmā tattha abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena
translated: and the place of origin is the place of origin of the resultant states, as in the answer to the question, “What is the origin of resultant states?” Therefore it should be understood that the consciousness, etc., with formations as condition are included there in the Abhidhamma too.

original: saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇādayo gahitāti veditabbā. Avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā ca abhidhammabhājanīye
analyzed: saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇa ādayaḥ gahitā ati veditabbā avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ca abhidhammabhājanīye
translated: And the formations with ignorance as condition are stated in the Abhidhamma too in the section on the dependent origination in terms of aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: catubhūmakakusalasaṅkhāro akusalasaṅkhāro ca vuttoti so eva dhātukathāyaṃ gahitoti🔽daṭṭhabbo. Bhavo pana dhātukathāyaṃ kammupapattibhavavisesadassanatthaṃ na abhidhammabhājanīyavasena
analyzed: catu bhūmaka kusala saṅkhāro akusala saṅkhāro ca vutto ti saḥ eva dhātu kathā ayam gahito ti  daṭṭhabbaḥ bhavaḥ pana dhātu kathā ayam kamma upapatti bhava visesa dassana ttham na abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena
translated: And the profitable and unprofitable formations in the four planes are included there in the exposition of the elements.🔽But the kinds of becoming are not included in the exposition of the elements in the Abhidhamma in the way stated, because the exposition of the elements is given there in order to show the distinction between the kinds of kamma-process becoming and rebirth-process becoming.

original: gahito. Evañca katvā tattha “upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti anuddharitvā “kammabhavo”tiādināva
analyzed: evam ca katvā tattha upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ ti an uddharitvā kamma bhavaḥ ti ādinā ava
translated: And it is in this way that the kinds of becoming are included there in the Abhidhamma too, for the kinds of becoming are included there in the Abhidhamma by the method of “With clinging as condition, becoming” without being specifically mentioned.

original: nayena bhavo uddhaṭo. Vipākañhetanti viññāṇassa vipākattā saṅkhārapaccayattaṃ sādheti,🔽tassa pana sādhanatthaṃ “upacitakammābhāve vipākābhāvato”ti vuttanti taṃ vivaranto
analyzed: nayena bhavaḥ uddhaṭaḥ vipākam hetanti viññāṇassa vipāka ttā saṅkhāra paccaya ttam sādheti  tassa pana sādhana ttham upacita kamma abhāve vipāka abhāvato ti vuttan ti tam vivaranto
translated: And the inclusion of the kinds of consciousness is established by the inclusion of the kinds of resultant consciousness,🔽and the inclusion of the kinds of resultant consciousness is established by the inclusion of the kinds of kamma-result.🔽And the inclusion of the kinds of kamma-result is established by the inclusion of the kinds of accumulated kamma.

original: “vipākañcā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vipākam ca ati ādim āha
translated: And the inclusion of the kinds of accumulated kamma is established by the inclusion of the kinds of formations.

original: Yebhuyyena lobhasampayuttajavanāvasāneti javanena tadārammaṇaniyame somanassasahagatānantaraṃ
analyzed: yebhuyyena lobha sampayutta javana avasānā iti javanena tad ārammaṇa niyame somanassa sahagata anantaram
translated: As a rule, it is the impulsions associated with greed that end in registration.

original: somanassasahagatatadārammaṇassa vuttattā somanassasahagatāneva sandhāya vuttanti
analyzed: somanassa sahagata tad ārammaṇassa vuttattā somanassa sahagatān eva sandhāya vuttanti
translated: But since the registration of the same object as that of the consciousness associated with joy is mentioned, it should be understood that the words “associated with joy” are said only of the registration of the same object as that of the consciousness associated with joy.

original: veditabbaṃ. Yasmā pana tihetukajavanāvasāne ca kadāci ahetukaṃ tadārammaṇaṃ hoti,
analyzed: veditabbam yasmā pana ti hetuka javana avasāne ca kadāci ahetukam tad ārammaṇam hoti
translated: But since registration without root-cause sometimes occurs at the end of impulsions with two roots,🔽therefore it is said “as a rule.”

original: tasmā “yebhuyyenā”ti āha. Sakiṃ vāti “dirattatirattā”dīsu viya veditabbaṃ. Dvikkhattumeva🔽pana uppajjantīti vadanti. “Dirattatiratta”nti ettha pana vā-saddassa abhāvā vacanasiliṭṭhatāmattena
analyzed: tasmai yebhuyyena iti āha sakim vā ati diratta tiratta ādīsu viya veditabbam dvi kkhattum eva  pana uppajjanti iti vadanti ettha pana vā saddassa abhāvāḥ
translated: It should be understood as “once” in the way stated in the passage beginning, “For one, two, or three nights” .🔽But they say that it arises only twice.🔽But in the passage, “For one, two, or three nights” , the word vā is not found, and so the inclusion of “one night” is appropriate only as a verbal usage.

original: dirattaggahaṇaṃ katanti yujjati, “nirantaratirattadassanatthaṃ vā”ti. Idha pana vā-saddo
analyzed: di ratta ggahaṇam yujjati nirantara tiratta dassana attham vāti idha pana vā saddaḥ
translated: Or it is for the purpose of showing that it is uninterrupted.🔽But here the word vā is used in the sense of “occasionally.”

original: vikappanattho vuttoti sakiṃ eva ca kadāci pavattiṃ sandhāya “sakiṃ vā”ti vuttanti
analyzed: vikappana atthaḥ vuttaḥ ti sakim eva ca kadāci pavattim sandhāya sakim vā iti vuttam
translated: So “once” is said with reference to the occurrence of registration on some occasion only.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Teneva hi sakiṃ tadārammaṇappavattiyā vicāretabbataṃ dassento “cittappavattigaṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tena iva hi sakim tad ārammaṇa ppavattiyāḥ vicāretabba tam dassento citta ppavatti gaṇanāyam
translated: For it is in order to show that the object is to be investigated by the occurrence of the javanas that he says, “But in the counting of the occurrence of consciousnesses … . ”

original: panā”tiādimāha. Tattha cittappavattigaṇanāyanti vipākakathāyaṃ balavarūpādike ārammaṇe
analyzed: pana ati ādim āha tattha citta ppavatti gaṇanāyanti vipāka kathā ayam balava rūpa ādike ārammaṇe
translated: Herein, in the counting of the occurrence of consciousnesses : he refers to the counting of the occurrence of consciousnesses stated in the section on result in the case of a strong object such as a visible form, etc.

original: vuttaṃ cittappavattigaṇanaṃ sandhāyāha. Tattha hi dveva tadārammaṇuppattivārā āgatā.
analyzed: vuttam citta ppavatti gaṇanam sandhāya āha tattha hi dve iva tad ārammaṇa uppatti vārāḥ āgatā
translated: For there are two occurrences of the object in the case of the object classed as proximate.

original: Javanavisayānubhavanañhi tadārammaṇaṃ āsannabhede tasmiṃ visaye ekacittakkhaṇāvasiṭṭhāyuke
analyzed: javana visaya anubhavanam hi tad ārammaṇam āsanna bhede tasmin visaye
translated: The intention is that the occurrence of the object as the experience of the object of the javanas would not arise in the case of the object classed as proximate if the life-continuum were to last for only one consciousness-moment.

original: na uppajjeyyāti adhippāyo. Anurūpāya paṭisandhiyāti akusalavipākassa apāyapaṭisandhi,
analyzed: na uppajjeyya ati adhippāyaḥ anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā ati akusala vipākassa apāya paṭisandhi
translated: With a rebirth-linking appropriate to it : for the result of unwholesome kamma, rebirth-linking in the unhappy destinies;

original: kāmāvacarādikusalavipākānaṃ kāmarūpārūpasugatipaṭisandhiyo yathākammaṃ anurūpā.
analyzed: kāmāvacara ādi kusala vipākānam kāmarūpa arūpa sugati paṭisandhiyaḥ yathākammam anurūpā
translated: for the results of wholesome kamma of the sense sphere, etc., rebirth-linking in the happy destinies of the sense-sphere, fine-material, and immaterial planes, which is appropriate to the kamma.🔽The section on rebirth-linking is of great scope.

original: Paṭisandhikathā mahāvisayāti katvā pavattimeva tāva dassento “pavattiyaṃ panā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: paṭisandhi kathā mahā visayā ti katvā pavattim eva tāva dassentaḥ pavattiyam pana iti ādim āha
translated: But in order to show only the occurrence he says, “But in the case of occurrence … ” .

original: Ahetukadvayādīnaṃ dvāraniyamāniyamāvacanaṃ bhavaṅgabhūtānaṃ sayameva dvārattā cutipaṭisandhibhūtānañca🔽bhavaṅgasaṅkhātena aññena ca dvārena anuppattito niyataṃ aniyataṃ vā dvāraṃ etesanti🔽vattuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā. Ekassa sattassa pavattarūpāvacaravipāko pathavīkasiṇādīsu
analyzed: ahetuka dvaya ādīnam dvāra niyama aniyama avacanam sayam eva cuti paṭisandhi bhūtānam ca  bhavaṅga saṅkhātena aññena ca dvārena anuppattitaḥ niyatam aniyatam vā dvāram etesanti  vattum a sakkuṇeyya ttā ekassa sattassa pavatta rūpa avacara vipāko pathavī kasiṇa ādīsu
translated: The two kinds of non-causality, etc., are not mentioned as to door because they are respectively determined and undetermined as to door, being, like the life-continuum, the door themselves, and because they are, like death and rebirth-linking,🔽not doors. For it is impossible to say of them that they are determined or undetermined as to door because they do not occur by means of the life-continuum or any other door.🔽The resultant fine-material-sphere consciousness of a single being does not occur with any object other than that with which it has already occurred, whether the kasiṇa of the earth-device, etc., as its object,

original: yasmiṃ ārammaṇe pavatto, tato aññasmiṃ tassa pavatti natthīti rūpāvacarānaṃ niyatārammaṇatā
analyzed: yasmim ārammaṇe pavatto tatas aññasmim tassa pavatti natthi iti rūpāvacarānam niyata ārammaṇa tā
translated: so the fine-material-sphere kinds are said to be determined as to object.

original: vuttā. Tatrassāti pavattiyaṃ bāttiṃsavidhassa.
analyzed: vuttā tatrassa ati pavattiyam bāttiṃsavidhassa
translated: In that case: in that occurrence of thirty-two kinds.

original: Indriyappavattiānubhāvato eva cakkhusotadvārabhedena, tassa ca viññāṇavīthibhedāyattattā🔽vīthibhedena ca bhavitabbaṃ, tasmiñca sati “āvajjanānantaraṃ dassanaṃ savanaṃ vā
analyzed: indriya ppavatti ānubhāvato eva cakkhu sota dvāra bhedena tassa ca viññāṇa vīthi bheda āyatta ttā  vīthi bhedena ca bhavitabbam tasmin ca sati āvajjana anantaram dassanam savanam vā
translated: Because of the influence of the occurrence of the faculties, there must be a distinction of door as eye and ear, and that is dependent on a distinction of cognitive series,🔽and there must be a distinction of series, and when that exists there must be a distinction of consciousness in the way stated thus: “After adverting, there is either seeing or hearing,🔽and after that there is receiving” , etc.,

original: tadanantaraṃ sampaṭicchana”ntiādinā cittaniyamena bhavitabbaṃ. Tathā ca sati sampaṭicchanasantīraṇānampi
analyzed: tad anantaram sampaṭicchana nti ādinā citta niyamena bhavitabbam tathā ca sati sampaṭicchana santīraṇānam pi
translated: and when that exists there must be a distinction of receiving and investigating.

original: bhāvo siddho hoti, na indriyappavattiānubhāvena dassanasavanamattasseva, nāpi indriyānaṃ
analyzed: bhāvo siddhaḥ hoti na indriya ppavatti ānubhāvena dassana savana mattassa iva nā api
translated: The existence of the object is established, not by the power of the occurrence of the faculties, by mere seeing and hearing, nor by the faculties themselves,

original: eva dassanasavanakiccatāti imamatthaṃ dassento āha “dvāravīthibhede cittaniyamato
analyzed: eva dassana savana kicca tā ti imam attham dassentaḥ āha dvāra vīthi bhede citta niyamato
translated: showing this meaning, he said, “and by the restriction of consciousness to the opening and the street.”

original: cā”ti. Paṭhamakusalena ce tadārammaṇassa uppatti hoti, taṃ paṭhamakusalānantaraṃ🔽uppajjamānaṃ janakaṃ anubandhati nāma, dutiyakusalādianantaraṃ uppajjamānaṃ janakasadisaṃ
analyzed: ca ati paṭhama kusalena ce tad ārammaṇassa uppatti hoti tam paṭhama kusala anantaram  uppajjamānam janakam anubandhati nāma dutiya kusala ādi anantaram uppajjamānam janaka sadisam
translated: If the arising of the object occurs at that time by the first wholesome, that which arises immediately after the first wholesome is called “following the producer,”

original: anubandhati nāma, akusalānantaraṃ uppajjamānañca kāmāvacaratāya janakasadisanti.🔽Ekādasa tadārammaṇacittāni…pe… tadārammaṇaṃ na gaṇhantīti tadārammaṇabhāvatāya “tadārammaṇa”nti
analyzed: nāma akusala anantaram uppajjamānam ca kāmāvacara tāyai  ekādasa tad ārammaṇa citta ānipe tad ārammaṇam na gaṇhanti iti tad ārammaṇa bhāva tāya
translated: that which arises immediately after the second wholesome, etc., is called “following the similar to the producer,” and that which arises immediately after the unwholesome is called “following the similar to the producer of the sense-sphere.”🔽The eleven consciousnesses that take that as object … do not take that as object.

original: laddhanāmāni tadārammaṇabhāvaṃ na gaṇhanti, tadārammaṇabhāvena nappavattantīti attho.
analyzed: laddha nāmāni tad ārammaṇa bhāvam na gaṇhanti tad ārammaṇa bhāvena na pavattanti iti attho
translated: The eleven consciousnesses that take that as object do not take the state of being the object of that as object, do not occur by way of the state of being the object of that.

original: Atha vā nāmagottaṃ ārabbha javane javite tadārammaṇaṃ tassa javanassa ārammaṇaṃ na
analyzed: atha vā nāma gottam ārabbha javane javite tad ārammaṇam tassa javanassa ārammaṇam na
translated: Or else, in each impulsion in regard to name and race, the object of that impulsion is not the object of that impulsion,

original: gaṇhanti, nālambantīti attho. Rūpārūpadhammeti rūpārūpāvacare dhamme. Idaṃ pana vatvā
analyzed: gaṇhanti na ālambanti iti atthaḥ rūpa arūpa dhamma iti rūpa arūpa avacare dhamme idam pana vatvā
translated: they do not cling to them. The meaning is that they do not take them as a basis. The fine-material and immaterial dhammas: the dhammas of the fine-material and immaterial spheres. After saying this,

original: “abhiññāñāṇaṃ ārabbhā”ti visesanaṃ parittādiārammaṇatāya kāmāvacarasadisesu ceva
analyzed: abhiññā ñāṇam ārabbha ati visesanam paritta ādi ārammaṇa tāya kāmāvacara sadisesu ca iva
translated: he specifies: “with respect to the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power” , because the object of the limited kinds of supernormal power, etc., is similar to that of the kinds of supernormal power in the sense sphere.

original: tadārammaṇānuppattidassanatthaṃ. Micchattaniyatā dhammā maggo viya bhāvanāya siddhā
analyzed: tad ārammaṇa anuppatti dassana ttham micchatta niyatāḥ dhammāḥ maggaḥ viya bhāvanāya siddhā
translated: The purpose of showing the arising of the object condition is this: the dhammas that are fixed in the wrong way are accomplished by development like the path.

original: mahābalā cāti tattha javanena pavattamānena sānubandhanena na bhavitabbanti tesu
analyzed: mahā balā ca ati tattha javanena pavattamānena sa anubandhanena na bhavitabbanti tesu
translated: They are powerful. Therefore, when they occur by way of impulsion, they should not be accompanied by the object condition.

original: tadārammaṇaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ. Lokuttaradhamme ārabbhāti eteneva siddhe “sammattaniyatadhammesū”ti
analyzed: tad ārammaṇam paṭikkhittam lokuttara dhamme ārabbha ati etena iva siddhe sammatta niyata dhammesu iti
translated: The object condition is excluded in regard to them. With respect to the supramundane dhammas: this is established by that very statement. The separate mention of “the dhammas that are fixed in the right way”

original: visuṃ uddharaṇaṃ sammattamicchattaniyatadhammānaṃ aññamaññapaṭipakkhāti balavabhāvena
analyzed: visum uddharaṇam sammatta micchatta niyata dhammānam aññamañña paṭipakkhā ati balava bhāvena
translated: is for the purpose of showing that the dhammas that are fixed in the right way and the dhammas that are fixed in the wrong way are mutually opposed and therefore powerful,

original: tadārammaṇassa avatthubhāvadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: tad ārammaṇassa avatthu bhāva dassana tham
translated: and that the object condition does not have a basis in them.

original: Evaṃ pavattiyaṃ viññāṇappavattiṃ dassetvā paṭisandhiyaṃ dassetuṃ “yaṃ pana vutta”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: evam pavattiyam viññāṇa ppavattim dassetvā paṭisandhiyam dassetum yam pana vutta nti ādim āha
translated: Having thus shown the occurrence of consciousness in the course of an existence, he says, “But what was said” in order to show it in rebirth-linking.

original: Kena katthāti kena cittena kasmiṃ bhave. Ekūnavīsati paṭisandhiyo tena tena cittena
analyzed: kena kattha ati kena cittena kasmin bhave ekūnavīsati paṭisandhiyaḥ tena tena cittena
translated: By what? In what? By what kind of consciousness? In what kind of becoming?🔽Nineteen kinds of rebirth-linking are by the kinds of consciousness stated.

original: pavattamānā paṭisandhikkhaṇe rūpārūpadhammāti tena tena cittena sā sā tattha tattha
analyzed: pavattamānā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe rūpa arūpa dhammā ti tena tena cittena sā sā tattha tattha
translated: By what? In what kind of becoming? The nineteen kinds of rebirth-linking consciousness, occurring with the kinds of consciousness stated, are called “rebirth-linking” in the various kinds of becoming, etc., by the various kinds of consciousness stated.

original: paṭisandhi hotīti vuttā. Tassāti cittassa.
analyzed: paṭisandhi hoti iti vuttā tassa ati cittassa
translated: “By that” means by the kind of consciousness stated.

original: Āgantvāti āgataṃ viya hutvā. Gopakasīvalīti rañño hitārakkhe gopakakule jāto sīvalināmako.🔽Kammādianussaraṇabyāpārarahitattā “sammūḷhakālakiriyā”ti vuttā. Abyāpāreneva hi tattha
analyzed: āgantvā ti āgatam viya hutvā gopakasīvalī iti raññaḥ hitārakkhe gopaka kule jātaḥ sīvali nāmako  kamma ādi anussaraṇa byāpāra rahita ttā sammūḷha kāla kiriyā ati vuttā a byāpārena iva hi tattha
translated: “Having come” means having become as if it had come. Gopaka-Sīvali was a clansman of the Gopaka family, which was devoted to the service of the king, and his name was Sīvali.🔽It is called “death with delusion” because it is devoid of the reviewing of kamma, etc., and of ill will. For it is only through the absence of ill will that the reviewing of kamma, etc., takes place there.

original: kammādiupaṭṭhānaṃ hotīti. “Pisiyamānāya makkhikāya paṭhamaṃ kāyadvārāvajjanaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ🔽nāvaṭṭeti attanā cintiyamānassa kassaci atthitāyā”ti keci kāraṇaṃ vadanti, tadetaṃ
analyzed: kamma ādi upaṭṭhānam hoti iti pisiyamānāya makkhikāya paṭhamam kāya dvāra āvajjanam bhavaṅgam  na avaṭṭeti attanā cintiyamānassa kassaci atthitāya ati keci kāraṇam vadanti tat etam
translated: Some say that the first adverting to the door of the body is the life-continuum, which does not turn back because of the presence of something being thought of by oneself.

original: akāraṇaṃ bhavaṅgavisayato aññassa cintiyamānassa abhāvā aññacittappavattakāle ca
analyzed: akāraṇam bhavaṅga visayataḥ aññassa cintiyamānassa abhāvāḥ añña citta ppavatta kāle ca
translated: But this is no reason, because there is no thought of anything other than the life-continuum’s own objective field, and because there is no occurrence of any other kind of consciousness at that time.

original: bhavaṅgāvaṭṭanasseva asambhavato. Idaṃ panettha kāraṇaṃ siyā – “tānissa tamhi samaye🔽olambanti ajjholambanti abhippalambantī”ti vacanato tīsu javanavāresu appavattesveva
analyzed: bhavaṅga avaṭṭanassa iva asambhavataḥ idam pana ittha kāraṇam siyā tāni issa tamhi samaye  olambanti ajjholambanti abhippalambanti iti vacanato tīsu javana vāresu appavattesu eva
translated: because it is impossible for the life-continuum to be diverted. But the reason for this may be stated as follows. Since it is said that “they hang down, they hang on him, they are attached to him” ,🔽it must be the case that the life-continuum is diverted only when the three impulsions have not occurred.

original: kammādiupaṭṭhānena bhavitabbaṃ. Anekajavanavārappavattiyā hi ajjholambanaṃ abhippalambanañca
analyzed: kamma ādi upaṭṭhānena bhavitabbam aneka javana vāra ppavattiyā hi ajjholambanam abhippalambanam ca
translated: For it is when there is the occurrence of many impulsions that there is hanging on and attachment.

original: hotīti. Tasmā kāyadvārāvajjanaṃ anāvaṭṭetvā manodvārāvajjanameva kammādiālambaṇaṃ
analyzed: hoti iti tasmai kāya dvāra āvajjanam an āvaṭṭetvā manaḥ dvāra āvajjanam eva kamma ādi ālambaṇam
translated: Therefore, without diverting the adverting at the eye door, the adverting at the mind door only, which has the kamma, etc., as its object, diverts the life-continuum.

original: paṭhamaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ āvaṭṭeti, tato phoṭṭhabbassa balavattā dutiyavāre kāyaviññāṇavīthi🔽paccuppanne phoṭṭhabbe pavattati, tato purimajavanavāragahitesveva kammādīsu kamena
analyzed: paṭhamam bhavaṅgam āvaṭṭeti tatas phoṭṭhabbassa balavattā dutiya vāre kāya viññāṇa vīthi  paccuppanne phoṭṭhabbe pavattati tatas purima javana vāra gahitesu eva kamma ādīsu kamena
translated: Then, since the second impulsions occur in the cognitive series of body-consciousness when the force of the tangible object is strong,

original: manodvārajavanaṃ javitvā mūlabhavaṅgasaṅkhātaṃ āgantukabhavaṅgasaṅkhātaṃ vā tadārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: manaḥ dvāra javanam mūla bhavaṅga saṅkhātam āgantuka bhavaṅga saṅkhātam vā tad ārammaṇam
translated: after that, the mind door impulsion occurs in the kamma, etc., already apprehended in the first impulsions, and it enters upon the life-continuum, which is called the “root life-continuum” or the “visiting life-continuum,” having that as its object,

original: bhavaṅgaṃ otarati, tadārammaṇābhāve vā bhavaṅgameva. Etasmiṃ ṭhāne kālaṃ karotīti
analyzed: bhavaṅgam otarati tad ārammaṇa abhāve vā bhavaṅgam eva etasmin ṭhāne kālam karoti iti
translated: or else the life-continuum itself if there is no object of that kind. It is at this point that death occurs.

original: tadārammaṇānantarena cuticittena, tadārammaṇābhāve vā bhavaṅgasaṅkhāteneva cuticittena
analyzed: tad ārammaṇa anantarena cuti cittena tad ārammaṇa abhāve vā bhavaṅga saṅkhātena iva cuti cittena
translated: and by the death-consciousness which has that as its object, or by the death-consciousness called the life-continuum when there is no object.

original: cavatīti attho. Bhavaṅgameva hi cuticittaṃ hutvā pavattatīti cuticittaṃ idha “bhavaṅga”nti🔽vuttanti. Manodvāravisayo lahukoti lahukapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “arūpadhammānaṃ…pe…
analyzed: cavati iti atthaḥ bhavaṅgam eva hi cuti cittam hutvā pavattati iti cuti cittam idha bhavaṅganti  vuttanti manaḥ dvāra visayaḥ lahukaḥ ti lahuka paccupaṭṭhānam sandhāya vuttam arūpa dhammānam pe
translated: The meaning is that it passes away. For the death-consciousness occurs as the life-continuum, and so it is called “life-continuum” here.🔽The words “The object of the mind door is quick” are said with reference to the quick appearance of immaterial states.

original: lahuko”ti. Arūpadhammassa hi manodvārassa visayo lahukapaccupaṭṭhānoti. Balavati🔽ca rūpadhammassa kāyadvārassa visaye appavattitvā manodvāravisaye kammādimhi paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: lahuko ti arūpa dhammassa hi manaḥ dvārassa visayaḥ lahuka paccupaṭṭhāno ti balavati  ca rūpa dhammassa kāya dvārassa visaye manaḥ dvāra visaye kamma ādimhi paṭhamaṃ
translated: For the object of the immaterial mind door is of quick appearance.🔽Without occurring in the object of the material body door, which is powerful,🔽the first occurrence of consciousness is in the object of the mind door, such as kamma.🔽Thus the quickness of the object is shown.

original: cittappavattidassanena arūpadhammānaṃ visayassa lahukatā dīpitāti. Rūpānaṃ visayābhāvepi
analyzed: citta ppavatti dassanena arūpa dhammānam visayassa lahuka tā dīpitā ati rūpānam visaya abhāve pi
translated: Or, although there is no object of material states,

original: vā “arūpadhammāna”nti vacanaṃ yesaṃ visayo atthi, taṃdassanatthamevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā arūpa dhammānam ti vacanam yesam visayaḥ atthi tad dassana attham eva ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: the words “of immaterial states” should be regarded as said in order to show those that do have an object.

original: Tena lahukammādīsu cittappavattito lahugahaṇīyatā visayassa lahukatā.
analyzed: tena lahu kamma ādīsu citta ppavattitaḥ lahu gahaṇīya tā visayassa lahuka tā
translated: Thus the quickness of the object is its being apprehended quickly by consciousness occurring in quick kamma, etc.

original: Kammādīnaṃ bhūmicittupādādivasena vitthārato ananto pabhedoti “saṅkhepato”ti āha.
analyzed: kamma ādīnam bhūmi cittu pāda ādi vasena vitthārataḥ anantaḥ pabhedo ti saṅkhepato iti āha
translated: The analysis of kamma, etc., is endless in detail according to plane, consciousness, rebirth-linking, etc., so he said, “in brief.”

original: Avijjātaṇhādikilesesu anupacchinnesveva kammādino upaṭṭhānaṃ, tañcārabbha cittasantānassa
analyzed: avijjā taṇhā ādi kilesesu anupacchinnesu eva kamma ādinaḥ upaṭṭhānam tat ca ārabbha citta santānassa
translated: Kamma, etc., appear only when defilements such as ignorance and craving are unabandoned. And the continuity of consciousness

original: bhavantaraninnapoṇapabbhāratā hotīti āha “anupacchinnakilesabalavināmita”nti. Santāne
analyzed: āha santāne
translated: is inclined, bent, and led by them. That is why he said, “bent by the power of unabandoned defilements.”

original: hi vināmite tadekadesabhūtaṃ paṭisandhicittañca vināmitameva hoti, na ca ekadesavināmitabhāvena🔽vinā santānavināmitatā atthīti. Sabbattha pana “duggatipaṭisandhininnāya cutiyā purimajavanāni
analyzed: hi vināmite tad eka desa bhūtam paṭisandhi cittam ca vināmitam eva hoti na ca eka desa vināmita bhāvena  vinā santāna vināmita tā atthi iti sabbattha pana duggati paṭisandhi ninnāya cutiyā purima javanāni
translated: For when the continuity is bent, the rebirth-linking consciousness, which is a part of it, is also bent. And the continuity is not bent by the bending of a part of it.

original: akusalāni, itarāya ca kusalānī”ti nicchinanti. “Nimittassādagadhitaṃ vā, bhikkhave,🔽viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭhati anubyañjanassādagadhitaṃ vā. Tasmiṃ ce samaye kālaṃ
analyzed: akusalāni itarāya ca kusalāni iti nicchinanti vā bhikkhave  viññāṇam tiṭṭhamānam tiṭṭhati vā tasmin ce samaye kālam
translated: But in all cases unwholesome consciousnesses are the impulsion impulsions of the kind of death that is inclined to an unhappy destination, and wholesome consciousnesses are those of the other kind.🔽“Bhikkhus, consciousness is supported by a condition and has an object.

original: karoti, ṭhānametaṃ vijjati, yaṃ dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ upapajjeyya nirayaṃ
analyzed: karoti ṭhānam etam vijjati yam dvinnam gatīnam aññataram gatim upapajjeyya nirayam
translated: If at that time one were to die, there is the possibility that he might reappear in one of two destinations, in hell or the animal realm.

original: vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā”ti vuttaṃ. Tasmā āsannaṃ akusalaṃ duggatiyaṃ, kusalañca sugatiyaṃ🔽paṭisandhiyā upanissayo hotīti.
analyzed: vā tiracchānayonim vā iti vuttam tasmai āsannam akusalam duggatiyam kusalam ca sugatiyam  paṭisandhiyāḥ upanissayaḥ hoti iti
translated: Therefore unwholesome kamma is a proximate condition for rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny, and wholesome kamma is a proximate condition for rebirth-linking in a happy destiny.

original: Rāgādihetubhūtaṃ hīnamārammaṇanti akusalavipākassa ārammaṇaṃ bhavituṃ yuttaṃ aniṭṭhārammaṇaṃ🔽āha. Tampi hi saṅkappavasena rāgassapi hetu hotīti. Akusalavipākajanakakammasahajātānaṃ
analyzed: rāga ādi hetu bhūtam hīnam ārammaṇanti akusala vipākassa ārammaṇam bhavitum yuttam aniṭṭha ārammaṇam  āha tam pi hi saṅkappa vasena rāgassa api hetu hoti iti akusala vipāka janaka kamma sahajātānam
translated: The object that is a cause of greed, etc., is a low object. He says that an undesirable object is suitable to be the object of unwholesome kamma-result.🔽For that is also a cause of greed by way of reflection.

original: vā taṃsadisāsannacutijavanacetanāsahajātānañca rāgādīnaṃ hetubhāvo eva hīnatā. Tañhi🔽pacchānutāpajanakakammānamārammaṇaṃ kammavasena aniṭṭhaṃ akusalavipākassa ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: vā hetu bhāvaḥ eva hīna tā  pacchā anutāpa janaka kammānam ārammaṇam kamma vasena aniṭṭham akusala vipākassa ārammaṇam
translated: Or the lowness is just the fact that greed, etc., are causes of the consciousnesses of the kind that produce unwholesome kamma-result, and of the consciousnesses of the kind that are associated with the volition at the time of death that is similar to that kamma.🔽For that is an undesirable object by way of kamma, being the object of kamma that produces subsequent remorse. It can be the object of unwholesome kamma-result.

original: bhaveyya, aññathā ca iṭṭhārammaṇe pavattassa akusalakammassa vipāko kammanimittārammaṇo
analyzed: bhaveyya aññathā ca iṭṭha ārammaṇe pavattassa akusala kammassa vipāko kamma nimitta ārammaṇaḥ
translated: And the result of unwholesome kamma that occurs with a desirable object would not have the sign of the kamma as its object.🔽For it is not proper that the result of unwholesome kamma should be desirable.

original: na bhaveyya. Na hi akusalavipāko iṭṭhārammaṇo bhavitumarahatīti. Pañcadvāre ca āpāthamāgacchantaṃ
analyzed: na bhaveyya na hi akusala vipākaḥ iṭṭha ārammaṇaḥ bhavitum arahati iti pañca dvāre ca āpātham āgacchantam
translated: And in the five doors it is an undesirable object that is the object of unwholesome kamma-result.

original: paccuppannaṃ kammanimittaṃ āsannakatakammārammaṇasantatiyaṃ uppannaṃ taṃsadisañca
analyzed: paccuppannam kamma nimittam āsanna kata kamma ārammaṇa santatiyam uppannam taṃsadisam ca
translated: The sign of kamma in the present should be regarded as the kamma that has just been done, and the continuity of consciousness that has arisen with that as its object.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ, aññathā tadeva paṭisandhiārammaṇūpaṭṭhāpakaṃ tadeva ca paṭisandhijanakaṃ🔽bhaveyya, na ca paṭisandhiyā upacārabhūtāni viya “etasmiṃ tayā pavattitabba”nti paṭisandhiyā
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam aññathā tat eva paṭisandhi ārammaṇa upaṭṭhāpakam tat eva ca paṭisandhi janakam  na ca paṭisandhiyā upacāra bhūtāni viya etasmin tayā pavattitabbanti paṭisandhiyā
translated: Otherwise, that same kamma would be the cause of rebirth-linking and that same object would be the object of rebirth-linking.

original: ārammaṇaṃ anupādentāni viya ca pavattāni cutiāsannāni javanāni paṭisandhijanakāni
analyzed: ārammaṇam anupādentāni viya ca pavattāni cuti āsannāni javanāni paṭisandhi janakāni
translated: And the impulsions that are near to death would not be the cause of rebirth-linking, as are the impulsions that are near to rebirth-linking.🔽For it is said, “Because it has been done, because it has been stored up” .

original: bhaveyyuṃ. “Katattā upacitattā”ti hi vuttaṃ. Tadā ca taṃsamānavīthiyaṃ viya pavattamānāni🔽kathaṃ katūpacitāni siyuṃ, na ca assāditāni tadā, na ca lokiyāni lokuttarāni viya
analyzed: bhaveyyum kata ttā upacita ttā iti hi vuttam tadā ca taṃsamāna vīthiyam viya pavattamānāni  katham katu upacitāni siyum na ca assāditāni tadā na ca lokiyāni lokuttarāni
translated: And how could those that occur in the same cognitive series as that kamma have been done and stored up?

original: samānavīthiphalāni honti.
analyzed: samāna vīthi phalāni honti
translated: And they are not relished at that time. And they do not have the same result as that of the supramundane, which is the opposite.

original: “Pubbe vāssa taṃ kataṃ hoti pāpakammaṃ dukkhavedanīyaṃ, pacchā vāssa taṃ kataṃ hoti
analyzed: pubbe vā assa tat katam hoti pāpa kammam dukkha vedanīyam pacchā vā assa tat katam hoti
translated: “Or it was done by him in the past” .

original: pāpakammaṃ dukkhavedanīyaṃ, maraṇakāle vāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi samattā samādinnā,
analyzed: pāpa kammam dukkha vedanīyam maraṇa kāle vā assa hoti micchādiṭṭhi samattā samādinnā
translated: and his action is of sufferingable result, and at the time of death his wrong view is complete and fully taken up,

original: tena so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti –
analyzed: tena so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati iti
translated: then with the breakup of the body, after death, he reappears in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell” .

original: Ādinā sutte maraṇakāle samattāya samādinnāya micchādiṭṭhiyā sammādiṭṭhiyā ca sahajātacetanāya
analyzed: ādinā sutte maraṇa kāle samattāya samādinnāya micchādiṭṭhiyā sammādiṭṭhiyā ca sahajāta cetanāya
translated: In the first part of the sutta the rebirth-linking consciousness is said to be given by wrong view or by right view complete and fully taken up at the time of death.

original: paṭisandhidānaṃ vuttaṃ, na ca dubbalehi pañcadvārikajavanehi micchādiṭṭhi sammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: paṭisandhi dānam vuttam na ca dubbalehi pañca dvārika javanehi micchādiṭṭhi sammādiṭṭhi
translated: But wrong view or right view is not complete and fully taken up by the weak impulsions of the five doors.

original: vā samattā hoti samādinnā. Vakkhati ca –🔽“Sabbampi hetaṃ kusalākusaladhammapaṭivijānanādicavanapariyosānaṃ kiccaṃ manodvārikacitteneva
analyzed: vā samattā hoti samādinnā vakkhati ca  sabbam pi ha etam kusala akusala dhamma paṭivijānana ādi cavana pariyosānam kiccam manodvārika cittena iva
translated: And it is said:

original: hoti, na pañcadvārikenāti sabbassapetassa kiccassa karaṇe sahajavanakāni vīthicittāni paṭikkhittānī”ti.
analyzed: hoti na pañcadvārikena ati sabbassa apetassa kiccassa karaṇe sahaja vanakāni vīthi cittāni paṭikkhittāni iti
translated: “All this function beginning with the discerning of profitable and unprofitable ideas and ending with the adverting is done by the mind-door adverting consciousness only, not by the five-door adverting consciousness. So the impulsions that accompany the consciousnesses of the cognitive series are excluded from doing all this function” .

original: Tattha hi “na kiñci dhammaṃ paṭivijānātīti ‘manopubbaṅgamā dhammā’ti evaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: tattha hi na kiñci dhammam paṭivijānāti iti manaḥ pubbaṅgamāḥ dhammā ti evam vuttam
translated: For in that passage it is said that “he discerns no ideas at all” , and it is said that “ideas have mind as their forerunner” ,

original: ekampi kusalaṃ vā akusalaṃ vā na paṭivijānātī”ti ca vuttaṃ. Yesaṃ paṭivibhāvanappavattiyā
analyzed: ekam pi kusalam vā akusalam vā na paṭivijānāti iti ca vuttam yesam paṭivibhāvana pavattiyā
translated: and he does not discern even one profitable or unprofitable state.

original: sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā anveti, tesaṃ sā pavatti pañcadvāre paṭikkhittā, kusalākusalakammasamādānañca
analyzed: sukham vā dukkham vā anveti tesam sā pavatti pañca dvāre paṭikkhittā kusala akusala kamma samādānam ca
translated: The occurrence of the kinds of consciousness that are the basis for the experience of pleasure and pain is excluded from the five doors, and so is the undertaking of profitable and unprofitable kamma.

original: tādisamevāti. Tadārammaṇānantaraṃ pana cavanaṃ, tadanantarā ca upapatti manodvārikā
analyzed: tādisam eva ati tad ārammaṇa anantaram pana cavanam tad anantarā ca upapatti manodvārikā
translated: It is only the kind that is like that. But the death consciousness that occurs next to the registration, and the rebirth-linking that occurs next to that, are only of the mind door,

original: eva hoti, na sahajavanakavīthicitte pariyāpannāti iminā adhippāyena idha pañcadvārikatadārammaṇānantaraṃ🔽cuti, tadanantaraṃ paṭisandhi ca vuttāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tattha avasesapañcacittakkhaṇāyuke🔽rūpādimhi uppannaṃ paṭisandhiṃ sandhāyeva “paccuppannārammaṇaṃ upapatticittaṃ paccuppannārammaṇassa
analyzed: eva hoti na sahaja vanaka vīthi citte pariyāpannā ati iminā adhippāyena idha pañca dvārika tad ārammaṇa anantaram  tad anantaram paṭisandhi ca vuttā iti daṭṭhabbam tattha avasesa pañca citta khaṇa āyuke  rūpa ādimhi uppannam paṭisandhim sandhāya iva paccuppanna ārammaṇam upapatti cittam paccuppanna ārammaṇassa
translated: and they are not included in the course of consciousness with impulsion. It is with this intention that death and rebirth-linking are mentioned here next to the registration of the five doors.🔽Herein, the words “The rebirth-linking consciousness that arises contingent upon a present object condition is a condition, as proximate condition, for the life-continuum that has a present object” refer to the rebirth-linking that arises contingent upon visible data, etc., that last for the remaining five consciousness moments.

original: bhavaṅgassa anantarapaccayena paccayo”ti, avasesekacittakkhaṇāyuke ca uppannaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: bhavaṅgassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ ti avasesa eka citta khaṇa āyuke ca uppannam sandhāya
