translated: And the words “The rebirth-linking consciousness that arises contingent upon a present object condition is a condition, as proximity condition, for the life-continuum that has a past object” refer to the rebirth-linking that arises contingent upon the last of the five consciousness moments.

original: “paccuppannārammaṇaṃ upapatticittaṃ atītārammaṇassa bhavaṅgassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇam upapatti cittam atīta ārammaṇassa bhavaṅgassa anantara paccayena
translated: “The rebirth-linking consciousness with a present object is a condition, as proximate condition, for the life-continuum consciousness with a past object.”

original: paccayo”ti vuttanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Suddhāya vāti mahaggatakammanimittārammaṇāya javanavīthiyā tadārammaṇarahitāyāti
analyzed: paccayaḥ iti vuttam ti veditabbam  suddhāya vāti mahaggata kamma nimitta ārammaṇāya javana vīthiyā tad ārammaṇa rahitāya ati
translated: This is how it should be understood.🔽“In the pure” means in the cognitive series that has a supramundane kamma as its object and is devoid of that object.

original: attho. Sā pana javanavīthi mahaggatavipākassa upacāro viya daṭṭhabbā. Keci pana taṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ sā pana javana vīthi mahaggata vipākassa upacāraḥ viya daṭṭhabbā keci pana tam
translated: But that cognitive series should be regarded as the access of the supramundane resultant consciousness. Some, however, say that that series🔽ends with the supramundane consciousness.

original: vīthiṃ mahaggatāvasānaṃ vadanti. Atītārammaṇā ekādasavidhā, navattabbārammaṇā sattavidhā.
analyzed: vīthim mahaggata avasānam vadanti atīta ārammaṇā ekādasavidhā nava ttabba ārammaṇā sattavidhā
translated: With a past object, eleven kinds; with a non-existent object, seven kinds.

original: Etenānusārena āruppacutiyāpi anantarā paṭisandhi veditabbāti idaṃ kasmā vuttaṃ, nanu
analyzed: etena anusārena āruppa cutiyā api anantarā paṭisandhi veditabbā ti idam kasmā vuttam nanu
translated: Why is it said that rebirth-linking consciousness should be understood to occur immediately after death in the immaterial realm in the same way?

original: “pathavīkasiṇajjhānādivasena paṭiladdhamahaggatasugatiyaṃ ṭhitassā”ti evamādike eva
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇa jhāna ādi vasena paṭiladdha mahaggata sugatiyam ṭhitassa ati evamādike eva
translated: For has it not been said that “this rebirth-linking occurs in the same way in the case of one who has attained the jhānas by means of the earth kasiṇa, etc., and is reborn in a happy destiny in the sensuous realm” ,

original: naye ayampi paṭisandhi avaruddhāti? Na, tattha rūpāvacaracutianantarāya eva paṭisandhiyā
analyzed: naye ayam pi na tattha rūpāvacara cuti anantarāyaḥ eva paṭisandhiyā
translated: and so on?🔽It has been said, but only in the case of rebirth-linking consciousness that occurs immediately after death in the sensuous realm.

original: vuttattā. Tattha hi “pathavīkasiṇādikaṃ vā nimittaṃ mahaggatacittaṃ vā manodvāre
analyzed: vutta ttā tattha hi pathavī kasiṇa ādikam vā nimittam mahaggata cittam vā manaḥ dvāre
translated: because it is stated. For there it is said that the rebirth-linking consciousness arises immediately next to the death consciousness in the fine-material sphere only, with the sign of the earth kasiṇa, etc., or with the exalted consciousness of the mind-door adverting, or with visible data, etc., as object.

original: āpāthamāgacchati. Cakkhusotānaṃ vā”tiādikena rūpāvacaracutiyā eva anantarā paṭisandhi
analyzed: āpātham āgacchati cakkhu sotānam vāti ādikena rūpāvacara cutiyā eva anantarā paṭisandhi
translated: So it is understood that only the death consciousness in the fine-material sphere is next to the rebirth-linking consciousness.

original: vuttāti viññāyati. Athāpi yathāsambhavayojanāya ayampi paṭisandhi tattheva avaruddhā,🔽arūpāvacaracutianantarā pana rūpāvacarapaṭisandhi natthi, arūpāvacare ca uparūparicutiyā
analyzed: vuttā iti viññāyati atha api yathā sambhava yojanāya ayam pi paṭisandhi tattha iva avaruddhā  arūpāvacara cuti anantarā pana rūpāvacara paṭisandhi natthi arūpāvacare ca
translated: But if it is interpreted as appropriate, this rebirth-linking consciousness is included there too.

original: heṭṭhimā heṭṭhimā paṭisandhīti catutthāruppacutiyā navattabbārammaṇā paṭisandhi natthi.🔽Tena tato tattheva atītārammaṇā kāmāvacare ca atītapaccuppannārammaṇā paṭisandhi🔽itarāhi ca yathāsambhavaṃ atītanavattabbārammaṇā āruppapaṭisandhi, atītapaccuppannārammaṇā
analyzed: heṭṭhimā heṭṭhimā paṭisandhi iti catuttha āruppa cutiyāḥ navattabba ārammaṇā paṭisandhi natthi  tena tatas tattha iva atīta ārammaṇā kāmāvacare ca atīta paccuppanna ārammaṇā paṭisandhi  ca yathāsambhavam atīta navattabba ārammaṇā āruppa paṭisandhi atīta paccuppanna ārammaṇā
translated: But there is no rebirth-linking consciousness in the fine-material sphere next to the death consciousness in the immaterial sphere. And there is no rebirth-linking consciousness with a supramundane or an unclassifiable object next to the death consciousness in the fourth immaterial sphere, because the death consciousness in the immaterial sphere is of a lower level than the rebirth-linking consciousness.🔽So in order to show the difference, the rebirth-linking consciousness is stated separately as follows: “With past object” is the rebirth-linking consciousness in the fine-material sphere next to the death consciousness in the immaterial sphere.🔽“With past and future object” is the rebirth-linking consciousness in the sense sphere next to the death consciousness in the immaterial sphere.

original: ca kāmāvacarapaṭisandhi yojetabbāti imassa visesassa dassanatthaṃ visuṃ uddharaṇaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: ca kāmāvacara paṭisandhi yojetabbā ti imassa visesassa dassana attham visum uddharaṇam katam
translated: “With past and unclassifiable object” is the rebirth-linking consciousness in the immaterial sphere next to the death consciousness in the immaterial sphere.🔽“With past and present object” is the rebirth-linking consciousness in the sense sphere next to the death consciousness in the sense sphere.

original: Evaṃ ārammaṇavasena ekavidhāya kāmāvacarasugaticutiyā duvidhā duggatipaṭisandhi,🔽duggaticutiyā duvidhā sugatipaṭisandhi, kāmāvacarasugaticutiyā dviekadvippakārānaṃ
analyzed: evam ārammaṇa vasena ekavidhāya kāmāvacara sugati cutiyā duvidhā duggati paṭisandhi  duggati cutiyā duvidhā sugati paṭisandhi kāmāvacara sugati cutiyā
translated: So the rebirth-linking of the two kinds of death in the happy destinies of the sense sphere is of two kinds as rebirth-linking in the unhappy destinies.

original: kāmarūpāruppānaṃ vasena pañcavidhā sugatipaṭisandhi, rūpāvacaracutiyā ca tatheva
analyzed: vasena pañcavidhā sugati paṭisandhi rūpāvacara cutiyā ca tathā iva
translated: The rebirth-linking of the two kinds of death in the unhappy destinies is of two kinds as rebirth-linking in the happy destinies. The rebirth-linking of the two kinds of death in the happy destinies of the sense sphere is of five kinds as rebirth-linking in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming, which are respectively single, twofold and fivefold.

original: pañcavidhā, duvidhāya āruppacutiyā paccekaṃ dvinnaṃ dvinnaṃ kāmāruppānaṃ vasena aṭṭhavidhā🔽ca paṭisandhi dassitā, duggaticutiyā pana ekavidhāya duggatipaṭisandhi duvidhā na
analyzed: pañcavidhā duvidhāya āruppa cutiyā paccekam dvinnam dvinnam kāma āruppānam vasena aṭṭhavidhā  ca paṭisandhi dassitā duggati cutiyā pana ekavidhāya duggati paṭisandhi duvidhā na
translated: The rebirth-linking of death in the fine-material sphere is of five kinds in the same way. The rebirth-linking of the two kinds of death in the immaterial sphere is of eight kinds as rebirth-linking in the sense-sphere and immaterial kinds of becoming, which are respectively twofold, twofold, fivefold and fivefold.

original: dassitā, taṃ dassetuṃ “duggatiyaṃ ṭhitassa panā”tiādimāha. Yathāvuttā pana –
analyzed: dassitā tam dassetum duggatiyam ṭhitassa pana ati ādim āha yathā vuttā pana
translated: But the rebirth-linking of the single kind of death in the unhappy destinies is not shown as twofold. So in order to show that he said, “But when he is in an unhappy destiny” .

original: Dvidvipañcappakārā ca, pañcāṭṭhaduvidhāpi ca;
analyzed: ca ca
translated: The kinds of rebirth-linking Are two, two, five, five, eight, and two;

original: Catuvīsati sabbāpi, tā honti paṭisandhiyo.
analyzed: catuvīsati sabbā api tāḥ honti paṭisandhiyaḥ
translated: All are twenty-four in number, As has been said.

original: “Kāmāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa katattā”tiādinā nānākkhaṇikakammapaccayabhāvo dassitappakāroti upanissayapaccayabhāvameva dassento “vuttañheta”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: kāmāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa kata ttā atiādinā nānākkhaṇika kamma paccaya bhāvaḥ dassita ppakāraḥ iti upanissaya paccaya bhāvam eva dassentaḥ vuttam hetat tiādim āha
translated: “It is said” : he said this in order to show the condition by way of decisive support condition.

original: Ādinā sahātiādinā vimissaviññāṇena saha. Omato dve vā tayo vā dasakā uppajjantīti
analyzed: ādinā saha ati ādinā vimissa viññāṇena saha omataḥ dve vā tayaḥ vā dasakāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: “With the beginning” and so on: with the mixed consciousness. Two or three decades arise from the mind-unit.🔽This is said with reference to those who are born in the womb. Elsewhere many groups arise together.

original: gabbhaseyyakānaṃ vasena vuttaṃ. Aññattha hi aneke kalāpā saha uppajjanti. Brahmattabhāvepi
analyzed: gabbhaseyyakānam vasena vuttam aññattha hi aneke kalāpā saha uppajjanti brahmatta bhāve pi
translated: In the state of Brahmā,

original: hi anekagāvutappamāṇe aneke kalāpā sahuppajjantīti tiṃsato adhikāneva rūpāni honti🔽gandharasāhārānaṃ paṭikkhittattā cakkhusotavatthusattakajīvitachakkabhāvepi tesaṃ
analyzed: hi aneka gāvuta ppamāṇe aneke kalāpā sahuppajjanti iti tiṃsataḥ rūpāni honti  gandha rasa āhārānaṃ cakkhu sota vatthu sattaka jīvita chakka bhāve pi tesam
translated: many groups arise together, the size of a cow’s hide. Therefore there are more than thirty material instances.🔽Because smell and taste are absent, there are fewer eye and ear bases and life faculty.

original: bahuttā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana tatthapi cakkhusotavatthudasakānaṃ jīvitanavakassa ca
analyzed: bahuttā aṭṭhakathāyam pana tattha api cakkhu sota vatthu dasakānam jīvita navakassa ca
translated: But in the commentary, the arising of the ten material instances of the eye and ear bases and the eleven of the life faculty is mentioned.

original: uppatti vuttā, pāḷiyaṃ pana “rūpadhātuyā upapattikkhaṇe ṭhapetvā asaññasattānaṃ devānaṃ
analyzed: uppatti vuttā pāḷiyam pana rūpadhātuyāḥ upapatti kkhaṇe ṭhapetvā asaññasattānam devānam
translated: In the text, however, it is said: “At the moment of reappearance in the fine-material sphere, except for the non-percipient beings,

original: pañcāyatanāni pātubhavanti, pañca dhātuyo pātubhavantī”ti vuttaṃ, tathā “rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: pañca āyatanāni pātubhavanti pañca dhātuyaḥ pātubhavanti iti vuttam tathā rūpa dhātuyā
translated: and the five sense bases and the five elements become manifest.”🔽And in the same way, “In the element of visible form there are six bases and nine elements,”

original: cha āyatanāni nava dhātuyo”ti sabbasaṅgahavasena tattha vijjamānāyatanadhātuyo dassetuṃ
analyzed: cha āyatanāni nava dhātuyo ti sabba saṅgaha vasena tattha vijjamāna āyatana dhātuyaḥ dassetuṃ
translated: it is said in order to show the bases and elements that exist there by way of the most comprehensive classification.

original: vuttaṃ. Kathāvatthumhi ca ghānāyatanādīnaṃ viya gandhāyatanādīnañca tattha bhāvo
analyzed: vuttam kathā vatthumhi ca ghāna āyatana ādīnam viya gandha āyatana ādīnam ca tattha bhāvaḥ
translated: And in the Kathāvatthu the existence of the sense bases of odour, etc., there is rejected in the same way as that of the nose base, etc.,

original: paṭikkhitto “atthi tattha ghānāyatananti? Āmantā, atthi tattha gandhāyatananti? Na
analyzed: paṭikkhittaḥ atthi tattha ghāna āyatananti āmantā atthi tattha gandha āyatananti na
translated: “Is there there the nose base? Yes. Is there there the odour base?🔽No.”

original: hevaṃ vattabbe”tiādinā, na ca aphoṭṭhabbāyatanānaṃ pathavīdhātuādīnaṃ viya agandharasāyatanānaṃ🔽gandharasānaṃ tattha bhāvo sakkā vattuṃ phusituṃ asakkuṇeyyatāvinimuttassa pathavīādisabhāvassa
analyzed: ha evam vattabba iti ādinā na ca a phoṭṭhabba āyatanānam pathavī dhātu ādīnam viya a gandha rasa āyatanānam  gandha rasānam tattha bhāvaḥ sakkā vattum phusitum a sakkuṇeyya tā vinimuttassa pathavī ādi sabhāvassa
translated: And the existence of odour and flavour there cannot be said to be like that of the earth element, etc., which are the tangible-data bases,

original: viya gandharasabhāvavinimuttassa gandharasasabhāvassa abhāvā.
analyzed: gandha rasa bhāva vinimuttassa gandha rasa sabhāvassa abhāvā
translated: because there is no odour and flavour there that is not devoid of the nature of odour and flavour, as there is no earth element, etc., that is not devoid of the nature of the tangible datum that can be contacted.

original: Yadi ca ghānasamphassādīnaṃ kāraṇabhāvo natthīti āyatanānīti tena vucceyyuṃ, dhātu-saddo
analyzed: yadi ca ghāna samphassa ādīnam kāraṇa bhāvaḥ na atthi iti āyatanāni iti tena vucceyyum dhātu saddaḥ
translated: And if it is said that the bases are so called because they are the cause of nose-contact, etc., then the term element

original: pana nissattanijjīvavācakoti gandhadhāturasadhātūti avacane natthi kāraṇaṃ, dhammabhāvo
analyzed: pana nissatta nijjīva vācakaḥ ti gandha dhātu rasa dhātū ti avacane na atthi kāraṇam dhamma bhāvo
translated: But there is no reason why the words “odour element” and “flavour element” should not be used in the way stated, since the state of being an element is common to all dhammas.

original: ca tesaṃ ekantena icchitabbo sabhāvadhāraṇādilakkhaṇato aññassa abhāvā, dhammānañca
analyzed: ca tesam ekantena icchitabbo sabhāva dhāraṇā ādi lakkhaṇato aññassa abhāvāḥ dhammānaṃ ca
translated: And the state of being an element must be admitted in the ultimate sense, since there is nothing else to be found as the characteristic of holding together a specific individual nature, etc.,🔽and the state of being a base is stated in the ultimate sense in the Yamaka: “Is dhamma a base? All are. ”

original: āyatanabhāvo ekantato yamake vutto “dhammo āyatananti? Āmantā”ti. Tasmā tesaṃ gandharasāyatanabhāvābhāvepi
analyzed: āyatana bhāvaḥ ekantataḥ yamake vuttaḥ dhammo āyatananti āmantā ati tasmā tesam gandha rasa āyatana bhāva abhāve pi
translated: So even though there is no state of being a base consisting in odour and flavour,

original: koci āyatanasabhāvo vattabbo. Yadi ca phoṭṭhabbabhāvato añño pathavīdhātuādibhāvo🔽viya gandharasabhāvato añño tesaṃ koci sabhāvo siyā, tesaṃ dhammāyatane saṅgaho.🔽Gandharasabhāve pana āyatanabhāve ca sati gandho ca so āyatanañca gandhāyatanaṃ,
analyzed: koci āyatana sabhāvaḥ vattabbaḥ yadi ca phoṭṭhabba bhāvataḥ añño pathavī dhātu ādi bhāvo  viya gandha rasa bhāvato añño tesam koci sabhāvo siyā tesam dhamma āyatane saṅgaho  gandha rasa bhāve pana āyatana bhāve ca sati gandhaḥ ca āyatanam ca gandhāyatanam
translated: some state of being a base must be mentioned. And if there were some state of being a base consisting in odour and flavour, different from the state of being a tangible datum, like the state of being the earth element, etc.,🔽then they would be included in the mental-data base.🔽But when there is the state of being a base consisting in odour and flavour, then it is allowable to say that “Odour is a base, and that is a mental-data base, thus odour is the mental-data base” ,

original: raso ca so āyatanañca rasāyatananti idamāpannamevāti gandharasāyatanabhāvo ca na
analyzed: rasaḥ ca saḥ āyatanam ca rasa āyatananti idam āpannam eva ati gandha rasa āyatana bhāvaḥ ca na
translated: and that “Flavour is a base, and that is a mental-data base, thus flavour is the mental-data base” ,🔽and so the state of being a mental-data base consisting in odour and flavour cannot be denied.

original: sakkā nivāretuṃ, “tayo āhārā”ti ca vacanato kabaḷīkārāhārassa tattha abhāvo viññāyati.
analyzed: sakkā nivāretum tayo āhārā ti ca vacanato kabaḷīkāra āhārassa tattha abhāvaḥ viññāyati
translated: And the fact that there is no physical nutriment there is known from the words, “Three nutriments” .

original: Tasmā yathā pāḷiyā avirodho hoti, tathā rūpagaṇanā kātabbā. Evañhi dhammatā na vilomitā hotīti.
analyzed: tasmā yathā pāḷiyāḥ avirodhaḥ hoti tathā rūpa gaṇanā kātabbā evam hi dhamma tā na vilomitā hoti iti
translated: So the enumeration of materiality should be done in such a way that it is not in conflict with the texts. For in that way the natural order is not violated.

original: Jātiuṇṇāyāti gabbhaṃ phāletvā gahitauṇṇāyātipi vadanti. Sambhavabhedoti atthitābhedo. Nijjhāmataṇhikā kira niccaṃ dukkhāturatāya kāmaṃ sevitvā gabbhaṃ na gaṇhanti.
analyzed: jāti uṇṇāya ati gabbham phāletvā gahita oṇṇāya ati pi vadanti sambhava bhedo ti atthi tā bhedaḥ nijjhāma taṇhikā kira niccam dukkha ātura tāya kāmam sevitvā gabbham na gaṇhanti
translated: “At the time of the peak of the embryo”: they say “at the time of the peak of the embryo after the bursting of the amniotic vesicle.” “The difference of origination”: the difference of non-existence. The Nijjhāmataṇhī spirits, it seems, never become pregnant because they are always suffering from the pain of menstruation.

original: Rūpībrahmesu tāva opapātikayonikesūti opapātikayonikehi rūpībrahme niddhāreti. “Saṃsedajopapātīsu
analyzed: rūpī brahmesu tāva opapātika yonikesu iti opapātika yonikehi rūpī brahme saṃseda jopapātīsu
translated: “Among the fine-material Brahmās, firstly, among those of apparitional generation and those of the womb”: among the fine-material Brahmās of apparitional generation and of the womb.

original: avakaṃsato tiṃsā”ti etaṃ vivaranto āha “avakaṃsato panā”tiādi, taṃ panetaṃ pāḷiyā
analyzed: etam vivarantaḥ āha avakaṃsataḥ tam pana itam
translated: “Among the thirty-two in the case of the rest” . Explaining this, he says, “But in the case of the rest” , etc. But this does not agree with the text.

original: na sameti. Na hi pāḷiyaṃ kāmāvacarānaṃ saṃsedajopapātikānaṃ aghānakānaṃ upapatti
analyzed: na sameti na hi pāḷiyam kāmāvacarānam saṃseda ja upapātikānam aghānakānam
translated: For in the text no rebirth among the apparitional beings of the sense sphere is mentioned.

original: vuttā. Dhammahadayavibhaṅge hi –
analyzed: vuttā dhamma hadaya vibhaṅge hi
translated: For in the Dhammahadayavibhaṅga it is said:

original: “Kāmadhātuyā upapattikkhaṇe kassaci ekādasāyatanāni pātubhavanti, kassaci dasāyatanāni, kassaci aparāni dasāyatanāni, kassaci navāyatanāni, kassaci sattāyatanāni pātubhavantī”ti –
analyzed: kāmadhātuyāḥ upapatti khaṇe kassaci ekādasa āyatanāni pātubhavanti kassaci dasa āyatanāni kassaci aparāni dasa āyatanāni kassaci nava āyatanāni kassaci satta āyatanāni pātubhavanti iti
translated: “At the moment of rebirth-linking in the fine-material sphere eleven bases become manifest to some, ten to some, to some the other ten, to some nine, to some seven” .

original: Vuttaṃ, na vuttaṃ “aṭṭhāyatanāni pātubhavantī”ti. Tathā “dasāyatanāni pātubhavantī”ti🔽tikkhattuṃ vattabbaṃ siyā, aghānakaupapattiyā vijjamānāya tikkhattuñca “navāyatanāni
analyzed: vuttam na vuttam aṭṭha āyatanāni pātubhavanti iti tathā dasa āyatanāni pātubhavanti iti  tikkhattum vattabbam siyā aghānaka upapattiyā vijjamānāya tikkhattum ca nava āyatanāni
translated: But it is not said that eight become manifest. And likewise it should be said three times that ten become manifest,🔽and it is not said that nine become manifest, though there is rebirth without the nose.

original: pātubhavantī”ti, na ca taṃ vuttaṃ. Evaṃ dhātupātubhāvādipañhesu yamakepi ghānajivhākāyānaṃ sahacāritā vuttāti.
analyzed: pātubhavanti iti na ca tat vuttam evam dhātu pātubhāva ādi pañhesu yamake pi ghāna jivhā kāyānam sahacāri tā vuttā ti
translated: So too in the dyads on the manifestation of the elements, etc., the nose, tongue and body are mentioned as occurring together.

original: Cutipaṭisandhīnaṃ khandhādīhi aññamaññaṃ samānatā abhedo, asamānatā bhedo. Nayamukhamattaṃ
analyzed: cuti paṭisandhīnam khandha ādīhi aññamaññam samāna tā abhedaḥ asamāna tā bhedaḥ naya mukhamattam
translated: Sameness of aggregates, etc., at death and rebirth-linking is non-differentiation; differentiation is non-sameness.

original: dassetvā vuttaṃ avuttañca sabbaṃ saṅgaṇhitvā āha “ayaṃ tāva arūpabhūmīsuyeva nayo”ti.
analyzed: dassetvā vuttam a vuttam ca sabbam saṅgaṇhitvā āha ayam tāva arūpa bhūmīsu yā iva nayo ti
translated: The method is shown in the dyads, but the rest is included by the words “This is the method in the immaterial sphere only.”

original: Rūpārūpāvacarānaṃ upacārassa balavatāya tato cavitvā duggatiyaṃ upapatti natthīti
analyzed: rūpa arūpa avacarānaṃ upacārassa balava tāya tato cavitvā duggatiyam upapatti natthi iti
translated: And because the access of the fine-material and immaterial jhānas is strong, there is no rebirth in a lower plane for one who has died from there.🔽So he said “at death in a happy destiny” .

original: “ekaccasugaticutiyā”ti āha. Ekaccaduggatipaṭisandhīti ettha ekaccaggahaṇassa payojanaṃ🔽maggitabbaṃ. Ayaṃ panetthādhippāyo siyā – nānattakāyanānattasaññīsu vuttā ekacce
analyzed: ekacca sugati cutiyā iti āha ekacca duggati paṭisandhi iti ettha ekacca ggahaṇassa payojanam  maggitabbam ayam pana itthā adhippāyaḥ siyā nānatta kāya nānatta saññīsu vuttāḥ ekacce
translated: As regards the words “a rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny,” the purpose of the word “certain” should be🔽traced out. The intention here may be this: the certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .

original: vinipātikā tihetukādipaṭisandhikā, tesaṃ taṃ paṭisandhiṃ vinipātabhāvena duggatipaṭisandhīti🔽gahetvā sabbasugaticutiyāva sā paṭisandhi hoti, na ekaccasugaticutiyā evāti taṃnivattanatthaṃ🔽ekaccaduggatiggahaṇaṃ kataṃ. Apāyapaṭisandhi eva hi ekaccasugaticutiyā hoti, na sabbasugaticutiyā.
analyzed: vinipātikā ti hetuka ādi paṭisandhikā tesam tam paṭisandhim vinipāta bhāvena duggati paṭisandhi iti  gahetvā sabba sugati cutiyā ava sā paṭisandhi hoti na ekacca sugati cutiyā eva ati tad nivattana attham  ekacca duggati gahaṇam katam apāya paṭisandhi eva hi ekacca sugati cutiyā hoti na sabba sugati cutiyā
translated: The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .

original: Atha vā duggatipaṭisandhi duvidhā ekaccasugaticutiyā anantarā duggaticutiyā cāti.
analyzed: atha vā duggati paṭisandhi duvidhā ekacca sugati cutiyā anantarā duggati cutiyā ca ati
translated: The certain kind of unhappy destiny is the one called “rebirth-linking in a certain kind of unhappy destiny” .🔽The

original: Tattha pacchimaṃ vajjetvā purimaṃ eva gaṇhituṃ āha “ekaccaduggatipaṭisandhī”ti. Ahetukacutiyā
analyzed: tattha pacchimam vajjetvā purimam eva gaṇhitum āha ekacca duggati paṭisandhi iti ahetuka cutiyā
translated: Herein, the last is to be rejected and the first is to be taken, so he said “ some rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny” .🔽🔽In the case of a rebirth-linking with no root-cause

original: sahetukapaṭisandhīti duhetukā tihetukā ca yojetabbā. Maṇḍūkadevaputtādīnaṃ viya hi🔽ahetukacutiyā tihetukapaṭisandhipi hotīti.
analyzed: sa hetuka paṭisandhi iti du hetukā ti hetukā ca yojetabbā maṇḍūka devaputta ādīnam viya hi  ahetuka cutiyā ti hetuka paṭisandhi pi hoti iti
translated: Herein, the last should be set aside and the first taken. “With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny” is said. With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny: with some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny should be construed. For there is rebirth-linking with three roots in the case of some kinds of death without roots, as in the case of the young god Maṇḍa and so on.

original: Tassa tassa viparītato ca yathāyogaṃ yojetabbanti “ekaccasugaticutiyā ekaccaduggatipaṭisandhī”tiādīsu
analyzed: tassa tassa viparītataḥ ca yathāyogam yojetabbanti ekacca sugati cutiyā ekacca duggati paṭisandhi iti ādīsu
translated: With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny: with some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny: with some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny: with some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny should be construed.

original: bhedavisesesu “ekaccaduggaticutiyā ekaccasugatipaṭisandhī”tiādinā yaṃ yaṃ yujjati,🔽taṃ taṃ yojetabbanti attho. Yujjamānamattāpekkhanavasena napuṃsakaniddeso kato, yojetabbanti
analyzed: bheda visesesu ekacca duggati cutiyā ekacca sugati paṭisandhi iti ādinā yam yam yujjati  tam tam yojetabbanti atthaḥ yujjamāna matta apekkhana vasena napuṃsaka niddeso kataḥ yojetabbanti
translated: With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny: with some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny: with some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny: with some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny: with some kinds of death in an unhappy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny should be construed.

original: vā bhāvattho daṭṭhabbo. Amahaggatabahiddhārammaṇāya mahaggataajjhattārammaṇātiādīsu🔽pana viparītayojanā na kātabbā. Na hi mahaggataajjhattārammaṇāya cutiyā arūpabhūmīsu
analyzed: vā bhāva atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ amahaggata bahiddhā ārammaṇāya mahaggata ajjhatta ārammaṇa āti ādīsu 🔽pana viparīta yojanā na kātabbā na hi mahaggata ajjhatta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ arūpa bhūmīsu
translated: With some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny: with some kinds of death in a happy destiny and with some kinds of rebirth-linking in a happy destiny should be construed.🔽With some kinds of

original: amahaggatabahiddhārammaṇā paṭisandhi atthi. Catukkhandhāya arūpacutiyā pañcakkhandhā
analyzed: amahaggata bahiddhā ārammaṇā paṭisandhi atthi catu khandhāya arūpa cutiyā pañca khandhā
translated: There is rebirth-linking with a great-sphere object externally. There is death in the immaterial with four aggregates and rebirth-linking with five aggregates in the fine-material sphere.

original: kāmāvacarapaṭisandhīti etassa vipariyāyo sayameva yojito. Atītārammaṇacutiyā paccuppannārammaṇā🔽paṭisandhīti etassa ca vipariyāyo natthi evāti. Bhedaviseso eva ca evaṃ vitthārena
analyzed: kāmāvacara paṭisandhi iti etassa vipariyāyo sayam eva yojitaḥ atīta ārammaṇa cutiyā paccuppanna ārammaṇā  paṭisandhi iti etassa ca vipariyāyaḥ natthi eva ati bheda visesaḥ eva ca evam vitthārena
translated: The opposite of this is to be construed by the method stated thus: “With death in the past and rebirth-linking in the present … ”🔽And there is no opposite of this: “With death with a past object and rebirth-linking with a present object. ”

original: dassito, abhedaviseso pana ekekasmiṃ bhede tattha tattheva cutipaṭisandhiyojanāvasena🔽yojetabbo “pañcakkhandhāya kāmāvacarāya pañcakkhandhā kāmāvacarā…pe… avitakkaavicārāya
analyzed: dassitaḥ abheda visesaḥ pana ekekasmin bhede tattha tattha iva cuti paṭisandhi yojanā vasena  yojetabbo pañcakkhandhāya kāmāvacarāya avitakka avicārāya
translated: But the difference in the way of dividing is shown in detail in this way. The difference in the undifferentiated way is to be construed by the method of construing death and rebirth-linking in each case thus: “With death in the fine-material sphere with five aggregates, rebirth-linking with five aggregates in the fine-material sphere … With death in the immaterial sphere with four aggregates, rebirth-linking with four aggregates in the immaterial sphere” .

original: avitakkaavicārā”ti, catukkhandhāya pana catukkhandhā sayameva yojitā. Eteneva nayena
analyzed: avitakka avicārā ti catu khandhāya pana catu khandhā sayam eva yojitā etena iva nayena
translated: But the opposite of this is to be construed by the method stated thus: “With death in the fine-material sphere with five aggregates, rebirth-linking with five aggregates in the fine-material sphere … With death in the immaterial sphere with four aggregates, rebirth-linking with four aggregates in the immaterial sphere” .🔽The difference in the undifferentiated way is not shown in the case of the five aggregates, etc., because it can be known by the same method.

original: sakkā ñātunti pañcakkhandhādīsu abhedaviseso na dassitoti. Tato hetuṃ vināti tattha hetuṃ vinā.
analyzed: sakkā ñātunti pañca kkhandha ādīsu abheda visesaḥ na dassito ti tatas hetum vinā ti tattha hetum vinā
translated: “Without a cause there” means without a cause there.

original: Aṅgapaccaṅgasandhīnaṃ bandhanāni aṅgapaccaṅgasandhibandhanāni, tesaṃ chedakānaṃ.
analyzed: aṅga paccaṅga sandhīnam bandhanāni aṅga paccaṅga sandhi bandhanāni tesam chedakānam
translated: “Joints’ bonds” are the bonds of the joints of the limbs and minor parts. “Of those that cut” means of those that cut them.

original: Niruddhesu cakkhādīsūti atimandabhāvūpagamanaṃ sandhāya vuttanti veditabbaṃ. Pañcadvārikaviññāṇānantarampi
analyzed: niruddhesu cakkha ādīsu iti ati manda bhāva upagamanam sandhāya vuttan ti veditabbam pañcadvārika viññāṇa anantaram pi
translated: For cessation is shown previously to the five-door-consciousness,

original: hi pubbe cuti dassitā. Yamake ca –🔽“Yassa cakkhāyatanaṃ nirujjhati, tassa manāyatanaṃ nirujjhatīti? Āmantā. Yassa vā🔽pana manāyatanaṃ nirujjhati, tassa cakkhāyatanaṃ nirujjhatīti? Sacittakānaṃ acakkhukānaṃ🔽cavantānaṃ tesaṃ manāyatanaṃ nirujjhati, no ca tesaṃ cakkhāyatanaṃ nirujjhati. Sacakkhukānaṃ
analyzed: hi pubbe cuti dassitā yamake ca  yassa cakkhu āyatanam nirujjhati tassa mana āyatanam nirujjhati iti āmantā yassa vā  pana mana āyatanam nirujjhati tassa cakkhu āyatanam nirujjhati iti sa cittakānam acakkhukānam  cavantānam tesam manāyatanam nirujjhati no ca tesam cakkhāyatanam nirujjhati sa cakkhukānam
translated: and in the case of twins,

original: cavantānaṃ tesaṃ manāyatanañca nirujjhati, cakkhāyatanañca nirujjhatī”ti –
analyzed: cavantānam tesam manāyatanam ca nirujjhati cakkhāyatanam ca nirujjhati iti
translated: “If the eye-sensitivity of one of a pair of twins ceases, does the mind-sensitivity of the other cease too? It may be that the mind-sensitivity of the other ceases, though the eye-sensitivity of this one does not cease. It may be that the eye-sensitivity of this one ceases, though the mind-sensitivity of the other does not cease. It may be that the eye-sensitivity of this one ceases and also the mind-sensitivity of the other ceases. It may be that the eye-sensitivity of this one does not cease and also the mind-sensitivity of the other does not cease” .

original: Ādinā cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ cuticittena saha nirodho vuttoti. Laddho avaseso avijjādiko
analyzed: ādinā cakkhāyatana ādīnam cuti cittena saha nirodho vuttaḥ ti laddhaḥ avasesaḥ avijjā ādikaḥ
translated: And so on. So cessation is stated together with the death consciousness in the case of the eye-sensitivity, etc.🔽The condition that is left over,🔽is a condition for consciousness, is a condition that is left over, which is a formation.

original: viññāṇassa paccayo etenāti laddhāvasesapaccayo, saṅkhāro. Avijjāpaṭicchāditādīnave
analyzed: viññāṇassa paccayaḥ etena ati laddha avasesa paccayaḥ saṅkhāro avijjā paṭicchādita ādīnave
translated: In the case of the ignorance that is concealed by ignorance, etc.

original: tasmiṃ kammādivisaye paṭisandhiviññāṇassa ārammaṇabhāvena uppattiṭṭhānabhūte taṇhāya
analyzed: tasmin kamma ādi visaye paṭisandhi viññāṇassa ārammaṇa bhāvena uppatti ṭṭhāna bhūte taṇhāya
translated: Because craving, which is the condition for rebirth-linking consciousness in the objective field of kamma-result, has not been abandoned,

original: appahīnattā eva purimuppannāya ca santatiyā pariṇatattā paṭisandhiṭṭhānābhimukhaṃ
analyzed: appahīna ttā eva purima uppannāya ca santatiyā pariṇata ttā paṭisandhi ṭṭhāna abhimukham
translated: and because of the transformation of the preceding continuity, consciousness occurs tending, inclining, and leaning towards the rebirth-linking base.

original: viññāṇaṃ ninnapoṇapabbhāraṃ hutvā pavattatīti āha “taṇhā nāmetī”ti. Sahajātasaṅkhārāti
analyzed: viññāṇam ninna poṇa pabbhāram hutvā pavattati iti āha taṇhā nāma iti iti sahajāta saṅkhārā ati
translated: That is why he said, “Craving is called ‘leading’ … “

original: cutiāsannajavanaviññāṇasahajātacetanā, sabbepi vā phassādayo. Tasmiṃ paṭisandhiṭṭhāne🔽kammādivisaye viññāṇaṃ khipanti, khipantā viya tasmiṃ visaye paṭisandhivasena viññāṇapatiṭṭhānassa
analyzed: cuti āsanna javana viññāṇa sahajāta cetanā sabbe pi vā phassa ādayaḥ tasmim paṭisandhi ṭṭhāne  kamma ādi visaye viññāṇam khipanti khipantāḥ viya tasmin visaye paṭisandhi vasena viññāṇa patiṭṭhānassa
translated: “Conascent formations”: the volition conascent with the impulsion consciousness near to death, or all the states beginning with contact.

original: hetubhāvena pavattantīti attho.
analyzed: hetu bhāvena pavattanti iti atthaḥ
translated: They “impel” consciousness to the rebirth-linking base, in the objective field of kamma-result. The meaning is that they occur as the cause for the establishment of consciousness by rebirth-linking in that objective field as if impelling it.

original: Tanti taṃ viññāṇaṃ, cutipaṭisandhitadāsannaviññāṇānaṃ santativasena viññāṇanti upanītekattaṃ.
analyzed: tam ti tam viññāṇam cuti paṭisandhi tad āsanna viññāṇānam santati vasena viññāṇan ti upanīta ekattam
translated: “That”: that consciousness, which is brought to unity as consciousness by continuity of death, rebirth-linking, and the consciousness near to rebirth-linking.

original: Taṇhāya nāmiyamānaṃ…pe… pavattatīti namanakhipanapurimanissayajahanāparanissayassādananissayarahitapavattanāni
analyzed: taṇhāya pavattati iti namana khipana purima nissaya jahana apara nissaya ssādana nissaya rahita pavattanāni
translated: “Impelled by craving … occurs” : it occurs without bending, impulsion, previous support, relinquishment of previous support, satisfaction, or dependence on support.

original: santativasena tassevekassa viññāṇassa honti, na aññassāti dasseti. Santativasenāti🔽ca vadanto “tadevidaṃ viññāṇaṃ sandhāvati saṃsarati anañña”nti idañca micchāgāhaṃ
analyzed: santati vasena tassa iva ekassa viññāṇassa honti na aññassa ati dasseti santati vasena ati  ca vadantaḥ tat eva idam viññāṇam sandhāvati saṃsarati idam ca micchāgāham
translated: He shows that they belong to that same consciousness, not to another.🔽And by saying “in continuity” he rejects the wrong view that “This consciousness runs and wanders about, not another.”

original: paṭikkhipati. Sati hi nānattanaye santativasena ekattanayo hotīti. Orimatīrarukkhavinibaddharajju
analyzed: paṭikkhipati sati hi nānā tanaye santati vasena eka tanayaḥ hoti iti orima tīra rukkha vinibaddha rajju
translated: For if there were a plurality of consciousnesses, the continuity would be a plurality too.🔽The kamma, etc., as object should be regarded as the rope fastened to the tree on the near bank;

original: viya purimabhavattabhāvavinibandhaṃ kammādiārammaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, puriso viya viññāṇaṃ,
analyzed: viya purima bhava tta bhāva vinibandham kamma ādi ārammaṇam daṭṭhabbam purisaḥ viya viññāṇam
translated: consciousness is like the man;

original: tassa mātikātikkamanicchā viya taṇhā, atikkamanapayogo viya khipanakasaṅkhārā. Yathā🔽ca so puriso paratīre patiṭṭhahamāno paratīrarukkhavinibaddhaṃ kiñci assādayamāno
analyzed: tassa mātikā atikkaman icchā viya taṇhā atikkamana payogaḥ viya khipanaka saṅkhārā yathā  ca so puriso para tīre patiṭṭhahamāno para tīra rukkha vinibaddham kiñci assādayamāno
translated: craving is like his desire to cross over; the volitions are like his effort to cross over.🔽And just as the man, when he has reached the further bank, does so either by enjoying the rope fastened to the tree on the further bank or without doing so,

original: anassādayamāno vā kevalaṃ pathaviyaṃ sabalapayogeheva patiṭṭhāti, evamidampi bhavantarattabhāvavinibaddhaṃ
analyzed: anaḥsādayamānaḥ vā kevalam pathaviyam sa bala payaḥ gehā iva patiṭṭhāti evam idam pi bhavanta ratta bhāva vinibaddham
translated: so this consciousness, when it has reached the further bank of the rebirth-linking, does so by enjoying the kamma, etc., fastened to the existence on the further bank or without doing so.

original: hadayavatthunissayaṃ pañcavokārabhave assādayamānaṃ catuvokārabhave anassādayamānaṃ
analyzed: hadaya vatthu nissayam pañcavokāra bhave assādayamānam catuvokāra bhave an assādayamānam
translated: It occurs in the five-constituent becoming, experiencing the object of the heart-basis, and in the four-constituent becoming, not experiencing it.🔽Or it occurs only in the kamma that is associated with the object.

original: vā kevalaṃ ārammaṇasampayuttakammeheva pavattati. Tattha assādayamānanti pāpuṇantaṃ,
analyzed: vā kevalam ārammaṇa sampayutta kammehi iva pavattati tattha assādayamānanti pāpuṇantam
translated: Herein, “experiencing” is reaching,

original: paṭilabhamānanti attho.
analyzed: paṭilabhamānanti attho
translated: obtaining, is what is meant.🔽From the rebirth-linking in another becoming, etc.,

original: Bhavantarādipaṭisandhānatoti bhavantarassa ādisambandhanato, bhavantarādayo vā bhavayonigativiññāṇaṭṭhitisattāvāsantarā,
analyzed: bhavantara ādi paṭisandhānato ti bhavantarassa ādi sambandhanataḥ bhavantara ādayaḥ vā bhava yoni gati viññāṇa ṭṭhiti sattā vāsantarā
translated: means from the connection with the beginning of another becoming, or else the “other becoming, etc.,” are the other becoming, the other kind of being, the other destiny, the other station of consciousness, the other abode of beings,

original: tesaṃ paṭisandhānatoti attho. Kammanti paṭisandhijanakaṃ kammaṃ. Saṅkhārāti cutiāsannajavanaviññāṇasahagatā khipanakasaṅkhārā.🔽Saddādihetukāti ettha paṭighoso saddahetuko, padīpo padīpantarādihetuko, muddā lañchanahetukā,
analyzed: tesam paṭisandhānato ti attho kammanti paṭisandhi janakam kammam saṅkhārā ati cuti āsanna javana viññāṇa sahagatā khipanaka saṅkhārā  sadda ādi hetukā ati ettha paṭighosaḥ sadda hetuko padīpo padīpa antara ādi hetukaḥ muddā lañchana hetukā
translated: and the meaning is that it occurs from the rebirth-linking of these. “Kamma” is the kamma that generates rebirth-linking. “Determinations” are the determinations that impel at the time of death.🔽With sound, etc., as cause: here sound as cause is the sound of a voice; light as cause is a lamp, another lamp, etc.; a mark as cause is a tally;

original: chāyā ādāsādigatamukhādihetukā. Aññatra agantvā hontīti saddādipaccayadesaṃ agantvā
analyzed: chāyā ādāsa ādi gata mukha ādi hetukā aññatra a gantvā honti iti sadda ādi paccaya desam a gantvā
translated: a shadow as cause is the face, etc., in a mirror, etc. “Without going there” means without going to the place that is the condition for sound, etc.

original: saddādihetukā honti tato pubbe abhāvā, evamidampi paṭisandhiviññāṇaṃ na hetudesaṃ🔽gantvā taṃhetukaṃ hoti tato pubbe abhāvā, tasmā na idaṃ hetudesato purimabhavato🔽āgataṃ paṭighosādayo viya saddādidesato, nāpi tattha hetunā vinā uppannaṃ saddādīhi🔽vinā paṭighosādayo viyāti attho. Atha vā aññatra agantvā hontīti pubbe paccayadese
analyzed: sadda ādi hetukāḥ honti tatas pubbe abhāvāḥ evam idam pi paṭisandhi viññāṇam na hetu desam  gantvā taṃhetukam hoti tatas pubbe abhāvā tasmā na idam hetu desato purima bhavataḥ  āgatam paṭighosa ādayaḥ sadda ādi desataḥ na api tattha hetunā vinā uppannam sadda ādīhi  vinā paṭighosa ādayaḥ viya iti atthaḥ atha vā aññatra a gantvā honti iti pubbe paccaya dese
translated: They are not due to sound, etc., because they did not exist before. So too this rebirth-linking consciousness is not due to a cause that existed before it,🔽because it did not exist before. Therefore it has not come from a previous becoming, like an echo, etc., from sound, etc. Nor has it arisen there without a cause, like an echo, etc., without sound, etc. This is the meaning.

original: sannihitā hutvā tato aññatra gantvā tappaccayā na honti uppattito pubbe abhāvā, nāpi🔽saddādipaccayā na honti, evamidampīti vuttanayena yojetabbaṃ. Esa nayoti bījaṅkurādīsu🔽sabbahetuhetusamuppannesu yathāsambhavaṃ yojanā kātabbāti dasseti. Idhāpi hi hetuhetusamuppannaviññāṇānaṃ
analyzed: sannihitāḥ hutvā tatas aññatra gantvā tad paccayāḥ na honti uppattito pubbe abhāvā na api  sadda ādi paccayāḥ na honti evam idam pi iti vutta nayena yojetabbam esa nayaḥ ti bīja aṅkura ādīsu  sabba hetu hetu samuppannesu yathāsambhavam yojanā kātabbā iti dasseti idha api hi hetu hetu samuppanna viññāṇānam
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning can be given as follows: They are not due to a cause that existed before it, because they did not exist before, that is to say, because they are not present at the time of the cause. Nor are they due to a cause, because they are not due to sound, etc., like an echo, etc. So too this rebirth-linking consciousness, etc.

original: ekantamekatte sati na manussagatiko devagatibhūto siyā, ekantanānatte na kammavato
analyzed: ekantam ekatte sati na manussa gatikaḥ deva gati bhūtaḥ siyā ekanta nānatte na kammavataḥ
translated: This method, etc. He shows that the application should be made in all cases of cause and causally arisen states such as the seed and the sprout, as appropriate. For here too, if the consciousnesses that are cause and causally arisen were absolutely identical, one who had a human destiny would not have a divine destiny; and if they were absolutely different, then the kamma-creator would not reap the fruit.

original: phalaṃ siyā. Tato “rattassa bījaṃ, rattassa phala”ntiādikassa viya “bhūtapubbāhaṃ,🔽bhante, rohitasso nāma isī”tiādikassa vohārassa lopo siyā, tasmā ettha santānabandhe🔽sati hetuhetusamuppannesu na ekantameva ekatā vā nānatā vā upagantabbā. Ettha ca🔽ekantaekatāpaṭisedhena “sayaṃkataṃ sukhaṃ dukkha”nti imaṃ diṭṭhiṃ nivāreti, ekantanānatāpaṭisedhena
analyzed: phalam siyā tatas rattassa bījam rattassa phalanti ādikassa viya bhūta pubbāham  bhante rohitassaḥ nāma isi iti ādikassa vohārassa lopaḥ siyā tasmai ettha santāna bandhe  sati hetu hetu samuppannesu na ekantam eva ekatā vā nānatā vā upagantabbā ettha ca  ekanta ekatā paṭisedhena sayaṃkatam sukham dukkhanti imam diṭṭhim nivāreti ekanta nānatā paṭisedhena
translated: and the fruit would be. And then, as in the case of the expression “The seed is at night, the fruit is at night,” etc., so in the case of the expression “I was in the past, venerable sir, a bull elephant named Roja,” etc., there would be the loss of usage. Therefore, when there is a continuity of the series,🔽it should not be asserted that there is absolute identity or absolute difference in the case of cause and effect. And here,🔽by the denial of absolute identity, the view that pleasure and pain are self-made is rejected; by the denial of absolute difference, the view that they are made by another is rejected.

original: “paraṃkataṃ sukhaṃ dukkha”nti, hetuhetusamuppannabhāvavacanena “adhiccasamuppanna”nti. Etthāti ekasantāne.🔽Catumadhuraalattakarasādibhāvanā ambamātuluṅgādibījānaṃ abhisaṅkhāro. Ettha bījaṃ🔽viya kammavā satto, abhisaṅkhāro viya kammaṃ, bījassa aṅkurādippabandho viya sattassa
analyzed: paraṃkatam sukham dukkhanti hetu hetu samuppanna bhāva vacanena adhicca samuppannanti ettha ati eka santāne 🔽catu madhura alattaka rasa ādi bhāvanā amba mātuluṅga ādi bījānam abhisaṅkhāraḥ ettha bījam 🔽viya kammavā sattaḥ abhisaṅkhāraḥ viya kammam bījassa aṅkura ādi ppabandhaḥ viya sattassa
translated: and the fruit would be the same. Then the usage “The seed of the night, the fruit of the night” and so on, and “I was the seer named Rohitassa, venerable sir” and so on, would be lost. So here, when there is a continuity, it is not proper to insist on either sameness or otherness in what is originated by cause and condition. And here he rejects the view “Pleasure and pain are self-made” by the rejection of absolute sameness, and he rejects the view “Pleasure and pain are other-made” by the rejection of absolute otherness, and he rejects the view “Pleasure and pain are fortuitous” by the statement that there is an origination of what is originated by cause and condition. Here means in a single continuity. The “formation” is the cultivation of the four kinds of nutriment, of the four great elements, of the four formless constituents, of the four paths, of the four fruits, of the four jhānas, of the four formless attainments, of the four foundations of mindfulness, and so on. Herein, just as the seed is the being, so the kamma is the formation. Just as the succession of sprout, and so on, is to the seed, so the succession of the aggregates, and so on, is to the being.

original: paṭisandhiviññāṇādippabandho, tatthuppannassa madhurassa rattakesarassa vā phalassa
analyzed: paṭisandhi viññāṇa ādi ppabandho tattha uppannassa madhurassa ratta kesarassa vā phalassa
translated: and the series beginning with rebirth-linking consciousness is like the sweet or sour taste that arises in the fruit of the same kind of seed,

original: vā tasseva bījassa, tato eva ca abhisaṅkhārato bhāvo viya kammakārakasseva sattassa,
analyzed: vā tassa iva bījassa tatas eva ca abhisaṅkhārataḥ bhāvaḥ viya kamma kārakassa iva sattassa
translated: and like the existence of the seed itself, which is the maker of the fruit, and the fruit’s existence is due to that kamma.🔽And the learning of a craft by a boy’s body does not go on to the body in later life.

original: taṃkammato eva ca phalassa bhāvo veditabbo. Bālasarīre kataṃ vijjāpariyāpuṇanaṃ sippasikkhanaṃ🔽osadhappayogo ca na vuḍḍhasarīraṃ gacchanti. Atha ca taṃnimittaṃ vijjāpāṭavaṃ sippajānanaṃ
analyzed: taṃkammataḥ eva ca phalassa bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ bāla sarīre katam vijjā pariyāpuṇanam sippa sikkhanam  osadha ppayogaḥ ca na vuḍḍha sarīram gacchanti atha ca taṃnimittam vijjā pāṭavam sippa jānanam
translated: And yet the skill in learning and the craft and the health are in the body in later life, which has that as its sign.🔽And they are not in another’s body, because they arise only in the body in later life that is included in that same continuity.

original: anāmayatā ca vuḍḍhasarīre hoti, na ca taṃ aññassa hoti taṃsantatipariyāpanne eva🔽vuḍḍhasarīre uppajjanato, na ca yathāpayuttena vijjāpariyāpuṇanādinā vinā aññato
analyzed: anāmaya tā ca vuḍḍha sarīre hoti na ca tam aññassa hoti tad santati pariyāpanne eva  vuḍḍha sarīre uppajjanataḥ na ca yathā apayuttena vijjā pariyāpuṇana ādinā vinā aññatas
translated: And they are not due to another, because they are absent when the learning of the craft, etc., is absent.

original: hoti tadabhāve abhāvato. Evamidhāpi santāne yaṃ phalaṃ, etaṃ nāññassa, na ca aññatoti
analyzed: hoti tad abhāve abhāvataḥ evam idha api santāne yam phalam etam na aññassa na ca aññatoti
translated: So too here, the fruit that is in the continuity is not in another, nor is it due to another.

original: yojetabbaṃ. Na aññatoti etena ca saṅkhārābhāve phalābhāvameva dasseti, nāññapaccayanivāraṇaṃ karoti.
analyzed: yojetabbam na aññatas ti etena ca saṅkhāra abhāve phala abhāvam eva dasseti na añña paccaya nivāraṇam karoti
translated: and it should be construed thus. By “not from another” he shows only that there is no effect if there is no formation, he does not deny other conditions.

original: Yampi vuttaṃ, tattha vadāmāti vacanaseso. Tattha vā upabhuñjake asati siddhā bhuñjakasammutīti sambandho. Phalatīti sammuti phalatisammuti.
analyzed: yat pi vuttam tattha vadāma ati vacana seso tattha vā upabhuñjake asati siddhā bhuñjaka sammuti iti sambandho phalati iti sammuti phalati sammuti
translated: And the words “Here we say” are a continuation of the statement. Or else the construction is: “If there is no experiencer, the agreement is established that there is an experiencer.” The agreement that it fructifies is the agreement that it fructifies.

original: Evaṃ santepīti asaṅkantipātubhāve, tattha ca yathāvuttadosapariharaṇe sati siddheti
analyzed: evam sante pi iti asaṅkanti pātubhāve tattha ca yathā vutta dosa pariharaṇe sati siddhā iti
translated: Even so, when there is no manifestation of doubt, and when the stated faults are avoided, it is established.

original: attho. Pavattito pubbeti kammāyūhanakkhaṇato pubbe. Pacchā cāti vipaccanapavattito🔽pacchā ca. Avipakkavipākā katattā ce paccayā, vipakkavipākānampi katattaṃ samānanti
analyzed: atthaḥ pavattitaḥ pubbe iti kamma āyūhana khaṇato pubbe pacchā ca ati vipaccana pavattito  pacchā ca avipakka vipākā kata ttā ce paccayāḥ vipakka vipākānam pi kata ttam samānanti
translated: This is the meaning. Before its occurrence is before the moment of the accumulation of kamma. And after is after the ripening and occurrence of the kamma.🔽And if the conditions are not yet ripe for the ripening of the kamma, then the kamma is still capable of giving its fruit even though the conditions are ripe for the ripening of other kamma.

original: tesampi phalāvahatā siyāti āsaṅkānivattanatthaṃ āha “na ca niccaṃ phalāvahā”ti. Na
analyzed: tesam pi phala āvaha tā siyā ti āsaṅkā nivattana attham āha na ca niccam phala āvahā ati na
translated: Therefore he says, “But it does not always give its fruit.”

original: vijjamānattā vā avijjamānattā vāti etena vijjamānattaṃ avijjamānattañca nissāya vuttadoseva pariharati.
analyzed: vijjamānattā vā a vijjamānattā vā iti etena vijjamānattam a vijjamāna ttam ca nissāya vutta dosā iva pariharati
translated: By “whether it exists or not” he avoids the stated faults by way of the existence or non-existence of the kamma.

original: Tassā pāṭibhogakiriyāya, bhaṇḍakīṇanakiriyāya, iṇagahaṇādikiriyāya vā karaṇamattaṃ
analyzed: tassā pāṭibhoga kiriyāya bhaṇḍa kīṇana kiriyāya iṇa gahaṇa ādi kiriyāya vā karaṇa mattam
translated: The mere performance of the act of repayment, of the act of paying the price, of the act of taking a loan, etc.,🔽is the mere performance of the act. That is a condition for the act of repayment, etc., in the sense of outcome,

original: taṃkiriyākaraṇamattaṃ. Tadeva tadatthaniyyātane paṭibhaṇḍadāne iṇadāne ca paccayo🔽hoti, aphalitaniyyātanādiphalanti attho.
analyzed: tad kiriyā karaṇa mattam tat eva tad attha niyyātane paṭibhaṇḍa dāne iṇa dāne ca paccayaḥ  hoti a phalita niyyātana ādi phalanti attho
translated: and for the act of giving back the price, etc., in the sense of decisive-support. The meaning is that the outcome of the act of repayment, etc., is the giving back of the price, etc.

original: Avisesenāti “tihetuko tihetukassā”tiādikaṃ bhedaṃ akatvāva sāmaññato, piṇḍavasenāti🔽attho. Sabbattha upanissayapaccayo balavakammassa vasena yojetabbo. “Dubbalañhi upanissayapaccayo
analyzed: avisesena ati ti hetuko ti hetukassa ati ādikam bhedam a katvā ava sāmaññato piṇḍa vasena ati  atthaḥ sabbattha upanissaya paccayaḥ balava kammassa vasena yojetabbaḥ dubbalam hi upanissaya paccayaḥ
translated: Without distinction: without making the distinction “a being of three roots is of three roots,” etc., in the general way, by groups, is the meaning.🔽In all cases the condition by decisive-support should be construed according to the strength of the kamma. For it is said, “A weak decisive-support condition is not a condition” .

original: na hotī”ti vakkhamānamevetaṃ paṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyanti. Avisesenāti sabbapuññābhisaṅkhāraṃ
analyzed: na hoti iti vakkhamānam eva etam paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanāyanti avisesena ati sabba puñña abhisaṅkhāram
translated: In the description of the line of presentation . Without distinction: it includes all formations of merit together.

original: saha saṅgaṇhāti. Dvādasākusalacetanābhedoti ettha uddhaccasahagatā kasmā gahitāti
analyzed: saha saṅgaṇhāti ettha uddhacca sahagatā kasmā gahitā ati
translated: The twelve kinds of unprofitable volition: here it should be considered why that accompanied by agitation is included.

original: vicāretabbametaṃ. Ekassa viññāṇassa tatheva paccayo paṭisandhiyaṃ, no pavatteti ekasseva
analyzed: vicāretabbam etam ekassa viññāṇassa tathā iva paccayaḥ paṭisandhiyam no pavatteti ekassa iva
translated: A condition for one consciousness in the same way in rebirth-linking, but not in the course of an existence.

original: paccayabhāvaniyamo paṭisandhiyaṃ, no pavatte. Pavatte hi sattannampi paccayoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: paccaya bhāva niyamo paṭisandhiyam no pavatte pavatte hi sattannam pi paccayaḥ ti adhippāyo
translated: The regularity of conditions is in rebirth-linking, not in the course of an existence. The intention is that in the course of an existence there are conditions for all seven.

original: “Tathā kāmāvacaradevalokepi aniṭṭhā rūpādayo natthī”ti vuttaṃ, devānaṃ pana pubbanimittapātubhāvakāle
analyzed: tathā kāmāvacara deva loke pi aniṭṭhāḥ rūpa ādayaḥ natthi iti vuttam devānam pana pubba nimitta pātubhāva kāle
translated: “So too in the sense-desire world of gods there are no undesirable visible data, etc.,” it is said. But when the prenascent signs of the gods appear,

original: milātamālādīnaṃ aniṭṭhatā kathaṃ na siyā.🔽Sveva dvīsu bhavesūti ettha ekūnatiṃsacetanābhedampi cittasaṅkhāraṃ cittasaṅkhārabhāvena🔽ekattaṃ upanetvā “svevā”ti vuttaṃ. Tadekadeso pana kāmāvacaracittasaṅkhārova terasannaṃ
analyzed: milāta mālā ādīnam aniṭṭha tā katham na siyā  su eva dvīsu bhavesu iti ettha ekūnatiṃsa cetanā bhedam pi citta saṅkhāram citta saṅkhāra bhāvena  ekattam upanetvā su eva ati vuttam tad eka deso pana kāmāvacara citta saṅkhāraḥ iva
translated: how can the undesirable nature of the faded wreath, etc., be denied?

original: navannañca paccayo daṭṭhabbo. Ekadesapaccayabhāvena hi samudāyo vuttoti.
analyzed: paccayo daṭṭhabbo ekadesa paccaya bhāvena hi samudāyaḥ vutto ti
translated: “In the two kinds of becoming” : here the diversity of the eighty-nine kinds of consciousness classed as “mental volition” is brought together under the unity of the class “mental volition” and called “just that” . But only the mental volition of the sense sphere should be regarded as a condition for thirteen kinds of rebirth-linking and for nine kinds of rebirth-linking. For a plurality is spoken of as a condition by way of a single factor.

original: Yattha ca vitthārappakāsanaṃ kataṃ, tato bhavato paṭṭhāya mukhamattappakāsanaṃ kātukāmo
analyzed: yattha ca vitthāra pakāsanam katam tatas bhavataḥ paṭṭhāya mukha matta ppakāsanam kātu kāmo
translated: And where the exposition is given in detail, he who wishes to give the barest outline beginning with the words “From the first”

original: āha “ādito paṭṭhāyā”ti. Tena “dvīsu bhavesū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tatiyajjhānabhūmivasenāti
analyzed: āha āditaḥ paṭṭhāya iti tena dvīsu bhavesu utiādi vuttam tatiya jhāna bhūmi vasena ati
translated: says “in the two kinds of becoming” , etc. “By the plane of the third jhāna” means by the plane of the third jhāna of the fine-material sphere.

original: etena ekattakāyaekattasaññīsāmaññena catutthajjhānabhūmi ca asaññāruppavajjā gahitāti
analyzed: etena ekatta kāya ekatta saññī sāmaññena catuttha jjhāna bhūmi ca asaññā aruppa vajjā gahitā ati
translated: By this similarity of single-aggregate-and-single-perception, the plane of the fourth jhāna and the immaterial states except the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception are included.

original: veditabbā. Yathāsambhavanti ekavīsatiyā kāmāvacararūpāvacarakusalavipākesu cuddasannaṃ
analyzed: veditabbāḥ yathā sambhavanti ekavīsatiyā kāmāvacara rūpāvacara kusala vipākesu
translated: “According as appropriate”: in the twenty-one kinds of sense-sphere and fine-material-sphere profitable and resultant consciousness,

original: paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte ca, sattannaṃ pavatte eva. Ayaṃ yathāsambhavo.🔽Catunnaṃ viññāṇānanti bhavādayo apekkhitvā vuttaṃ, catūsu antogadhānaṃ pana tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: pavatte ca pavatte eva ayam yathā sambhavaḥ  catunnam viññāṇānam ti bhava ādayaḥ apekkhitvā vuttam catūsu antogadhānam pana tiṇṇam
translated: in fourteen kinds of rebirth-linking and in seven kinds of life-continuum. This is the “according as appropriate.”

original: viññāṇānaṃ tīsu viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu ca paccayabhāvo yojetabbo, aviññāṇake sattāvāse saṅkhārapaccayā
analyzed: viññāṇānam tīsu viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu ca paccaya bhāvaḥ yojetabbaḥ aviññāṇake sattā vāse saṅkhāra paccayā
translated: “Of the four kinds of consciousness”: this is said with reference to the kinds of becoming, etc., but the condition qua condition should be construed in the three kinds of consciousness included in the four and in the three stations of consciousness.

original: viññāṇe avijjamānepi tassa saṅkhārahetukattaṃ dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādimāha. Etasmiñca🔽mukhamattappakāsane puññābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ duggatiādīsu pavattiyaṃ kusalavipākādiviññāṇānaṃ
analyzed: viññāṇe avijjamāne pi tassa saṅkhāra hetuka ttam dassetum api ca ati ādim āha etasmin ca  mukha matta pakāsane puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam duggati ādīsu pavattiyam kusala vipāka ādi viññāṇānam
translated: In the case of the non-percipient realm of existence, although consciousness does not exist as a condition for material form, the words “Moreover, etc.” are stated to show that it is a condition for material form by way of kamma condition.

original: paccayabhāvo bhavesu vuttanayeneva viññāyatīti na vuttoti veditabbo.
analyzed: paccaya bhāvaḥ bhavesu vutta nayena iva viññāyati iti na vuttaḥ ti veditabbaḥ
translated: And in this exposition of the face of a looking glass, the condition qua condition for the profitable resultant consciousness, etc., in the occurrence of the formations of merit, etc., in the unhappy destinies, etc., should be understood to be stated in the way already stated in the case of the kinds of becoming.

original: Viññāṇapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: viññāṇa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section of the exposition of the word consciousness is ended.

original: Nāmarūpapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nāma rūpa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the name-and-form clause

original: 228. Suttantābhidhammesu nāmarūpadesanāviseso desanābhedo. Tayo khandhāti etaṃ yadipi pāḷiyaṃ natthi, atthato pana vuttameva hotīti katvā vuttanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Aṇḍajānañca abhāvakānanti yojetabbaṃ. Santatisīsānīti kalāpasantānamūlāni. Yadipi
analyzed: suttanta abhidhammesu nāma rūpa desanā visesaḥ desanā bhedaḥ tayo khandhā ti etam yadi pi pāḷiyam natthi atthataḥ pana vuttam eva hoti iti katvā vuttam ti veditabbam  aṇḍa jānan ca abhāva kānan ti yojetabbam santati sīsāni iti kalāpa santāna mūlāni yadi api
translated: The difference in the teaching of name-and-form in the Suttas and the Abhidhamma is a difference in the teaching. Although the words “three aggregates” are not in the text, still it can be understood that they are stated by taking it as said in the meaning.

original: vikārarūpāni paṭisandhikkhaṇe na santi, lakkhaṇaparicchedarūpāni pana santīti tāni
analyzed: vikāra rūpāni paṭisandhi kkhaṇe na santi lakkhaṇa pariccheda rūpāni pana santi iti tāni
translated: “And egg-born and womb-born” should be construed. “Roots of continuity” : roots of the continuity of the aggregates. Although the modified forms are not present at the moment of rebirth-linking, still the forms that are delimitations of the physical heart- basis are present.

original: aparinipphannāni paramatthato vivajjento āha “rūparūpato”ti.
analyzed: a parinipphannāni paramatthataḥ vivajjentaḥ āha rūpa rūpato ti
translated: Therefore, excluding those which are not yet fully arisen in the ultimate sense, he said “materiality as matter.”

original: Kāmabhave pana yasmā sesaopapātikānanti ettha kiñcāpi kāmabhave “opapātikā”ti vuttā🔽na santi, yena sesaggahaṇaṃ sātthakaṃ bhaveyya, aṇḍajagabbhaseyyakehi pana opapātikasaṃsedajā
analyzed: kāma bhave pana yasmā sesa opapātikānam ti ettha kiñcā api kāma bhave opapātikā ati vuttā  na santi yena sesa ggahaṇam sātthakam bhaveyya aṇḍa ja gabbhaseyyakehi pana opapātika saṃseda jā
translated: But in the sense sphere, although “those that are spontaneously born” are not mentioned in the text,🔽still it should be understood that they are included by the words “the rest.” For the rest are either egg-born or womb-born or spontaneously born.

original: sesā hontīti sesaggahaṇaṃ katanti veditabbaṃ. Atha vā brahmakāyikādikehi opapātikehi
analyzed: sesāḥ honti iti sesa ggahaṇam katam ti veditabbam atha vā brahmakāyika ādikehi opapātikehi
translated: Or else, the rest are those that are spontaneously born among the Brahmā-world deities, etc.

original: vuttehi sese sandhāya “sesaopapātikāna”nti āha. Te pana arūpinopi santīti “kāmabhave”ti🔽vuttaṃ, aparipuṇṇāyatanānaṃ pana nāmarūpaṃ yathāsambhavaṃ rūpamissakaviññāṇaniddese
analyzed: vuttehi sese sandhāya sesa opapātikānam ti āha te pana arūpinaḥ api santi iti kāma bhava iti  vuttam aparipuṇṇa āyatanānam pana nāma rūpam yathāsambhavam rūpa missaka viññāṇa niddese
translated: and the rest of the kinds of rebirth mentioned are referred to by the words “the rest of the kinds of rebirth in the five-constituent kind.” But since these are also immaterial, the words “in the sensual-sphere element” are stated.🔽But since the mentality-materiality of those who are not complete as to the sense bases is mixed with materiality, it is included in the description of consciousness accompanied by materiality, as appropriate.

original: vuttanayena sakkā dhammagaṇanāto viññātunti na vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vutta nayena sakkā dhamma gaṇanātaḥ viññātunti na vuttan ti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: He says ‘the rest of the kinds of rebirth’ referring to those not mentioned. But since they are immaterial too, he says ‘in the sense sphere’. But the materiality of those whose bases are incomplete should be understood as able to be known by counting the kinds of materiality in the way already described under consciousness accompanied by materiality, which is given in the Description of Materiality .

original: Avakaṃsato dve aṭṭhakāneva utucittasamuṭṭhānāni hontīti sasaddakālaṃ sandhāya “ukkaṃsato🔽dvinnaṃ navakāna”nti vuttaṃ. Pubbeti khandhavibhaṅgeti vadanti. Tattha hi “ekekacittakkhaṇe
analyzed: avakaṃsataḥ dve utu citta samuṭṭhānāni honti iti sa sadda kālam sandhāya ukkaṃsataḥ  dvinnam navakānam ti vuttam pubba iti khandha vibhaṅga iti vadanti tattha hi ekeka citta kkhaṇe
translated: As regards the ‘at most’ , only two octads are temperature-originated and consciousness-originated, so ‘at most two nonets’ is said referring to the time when there is sound.🔽The ‘previously stated’ is said by some to be in the Description of the Aggregates, where it is said, ‘Arising three times in each conscious moment’ .

original: tikkhattuṃ uppajjamāna”nti vuttaṃ. Idheva vā vuttaṃ santatidvayādikaṃ sattakapariyosānaṃ🔽sandhāyāha “pubbe vuttaṃ kammasamuṭṭhānaṃ sattatividha”nti, taṃ panuppajjamānaṃ ekekacittakkhaṇe
analyzed: tikkhattum uppajjamānanti vuttam idha iva vā vuttam santati dvaya ādikam sattaka pariyosānam  sandhāya āha pubbe vuttam kamma samuṭṭhānam sattatividhan ti tam pana uppajjamānam ekeka citta kkhaṇe
translated: Or it is said by others that it is said here in the Description of the Materiality Aggregate, referring to the ‘two continuants, etc.,’ which end with the ‘seven septuple origins’ .

original: tikkhattuṃ uppajjatīti iminādhippāyena vuttaṃ “ekekacittakkhaṇe tikkhattuṃ uppajjamāna”nti.
analyzed: tikkhattum uppajjati iti iminā adhippāyena vuttam ekeka citta khaṇe tikkhattum uppajjamānan ti
translated: That, as it arises, arises three times in each conscious moment, is what is meant by ‘arising three times in each conscious moment’.

original: Catuddisā vavatthāpitāti aññamaññasaṃsaṭṭhasīsā mūlena catūsu disāsu vavatthāpitā
analyzed: catuddisā vavatthāpitā ati aññamañña saṃsaṭṭha sīsā mūlena catūsu disāsu vavatthāpitā
translated: “Defined in the four directions” means that they are defined in the four directions by their roots, which are interlocked like the heads of the nāgas that guard the cardinal points.

original: aññamaññaṃ āliṅgetvā ṭhitā bhinnavāhanikā viya.
analyzed: aññam aññam āliṅgetvā ṭhitā bhinna vāhanikā viya
translated: They stand embracing each other.

original: Pañcavokārabhave ca pavattiyanti rūpājanakakammajaṃ pañcaviññāṇappavattikālaṃ sahajātaviññāṇapaccayañca🔽sandhāyāha. Tadā hi tato nāmameva hotīti, kammaviññāṇapaccayā pana sadāpi ubhayaṃ
analyzed: pañca vokāra bhave ca pavattiyanti rūpa ajanaka kamma jam pañca viññāṇa ppavatti kālam sahajāta viññāṇa paccayam ca  sandhāya āha tadā hi tatas nāmam eva hoti iti kamma viññāṇa paccayā pana sadā api ubhayam
translated: “In the five-constituent becoming” means in the time of the occurrence of the five kinds of consciousness produced by kamma, and in the time of the consciousness that is a condition for the kamma-born materiality.🔽For then there is only mentality. But it can be said that in all times there is both mentality and materiality, which are respectively the result of kamma-produced consciousness and of kamma. And materiality that is a condition for the subsequent consciousness is present.

original: hotīti sakkā vattuṃ, pacchājātaviññāṇapaccayā ca rūpaṃ upatthaddhaṃ hotīti. Asaññesūtiādi🔽kammaviññāṇapaccayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, pañcavokārabhave ca pavattiyanti bhavaṅgādijanakakammato
analyzed: hoti iti sakkā vattum pacchājāta viññāṇa paccayā ca rūpam upatthaddham hoti iti asaññesu utiādi  kamma viññāṇa paccayam sandhāya vuttam pañcavokāra bhave ca pavattiyanti bhavaṅga ādi janaka kammato
translated: “In the immaterial becoming” is said with reference to the consciousness that is a condition for kamma.

original: aññena rūpuppattikālaṃ nirodhasamāpattikālaṃ bhavaṅgādiuppattikālato aññakālañca
analyzed: aññena rūpa uppatti kālam nirodha samāpatti kālam bhavaṅga ādi uppatti kālataḥ añña kālañca
translated: “In the five-constituent becoming” is said with reference to the time of the occurrence of materiality produced by kamma other than that which produces the life-continuum, and with reference to the time of the attainment of cessation, and with reference to the time other than that of the arising of the life-continuum, etc.

original: sandhāya vuttanti yuttaṃ. Bhavaṅgādiuppattikāle hi taṃjanakeneva kammunā uppajjamānaṃ
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam iti yuttam bhavaṅga ādi uppatti kāle hi tad janakena iva kammunā uppajjamānam
translated: For at the time of the arising of the life-continuum, etc., the materiality that arises through the kamma that produces it is not a condition for the kamma-born consciousness.

original: rūpaṃ, so ca vipāko kammaviññāṇapaccayo hotīti sakkā vattuṃ. Sahajātaviññāṇapaccayānapekkhampi
analyzed: rūpam so ca vipāko kamma viññāṇa paccayo hoti iti sakkā vattum sahajāta viññāṇa paccaya an apekkham pi
translated: and that resultant materiality is a condition for the kamma-consciousness.🔽For the materiality and mentality occurring in the course of an existence, though they do not need a condition consisting of consciousness that is conascent with them,

original: hi pavattiyaṃ kammena pavattamānaṃ rūpaṃ nāmañca na kammaviññāṇānapekkhaṃ hotīti.🔽Sabbatthāti paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte ca. Sahajātaviññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, kammaviññāṇapaccayā
analyzed: hi pavattiyam kammena pavattamānam rūpam nāmañca na kamma viññāṇa anapekkham hoti iti  sabbattha ati paṭisandhiyam pavatte ca sahajāta viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpam kamma viññāṇa paccayā
translated: nevertheless do need a condition consisting of kamma-consciousness.🔽In all instances: in rebirth-linking and in the course of an existence. The mentality-materiality that is a condition for the consciousness that is conascent with it,🔽and the mentality-materiality that is a condition for kamma-consciousness, should be construed as appropriate.

original: ca nāmarūpañca yathāsambhavaṃ yojetabbaṃ. Nāmañca rūpañca nāmarūpañca nāmarūpanti
analyzed: ca nāma rūpam ca yathāsambhavam yojetabbam nāman ca rūpam ca nāma rūpam ca nāma rūpanti
translated: Mentality and materiality, mentality-materiality, mentality-materiality:

original: ettha nāmarūpa-saddo attano ekadesena nāma-saddena nāma-saddassa sarūpo, rūpa-saddena🔽ca rūpa-saddassa, tasmā “sarūpānaṃ ekaseso”ti nāmarūpa-saddassa ṭhānaṃ itaresañca
analyzed: ettha nāma rūpa saddaḥ attanaḥ ekadesena nāma saddena nāma saddassa sarūpaḥ rūpa saddena  ca rūpa saddassa tasmā nāma rūpa saddassa ṭhānam itaresam ca
translated: here the word mentality-materiality is similar in meaning to the word mentality by one part of its meaning, and it is similar in meaning to the word materiality by the other part of its meaning.

original: nāmarūpa-saddānaṃ adassanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: nāma rūpa saddānam adassanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: Therefore the place of the word mentality-materiality should be seen as occupied by the words mentality and materiality, and the words mentality-materiality should be seen as not occurring in the other instances.🔽Other than resultant, not resultant:🔽From the twofold state,

original: Vipākato aññaṃ avipākaṃ. Yato dvidhā mataṃ, tato yuttameva idanti yojetabbaṃ. Kusalādicittakkhaṇeti
analyzed: vipākataḥ aññam avipākam yatas dvidhā matam tatas yuttam eva idan ti yojetabbam kusala ādi citta kkhaṇa iti
translated: it is proper to construe this thus.

original: ādi-saddena akusalakiriyacittakkhaṇe viya vipākacittakkhaṇepi vipākājanakakammasamuṭṭhānaṃ🔽saṅgahitanti veditabbaṃ. Vipākacittakkhaṇe pana abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇapaccayā pubbe
analyzed: ādi saddena akusala kiriya citta kkhaṇe viya vipāka citta kkhaṇe pi vipāka ajanaka kamma samuṭṭhānam  saṅgahitanti veditabbam vipāka citta kkhaṇe pana abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇa paccayā pubbe
translated: And by the word “etc.” it should be understood that in the case of resultant consciousness, too, the kamma-originated materiality that generates the result is included, as in the case of unprofitable kamma-resultant consciousness.🔽But in the case of resultant consciousness, both are found, as in the case of the consciousnesses of the five doors, since there is rebirth-linking consciousness with past kamma as condition and there is the consciousness of the five doors with the bhavanga as condition.

original: vuttanayena ubhayañca upalabbhatīti tādisavipākacittakkhaṇavajjanatthaṃ “kusalādicittakkhaṇe”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vutta nayena ubhayam ca upalabbhati iti tādisa vipāka citta kkhaṇa vat jana attham kusala ādi citta kkhaṇā iti vuttam
translated: So in order to avoid the misinterpretation of such resultant consciousness, the words “in the case of profitable, etc., consciousness” are stated.

original: Suttantikapariyāyenāti paṭṭhāne rūpānaṃ upanissayapaccayassa avuttattā vuttaṃ, suttante
analyzed: suttantika pariyāyena ati paṭṭhāne rūpānam upanissaya paccayassa a vutta ttā vuttam suttante
translated: By the method of the Suttas: because the condition by way of decisive support is not mentioned in the Paṭṭhāna, it is said. But in the Suttas,

original: pana “yasmiṃ sati yaṃ hoti, asati ca na hoti, so tassa upanissayo nidānaṃ hetu pabhavo”ti
analyzed: pana yasmin sati yam hoti asati ca na hoti so tassa upanissayaḥ nidānam hetu pabhavaḥ ti
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises,”🔽it is said that materiality has consciousness as its decisive support.

original: katvā “viññāṇūpanisaṃ nāmarūpa”nti rūpassa ca viññāṇūpanissayatā vuttā. Vanapatthapariyāye
analyzed: katvā viññāṇa upanisam nāma rūpan ti rūpassa ca viññāṇa upanissaya tā vuttā vanapatthapariyāye
translated: And in the Vanapattha Sutta,

original: ca vanasaṇḍagāmanigamanagarajanapadapuggalūpanissayo iriyāpathavihāro, tato ca cīvarādīnaṃ
analyzed: ca vana saṇḍa gāma nigama nagara janapada puggala upanissayo iriyāpatha vihāro tatas ca cīvara ādīnam
translated: “The posture, the abiding, have as their decisive support the forest, the grove, the village, the town, the city, the country, the person,” and from that the robe, etc.,

original: jīvitaparikkhārānaṃ kasirena ca appakasirena ca samudāgamanaṃ vuttaṃ, na ca vanasaṇḍādayo🔽ārammaṇūpanissayādibhāvaṃ iriyāpathānaṃ cīvarādisamudāgamanassa ca bhajanti, tasmā
analyzed: jīvita parikkhārānam kasirena ca appa kasirena ca samudāgamanam vuttam na ca vana saṇḍa ādayo  ārammaṇa upanissaya ādi bhāvam iriyāpathānam cīvara ādi samudāgamanassa ca bhajanti tasmā
translated: and the difficulty or ease of obtaining the requisites of life is mentioned, but the forest groves, etc.,🔽do not do so. And the postures do not do so for the obtaining of the robe, etc., nor do the latter for the postures. So their state of being decisive-support conditions should be understood as non-existence of them without the other.

original: vinā abhāvo eva ca suttantapariyāyato upanissayabhāvo daṭṭhabbo. Nāmassa abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ
analyzed: vinā abhāvaḥ eva ca suttanta pariyāyataḥ upanissaya bhāvo daṭṭhabbo nāmassa abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇam
translated: The kamma-resultant consciousness that is rebirth-linking, etc.,🔽is a condition, as object condition, for the materiality that is kamma-resultant.

original: kammārammaṇapaṭisandhiādikāle ārammaṇapaccayova hotīti vattabbameva natthīti rūpasseva
analyzed: kamma ārammaṇa paṭisandhi ādi kāle ārammaṇa paccayaḥ uva hoti iti vattabbam eva natthi iti rūpassa iva
translated: So it is not necessary to say that it is a condition for the materiality that is kamma-resultant.

original: suttantikapariyāyato ekadhā paccayabhāvo vutto. Sasaṃsayassa hi rūpassa taṃpaccayo
analyzed: sutta ntika pariyāyataḥ ekadhā paccaya bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ sa saṃsayassa hi rūpassa taṃ paccayo
translated: The state of being a condition in one way for materiality is mentioned in the texts only in the case of the materiality that is doubtful.

original: hotīti vutte nāmassa hotīti vattabbameva natthīti.
analyzed: hoti iti vutte nāmassa hoti iti vattabbam eva natthi iti
translated: For if it were said that it is a condition for that, it would be necessary to say that it is a condition for mentality also.

original: Pavattassa pākaṭattā apākaṭaṃ paṭisandhiṃ gahetvā pucchati “kathaṃ paneta”ntiādinā.🔽Suttato nāmaṃ, yuttito rūpaṃ viññāṇapaccayā hotīti jānitabbaṃ. Yuttito sādhetvā suttena
analyzed: pavattassa pākaṭa ttā apākaṭam paṭisandhim gahetvā pucchati katham pana itara nti ādinā 🔽suttataḥ nāmam yuttitaḥ rūpam viññāṇa paccayā hoti iti jānitabbam yuttitaḥ sādhetvā suttena
translated: He asks the question “But how is it?” , taking rebirth-linking, which is not obvious, as the example.

original: taṃ daḷhaṃ karonto “kammasamuṭṭhānassapi hī”tiādimāha. Cittasamuṭṭhānassevāti cittasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: tam daḷham karontaḥ kamma samuṭṭhānassa api hi itiādim āha citta samuṭṭhānassa iva iti citta samuṭṭhānassa
translated: as if of what is originated by consciousness.

original: viya. Yasmā nāmarūpameva pavattamānaṃ dissati, tasmā tadeva vadantena anuttaraṃ dhammacakkaṃ
analyzed: viya yasmā nāma rūpam eva pavattamānam dissati tasmā tat eva vadantena anuttaram dhammacakkam
translated: Since only mentality-materiality is seen to occur, therefore by one who says that he set rolling the unsurpassed Wheel of the Dhamma.

original: pavattitaṃ. Suññatāpakāsanañhi dhammacakkappavattananti adhippāyo. Nāmarūpamattatāvacaneneva
analyzed: pavattitam suñña tā pakāsanam hi dhamma cakka ppavattanan ti adhippāyaḥ nāma rūpa matta tā vacanena iva
translated: For the purpose of the teaching of voidness is the setting rolling of the Wheel of the Dhamma.

original: vā pavattiyā dukkhasaccamattatā vuttā, dukkhasaccappakāsanena ca tassa samudayo,
analyzed: vā pavattiyā dukkha sacca matta tā vuttā dukkha sacca ppakāsanena ca tassa samudayaḥ
translated: Or by the mere statement that there is only mentality-materiality the truth of suffering is stated as being only that much, and by the teaching of the truth of suffering its origin,🔽and its cessation, and the way leading to its cessation, are also taught.

original: tassa ca nirodho, nirodhagāmī ca maggo pakāsito eva hoti. Ahetukassa dukkhassa hetunirodhā,🔽anirujjhanakassa ca abhāvā, nirodhassa ca upāyena vinā anadhigantabbattāti catusaccappakāsanaṃ
analyzed: tassa ca nirodhaḥ nirodha gāmī ca maggo pakāsitaḥ eva hoti ahetukassa dukkhassa hetu nirodhā  anirujjhanakassa ca abhāvāḥ nirodhassa ca upāyena vinā an adhigantabba ttā ati catu sacca ppakāsanam
translated: For when the cause of suffering that has no cause ceases,

original: dhammacakkappavattanaṃ yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma cakka ppavattanam yojetabbam
translated: and since there is no non-cessation, cessation is not to be reached without a means. So the teaching of the four truths should be construed as the setting rolling of the Wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Nāmarūpapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nāma rūpa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the description of the word mentality-materiality is ended.

original: Saḷāyatanapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the word the sixfold base

original: 229. Niyamatoti ca idaṃ catunnaṃ bhūtānaṃ, channaṃ vatthūnaṃ, jīvitassa ca yathāsambhavaṃ
analyzed: niyamataḥ ti ca idam catunnam bhūtānam channam vatthūnam jīvitassa ca yathāsambhavam
translated: “Certainly” means in the case of the four great primaries, the six bases, and life, according to the circumstances.
