analyzed: evam vakka pañcaka ādīsu anuloma sajjhāyam vatvā paṭiloma sajjhāyaḥ  purimehi sambandhaḥ vuttaḥ svāyam ye paratas visum ti pañca aham purimehi ekatas ti pañca aham ti  cha pañcāham sajjhāyā vakkhamānā tesu ādi anta dassana vasena vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbaḥ anuloma paṭiloma sajjhāye pi  hi paṭiloma sajjhāyaḥ antimaḥ ti sajjhāya ppakāra antaram vā etam pi iti veditabbam hatthasaṅkhalikā  lakkhaṇa paṭivedhassa ati asubha lakkhaṇa paṭivedhassa dhātu lakkhaṇa paṭivedhassa vā
translated: “Flesh … kidney … hair” . After training in the forward order in the five pentad series beginning with the kidney, he should train in the reverse order,🔽and the connection with the previous pentad series should be made. This training in the five pentad series, which is given here as five times five days, is to be done in two ways: either separately as stated, or all together.🔽It should be regarded as stated in this way in order to show the beginning and end. For in the case of training in the forward and reverse order too,🔽the reverse order is the last. This should be understood as a further alternative to the training course.🔽“A chain of hands” is a series of hands.🔽“Fingers” is a series of fingers.🔽“For the purpose of discerning the characteristics” means for the purpose of discerning the characteristics of foulness or for the purpose of discerning the characteristics of the elements.

original: Attano bhāgo sabhāgo, sabhāgena paricchedo sabhāgaparicchedo, heṭṭhuparitiriyantehi sakakoṭṭhāsikakesantarādīhi ca paricchedoti attho.
analyzed: attanaḥ bhāgo sa bhāgaḥ sabhāgena paricchedo sa bhāga paricchedo heṭṭhu paritiriyantehi saka koṭṭhāsika kesantara ādīhi ca paricchedo ti attho
translated: “Flesh,” “kidneys,” “bones,” “marrow,” “skin,” “sinews,” “veins,” “muscles,” “entrails,” “lungs,” “heart,” “liver,” “midriff,” “bowels,” “mesentery,” “contents of the stomach,” “spleen,” “urine,” “faeces,” “brain,” “tongue,” “flesh,” “blood,” “mucus,” “bile,” “phlegm,” “pus,” “lymph,” “oil of the joints,” “tears,” “saliva,” “oil of the body,” “mast,” “semen,” “ear-kennels,” “nasal mucus,” “spittle,” “snot,” “sweat,” “oils of the head-hairs and body-hairs,” “head-hairs,” “body-hairs,” “teeth,” “nails,” “skin,” “flesh,” “puss,” “blood,” “sweat,” “fat,” “tears,” “grease,” “spittle,” “mucus,” “synovial fluid,” “oil of the body,” “mast,” “semen,” “brain,” “kidneys,” “heart,” “liver,” “dorsal vertebrae,” “lungs,” “bowels,” “abdomen,” “mesentery,” “contents of the stomach,” “bile,” “faeces,” “trachea,” “tears,” “grease,” “spittle,” “mucus,” “synovial fluid,” “oil of the body,” “mast,” “semen,” “brain,” “kidneys,” “heart,” “liver,” “dorsal vertebrae,” “lungs,” “bowels,” “abdomen,” “mesentery,” “contents of the stomach,” “bile,” “faeces,” “trachea,” “head-hairs,” “body-hairs,” “teeth,” “nails,” “skin,” “flesh,” “puss,” “blood,” “sweat,” “fat,” “tears,” “grease,” “spittle,” “mucus,” “synovial fluid,” “oil of the body,” “mast,” “semen,” “brain,” “kidneys,” “heart,” “liver,” “dorsal vertebrae,” “lungs,” “bowels,” “abdomen,” “mesentery,” “contents of the stomach,” “bile,” “faeces,” “trachea,” “head-hairs,” “body-hairs,” “teeth,” “nails,” “skin,” “flesh,” “puss,” “blood,” “

original: Dhātuvibhaṅgo pukkusātisuttaṃ. Sādhāraṇavasenāti ettakeneva siddhe sabba-ggahaṇaṃ vaṇṇakasiṇavasena catukkajjhānikasamathasādhāraṇattassa ca dassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: dhātu vibhaṅgaḥ pukkusāti suttam sādhāraṇa vasena ati ettakena iva siddhe sabba ggahaṇam vaṇṇa kasiṇa vasena ca dassana ttham
translated: As to the shared meaning: the inclusion of all is stated for the purpose of showing that the jhāna of the kasiṇas of colour is shared in common with the ordinary man.🔽As to the outlet: the meaning is that it is the path to be practised and to be developed.

original: Okkamanavissajjananti paṭipajjitabbavajjetabbe maggeti attho. Bahiddhā puthuttārammaṇeti
analyzed: okkamana vissajjanan ti paṭipajjitabba vajjetabbe magge ti atthaḥ bahiddhā puthuttā ārammaṇā iti
translated: As to the object that is external and individual:

original: ettha kāyānupassanaṃ hitvā subhādivasena gayhamānā kesādayopi bahiddhā puthuttārammaṇānevāti🔽veditabbā. Ukkuṭṭhukkaṭṭhiṭṭhāneyeva uṭṭhahitvāti pubbe viya ekattha katāya ukkuṭṭhiyā🔽kamena sabbatālesu patitvā uṭṭhahitvā pariyantatālaṃ āditālañca agantvā tato tato
analyzed: ettha kāya anupassanam hitvā subha ādi vasena gayhamānā kesa ādayaḥ api bahiddhā puthutta ārammaṇān eva āti  veditabbā ukkuṭṭha ukkaṭṭhi ṭhāneyā iva uṭṭhahitvā ti pubbe viya ekattha katāya ukkuṭṭhiyā  kamena sabba tālesu patitvā uṭṭhahitvā pariyanta tālam ādi tālam ca a gantvā tato tato
translated: herein, the head hairs and so on, which are apprehended by means of the sign of the beautiful, etc., should be understood as the object that is external and individual, leaving aside the contemplation of the body.🔽Having risen in the place where he has stood up cross-legged: having risen in the place where he has made the cross-legged posture, in other words, having risen from the place where he has made the cross-legged posture, as before.

original: tattha tattheva katāya ukkuṭṭhiyā uṭṭhahitvāti attho.
analyzed: tattha tattha iva katāya ukkuṭṭhiyā uṭṭhahitvā ati attho
translated: Having risen in the place where he has made the cross-legged posture, without going to the end of the range and back again, but having risen there and there.

original: Adhicittanti samathavipassanācittaṃ. Anuyuttenāti yuttapayuttena, bhāventenāti attho.
analyzed: adhicittam ti samatha vipassanā cittam anuyuttena ati yutta payuttena bhāventena ati attho
translated: As to the higher mind: the mind of serenity and insight. As to the attendant: as to the attendant that is associated with it; the meaning is, as to the development.

original: Samādhinimittaṃ upalakkhaṇākāro samādhiyeva. Manasi kātabbanti citte kātabbaṃ, uppādetabbanti
analyzed: samādhi nimittam upalakkhaṇa ākāraḥ samādhiyā iva manasi kātabbanti citte kātabbam uppādetabbanti
translated: The sign of concentration is the aspect of the sign that is concentration itself. He should bring it to mind: he should bring it to mind, he should bring it to presence.

original: attho. Samādhikāraṇaṃ vā ārammaṇaṃ samādhinimittaṃ āvajjitabbanti attho. Ṭhānaṃ atthīti🔽vacanaseso, taṃ cittaṃ kosajjāya saṃvatteyya, etassa saṃvattanassa kāraṇaṃ atthīti
analyzed: atthaḥ samādhi kāraṇam vā ārammaṇam samādhi nimittam āvajjitabbanti atthaḥ ṭhānam atthi iti  vacana sesaḥ tam cittam kosajjāya saṃvatteyyaḥ etassa saṃvattanassa kāraṇam atthi iti
translated: The sign of concentration is the mode of appearance of the object in concentration itself. He should bring to mind: he should bring about in his mind, the meaning is. Or the meaning is that he should advert to the sign of concentration, which is the object that is the cause of concentration. There is a possibility:🔽the word “possibility” is a remainder from the passage in the Paṭisambhidā, which reads: “There is a possibility that this bhikkhu’s cognizance might become slack, there is a possibility that his cognizance might become excited” . The meaning is: there is a cause for this bhikkhu’s cognizance to become slack or excited.

original: attho. Taṃ vā manasikaraṇaṃ cittaṃ kosajjāya saṃvatteyyāti etassa ṭhānaṃ kāraṇanti🔽attho. Na ca pabhaṅgūti kammaniyabhāvūpagamanena ca pabhijjanasabhāvanti attho.
analyzed: attho tam vā manasikaraṇam cittam kosajjāya saṃvatteyya ati etassa ṭhānam kāraṇan ti  attho na ca pabhaṅgū ti kamma niya bhāva upagamanena ca pabhijjana sabhāvanti attho
translated: Or the meaning of the word “possibility” is: there is a cause for this bringing to mind to lead to slackness or to excitement.🔽It will not break up: the meaning is that it will not break up with the occurrence of change-of-lineage.

original: Ālimpetīti ādīpeti jāleti. Tañcāti taṃ piḷandhanavikatisaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ payojanaṃ.
analyzed: ālimpeti iti ādīpeti jāleti tam ca ati tam piḷandhana vikati saṅkhātam attham payojanam
translated: It will be worked: it will be heated, it will be made to glow. And that: that purpose consisting in the melting and the spreading out.

original: Assāti suvaṇṇakārassa anubhoti sambhoti sādheti. Assa vā suvaṇṇassa taṃ atthaṃ suvaṇṇakāro anubhoti pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: assa ati suvaṇṇa kārassa anubhoti sambhoti sādheti assa vā suvaṇṇassa tam attham suvaṇṇa kāraḥ anubhoti pāpuṇāti
translated: It will be: the goldsmith will experience, will enjoy, will accomplish. Or the goldsmith will experience, will reach, that purpose of the gold.

original: Abhiññāya iddhividhādiñāṇena sacchikaraṇīyassa iddhividhapaccanubhavanādikassa abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa.🔽Paccakkhaṃ yassa atthi, so sakkhi, sakkhino bhabbatā sakkhibhabbatā, sakkhibhavanatāti
analyzed: abhiññāya iddhividha ādi ñāṇena sacchikaraṇīyassa iddhividha paccanubhavana ādikassa abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyassa  paccakkham yassa atthi so sakkhi sakkhinaḥ bhabba tā sakkhi bhabba tā sakkhi bhavana tā ti
translated: The kind of direct-knowledge that is to be realized by direct-knowledge is the realization of the kinds of supernormal power, etc., that are to be realized by direct-knowledge.🔽One who has the direct-knowledge is a “witness” . The state of being a witness is “witness-state” .

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Sakkhi ca so bhabbo cāti vā sakkhibhabbo. Ayañhi iddhividhādīnaṃ bhabbo,
analyzed: vuttam hoti sakkhi ca saḥ bhabbaḥ ca ati vā sakkhibhabbaḥ ayañhi iddhividha ādīnam bhabbaḥ
translated: He is a witness and he is able, thus he is a “witness-state-possessor” . For he is able to do the kinds of supernormal power, etc.,

original: tattha ca sakkhīti sakkhibhabbo, tassa bhāvo sakkhibhabbatā, taṃ pāpuṇāti. Āyataneti
analyzed: tattha ca sakkhi iti sakkhibhabbaḥ tassa bhāvaḥ sakkhibhabba tā tam pāpuṇāti āyatane iti
translated: and he is a witness to them too. The state of that is “witness-state-possessor-ness” . He reaches that.🔽In the sense-sphere, etc., is the meaning.

original: pubbahetādike kāraṇe sati.
analyzed: pubba hetā ādike kāraṇe sati
translated: When there is a reason such as a former cause,

original: Sītibhāvanti nibbānaṃ, kilesadarathavūpasamaṃ vā. Sampahaṃsetīti samapavattaṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: sīti bhāvanti nibbānam kilesa daratha vūpasamam vā sampahaṃseti iti sama pavattam cittam
translated: Nibbāna is “the state of peace” or the subsiding of the fever of defilement. “He exalts” : he delights, he exalts, the mind that has occurred thus,

original: tathāpavattiyā paññāya toseti uttejeti. Yadā vā nirassādaṃ cittaṃ bhāvanāya na pakkhandati,
analyzed: tathā pavattiyā paññāya toseti uttejeti yadā vā nirassādam cittam bhāvanāya na pakkhandati
translated: by means of the understanding that occurs thus. Or when the mind is not confident in the development because it is not satisfied,

original: tadā jātiādīni saṃvegavatthūni paccavekkhitvā sampahaṃseti samuttejeti.
analyzed: tadā jāti ādīni saṃvega vatthūni paccavekkhitvā sampahaṃseti samuttejeti
translated: then he exhorts it, he exalts it, by reviewing the grounds for a sense of urgency such as the fact of birth, and so on.

original: Tiriyaṃ aññamaññena paricchinnā, kathaṃ? Dve kesā ekato natthīti. Āsayoti nissayo, paccayoti attho.
analyzed: tiriyam aññamaññena paricchinnā katham dve kesā ekatas natthi iti āsayo ti nissayo paccayo ti attho
translated: They are divided from each other by the space between them. How? There are no two hairs together.🔽‘Place’ means ‘support,’ ‘basis’ is the meaning.

original: Nakhā tiriyaṃ aññamaññena paricchinnāti visuṃ vavatthitataṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tameva hi atthaṃ dassetuṃ “dve nakhā ekato natthī”ti āhāti.
analyzed: nakhā tiriyam aññamaññena paricchinnā ati visum sandhāya vuttam tam eva hi attham dassetum dve nakhā ekatas natthi iti āha ati
translated: ‘Nails’ are divided from each other by the space between them. This is said with reference to their being separately situated. And in order to show that same meaning he said, ‘There are no two nails together.’

original: Sukhumampīti yathāvuttaoḷārikacammato sukhumaṃ antomukhacammādi. Koṭṭhāsesu vā tacena
analyzed: sukhumam pi iti yathā vutta oḷārika cammato sukhumam antomukha camma ādi koṭṭhāsesu vā tacena
translated: ‘Even the fine’ means the fine skin of the inner surface of the mouth, etc., which is finer than the coarse skin already mentioned. Or alternatively,

original: paricchinnattā yaṃ durupalakkhaṇīyaṃ, taṃ “sukhuma”nti vuttaṃ. Tañhi vuttanayena
analyzed: paricchinna ttā yam durupalakkhaṇīyam tam sukhuman ti vuttam tat hi vutta nayena
translated: it is said to be ‘fine’ because it is difficult to discern, since it is divided up into parts by the pores of the skin. For that

original: tacaṃ vivaritvā passantassa pākaṭaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: tacam vivaritvā passantassa pākaṭam hoti iti
translated: becomes evident to one who sees it by opening up the skin as described.

original: Tālaguḷapaṭalaṃ nāma pakkatālaphalalasikaṃ tālapaṭṭikāya limpitvā sukkhāpetvā uddharitvā gahitapaṭalaṃ.
analyzed: tālaguḷapaṭalam nāma pakka tāla phala lasikam tāla paṭṭikāya limpitvā sukkhāpetvā uddharitvā gahita paṭalam
translated: ‘A palm-leaf sheath’ is a sheath made from a strip of palm leaf, which is dried after being smeared with glue and then removed.

original: Evaṃ timattānīti evaṃ-matta-saddehi gopphakaṭṭhikādīni avuttānipi dassetīti veditabbaṃ. Kīḷāgoḷakāni suttena bandhitvā aññamaññaṃ ghaṭṭetvā kīḷanagoḷakāni.
analyzed: evam ti mattāni iti evaṃmatta saddehi goppha kaṭṭhikā ādīni avuttāni api dasseti iti veditabbam kīḷā goḷakāni suttena bandhitvā aññamaññam ghaṭṭetvā kīḷana goḷakāni
translated: The play-balls are balls for playing with, which are made of thread and are bound together.

original: Tattha jaṅghaṭṭhikassa patiṭṭhitaṭṭhānanti jaṇṇukaṭṭhimhi pavisitvā ṭhitaṭṭhānanti
analyzed: tattha jaṅghaṭṭhikassa patiṭṭhita ṭhānanti jaṇṇuka ṭṭhimhi pavisitvā ṭhita ṭhānanti
translated: Herein, the “place where the shin-bone is set” is the place where the knee-bone enters.

original: adhippāyo. Tena aṭṭhinā patiṭṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ yaṃ kaṭiṭṭhino, taṃ aggachinnamahāpunnāgaphalasadisaṃ.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ tena aṭṭhinā patiṭṭhita ṭṭhānam yam kaṭiṭṭhinaḥ tam agga chinna mahā punnāga phala sadisam
translated: That is the meaning. The place where the shin-bone is set, which is in the hip-bone, is like a large cut-off punnaga fruit-stone.

original: Sīsakapaṭṭaveṭhakaṃ veṭhetvā ṭhapitasīsamayaṃ paṭṭakaṃ. Suttakantanasalākāviddhā
analyzed: sīsaka paṭṭa veṭhakam veṭhetvā ṭhapita sīsa mayam paṭṭakam sutta kantana salākā viddhā
translated: The “head-wrapping” is a strip of iron like a strip of tin used for wrapping up the head. The “balls pierced by the needle of thread”

original: goḷakā vaṭṭanāti vuccanti, vaṭṭanānaṃ āvali vaṭṭanāvali. Avalekhanasatthakaṃ ucchutacāvalekhanasatthakaṃ.
analyzed: goḷakāḥ vaṭṭanā ti vuccanti vaṭṭanānam āvali vaṭṭana āvali avalekhana satthakam ucchutaca avalekhana satthakam
translated: are called “balls,” and the “series of balls” is the “series of balls and needles.” The “scraper” is a scraper for cleaning the mouth.

original: Vakkabhāgena paricchinnanti vakkapariyantabhāgena paricchinnaṃ.
analyzed: vakka bhāgena vakka pariyanta bhāgena paricchinnam
translated: “Defined by the section of the belly” means defined by the edge of the belly.

original: Sakkharasudhāvaṇṇanti marumpehi katasudhāvaṇṇaṃ. “Setasakkharasudhāvaṇṇa”nti ca pāṭhaṃ vadanti, setasakkharāvaṇṇaṃ sudhāvaṇṇañcāti attho.
analyzed: sakkhara sudhā vaṇṇam ti marumpehi kata sudhā vaṇṇam seta sakkhara sudhā vaṇṇam iti ca pāṭham vadanti seta sakkhara āvaṇṇam sudhā vaṇṇam ca ati attho
translated: “The colour of white sugar-candy” means the colour of sugar-candy made from molasses. “The colour of white sugar-candy” is also a reading, the meaning of which is “the colour of white sugar-candy and the colour of sugar-candy.”

original: Yattha annapānaṃ nipatitvā tiṭṭhatīti sambandho.
analyzed: yattha anna pānam nipatitvā tiṭṭhati iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The construction is: “where the food and drink come to rest.”

original: Visamacchinnakalāpo visamaṃ udakaṃ paggharati, evameva sarīraṃ kesakūpādivivarehi upari heṭṭhā tiriyañca visamaṃ paggharatīti dassetuṃ visamacchinna-ggahaṇaṃ karoti.
analyzed: visama chinna kalāpaḥ visamam udakam paggharati evam eva sarīram kesakūpa ādi vivarehi upari heṭṭhā tiriyam ca visamam paggharati iti dassetum visama chinna ggahaṇam karoti
translated: “Unevenly cut” is mentioned in order to show that the body oozes unevenly through the openings of the hair pores, etc., just as water oozes from a place that is unevenly cut.

original: Atikaṭukaaccuṇhādiko visabhāgāhāro uṇhakāle pavattamānānaṃ dhātūnaṃ visabhāgattā.🔽Ekattārammaṇabaleneva vāti vikkhambhitanīvaraṇena susamāhitacittena upaṭṭhitassa
analyzed: ati kaṭuka accuṇha ādikaḥ visa bhāga āhāraḥ uṇha kāle pavattamānānam dhātūnam visa bhāga ttā  ekatta ārammaṇa balena iva vāti vikkhambhita nīvaraṇena su samāhita cittena upaṭṭhitassa
translated: “Unwholesome food” is food that is incompatible with the bodily humours that occur at the time of heat, etc.🔽“By the power of a single object” means by the power of a single object that appears.

original: nānārammaṇavipphandanavirahena ekasabhāvassa ārammaṇassa vasena. Tañhi ekattārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: nānā ārammaṇa vipphandana virahena eka sabhāvassa ārammaṇassa vasena tat hi ekatta ārammaṇam
translated: “By the power of a single object” means by the power of a single object that appears. For that object

original: upaṭṭhahamānameva attani abhiratiṃ, sātisayaṃ pharaṇapītiṃ, iṭṭhākārānubhavanañca
analyzed: upaṭṭhahamānam eva abhiratim sa atisayam pharaṇa pītim iṭṭha ākāra anubhavanam ca
translated: appears to him as a delight in himself, as a surfeit of happiness, and as the experience of a desirable form.

original: somanassaṃ uppādeti. Na hi abhiratisomanassehi vinā anatikkantapītisukhassa ekattupaṭṭhānaṃ atthīti.
analyzed: somanassam uppādeti na hi abhirati somanassehi vinā an atikkanta pīti sukhassa ekattupaṭṭhānam atthi iti
translated: He arouses happiness. For there is no single occurrence of the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths without happiness and gladness.

original: Avisesato pana sādhāraṇavasenāti paṭikūladhātuvaṇṇavisesaṃ akatvā samathavipassanāsādhāraṇavasenāti
analyzed: avisesato pana sādhāraṇa vasena ati paṭikūla dhātu vaṇṇa visesam a katvā samatha vipassanā sādhāraṇa vasena ati
translated: But in the general sense without distinction: in the general sense without making a distinction between the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths and the visible-form aspect of the object.🔽In the three ways: in the way stated in the following paragraphs beginning with “in conformity.”

original: attho. Tividhenāti anulomādinā vakkhamānena. Cha māseti addhamāse ūnepi māsaparicchedena🔽paricchijjamāne sajjhāye cha māsā paricchedakā hontīti katvā vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: attho tividhena ati anuloma ādinā vakkhamānena cha māse iti addha māse ūne pi māsa paricchedena  paricchijjamāne sajjhāye cha māsā paricchedakāḥ honti iti katvā vuttam ti veditabbam
translated: For six months: the six months are mentioned in order to prevent the meditator from going away during the month.🔽It should be understood that the six months are mentioned in order to prevent the meditator from going away during the month.

original: Paricchijjamānassa māsantaragamananivāraṇañhi chamāsaggahaṇaṃ, na sakalachamāse parivattadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: paricchijjamānassa māsa antara gamana nivāraṇam hi cha māsa ggahaṇam na sakala cha māse parivatta dassana ttham
translated: The six months are not mentioned in order to show that the whole of the six months must be spent on the meditation subject.

original: Ācariyāti aṭṭhakathācariyā.
analyzed: ācariyā ti aṭṭhakathā cariyā
translated: The teachers: the teachers of the commentaries.🔽The characteristic: the characteristic of repulsiveness in the elements.

original: Lakkhaṇanti dhātupaṭikūlalakkhaṇaṃ. Janaṃ na arahantīti ajaññā, jane pavesetuṃ ayuttā jigucchanīyāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: lakkhaṇanti dhātu paṭikūla lakkhaṇam janam na arahanti iti ajaññā jane pavesetum ayuttā jigucchanīyā iti vuttam hoti
translated: It is not fit for people, thus it is ignoble ; it is not suitable for people, thus it is ignoble ; it is contemptible, is what is meant.

original: Paṭipāṭiyā aṭṭhīnīti paṭipāṭiyā aṭṭhīni koṭiyā ṭhitāni. Na ettha koci attā nāma atthi,🔽aṭṭhīni eva aṭṭhipuñjamatto evāyaṃ saṅghāṭoti dasseti. Anekasandhiyamitoti anekehi
analyzed: paṭipāṭiyā aṭṭhīni iti paṭipāṭiyā aṭṭhīni koṭiyā ṭhitāni na ettha koci attā nāma atthi  aṭṭhīni eva aṭṭhi puñja mattaḥ eva ayam saṅghāṭaḥ iti dasseti aneka sandhiyam itaḥ ti anekehi
translated: ‘Bones in sequence’: the bones are in sequence, standing in a row. There is no self here at all,

original: sandhīhi yamito sambaddho so aṭṭhipuñjoti dasseti. Na kehicīti yamentaṃ attānaṃ paṭisedheti.
analyzed: sandhīhi yamitaḥ sambaddhaḥ saḥ aṭṭhipuñjaḥ ti dasseti na kehici iti yamentam attānam paṭisedheti
translated: he shows that it is just a heap of bones, just a bundle of bones. ‘Bound together with sinews’: he shows that the heap of bones is bound together with many sinews. ‘No where’: he denies that there is a self here.

original: Codito jarāya maraṇābhimukhagamanena codito.🔽Mahābhūtaṃ upādārūpena paricchinnaṃ “nīlaṃ pītaṃ sugandhaṃ duggandha”ntiādinā. Upādārūpaṃ
analyzed: coditaḥ jarāya maraṇa abhimukha gamanena coditaḥ  mahābhūtam upādā rūpena paricchinnam nīlam pītam sugandham upādā rūpam
translated: ‘Urged on by ageing’: urged on by ageing, which is the approach to death.

original: mahābhūtena tannissitassa tassa tato bahi abhāvā. Chāyātapānaṃ ātapapaccayachāyuppādakabhāvo🔽aññamaññaparicchedakatā. Rūpakkhandhassa pariggahitattā tadantogadhānaṃ cakkhādiāyatanadvārānaṃ
analyzed: mahābhūtena tad nissitassa tassa tatas bahi abhāvā chāyā ātapānam ātapa paccaya chāyā uppādaka bhāvo  aññamañña paricchedaka tā rūpa kkhandhassa pariggahita ttā tad antogadhānam
translated: The primary elements are delimited by the derived materiality, and the derived materiality is delimited by the primary elements, as in the case of blue, yellow, sweet, bitter, etc. The shadow is delimited by the tree, and the tree by the shadow. The shadow is the condition for the tree, and the tree for the shadow.🔽The delimitation of the immaterial states by the material states is by means of the faculties, and that of the material states by the immaterial states is by means of the activities. The delimitation of the eye base, etc., is by the materiality associated with it, and that of the materiality is by the eye base, etc.

original: vasena taṃtaṃdvārikā arūpino khandhā pākaṭā honti, āyatanāni ca dvārāni ca āyatanadvārānīti
analyzed: vasena taṃtaṃdvārikāḥ arūpino khandhāḥ pākaṭāḥ honti āyatanāni ca dvārāni ca āyatana dvārāni iti
translated: The immaterial aggregates are evident by means of the material aggregate, which is their door, as the eye-door, etc., are for the eye, etc.

original: vā attho. Tena rūpāyatanādīnañca vasenāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vā attho tena rūpa āyatana ādīnam ca vasena ati vuttam hoti
translated: or it is the meaning of the word. So it is said with reference to the visible-data base, etc., as well as to the materiality aggregate.

original: Sappaccayāti sappaccayabhāvā, paccayāyattaṃ hutvā nibbattanti vuttaṃ hoti. Samāno vā sadiso yutto paccayo sappaccayo, tasmā sappaccayā.🔽Ettakoti yathāvuttena ākārena paguṇo koṭṭhāso. Uggahova uggahasandhi. Vaṇṇādimukhena hi upaṭṭhānaṃ ettha sandhīyati sambajjhatīti “sandhī”ti vuccati.
analyzed: sappaccayā ti sappaccaya bhāvā paccaya āyattam hutvā nibbattanti vuttam hoti samānaḥ vā sadisaḥ yuttaḥ paccayaḥ sappaccayaḥ tasmā sappaccayā  ettakaḥ ti yathā vuttena ākārena paguṇaḥ koṭṭhāsaḥ uggahaḥ uva uggaha sandhi vaṇṇa ādi mukhena hi upaṭṭhānam ettha sandhīyati sambajjhati iti sandhi iti vuccati
translated: With conditions: by the state of having conditions; they are produced in dependence on conditions, is what is meant. Or else, a condition is a cause that is suitable, similar, and appropriate. So with conditions means with a cause that is suitable, similar, and appropriate.🔽As much as: a portion that is well known in the way already stated.🔽The mere grasping is the grasping link. For the appearance as visible data, etc., is called the “link” because it is linked, is connected, with the apprehending of visible data, etc., by way of the respective bases, eye, etc.🔽It appears: the meaning is that it appears as visible data, etc.

original: Upaṭṭhātīti vaṇṇādivasena upaṭṭhātīti attho. Pañcaṅgasamannāgateti nātidūranāccāsannagamanāgamanasampannanti
analyzed: upaṭṭhāti iti vaṇṇa ādi vasena upaṭṭhāti iti attho pañcaṅga samannāgatā iti na ati dūra na acca āsanna gamana āgamana sampannanti
translated: Possessing five factors: the factor of being neither too far nor too near for going and coming;

original: ekaṅgaṃ, divā abbokiṇṇaṃ rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosanti ekaṃ, appaḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassanti🔽ekaṃ, tasmiṃ kho pana senāsane viharantassa appakasirena uppajjati cīvara…pe… parikkhāroti
analyzed: ekaṅgam divā abbokiṇṇam rattim appa saddam appa nigghosanti ekam 🔽ekam tasmim kho pana senāsane viharantassa appa kasirena uppajjati cīvara pe parikkhāraḥ ti
translated: the factor of being free from din during the day and from noise at night; the factor of being free from contact with too many desirable and delectable forms, sounds, odours, tastes, and tactile objects;🔽the factor of being free from the touch of gadflies, flies, wind, sun, and reptiles; the factor of being conducive to the obtaining of alms by one of few wishes and easily obtained for one of much desire.

original: ekaṃ, tasmiṃ pana senāsane therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutāti ekaṃ. Pañcaṅgasamannāgatenāti
analyzed: ekam tasmim pana senāsane therāḥ bhikkhū viharanti bahu suta ati ekam pañcaṅga samannāgatena ati
translated: Possessed of five factors:

original: appābādhāsāṭheyyasaddhāpaññāvīriyehi padhāniyaṅgehi samannāgatena.
analyzed: appa ābādhā sāṭheyya saddhā paññā vīriyehi padhāniyaṅgehi samannāgatena
translated: possessed of the factors of chief importance, namely, non-affliction, non-deceit, faith, understanding, and energy.

original: Uṭṭhānakadāyanti tehi khettehi uṭṭhānakaṃ, tehi dātabbadhaññanti attho. Ettha ca
analyzed: uṭṭhānakadāyanti tehi khettehi uṭṭhānakam tehi dātabba dhaññanti atthaḥ ettha ca
translated: The field that is tilled by ploughing: the meaning is that the grain is to be given from those fields that are tilled by ploughing. And here

original: aṭṭhakumbhadāyakakhettaṃ viya mukhadhovanakiccaṃ, soḷasakumbhadāyakaṃ viya khādanabhuñjanakiccaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭha kumbha dāyaka khettam viya mukha dhovana kiccam soḷasa kumbha dāyakam viya khādana bhuñjana kiccam
translated: the duty of washing the mouth should be regarded as like the field that gives eight potfuls, and the duty of eating and drinking as like the field that gives sixteen potfuls,

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ lahukagarukabhāvato. Tato pana yaṃ dukkhaṃ nibbattati, taṃ aññañca dvattiṃsākāramanasikārena
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam lahuka garuka bhāvato tatas pana yam dukkham nibbattati tam aññam ca dvattiṃsa ākāra manasikārena
translated: according as they are light or heavy. Then the suffering that arises from that and other suffering are averted by attention to the thirty-two aspects.🔽So it is said: “The work should be done right there.”

original: ca nivattatīti āha “ettheva kammaṃ kātabba”nti. Ettāvatāti ekadivasaṃ tiṃsa vāre🔽manasikāraṭṭhapanena.
analyzed: ca nivattati iti āha ettha iva kammam kātabbanti ettāvatā iti eka divasam tiṃsa vāre  manasikāra ṭṭhapanena
translated: As much as: by stopping attention for thirty times in one day.

original: Sahassuddhāraṃ sādhetvāti sahassavaḍḍhitaṃ iṇaṃ yojetvā. Uddharitabboti uddhāroti
analyzed: sahassa uddhāram sādhetvā ati sahassa vaḍḍhitam iṇam yojetvā uddharitabbaḥ uti uddhāraḥ iti
translated: Having made a thousandfold pledge: having made a pledge with a thousandfold interest. It should be paid off: uddharitabbo is uddhāro.

original: hi vaḍḍhi vuccatīti. Suddhacittenāti vikkhepādikilesavirahitacittena. Kesādīsu tace
analyzed: hi vaḍḍhi vuccati iti suddha cittena ati vikkhepa ādi kilesa virahita cittena kesa ādīsu tace
translated: With a pure consciousness: with a consciousness free from defilements such as distraction.🔽They are attached to the hair, etc., taking the skin, which is the outer covering of the flesh, to be the skin of the body.

original: rajjantā succhavicammaṃ tacoti gahetvā “suvaṇṇādivaṇṇo me taco”tiādinā rajjanti.🔽Tesu dve ekamaggaṃ paṭipajjamānā nāma na hontīti yathā tathā vā palāyantīti attho. Tattha rāgādivatthubhāvena dvattiṃsākārānaṃ corasadisatā anatthāvahatā daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: rajjantā su chavi cammam taco ti gahetvā suvaṇṇa ādi vaṇṇaḥ me taco ti ādinā rajjanti  tesu dve eka maggam paṭipajjamānāḥ nāma na honti iti yathā tathā vā palāyanti iti attho tattha rāga ādi vatthu bhāvena cora sadisa tā anattha āvaha tā daṭṭhabbā
translated: They are attached to the flesh, taking the flesh of the body to be the flesh of the body.🔽They are attached to the bones, taking the bones of the body to be the bones of the body.🔽They are attached to the marrow, taking the marrow of the body to be the marrow of the body.🔽They are attached to the kidneys, taking the kidneys of the body to be the kidneys of the body.

original: Kammameva visesādhigamassa ṭhānanti kammaṭṭhānaṃ bhāvanā vuccati. Tenāha “manasikarontassa
analyzed: kammam eva visesa adhigamassa ṭhānan ti kammaṭṭhānam bhāvanā vuccati tena āha manasikarontassa
translated: They are attached to the heart, taking the heart of the body to be the heart of the body.🔽They are attached to the liver, taking the liver of the body to be the liver of the body.🔽They are attached to the spleen, taking the spleen of the body to be the spleen of the body.🔽They are attached to the lungs, taking the lungs of the body to be the lungs of the body.🔽They are attached to the bowels, taking the bowels of the body to be the bowels of the body.🔽They are attached to the entrails, taking the entrails of the body to be the entrails of the body.🔽They are attached to the undigested food, taking the undigested food in the body to be the undigested food in the body.

original: appanaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti. Kammassa vā bhāvanāya ṭhānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ appanārammaṇabhāvūpagamanena
analyzed: appanam pāpuṇāti iti kammassa vā bhāvanāya ṭhānam ārammaṇam appana ārammaṇa bhāva upagamanena
translated: They are attached to the excrement, taking the excrement in the body to be the excrement in the body.🔽They are attached to the brain, taking the brain in the head to be the brain in the head.🔽They are attached to the tears, taking the tears in the eyes to be the tears in the eyes.🔽They are attached to the grease, taking the grease in the body to be the grease in the body.

original: appanaṃ pāpuṇātīti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: appanam pāpuṇāti iti vuttam
translated: They are attached to the spit, taking the spit in the mouth to be the spit in the mouth.🔽They are attached to the snot, taking the snot in the nostrils to be the snot in the nostrils.

original: Mānajātikoti etena laṅghanasamatthatāyogena upasamarahitataṃ dasseti. Cittampi hi tathā nānārammaṇesu vaḍḍhitaṃ upasamarahitanti dassetabbanti.
analyzed: māna jātikā ti etena laṅghana samattha tā yogena upasama rahita tam dasseti cittam pi hi tathā nānā ārammaṇesu vaḍḍhitam upasama rahitanti dassetabbanti
translated: They are attached to the oil of the joints, taking the oil of the joints in the body to be the oil of the joints in the body.🔽They are attached to the urine, taking the urine in the bladder to be

original: Hatthe gahitapañhavatthu pākatikamevāti visuddhimagge vuttataṃ sandhāyāha. Tattha hi vuttaṃ –
analyzed: hatthe gahita pañha vatthu pākatikam evā ti visuddhimagge sandhāya āha tattha hi vuttam
translated: The story of the question held in the hand is given in the Visuddhimagga. For this is said there:

original: “Mālakatthero kira dīghabhāṇakaabhayattheraṃ hatthe gahetvā ‘āvuso abhaya, imaṃ tāva
analyzed: mālaka ttheraḥ kira dīghabhāṇaka abhaya ttheram hatthe gahetvā āvuso abhaya imam tāva
translated: “The Elder Mālunkyāputta, it seems, took the Elder Abhaya, a Dīgha reciter, by the arm, saying, ‘Come, friend Abhaya,

original: pañhaṃ uggaṇhāhī’ti vatvā āha ‘mālakatthero dvattiṃsakoṭṭhāsesu dvattiṃsapaṭhamajjhānalābhī,
analyzed: pañham uggaṇhāhi iti vatvā āha mālaka ttheraḥ dvattiṃsa koṭṭhāsesu dvattiṃsa paṭhama jhāna lābhī
translated: learn this question first,’ and he said, ‘The Elder Mālunkyāputta has attained the first jhāna in each of the thirty-two parts of the body.

original: sace rattiṃ ekaṃ, divā ekaṃ samāpajjati, atirekaḍḍhamāsena puna sampajjati. Sace
analyzed: sace rattim ekam divā ekam samāpajjati atireka ḍḍha māsena punar sampajjati sace
translated: If he attains it once by day and once by night, he attains it again in a fortnight.

original: pana devasikaṃ ekameva samāpajjati, atirekamāsena puna sampajjatī”’ti.
analyzed: pana devasikam ekam eva samāpajjati atireka māsena punar sampajjati iti
translated: But if he attains it once a day, he attains it again in a month’” .

original: Idaṃ pana ekaṃ manasikarontassa ekaṃ pāṭiyekkaṃ manasikarontassa dvattiṃsāti etassa sādhanatthaṃ nidassanavasena ānītanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: idam pana ekam manasikarontassa ekam pāṭiyekkam manasikarontassa dvattiṃsa ati etassa sādhana attham nidassana vasena ānītanti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: But this is to be regarded as cited just to show how the thirty-two are established for one who gives attention to them all together and for one who gives attention to them separately.

original: Anupādinnakapakkhe ṭhitānīti etena cetiyapabbatavāsī mahātissatthero viya, saṅgharakkhitattherupaṭṭhākasāmaṇero
analyzed: an upādinnaka pakkhe ṭhitāni iti etena cetiya pabbata vāsī mahā tissa theraḥ viya saṅgharakkhita thera upaṭṭhāka sāmaṇeraḥ
translated: “Standing in the unpercipient category”: the novice attendant on the Elder Saṅgharakkhita who lived at Cetiyapabbata

original: viya ca anupādinnakapakkhe ṭhapetvā gahetuṃ sakkontassa dasavidhāsubhavasena jīvamānakasarīrepi🔽upaṭṭhite upacārappatti dassitā hotīti veditabbā. “Atthissa kāye”ti pana sattavasena🔽kesādīsu gayhamānesu yathā “imasmiṃ kāye”ti satta-ggahaṇarahite ahaṃkāravatthumhi
analyzed: viya ca an upādinnaka pakkhe ṭhapetvā gahetum sakkontassa dasavidha asubha vasena jīvamānaka sarīre pi  upaṭṭhite upacāra ppatti dassitā hoti iti veditabbā atthi issa kāya iti pana satta vasena  kesa ādīsu gayhamānesu yathā imasmin kāya iti satta ggahaṇa rahite ahaṃkāra vatthumhi
translated: And as though it were placed in the unappropriated-to-state, it is shown that when he is able to apprehend it, the access of the meditation is present in the living body too, in the tenfold aspect of foulness.🔽But when he apprehends the head hairs, etc., in the seven ways beginning with “There is in this body,”🔽then the sign becomes evident to him in his own body, which is devoid of the sevenfold apprehension of “in this” and is the object of the conceit “I am,” which is always present, though not always in the obvious way.

original: viddhastāhaṃkāre sadā sannihite pākaṭe ca attano kāye upaṭṭhānaṃ hoti, na tathā tatthāti🔽appanaṃ appattā ādīnavānupassanāva tattha hotīti adhippāyenāha “asubhānupassanāsaṅkhātā
analyzed: viddhasta ahaṃkāre sadā sannihite pākaṭe ca attano kāye upaṭṭhānam hoti na tathā tattha ati  appanam appattā ādīnava anupassanā ava tattha hoti iti adhippāyena āha asubha anupassanā saṅkhātā
translated: But it is not so in the case of the head hairs, etc.,🔽so the intention is that only the contemplation of foulness as disappointment is present there, not absorption.

original: pana vipassanābhāvanā hotīti veditabbā”ti.
analyzed: pana vipassanā bhāvanā hoti iti veditabbā ati
translated: “But it should be understood that the development of insight called ‘contemplation of foulness’ is present there.”

original: 357. Ādimhi sevanā āsevanā, vaḍḍhanaṃ bhāvanā, punappunaṃ karaṇaṃ bahulīkammanti ayametesaṃ viseso.
analyzed: ādimhi sevanā āsevanā vaḍḍhanam bhāvanā punappunam karaṇam bahulīkammanti ayam etesam visesaḥ
translated: The difference between these is this. Frequenting is practice. Repetition is development. Doing again and again is making much.

original: 362. Vatthupariññāyāti abhijjhādomanassānaṃ vatthubhūtassa kāyassa parijānanena.
analyzed: vatthu pariññāya ati abhijjhā domanassānam vatthu bhūtassa kāyassa parijānanena
translated: By means of full-understanding of the object: by means of full-understanding of the body, which is the object of covetousness and grief.

original: Appitāti gamitā, sā ca vināsitatāti āha “vināsitā”ti. Appavattiyaṃ ṭhapitātipi appitāti
analyzed: appitā ati gamitā sā ca vināsita tā ti āha vināsitā ati appavattiyam ṭhapitā atipi appitā ati
translated: “Gone” means “destroyed.” “Established in non-occurrence” means “made to go” .

original: ayamattho niruttisiddhiyā vuttoti daṭṭhabbo. Vigatantā katāti idāni kātabbo anto
analyzed: ayam attho nirutti siddhiyā vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbaḥ vigata antā katā ati idāni kātabbaḥ antaḥ
translated: This meaning should be understood as stated in the commentary on the word “utterly” .🔽“Without remainder” means “without what is to be done” .

original: etesaṃ natthīti vigatantā, evaṃbhūtā katāti attho. Kammameva visesādhigamassa ṭhānaṃ🔽kammaṭṭhānaṃ, kamme vā ṭhānaṃ bhāvanārambho kammaṭṭhānaṃ, tañca anupassanāti āha
analyzed: etesam na atthi iti vigata antā evaṃbhūtā katā ati attho kammam eva visesa adhigamassa ṭhānam  kammaṭṭhānam kamme vā ṭhānam bhāvanā ārambhaḥ kammaṭṭhānam tat ca anupassanā ti āha
translated: “The basis for the work” is the basis for the attainment of distinction.🔽Or the beginning of development is the basis for the work, the meditation subject.🔽And that is “contemplation,” thus he said “the meditation subject as contemplation.”

original: “anupassanāya kammaṭṭhāna”nti, anupassanāya vuttanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: anupassanāya kammaṭṭhānanti anupassanāya vuttanti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that it is stated as “contemplation.”

original: Kāyānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Vedanānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kāya anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  vedanā anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the contemplation of the body is ended.🔽The description of the contemplation of feeling🔽“Understanding and feeling” is “understanding and being conscious of feeling.”

original: 363. Sampajānassa vediyanaṃ sampajānavediyanaṃ. Vatthunti sukhādīnaṃ ārammaṇamāha,
analyzed: sampajānassa vediyanam sampajāna vediyanam vatthum ti sukha ādīnam ārammaṇam āha
translated: “The object” is the object of pleasure, etc.,🔽and the compound “vatthuārammaṇaṃ” should be regarded as a dvanda compound.

original: tena vatthu ārammaṇaṃ etissāti vatthuārammaṇāti samāso daṭṭhabbo. Vohāramattaṃ hotīti
analyzed: tena vatthu ārammaṇam etissa ati vatthu ārammaṇā ati samāsaḥ daṭṭhabbo vohāra mattam hoti iti
translated: “It is mere usage” means

original: etena “sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī”ti idaṃ vohāramattena vuttanti dasseti.
analyzed: etena sukham vedanam vedayāmi iti idam vohāra mattena vuttanti dasseti
translated: By this he shows that the statement “I feel a pleasant feeling” is made only by way of designation.

original: Vīriyasamādhiṃ yojetvāti adhivāsanavīriyassa adhimattatāya tassa samatāya ubhayaṃ
analyzed: vīriya samādhim yojetvā ati adhivāsana vīriyassa adhimatta tāya tassa sama tāya ubhayam
translated: “Having yoked concentration with energy”: because of the abundance of the energy of endurance, both are yoked together by his equanimity.

original: saha yojetvā. Saha paṭisambhidāhīti lokuttarapaṭisambhidāhi saha. Lokiyānampi vā🔽sati uppattikāle tattha samatthataṃ sandhāya “saha paṭisambhidāhī”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: saha yojetvā saha paṭisambhidāhi iti lokuttara paṭisambhidāhi saha vā  sati uppatti kāle tattha samattha tam sandhāya saha vuttan ti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: “Together with the discriminations”: together with the supramundane discriminations. Or else,🔽it should be understood that the words “together with the discriminations” refer to the ability to attain the mundane discriminations at the time of their arising.

original: Samasīsīti vārasamasīsī hutvā paccavekkhaṇavārassa anantaravāre parinibbāyīti attho.
analyzed: samasīsī iti vāra samasīsī hutvā paccavekkhaṇa vārassa anantara vāre parinibbāyi iti attho
translated: “With the same head”: with the same turn. The meaning is: he attained final Nibbāna in the turn immediately following the turn of reflection.

original: Saṅkhepamanasikāravasena mahāsatipaṭṭhāne, vitthāramanasikāravasena rāhulovādadhātuvibhaṅgādīsu.
analyzed: saṅkhepa manasikāra vasena mahāsati paṭṭhāne vitthāra manasikāra vasena rāhulovāda dhātu vibhaṅga ādīsu
translated: In the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta by way of the brief application of attention, and in the Rāhulavada, Dhātuvibhaṅga, etc., by way of the detailed application of attention.

original: Phassapañcamakeyevāti eva-saddena vuttesu tīsupi mukhesu pariggahassa samānataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: phassa pañcamake iva iva āti eva saddena vuttesu tīsu pi mukhesu pariggahassa samāna tam dasseti
translated: “With contact as the fifth”: by the word “only” he shows the equality of the three mentioned in the three ways.

original: Nāmarūpavavatthānassa adhippetattā niravasesarūpapariggahassa dassanatthaṃ “vatthu
analyzed: nāma rūpa vavatthānassa adhippeta ttā niravasesa rūpa pariggahassa dassana ttham vatthu
translated: “The object of the exposition of mentality-materiality”: for the purpose of showing the inclusion of all materiality without exception, he says “the object of the exposition of mentality-materiality.”

original: nāma karajakāyo”ti āha, na cakkhādīni chavatthūnīti. Karajakāyassa pana vatthubhāvasādhanatthaṃ
analyzed: nāma karaja kāyaḥ iti āha na cakkha ādīni cha vatthūni iti karaja kāyassa pana vatthu bhāva sādhana attham
translated: “The body as the basis of mind-and-body” and not the six bases beginning with the eye.

original: “idañca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ, ettha paṭibaddha”nti suttaṃ ābhataṃ.🔽Phassaviññāṇānaṃ pākaṭatā kesañci hotīti yesaṃ na hoti, te sandhāyāha “phassavasena🔽vā hi…pe… na pākaṭaṃ hotī”ti. Tesaṃ pana aññesañca sabbesaṃ veneyyānaṃ vedanā pākaṭāti
analyzed: idam ca pana me viññāṇam ettha sitam ettha paṭibaddhanti suttam ābhataṃ  phassa viññāṇānam pākaṭa tā kesañci hoti iti yesam na hoti te sandhāya āha phassa vasena  vā hipe na pākaṭam hoti iti tesam pana aññesam ca sabbesam veneyyānam vedanā pākaṭā ati
translated: And in order to prove that the body is the basis of mind-and-body, the sutta is quoted: “And this my consciousness is dependent, bound up with, this body” .🔽Because the impact and the consciousness are obvious to some, he says, “Or else, through impact … it is not obvious” .🔽But feeling is obvious to those and to all other disciples,

original: āha “vedanāvasena pana pākaṭaṃ hotī”ti. Satadhotasappi nāma satavāraṃ vilāpetvā vilāpetvā
analyzed: āha vedanā vasena pana pākaṭam hoti iti nāma sata vāram vilāpetvā vilāpetvā
translated: so he says, “But through feeling it is obvious” .

original: udake pakkhipitvā uddharitvā gahitasappi.
analyzed: udake pakkhipitvā uddharitvā gahita sappi
translated: “A hundred-reeled oil tube” is an oil tube that has been drawn out a hundred times by dipping it in water and pulling it out.🔽“Having disentangled it” : having extracted it from the combination of the four khandhas.

original: Vinivattetvāti catukkhandhasamudāyato visuṃ uddharitvā. Mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttādīsu
analyzed: vinivattetvā iti catu khandha samudāyataḥ visum uddharitvā mahāsati paṭṭhāna sutta ādīsu
translated: In the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta and other places,

original: katthaci paṭhamaṃ rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ vatvā pacchā arūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ vedanāvasena vinivattetvā
analyzed: katthaci paṭhamam rūpa kammaṭṭhānam vatvā pacchā arūpa kammaṭṭhānam vedanā vasena vinivattetvā
translated: sometimes the material meditation subject is given first and then the immaterial meditation subject, having disentangled it through feeling.

original: dassitaṃ. Katthaci arūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ eva vedanāvasena arūparāsito, ñātapariññāya
analyzed: dassitam katthaci arūpa kammaṭṭhānam eva vedanā vasena arūpa rāsitaḥ ñāta pariññāya
translated: And in some places the immaterial meditation subject is shown as the immaterial side of feeling, or as the immaterial side of the material and immaterial, by way of full-understanding as a known mental datum.🔽And in some places it is shown by turning away from the material and immaterial sides of the material and immaterial, by way of full-understanding as abandoning.

original: pariññātato vā rūpārūparāsito vā vinivattetvā dassitaṃ. Tatthāpi yesu paṭhamaṃ ñātapariññā
analyzed: pariññātataḥ vā rūpa arūpa rāsitaḥ vā vinivattetvā dassitam tattha api yesu paṭhamam ñāta pariññā
translated: And here too, in the cases where full-understanding as a known mental datum is mentioned first, it is included in the latter.

original: vuttā, tesu tadantogadhaṃ. Yesu na vuttā, tesu ca vedanāya ārammaṇamattaṃ saṃkhittaṃ
analyzed: vuttā tesu tat antogadham yesu na vuttā tesu ca vedanāya ārammaṇa mattam saṃkhittam
translated: But in the cases where it is not mentioned, only the object as a mere datum is abbreviated.

original: pāḷianāruḷhaṃ rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ sandhāya rūpakammaṭṭhānassa paṭhamaṃ kathitatā vuttāti veditabbā.🔽“Manoviññeyyānaṃ dhammānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantāna”ntiādinā nayena vuttaṃ chagehassitasomanassaṃ
analyzed: pāḷi anāruḷham rūpa kammaṭṭhānam sandhāya rūpa kammaṭṭhānassa paṭhamam kathita tā vuttā iti veditabbā  manaḥ viññeyyānam dhammānam iṭṭhānam kantānam ti ādinā nayena vuttam chagehassita somanassam
translated: And the reason why the material meditation subject is mentioned first should be understood as follows.🔽The six kinds of pleasant happy feeling that are “dependent on the home life” are only the perception of gratification in the five cords of sense desire.

original: pañcakāmaguṇesu assādānupassino eva hotīti āha “pañcakāmaguṇāmisanissitā cha gehassitasomanassavedanā”ti.
analyzed: pañca kāmaguṇesu assāda anupassinaḥ eva hoti iti āha pañca kāmaguṇa āmisa nissitā cha geha ssita somanassa vedanā ti
translated: So he said “The six kinds of pleasant happy feeling dependent on the home life and based on the sensual pleasures of the five cords of sense desire.”

original: Vedanānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vedanā anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the contemplation of feeling is ended.

original: Cittānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the contemplation of consciousness

original: 365. Kilesasampayuttānaṃ dhammānaṃ kehici kilesehi vippayogepi sati yehi sampayuttā,🔽tehi saṃkilesabhāvena sadisehi saṃkiliṭṭhattā itarehipi na visuddhatā hotīti āha🔽“na pacchimapadaṃ bhajantī”ti. Duvidhanti visuṃ vacanaṃ sarāgasadosehi visiṭṭhaggahaṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: kilesa sampayuttānam dhammānam kehici kilesehi vippayoge pi sati yehi sampayuttā  tehi saṃkilesa bhāvena sadisehi saṃkiliṭṭha ttā itarehi pi na visuddha tā hoti iti āha  na pacchima padam bhajanti iti visum vacanam sa rāga sa dosehi visiṭṭha ggahaṇa attham
translated: Although there is disconnection from some defilements in the case of states associated with defilements, still, because of their being defiled by the defilements with which they are associated, which are similar to them in being defiled, they are not purified by the others either.🔽That is why he said, “They do not take the last term” .🔽The two kinds are mentioned separately in order to show the difference between those associated with greed and those associated with hate.

original: Avipassanupagattā “idha okāsova natthī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Cittānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: a vipassanā upaga ttā idha okāsaḥ uva na atthi iti vuttam  citta anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Although there is disconnection of some defilements from the states associated with defilements, still, because of the defilement-like nature of those associated with them, they are defiled and not purified by the others either. So it is said that they do not “take the last term” . “Of two kinds” : the separate statement is for the purpose of singling out greed and hate. “Not suitable for insight” : it is said that “there is no opportunity here” . The description of the contemplation of consciousness is ended.🔽The description of the contemplation of mental objects

original: Dhammānupassanāniddeso🔽Ka. nīvaraṇapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ka nīvaraṇa pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the hindrances

original: 367. Kaṇhasukkānaṃ yuganaddhatā natthīti pajānanakāle abhāvā “abhiṇhasamudācāravasenā”ti āha.
analyzed: kaṇha sukkānam yuga naddha tā natthi iti pajānana kāle abhāvāḥ abhiṇha samudācāra vasena ati āha
translated: The meaning is that there is no yoking together of the black and the white at the time of discerning. “By their frequent occurrence” is said.

original: Subhampīti kāmacchandopi. So hi attano gahaṇākārena “subha”nti vuccati, tenākārena
analyzed: subham pi iti kāmacchandaḥ api saḥ hi attanaḥ gahaṇa ākārena subham ti vuccati tena ākārena
translated: “Beauty” is sensual desire. That is called “beauty” in the sense of its own apprehension.

original: pavattamānakassa aññassa kāmacchandassa nimittattā “nimitta”nti cāti. Ākaṅkhitassa
analyzed: pavattamānakassa aññassa kāmacchandassa nimitta ttā nimittanti ca ati ākaṅkhitassa
translated: Because it is the sign of another sensual desire that occurs in that mode, it is called “sign” .🔽“What is wished for” is the object of sensual desire.

original: hitasukhassa anupāyabhūto manasikāro anupāyamanasikāro. Tatthāti nipphādetabbe ārammaṇabhūte🔽ca duvidhepi subhanimitte.
analyzed: hita sukhassa anupāya bhūtaḥ manasikāraḥ anupāya manasikāro tattha ati nipphādetabbe ārammaṇa bhūte  ca duvidhe api subha nimitte
translated: Attention that is not a means to welfare and pleasure is unmethodical attention. Herein, in the two kinds of sign as object to be produced,

original: Asubhampīti asubhajjhānampi. Taṃ pana dasasu asubhesu kesādīsu ca pavattaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: asubham pi iti asubha jjhānam pi tam pana dasasu asubhesu kesa ādīsu ca pavattam daṭṭhabbam
translated: and in foulness too: foulness should be regarded as occurring in the ten kinds of foulness beginning with the bloated and in head hairs, body hairs, etc.,

original: Kesādīsu hi saññā asubhasaññāti girimānandasutte vuttāti. Ettha catubbidhassapi ayonisomanasikārassa
analyzed: kesa ādīsu hi saññā asubha saññā ti girima ānanda sutte vuttā ti ettha catubbidhassa api a yoniso manasikārassa
translated: for it is said in the Girimānanda Sutta that perception of the bloated, etc., and of head hairs, body hairs, and so on, is perception of foulness.

original: yonisomanasikārassa ca dassanaṃ niravasesadassanatthaṃ katanti veditabbaṃ. Tesu pana
analyzed: yonisoma nasikārassa ca dassanam niravasesa dassana attham katan ti veditabbam tesu pana
translated: And the seeing of both kinds of unmethodical attention and of methodical attention should be understood here as given in all ways.

original: asubhe subhanti asubhanti ca manasikāro idhādhippeto, tadanukulattā vā itarepīti.🔽Bhojane mattaññuno thinamiddhābhibhavābhāvā otāraṃ alabhamāno kāmarāgo pahīyatīti
analyzed: asubhe subhanti asubhanti ca manasikāraḥ idha adhippeto tad anukula ttā vai itare pi iti  bhojane mattaññunaḥ otāram a labhamānaḥ kāma rāgaḥ pahīyati iti
translated: But here attention to foulness as beautiful and attention to what is beautiful as foul are intended, or else the other two kinds of attention are included by the former two.🔽And they say that lust for sense desires is abandoned because there is no opportunity for the over- powering of consciousness by torpor and lethargy when there is moderation in food,

original: vadanti. Bhojananissitaṃ pana āhārepaṭikūlasaññaṃ, tabbipariṇāmassa tadādhārassa
analyzed: vadanti bhojana nissitam pana āhāre paṭikūla saññam tad vipariṇāmassa tad ādhārassa
translated: but the perception of unattractiveness in nutriment, which is based on the food, is the cause of the abandoning of lust for sense desires.

original: tassa ca upanissayabhūtassa asubhatādidassanaṃ, kāyassa ca āhāraṭṭhitikatādidassanaṃ
analyzed: tassa ca upanissaya bhūtassa asubha tā ādi dassanam kāyassa ca āhāra ṭṭhitika tā ādi dassanam
translated: and the seeing of the ugliness, etc., which is the decisive-support condition for that, and the seeing of the dependence of the body on nutriment, etc.,

original: so uppādetīti tassa kāmacchando pahīyateva, abhidhammapariyāyena sabbopi lobho kāmacchandanīvaraṇanti
analyzed: saḥ uppādeti iti tassa kāmacchandaḥ pahīyateva abhidhamma pariyāyena sabbaḥ api lobho kāmacchanda nīvaraṇan ti
translated: he abandons sensual desire. In the Abhidhamma Pitaka all greed is called the hindrance of sensual desire.

original: āha “arahattamaggenā”ti.
analyzed: āha arahatta maggena ati
translated: That is why it is said, “by the path of arahatship.”

original: Odissakānodissakadisāpharaṇānanti attagaruatippiyasahāyamajjhattavasena odissakatā,
analyzed: odissaka anodissaka disāpharaṇānam anti atta garu atippiya sahāya majjhatta vasena odissaka tā
translated: As to the pervasion of the directions with and without distinction: the distinction is that of oneself as dear, a neutral person as dear, and a hostile person as dear,

original: sīmābhede kate anodissakatā, ekadisāpharaṇavasena disāpharaṇatā mettāya uggahaṇe🔽veditabbā. Vihāraracchāgāmādivasena vā odissakadisāpharaṇaṃ, vihārādiuddesarahitaṃ🔽puratthimādidisāvasena anodissakadisāpharaṇanti evaṃ vā dvidhā uggahaṃ sandhāya “odissakānodissakadisāpharaṇāna”nti
analyzed: sīmā bhede kate anodissaka tā eka disā pharaṇa vasena disā pharaṇa tā mettāya uggahaṇe  veditabbā vihāra racchā gāma ādi vasena vā odissaka disā pharaṇam vihāra ādi uddesa rahitam  puratthima ādi disā vasena anodissaka disā pharaṇanti evam vā dvidhā uggaham sandhāya odissaka anodissaka disā pharaṇa ananti
translated: and the absence of distinction is that of the pervasion of the directions without making the distinction of boundary.🔽The pervasion of the directions should be understood as the pervasion of the directions with the distinction of the monastery, the village, etc., and the pervasion of the directions without the distinction of the monastery, etc., but with the distinction of the eastern direction, etc.

original: vuttaṃ. Uggaho ca yāva upacārā daṭṭhabbo, uggahitāya āsevanā bhāvanā. Tattha “sabbe
analyzed: vuttam uggahaḥ ca yāva upacārāḥ daṭṭhabbo uggahitāya āsevanā bhāvanā tattha sabbe
translated: Thus it is said, “as to the pervasion of the directions with and without distinction.” And the learning sign should be regarded as extending as far as the access of loving- kindness. The counterpart sign is the development of loving-kindness. Herein, “all beings” is the object of loving-kindness.

original: sattā pāṇā bhūtā puggalā attabhāvapariyāpannā”ti etesaṃ vasena pañcavidhā, ekekasmiṃ
analyzed: sattā pāṇāḥ bhūtāḥ puggalāḥ etesam vasena pañcavidhāḥ ekekasmin
translated: and the fivefold one is according to beings, creatures, living beings, persons, and individuals, which are included in the selfhood.

original: “averā hontu, abyāpajjā, anīghā, sukhī attānaṃ pariharantū”ti catudhā pavattito vīsatividhā🔽vā anodhisopharaṇā mettā, “sabbā itthiyo purisā ariyā anariyā devā manussā vinipātikā”ti
analyzed: averāḥ hontu a byāpajjāḥ anīghāḥ sukhī attānam pariharantu uti catudhā pavattitaḥ vīsatividhā  vā anodhi sopharaṇā mettā sabbāḥ itthiyaḥ purisāḥ ariyāḥ anariyāḥ devāḥ manussāḥ vinipātikā ati
translated: The twentyfold one is according to the fourfold occurrence thus: “May they be free from enmity, affliction, and anxiety, and may they live happily.”🔽The sevenfold one is according to the occurrence with reference to beings, etc., as “all women, all men, all Noble Ones, all ordinary men, all gods, all men, all beings in states of loss” and so on.

original: sattodhikaraṇavasena pavattā sattavidhā, aṭṭhavīsatividhā vā odhisopharaṇā mettā,
analyzed: sattā adhikaraṇa vasena pavattā sattavidhā aṭṭhavīsatividhā vā odhi sopharaṇā mettā
translated: The twenty-eightfold one is according to the occurrence with reference to beings, etc., and with reference to women, etc.

original: dasahi disāhi disodhikaraṇavasena pavattā dasavidhā ca disāpharaṇā mettā, ekekāya
analyzed: dasahi disāhi disodhi karaṇa vasena pavattā dasavidhā ca ekekāya
translated: The tenfold one is according to the occurrence with reference to the ten directions.

original: vā disāya sattādiitthiādiaverādiyogena asītādhikacatusatappabhedā anodhisoodhisopharaṇā veditabbā.
analyzed: vā disāya satta ādi itthi ādi aveḥ ādi yogena asīta adhika catusata ppabhedā veditabbā
translated: The twenty-eightfold one without reference to directions should be understood as the twenty-eight kinds of non-reference to directions, which is the twenty-eightfold one with reference to directions, according to the combination of women, men, Noble Ones, ordinary men, gods, human beings, beings in states of loss, etc., with freedom from enmity, etc.

original: Kāyavināmanāti kāyassa vividhena ākārena nāmanā.
analyzed: kāya vināmanā ti kāyassa vividhena ākārena nāmanā
translated: Body-transfiguration: the transfiguring of the body in various ways.

original: Atibhojane nimittaggāhoti atibhojane thinamiddhassa nimittaggāho, “ettake bhutte
analyzed: atibhojane nimitta ggāho ti atibhojane thinamiddhassa nimitta ggāho ettake bhutte
translated: Taking a sign from over-eating: taking a sign from sloth and torpor that arise owing to over-eating.

original: thinamiddhassa kāraṇaṃ hoti, ettake na hotī”ti thinamiddhassa kāraṇākāraṇaggāhoti
analyzed: thinamiddhassa kāraṇam hoti ettake na hoti iti thinamiddhassa kāraṇa akāraṇa ggāhā ti
translated: The meaning is that he has the wrong grasp of the cause and non-cause of stiffness and torpor.

original: attho. Dhutaṅgānaṃ vīriyanissitattā āha “dhutaṅganissitasappāyakathāyapī”ti.
analyzed: atthaḥ dhutaṅgānam vīriya nissita ttā āha dhutaṅga nissita sappāya kathāya api iti
translated: Since the ascetic practices are dependent on energy, he said “also in the right kind of talk dependent on the ascetic practices.”

original: Kukkuccampi katākatānusocanavasena pavattamānaṃ uddhaccena samānalakkhaṇaṃ avūpasamasabhāvamevāti cetaso avūpasamo “uddhaccakukkuccamevā”ti vutto.
analyzed: kukkuccam pi kata akata anusocana vasena pavattamānam uddhaccena samāna lakkhaṇam avūpasama sabhāvam eva ati cetasaḥ avūpasamaḥ uddhacca kukkuccam eva ati vutto
translated: and since worry also occurs as a form of agitation with the characteristic of non-stillness of consciousness, he said “agitation and worry are non-stillness of consciousness.”

original: Bahussutassa ganthato ca atthato ca atthādīni vicinantassa cetaso vikkhepo na hoti
analyzed: bahu ssutassa ganthato ca atthato ca attha ādīni vicinantassa cetasaḥ vikkhepaḥ na hoti
translated: In one who is learned, who investigates the meaning and the Dhamma and the Teaching, there is no distraction of consciousness

original: yathāvidhipaṭipattiyā yathānurūpapatikārappavattiyā katākatānusocanañcāti “bāhusaccenapi
analyzed: yathāvidhi paṭipattiyā yathā anurūpa patikāra ppavattiyā kata akata anusocanam ca ati bāhu saccena api
translated: and no worry about what has been done and what has not been done, since he practices in accordance with the rules and acts in the right way.

original: uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīyatī”ti āha. Vuḍḍhasevitā ca vuḍḍhasīlitaṃ āvahatīti cetovūpasamakarattā🔽uddhaccakukkuccappahānakāritā vuttā. Vuḍḍhataṃ pana anapekkhitvā vinayadharā kukkuccavinodakā
analyzed: uddhacca kukkuccam pahīyati iti āha vuḍḍha sevitā ca vuḍḍha sīlitam āvahati iti cetaḥ vūpasama karattā  uddhacca kukkucca ppahāna kāri tā vuttā vuḍḍha tam pana an apekkhitvā vinaya dharā kukkucca vinodakā
translated: Therefore he said “agitation and worry are abandoned through much learning.”🔽and since the service of the elders brings about the virtue of the elders,🔽he said “it is the cause of the abandoning of agitation and worry” because it brings about stillness of consciousness.🔽But the good friends who remove worry should be regarded as those who are the upholders of the Discipline,

original: kalyāṇamittā vuttāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittā vuttā iti daṭṭhabbā
translated: without regard to seniority.

original: Tiṭṭhati etthāti ṭhānīyā, vicikicchāya ṭhānīyā vicikicchāṭhānīyā. Ṭhātabbāti vā ṭhānīyā, vicikicchā ṭhānīyā etesūti vicikicchāṭhānīyā.🔽Kāmaṃ bahussutatāparipucchakatāhi aṭṭhavatthukāpi vicikicchā pahīyati, tathāpi ratanattayavicikicchāmūlikā
analyzed: tiṭṭhati ettha ati ṭhānīyā vicikicchāya ṭhānīyā vicikicchā ṭhānīyā ṭhātabbā ati vā ṭhānīyā vicikicchā ṭhānīyā etesu uti vicikicchā ṭhānīyā  kāmam bahu ssuta tā paripucchaka tāhi aṭṭhavatthukā api vicikicchā pahīyati tathā api rata nattaya vicikicchā mūlikā
translated: The state of being a state of doubt is the state of doubtfulness. Or alternatively, the state of being a state of doubt is the state of being a state of doubtfulness.

original: sesavicikicchāti katvā āha “tīṇi ratanāni ārabbhā”ti. Vinaye pakataññutā “sikkhāya
analyzed: sesa vicikicchā ati katvā āha tīṇi ratanāni ārabbha ati vinaye pakataññu tā sikkhāya
translated: Though doubt about the eight questions is abandoned by much learning and by asking questions, nevertheless it is said, “With reference to the Three Jewels,” because the other kinds of doubt have the doubt about the Three Jewels as their root.

original: kaṅkhatī”ti vuttāya vicikicchāya pahānaṃ karotīti āha “vinaye ciṇṇavasībhāvassapī”ti.🔽Okappaniyasaddhāsaṅkhātaadhimokkhabahulassāti anupavisanasaddhāsaṅkhātaadhimokkhena🔽adhimuccanabahulassa. Adhimuccanañca adhimokkhuppādanamevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Saddhāya
analyzed: kaṅkhati iti vuttāya vicikicchāya pahānam karoti iti āha vinaye ciṇṇavasībhāvassa api iti  okappaniya saddhā saṅkhāta adhimokkha bahulassa ati anupavisana saddhā saṅkhāta adhimokkhena  adhimuccana bahulassa adhimuccanam ca adhimokkha uppādanam eva ati daṭṭhabbam saddhāya
translated: And though the abandoning of the doubt stated thus, “He doubts the training” , is effected by proficiency in the Discipline, nevertheless it is said, “Even though he has mastery in the Discipline,” because the doubt stated thus, “He doubts the training” , is abandoned by the faith called “looking-on” .🔽By one who has much resolved confidence called “looking-on” : by one who has much resolved confidence called “entering into” .🔽Or alternatively, “looking-on” is the faith called “looking-on” .

original: vā ninnatā adhimutti.
analyzed: vā ninna tā adhimutti
translated: “Resolved confidence” is the state of being resolved.

original: Nīvaraṇapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the hindrances is ended.

original: Kha. bojjhaṅgapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bojjhaṅga pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the enlightenment factors

original: Khandhādipāḷiyā attho khandhādīnaṃ atthoti katvā āha “khandha…pe… vipassanānaṃ atthasannissitaparipucchābahulatā”ti.
analyzed: khandha ādi pāḷiyā atthaḥ khandha ādīnam atthaḥ iti katvā āha khandhape vipassanānam attha sannissita paripucchā bahula tā ti
translated: The meaning of the text of the aggregates, etc., is the meaning of the aggregates, etc., he says. “The questions are concerned with the meaning of the aggregates, etc., and insight.”

original: Tena pāḷimuttakapucchā na tathā paññāsaṃvattanikā, yathā atthapaṭipucchāti dasseti.
analyzed: tena pāḷimuttaka pucchā na tathā paññā saṃvattanikā yathā attha paṭipucchā ati dasseti
translated: He shows that questions about the text do not lead to the fifty as much as questions about the meaning.

original: Mandattā aggijālādīsu āpodhātuādīnaṃ viya vīriyādīnaṃ sakicce asamatthatā vuttā.
analyzed: manda ttā aggi jāla ādīsu āpodhātu ādīnam viya vīriya ādīnam sa kicce asamattha tā vuttā
translated: “Because of dullness” means because of the inability of energy, etc., to perform their several functions, like the inability of the water element, etc., to burn, etc.

original: Pattaṃ nīharantova taṃ sutvāti ettha pañcābhiññattā dibbasotena assosīti vadanti.
analyzed: pattam nīharantaḥ iva tam sutvā iti ettha pañca abhiññattā dibba sotena assosi iti vadanti
translated: “On hearing it, he took out his bowl” : they say he heard it with the divine ear, because he had the five superknowledges.

original: Pasādasinehābhāvenāti pasādasaṅkhātassa sinehassa abhāvena. Gadrabhapiṭṭhe lūkharajo lūkhataro hutvā dissatīti atilūkhatāya taṃsadise.
analyzed: pasāda sineha abhāvena ati pasāda saṅkhātassa sinehassa abhāvena gadrabha piṭṭhe lūkhara jaḥ lūkhataraḥ hutvā dissati iti ati lūkha tāya taṃsa dise
translated: “Because of the absence of affection born of confidence” : because of the absence of affection called confidence. “Like the dust on a donkey’s back” : like the dust on the back of a donkey, which is more coarse.

original: Saṃvejanapasādanehi tejanaṃ tosanañca sampahaṃsanāti.
analyzed: saṃvejana pasādanehi tejanam tosanam ca sampahaṃsanā ati
translated: “He exhorted and gladdened them with stirring and confidence-inspiring words” : he exhorted and gladdened them with words that stirred them up and inspired confidence.

original: Bojjhaṅgapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bojjhaṅga pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the factors of enlightenment is ended.

original: Samathavipassanāsuddhavipassanāvasena paṭhamassa itaresañca kathitattāti attho. Maggasampayuttā
analyzed: samatha vipassanā suddha vipassanā vasena paṭhamassa itaresañca kathita ttā ti atthaḥ magga sampayuttā
translated: The meaning is that the first and the other are taught by way of serenity and insight, and by way of pure insight, respectively.

original: sati kāyānupassanā nāmāti āgamanavasena vuttaṃ. Evaṃ tāva desanā puggale tiṭṭhatīti
analyzed: sati kāya anupassanā nāma ati āgamana vasena vuttam evam tāva desanā puggale tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “Contemplation of the body” is said by way of the coming in of the body.🔽Thus the teaching is established in the individual.

original: kāyānupassīādīnaṃ āgamanavasena visesetvā vuttā satipaṭṭhānadesanā puggale tiṭṭhatīti
analyzed: kāya anupassī ādīnam āgamana vasena visesetvā vuttā sati paṭṭhāna desanā puggale tiṭṭhati iti
translated: The meaning is that the teaching of the foundations of mindfulness is stated by distinguishing the contemplator of the body, etc., by way of their coming in.

original: attho. Na hi sakkā ekassa anekasamaṅgitā vattuṃ ekakkhaṇe anekasatisambhavāvabodhapasaṅgā,🔽puggalaṃ pana āmasitvā sakiccaparicchinne dhamme vuccamāne kiccabhedena ekissāpi
analyzed: atthaḥ na hi sakkā ekassa aneka samaṅgi tā vattum eka khaṇe aneka sati sambhava avabodha pasaṅgā  puggalam pana āmasitvā sa kicca paricchinne dhamme vuccamāne kicca bhedena ekissa api
translated: For it is not possible to say that one possesses many things at one time, because of the consequence that many kinds of mindfulness would be manifested.🔽But when the teaching is stated by way of the individual, who is the possessor of the functions, then it is shown that even one mindfulness has many names by way of the division of its functions.

original: satiyā anekanāmatā hotīti dassento “kāye panā”tiādimāha. Yathā hi puggalakiccaṃ dhammā🔽evāti dhammabhedena kāyānupassīādipuggalabhedova hoti, na evaṃ dhammassa dhammo kiccanti
analyzed: satiyāḥ aneka nāma tā hoti iti dassentaḥ kāye pana iti ādim āha yathā hi puggala kiccam dhammā  eva ati dhamma bhedena kāya anupassī ādi puggala bhedaḥ va hoti na evam dhammassa dhammo kiccanti
translated: Thus he says, “But in the body” , etc.🔽For just as the individual is the possessor of the functions, so too the teaching is the possessor of the functions.🔽Thus the individual is divided by way of the teaching, just as the teaching is divided by way of the individual.

original: na dhammabhedena tassa bhedo, tasmā ekāva sati catuvipallāsappahānabhūtā magge samiddhā
analyzed: na dhamma bhedena tassa bhedaḥ tasmai sati catu vipallāsa pahāna bhūtā magge samiddhā
translated: But it is not so that the teaching is divided by way of the teaching. Therefore the intention here is this: the one mindfulness, which is the path that abandons the four perversions, is successful in the path of fruition.

original: anatthantarena tappahānakiccabhedena cattāri nāmāni labhatīti ayamettha adhippāyo.
analyzed: anattha antarena tad pahāna kicca bhedena cattāri nāmāni labhati iti ayam ettha adhippāyaḥ
translated: It obtains four names by way of the division of its function in abandoning the four perversions without distinction.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Sutta Mode of Conveying is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Abhidhamma Mode of Conveying

original: 374. Abhidhammabhājanīye “kathañca bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati? Idha bhikkhu
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīye kathañca bhikkhu kāye kāya anupassī viharati idha bhikkhu
translated: In the Abhidhamma Mode of Conveying, the foundations of mindfulness are taught by means of the words “And how does a bhikkhu abide contemplating the body as a body? Here a bhikkhu,

original: yasmiṃ samaye…pe… dandhābhiññaṃ kāye kāyānupassī, yā tasmiṃ samaye satī”tiādinā āgamanavasena🔽visesitāni satipaṭṭhānāni puggale ṭhapetvā desetvā puna “tattha katamaṃ satipaṭṭhānaṃ?
analyzed: dandha abhiññam kāye kāya anupassī yā tasmim samaye satī itiādinā āgamana vasena  visesitāni sati paṭṭhānāni puggale ṭhapetvā desetvā puna tattha katamam sati paṭṭhānam
translated: at whatever time he is developing the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his bodily inertia is abandoned and his energy is aroused.🔽At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his bodily agitation is abandoned and his energy is aroused.

original: Idha bhikkhu yasmiṃ samaye…pe… dandhābhiññaṃ…pe… yā tasmiṃ samaye satī”tiādinā puggalaṃ🔽anāmasitvā āgamavisesanañca akatvā catukiccasādhakekasativasena suddhikasatipaṭṭhānanayo
analyzed: idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye pe dandhābhiññaṃpe yā tasmin samaye sati iti ādinā puggalaṃ  an āmasitvā āgama visesanam ca a katvā catu kicca sādhaka ikasati vasena suddhi kasati paṭṭhāna nayo
translated: At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his depression is abandoned and his energy is aroused.🔽At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his restlessness is abandoned and his energy is aroused.

original: vuttoti ayamettha nayadvaye viseso.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Satipaṭṭhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vuttaḥ ti ayam ettha naya dvaye visesaḥ  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sati paṭṭhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his doubt is abandoned and his energy is aroused.🔽At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his bodily inertia is abandoned and his energy is aroused.🔽At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his bodily agitation is abandoned and his energy is aroused.🔽At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his depression is abandoned and his energy is aroused.

original: 8. Sammappadhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: sammappadhāna vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit … that is his right concentration. At that time his restlessness is abandoned and his energy is aroused.

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: At whatever time a bhikkhu … develops … the supermundane jhana … leading to the uprooting of conceit

original: 390. Kāraṇappadhānāti “anuppannapāpakānuppādādiatthā”ti gahitā tatheva te hontīti🔽taṃ atthaṃ sādhentiyevāti etassa atthassa dīpako sammā-saddoti yathādhippetatthassa🔽anuppannapāpakānuppādādino kāraṇabhūtā, padhānakāraṇabhūtāti attho. Sammāsaddassa🔽upāyayonisoatthadīpakataṃ sandhāya “upāyappadhānā yonisopadhānā”ti vuttaṃ. Paṭipannakoti
analyzed: kāraṇa ppadhānā ati anuppanna pāpaka anuppāda ādi atthā ati gahitā tathā iva te honti iti  tam attham sādhentiyā iva ati etassa atthassa dīpako sammāsaddaḥ ti yathā adhippeta tthassa  kāraṇa bhūtā padhāna kāraṇa bhūtā ti attho sammāsaddassa  upāya yoniso attha dīpaka tam sandhāya upāya ppadhānā yoniso upadhānā ti vuttam paṭipannakaḥ ti
translated: “The cause is the predominance” : the meaning is that the words “the non-arising of unarisen evil, etc.,” are the cause of the meaning “they are just as they are” .🔽The word “right” is the light for that meaning,🔽the meaning of the words “the non-arising of unarisen evil, etc.,” is the cause, the predominant cause, of the meaning “they are just as they are” .🔽The words “the means is the predominance” and “the method is the predominance” are said with reference to the light for the meaning of “the means” and “the method” in the word “right” .🔽“The one who has entered upon” :

original: bhāvanamanuyutto. Bhusaṃ yogo payogo, payogova parakkamo payogaparakkamo. Etānīti🔽“vāyamatī”tiādīni “āsevamāno vāyamatī”tiādinā yojetabbāni.🔽Anuppannāti avattabbataṃ āpannānanti bhūmiladdhārammaṇādhiggahitāvikkhambhitāsamugghātituppannānaṃ.🔽391. Dhammacchandoti taṇhādiṭṭhivīriyacchandā viya na añño dhammo, atha kho chandaniyasabhāvo
analyzed: bhāvanam anuyuttaḥ bhusam yogaḥ payogaḥ payogaḥ uva parakkamaḥ payoga parakkamaḥ etāni iti 🔽vāyamati itiādīni āsevamānaḥ vāyamati iti ādinā yojetabbāni 🔽anuppannā ati avattabba tam āpannānam ti bhūmi laddha ārammaṇa adhiggahita a vikkhambhi tā a samugghāti tuppannānam 🔽dhamma chando ti taṇhā diṭṭhi vīriya chandāḥ viya na aññaḥ dhammaḥ atha kho chanda niya sabhāvaḥ
translated: “The cause is the predominance” : the meaning is that the cause is the predominance. The word “right” is a light for the meaning intended, namely, that the cause is the predominance. The meaning is that they are the principal cause. The words “the predominance of means” and “the predominance of right method” are said with reference to the light thrown by the word “right” on the meaning of “means” and “right method.” “One who is practicing” is one who is devoted to development. “Effort” is exertion. “Exertion in effort” is the exertion of exertion. “These” : “He strives” and so on should be construed with “he cultivates, develops, makes much of” and so on. “Not yet arisen” : they have not yet come into being. “The cause is the predominance” : the meaning is that the cause is the predominance. The word “right” is a light for the meaning intended, namely, that the cause is the predominance. The meaning is that they are the principal cause. The words “the predominance of means” and “the predominance of right method” are said with reference to the light thrown by the word “right” on the meaning of “means” and “right method.” “One who is practicing” is one who is devoted to development. “Effort” is exertion. “Exertion in effort” is the exertion of exertion. “These” : “He strives” and so on should be construed with “he cultivates, develops, makes much of” and so on. “Not yet arisen” : they have not yet come into being. “The cause is the predominance” : the meaning is that the cause is the predominance. The word “right” is a light for the meaning intended, namely, that the cause is the predominance. The meaning is that they are the principal cause. The words “the predominance of means” and “the predominance of right method” are said with reference to the light thrown by the word “right” on the meaning of “means” and “right method.” “One who is practicing” is one who is devoted to development. “Effort” is exertion. “Exertion in effort” is the exertion of exertion. “These” : “He strives” and so on should be construed with “he cultivates, develops, makes much of” and so on. “Not yet arisen” : they have not yet come into being. “The cause is the predominance” :

original: evāti dassento āha “sabhāvacchando”ti. Tattha “yo kāmesu kāmacchando”tiādīsu taṇhā
analyzed: eva ati dassentaḥ āha sabhāva chando ti tattha yaḥ kāmesu kāmacchandaḥ iti ādīsu taṇhā
translated: He said “will-to-be-in-becoming” in order to show that. Herein, it should be understood that in the passage beginning “Will-to-sensual-desires in the case of sensual desires” , “will” is craving.

original: chandoti vuttāti veditabbo, “sabbeva nu kho, mārisa, samaṇabrāhmaṇā ekantavādā ekantasīlā🔽ekantachandā ekantaajjhosānā”ti ettha diṭṭhi, pamādaniddese “nikkhittachandatā nikkhittadhuratā”ti vīriyanti vaṇṇeti.
analyzed: chandaḥ iti vuttā ati veditabbo sabbe iva nu kho mārisa samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ ekanta vādāḥ ekanta sīlāḥ  ekanta chandā ekanta ajjhosānā ti ettha diṭṭhi pamāda niddese nikkhitta chanda tā nikkhitta dhura tā ati vīriyanti vaṇṇā iti
translated: In the passage “Are all ascetics and Brahmins of one doctrine, one discipline, one inclination, one aspiration? ” , it is view.🔽In the passage “Negligence is the will to put away, the will to put forward” , it is energy.

original: 394. Vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhatīti padadvayassapi niddeso vīriyaniddesoyevāti adhippāyenāha “vīriyaniddese”ti.
analyzed: vāyamati vīriyam ārabhati iti pada dvayassa api niddesaḥ vīriya niddesaḥ yā iva ati adhippāyena āha vīriya niddesa iti
translated: The intention is this: the two terms “he strives” and “he exerts energy” are both a demonstration of energy, so he said “in the demonstration of energy” .

original: 406. Sabbapubbabhāgeti sabbamaggānaṃ pubbabhāge. Purimasminti “anuppannā me kusalā🔽dhammā anuppajjamānā anatthāya saṃvatteyyu”nti etthāpi “samathavipassanāva gahetabbā”ti🔽vuttaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ, taṃ pana maggānuppannatāya bhāvato anuppajjamāne ca tasmiṃ
analyzed: sabba pubbabhāge ti sabba maggānam pubbabhāge purimasmin ti anuppannā me kusalā  dhammāḥ an uppajjamānāḥ anatthāya saṃvatteyyun ti ettha api samatha vipassanā ava gahetabbā ati  vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam tam pana magga anuppannatāya bhāvataḥ anuppajjamāne ca tasmin
translated: In the earlier stage of all paths: in the earlier stage of all paths.🔽In the earlier: here too it is said in the commentary that only serenity and insight should be taken.

original: vaṭṭānatthasaṃvattanato na yuttanti paṭikkhipati.
analyzed: vaṭṭāna attha saṃvattanataḥ na yuttam ti paṭikkhipati
translated: But that is rejected because they are not actually non-arisen in the path, and because it is not proper to say that they are non-arisen when they are in fact arisen and that they are for the purpose of what is not the round of rebirths.

original: Mahantaṃ gāravaṃ hoti, tasmā “saṅghagāravena yathāruci vindituṃ na sakkā”ti saṅghena🔽saha na nikkhami. Atimandāni noti nanu atimandānīti attho. Santasamāpattito aññaṃ
analyzed: mahantam gāravam hoti tasmai saṅgha gāravena yathāruci vinditum na sakkā ati saṅghena  saha na nikkhami ati mandāni no ti nanu ati mandāni iti attho santa samāpattitaḥ aññam
translated: That is why he did not go forth with the Community.🔽Are not too slow: the meaning is, are not too slow.🔽There is no stronger support than the attainment of serenity.

original: santhambhanakāraṇaṃ balavaṃ natthīti “tato parihīnā santhambhituṃ na sakkontī”ti
analyzed: santhambhana kāraṇam balavam natthi iti tatas parihīnā santhambhitum na sakkonti iti
