translated: That is why he said, “She cannot support herself any more than that, for there is no other support beyond that.”

original: āha. Na hi mahārajjumhi chinne suttatantū sandhāretuṃ sakkontīti. Samathe vatthuṃ
analyzed: āha na hi mahā rajjumhi chinne sutta tantū sandhāretum sakkonti iti samathe vatthum
translated: For when the great rope is broken the thread cannot support it.

original: dassetvā tena samānagatikā vipassanā cāti iminā adhippāyenāha “evaṃ uppannā samathavipassanā…pe… saṃvattantī”ti.
analyzed: dassetvā tena samāna gatikā vipassanā ca ati iminā adhippāyena āha evam uppannā samatha vipassanā pe saṃvattanti iti
translated: Having shown the basis for serenity, he said, “When serenity and insight have arisen in this way … they lead to” in order to show that insight has the same destiny as serenity.

original: Tattha anuppannānanti ettha tattha duvidhāya sammappadhānakathāya, tattha vā pāḷiyaṃ “anuppannāna”nti etassa ayaṃ vinicchayoti adhippāyo. Eteyevāti anamatagge saṃsāre uppannāyeva.
analyzed: tattha anuppannānam ti ettha tattha duvidhāya sammappadhāna kathāya tattha vā pāḷiyam anuppannānam ti etassa ayam vinicchayaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ ete iyeva āti anamatagge saṃsāre uppannāya iva
translated: Herein, as regards the words “not arisen” in the phrase “when the path has not arisen” , the intention is that this is the exposition of the words “not arisen” in the text.🔽These are the only ones: they have arisen in the course of the beginningless round of rebirths.

original: Cuddasa mahāvattāni khandhake vuttāni āgantukaāvāsikagamikaanumodana bhattagga piṇḍacārika
analyzed: cuddasa mahāvattāni khandhake vuttāni āgantuka āvāsika gamika anumodana bhattagga piṇḍacārika
translated: Fourteen great observances are mentioned in the Khandhakas: for newly arrived monks, for resident monks, for the chief seat, for those who are giving thanks, for those who are eating in the refectory, for alms-collectors,

original: āraññika senāsana jantāgharavaccakuṭi ācariyaupajjhāyasaddhivihārikaantevāsikavattāni
analyzed: āraññika senāsana jantā ghara vacca kuṭi ācariya aupajjhāya saddhivihārika antevāsika vattāni
translated: for those who live in the forest, for those who use a sitting mat, for those who use a sauna, for those who use a stilt house, for teachers, for preceptors, for co-resident pupils, and for novice co-residents.

original: cuddasa. Tato aññāni pana kadāci tajjanīyakammakatādikāle pārivāsikādikāle ca caritabbāni
analyzed: tatas aññāni pana kadāci tajjanīya kammaka tā ādi kāle pārivāsika ādi kāle ca caritabbāni
translated: But there are other minor observances that should be observed on certain occasions, such as when a monk is undergoing a penalty, or when he is on probation.

original: dvāsīti khuddakavattānīti kathitāni daṭṭhabbāni. Na hi tāni sabbāsu avatthāsu caritabbāni,
analyzed: khuddaka vattāni iti kathitāni daṭṭhabbāni na hi tāni sabbāsu avatthāsu caritabbāni
translated: These are said to be eighty-two. They should be looked up in the Khandhaka. For they are not to be observed on all occasions,🔽and so they are not counted among the great observances.

original: tasmā mahāvatte agaṇitāni. Tattha “pārivāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññāpessāmī”ti
analyzed: tasmā mahāvatte agaṇitāni tattha pārivāsikānam bhikkhūnam vattam paññāpessāmi iti
translated: There, beginning with “I will announce the observance for monks on probation,”

original: ārabhitvā “na upasampādetabbaṃ…pe… na chamāyaṃ caṅkamante caṅkame caṅkamitabba”nti
analyzed: ārabhitvā na upasampādetabbam pe na chamāyam caṅkamante caṅkame caṅkamitabbanti
translated: and ending with “You should not walk up and down on the walk in front of the monastery,”

original: vuttāni pakatatte caritabbavattāvasānāni chasaṭṭhi, tato paraṃ “na, bhikkhave, pārivāsikena
analyzed: vuttāni pakatatte caritabba vatta avasānāni cha saṭṭhi tatas param na bhikkhave pārivāsikena
translated: sixty-six are mentioned for those on probation. After that, “Monks on probation,

original: bhikkhunā pārivāsikavuḍḍhatarena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ, mūlāyapaṭikassanārahena, mānattārahena,
analyzed: bhikkhunā pārivāsika vuḍḍhatarena bhikkhunā saddhim mūlāya paṭikassana arahena mānatta arahena
translated: with a more senior probationer, with one deserving resolution for past offenses, with one deserving the trial period,

original: mānattacārikena, abbhānārahena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vatthabba”ntiādīni
analyzed: mānatta cārikena abbhāna arahena bhikkhunā saddhim ekacchanne āvāse vatthabba nti ādīni
translated: with one undertaking the trial period, with one deserving rehabilitation. ”

original: pakatatte caritabbehi anaññattā visuṃ visuṃ agaṇetvā pārivāsikavuḍḍhatarādīsu puggalantaresu
analyzed: pakatatte caritabbehi an aññattā visum visum a gaṇetvā pārivāsika vuḍḍhatara ādīsu puggalantaresu
translated: Because they are not different from the duties that should be done by one who is regular, they are not counted separately. They are to be counted as five by combining them under the headings of probationer, more senior, etc.,

original: caritabbattā tesaṃ vasena sampiṇḍetvā ekekaṃ katvā gaṇetabbāni pañcāti ekasattati🔽vattāni, ukkhepanīyakammakatavattesu vattapaññāpanavasena vuttaṃ “na pakatattassa
analyzed: caritabba ttā tesam vasena sampiṇḍetvā ekekam katvā gaṇetabbāni pañca ati ekasattati  vattāni ukkhepanīya kamma kata vattesu vatta paññāpana vasena vuttam na pakatattassa
translated: and making them one. Thus there are seventy-one duties.

original: bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ…pe… nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṃ sāditabba”nti idaṃ🔽abhivādanādīnaṃ assādiyanaṃ ekaṃ, “na pakatatto bhikkhu sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsetabbo”tiādīni
analyzed: bhikkhuno abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam pe nahāne piṭṭhi parikammam sāditabbanti idam  abhivādana ādīnam assādiyanam ekam na pakatattaḥ bhikkhu sīla vipattiyā an uddhaṃsetabbā iti ādīni
translated: In the case of the duties in the case of one who is suspended, it is said: “He should not consent to the regular monk bowing down to him, rising up for him, saluting with joined palms to him, doing acts of respect toward him, offering him a seat, offering him a bed, offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool, offering him a foot scraper, receiving his bowl and robe, and massaging his back when he is bathing.”🔽This is one duty, namely, not consenting to the regular monk’s bowing down, etc.

original: ca dasāti evaṃ dvāsīti honti. Etesveva kānici tajjanīyakammakatādivattāni, kānici
analyzed: ca dasāti evam dvāsīti honti etesu eva kānici tajjanīya kammaka tā ādi vattāni kānici
translated: “He should not accuse the regular monk of failure in morality,” etc., are ten duties. Thus there are eighty-two. Some of these duties are those of one who is subject to the legal procedure of demotion, etc., and some are those of one who is regular.

original: pārivāsikādivattānīti aggahitaggahaṇena dvāsītivattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: pārivāsika ādi vattāni iti aggahita ggahaṇena dvāsīti vattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: and the rest are as in the case of the one who is on probation, etc.,” it should be understood that “the rest” are the two hundred and twenty-four kinds of consciousness.

original: Idha vipākānubhavanavasena tadārammaṇaṃ, avipakkavipākassa sabbathā avigatattā bhavitvā
analyzed: idha vipāka anubhavana vasena tad ārammaṇam avipakka vipākassa sabbathā avigata ttā bhavitvā
translated: Herein, the object is “experienced” in the sense of result, because the result of kamma that has not yet matured is never absent.🔽And kamma is said to be “arisen and ceased after being experienced” in the sense of its having been arisen and ceased after having been present in the past.

original: vigatamattavasena kammañca “bhutvā vigatuppanna”nti vuttaṃ, na aṭṭhasāliniyaṃ viya
analyzed: vigata matta vasena kammañca bhutvā vigata uppannanti vuttam na aṭṭhasāliniyam viya
translated: It is not said to be “arisen and ceased after being experienced” in the way that a javana process is said to be “experienced and then ceased” in the Aṭṭhasālinī,

original: rajjanādivasena anubhutvāpagataṃ javanaṃ, uppajjitvā niruddhatāvasena bhūtāpagatasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: rajjana ādi vasena javanam uppajjitvā niruddha tā vasena bhūta apagata saṅkhātam
translated: after having been experienced in the way of being born and dying, etc.🔽And the rest of the formed is said to be “arisen and ceased after having been present” in the sense of its having been arisen and ceased after having been present.

original: sesasaṅkhatañca “bhūtāpagatuppanna”nti, tasmā idha okāsakatuppannaṃ vipākameva vadati,
analyzed: sesa saṅkhatam ca bhūta apagata uppannam ti tasmai idha okāsa kata uppannam vipākam eva vadati
translated: So here the word “present” refers only to the result that is present,

original: na tattha viya kammampīti. Anusayitakilesāti appahīnā maggena pahātabbā adhippetā.
analyzed: na tattha viya kammam pi iti anusayita kilesā ati appahīnā maggena pahātabbā adhippetā
translated: and not to kamma as well, as in the Aṭṭhasālinī. “Underlying tendencies” are defilements that have not been abandoned and are to be abandoned by the path.

original: Tenāha “atītā vā…pe… na vattabbā”ti. Tesañhi ambataruṇopamāya vattamānāditā na vattabbāti.
analyzed: tena āha atītā vāpe na vattabbā iti tesam hi amba taruṇa upamāya vattamāna āditā na vattabbā ati
translated: Hence he says, “Past … not to be stated,” for their being present, etc., cannot be stated by the simile of the mango fruit.

original: Āhatakhīrarukkho viya nimittaggāhavasena adhigataṃ ārammaṇaṃ, anāhatakhīrarukkho
analyzed: āhata khīra rukkhaḥ viya nimitta ggāha vasena adhigatam ārammaṇam anāhata khīra rukkhaḥ
translated: The object that has been apprehended by the act of apprehending the sign is like a tapped rubber tree.

original: viya avikkhambhitatāya antogadhakilesaṃ ārammaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, nimittaggāhakāvikkhambhitakilesā
analyzed: viya a vikkhambhita tāya antogadha kilesam ārammaṇam daṭṭhabbam nimitta ggāhaka a vikkhambhita kilesā
translated: and the defilements that are not suppressed should be regarded as the fruit of the tree that is not cut down.

original: vā puggalā āhatānāhatakhīrarukkhasadisā. Purimanayenevāti avikkhambhituppanne viya🔽“imasmiṃ nāma ṭhāne nuppajjissantīti na vattabbā asamugghāṭitattā”ti yojetvā vitthāretabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā puggalāḥ āhata anāhata khīra rukkha sadisāḥ purima nayena iva ati a vikkhambhita uppanne viya  imasmin nāma ṭhāne nuppajjissanti iti na vattabbāḥ a samugghāṭita ttā ati yojetvā vitthāretabbam
translated: Or else, the persons whose defilements are suppressed by the apprehending of the sign are like the fruit of the tree that is cut down, and those whose defilements are not suppressed are like the fruit of the tree that is not cut down.

original: Pāḷiyanti paṭisambhidāpāḷiyaṃ. Maggena pahīnakilesānameva tidhā navattabbataṃ apākaṭaṃ🔽pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ ajātaphalarukkho ābhato, atītādīnaṃ appahīnatādassanatthampi “jātaphalarukkhena
analyzed: pāḷiyanti paṭisambhidā pāḷiyam maggena pahīna kilesānam eva tidhā nava ttabba tam apākaṭam  pākaṭam kātum ajāta phala rukkhaḥ ābhataḥ atīta ādīnam appahīna tā dassana attham pi jāta phala rukkhena
translated: “In the first way” should be construed as follows: “Just as the fruit that is not cut down is not to be spoken of as ‘It will not arise in such and such a place,’ because it is not uprooted, so too the defilements that are not suppressed are not to be spoken of as ‘They will not arise in such and such a place,’ because they are not uprooted.”🔽“In the texts” means in the Paṭisambhidā texts.🔽The fact that the defilements abandoned by the path are not to be spoken of in the three ways is not obvious,🔽so he gives the example of the tree with fruit, saying that it should be illustrated by the tree with fruit.

original: dīpetabba”nti āha. Tattha yathā acchinne rukkhe nibbattirahāni phalāni chinne anuppajjamānāni
analyzed: dīpetabbam ti āha tattha yathā acchinne rukkhe nibbatti rahāni phalāni chinne anuppajjamānāni
translated: Herein, just as the fruit that has not fallen from the tree when it is cut down does not arise again when it is cut down,

original: na kadāci sasabhāvāni ahesuṃ honti bhavissanti cāti atītādibhāvena na vattabbāni,
analyzed: na kadāci sa sabhāvāni ahesum honti bhavissanti ca ati atīta ādi bhāvena na vattabbāni
translated: and so it is not to be spoken of as past, etc., because it has never had or will have such a nature,

original: evaṃ maggena pahīnakilesā ca daṭṭhabbā. Yathā ca chede asati phalāni uppajjissanti,
analyzed: evam maggena pahīna kilesā ca daṭṭhabbā yathā ca chede asati phalāni uppajjissanti
translated: and the defilements to be abandoned by the path should be regarded as the fruit.

original: sati ca nuppajjissantīti chedassa sātthakatā, evaṃ maggabhāvanāya ca sātthakatā yojetabbā.
analyzed: sati ca nuppajjissanti iti chedassa sa atthaka tā evam magga bhāvanāya ca sa atthaka tā yojetabbā
translated: And just as the usefulness of the cutting should be illustrated as follows: “If there were no cutting, the fruits would arise, but if there is cutting they do not arise,” so the usefulness of the development of the path should be illustrated in this way.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā🔽427. Pañhapucchake yaṃ vuttaṃ “vīriyajeṭṭhikāya pana aññassa vīriyassa abhāvā na🔽vattabbāni maggādhipatīnīti vā na maggādhipatīnīti vā”ti, ettha “maggādhipatīnī”ti
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā        pañha pucchake yam vuttam vīriya jeṭṭhikāya pana aññassa vīriyassa abhāvā na  vattabbāni magga adhipatīni iti vā na magga adhipatīni iti vā ati ettha magga adhipatīni iti
translated: The commentary on the “Basket of Conduct” is ended.🔽In the “Questions” it is said: “But because there is no other energy, it cannot be said of the predominances in the path that they are predominances in energy or that they are not predominances in energy” . Here the reason why it cannot be said of them that they are predominances in energy is that there is no other energy, which should be understood to be because they are not predominances in energy.

original: na vattabbatāya eva aññassa vīriyassa abhāvo kāraṇanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Chandassa pana🔽cittassa vā namaggabhūtassa adhipatino tadā abhāvā “na maggādhipatīnī”ti na vattabbānīti
analyzed: na vattabba tāya eva aññassa vīriyassa abhāvaḥ kāraṇan ti daṭṭhabbam chandassa pana  cittassa vā na magga bhūtassa adhipatino tadā abhāvā na magga adhipatīni iti na vattabbāni iti
translated: But because there is no energy that is a path, which is the predominance of zeal or of consciousness, it cannot be said of them that they are predominances in a path.🔽This is what is meant.

original: vuttaṃ. Chandacittānaṃ viya namaggabhūtassa aññassa vīriyādhipatino abhāvāti vā adhippāyo.
analyzed: vuttam chanda cittānam viya na magga bhūtassa aññassa vīriya adhipatino abhāvā ti vā adhippāyo
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning can be regarded as follows: because there is no other energy that is a path and is a predominance of zeal or of consciousness, it cannot be said of them that they are predominances in a path.

original: Sammappadhānānaṃ tadā maggasaṅkhātaadhipatibhāvato vā “na maggādhipatīnī”ti navattabbatā vuttāti veditabbā.
analyzed: sammappadhānānam tadā magga saṅkhāta adhipati bhāvataḥ vā na magga adhipatīni iti navattabba tā vuttā iti veditabbā
translated: and because they are not the dominant influence in the path, which is called the right endeavour, they are said to be not in the path, not dominant.

original: Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Sammappadhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sammappadhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the questions is ended.🔽The exposition of the right endeavours is ended.

original: 9. Iddhipādavibhaṅgo
analyzed: iddhi pāda vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Exposition of the Bases of Psychic Power

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The Suttas as a Basket

original: 431. Iddhi-saddassa paṭhamo kattuattho, dutiyo karaṇattho vutto, pāda-saddassa eko
analyzed: iddhi saddassa paṭhamaḥ kattu atthaḥ dutiyaḥ karaṇa atthaḥ vuttaḥ pāda saddassa ekaḥ
translated: The word iddhi is said to have two meanings: the first is the meaning of agent, and the second is the meaning of instrument. The word pada is said to have one meaning,

original: karaṇamevattho vutto. Pajjitabbāva iddhi vuttā, na ca ijjhantī pajjitabbā ca iddhi🔽pajjanakaraṇena pādena samānādhikaraṇā hotīti “paṭhamenatthena iddhi eva pādo iddhipādo”ti
analyzed: vuttaḥ pajjitabbā ava iddhi vuttā na ca ijjhantī pajjitabbā ca iddhi  pajjana karaṇena pādena samāna adhikaraṇā hoti iti paṭhamena atthena iddhi eva pādo iddhi pādo ti
translated: namely, instrument. Psychic power is said to be what should be caused to occur, and it is not what should be caused to occur that is successful.

original: na sakkā vattuṃ, tathā iddhikiriyākaraṇena sādhetabbā ca vuddhisaṅkhātā iddhi pajjanakiriyākaraṇena
analyzed: na sakkā vattum tathā iddhi kiriyā karaṇena sādhetabbā ca vuddhi saṅkhātā iddhi pajjana kiriyā karaṇena
translated: Psychic power, which is called understanding, and which should be accomplished by the performance of the act of psychic power, is what should be caused to occur by the performance of the act of causing to occur. Therefore it is not possible to say that “ psychic power itself is a base because of the first meaning,”🔽and that “ psychic power is a base because of the second meaning,”

original: pajjitabbāti dvinnaṃ karaṇānaṃ na asamānādhikaraṇatā sambhavatīti “dutiyenatthena
analyzed: pajjitabbā ati dvinnam karaṇānam na asamāna adhikaraṇa tā sambhavati iti dutiyena atthena
translated: since the two acts are not of the same reference.

original: iddhiyā pādo iddhipādo”ti ca na sakkā vattuṃ, tasmā paṭhamenatthena iddhiyā pādo
analyzed: iddhiyā pādo iddhi pādo ti ca na sakkā vattum tasmā paṭhamena atthena iddhiyā pādo
translated: and it cannot be said that it is a foot of success by success,🔽

original: iddhipādo, dutiyenatthena iddhi eva pādo iddhipādoti evaṃ yojanā yujjati.
analyzed: iddhipādaḥ dutiyena atthena eva pādo iddhipādo ti evam yojanā yujjati
translated: and it cannot be said that the footing for success is success by means of success. So the construing should be done in this way: the footing for success is success by means of the first meaning, and success is the footing by means of the second meaning.

original: “Chandaṃ ce…pe… ayaṃ vuccati chandasamādhī”ti imāya pāḷiyā chandādhipati samādhi
analyzed: chandam cepe ayam vuccati chanda samādhi iti imāya pāḷiyā chanda adhipati samādhi
translated: “If, with a desire, he enters upon and abides in a certain attainment, this is called concentration due to desire” .

original: chandasamādhīti adhipati-saddalopaṃ katvā samāso vuttoti viññāyati, adhipati-saddatthadassanavasena
analyzed: chanda samādhi iti adhipati sadda lopam katvā samāsaḥ vuttaḥ ti viññāyati adhipati sadda ttha dassana vasena
translated: It is evident that the compound chandasamādhi is formed by dropping the word adhipati and making a compound of chanda and samādhi.

original: pana “chandahetuko chandādhiko vā samādhi chandasamādhī”ti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttanti
analyzed: pana chanda hetuko chanda adhikaḥ vā samādhi chanda samādhi iti aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttanti
translated: But it should be understood that the commentary says “Concentration due to desire is concentration due to desire as cause or concentration due to desire as condition” .🔽Some say that the word padhāna is a synonym for energy.🔽For the word padhāna is used in the sense of the prevention of other things,

original: veditabbaṃ. Padhānabhūtāti vīriyabhūtāti keci vadanti. Saṅkhatasaṅkhārādinivattanatthañhi
analyzed: veditabbam padhāna bhūtā ati vīriya bhūtā ati keci vadanti saṅkhata saṅkhāra ādi nivattana attham hi
translated: in the sense of the making of a particular effort.

original: padhānaggahaṇanti. Atha vā taṃ taṃ visesaṃ saṅkharotīti saṅkhāro, sabbaṃ vīriyaṃ.
analyzed: padhāna ggahaṇanti atha vā tam tam visesam saṅkharoti iti saṅkhāro sabbam vīriyam
translated: Or alternatively, it is a synonym for all energy, since it is said “He makes an effort, strives, strains, exerts his energy, lays hold of his mind, and makes it straight” .

original: Tattha catukiccasādhakato aññassa nivattanatthaṃ padhānaggahaṇanti padhānabhūtā seṭṭhabhūtāti
analyzed: tattha catu kicca sādhakataḥ aññassa nivattana attham padhāna ggahaṇam ti padhāna bhūtā seṭṭha bhūtā ati
translated: Herein, the word padhāna is used in the sense of the prevention of other things, in the sense of the best, since it is the best of all things that make for the achievement of the four kinds of noble fruit.

original: attho. Catubbidhassa pana vīriyassa adhippetattā bahuvacananiddeso kato. Adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhenāti
analyzed: attho catubbidhassa pana vīriyassa adhippeta ttā bahuvacana niddeso kataḥ adhiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena ati
translated: and the plural is used because it is the fourfold energy that is intended. As to the meaning of “foundation”:

original: duvidhatthāyapi iddhiyā adhiṭṭhānatthena. Pādabhūtanti iminā visuṃ samāsayojanāvasena
analyzed: iddhiyā adhiṭṭhāna tthena iminā visum samāsa yojanā vasena
translated: it is in the sense of foundation for the two kinds of success.🔽As to the meaning of “foot”:

original: pana yo pubbe iddhipādattho pāda-saddassa upāyatthataṃ gahetvā yathāyutto vutto,🔽so vakkhamānānaṃ paṭilābhapubbabhāgānaṃ kattukaraṇiddhibhāvaṃ, uttaracūḷabhājanīye🔽vā vuttehi chandādīhi iddhipādehi sādhetabbāya iddhiyā kattiddhibhāvaṃ, chandādīnañca
analyzed: pana yaḥ pubbe iddhipāda atthaḥ pāda saddassa upāya ttha tam gahetvā yathā yuttaḥ vuttaḥ  saḥ vakkhamānānam paṭilābha pubbabhāgānam kattu karaṇa iddhi bhāvam uttaracūḷa bhājanīye  vā vuttehi chanda ādīhi iddhipādehi sādhetabbāya iddhiyā kattiddhi bhāvam chanda ādīnam ca
translated: but the word “foot” is taken in the sense of means, and it is used in the way appropriate to that sense.

original: karaṇiddhibhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttoti veditabbo.🔽Vīriyiddhipādaniddese “vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgata”nti dvikkhattuṃ vīriyaṃ
analyzed: karaṇiddhi bhāvam sandhāya vuttaḥ iti veditabbaḥ  vīriya iddhipāda niddese vīriya samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatanti dvikkhattum vīriyam
translated: It should be understood that this is said with reference to the fact that the four bases for success are the means to the success that is the doing and the making of the kinds of success mentioned below, and with reference to the fact that the four bases for success consisting of zeal, etc., are the means to the success that is the doing of the success that is accomplished by means of the zeal, etc., mentioned in the Uttaracuda Sutta .🔽In the description of the basis for success that is energy, the word “energy” occurs twice as “endowed with the faculty of energy” and as “endowed with the strength of energy.”

original: āgataṃ. Tattha purimaṃ samādhivisesanaṃ “vīriyādhipati samādhi vīriyasamādhī”ti,
analyzed: āgatam tattha purimam samādhi visesanam vīriya adhipati samādhi vīriya samādhi iti
translated: Herein, the first “energy” is a distinction of concentration, for “energy predominance concentration” is “energy concentration.”

original: dutiyaṃ samannāgamaṅgadassanaṃ. Dveyeva hi sabbattha samannāgamaṅgāni samādhi padhānasaṅkhāro
analyzed: dutiyam samannāgam aṅga dassanam dveyā iva hi sabbattha samannāgam aṅgāni samādhi padhāna saṅkhāro
translated: For there are only two constituents of success everywhere, namely concentration and the mental formations consisting in the right exertions.

original: ca, chandādayo samādhivisesanāni, padhānasaṅkhāro pana padhānavacaneneva visesito,
analyzed: ca chanda ādayaḥ samādhi visesanāni padhāna saṅkhāraḥ pana padhāna vacanena iva visesitaḥ
translated: But the mental formations consisting in the right exertions are distinguished by the word “exertion” itself,

original: na chandādīhīti na idha vīriyādhipatitā padhānasaṅkhārassa vuttā hoti. Vīriyañca
analyzed: na chanda ādīhi iti na idha vīriya adhipati tā padhāna saṅkhārassa vuttā hoti vīriyam ca
translated: not by zeal, etc., so that in this context the mental formations consisting in the right exertions are not said to be governed by energy.

original: samādhiṃ visesetvā ṭhitameva samannāgamaṅgavasena padhānasaṅkhāravacanena vuttanti
analyzed: samādhim visesetvā ṭhitam eva samannāgam aṅga vasena padhāna saṅkhāra vacanena vuttanti
translated: And since energy is established as distinguishing concentration, it is said to be the mental formations consisting in the right exertions by the words “constituent of success” as a constituent of success.🔽So it is not said that success is the possession of two energies.

original: nāpi dvīhi vīriyehi samannāgamo vutto hotīti. Yasmā pana chandādīhi visiṭṭho samādhi,
analyzed: na api dvīhi vīriyehi samannāgamaḥ vuttaḥ hoti iti yasmā pana chanda ādīhi visiṭṭhaḥ samādhi
translated: But since concentration is distinguished by zeal, etc.,

original: tathā visiṭṭheneva ca tena sampayutto padhānasaṅkhāro sesadhammā ca, tasmā samādhivisesanānaṃ
analyzed: tathā visiṭṭhena iva ca tena sampayuttaḥ padhāna saṅkhāro sesa dhammā ca tasmā samādhi visesa nānam
translated: and the mental formations consisting in the right exertions are associated with it as distinguished in the same way, and the remaining states are associated with it,🔽the four bases for success are stated as the distinction of concentration.

original: vasena cattāro iddhipādā vuttā. Visesanabhāvo ca chandādīnaṃ taṃtaṃavassayanavasena
analyzed: vasena cattāro iddhipādāḥ vuttāḥ visesana bhāvaḥ ca chanda ādīnam
translated: And the distinction of zeal, etc., is in the sense of their respectively predominating.

original: hotīti “chandasamādhi…pe… iddhipāda”nti ettha nissayatthepi pāda-sadde upāyatthena
analyzed: hoti iti ettha nissaya tthe pi pāda sadde upāya tthena
translated: So in the passage, “The basis for success that is concentration due to zeal” , the word “basis” is used in the sense of foundation in the sense of cause.

original: chandādīnaṃ iddhipādatā vuttā hoti. Teneva uttaracūḷabhājanīye “cattāro iddhipādā
analyzed: chanda ādīnam iddhipāda tā vuttā hoti tena iva uttaracūḷabhājanīye cattāro iddhipādā
translated: in the Uttaracudāpakaraṇa: “The four bases for spiritual success are🔽will-power, thought-power, investigation-power, and transformation-power” .

original: chandiddhipādo”tiādinā chandādīnameva iddhipādatā vuttā. Pañhapucchake ca “cattāro🔽iddhipādā idha bhikkhu chandasamādhī”tiādināva uddesaṃ katvāpi puna chandādīnaṃyeva
analyzed: chanda iddhipāda iti ādinā chanda ādīnam eva iddhipāda tā vuttā pañha pucchake ca cattāro  iddhipādāḥ idha uddesam katvā api puna
translated: And in the Pañhapucchaka: “The four bases for spiritual success are🔽will-power, thought-power, investigation-power, and transformation-power” .🔽And in the Vibhaṅga the profitable, etc., state of will-power, etc., is🔽analysed, after they have been stated in the same way as in the Pañhapucchaka.

original: kusalādibhāvo vibhattoti. Upāyiddhipādadassanatthameva hi nissayiddhipādadassanaṃ
analyzed: kusala ādi bhāvaḥ vibhattaḥ ti upāya iddhipāda dassana attham eva hi nissaya iddhipāda dassanam
translated: The showing of the bases for spiritual success as a means is done for the🔽purpose of showing them as a footing. Otherwise there would not be a fourfold

original: kataṃ, aññathā catubbidhatā na hotīti ayamettha pāḷivasena atthavinicchayo veditabbo.
analyzed: katam aññathā catubbidha tā na hoti iti ayam ettha pāḷi vasena attha vinicchayo veditabbo
translated: state. This is how the exposition should be understood here as to the text.🔽In front of the chariot: in front of the chariot.

original: 433. Rathadhureti rathassa purato. Hīnajātiko caṇḍālo upaṭṭhānādiguṇayogepi senāpatiṭṭhānādīni
analyzed: ratha dhurā iti rathassa puratas hīna jātikaḥ caṇḍālaḥ upaṭṭhāna ādi guṇa yoge pi senāpati ṭṭhāna ādīni
translated: The low-caste man, though he has the qualities of service, etc., does not get🔽the rank of general, etc. That is why it is said: “Having purified his birth …🔽he does not make birth his guide” .

original: na labhatīti āha “jātiṃ sodhetvā…pe… jātiṃ avassayatī”ti. Amantanīyoti hitāhitamantane na araho.
analyzed: na labhati iti āha jātim sodhetvā ape jātim avassayati iti a mantanīyaḥ uti hita ahita mantane na araho
translated: Not fit to be consulted: not fit to be consulted about what is good and bad.🔽The Elder Ratthapala, because of the existence of will-power, did not

original: Raṭṭhapālatthero chande sati kathaṃ nānujānissantīti sattapi bhattāni abhuñjitvā
analyzed: raṭṭhapāla thero chande sati katham na anujānissanti iti bhattāni a bhuñjitvā
translated: allow that he should not eat seven meals a day.

original: mātāpitaro anujānāpetvā pabbajitvā chandameva avassāya lokuttaradhammaṃ nibbattesīti
analyzed: mātā pitaraḥ anujānāpetvā pabbajitvā chandam eva avassāya lokuttara dhammam nibbattesi iti
translated: and after he had gone forth with his parents’ permission, he produced the supramundane state by means of zeal alone.

original: āha “raṭṭhapālatthero viyā”ti.
analyzed: āha raṭṭhapāla ttheraḥ viyā ti
translated: So it was said: “Like the Elder Ratthapala.”

original: Mogharājatthero vīmaṃsaṃ avassayīti tassa bhagavā “suññato lokaṃ avekkhassū”ti suññatākathaṃ
analyzed: mogharāja ttheraḥ vīmaṃsam avassayi iti tassa bhagavā suññataḥ lokam avekkhassu iti suññatā katham
translated: The Elder Mogharaja produced the supramundane state by means of reflection. The Blessed One expounded the exposition of voidness to him with the words, “You should look upon the world as void” ,

original: kathesi, paññānissitamānaniggahatthañca dvikkhattuṃ pucchito pañhaṃ na kathesi. Tattha
analyzed: kathesi paññā nissita māna niggaha attham ca dvi kkhattum pucchito pañham na kathesi tattha
translated: and when asked a question twice he did not answer it, because he wanted to make him understand by means of understanding.

original: punappunaṃ chanduppādanaṃ tosanaṃ viya hotīti chandassa upaṭṭhānasadisatā vuttā,
analyzed: punappunam chanda uppādanam tosanam viya hoti iti chandassa upaṭṭhāna sadisa tā vuttā
translated: Herein, the repeated production of zeal is like the satisfying of a craving, so it is said that zeal is like a servant;

original: thāmabhāvato vīriyassa sūrattasadisatā, “chadvārādhipati rājā”ti vacanato pubbaṅgamattā
analyzed: thāma bhāvataḥ vīriyassa sūratta sadisa tā cha dvāra adhipati rājā ati vacanataḥ pubbaṅgama ttā
translated: and since energy is strong, it is like a hero;

original: cittassa visiṭṭhajātisadisatā.🔽Abhedatoti chandādike tayo tayo dhamme sampiṇḍetvā, iddhiiddhipāde amissetvā vā kathananti
analyzed: cittassa visiṭṭha jāti sadisa tā  abhedato ti chanda ādike tayo tayo dhamme sampiṇḍetvā iddhi iddhipāde a missetvā vā
translated: and since the mind is the chief of the sixfold base, it is like a chief.🔽As to unmixed: the meaning is that they are expounded without mixing the three things, zeal, etc., in pairs or all together, in the case of the bases for spiritual power. Herein,

original: attho. Tattha chandavīriyādayo visesena ijjhanti etāyāti iddhīti vuccanti, ijjhatīti
analyzed: tattha chanda vīriya ādayaḥ visesena ijjhanti etāya ati iddhi iti vuccanti ijjhati iti
translated: they are called “bases for spiritual power” because of the success that comes from zeal, etc.,

original: iddhīti avisesena samādhipadhānasaṅkhārāpīti.
analyzed: id hi iti avisesena samādhi padhāna saṅkhārā api iti
translated: ‘Success’ is concentration, and also the associated states, without distinction.

original: Chandiddhipādasamādhiddhipādādayo visiṭṭhā, pādo sabbiddhīnaṃ sādhāraṇattā avisiṭṭho,
analyzed: chanda iddhipāda samādhiddhipāda ādayaḥ visiṭṭhā pādo sabba iddhīnam sādhāraṇa ttā a visiṭṭhaḥ
translated: The bases of success consisting of desire, etc., are distinguished. The base is not distinguished, since it is common to all kinds of success.

original: tasmā visiṭṭhesveva pavesaṃ avatvā avisiṭṭhe ca pavesaṃ vattuṃ yuttanti dassetuṃ
analyzed: tasmā visiṭṭhesu eva pavesam a vatvā a visiṭṭhe ca pavesam vattum yuttam ti dassetum
translated: Therefore, since it is proper to include it only in the distinguished kinds and not in the undistinguished kind, he said,

original: sabbattha “pāde patiṭṭhātipi vattuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti āha. Tatthevāti chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhāraiddhipādesu,
analyzed: sabbattha pāde vattum vaṭṭati iti āha tattha eva iti chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra aiddhipādesu
translated: ‘It is proper to say that it is established in the base in all instances’ in order to show that. There itself means in the bases of success consisting of desire, concentration, energy, and inquiry.

original: catūsu chandādikesvevāti attho. “Chandavato ko samādhi na ijjhissatī”ti samādhibhāvanāmukhena
analyzed: catūsu chanda ādikesu eva ati attho chandavato kaḥ samādhi naḥ ijjhissati iti samādhi bhāvanā mukhena
translated: The meaning is: in the four beginning with desire. ‘What concentration will not succeed for one who has desire?’

original: bhāvitā samādhibhāvitā.
analyzed: bhāvitā samādhi bhāvitā
translated: Concentration developed by way of the development of concentration is concentration developed by concentration.

original: Ettha panāti bhedakathāyaṃ abhedakathanato abhinavaṃ natthīti attho. Ye hi tayo dhammā🔽abhedakathāyaṃ iddhiiddhipādotveva vuttā, te eva bhedakathāyaṃ iddhīpi honti iddhipādāpi,
analyzed: ettha pana ati bheda kathā ayam abheda kathanataḥ abhinavam natthi iti atthaḥ ye hi tayaḥ dhammā  abheda kathā ayam vuttā te eva bheda kathā ayam honti iddhipādāḥ api
translated: Herein means in the explanation of the distinction. The meaning is: there is nothing new. For the three states🔽that were called success and bases of success in the explanation of the undifferentiated are called success and bases of success in the explanation of the differentiated.

original: sesā iddhipādā evāti evaṃ abhinavābhāvaṃ dassento “chando samādhī”tiādimāha. Ime
analyzed: sesāḥ iddhipādāḥ eva ati evam abhinava abhāvam dassento chando samādhi iti ādim āha ime
translated: The rest are only bases of success. Showing that there is nothing new, he said, ‘Desire, concentration,’ etc.

original: hi tayo…pe… na vinā, tasmā sesā sampayuttakā cattāro khandhā tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ ijjhanena🔽iddhi nāma bhaveyyuṃ, na attano sabhāvenāti te iddhipādā eva honti, na iddhīti evamidaṃ🔽purimassa kāraṇabhāvena vuttanti veditabbaṃ. Atha vā tiṇṇaṃ iddhitā iddhipādatā ca
analyzed: hi na vinā tasmā sesā sampayuttakā cattāro khandhā tesam tiṇṇam ijjhanena  id hi nāma bhaveyyum na sabhāvena ati te iddhipādāḥ eva honti na iddhi iti evam idam  purimassa kāraṇa bhāvena vuttan ti veditabbam atha vā tiṇṇam iddhi tā iddhipāda tā ca
translated: for the three are not successful without the other four, therefore the remaining associated four aggregates would be successful with the success of the three,🔽but not by their own individual nature, thus they are bases of success, not successes. So this should be understood as said by way of the former being the cause of the latter.

original: vuttā, sesānañca iddhipādatāva, taṃ sabbaṃ sādhetuṃ “ime hi tayo…pe… na vinā”ti āha.
analyzed: vuttā sesānam ca iddhipāda tā ava tam sabbam sādhetum ime hi tayā upe na vinā iti āha
translated: Or else, the success of the three is said to be a base of success, and the success of the rest is said to be a base of success, and in order to establish all that he said, “for the three are not successful without the other four.”

original: Tena yasmā ijjhanti, tasmā iddhi. Ijjhamānā ca yasmā sampayuttakehi saheva ijjhanti,🔽na vinā, tasmā sampayuttakā iddhipādā, tadantogadhattā pana te tayo dhammā iddhipādāpi
analyzed: tena yasmai ijjhanti tasmai iddhi ijjhamānā ca yasmai sampayuttakehi saha iva ijjhanti  na vinā tasmā sampayuttakāḥ iddhipādā pana te tayo dhammā iddhipādā api
translated: Therefore, since they are successful, they are success. And since they are successful only with the associated factors, not without them,

original: hontīti dasseti. Sampayuttakānampi pana khandhānaṃ iddhibhāvapariyāyo atthīti dassetuṃ
analyzed: honti iti dasseti sampayuttakānam pi pana khandhānam iddhi bhāva pariyāyaḥ atthi iti dassetuṃ
translated: the associated factors are bases of success. But he shows that the three states are also bases of success because they are included in that. But in order to show that there is also a method of construing the associated aggregates as success,

original: “sampayuttakā panā”tiādimāha. Catūsu khandhesu ekadesassa iddhitā, catunnampi “iddhiyā
analyzed: sampayuttakā pana ati ādim āha catūsu khandhesu eka desassa iddhi tā catunnam pi iddhiyā
translated: he said, “But the associated aggregates are also success.” The success of one part of the four aggregates is success by success.

original: pādo iddhipādo”ti iminā atthena iddhipādatā, punapi catunnaṃ khandhānaṃ “iddhi eva🔽pādo iddhipādo”ti iminā atthena iddhipādatā ca dassitā, na aññassāti katvā āha “na
analyzed: pādaḥ iddhipādaḥ ti iminā atthena iddhipāda tā punapi catunnam khandhānam iddhi eva  pādaḥ iddhipādo ti iminā atthena iddhipāda tā ca dassitā na aññassa ati katvā āha na
translated: and the foot is a basis for success” . And again, the four aggregates are shown as a basis for success in the sense that success is their fruit,

original: aññassa kassaci adhivacana”nti. Iminā “iddhi nāma anipphannā”ti idaṃ vādaṃ paṭisedheti.
analyzed: aññassa kassaci adhivacanan ti iminā id hi nāma a nipphannā ati idam vādam paṭisedheti
translated: and they are shown as a basis for success in the sense that success is their fruit. It is not in any other sense. Hence he said, “It is not a designation for anything else.” By this he rejects the view that success is not a non-arisen state.

original: Paṭilābhapubbabhāgānaṃ paṭilābhasseva ca iddhiiddhipādatāvacanaṃ apubbanti katvā
analyzed: paṭilābha pubba bhāgānam paṭilābhassa iva ca iddhi iddhipāda tā vacanam apubbanti katvā
translated: Since the acquisition and the prior stage of acquisition are called “success” and “basis for success,” respectively,

original: pucchati “kenaṭṭhena iddhi, kenaṭṭhena pādo”ti. Paṭilābho pubbabhāgo cāti vacanaseso.
analyzed: pucchati kenaṭṭhena iddhi kenaṭṭhena pādo ti paṭilābhaḥ pubbabhāgaḥ ca ati vacana seso
translated: he asks, “In what sense is it success? In what sense is it a basis?” The remainder of the passage is the answer.

original: Upāyo ca upāyabhāveneva attano phalassa patiṭṭhā hotīti āha “patiṭṭhānaṭṭheneva pādo”ti.🔽Chandoyeva…pe… vīmaṃsāva vīmaṃsiddhipādoti kathitaṃ, tasmā na cattāro khandhā iddhiyā
analyzed: upāyaḥ ca upāya bhāvena iva attanaḥ phalassa patiṭṭhā hoti iti āha patiṭṭhāna aṭṭhena iva pādo ti  chandaḥ yevape vīmaṃsāva kathitam tasmā na cattāraḥ khandhāḥ iddhiyā
translated: And the means is a basis in the sense of a foundation for its own fruit.

original: samānakālikā nānākkhaṇikā vā iddhipādā, jeṭṭhakabhūtā pana chandādayo eva sabbattha
analyzed: samāna kālikāḥ nānā kkhaṇikāḥ vā iddhipādāḥ jeṭṭhaka bhūtā pana chanda ādayo eva sabbattha
translated: Since zeal, etc., are called the basis for success by zeal, etc., therefore the four aggregates are not the basis for success either simultaneously with success or at a different time. Rather, zeal, etc., which are the most important, are in every case

original: iddhipādāti ayameva tesaṃ aṭṭhakathācariyānaṃ adhippāyo. Suttantabhājanīye hi abhidhammabhājanīye
analyzed: iddhipādā ti ayam eva tesam aṭṭhakathā cariyānam adhippāyaḥ suttanta bhājanīye hi abhidhamma bhājanīye
translated: This is the intention of the teachers of the commentary. For in the Suttantabhājanīya and the Abhidhammabhājanīya

original: ca samādhivisesanavasena dassitānaṃ upāyabhūtānaṃ iddhipādānaṃ pākaṭakaraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ca samādhi visesana vasena dassitānam upāya bhūtānam iddhipādānam pākaṭa karaṇa attham
translated: This is the intention of the teachers of the commentary. For the four bases of success are shown in the Suttantabhāṇavāra and the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra as the means for the development of concentration by means of the special qualities of concentration.🔽The Uttara Cūḷabhāṇavāra is stated for the purpose of making clear the bases of success.

original: uttaracūḷabhājanīyaṃ vuttanti. Kecīti uttaravihāravāsitherā kira.
analyzed: uttara cūḍa bhājanīyam keci iti uttara vihāra vāsi therā kira
translated: Some say: the elders of the Uttaravihāra, it seems.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhāṇavāra is finished.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: . The commentary on the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra

original: 444. Abhidhammabhājanīye “iddhipādoti tathābhūtassa phasso…pe… paggāho avikkhepo”ti
analyzed: abhidhamma bhājanīye iddhipādaḥ ti tathābhūtassa phassope paggāhaḥ avikkhepo ti
translated: In the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra, “The base of success is the contact … the exertion … the confidence … the equanimity of one who has thus gone” ,

original: iddhiiddhipādatthadassanatthaṃ paggāhāvikkhepā vuttā, cittapaññā ca saṅkhipitvāti.
analyzed: iddhi iddhipāda attha dassana ttham paggāha avikkhepā vuttā citta paññā ca saṅkhipitvā ti
translated: the exertion and the confidence are stated for the purpose of showing the success and the base of success of success. And the mind and understanding are stated concisely.

original: Cattāri nayasahassāni vibhattānīti idaṃ sādhipativārānaṃ paripuṇṇānaṃ abhāvā vicāretabbaṃ.
analyzed: cattāri naya sahassāni vibhattāni iti idam sa adhipati vārānam paripuṇṇānam abhāvā vicāretabbam
translated: “Four thousand methods are analyzed” . This should be investigated, because the chapters on the dominants are not complete.

original: Na hi adhipatīnaṃ adhipatayo vijjanti, ekekasmiṃ pana iddhipādaniddese ekeko adhipativāro
analyzed: na hi adhipatīnam adhipatayaḥ vijjanti ekekasmin pana iddhipāda niddese ekekaḥ adhipati vāro
translated: For there are no dominants of the dominants, but in the description of each base of success there is one chapter on the dominants.

original: labbhatīti soḷasa soḷasa nayasatāni labbhanti.
analyzed: labbhati iti soḷasa soḷasa naya satāni labbhanti
translated: “Can be found” means that the sixteen hundred and sixty ways can be found.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the section on the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the questioner

original: Nanu ca cattāropi adhipatayo ekakkhaṇe labbhanti, aññamaññassa pana adhipatayo na
analyzed: nanu ca cattāraḥ api adhipatayaḥ eka kkhaṇe labbhanti aññamaññassa pana adhipatayaḥ na
translated: But are not the four dominants found in a single conscious moment? And are not the others dominants of each other?

original: bhavanti “cattāro iddhipādā na maggādhipatino”ti vuttattā. Rājaputtopamāpi hi etamatthaṃ🔽dīpetīti? Na, ekakkhaṇe dutiyassa adhipatino abhāvato eva, “na maggādhipatino”ti
analyzed: bhavanti cattāraḥ iddhipādāḥ na magga adhipatino ti vutta ttā rāja putta upamā api hi etam attham  dīpeti iti na eka kkhaṇe dutiyassa adhipatino abhāvataḥ eva na magga adhipatino ti
translated: Because it is said, “The four bases for spiritual power are not dominants of the path,” and because the simile of the princes illustrates this meaning?

original: vuttattā rājaputtopamā adhipatiṃ na karontīti imamevatthaṃ dīpeti, na adhipatīnaṃ🔽sahabhāvaṃ. Taṃ kathaṃ jānitabbanti? Paṭikkhittattā. Adhipatipaccayaniddese hi aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: vutta ttā rāja putta upamāḥ adhipatim na karonti iti imam eva attham dīpeti na adhipatīnam  sahabhāvam tam katham jānitabbanti paṭikkhitta ttā adhipati paccaya niddese hi aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: No. Because in a single conscious moment the second is not a dominant of the first, and because it is said, “They are not dominants of the path,” the simile of the princes illustrates only this meaning, namely, that they are not dominants, not that they are not co-existent dominants.🔽How is that to be known? Because of the rejection. For in the explanation of the dominant condition in the Niddesa it is said:

original: vuttā “kasmā pana yathā hetupaccayaniddese ‘hetū hetusampayuttakāna’nti vuttaṃ, evamidha
analyzed: vuttā kasmā pana yathā hetu paccaya niddese hetū hetu sampayuttakānam ti vuttam evam idha
translated: “But why is it said here ‘The dominants are a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated states,’ not ‘for the states associated with them and not associated with them’ as in the case of the explanation of the root-cause condition?”

original: ‘adhipatī adhipatisampayuttakāna’nti avatvā ‘chandādhipati chandasampayuttakāna’ntiādinā
analyzed: adhipatī adhipati sampayuttakān anti avatvā chanda adhipati chanda sampayuttakān anti ādinā
translated: ‘The predominance of the predominance faculty’ is not stated, but the teaching is given in the way beginning, ‘The predominance of zeal is that of what is associated with zeal’ .

original: nayena desanā katāti? Ekakkhaṇe abhāvato”ti. Sati ca catunnaṃ adhipatīnaṃ sahabhāve
analyzed: nayena desanā katā ati eka khaṇe abhāvato ti sati ca catunnam adhipatīnam sahabhāve
translated: Why is this? Because they do not exist in a single conscious moment. And if the four kinds of predominance existed together,

original: “ariyamaggasamaṅgissa vīmaṃsādhipateyyaṃ maggaṃ bhāventassā”ti visesanaṃ na kattabbaṃ
analyzed: ariya magga samaṅgissa vīmaṃsā ādhipateyyam maggam bhāventassa ati visesanam na kattabbam
translated: the qualification ‘of one possessing the noble path, who is developing the path with predominance of inquiry’ would not have to be stated in the Vibhaṅga passage,

original: siyā avīmaṃsādhipatikassa maggassa abhāvā. Chandādīnaṃ aññamaññādhipatikaraṇabhāve
analyzed: siyā avīmaṃsā ādhipatikassa maggassa abhāvā chanda ādīnam aññamañña adhipati karaṇa bhāve
translated: because there would be no path with predominance of inquiry. And if zeal and the others were to exercise predominance over each other,

original: ca “vīmaṃsaṃ ṭhapetvā taṃsampayutto”tiādinā chandādīnaṃ vīmaṃsādhipatikattavacanaṃ
analyzed: ca vīmaṃsam ṭhapetvā chanda ādīnam
translated: the statement in the Vibhaṅga that ‘zeal, etc., are associated with the predominance of inquiry’ would not have to be made.

original: na vattabbaṃ siyā. Tathā “cattāro ariyamaggā siyā maggādhipatino, siyā na vattabbā
analyzed: na vattabbam siyā tathā cattāro ariya maggā siyā magga adhipatino siyā na vattabbā
translated: And the statement in the Vibhaṅga that ‘the four noble paths may be with predominance of path, may be not so classifiable’ would not have to be made.

original: maggādhipatino”ti evamādīhipi adhipatīnaṃ sahabhāvo paṭikkhitto evāti.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Iddhipādavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: magga adhipatino ti evamādīhi pi adhipatīnam sahabhāvaḥ paṭikkhittaḥ evā ti  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  iddhipāda vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: So the coexistence of the predominance faculties is rejected in this way too.🔽The commentary on the questions and answers is ended.🔽The exposition of the bases of success is ended.

original: 10. Bojjhaṅgavibhaṅgo
analyzed: bojjhaṅga vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The exposition of the enlightenment factors

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The sutta collection as a receptacle

original: Paṭhamanayavaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Discourse on Crossing the Flood

original: 466. Patiṭṭhānāyūhanā oghataraṇasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ –🔽“Kilesavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ, abhisaṅkhāravasena āyūhanā. Tathā taṇhādiṭṭhīhi patiṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: kilesa vasena patiṭṭhānam abhisaṅkhāra vasena āyūhanā tathā taṇhā diṭṭhīhi patiṭṭhānam
translated: In the commentary on the Discourse on Crossing the Flood, it is said:🔽“The establishment is by way of defilements, the accumulation is by way of formations. Likewise, the establishment is by way of craving and views,

original: avasesakilesābhisaṅkhārehi āyūhanā. Taṇhāvasena patiṭṭhānaṃ, diṭṭhivasena āyūhanā.
analyzed: avasesa kilesa abhisaṅkhārehi āyūhanā taṇhā vasena patiṭṭhānam diṭṭhi vasena āyūhanā
translated: the accumulation is by way of the remaining defilements and formations. The establishment is by way of craving, the accumulation is by way of views.

original: Sassatadiṭṭhiyā patiṭṭhānaṃ, ucchedadiṭṭhiyā āyūhanā. Līnavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ, uddhaccavasena
analyzed: sassata diṭṭhiyāḥ patiṭṭhānam uccheda diṭṭhiyāḥ āyūhanā līna vasena patiṭṭhānam uddhacca vasena
translated: The establishment is by way of the view of eternalism, the accumulation is by way of the view of annihilationism. The establishment is by way of depression,

original: āyūhanā. Kāmasukhānuyogavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ, attakilamathānuyogavasena āyūhanā. Sabbākusalābhisaṅkhāravasena
analyzed: āyūhanā kāma sukha anuyoga vasena patiṭṭhānam atta kilamatha anuyoga vasena āyūhanā sabba akusala abhisaṅkhāra vasena
translated: the accumulation is by way of agitation. The establishment is by way of devotion to sensual pleasure and devotion to self-mortification, the accumulation is by way of devotion to the pursuit of neither sensual pleasure nor self-mortification. The establishment is by way of all unwholesome formations,

original: patiṭṭhānaṃ, sabbalokiyakusalābhisaṅkhāravasena āyūhanā”ti –
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam sabba lokiya kusala abhisaṅkhāra vasena
translated: the accumulation is by way of all mundane wholesome formations.”

original: Vuttesu pakāresu idha avuttānaṃ vasena veditabbā.
analyzed: vuttesu pakāresu idha avuttānam vasena veditabbā
translated: The remaining terms should be understood by way of the unmentioned factors among those mentioned.

original: Sammappavatte dhamme paṭisañcikkhati, upapattito ikkhati, tadākāro hutvā pavattatīti
analyzed: sammappavatte dhamme paṭisañcikkhati upapattitaḥ ikkhati tad ākāraḥ hutvā pavattati iti
translated: He reflects on the things that have arisen rightly, he looks on from the time of rebirth, he occurs with that aspect.

original: paṭisaṅkhānalakkhaṇo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo. Evañca katvā “paṭisaṅkhā santiṭṭhanā gahaṇe
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna lakkhaṇaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ evañca katvā paṭisaṅkhā santiṭṭhanā gahaṇe
translated: The equanimity factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of reflection.🔽And when it is so defined, equanimity is said to be equanimity about formations because it is prominent in the function of equanimity, which is “uninterestedness consisting in non-attention” .

original: majjhattatā”ti upekkhākiccādhimattatāya saṅkhārupekkhā vuttā. Anukkamanikkhepe payojanaṃ
analyzed: majjhatta tā ti upekkhā kicca adhimatta tāya saṅkhāra upekkhā vuttā anukkama nikkhepe payojanam
translated: The purpose of the successive order is

original: purimassa purimassa pacchimapacchimakāraṇabhāvo.
analyzed: purimassa purimassa pacchima pacchima kāraṇa bhāvaḥ
translated: the fact that each preceding one is a cause for each succeeding one.🔽The understanding is included in order to show the state of being powerful,

original: 467. Balavatī eva sati satisambojjhaṅgoti katvā balavabhāvadīpanatthaṃ paññā gahitā,
analyzed: balavatī eva satī sati sambojjhaṅgā iti katvā balava bhāva dīpana attham paññā gahitā
translated: making the powerful mindfulness the mindfulness factor of complete awakening,

original: na yassa kassaci sampadhāraṇasati, kusaluppattikāraṇassa pana saraṇaṃ satīti dassento🔽“vattaṃ vā”tiādimāha. Vattasīse ṭhatvāti “aho vata me dhammaṃ suṇeyyuṃ, sutvā ca🔽dhammaṃ pasīdeyyuṃ, pasannā ca me pasannākāraṃ kareyyu”nti evaṃcitto ahutvā “svākkhāto
analyzed: na yassa kassaci sampadhāraṇa sati kusala uppatti kāraṇassa pana saraṇam sati iti dassento  vattam vā iti ādim āha vatta sīse ṭhatvā iti aho vata me dhammam suṇeyyum sutvā ca  dhammam pasīdeyyum pasannā ca me pasanna ākāram kareyyun ti evaṃcittaḥ a hutvā su ākkhātaḥ
translated: not any mindfulness that merely holds up, but rather the mindfulness that is the refuge for the arising of profitable states.🔽Showing this, he said: “Either in the case of a duty that has to be done” .

original: bhagavatā dhammo…pe… viññūhi, aho vata me dhammaṃ suṇeyyuṃ, sutvā ca dhammaṃ ājāneyyuṃ,
analyzed: bhagavatā dhamma upe viññūhi aho vata me dhammam suṇeyyum sutvā ca dhammam ājāneyyum
translated: Not with the thought: “Oh, that they might listen to the Dhamma from me! Having listened, that they might gain confidence in me! Having gained confidence, that they might render service with confidence!” but with the thought: “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, onward-leading, and directly experienceable by the wise. Oh, that they might listen to the Dhamma from me! Having listened, that they might understand the Dhamma! Having understood the Dhamma,

original: ājānitvā ca pana tathatthāya paṭipajjeyyu”nti dhammasudhammataṃ paṭicca kāruññaṃ🔽anuddayaṃ anukampaṃ upādāya mahākassapattherena viya bhāsitanti attho. Vimuttāyatanasīseti
analyzed: ājānitvā ca pana tathatthāya paṭipajjeyyunti dhamma su dhamma tam paṭicca kāruññam  anuddayam anukampam upādāya mahākassapa therena viya bhāsitanti atthaḥ vimutta āyatana sīsā iti
translated: and having understood it, they would practice accordingly?” The meaning is that he spoke out of compassion, out of a sense of mercy, out of a sense of urgency, and out of a sense of the true nature of things.

original: “na heva kho satthā, apica kho yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ
analyzed: na ha iva kho satthā apica kho yathāsutam yathā pariyattam dhammam vitthārena paresam
translated: “At the head of the liberation-bases” means: “Not only that, but also I will teach others in detail the Dhamma as I have heard and learned it.”

original: desessāmī”ti evaṃ vimuttikāraṇapadhānabhāve ṭhatvā. Cirakatavattādivasena taṃsamuṭṭhāpako🔽arūpakoṭṭhāso vutto, bhāvatthattā eva vā katabhāsita-saddā kiriyābhūtassa arūpakoṭṭhāsassa
analyzed: desessāmi iti evam vimutti kāraṇa padhāna bhāve ṭhatvā cirakatavattā ādi vasena tad samuṭṭhāpakaḥ  arūpa koṭṭhāsaḥ vuttaḥ bhāva tthattā eva vā kata bhāsita saddā kiriyā bhūtassa arūpa koṭṭhāsassa
translated: Thus he stood firm in the practice of the cause of liberation. The immaterial aggregate is mentioned as the basis for the practice of service rendered over a long period of time, etc.

original: vācakāti katvā āha “kāyaviññattiṃ…pe… koṭṭhāsa”nti.🔽Bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpakatā purimānaṃ channaṃ attano attano anantarikassa, paresaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: vācakā iti katvā āha  bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpaka tā purimānam channam attanaḥ attanaḥ anantarikassa paresam sabbesam
translated: Or else, the immaterial aggregate is mentioned because it is the basis for the state of existence, or because the words “done” and “spoken” are the verbal intimation of the immaterial aggregate, which is the action.🔽The condition for the arising of the enlightenment factors should be understood in the following way: each of the first six enlightenment factors is the condition for the next one, and all are the condition for the last one.

original: vā taṃtaṃpariyāyena samuṭṭhāpanavasena yojetabbā. Kāmalokavaṭṭāmisāti taṇhā tadārammaṇā
analyzed: vā taṃ taṃ pariyāyena samuṭṭhāpana vasena yojetabbā kāma loka vaṭṭā amisā ati taṇhā tad ārammaṇā
translated: The round of craving for the sense-pleasures and the round of views

original: khandhāti vadanti, pañcakāmaguṇiko ca rāgo tadārammaṇañca kāmāmisaṃ, “sassato attā🔽ca loko cā”tiādinā lokaggahaṇavasena pavatto sassatucchedasahagato rāgo tadārammaṇañca🔽lokāmisaṃ, lokadhammā vā, vaṭṭassādavasena uppanno saṃsārajanako rāgo tadārammaṇañca🔽vaṭṭāmisaṃ. Maggassa pubbabhāgattā pubbabhāgā.
analyzed: khandhā ti vadanti pañca kāmaguṇikaḥ ca rāgaḥ tad ārammaṇam ca kāma āmisam sassataḥ attā  ca loko ca ati ādinā loka ggahaṇa vasena pavatto rāgo tad ārammaṇam ca  loka āmisam loka dhammā vā vaṭṭa ssāda vasena uppanno saṃsāra janakaḥ rāgaḥ tad ārammaṇam ca  vaṭṭa āmisam maggassa pubbabhāga ttā pubbabhāgā
translated: “Aggregates” is said. And the lust for the five strands of sense pleasure and the sensual pleasure therein, and the lust accompanied by the eternalist and annihilationist views that arise with the apprehension of the world in such passages as “The world is eternal” and the sensual pleasure therein,🔽or the sensual pleasure in the worldly states, or the lust that arises with the relish of the round and that generates the round of rebirths and the sensual pleasure therein,🔽are the sensual pleasures of the prior portion because they are prior to the path.

original: Paṭhamanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Dutiyanayavaṇṇanā🔽468-469. Abhiññeyyā dhammā nāma “sabbe sattā āhāraṭṭhitikā, dve dhātuyo, tisso dhātuyo,🔽cattāri ariyasaccāni, pañca vimuttāyatanāni, cha anuttariyāni, satta niddasavatthūni,🔽aṭṭhābhibhāyatanāni, navānupubbavihārā, dasa nijjaravatthūnī”ti evaṃpabhedā dhammā,🔽“sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, abhiññeyya”nti dassitā khandhādayo ca. Vānanti vinandhanaṃ bhavādīnaṃ,
analyzed: 🔽dutiya naya vaṇṇanā 🔽abhiññeyyāḥ dhammāḥ nāma sabbe sattāḥ āhāra ṭṭhitikāḥ dve dhātuyo tisso dhātuyo 🔽cattāri ariya saccāni pañca vimutta āyatanāni cha anuttariyāni satta niddasa vatthūni 🔽aṭṭha abhibhāyatanāni nava anupubbavihārāḥ dasa nijjara vatthūni iti evaṃpabhedāḥ dhammāḥ 🔽sabbam bhikkhave abhiññeyyanti dassitā khandha ādayaḥ ca vānanti vinandhanam bhava ādīnam

original: gamanaṃ vā piyarūpasātarūpesu.
analyzed: gamanam vā piya rūpa sāta rūpesu
translated: or to the going to what is pleasing and agreeable.

original: Caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhahantassa uppannavīriyaṃ vipassanāsahagatanti veditabbaṃ. Ettakenāti
analyzed: caṅkamam adhiṭṭhahantassa uppanna vīriyam vipassanā sahagatanti veditabbam ettakena ati
translated: The energy arisen in one who is determining a walk should be understood as being accompanied by insight. As much as this:🔽as far as “mixed mundane and supramundane” has been said.

original: “lokiyalokuttaramissakā kathitā”ti ettāvatā. Lokiyanti vadanto na kilamatīti kāyaviññattisamuṭṭhāpakassa🔽lokiyattā acodanīyoti attho. Alabbha…pe… paṭikkhittāti rūpāvacare alabbhamānakaṃ🔽pītisambojjhaṅgaṃ upādāya labbhamānāpi avitakkaavicārā pīti paṭikkhittā, “pītisambojjhaṅgo”ti🔽na vuttoti attho. Kāmāvacare vā alabbhamānakaṃ avitakkaavicāraṃ pītiṃ upādāya labbhamānakāva
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara missakā kathitā ati ettāvatā lokiyam ti vadantaḥ na kilamati iti kāya viññatti samuṭṭhāpakassa  lokiya ttā acodanīyaḥ ti atthaḥ alabbhape paṭikkhittā ati rūpāvacare alabbhamānakam  pīti sambojjhaṅgam upādāya labbhamānā api avitakka avicārā pīti paṭikkhittā pīti sambojjhaṅgā ti  na vuttaḥ ti attho kāmāvacare vā alabbhamānakam avitakka avicāram pītim upādāya labbhamānakā ava
translated: Saying “mundane” he does not tire himself. The meaning is that it is not to be reproved because the mundane is the cause of the intimation of the body.🔽Not obtainable, etc. The mundane joy that is not obtainable in the fine-material sphere, and that which is obtainable there but is not accompanied by applied and sustained thought, is “reproved” in the sense of being rejected, in the sense that it is not called “the enlightenment factor of joy.”

original: pītibojjhaṅgabhūtā paṭikkhittā, avitakkaavicāro pītisambojjhaṅgo na vuttoti attho.
analyzed: pīti bojjhaṅga bhūtā paṭikkhittā avitakka avicāro pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ na vuttaḥ ti attho
translated: Or alternatively, the mundane joy that is not obtainable in the fine-material sphere, and that which is obtainable there but is not accompanied by applied and sustained thought, is “reproved” in the sense of being rejected, in the sense that the joy that is a condition for the enlightenment factor of joy is not called “the enlightenment factor of joy that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought.”

original: Ajjhattavimokkhanti ajjhattadhamme abhinivisitvā tato vuṭṭhitamaggo “ajjhattavimokkho”ti
analyzed: ajjhatta vimokkham ti ajjhatta dhamme abhinivisitvā tatas vuṭṭhita maggaḥ ajjhatta vimokkho ti
translated: An outlet by means of internal: the path that has emerged from the internal states of consciousness and its concomitants by penetrating them is called “an outlet by means of internal states.”

original: idha vuttoti adhippāyo. Na vāretabboti vipassanāpādakesu kasiṇādijhānesu satiādīnaṃ
analyzed: idha vuttaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ na vāretabbaḥ ti vipassanā pādakesu kasiṇa ādi jhānesu sati ādīnam
translated: The intention is that it is mentioned here.🔽“It should not be excluded”: the meaning is that it should not be rejected because the jhāna factors such as joy, etc.,

original: nibbedhabhāgiyattā na paṭikkhipitabboti attho. Anuddharantā pana vipassanā viya bodhiyā🔽maggassa āsannakāraṇaṃ jhānaṃ na hoti, na ca tathā ekantikaṃ kāraṇaṃ, na ca vipassanākiccassa
analyzed: nibbedha bhāgiya ttā na paṭikkhipitabbaḥ ti attho an uddharantā pana vipassanā viya bodhiyā  maggassa āsanna kāraṇam jhānam na hoti na ca tathā ekantikam kāraṇam na ca vipassanā kiccassa
translated: are included in the penetration of the four truths. But they do not include it as a proximate cause of the path as is insight,🔽nor is it an absolute cause, nor is it included as the completion of the function of jhāna as is the function of insight.

original: viya jhānakiccassa niṭṭhānaṃ maggoti katvā na uddharanti. Tattha kasiṇajjhānaggahaṇena🔽tadāyattāni āruppānipi gahitānīti daṭṭhabbāni. Asubhajjhānānaṃ avacanaṃ avitakkāvicārassa adhippetattā.
analyzed: viya jhāna kiccassa niṭṭhānam maggo ti katvā na uddharanti tattha kasiṇa jhāna ggahaṇena  tad āyattāni āruppāni api gahitāni iti daṭṭhabbāni asubha jjhānānam avacanam avitakka avicārassa adhippeta ttā
translated: The reason why the jhāna factors are not included is that the jhāna factors are not included in the path as the enlightenment factors are.

original: Dutiyanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya naya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the second method is ended.

original: Tatiyanayavaṇṇanā🔽470-471. Tadaṅgasamucchedanissaraṇavivekanissitataṃ vatvā paṭippassaddhivivekanissitattassa
analyzed: tatiya naya vaṇṇanā  tad aṅga samuccheda nissaraṇa viveka nissita tam vatvā paṭippassaddhi viveka nissita ttassa
translated: The explanation of the third method🔽. After stating that the enlightenment factors are “based on seclusion, based on dispassion, based on cessation, and they lead to relinquishment,” he does not say that they are “based on peace” and “based on insight,”

original: avacanaṃ “satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvetī”tiādinā idha bhāvetabbānaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ vuttattā.
analyzed: a vacanam sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti iti ādinā idha bhāvetabbānam bojjhaṅgānam vutta ttā
translated: because the enlightenment factors to be developed here are stated in the way beginning, “He develops the mindfulness enlightenment factor depending on seclusion” .

original: Bhāvitabojjhaṅgassa hi sacchikātabbā phalabojjhaṅgā abhidhammabhājanīye vuttāti.
analyzed: bhāvita bojjhaṅgassa hi sacchikātabbā phala bojjhaṅgā abhidhammabhājanīye vuttā ti
translated: For the factors of the path to be developed are the factors of fruition to be realized, as stated in the Abhidhamma.

original: Vossagga-saddo pariccāgattho pakkhandanattho cāti vossaggassa duvidhatā vuttā. Yathāvuttenāti
analyzed: vossagga saddo pariccāga attho pakkhandana ttho ca ati vossaggassa duvidha tā vuttā yathā vuttena ati
translated: The word “surrender” has the meaning of “giving up” and the meaning of “entering into.”🔽“In the way stated” means in the way of the abandoning of the defilements and in the way of making the object the state of being inclined to that.

original: tadaṅgasamucchedappakārena tanninnabhāvārammaṇakaraṇappakārena ca. Pariṇāmentaṃ vipassanākkhaṇe,
analyzed: tad aṅga samuccheda ppakārena tad ninna bhāva ārammaṇa karaṇa ppakārena ca pariṇāmentam vipassanā kkhaṇe
translated: “Transformed” at the moment of insight;

original: pariṇataṃ maggakkhaṇe.
analyzed: pariṇatam magga kkhaṇe
translated: “transformed” at the moment of the path.

original: Tatiyanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tatiya naya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the third method is finished.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the sutta-explanation is finished.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽472. Upekkhanavasenāti sabhāvaniddesataṃ dasseti, hāpanavaḍḍhanesu byāpāraṃ akatvā
analyzed: upekkhana vasena āti sa bhāva niddesa tam dasseti hāpana vaḍḍhanesu byāpāram a katvā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhamma-explanation🔽“Through equanimity” shows the definition of the nature of equanimity. The meaning is: through equanimity in the sense of looking on, without engaging in diminishing or increasing.

original: upapattito ikkhanavasenāti attho. Lokiyaupekkhanāya adhikā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanāti
analyzed: upapattitaḥ ikkhana vasena ati attho lokiya upekkhanāya adhikā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā ati
translated: “Looking on” is the equanimity that is superior to mundane equanimity.

original: ayamattho idha lokuttarā eva adhippetāti yuttoti.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Bojjhaṅgavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ idha lokuttarā eva adhippetā ati yuttaḥ ti  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  bojjhaṅga vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The meaning here is that only the supramundane equanimity is intended.🔽The commentary on the Abhidhamma-explanation is finished.🔽The commentary on the analysis of the factors of enlightenment is finished.

original: 11. Maggaṅgavibhaṅgo
analyzed: maggaṅga vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The analysis of the path factors

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽490. Abhidhamme lokuttaracittabhājanīyepi “tasmiṃ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā
analyzed: abhidhamme lokuttara citta bhājanīye pi tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ
translated: 2. Description of the Abhidhamma Portion

original: honti…pe… aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo hotī”ti vuttattā idhāpi abhidhammabhājanīye abhidhammānurūpaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo hoti iti vutta ttā idha api abhidhamma bhājanīye abhidhamma anurūpam
translated: In the Abhidhamma Portion, which is a receptacle for the supramundane consciousness, the passage “At that time there are four aggregates, … the eight factors of the noble path” shows that the exposition should be given in accordance with the Abhidhamma.

original: desanaṃ karonto “aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo”ti ariyopapadataṃ na karoti.
analyzed: desanam karontaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo ti ariya upapada tam na karoti
translated: So the Exalted One, giving the exposition in accordance with the Abhidhamma, does not call the noble path the “noble generation” .

original: 493. Tasmiṃ samayeti lokiyakālena etesaṃ atirekakiccaṃ dasseti. Viratiuppādanena
analyzed: tasmin samaye iti lokiya kālena etesam atireka kiccam dasseti virati uppādanena
translated: “At that time” shows the excess of function of these factors over the mundane factors.

original: micchāvācādīni puggalaṃ pajahāpentīti sammādiṭṭhādīni pañca “kārāpakaṅgānī”ti vuttāni.
analyzed: micchā vācā ādīni puggalam pajahāpenti iti sammādiṭṭha ādīni pañca kārāpakaṅgāni iti vuttāni
translated: By the arising of the abstentions, wrong speech, etc., are abandoned in the individual. Thus the five factors beginning with right view are called “the factors that cause to be done” .🔽For the function of right speech, etc., is abstention, and these cause that to be done.

original: Sammāvācādikiriyā hi virati, tañca etāni kārāpentīti. Virativasenāti viramaṇakiriyāvasena,
analyzed: sammā vācā ādi kiriyā hi virati tat ca etāni virati vasena ati viramaṇa kiriyā vasena
translated: “By the way of abstention” means by the way of the action of refraining;🔽the meaning is, not by the way of causing to be done or by the way of being the doer.

original: na kārāpakabhāvena kattubhāvena cāti attho. Imaṃ…pe… kiccātirekataṃ dassetunti lokuttarakkhaṇepi
analyzed: na kārāpaka bhāvena kattu bhāvena ca ati atthaḥ imaṃ pe kicca atirekatam dassetun ti lokuttara kkhaṇe pi
translated: “Shows the excess of function” shows the excess of function of these factors in the supramundane consciousness moment.

original: imāneva pañca sammāvācādittayassa ekakkhaṇe kārāpakānīti dassetunti attho. Micchādiṭṭhādikā
analyzed: imāni eva pañca sammāvācā dittayassa eka khaṇe kārāpakāni iti dassetun ti atthaḥ micchādiṭṭha ādikā
translated: The meaning is that it shows that these five are the makers of the three beginning with right speech in a single moment.

original: dasa, tappaccayā akusalā ca dasāti vīsati akusalapakkhiyā, sammādiṭṭhādikā dasa,
analyzed: dasa tad paccayāḥ akusalā ca dasa ati vīsati akusala pakkhiyā sammādiṭṭha ādikā dasa
translated: The ten wrongnesses beginning with wrong view, and the ten unprofitable roots that have wrong view as their condition, and the ten profitablenesses beginning with right view,

original: tappaccayā ca kusalā dasāti vīsati kusalapakkhiyā ca mahācattārīsakasutte vuttāti tassa etaṃ nāmaṃ.
analyzed: tad paccayā ca kusalā dasāti vīsati kusala pakkhiyā ca mahācattārīsaka sutte vuttā ati tassa etam nāmam
translated: and the ten profitable roots that have right view as their condition, make twenty each, and these are called the “great forty” because they are mentioned in the Great Forty Discourse .🔽They are “profitable-share” because they are in the profitable portion, the meaning is that they are a part of the profitable formation.

original: Puññabhāgiyāti puññakoṭṭhāse bhavā, puññābhisaṅkhārekadesabhūtāti attho. Khandhopadhiṃ vipaccati, tattha vā vipaccatīti upadhivepakkā.🔽Pañcaṅgikamaggaṃ uddisitvā tattha ekekaṃ pucchitvā tassa tasseva samayavavatthānaṃ🔽katvā vissajjanaṃ “pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchitvā pāṭiyekkaṃ vissajjana”nti vuttaṃ. Saha pana
analyzed: puñabhāgiyā ati puñña koṭṭhāse bhavā puñña abhisaṅkhāra eka desa bhūtā ati attho khandha upadhim vipaccati tattha vā vipaccati iti upadhi vepakkā  pañcaṅgika maggam uddisitvā tattha ekekam pucchitvā tassa tassa iva samaya vavatthānam  katvā vissajjanam pāṭiyekkam pucchitvā pāṭiyekkam vissajjanan ti vuttam saha pana
translated: They are “ripening in the attachment” because they ripen in the aggregates and attachments, or because they ripen there.🔽The answering of the question after defining the occasion for each of the five factors after stating the five-factored path is called “answering by defining the occasion for each question.”🔽But the answering of the question after defining the occasion for all five together after asking the question all at once is called “answering by defining the occasion for the question as a whole.”

original: pucchitvā pañcannampi samayavavatthānaṃ katvā vissajjane “tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: pucchitvā pañcannam pi samaya vavatthānam katvā vissajjane tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhiyā
translated: “Herein, what is right view?

original: paññā”tiādiko paṭiniddeso ekato vissajjanapaṭiniddesattā na pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchāvissajjanaṃ
analyzed: paññāti ādiko paṭiniddesaḥ ekatas vissajjana paṭiniddesa ttā na pāṭiyekkam pucchā vissajjanam
translated: “Understanding” and so on is a reply in terms of a single factor. It is not a reply to a question asked separately,

original: nāma hotīti. Tattha pañcaṅgikavāre eva pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchāvissajjanaṃ sammādiṭṭhādīsu
analyzed: nāma hoti iti tattha pañcaṅgika vāre eva pāṭiyekkam pucchā vissajjanam sammādiṭṭha ādīsu
translated: because it is a reply in terms of a single factor. Herein, the reply to a question asked separately in the case of the five-factored one should be understood as follows.🔽The arising of the path in the case of each of the right views, etc.,

original: kārāpakaṅgesu ekekamukhāya bhāvanāya magguppattiṃ sandhāya katanti veditabbaṃ. Vācādīni
analyzed: ekeka mukhāya bhāvanāya magga uppattim sandhāya katanti veditabbam vācā ādīni
translated: is in terms of a single door of development, namely, the right exertions.

original: hi pubbasuddhiyā sijjhanti, na maggassa upacārenāti.
analyzed: hi pubba suddhiyā sijjhanti na maggassa upacārena ati
translated: For speech, etc., are perfected by the prior purification, not by the path’s proximity.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Requisites of the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: Maggaṅgavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: maggaṅga vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Path Factors is ended.

original: 12. Jhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: jhāna vibhaṅgo
translated: The Description of the Jhanas🔽The Requisites of the Suttas

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ🔽Mātikāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam  mātikā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Schedule

original: 508. Jhānassa pubbabhāgakaraṇīyasampadā pātimokkhasaṃvarādi. Asubhānussatiyo lokuttarajjhānāni🔽ca ito bahiddhā natthīti sabbappakāra-ggahaṇaṃ karoti, suññā parappavādā samaṇebhīti
analyzed: jhānassa pubba bhāga karaṇīya sampadā pātimokkha saṃvara ādi asubha anussatiyaḥ lokuttara jhānāni 🔽ca itas bahiddhā na atthi iti sabba ppakāra ggahaṇam karoti suññā para pavādā samaṇebhi iti
translated: The requisites for the jhanas are the virtue of restraint by the Patimokkha, etc., which are the preliminary work for the jhanas, and the recollections of the unattractive, of death, of the body, of peace, of the repulsiveness of food, and of good will, and the perception of impermanence, the contemplation of the body as a physical basis for the perception of impermanence, and the defining of the four elements. The jhanas themselves are the jhanas with the four noble paths and fruits. The requisites for the direct knowledges are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, and the seven factors of enlightenment. The direct knowledges themselves are the four path knowledges and the four fruitional knowledges. The requisites for the path are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the four foundations for mindfulness. The path itself is the four noble paths. The requisites for the fruitions are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eight factors of the path. The fruitions themselves are the four fruitions. The requisites for the cessations are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eight factors of the path. The cess

original: vacanena samaṇabhāvakarapubbabhāgakaraṇīyasampadāsampannassapi abhāvaṃ dasseti. Sikkhāpadesu🔽nāmakāyādivasena vuttesu vacanānatikkamavasena sikkhitabbesu, avītikkamanaviraticetanāsaṅkhātesu
analyzed: vacanena samaṇa bhāva kara pubbabhāga karaṇīya sampadā sampannassa api abhāvam dasseti sikkhāpadesu  nāma kāya ādi vasena vuttesu vacana anatikkama vasena sikkhitabbesu avītikkamana virati cetanā saṅkhātesu
translated: By the words “in the training precepts” he shows the non-existence of the state of a bhikkhu in one who is endowed with the requisites of the preliminary work that brings about the state of a bhikkhu but who is not endowed with the requisites of the training.

original: vā sikkhākoṭṭhāsesu paripūraṇavasena sikkhitabbesu sā sā bhikkhusikkhādikā sikkhāpadekadesabhūtā
analyzed: vā sikkhā koṭṭhāsesu paripūraṇa vasena sikkhitabbesu sā sā bhikkhu sikkhā ādikā sikkhāpada ekadesa bhūtā
translated: In the training precepts, which are stated in the form of the groups of words, etc., and which are to be trained in by not transgressing the words, or which are to be trained in by fulfilling the component parts of the training, which are called the volition of non-transgression,🔽the bhikkhu training, etc., are the training precepts.

original: sikkhitabbāti āha “sikkhāpadesūti idamassa sikkhitabbadhammaparidīpana”nti.🔽Santosādivasena itarītarasantosaṃ, tassa ca vaṇṇavāditaṃ, aladdhā ca aparitassanaṃ,🔽laddhā ca agadhitaparibhoganti ete guṇe dasseti. Jhānabhāvanāya kārakoti paridīpanaṃ
analyzed: sikkhitabbā ti āha sikkhāpadesu uti idam assa sikkhitabba dhamma paridīpanan ti  santosa ādi vasena itarītara santosam tassa ca vaṇṇa vāditam aladdhā ca aparitassanam  laddhā ca ete guṇe dasseti jhāna bhāvanāya kārakā iti paridīpanam
translated: He says, “In the training precepts” is the explanation of the state of training.🔽By the words “content with any old alms” he shows the other kind of contentment, which is content with any old alms bowl, etc., and the commendation of that, and the non-distress of one who has not got them, and the use of them without greed when one has got them.🔽The explanation of the state of being a doer is the explanation of the state of being a doer of the development of jhana.

original: kārakabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Araññantiādinā senāsanassa pabhedaṃ, appasaddantiādinā nirādīnavataṃ,
analyzed: kāraka bhāva paridīpanam araññanti ādinā senāsanassa pabhedam appasaddanti ādinā nirādīnava tam
translated: By the words “in the forest” he shows the classification of the dwelling place, and by the words “secluded” he shows the absence of drawbacks.

original: paṭisallānasāruppanti ānisaṃsaṃ dīpetīti āha “senāsanappabhede…pe… paridīpana”nti.
analyzed: paṭisallāna sāruppam ti ānisaṃsam dīpeti iti āha paridīpanam ti
translated: He shows the benefit in the words “suitable for seclusion” and so he says “in the exposition of the kinds of lodging … the benefit is shown.”

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the mātikā is ended.

original: Niddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the niddesa

original: 509. Kammatthehi diṭṭhi-saddādīhi sāsanaṃ vuttanti “diṭṭhattā diṭṭhī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kammatthehi diṭṭhi sadda ādīhi sāsanam vuttanti diṭṭha ttā diṭṭhi itiādi vuttam
translated: . The Dispensation is called “the seen” because of the seen, the heard, etc., which are objects of the kinds of direct knowledge.

original: Sabhāvaṭṭhenāti aviparītaṭṭhena. Sikkhiyamāno kāyādīni vineti, na aññathāti āha “sikkhitabbaṭṭhena
analyzed: sabhāva ṭṭhena āti aviparīta ṭṭhena sikkhiyamāno kāya ādīni vinā iti na aññathā ti āha sikkhitabba ṭṭhena
translated: In the sense of the individual essence: in the sense of the unperverted individual essence. The training is purified by the training, and the training is purified by virtue.

original: vinayo”ti, vinayo vā sikkhitabbāni sikkhāpadāni, khandhattayaṃ sikkhitabbanti vinayo🔽viyāti vinayoti dasseti. Satthu anusāsanadānabhūtaṃ sikkhattayanti āha “anusiṭṭhidānavasenā”ti.
analyzed: vinayaḥ ti vinayaḥ vā sikkhitabbāni sikkhāpadāni khandha ttayam sikkhitabbanti vinayaḥ  viyā ti vinayo ti dasseti satthu anusāsana dāna bhūtam sikkhattayan ti āha anusiṭṭhi dāna vasena āti
translated: The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher virtue.🔽The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher understanding.🔽The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher consciousness.

original: Sammādiṭṭhipaccayattāti sammādiṭṭhiyā paccayattā. Tisso hi sikkhā sikkhantassa sammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paccaya ttā ati sammādiṭṭhiyā paccaya ttā tissaḥ hi sikkhā sikkhantassa sammādiṭṭhi
