translated: The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher wisdom.🔽The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher virtue.

original: paripūratīti. “Tasmātiha tvaṃ bhikkhu ādimeva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu, ko cādi
analyzed: paripūrati iti tasmāt iha tvam bhikkhu ādim eva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu kaḥ ca ādi
translated: The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher consciousness.🔽The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.🔽The training is purified by the training: the training is purified by the training in higher understanding.🔽The training is purified by virtue: virtue is the training, and the training is purified by that training.

original: kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ? Sīlañca suvisuddhaṃ diṭṭhi ca ujukā”ti vacanato sammādiṭṭhipubbaṅgamaṃ
analyzed: kusalānam dhammānam sīlam ca su visuddham diṭṭhi ca ujukā ati vacanataḥ sammādiṭṭhi pubbaṅgamam
translated: and of profitable ideas? “And virtue well purified, and view that is straight” .

original: sikkhattayaṃ. Etasmiñca atthadvaye phalakāraṇopacārehi sikkhattayaṃ “diṭṭhī”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: sikkhattayam etasmin ca attha dvaye phala kāraṇa upacārehi sikkhattayam diṭṭhī iti vuttam
translated: And in this twofold meaning, namely, as fruit and as cause, the three trainings are called “view” ,

original: kusaladhammehi vā attano ekadesabhūtehīti adhippāyo. Bhagavato vinayanakiriyattā🔽vinayo sikkhattayaṃ, taṃ pana vinayanaṃ dhammeneva avisamasabhāvena, desanādhammena
analyzed: kusala dhammehi vā attanaḥ eka desa bhūtehi iti adhippāyaḥ bhagavataḥ vinayana kiriyattā  vinayo sikkhattayam tam pana vinayanam dhammena iva avisamasa bhāvena desanā dhammena
translated: because they are a part of profitable ideas. The Blessed One’s intention is this:🔽The Discipline is the three trainings,🔽and that Discipline is called “the Discipline of the True Idea” because it is only by the True Idea, by what is not uneven, that it is conducted, or because it is conducted by the True Idea of teaching,

original: vā pavattaṃ, na daṇḍādināti “dhammavinayo”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā pavattam na daṇḍa ādinā iti dhamma vinayaḥ ti vuttam
translated: and not by punishment, and so on.🔽It is called “the Discipline of the True Idea” because it is for the purpose of the blameless idea,

original: Anavajjadhammatthanti paramānavajjanibbānatthaṃ, akuppacetovimuttiatthaṃ vā. Dhammesu🔽abhiññeyyādīsu abhijānanādikāraṇaṃ sikkhattayanti taṃ “dhammavinayo”ti vuttaṃ. “Imissā
analyzed: anavajja dhamma ttham ti parama anavajja nibbāna attham akuppa cetaḥ vimutti attham vā dhammesu  abhiññeyya ādīsu abhijānana ādi kāraṇam tam dhamma vinayo ti vuttam imissā
translated: either for the purpose of the non-occurrence of the ultimate blame, or for the purpose of the unperturbed deliverance of mind.🔽And it is called “the Discipline of the True Idea” because the three trainings are the cause of the act of directly knowing, and so on, in the case of the ideas that are to be directly known, and so on.

original: imasmi”nti punappunaṃ vuccamānaṃ niyamakaraṇaṃ hoti, eva-saddalopo vā katoti adhippāyenāha “niyamo kato”ti.
analyzed: imasmin ti punappunam vuccamānam niyama karaṇam hoti eva sadda lopaḥ vā kato ti adhippāyena āha niyamaḥ kato ti
translated: The intention is this: “In this way and in this way” is a means of making a rule, or else the word “in this way” has been omitted.

original: 510. Bhikkhukoti anaññatthena ka-kārena padaṃ vaḍḍhitanti “bhikkhanadhammatāyā”ti
analyzed: bhikkhuko ti anaññatthena kakārena padam vaḍḍhitanti bhikkhana dhamma tāya ati
translated: The word bhikkhu is extended by the suffix -ka in the sense of ‘not another’ , so the meaning is ‘in the nature of a beggar’ .🔽But in the reading bhikkhako, the meaning is ‘he who begs’ .

original: atthamāha. Bhikkhakoti pana pāṭhe bhikkhatīti bhikkhakoti attho. Jallikaṃ rajamissaṃ
analyzed: attham āha bhikkhako iti pana pāṭhe bhikkhati iti bhikkhako ti atthaḥ jallikam raja missam
translated: The reading rajojallikaṃ is the same as rajojallikamalaṃ;🔽the reading rajojallikamalaṃ is the same as rajojallikamalaṃ.

original: malaṃ, amissaṃ malameva. Bhinnapaṭadharoti nibbacanaṃ bhinnapaṭadhare bhikkhu-saddassa niruḷhattā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: malam amissam malam eva bhinna paṭadharo ti nibbacanam bhinna paṭadhare bhikkhu saddassa niruḷha ttā vuttam
translated: The explanation ‘of one who wears a patched cloak’ is said because the word bhikkhu is established in the sense of ‘one who wears a patched cloak.’

original: Yassa bhāvetabbo pahātabbo ca odhi avasiṭṭho atthi, so odhiso, arahā pana tadabhāvā
analyzed: yassa bhāvetabbo pahātabbo ca odhi avasiṭṭho atthi saḥ odhisaḥ arahā pana tad abhāvā
translated: One who has some remainder of pride left to be developed or abandoned is ‘one with pride’ . But an Arahant, because he has none,🔽is ‘without pride’ . So it is said that bhikkhus are ‘without pride through abandoning defilements.’

original: odhirahitoti “anodhiso kilesānaṃ pahānā bhikkhū”ti vutto. Odhi-saddo vā ekadese niruḷhoti
analyzed: odhi rahitaḥ ti anodhisaḥ kilesānam pahānā bhikkhu iti vuttaḥ odhi saddo vā ekadese niruḷho ti
translated: Or the word odhi is established in the sense of ‘in part’ ,

original: sabbamaggā sabbakilesā ca arahatā bhāvitā pahīnā ca “odhī”ti na vuccanti. Pahānāti
analyzed: sabba maggā sabba kilesā ca arahatā bhāvitā pahīnā ca odhī iti na vuccanti pahānā ati
translated: so all the paths and all defilements are not called ‘odhi’ by an Arahant, though they have been developed and abandoned by him.

original: idañca nibbacanaṃ bhedanapariyāyavasena vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: idam ca nibbacanam bhedana pariyāya vasena vuttan ti veditabbam
translated: And this explanation should be understood as given in terms of the method of analysis.

original: Sekkhotiādinā bhikkhu-saddena vuccamānaṃ atthaṃ guṇavasena dasseti, heṭṭhā pana “samaññāya paṭiññāyā”ti paññāyanavasena, “bhikkhatī”tiādinā nibbacanavasena dassito.
analyzed: sekkho tiādinā bhikkhu saddena vuccamānam attham guṇa vasena dasseti heṭṭhā pana samaññāya paṭiññāya ati paññāyana vasena bhikkhati iti ādinā nibbacana vasena dassitaḥ
translated: He shows the meaning of the word bhikkhu by way of its qualities with the words “the trainee, etc.”; but below he shows it by way of its being known with the words “by the name, by the designation,” and by way of its being uttered with the words “he begs for alms.”

original: Sekkho bhikkhūti satta sekkhā kathitā, bhinnattā pāpakānaṃ…pe… bhikkhūti khīṇāsavova🔽kathitoti idaṃ dvayaṃ “sekkhoti puthujjanakalyāṇakena saddhiṃ satta ariyā, bhinnattāti
analyzed: sekkhaḥ bhikkhu iti satta sekkhā kathitā bhinnattā pāpakānam pe bhikkhu iti khīṇāsavaḥ uva  kathitaḥ iti idam dvayam sekkho ti puthujjana kalyāṇakena saddhim satta ariyāḥ
translated: The seven trainees are called “the trainee bhikkhu.” The one whose defilements are destroyed is called “the bhikkhu” because he is “divided from evil.”🔽This pair does not agree with the other two pairs, namely, “the trainee” and “the seven nobles” and “divided from evil” and “the four who stand on the fruit.”

original: iminā pana cattāro phalaṭṭhā”ti iminā dvayena na sameti, tadidaṃ nippariyāyadassanaṃ🔽vuttanti veditabbaṃ. “Sesaṭṭhānesu puthujjanakalyāṇakādayo kathitā”ti vuttaṃ, nanu
analyzed: iminā pana cattāro iminā dvayena na sameti tat idam nippariyāya dassanam  vuttam ti veditabbam sesa ṭṭhānesu puthujjana kalyāṇaka ādayaḥ kathitā iti vuttam nanu
translated: This should be understood as the statement of the non-comprehensive view.🔽It is said that “the good persons of the world, etc., are mentioned in the remaining places.” But is not the bhikkhu of moral habit also mentioned by the designation?

original: paṭiññāya bhikkhusīlopi vuttoti? Vutto, na pana idhādhippeto sabbappakārajjhānanibbattakassa adhippetattā.
analyzed: paṭiññāya bhikkhu sīlaḥ api vuttaḥ ti vuttaḥ na pana idha adhippeto sabba ppakāra jjhāna nibbattakassa adhippeta ttā
translated: He is mentioned, but he is not intended here, because the one who produces the entire jhana is intended.

original: Bhagavato vacanaṃ upasampadākammakaraṇassa kāraṇattā ṭhānaṃ, tadanurūpaṃ ṭhānārahaṃ, anūnañattianussāvanaṃ uppaṭipāṭiyā ca avuttanti attho.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vacanam upasampadā kamma karaṇassa kāraṇa ttā ṭhānam tad anurūpam ṭhāna araham anūna ñatti anussāvanam uppaṭi pāṭiyā ca a vutta nti atthaḥ
translated: The Blessed One’s words are the occasion for the performance of the act of giving Acceptance, and so they are the occasion in the relevant sense. The motion is in conformity with that occasion, and so it is worthy of the occasion. The meaning is that the motion is not deficient or in excess and that it is recited in the right order.

original: 511. Nippariyāyato sīlaṃ samādānaviratiavītikkamanaviratibhāvatoti adhippāyo. Anabhijjhādīni
analyzed: nippariyāyataḥ sīlam samādāna virati avītikkamana virati bhāvataḥ ti adhippāyaḥ anabhijjhā ādīni
translated: The intention is that virtue is in the ultimate sense the abstinence from bodily misconduct, etc., since it is the abstinence from undertaking and from transgression.🔽The virtue consisting in mental pliability is called virtue in the conventional sense, referring to non-greed, etc.,

original: sandhāya cetasikasīlassa pariyāyasīlatā vuttā. Nagaravaḍḍhakī vatthuvijjācariyoti
analyzed: sandhāya cetasika sīlassa pariyāya sīla tā vuttā nagara vaḍḍhakī vatthu vijjā cariyaḥ ti
translated: The story of the city planner and the science of architecture is told.

original: vadanti. Catubbidho āhāro asitādīni, bhakkhitabbabhuñjitabbalehitabbacubitabbāni vā.
analyzed: vadanti catubbidhaḥ āhāraḥ asita ādīni vā
translated: The four kinds of nutriment are edible food, etc., or what is swallowed, chewed, tasted, and sucked.

original: Pātimokkhasaṃvarena upeto pihitindriyo hoti tiṇṇaṃ sucaritānaṃ indriyasaṃvarāhārattā,🔽pātimokkhasaṃvaro vā indriyasaṃvarassa upanissayo hoti. Iti pātimokkhasaṃvarena pihitindriyo
analyzed: pātimokkha saṃvarena upetaḥ pihita indriyaḥ hoti tiṇṇam su caritānam indriya saṃvara āhāra ttā  pātimokkha saṃvaraḥ vā indriya saṃvarassa upanissayaḥ hoti iti pātimokkha saṃvarena pihita indriyaḥ
translated: One who is endowed with the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha is one who has closed the doors of the sense faculties because the nutriment of the sense faculties’ restraint is included in the three kinds of good conduct.🔽Or the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha is the support for the restraint of the sense faculties. Thus one who has closed the doors of the sense faculties through the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha

original: “pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto”ti vutto. Iminā adhippāyena “saṃvuto”ti etassa pihitindriyoti
analyzed: pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto ti vuttaḥ iminā adhippāyena saṃvuto ti etassa pihita indriyaḥ ti
translated: is called “one restrained by the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha.” With this intention it is said that “one restrained” is one who has closed the doors of the sense faculties.

original: atthamāha. Pātimokkhena ca saṃvarena cāti idaṃ pātimokkhato aññaṃ sīlaṃ kāyikaavītikkamādiggahaṇena
analyzed: attham āha pātimokkhena ca saṃvarena ca ati idam pātimokkhataḥ aññam sīlam kāyika avītikkama ādi gahaṇena
translated: He says the meaning. “By the Pāṭimokkha and restraint”: this should be regarded as said with the intention that virtue other than the Pāṭimokkha is included by the inclusion of bodily and verbal non- transgression.

original: gahitanti iminā adhippāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Dutiyo panattho dvinnampi ekatthataṃ sandhāya vutto.
analyzed: gahitanti iminā adhippāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam dutiyaḥ pana atthaḥ dvinnam pi ekattha tam sandhāya vuttaḥ
translated: But the second meaning is stated with reference to the fact that both are of the same meaning.

original: 513. Sabbampi dussīlyanti iminā abhijjhādayo ca gahitāti sandhāyāha “manasāpi ācarati🔽eva, tasmā taṃ dassetu”nti. Tatthāti kāyikavītikkamādivasena vuttesu anācāresu. Garubhaṇḍavissajjanamāpajjatīti
analyzed: sabbam pi dussīlyanti iminā abhijjhā ādayaḥ ca gahitā iti sandhāya āha manasā api ācarati  eva tasmai tam dassetum ti tattha ati kāyika vītikkama ādi vasena vuttesu anācāresu garu bhaṇḍa vissajjanam āpajjati iti
translated: “All is unvirtuous”: with reference to this, he says, “and also covetousness, etc., are included.”🔽“Therefore, in order to show that, he said ‘in mind also one acts’ …

original: thullaccayaṃ āpajjatīti attho.
analyzed: thullaccayam āpajjati iti attho
translated: “There” means in the misconducts stated by way of bodily transgression, etc. “He commits the offence of a heavy wood” means he commits a thullaccaya offence.🔽“He builds” is said of one who has begun on a site belonging to the Community. “Work” is an act that is a heavy wood. “Manual work” is the work of the hands as stated.

original: Aropimoti saṅghikabhūmiyaṃ uṭṭhito vutto. Phātikammanti garubhaṇḍantarabhūtaṃ kammaṃ. Daṇḍakammanti yathāvuttaṃ hatthakammamāha. Sināyanti etenāti sinānaṃ, cuṇṇādi.
analyzed: saṅghika bhūmiyam uṭṭhitaḥ vutto phāti kamman ti garu bhaṇḍa antara bhūtam kammam daṇḍa kamman ti yathā vuttam hattha kammam āha sināyanti etena ati sinānam cuṇṇa ādi
translated: “Bath” is powder, etc., with which one bathes.

original: Saccālīkena piyavādī “cāṭū”ti vuccati, cāṭuṃ attānaṃ icchatīti cāṭukāmo, tassa bhāvo
analyzed: sacca alīkena piya vādī cāṭū ti vuccati cāṭum attānam icchati iti cāṭu kāmaḥ tassa bhāvo
translated: One who is a flatterer by means of truth and flattery is called a “flatterer.” One who desires to flatter is “one who desires to flatter.” The state of that is

original: cāṭukamyatā. Muggasūpassa appavisanaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthi sabbāhārehi aviruddhattāti
analyzed: cāṭu kamya tā mugga sūpassa appavisana ṭṭhānam nāma natthi sabba āhārehi a viruddha ttā ti
translated: There is no food that is not suitable for gruel. It is intended that there is none that is incompatible with any food.

original: adhippāyo. Paribhaṭati dhāreti, poseti vāti paribhaṭo, atha vā parivārabhūto bhaṭo sevako paribhaṭo.
analyzed: adhippāyo paribhaṭati dhārā iti posā iti vā ati paribhaṭaḥ atha vā parivāra bhūtaḥ bhaṭo sevako paribhaṭaḥ
translated: He is a servant who is served, who is maintained, who is looked after. Or else he is a servant who is served, who is a servant who is surrounded.

original: Bhaṇḍāgārikakammaṃ gihīnaṃ kariyamānaṃ vuttaṃ. Piṇḍatthaṃ paṭipiṇḍadānaṃ, piṇḍaṃ
analyzed: bhaṇḍāgārika kammam gihīnam kariyamānam vuttam piṇḍattham paṭipiṇḍa dānam piṇḍam
translated: The work of a storekeeper is said to be done by householders. The giving of alms food is the giving of alms food for the sake of alms food.

original: datvā paṭipiṇḍaggahaṇaṃ vā piṇḍapaṭipiṇḍaṃ. Saṅghabhogacetiyabhogānaṃ ayoniso vicāraṇaṃ
analyzed: da tvā paṭipiṇḍa ggahaṇam vā piṇḍa paṭipiṇḍam ayonisaḥ vicāraṇam
translated: Or else it is the taking of alms food after giving alms food. The mismanaging of the property of the Community and of shrines

original: saṅghuppādacetiyuppādapaṭṭhapanaṃ, attano santake viya paṭipajjananti keci.
analyzed: saṅgha uppāda cetiya uppāda paṭṭhapanam attano santake viya paṭipajjananti keci
translated: is the mismanaging of the property of the Community and of shrines. Some say that it is the mismanaging of the property of the Community and of shrines as if it were one’s own property.

original: 514. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, gocaro viyāti gocaro, abhiṇhaṃ caritabbaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati gocaraḥ gocaraḥ viya ati gocaraḥ abhiṇham caritabba ṭṭhānam
translated: Cows graze here, thus it is a grazing ground. Like a grazing ground, thus it is a grazing ground. It is a place that should be grazed frequently.

original: Gāvo vā cakkhādīni indriyāni, tehi caritabbaṭṭhānaṃ gocaro. Ayutto gocaro agocaroti
analyzed: gāvaḥ vā cakkha ādīni indriyāni tehi caritabba ṭṭhānam gocaraḥ ayuttaḥ gocaraḥ agocaraḥ ti
translated: Or else the cows are the faculties, eye, etc., and the place that should be grazed by them is a grazing ground. A non-grazing ground is a non-grazing ground.

original: tadañño yutto “gocaro”ti vutto.
analyzed: tad aññaḥ yuttaḥ gocaraḥ iti vuttaḥ
translated: Another is said to be a grazing ground because it is suitable.

original: Vā-saddo vidhunanatthopi hotīti katvā āha “viniddhutakibbisāni vā”ti.
analyzed: vā saddaḥ vidhunana atthaḥ api hoti iti katvā āha viniddhuta kibbisāni vā ti
translated: The word vā can have the meaning of “shaking off.” Taking it in this sense, he says “or shaken off their defilements.”

original: 515. Avarā pacchimā mattā etesanti oramattakāni. Saṃyamakaraṇīyānīti kāyavācāsaṃyamamattena
analyzed: avarā pacchimā mattā oramattakāni saṃyama karaṇīyāni iti kāya vācā saṃyama mattena
translated: They are called “to be done by restraint” because they are to be done by means of the restraint consisting in the bodily and verbal restraint of the bhikkhu who has gone into retreat.

original: kattabbapaṭikammāni, vikkhipitabbāni vā. “Puna na evaṃ karomī”ti cittena saṃvaramattena,
analyzed: kattabba paṭikammāni vikkhipitabbāni vā puna na evam karomi iti cittena saṃvara mattena
translated: Or they are to be done by means of the mere restraint of the mind, by means of the mere resolution “I will not do so again,” or by means of the restraint of the faculties.

original: indriyasaṃvareneva vā karaṇīyāni saṃvarakaraṇīyāni. Divivihārajanapadavāsī divivihāravāsī.
analyzed: indriya saṃvarena iva vā karaṇīyāni saṃvara karaṇīyāni divivihāra janapada vāsī divivihāra vāsī
translated: The “dwelling in a divine abiding” is the dwelling in the divine abiding of loving-kindness.

original: Manassa adhiṭṭhānameva adhiṭṭhānāvikammaṃ. Desanā idha “vuṭṭhānāvikamma”nti adhippetā.🔽Tattha “cittuppādakaraṇīyāni manasikārapaṭibaddhānī”ti vacanato pātimokkhasaṃvaravisuddhatthaṃ
analyzed: manassa adhiṭṭhānam eva adhiṭṭhāna avikammam desanā idha vuṭṭhāna avikamman ti adhippetā  tattha citta uppāda karaṇīyāni manasikāra paṭibaddhāni iti vacanato
translated: The “resolution” is the mere resolution of the mind. The “resolution of the mind’s aspiration” is the same as this.

original: anatikkamanīyāni anāpattigamanīyāni vajjāni vuttānīti ācariyassa adhippāyo. Catubbidhassāti
analyzed: an atikkamanīyāni anāpatti gamanīyāni vajjāni vuttāni iti ācariyassa adhippāyaḥ catubbidhassa ati
translated: Herein, the teacher’s intention is this: since it is said that “they are to be done by arousing the mind and are dependent on attention,” the offences that are not to be exceeded for the purpose of purifying the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha are called “not to be transgressed.”

original: attānuvādaparānuvādadaṇḍaduggatibhayassa.
analyzed: atta anuvāda para anuvāda daṇḍa duggati bhayassa
translated: The fourfold fear is fear of blame by oneself, by others, by kings, and of unhappy destinations.

original: 516. “Idha bhikkhū”ti bhikkhu eva adhippetoti sandhāya “sesasikkhā pana atthuddhāravasena
analyzed: idha bhikkhu iti bhikkhu eva adhippeto ti sandhāya sesa sikkhā pana attha uddhāra vasena
translated: Herein, the bhikkhu is intended by “bhikkhu” . The teacher’s intention is this: “The other training courses are to be understood in the way already stated in the exposition of the meaning of the training precepts.

original: sikkhā-saddassa atthadassanatthaṃ vuttā”ti āha. Bhikkhuggahaṇaṃ pana aggaparisāmukhena
analyzed: sikkhā saddassa attha dassana attham vuttā iti āha bhikkhu ggahaṇam pana agga parisā mukhena
translated: He said that the word “training” is mentioned in order to show the meaning of the word “training.”🔽But the mention of bhikkhus is made in order to show all four assemblies, which are the producers of all the training.

original: sabbajjhānanibbattakānaṃ catunnampi parisānaṃ dassanatthaṃ kataṃ. Guṇato vā bhikkhu
analyzed: sabbajjhāna nibbattakānam catunnam pi parisānam dassana attham katam guṇataḥ vā bhikkhu
translated: Or bhikkhus are intended as the best assembly.🔽So all the training should be regarded as intended here.

original: adhippetoti sabbāpi sikkhā idhādhippetāti daṭṭhabbā. Sabbena sikkhāsamādānenāti ettha
analyzed: adhippeto ti sabbā api sikkhā idha adhippetā ati daṭṭhabbā sabbena sikkhā samādānena ati ettha
translated: As to “by all the undertaking of the training”:

original: yena samādānena sabbāpi sikkhā samādinnā honti, taṃ ekampi sabbasamādānakiccakarattā
analyzed: yena samādānena sabbā api sikkhā samādinnā honti tam ekam pi sabba samādāna kiccakarattā
translated: by means of the undertaking by which all the training is undertaken, that is one undertaking, since it performs the function of all the undertakings,🔽is called “all the undertaking.” But there is nothing to be said about many .

original: sabbasamādānaṃ nāma hoti, anekesu pana vattabbameva natthi. Sabbena sikkhitabbākārenāti🔽avītikkamadesanāvuṭṭhānavattacaraṇādiākārena. Vītikkamanavasena sesassapi nissesatākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: sabba samādānam nāma hoti anekesu pana vattabbam eva na atthi sabbena sikkhitabba ākārena ati  a vītikkama desanā vuṭṭhāna vatta caraṇa ādi ākārena vītikkamana vasena sesassa api nissesa tā karaṇam
translated: As to “by all the modes of training”:🔽by means of the mode of training consisting in non-transgression, teaching, getting up , conduct of behaviour, etc.

original: sandhāya “bhinnassapī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sandhāya bhinnaḥ sa api iti ādim āha
translated: With reference to the fact that the rest is not left out by way of transgression he said “even if broken” , etc.

original: 519. Āvaraṇīyehi cittaparisodhanabhāvanā jāgariyānuyogoti katvā āha “bhāvana”nti.
analyzed: āvaraṇīyehi citta parisodhana bhāvanā katvā āha bhāvana nti
translated: Since the development of the mind is purification of the mind from hindrances, and the practice of wakefulness is the practice of the way of purification, he said “development” .

original: Suppapariggāhakanti “suppapariggāhakaṃ nāma idaṃ ito pubbe ito parañca natthi, ayametassa
analyzed: suppa pariggāhakanti suppa pariggāhakam nāma idam itas pubbe itas param ca na atthi ayam etassa
translated: Easy to understand: “Easy to understand” means that there is nothing more easy to understand than this. This is

original: paccayo”tiādinā pariggāhakaṃ.
analyzed: paccaya uti ādinā pariggāhakam
translated: “Well-analyzed”: analyzed as “This is the condition for that.”

original: 520-521. Yuttoti ārambhamāno. Sātaccaṃ nepakkañca pavattayamāno jāgariyānuyogaṃ anuyutto hotīti sambandhaṃ dasseti.🔽522. Lokiyāyapi…pe… āhāti idaṃ vipassanābhāvanāya satipaṭṭhānādayo ekasmiṃ ārammaṇe
analyzed: yuttaḥ ti ārambhamānaḥ sātaccam nepakkam ca pavattayamānaḥ jāgariya anuyogam anuyuttaḥ hoti iti sambandham dasseti  āha ati idam vipassanā bhāvanāya sati paṭṭhāna ādayaḥ ekasmin ārammaṇe
translated: “Attentive”: he shows the connection by saying that he is devoted to the practice of wakefulness, being energetic and maintaining mindfulness and clear comprehension.

original: saha nappavattanti, pavattamānānipi indriyabalāni bojjhaṅgesveva antogadhāni honti.
analyzed: saha na ppavattanti pavattamānāni api indriya balāni bojjhaṅgesu eva antogadhāni honti
translated: “In the mundane”: this is said because the foundations of mindfulness, etc., do not occur together with insight meditation, and because the faculties and powers, though occurring, are included in the factors of enlightenment.

original: Pītisambojjhaṅgaggahaṇena hi tadupanissayabhūtaṃ saddhindriyaṃ saddhābalañca gahitameva
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅga gahaṇena hi tad upanissaya bhūtam saddhā indriyam saddhā balam ca gahitam eva
translated: For by the factor of enlightenment of rapture the faculty of faith and the power of faith, which are the support for rapture, are included,

original: hoti “saddhūpanisaṃ pāmojja”nti vuttattā. Maggaṅgāni pañceva vipassanākkhaṇe pavattantīti
analyzed: hoti saddhūpanisam pāmojjanti vutta ttā maggaṅgāni pañca eva vipassanā khaṇe pavattanti iti
translated: since it is said: “Rapture is conditioned by faith” . And only five factors of the path occur at the moment of insight.

original: imamatthaṃ sandhāya vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: imam attham sandhāya vuttam ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: This is the meaning intended by the statement.

original: 523. Samantato, sammā, samaṃ vā sātthakādipajānanaṃ sampajānaṃ, tadeva sampajaññaṃ. Tenāti satisampayuttattā eva uddese avuttāpi sati niddese “sato”ti iminā vuttāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: samantataḥ sammā samam vā sa atthaka ādi pajānanam sampajānam tat eva sampajaññam tena ati sati sampayutta ttā eva uddese a vuttā api sati niddese sato ti iminā vuttā ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: 1. Understanding of what is useful, etc., is clear comprehension. It is the same as the clear comprehension of what is useful, etc., mentioned in the definition of clear comprehension in the Path of Purification. The intention is that although mindfulness is not mentioned in the definition, it is included because it is associated with clear comprehension.🔽Clear comprehension of what is useful is clear comprehension of going out and returning, etc., that is useful. So too with the clear comprehension of what is suitable.

original: Sātthakānaṃ abhikkamādīnaṃ sampajānanaṃ sātthakasampajaññaṃ. Evaṃ sappāyasampajaññaṃ.🔽Abhikkamādīsu pana bhikkhācāragocare aññatthāpi ca pavattesu avijahite kammaṭṭhānasaṅkhāte🔽gocare sampajaññaṃ gocarasampajaññaṃ. Abhikkamādīsu asammuyhanameva sampajaññaṃ asammohasampajaññaṃ.
analyzed: sa atthakānam abhikkama ādīnam sampajānanam sa atthaka sampajaññam evam sa ppāya sampajaññam  abhikkama ādīsu pana bhikkhā ācāra gocare aññattha api ca pavattesu a vijahite kammaṭṭhāna saṅkhāte  gocare sampajaññam gocara sampajaññam abhikkama ādīsu a sammuyhanam eva sampajaññam a sammoha sampajaññam
translated: But clear comprehension of resort is clear comprehension of the resort called the meditation subject, which occurs in going out and returning, etc., and in other activities as well.🔽Clear comprehension of non-delusion is clear comprehension that is simply non-delusion in going out and returning, etc.

original: Dve kathāti vacanakaraṇākaraṇakathā na kathitapubbā. Vacanaṃ karomi eva, tasmā subbacattā paṭivacanaṃ demīti attho.
analyzed: dve kathā ati vacana karaṇa akaraṇa kathā na kathita pubbā vacanam karomi eva tasmai subbacattā paṭivacanam demi iti attho
translated: The two kinds of talk: talk about doing and talk about not doing. Talk about doing is talk about what ought to be done. Talk about not doing is talk about what ought not to be done. Talk about doing is talk about what is allowable. Talk about not doing is talk about what is not allowable. Talk about doing is talk about what is blameless. Talk about not doing is talk about what is blameworthy. Talk about doing is talk about what is proper. Talk about not doing is talk about what is improper. Talk about doing is talk about what is beneficial. Talk about not doing is talk about what is harmful. Talk about doing is talk about what is allowable and beneficial. Talk about not doing is talk about what is not allowable and harmful. Talk about doing has not been mentioned before. The meaning is: I do what ought to be done, therefore I give a reply.

original: Kammaṭṭhānasīsenevāti kammaṭṭhānaggeneva, kammaṭṭhānaṃ padhānaṃ katvā evāti attho.
analyzed: kammaṭṭhāna sīsena iva ati kammaṭṭhāna aggena iva kammaṭṭhānam padhānam katvā eva ati attho
translated: With the meditation subject as the forerunner: with the meditation subject as the leader. The meaning is: making the meditation subject the chief thing.

original: Tena “pattampi acetana”ntiādinā vakkhamānaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ, yathāparihariyamānaṃ vā
analyzed: tena pattam pi acetana nti ādinā vakkhamānam kammaṭṭhānam yathā parihariyamānam vā
translated: So the meditation subject that will be described beginning with “The bowl, too, is without consciousness” can be undertaken in this way, or in any other way that occurs to a man of understanding.

original: avijahitvāti dasseti. “Tasmā”ti etassa “dhammakathā kathetabbāyevāti vadantī”ti etena
analyzed: a vijahitvā ati dasseti tasmā ati etassa dhamma kathā kathetabbāya iva ati vadanti iti etena
translated: “Therefore” : the connection is this: they say that the Dhamma talk should be given.

original: sambandho. Bhayeti paracakkādibhaye.
analyzed: sambandhaḥ bhaya iti para cakka ādi bhaye
translated: “Danger” : from a foreign army, etc.

original: Avasesaṭṭhāneti yāguaggahitaṭṭhāne. Ṭhānacaṅkamanamevāti adhiṭṭhātabbiriyāpathavasena vuttaṃ, na bhojanādikāle avassaṃ kattabbanisajjāyapi paṭikkhepavasena.
analyzed: avasesa ṭṭhāne ti yāgu agga hita ṭṭhāne ṭhāna caṅkamanam eva ti adhiṭṭhātabba biriyāpatha vasena vuttam na bhojana ādi kāle avassam kattabba nisajjāya api paṭikkhepa vasena
translated: “The rest of the place” : the place where the gruel is served. “Just walking and standing” : this is said with reference to the deportment that should be determined upon, not with reference to sitting, which is not to be done at all times during the meal, etc.

original: Thero dārucīriyo –🔽“Tasmātiha te, bāhiya, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ. Diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute mute🔽viññāte. Yato kho te, bāhiya, diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute mute viññāte viññātamattaṃ
analyzed: theraḥ dārucīriyaḥ  tasmā ati ha te bāhiye evam sikkhitabbam diṭṭhe diṭṭha mattam bhavissati sute mute  viññāte yatas kho te bāhiya diṭṭhe diṭṭha mattam bhavissati sute mute viññāte viññāta mattam
translated: The Elder Dārucīriya:🔽“Therefore, Bāhiya, you should train yourself thus: In the seen will be merely what is seen; in the heard will be merely what is heard; in the sensed will be merely what is sensed; in the cognized will be merely what is cognized.

original: bhavissati, tato tvaṃ, bāhiya, na tena, yato tvaṃ, bāhiya, na tena. Tato tvaṃ, bāhiya,
analyzed: bhavissati tato tvam bāhiya na tena yatas tvam bāhiya na tena tatas tvam bāhiya
translated: When for you there will be only what is seen, only what is heard, only what is sensed, only what is cognized, then, Bāhiya, there is no you in terms of that.🔽When there is no you in terms of that, then there is only the I-making, the mine-making, the mental proliferation in regard to the seen, the heard, the sensed, the cognized.

original: na tattha, yato tvaṃ, bāhiya, na tattha. Tato tvaṃ, bāhiya, nevidha na huraṃ na ubhayamantarena.
analyzed: na tattha yatas tvam bāhiya na tattha tatas tvam bāhiya na ividha na huram na ubhayam antarena
translated: “There is no self there, Bahiya, where there is no eye, no forms, no eye-consciousness, no eye-contact, and no feeling that arises with eye-contact as its condition.

original: Esevanto dukkhassā”ti –
analyzed: esevantaḥ dukkhassa ati
translated: This is the end of suffering.”

original: Ettakena arahattaṃ sacchākāsi.🔽Khāṇuādipariharaṇatthaṃ, patiṭṭhitapādapariharaṇatthaṃ vā passena haraṇaṃ vītiharaṇanti
analyzed: ettakena arahattam sacchākāsi  khāṇu ādi pariharaṇa attham patiṭṭhita pāda pariharaṇa attham vā passena haraṇam vītiharaṇam ti
translated: and he realized Arahantship.🔽They say that the “passing over” is the carrying of the body past the tree, etc., in order to avoid it, or the carrying of the body past the place where the foot was planted.

original: vadanti. Yāva patiṭṭhitapādo, tāva āharaṇaṃ atiharaṇaṃ, tato paraṃ haraṇaṃ vītiharaṇanti
analyzed: vadanti yāva patiṭṭhita pādo tāva āharaṇam atiharaṇam tatas param haraṇam vītiharaṇanti
translated: The “going beyond” is the carrying of the body as far as the planted foot; the “passing over” is the carrying of the body beyond that.

original: ayaṃ vā etesaṃ viseso. Avīcinti nirantaraṃ.
analyzed: ayam vai etesam visesaḥ nirantaram
translated: Or the difference is this: the “passing over” is without interruption.

original: Paṭhamajavanepi…pe… na hotīti idaṃ pañcaviññāṇavīthiyaṃ itthipurisoti rajjanādīnaṃ🔽abhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tattha hi āvajjanavoṭṭhabbanānaṃ ayoniso āvajjanavoṭṭhabbanavasena
analyzed: na hoti iti idam pañca viññāṇa vīthiyam itthi puriso ti rajjana ādīnam  abhāvam sandhāya vuttam tattha hi āvajjana voṭṭhabbanānam ayonisas āvajjana voṭṭhabbana vasena
translated: “In the first impulsion, etc., there is no lust, etc.,” because in the cognitive series of the five consciousnesses there is no lust, etc.,🔽for the lust, etc., that occur there are only the lust, etc., of the adverting and the impulsion.🔽For in the case of an agreeable visible form, etc., greed arises through the wrong adverting and wrong impulsion that occur in the mind door.

original: iṭṭhe itthirūpādimhi lobho, aniṭṭhe ca paṭigho uppajjati. Manodvāre pana itthipurisoti
analyzed: iṭṭhe itthi rūpa ādimhi lobhaḥ aniṭṭhe ca paṭighaḥ uppajjati manaḥ dvāre pana itthi puriso ti
translated: And in the case of a disagreeable visible form, etc., resentment arises.

original: rajjanādi hoti, tassa pañcadvārajavanaṃ mūlaṃ, yathāvuttaṃ vā sabbaṃ bhavaṅgādi.
analyzed: rajjana ādi hoti tassa pañca dvāra javanam mūlam yathā vuttam vā sabbam bhavaṅga ādi
translated: and the five-door impulsions are the root of that, or else all the life-continuum, and so on, are the root as already described.

original: Evaṃ manodvārajavanassa mūlavasena mūlapariññā vuttā. Āgantukatāvakālikatā pana pañcadvārajavanasseva
analyzed: evam manaḥ dvāra javanassa mūla vasena mūla pariññā vuttā āgantuka tā avakālika tā pana pañca dvāra javanassa iva
translated: So the “full understanding by way of the root” of the mind-door impulsion is stated by way of its root. But the “full understanding by way of what is merely arrived at and what merely occurs” is only of the five-door impulsion

original: apubbatittaratāvasena. Maṇisappo sīhaḷadīpe vijjamānā ekā sappajātīti vadanti. Calananti kampanaṃ.
analyzed: apubba tittara tā vasena maṇi sappaḥ sīhaḷadīpe vijjamānā ekā sappa jātī iti vadanti calanam ti kampanam
translated: by way of what is not previously known and what is new. They say that the “jewel-snake” is a kind of snake found in Ceylon. “Shaking” is trembling.

original: Atiharatīti yāva mukhā āharati. Vītiharatīti tato yāva kucchi, tāva harati, kucchigataṃ
analyzed: atiharati iti yāva mukhe āharati vītiharati iti tatas yāva kucchi tāva harati kucchi gatam
translated: “It carries” : it brings to the mouth. “It conveys” : it carries from there to the stomach, or it carries what is in the stomach.

original: vā passato harati. Allattañca anupāletīti vāyuādīhi ativisosanaṃ yathā na hoti, tathā
analyzed: vā passataḥ harati allattam ca anupāleti iti vāyu ādīhi ati visosanam yathā na hoti tathā
translated: “It keeps it moist” : it keeps it from being over-dried by wind, etc.

original: pāleti. Ābhujatīti pariyesanajjhoharaṇajiṇṇājiṇṇatādiṃ āvajjeti, vijānātīti attho.
analyzed: pāleti ābhujati iti pariyesana ajjhoharaṇa jiṇṇa ajiṇṇa tā ādim āvajjeti vijānāti iti attho
translated: “It digests it” : it adverts to the seeking, the eating, the worn and unworn state, etc., of what is eaten; the meaning is, it cognizes.

original: Taṃtaṃvijānananipphādakoyeva hi payogo “sammāpayogo”ti vuttoti. Atha vā “sammāpaṭipattimāgamma
analyzed: taṃ taṃ vijānana nipphādakaḥ yā iva hi payogo sammāpayogo ti vutto ti atha vā sammā paṭipattim āgamma
translated: For the function that produces the several kinds of cognizing is called “right function.” Or alternatively,

original: abbhantare attā nāma koci bhujanako natthī”tiādinā vijānanaṃ ābhujanaṃ.
analyzed: abbhantare attā nāma koci bhujanakaḥ natthi iti ādinā vijānanam ābhujanam
translated: “There is no such being as a self or soul that eats.”

original: Aṭṭhāneti manussāmanussapariggahite ayutte ṭhāne khettadevāyatanādike. Tumbato veḷunāḷiādiudakabhājanato. Tanti chaḍḍitaṃ udakaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭhāne ti manussa amanussa pariggahite ayutte ṭhāne khetta devāyatana ādike tumbataḥ veḷu nāḷi ādi udaka bhājanato tanti chaḍḍitam udakam
translated: “In a place” means in a place not suitable for a bhikkhu, such as a field, a shrine, etc., which are owned by human beings or non-human beings. “In a vessel” means in a bamboo tube, etc., which are water-vessels. “Water” means the water that is poured out.

original: Gateti gamaneti pubbe abhikkamapaṭikkamaggahaṇena gamanepi purato pacchato ca kāyassa atiharaṇaṃ vuttanti idha gamanameva gahitanti veditabbaṃ, vakkhamāno vā etesaṃ viseso.🔽Ettakenāti kammaṭṭhānaṃ avissajjetvā catunnaṃ iriyāpathānaṃ pavattanavacanamattena🔽gocarasampajaññaṃ na pākaṭaṃ hotīti attho. Evaṃ pana sutte kammaṭṭhānaṃ avibhūtaṃ
analyzed: gate ti gamane ti pubbe abhikkama paṭikkama gahaṇena gamane pi puratas pacchatas ca kāyassa atiharaṇam vuttanti idha gamanam eva gahitanti veditabbam vakkhamānaḥ vā etesam viseso  ettakena ati kammaṭṭhānam a vissajjetvā catunnam iriyāpathānam pavattana vacana mattena  gocara sampajaññam na pākaṭam hoti iti attho evam pana sutte kammaṭṭhānam avibhūtam
translated: “In going” means in going forward and in going back. The meaning should be understood as follows: by the taking of the path in going forward and in going back, the carrying of the body in front and behind is also stated. Or the difference between them will be stated.🔽“In this extent” means that the knowledge of the surrounding area is not evident by the mere statement of the occurrence of the four postures without giving up the meditation subject. The meaning is that the meditation subject is not evident in the sutta.

original: hotīti caṅkamanaṭṭhānanisajjāsu eva pavatte pariggaṇhantassa sutte pavattā apākaṭā hontīti attho.
analyzed: hoti iti caṅkamana ṭṭhāna nisajjāsu eva pavatte pariggaṇhantassa sutte pavattāḥ apākaṭāḥ honti iti attho
translated: And the meaning is that the occurrence of the meditation subject in the sutta is not evident to one who is discerning the occurrence of the meditation subject in walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: Kāyādikiriyāmayattā āvajjanakiriyāsamuṭṭhitattā ca javanaṃ, sabbampi vā chadvārappavattaṃ kiriyāmayapavattaṃ nāma, dutiyajjhānaṃ vacīsaṅkhāravirahā “tuṇhībhāvo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: kāya ādi kiriyā āmaya ttā āvajjana kiriyā samuṭṭhita ttā ca javanam sabbam pi vā cha dvāra ppavattam kiriyāmayapavattam nāma dutiya jhānam vacī saṅkhāra virahā tuṇhībhāvaḥ ti vuccati
translated: Or all the occurrence of the six doors is called “occurrence consisting in kamma-result” because it is the result of kamma that generates the life-continuum. Or the second jhāna is called “silence” because it is free from the disturbance of speech.

original: 526. Upāsanaṭṭhānanti issāsānaṃ viya upāsanassa sikkhāyogakaraṇassa kammaṭṭhānaupāsanassa
analyzed: upāsana ṭṭhānam ti issā āsānam viya upāsanassa sikkhā yoga karaṇassa kammaṭṭhāna aupāsanassa
translated: The place for practice: the meaning is the place for the practice of the meditation subject consisting in the development of the meditation, as for archers the place for practice is the target.🔽  Or the meaning is the place for the practice of the meditation subject consisting in the practice of the meditation, as for archers the place for practice is the bow.

original: ṭhānanti attho. Tameva hi atthaṃ dassetuṃ “yogapatha”nti āhāti. Sīsaṃ dhovatīti icchādāsabyā
analyzed: ṭhānam ti attho tam eva hi attham dassetum yogapatham ti āha ati sīsam dhovati iti icchā dāsabyā
translated: The word “path” is said in order to show that same meaning.

original: bhujissataṃ ñāpayati, micchāpaṭipannehi vā pakkhittaṃ ayasarajaṃ dhovati.🔽529. Vinayapariyāyena adinnādānapārājike āgataṃ. Suttantapariyāyena āraññakasikkhāpade🔽“pañcadhanusatikaṃ pacchima”nti āgataṃ āraññikaṃ bhikkhuṃ sandhāya. Na hi so vinayapariyāyike
analyzed: bhujissatam ñāpayati micchā paṭipannehi vā pakkhittam ayasa rajam dhovati  vinaya pariyāyena adinnādāna pārājike āgatam suttanta pariyāyena āraññaka sikkhāpade  pañca dhanusatikam pacchimanti āgatam āraññikam bhikkhum sandhāya na hi saḥ vinaya pariyāyike
translated: He washes his head: he makes known his state of being a slave of desire, or he washes off the iron dust thrown up by the ploughshare.🔽  In the Vinaya it is given in the pārājika rule on theft.🔽  In the Suttanta it is given in the training precept on the forest-dweller’s practice thus, “The forest is a place one arrow-shot away from a village” .

original: araññe vasanato “āraññako pantasenāsano”ti sutte vuttoti.
analyzed: araññe vasanatas āraññako panta senāsanaḥ ti sutte vutto ti
translated: It is given with reference to a forest-dwelling bhikkhu. For one who lives in the forest according to the Vinaya is not called a forest-dweller in the Suttanta, which says, “He dwells in the forest, in the jungle, in a mountain glen, in a rocky cave, in a charnel ground, in a jungle-hut, in the open air, on a heap of grass” .

original: 530. “Nitumba”ntipi “nadīkuñja”ntipi yaṃ vadanti, taṃ kandaranti apabbatapadesepi vidugganadīnivattanapadesaṃ kandaranti dasseti.
analyzed: yam vadanti tam kandaranti a pabbata padese pi vidugga nadī nivattana padesam kandaranti dasseti
translated: “Cave” : he shows that a cave is a place in a mountain or a place where a river turns and twists.

original: 531. Bhājetvā dassitanti etena bhājetabbataṃ ante niddesassa kāraṇaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: bhājetvā dassitanti etena bhājetabba tam ante niddesassa kāraṇam dasseti
translated: “Having shown by dividing up” : by this he shows the reason for the placing of the demonstrative pronoun at the end.🔽“Secret” : it is fit for secret action, thus it is “fit for secrecy” .

original: 533. Rahassa kiriyā rahassaṃ, taṃ arahati tassa yogganti rāhasseyyakaṃ. Vicittā hi taddhitāti. Rahasi vā sādhu rahassaṃ, tassa yoggaṃ rāhasseyyakaṃ.🔽536. Paṇihitoti suṭṭhu ṭhapito.🔽537. Pariggahitaniyyānanti pariggahitaniyyānasabhāvaṃ, kāyādīsu suṭṭhu pavattiyā
analyzed: rahassa kiriyā rahassam tam arahati tassa yoggam ti rāhasseyyakam vicittā hi rahasi vā sādhu rahassam tassa yoggam rāhasseyyakam  paṇihito ti suṭṭhu ṭhapito  pariggahita niyyānam ti pariggahita niyyāna sabhāvam kāya ādīsu suṭṭhu pavattiyā
translated: “Well placed” : well placed in the body, etc.,🔽“With the outlet well apprehended” : with the outlet well apprehended in the body, etc.,

original: niyyānasabhāvayuttanti attho. Kāyādipariggahaṇaṃ ñāṇaṃ vā pariggaho, taṃ-sampayuttatāya🔽pariggahitaṃ niyyānabhūtaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ katvāti attho.
analyzed: niyyāna sabhāva yuttanti attho kāya ādi pariggahaṇam ñāṇam vā pariggaho tad sampayutta tāya  pariggahitam niyyāna bhūtam upaṭṭhānam katvā iti atthaḥ
translated: the meaning is, with the outlet well apprehended, well placed, in the body, etc.🔽“With the occurrence of change” : the meaning is, with the occurrence of change in consciousness.

original: 542-543. Vikārappattiyāti cittassa vikārāpattibhāvenāti attho. Sabbasaṅgāhikavasenāti
analyzed: vikāra ppattiyā āti cittassa vikāra āpatti bhāvena ati attho sabba saṅgāhika vasena ati
translated: “By way of the all-inclusive” :

original: sattasaṅkhāragatasabbakodhasaṅgāhikavasena. Sabbasaṅgahaṇañca samucchedappahānassapi
analyzed: satta saṅkhāra gata sabba kodha saṅgāhika vasena sabba saṅgahaṇam ca samuccheda ppahānassa api
translated: as the collector of all the dangers that are in the seven categories of phenomena.🔽And the collecting of all is the abandoning by cutting off.

original: adhippetattā katanti veditabbaṃ.🔽546. Idaṃ sandhāyāti “dve dhammā”ti sandhāya. Ekavacanena “thinamiddha”nti uddisitvāpi
analyzed: adhippeta ttā katam ti veditabbam  idam sandhāya ati dve sandhāya eka vacanena uddisitvā api
translated: and as the collector of all the dews in the seven standpoints of the aggregates of grasping. And the “collecting together” should be understood as the abandoning by cutting off.🔽. “With reference to this”: with reference to “two ideas”. Although “drowsiness and lethargy” is stated by the singular number,

original: niddese “santā”ti vacanabhedo, bahuvacanaṃ katanti attho. Nirodhasantatāyāti vacanaṃ
analyzed: niddese santā ti vacana bhedaḥ bahuvacanam katan ti atthaḥ nirodha santatāya ati vacanam
translated: the difference in the words in the description is “the two” . The meaning is that the plural number is made. The words “the continuity of cessation”

original: aṅgasantatāya, sabhāvasantatāya vā santatānivāraṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: aṅga santatāya sabhāva santatāya vā
translated: are for the purpose of preventing the continuity of the factors of the aggregates or the continuity of the individual essences.

original: 550. Thinamiddhavikāravirahā tappaṭipakkhasaññā ālokasaññā nāma hoti. Teneva vuttaṃ “ayaṃ saññā ālokā hotī”ti.
analyzed: thinam iddha vikāra virahā tad paṭipakkha saññā āloka saññā nāma hoti tena iva vuttam ayam saññā ālokā hoti iti
translated: . The perception of light is called the perception of the opposite of drowsiness and lethargy. That is why it is said, “This perception is light.”

original: 553. “Vantattā muttattā”tiādīni, “ālokā hotī”tiādīni ca “cattattātiādīnī”ti vuttāni.
analyzed: vantattā muttattā atiādīni ālokāḥ hoti itiādīni ca cattattā atiādīni iti vuttāni
translated: . “Because of being vomited, because of being freed” , etc., and “because of being light” , etc., are said to be “because of being four” , etc.

original: Ādi-saddena vā dvinnampi niddesapadāni saṅgahetvā tattha yāni yesaṃ vevacanāni, tāneva
analyzed: ādi saddena vā niddesa padāni saṅgahetvā tattha yāni vevacanāni tān eva
translated: Or, by the word “etc.” the words of the description of both are included, and those that are synonyms for which are stated

original: sandhāya “aññamaññavevacanānī”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Paṭimuñcatoti etena sārambhaṃ
analyzed: sandhāya aññamañña vevacanāni iti vuttanti daṭṭhabbam paṭimuñcato ti etena sa ārambham
translated: and the words “synonyms” should be understood as said with reference to that. “He makes an exertion”: this shows an exertion with a basis.

original: abhibhavaṃ dasseti. Nirāvaraṇā hutvā ābhujati sampajānātīti nirāvaraṇābhogā, taṃsabhāvattā vivaṭā.
analyzed: abhibhavam dasseti nirāvaraṇāḥ hutvā ābhujati sampajānāti iti nirāvaraṇa ābhogā taṃsa bhāvattā vivaṭā
translated: “An exertion without obstruction”: he makes an exertion, he is aware, without obstruction, without hindrance. It is open because it has that nature.

original: 556. “Vikālo nu kho, na nu kho”ti anicchayatāya katavatthujjhācāramūlako vippaṭisāro vatthujjhācāro kāraṇavohārena vuttoti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vikālaḥ nu kho na nu kho ti anicchaya tāya kata vatthu jhācāra mūlakaḥ vippaṭisāraḥ vatthu jhācāro kāraṇa vohārena vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: “He is remorseful”: this is said to be remorse about the basis, which is the root of misconduct, because of the state of not wanting to do it, thinking, “Was it the wrong time or not?”

original: 562. Kilissantīti kilesentīti atthaṃ vadanti, sadarathabhāvena sayameva vā kilissanti. Na hi te uppajjamānā kilesarahitā uppajjantīti.
analyzed: kilissanti iti kilesenti iti attham vadanti sadaratha bhāvena sayam eva vā kilissanti na hi te uppajjamānā kilesa rahitāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: “They defile”: they defile, is the meaning. Or they defile themselves by the state of being a defilement. For they do not arise without being accompanied by defilements.

original: 564. Idheva ca vibhaṅge “upeto hotī”tiādi tattha tattha vuttameva.🔽588. Niddesavasenāti “tattha katamā upekkhā? Yā upekkhā”tiādiniddesavasena. “Imāya
analyzed: idha iva ca vibhaṅge upetaḥ hoti itiādi tattha tattha vuttam eva  niddesa vasena ati tattha katamā upekkhā yā upekkhā ati ādi niddesa vasena imāya
translated: And here in the Vibhaṅga the meaning of “endowed” and so on is given in each case.

original: upekkhāya upeto hotī”tiādi paṭiniddesavasenāti vadanti. “Tattha katamā…pe… imāya
analyzed: upekkhāya upetaḥ hoti itiādi paṭiniddesa vasena ati vadanti imāya
translated: “By means of the description”: by means of the description beginning, “Herein, what is equanimity? It is equanimity” . “He is endowed with this equanimity” and so on is said by means of the re-description, they say. “Herein, what is equanimity? … This equanimity” .

original: upekkhāya upeto hotī”ti etena puggalo niddiṭṭho hoti, “samupeto”tiādinā paṭiniddiṭṭho.
analyzed: upekkhāya upetaḥ hoti iti etena puggalaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ hoti samupetaḥ iti ādinā paṭiniddiṭṭhaḥ
translated: “He is endowed with equanimity” is the person demonstrated, and “endowed, fully endowed” is the demonstration.

original: Yāva vā “samannāgato”ti padaṃ, tāva niddiṭṭho, “tena vuccati upekkhako”ti iminā paṭiniddiṭṭhoti
analyzed: yāva vā samannāgato ti padam tāva niddiṭṭho tena vuccati upekkhako ti iminā paṭiniddiṭṭho ti
translated: Or alternatively, as far as the words “endowed with” go, the person is demonstrated, and by the words “he is called” he is demonstrated again.🔽So the demonstration and the demonstration again should be construed according to these two.

original: tesaṃ vasena niddesapaṭiniddesā yojetabbā. Pakārenāti upekkhāya “upekkhanā”tiādidhammappakārena
analyzed: tesam vasena niddesa paṭiniddesāḥ yojetabbā pakārena ati upekkhāya upekkhanā ati ādi dhamma ppakārena
translated: As to the mode of progress: they establish the meaning of the word “equanimity” by the mode of progress of the idea of equanimity,

original: “upeto samupeto”tiādipuggalappakārena ca upekkhakasaddassa atthaṃ ṭhapento paṭṭhapenti.
analyzed: upetaḥ samupetaḥ iti ādi puggala ppakārena ca upekkhaka saddassa attham ṭhapentaḥ paṭṭhapenti
translated: and they establish the meaning of the word “equanimity” by the mode of progress of the person who is “endowed, fully endowed.”

original: “Upekkhā”ti etassa atthassa “upekkhanā”ti kāraṇaṃ. Upekkhanāvasena hi upekkhāti.🔽Tathā “upeto samupeto”ti etesaṃ “upāgato samupāgato”ti kāraṇanti evaṃ dhammapuggalavasena
analyzed: upekkhā ati etassa atthassa upekkhanā ati kāraṇam upekkhanā vasena hi upekkhāti  tathā upetaḥ samupetaḥ iti etesam upāgataḥ samupāgataḥ iti kāraṇam ti evam dhamma puggala vasena
translated: “Equanimity” is the reason for the meaning of “equanimity.” For it is because of equanimity that there is equanimity.🔽Similarly, “endowed, fully endowed” is the reason for the meaning of “endowed, fully endowed.” So they explain by showing the reason for each meaning in this way, according to the ideas and the person.

original: tassa tassatthassa kāraṇaṃ dassentā vivaranti, “upekkhako”ti imasseva vā atthassa
analyzed: tassa tassa atthassa kāraṇam dassentā vivaranti upekkhakaḥ ti imassa eva vā atthassa
translated: Or they explain by showing the reason for the meaning of “equanimity” only, in this way:

original: “imāya upekkhāya upeto hotī”tiādinā kāraṇaṃ dassentā. “Upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā samupeto”tiādinā
analyzed: imāya upekkhāya upetaḥ hoti itiādinā kāraṇam dassentāḥ upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā samupetaḥ itiādinā
translated: and they show the reason for it in the phrase ‘Endowed with this equanimity’ and so on.🔽They analyse the terms in the phrase ‘Endowed with equanimity, endowed with the act of equanimity, endowed with the state of equanimity’ and so on.🔽Or else the word ‘equanimity’ is a term for the equanimity that is the fourth jhāna factor.

original: byañjanānaṃ vibhāgaṃ dassentā vibhajanti. Upekkhaka-saddantogadhāya vā upekkhāya🔽tasseva ca upekkhaka-saddassa visuṃ atthavacanaṃ “yā upekkhā upekkhanā”tiādinā, “imāya
analyzed: byañjanānam vibhāgam dassentāḥ vibhajanti upekkhaka sadda anta ugadhāya vā upekkhāya  tassa iva ca upekkhaka saddassa visum attha vacanam yā upekkhā upekkhanā ati ādinā imāya
translated: The analysis of the terms is as follows: ‘Equanimity’ is the equanimity that is the fourth jhāna factor.🔽‘Endowed with this equanimity’ is the analysis of the term.🔽The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of being neutral, the state of not being biased, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being excited.🔽The meaning of ‘endowed’ is the state of being furnished, the state of being provided, the state of being supplied, with that equanimity.

original: upekkhāya upeto hotī”tiādinā ca byañjanavibhāgo. Sabbathā aññātatā nikujjhitabhāvo,
analyzed: upekkhāya upetaḥ hoti iti ādinā ca byañjana vibhāgaḥ sabbathā aññāta tā nikujjhita bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being excited.🔽The meaning of ‘endowed’ is the state of being furnished, the state of being provided, the state of being supplied, with that equanimity.

original: kenaci pakārena viññātepi niravasesaparicchindanābhāvo gambhīrabhāvo.
analyzed: kenaci pakārena viññāte pi niravasesa paricchindana abhāvaḥ gambhīra bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being excited.🔽The meaning of ‘endowed’ is the state of being furnished, the state of being provided, the state of being supplied, with that equanimity.🔽The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being excited.🔽The meaning of ‘endowed’ is the state of being furnished, the state of being provided, the state of being supplied, with that equanimity.

original: 602. Uparibhūmippattiyāti idaṃ “rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā”ti ettheva yojetabbaṃ. Viññāṇañcāyatanādīnipi vā ākāsānañcāyatanādīnaṃ uparibhūmiyoti sabbatthāpi na na yujjati.
analyzed: upari bhūmi ppattiyā ti idam rūpa saññānam samatikkama ati ettha eva yojetabbam viññāṇañcāyatana ādīni pi vā ākāsānañcāyatana ādīnam upari bhūmiyā iti sabbattha api na na yujjati
translated: The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being excited.🔽The meaning of ‘endowed’ is the state of being furnished, the state of being provided, the state of being supplied, with that equanimity.

original: 610. Viññāṇañcāyatananiddese “anantaṃ viññāṇanti taṃyeva ākāsaṃ viññāṇena phuṭaṃ
analyzed: viññāṇañcāyatana niddese anantam viññāṇanti tat yeva ākāsam viññāṇena phuṭam
translated: The meaning of ‘equanimity’ is the state of being even, the state of not being uneven, the state of not being agitated, the state of not being

original: manasi karoti anantaṃ pharati, tena vuccati anantaṃ viññāṇa”nti ettha viññāṇenāti
analyzed: manasi karoti anantam pharati tena vuccati anantam viññāṇan ti ettha viññāṇena ati
translated: He gives attention to it as infinite, he pervades (the kasiṇa) with consciousness, thus it is said, ‘He gives attention to it as infinite consciousness.’

original: etaṃ upayogatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, taṃyeva ākāsaṃ phuṭaṃ viññāṇaṃ manasi karotīti kira
analyzed: etam upayoga atthe karaṇa vacanam taṃ yeva ākāsam phuṭam viññāṇam manasi karoti iti kira
translated: Herein, ‘with consciousness’ is a locative case used adverbially. It is said in the commentary that he gives attention to that same space pervaded by consciousness.

original: aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Ayaṃ vā etassa attho – taṃyeva ākāsaṃ phuṭaṃ viññāṇaṃ viññāṇañcāyatanaviññāṇena
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam ayam vā etassa attho tam yeva ākāsam phuṭam viññāṇam viññāṇañca āyatana viññāṇena
translated: Or this is the meaning here: he gives attention to that same space pervaded by consciousness by means of the consciousness of the base consisting of boundless consciousness.

original: manasi karotīti. Ayaṃ panattho yutto – taṃyeva ākāsaṃ viññāṇena phuṭaṃ tena gahitākāraṃ
analyzed: manasi karoti iti ayam pana atthaḥ yuttaḥ tam yeva ākāsam viññāṇena phuṭam tena gahita ākāram
translated: But this meaning is appropriate: he gives attention to that same space pervaded by consciousness, to the aspect of its being apprehended by that consciousness,

original: manasi karoti, evaṃ taṃ viññāṇaṃ anantaṃ pharatīti. Yañhi ākāsaṃ paṭhamāruppasamaṅgī🔽viññāṇena anantaṃ pharati, taṃ pharaṇākārasahitameva viññāṇaṃ manasikaronto dutiyāruppasamaṅgī
analyzed: manasi karoti evam tam viññāṇam anantam pharati iti yat hi ākāsam paṭhama āruppa samaṅgī  viññāṇena anantam pharati tam pharaṇa ākāra sahitam eva viññāṇam manasikarontaḥ dutiya āruppa samaṅgī
translated: thus that consciousness of his pervades the infinite. For the first-obtainer, who pervades the space with consciousness as infinite,

original: anantaṃ pharatīti vuccatīti.
analyzed: anantam pharati iti vuccati iti
translated: gives attention to the consciousness associated with the aspect of its pervading, and he is called one who pervades the infinite.

original: 615. Taṃyeva viññāṇaṃ abhāvetīti yaṃ pubbe “anantaṃ viññāṇa”nti manasi kataṃ, taṃyevāti attho. Tasseva hi ārammaṇabhūtaṃ paṭhamena viya rūpanimittaṃ tatiyenāruppena abhāvetīti.
analyzed: tam yeva viññāṇam abhāveti iti yam pubbe anantam viññāṇam ti manasi katam tam yeva ati attho tassa iva hi ārammaṇa bhūtam paṭhamena viya rūpa nimittam tatiyena āruppena abhāveti iti
translated: He dissolves away that same consciousness: the meaning is that he dissolves away that same consciousness which was previously brought to mind as “infinite consciousness.” For that immaterial state dissolves away the sign of materiality as object, as it were, with the first immaterial state.

original: Niddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description is finished.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhājanīya is finished.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽623. Abhidhammabhājanīye pañcakanayadassane “pañca jhānānī”ti ca, “tattha katamaṃ
analyzed: abhidhamma bhājanīye pañcaka naya dassane pañca jhānāni iti ca tattha katamam
translated: The Abhidhammabhājanīya

original: paṭhamaṃ jhāna”nti ca ādinā uddhaṭaṃ. Uddhaṭānaṃyeva catunnaṃ paṭhamatatiyacatutthapañcamajjhānānaṃ
analyzed: paṭhamam ca ādinā uddhaṭam catunnam paṭhama tatiya catuttha pañcama jhānānam
translated: In the demonstration of the fivefold method in the Abhidhammabhājanīya, the five jhānas are stated thus, “Five jhānas” , and the first, third, fourth, and fifth jhānas are brought in thus, “Herein, what is the first jhāna? ” , etc.,

original: dassanato, dutiyasseva visesadassanato ca.
analyzed: dassanataḥ dutiyassa iva visesa dassanataḥ ca
translated: and the second is brought in by the words, “The second jhāna … the third jhāna … the fourth jhāna … the fifth jhāna … is of two kinds” , and so on.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhājanīya is finished.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The Pañhapucchaka

original: 640. Lokuttarāpanetthāti etesu tīsujhānesu “lokuttarā siyā appamāṇārammaṇā”ti evaṃ
analyzed: etesu tīsu jhānesu lokuttarā siyā appamāṇa ārammaṇā ti evam
translated: The supramundane is included here too. In the case of these three jhānas, the supramundane may have an immeasurable object.

original: koṭṭhāsikā pana maggakāle, phalakāle vā lokuttarabhūtā evāti adhippāyo. Paricchinnākāsakasiṇālokakasiṇānāpānabrahmavihāracatutthāni
analyzed: koṭṭhāsikā pana magga kāle phala kāle vā lokuttara bhūtā eva ati adhippāyo
translated: The kasiṇa of air, the four divine abidings, and the fourth of the immaterial states

original: sabbatthapādakacatutthe saṅgahitānīti daṭṭhabbāni.
analyzed: sabbattha pādaka catutthe saṅgahitāni iti daṭṭhabbāni
translated: should be regarded as included in the fourth of the all-pervading .

original: Buddhapaccekabuddhakhīṇāsavā maggaṃ bhāvayiṃsu, phalaṃ sacchikariṃsūti, bhāvessanti
analyzed: buddha paccekabuddha khīṇāsavāḥ maggam bhāvayiṃsu phalam sacchikariṃsu iti bhāvessanti
translated: “The Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and those with cankers destroyed have developed the path and realized the fruition”

original: sacchikarissantīti ca heṭṭhimamaggaphalānaṃ vasena vuttanti veditabbaṃ. Kusalato
analyzed: sacchikarissanti iti ca heṭṭhima magga phalānam vasena vuttan ti veditabbam kusalato
translated: and “will develop and will realize” should be understood as said with reference to the lower path and fruition.

original: terasasu hi catutthesu ayaṃ kathā pavattā, na ca kusalacatutthena arahattamaggaphalāni daṭṭhuṃ sakkoti.
analyzed: terasasu hi catutthesu ayam kathā pavattā na ca kusala catutthena arahatta magga phalāni daṭṭhum sakkoti
translated: For this discussion occurs in the fourth of the thirteen kinds of profitable , and the fourth of the profitable cannot be taken as the path and fruition of Arahantship.

original: “Kiriyato terasanna”nti ettha lokuttaracatutthaṃ kiriyaṃ natthīti “dvādasanna”nti
analyzed: kiriyato ettha lokuttara catuttham kiriyam natthi iti
translated: “Twelve of the functional” here: there is no supramundane fourth of the functional, so “twelve” should be said.

original: vattabbaṃ, kusalato vā terasasu sekkhaphalacatutthaṃ antogadhaṃ katvā “kiriyato terasanna”nti
analyzed: vattabbam kusalataḥ vā terasasu sekkha phala catuttham antogadham katvā kiriyato
translated: Or, since the fourth of the functional of the trainer is included in the thirteen kinds of profitable, “thirteen of the functional” should be said.

original: asekkhacatutthena saha vadatīti veditabbaṃ. Sabbatthapādakañcettha khīṇāsavānaṃ yāni
analyzed: asekkha catutthena saha vadati iti veditabbam sabbattha pādakam ca ittha khīṇāsavānam yāni
translated: It should be understood that he speaks with the fourth path of the Asekha.

original: abhiññādīni santi, tesaṃ sabbesaṃ pādakattā sabbatthapādakanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Na hi
analyzed: abhiññā ādīni santi tesam sabbesam pādaka ttā sabbattha pādakanti daṭṭhabbam na hi
translated: Herein, it is the footing for all because it is the footing for all the kinds of direct-knowledge, etc., that exist in those who are without cankers.🔽For they have no round of rebirths.

original: tesaṃ vaṭṭaṃ atthīti. Paricchannākāsakasiṇacatutthādīni viya vā navattabbatāya sabbatthapādakasamānattā🔽sabbatthapādakatā daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: tesam atthi iti paricchanna ākāsa kasiṇa catuttha ādīni viya vā nava ttabba tāya sabbattha pādaka samāna ttā  sabbattha pādaka tā daṭṭhabbā
translated: Or alternatively, it is the footing for all because it is the same as the footing for all in that it is not to be made, like the fourth jhāna in the kasiṇa of the limited-space pervasion.🔽The mental formations are perception and feeling or else the four aggregates.

original: Manosaṅkhārā nāma saññāvedanā, cattāropi vā khandhā. Nimittaṃ ārabbhāti ettha “nimittaṃ nibbānañcā”ti vattabbaṃ.🔽“Ajjhatto dhammo ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo”ti ettha “ajjhattā
analyzed: manaḥ saṅkhārāḥ nāma saññā vedanā cattāro api vā khandhāḥ nimittam ārabbha ati ettha nimittam nibbānam ca ati vattabbam  ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ti ettha ajjhattā
translated: As regards “with a sign as the support” , “sign” should be taken as “sign and extinction” .

original: khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa yathākammūpagañāṇassa anāgataṃsañāṇassa
analyzed: khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgataṃsa ñāṇassa
translated: As regards “An internal thing is a condition, as the object condition, for an internal thing” , it is said that “The internal aggregates are a condition, as the object condition, for the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, for the knowledge of the past lives, for the knowledge of faring according to deeds, for the knowledge of the future,

original: āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo”ti vuttattā na cetopariyañāṇaṃ viya yathākammūpagañāṇaṃ
analyzed: āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ti vutta ttā na cetaḥ pariya ñāṇam viya yathā kammūpaga ñāṇam
translated: for adverting” . So the knowledge of faring according to deeds is not like the knowledge of penetration of minds.

original: parasantānagatameva jānāti, sasantānagatampi pana apākaṭaṃ rūpaṃ dibbacakkhu viya
analyzed: para santāna gatam eva jānāti sa santāna gatam pi pana apākaṭam rūpam dibba cakkhu viya
translated: He knows only what is in the mental continuity of others, but he also penetrates what is obscure in his own mental continuity, like the divine eye.

original: apākaṭaṃ kammaṃ vibhāveti. Tenāha “attano kammajānanakāle”ti.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: apākaṭam kammam vibhāveti tena āha attano kamma jānana kāle iti  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: He penetrates what is obscure in kamma. That is why he says “when he knows his own kamma.”🔽The commentary on the questions and answers is ended.

original: Jhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽13. Appamaññāvibhaṅgo
analyzed: jhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  appamaññā vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The commentary on the analysis of the jhānas is ended.🔽The analysis of the measureless states

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽642. Sabbadhīti disādesodhinā anodhisopharaṇaṃ vuttaṃ, sabbattatāya sabbāvantanti
analyzed: sabbadhi iti disā desa udhinā vuttam sabbattatāya
translated: The commentary on the sutta dealing with the measureless states🔽“In all directions” is said with reference to the direction-bound, and “in their entirety” is said with reference to the all-bound.

original: sattodhinā. Tenāha “anodhiso dassanattha”nti. Tathā-saddo iti-saddo vā na vuttoti🔽“mettāsahagatena cetasā”ti etassa anuvattakaṃ taṃ dvayaṃ tassa pharaṇantarādiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tena āha dassana tthanti tathā saddaḥ iti saddaḥ vā na vuttaḥ ti  mettā sahagatena cetasā ti etassa anuvattakam tam dvayam tassa
translated: That is why he says “in order to show the all-bound.”

original: aṭṭhānanti katvā na vuttaṃ, puna “mettāsahagatena cetasā”ti vuttanti attho.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam ti katvā na vuttam puna mettā sahagatena cetasā ati vuttam ti attho
translated: The meaning is that the two terms “in all ways” and “in their entirety” are not stated again because they are implied by the term “with a mind accompanied by loving-kindness.”

original: 643. Hirottappānupālitā mettā na parihāyati āsannasapattassa rāgassa sinehassa ca vipattiyā anuppattitoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: hira uttappa anupālitā mettā na parihāyati āsanna sapattassa rāgassa sinehassa ca vipattiyāḥ anuppattito ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that loving-kindness guarded by shame and moral dread does not decline because of the non-arising of the misfortune of lust and affection for a near and dear person.

original: 645. Adhimuñcitvāti suṭṭhu pasāretvāti attho. Taṃ dassento “adhikabhāvenā”tiādimāha, balavatā vā adhimokkhena adhimuccitvā.
analyzed: adhimuñcitvā iti suṭṭhu pasāretvā iti atthaḥ tam dassentaḥ adhika bhāvena ati ādim āha balavatā vā adhimokkhena adhimuccitvā
translated: “Having extended it well” means having extended it thoroughly. Showing that, he said “by extending it beyond” . Or else, having extended it with strong resolution.

original: 648. Heṭṭhā vuttoyevāti “sabbena sabbaṃ sabbathā sabba”nti etesaṃ “sabbena sikkhāsamādānena
analyzed: heṭṭhā vuttaḥ yeva ati sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbanti etesam sabbena sikkhā samādānena
translated: “The meaning has already been given” . The meaning of “all in every way” and “all in every way in every aspect” has already been given in the explanation of the jhānas as follows:🔽“All in every way in every aspect” means all in every way by undertaking the training;

original: sabbaṃ sikkhaṃ, sabbena sikkhitabbākārena sabbaṃ sikkha”nti ca jhānavibhaṅge attho
analyzed: sabbam sikkham sabbena sikkhitabba ākārena sabbam sikkhanti ca jhāna vibhaṅge attho
translated: all in every way in every aspect by training in every aspect that should be trained in.

original: vutto. Idha pana sabbena avadhinā attasamatāya sabbasattayuttatāya ca sabbaṃ lokaṃ,
analyzed: vuttaḥ idha pana sabbena avadhinā atta sama tāya sabba satta yutta tāya ca sabbam lokam
translated: But here the meaning that is appropriate is: all the world by all the time, by the equality of self and the other, and by the fact that all beings are related to self;

original: sabbāvadhidisādipharaṇākārehi sabbaṃ lokanti ca attho yujjati.
analyzed: sabba avadhi disā ādi pharaṇa ākārehi sabbam lokam ti ca atthaḥ yujjati
translated: and all the world by all the time, by the pervasion of the directions, etc., and by the fact that all beings are related to self.

original: 650. Paccatthikavighātavasenāti mettādīnaṃ āsannadūrapaccatthikānaṃ rāgabyāpādādīnaṃ vighātavasena. Yaṃ appamāṇaṃ, so averoti so averabhāvoti ayaṃ vā tassa atthoti.
analyzed: paccatthika vighāta vasena ati mettā ādīnam āsanna dūra paccatthikānam rāga byāpāda ādīnam vighāta vasena yam appamāṇam saḥ averaḥ iti saḥ avera bhāvo ti ayam vā tassa attho ti
translated: “By the act of destroying enemies” means by the act of destroying the enemies of loving-kindness, etc., which are greed, hate, etc., whether near or far. The measureless state is the absence of hate. Or the meaning is that the absence of hate is its meaning.

original: 653. Nirayādi gati, caṇḍālādi kulaṃ, annādīnaṃ alābhitā bhogo. Ādi-saddena dubbaṇṇatādi gahitaṃ.
analyzed: niraya ādi gati caṇḍāla ādi kulam anna ādīnam alābhi tā bhogaḥ ādi saddena dubbaṇṇa tā ādi gahitam
translated: and the ugly state, etc., are included by the word “and so on.”

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhāṇavāra is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Pañhapucchaka

original: 699. Imasmiṃ pana…pe… kathitāti iminā imasmiṃ vibhaṅge kathitānaṃ lokiyabhāvameva
analyzed: imasmin panape iminā imasmin vibhaṅge lokiya bhāvam eva
translated: In this, etc. By this he shows that the mundane nature only of those stated in this Vibhaṅga is intended,

original: dassento khandhavibhaṅgādīhi visesetīti na aññattha lokuttarānaṃ appamaññānaṃ kathitatā anuññātā hoti.
analyzed: dassentaḥ khandha vibhaṅga ādīhi viseseti iti na aññattha lokuttarānam appamaññānam kathita tā anuññātā hoti
translated: and he distinguishes them from those in the Khandha Vibhaṅga, etc., so that the fact that the supramundane kinds of the measureless states are stated elsewhere is not denied.

original: Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Pañhapucchaka is ended.

original: Appamaññāvibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: appamaññā vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the measureless states is ended.

original: 14. Sikkhāpadavibhaṅgo
analyzed: sikkhāpada vibhaṅgo
translated: The exposition of the training precepts

original: 1. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra

original: 703. Patiṭṭhānaṭṭhenāti sampayogavasena upanissayavasena ca okāsabhāvena. Piṭṭhapūvaodanakiṇṇanānāsambhāre🔽pakkhipitvā madditvā katā surā nāma. Madhukādipupphapanasādiphalaucchumuddikādinānāsambhārānaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena ati sampayoga vasena upanissaya vasena ca okāsa bhāvena piṭṭha pūva odana kiṇṇa nānā sambhāre 🔽pakkhipitvā madditvā katā surā nāma
translated: As bases: as the physical basis in the sense of the support for the associated states and as the physical basis in the sense of the object.

original: rasā ciraparivāsitā merayaṃ nāma, āsavoti attho.
analyzed: rasā cira parivāsitā merayam nāma āsavo ti attho
translated: Taste is the long-standing habit-energy of craving, which is what is meant by “intoxicant.”

original: 704. Taṃsampayuttattāti viratisampayuttattā, viraticetanāsampayuttattā vā.
analyzed: tad sampayutta ttā ati virati sampayutta ttā virati cetanā sampayutta ttā vā
translated: “ Associated with that” means associated with the abstention, or associated with the volition of abstention.

original: Kammapathā evāti asabbasādhāraṇesu jhānādikoṭṭhāsesu kammapathakoṭṭhāsikā evāti attho.
analyzed: kamma pathāḥ evā ti asabba sādhāraṇesu jhāna ādi koṭṭhāsesu kamma patha koṭṭhāsikāḥ evā ti attho
translated: “ Only the courses of action” means only the constituents of the courses of action, not all the constituents of the jhānas, etc.

original: Surāpānampi “surāpānaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ…pe… nirayasaṃvattanika”nti visuṃ kammapathabhāvena
analyzed: surā pānam pi surā pānam bhikkhave āsevitam pe niraya saṃvattanikam ti visum kammapatha bhāvena
translated: They say that drinking liquor is a course of action in its own right, for it is stated thus: “Bhikkhus, drinking liquor and wine is a practice that is the basis for heedlessness … it leads to states of woe” .🔽If that were so, there would be eleven courses of action, so it should be regarded as included among the courses of action already mentioned

original: āgatanti vadanti. Evaṃ sati ekādasa kammapathā siyuṃ, tasmāssa yathāvuttesveva kammapathesu🔽upakārakattasabhāgattavasena anupaveso daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vadanti evam sati ekādasa kamma pathā siyum tasmā assa yathā vuttesu eva kamma pathesu  upakāraka tta sabhā gatta vasena anupavesaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: by way of its being a contributory factor and having the same nature.

original: Sattaitthipurisārammaṇatā tathāgahitasaṅkhārārammaṇatāya daṭṭhabbā. “Pañca sikkhāpadā
analyzed: satta aitthi purisa ārammaṇa tā tathā gahita saṅkhāra ārammaṇa tāya daṭṭhabbā pañca sikkhāpadā
translated: The object of the seven courses of action consisting of killing living beings, etc., should be regarded as a woman, a man, a human being, and a non-human being, respectively. The object of the courses of action consisting of taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, and false speech should be regarded as belonging to another, a woman, and a human being, respectively. The object of the courses of action consisting of malicious speech, harsh speech, and gossip should be regarded as a human being, a human being, and a human being, respectively. The object of the five training precepts should be regarded as a living being, a woman, a man, an object of enjoyment, and a human being, respectively.🔽“The five training precepts have a limited object” .

original: parittārammaṇā”ti hi vuttaṃ. “Sabbāpi hi etā vītikkamitabbavatthuṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā🔽veracetanāhi eva viramantī”ti ca vakkhatīti.
analyzed: paritta ārammaṇā ti hi vuttam sabbā api hi etāḥ vītikkamitabba vatthum ārammaṇam katvā 🔽vera cetanāhi eva viramanti iti ca vakkhati iti
translated: “For all of them abstain from the object by means of the volition of non-transgression.”

original: Gorūpasīlako pakatibhaddo. Kākaṇikamattassa atthāyātiādi lobhavasena musākathane
analyzed: gorūpasīlakaḥ pakatibhaddo kākaṇika mattassa lobha vasena musā kathane
translated: The one of bovine deportment, who is naturally bad, is the one who speaks falsehood through greed for a mere trifle.🔽The schism in the Saṅgha, which is the worst kind of lying, is included under the heading of speaking falsehood through hate.🔽But in the case of speaking falsehood through hate for the purpose of bringing loss to another, the lesser and greater seriousness should be understood according to the qualities of the other.

original: vuttaṃ. Dosavasena musākathane ca niṭṭhappatto saṅghabhedo gahito. Dosavasena parassa🔽byasanatthāya musākathane pana tassa tassa guṇavasena appasāvajjamahāsāvajjatā yojetabbā,
analyzed: vuttam dosa vasena musā kathane ca niṭṭha ppattaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ gahitaḥ dosa vasena parassa  byasana tthāya musā kathane pana tassa tassa guṇa vasena appasāvajja mahāsāvajja tā yojetabbā
translated: And in the case of speaking falsehood through hate for the purpose of killing, etc., they are included only in the two, namely, the training precept on magic and the training precept on what is not the proper conduct.🔽If it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as abstinence, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct.🔽But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence.🔽But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct.

original: mandādhimattabyasanicchāvasena ca. Nissaggiyathāvaravijjāmayiddhimayā sāhatthikāṇattikesveva🔽pavisantīti dve eva gahitā.🔽Pañcapi kammapathā evāti cetanāsaṅkhātaṃ pariyāyasīlaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, viratisīlaṃ pana maggakoṭṭhāsikanti. Tesaṃ panāti sesasīlānaṃ.
analyzed: manda adhimatta byasana icchā vasena ca nissaggi yathāvara vijjā maya iddhi mayā sāhatthika āṇattikesu eva  pavisanti iti dve eva gahitā  pañca api kammapathāḥ evā ti cetanā saṅkhātam pariyāya sīlam sandhāya vuttam virati sīlam pana magga koṭṭhāsikan ti tesam pana ati sesa sīlānam
translated: But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence.🔽But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct.🔽But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence.🔽But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of abstinence, then virtue as virtue in the sense of restraint is included under the heading of virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct.

original: 712. “Koṭṭhāsabhāvenā”ti vuttaṃ, “patiṭṭhānabhāvenā”ti pana vattabbaṃ. Ettha pana🔽sikkhāpadavāre pahīnapañcābhabbaṭṭhānassa arahato viramitabbaverassa sabbathā abhāvā
analyzed: koṭṭhāsa bhāvena ati vuttam patiṭṭhāna bhāvena ati pana vattabbam ettha pana 🔽sikkhāpada vāre pahīna pañcābhabba ṭṭhānassa arahataḥ viramitabba verassa sabbathā abhāvā
translated: But if it is said that all five courses of action are virtue as virtue in the sense of what is not the proper conduct,

original: kiriyesu viratiyo na santīti na uddhaṭā, sekkhānaṃ pana pahīnapañcaverattepi taṃsabhāgatāya
analyzed: kiriyesu viratiyaḥ na santi iti na uddhaṭā sekkhānam pana taṃsa bhāga tāya
translated: The abstentions from the kinds of action are not mentioned because there is none in the case of the kinds of action. But in the case of the Initiate, even though the five kinds of hate are abandoned,

original: verabhūtānaṃ akusalānaṃ veranidānānaṃ lobhādīnañca sabbhāvā viratīnaṃ uppatti na
analyzed: vera bhūtānam akusalānam vera nidānānam lobha ādīnam ca sabbhāvā viratīnam uppatti na
translated: the arising of the abstentions from the kinds of unprofit that are hate and from the greed, etc., that are the source of hate is not

original: na bhavissati. Akusalasamuṭṭhitāni ca kāyakammādīni tesaṃ kāyaduccaritādīni verāneva,
analyzed: na bhavissati akusala samuṭṭhitāni ca kāya kamma ādīni tesam kāya duccarita ādīni
translated: impossible. And the bodily action, etc., that are due to unprofit are hate itself,

original: tehi ca tesaṃ viratiyo honteva, yato naphalabhūtassapi uparimaggattayassa aṭṭhaṅgikatā🔽hoti. Sikkhāvāre ca abhāvetabbatāya phaladhammāpi na sikkhitabbā, nāpi sikkhitasikkhassa
analyzed: tehi ca tesam viratiyaḥ hontā iva yatas na phala bhūtassa api upari magga ttayassa aṭṭhaṅgika tā  hoti sikkhāvāre ca abhāvetabba tāya phala dhammā api na sikkhitabbā na api sikkhita sikkhassa
