translated: and the abstentions from them are the absence of hate. So the three higher paths, though not consisting in fruition, have eight factors.

original: uppajjamānā kiriyadhammāti na keci abyākatā sikkhāti uddhaṭā.
analyzed: uppajjamānā kiriya dhammā ati na keci abyākatā sikkhā ati uddhaṭā
translated: And in the case of the training precepts, the states consisting in fruition are not to be trained in because they are not to be developed, and the states consisting in action are not to be trained in because they are not to be given up. So no indeterminate states are mentioned as training.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Requisites of the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: 2. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Questioner

original: 714. Sampattavirativasenāti sampatte paccuppanne ārammaṇe yathāviramitabbato virativasenāti attho.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sampatta virati vasena ati sampatte paccuppanne ārammaṇe yathā viramitabbataḥ virati vasena ati attho 🔽pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: “By way of the abstention that has come about” : the meaning is that it has come about in the way of abstention from the present, that is, the actual, object.

original: Sikkhāpadavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sikkhāpada vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Training Precepts is finished.

original: 15. Paṭisambhidāvibhaṅgo
analyzed: paṭisambhidā vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Analysis of the Discernment of What Is and Is Not the Path

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Teaching

original: 1. Saṅgahavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgaha vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Collection

original: 718. Eseva nayoti saṅkhepena dassetvā tameva nayaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “dhammappabhedassa🔽hī”tiādimāha. Niruttipaṭibhānappabhedā tabbisayānaṃ atthādīnaṃ paccayuppannādibhedehi
analyzed: esa eva nayo ti saṅkhepena dassetvā tam eva nayam vitthārataḥ dassetum dhamma ppabhedassa  hi itiādim āha nirutti paṭibhāna ppabhedā attha ādīnam paccayuppanna ādi bhedehi
translated: This same method: having shown in brief, he now shows that same method in detail, saying “The analysis of the ideas” .

original: bhinditvā veditabbā.
analyzed: bhinditvā veditabbā
translated: The analysis of the language and the analysis of the expression should be understood as the analysis of the meanings, etc., that are their respective domains, by way of the analysis of their origination, etc.

original: “Yaṃ kiñci paccayasamuppanna”nti etena saccahetudhammapaccayākāravāresu āgatāni dukkhādīni
analyzed: yam kiñci paccaya samuppannanti etena sacca hetu dhamma paccaya ākāra vāresu āgatāni dukkha ādīni
translated: By “Whatever is originated dependently” the suffering, etc., included in the section on the Truths, the section on the Root Causes, and the section on Conditions are included.

original: gahitāni. Saccapaccayākāravāresu nibbānaṃ, pariyattivāre bhāsitattho, abhidhammabhājanīye
analyzed: gahitāni sacca paccaya ākāra vāresu nibbānam pariyatti vāre bhāsita tthaḥ abhidhammabhājanīye
translated: In the section on the Truth of Cessation and the section on the Mode of Conveyness, the extinction is included. In the section on the Scriptures, the meaning taught is included. In the section on the Mode of Conveying the True Idea,

original: vipāko kiriyañcāti evaṃ pāḷiyaṃ vuttānameva vasena pañca atthā veditabbā, tathā dhammā ca.
analyzed: vipāko kiriyam ca ati evam pāḷiyam vuttānam eva vasena pañca atthā veditabbā tathā dhammā ca
translated: the five meanings stated in the texts should be understood, namely, the fruition, the inconstant, the natural outcome, the natural result, and the inconstant natural result, and also the ideas.

original: Vidahatīti nibbattakahetuādīnaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ nibbacanaṃ, tadatthaṃ pana vibhāvetumāha
analyzed: vidahati iti nibbattaka hetu ādīnam sādhāraṇam nibbacanam tad attham pana vibhāvetum āha
translated: The word “burns” is a general term for the root cause, etc., that originate it. But in order to demonstrate their meaning he says

original: “pavatteti ceva pāpeti cā”ti. Tesu purimo attho maggavajjesu daṭṭhabbo. Bhāsitampi
analyzed: pavattā iti ca iva pāpā iti ca ati tesu purimaḥ atthaḥ magga vajjesu daṭṭhabbo bhāsitam pi
translated: “He both makes it go forth and makes it reach”: the first meaning should be understood as applying to the paths,🔽for the path makes the meaning go forth by way of the understanding of what is said.

original: hi avabodhanavasena atthaṃ pavattetīti. Maggo pana nibbānaṃ pāpetīti tasmiṃ pacchimo.
analyzed: hi avabodhana vasena attham pavatteti iti maggaḥ pana nibbānam pāpeti iti tasmim pacchimo
translated: But the path makes nibbāna reach , so the second meaning applies to that.

original: Dhammaniruttābhilāpeti ettha dhamma-saddo sabhāvavācakoti katvā āha “yā sabhāvaniruttī”ti,
analyzed: dhamma nirutta abhilāpa iti ettha dhamma saddo sabhāva vācakaḥ iti katvā āha yā sabhāva nirutti iti
translated: As regards “he makes it speak the language of the Dhamma,” the word “Dhamma” is said to denote individual essence,🔽so he said “the language of individual essence.” The meaning is: the language of non-deficiency.

original: aviparītaniruttīti attho. Tassā abhilāpeti tassā niruttiyā avacanabhūtāya paññattiyā
analyzed: a viparīta nirutti iti attho tassā abhilāpe ti tassā niruttiyāḥ avacana bhūtāya paññattiyā
translated: He makes it speak the language of the Dhamma, he makes it speak the description that is the language of the Dhamma.

original: abhilāpeti keci vaṇṇayanti. Evaṃ sati paññatti abhilapitabbā, na vacananti āpajjati,
analyzed: abhilāpeti keci vaṇṇayanti evam sati paññatti abhilapitabbā na vacananti āpajjati
translated: Some commentators explain this as follows. If that is so, then the description would have to be spoken, not the language.🔽But apart from the language there is nothing else to be spoken, to be uttered.

original: na ca vacanato aññaṃ abhilapitabbaṃ uccāretabbaṃ atthi, athāpi phassādivacanehi bodhetabbaṃ
analyzed: na ca vacanataḥ aññam abhilapitabbam uccāretabbam atthi atha api phassa ādi vacanehi bodhetabbam
translated: If it is to be understood and spoken by means of the language of such things as contact,

original: abhilapitabbaṃ siyā, evaṃ sati atthadhammavajjaṃ tehi bodhetabbaṃ na vijjatīti tesaṃ
analyzed: abhilapitabbam siyā evam sati attha dhamma vajjam tehi bodhetabbam na vijjati iti tesam
translated: then in that case the language of the Dhamma would not be the meaning or the Dhamma that is to be understood by means of that language.

original: niruttibhāvo āpajjati. “Phassoti ca sabhāvanirutti, phassaṃ phassāti na sabhāvaniruttī”ti
analyzed: nirutti bhāvaḥ āpajjati phasso ti ca sabhāva nirutti phassam na sabhāva nirutti iti
translated: So the language would be the description. “Contact is the language of individual essence, but ‘contact, contact’ is not the language of individual essence of contact.”

original: dassitovāyamattho, na ca avacanaṃ evaṃpakāraṃ atthi, tasmā vacanabhūtāya eva tassā
analyzed: dassitaḥ uva ayam atthaḥ na ca avacanam evaṃpakāram atthi tasmai vacana bhūtāya eva tassā
translated: But the meaning is indicated, and there is no such statement as that, so the meaning should be regarded as follows:

original: sabhāvaniruttiyā abhilāpe uccāraṇeti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: sabhāva niruttiyāḥ abhilāpe uccāraṇā iti attho daṭṭhabbo
translated: The utterance is the expression of that natural language in the form of a statement.

original: Taṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ saddaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā paccavekkhantassa tasmiṃ sabhāvaniruttābhilāpe
analyzed: tam sabhāva niruttim saddam ārammaṇam katvā paccavekkhantassa tasmin sabhāva nirutta abhilāpe
translated: When he reviews that natural language as an object by making it the object of reviewing,🔽then, because it is said that “knowledge of the classification of natural languages is the discrimination of language,”

original: pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidāti vuttattā niruttisaddārammaṇāya sotaviññāṇavīthiyā
analyzed: pabheda gatam ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā ti vutta ttā nirutti sadda ārammaṇāya sota viññāṇa vīthiyā
translated: after the consciousness-born cognition of the sound of the natural language as object has occurred in the mind door,

original: parato manodvāre niruttipaṭisambhidā pavattatīti vadanti. “Niruttipaṭisambhidā paccuppannārammaṇā”ti🔽ca vacanaṃ saddaṃ gahetvā pacchā jānanaṃ sandhāya vuttanti. Evaṃ pana aññasmiṃ paccuppannārammaṇe
analyzed: paratas manaḥ dvāre nirutti paṭisambhidā pavattati iti vadanti nirutti paṭisambhidā paccuppanna ārammaṇā ti  ca vacanam saddam gahetvā pacchā jānanam sandhāya vuttan ti evam pana aññasmin paccuppanna ārammaṇe
translated: the discrimination of language occurs, they say. And the statement “The discrimination of language has a present object”🔽is said with reference to the subsequent knowledge of the sound after apprehending it. But if it were so,

original: aññaṃ paccuppannārammaṇanti vuttanti āpajjati. Yathā pana dibbasotañāṇaṃ manussāmanussādisaddappabhedanicchayassa
analyzed: aññam paccuppanna ārammaṇanti vuttanti āpajjati yathā pana dibba sota ñāṇam manussa amanussa ādi sadda ppabheda nicchayassa
translated: then it would follow that in the case of any other present object, the knowledge of that would be called “having a present object.” But just as the knowledge of the divine ear is called “having a present object”🔽because it is the knowledge of the sound of a present object, though it is not the knowledge of a sound that has been apprehended as present,

original: paccayabhūtaṃ taṃ taṃ saddavibhāvakaṃ, evaṃ sabhāvāsabhāvaniruttinicchayassa paccayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: paccaya bhūtam tam tam sadda vibhāvakam evam sabhāva asabhāva nirutti nicchayassa paccaya bhūtam
translated: The knowledge that discerns the sound that is the cause of the particular nature and the absence of particular nature is called the discrimination of language.

original: paccuppannasabhāvaniruttisaddārammaṇaṃ taṃvibhāvakañāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidāti vuccamāne
analyzed: paccuppanna sabhāva nirutti sadda ārammaṇam tat vibhāvaka ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā ti vuccamāne
translated: When it is said that the knowledge that discerns the sound that is the cause of the particular nature and the absence of particular nature in the present is the discrimination of language,

original: na pāḷivirodho hoti. Taṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ saddaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā paccavekkhantassāti
analyzed: na pāḷi virodhaḥ hoti tam sabhāva niruttim saddam ārammaṇam katvā paccavekkhantassa ati
translated: there is no contradiction with the text.

original: ca paccuppannasaddārammaṇaṃ paccavekkhaṇaṃ pavattayantassāti na na sakkā vattuṃ.
analyzed: ca paccuppanna sadda ārammaṇam paccavekkhaṇam pavattayantassa ati na na sakkā vattum
translated: And it cannot be said that “while he is reviewing the sound that is the cause of the particular nature and the absence of particular nature”🔽means that he is engaged in reviewing the sound that is the object in the present.

original: Tampi hi ñāṇaṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ vibhāventaṃyeva taṃtaṃsaddapaccavekkhaṇānantaraṃ taṃtaṃpabhedanicchayahetuttā
analyzed: tat pi hi ñāṇam sa bhāva niruttim vibhāventam yāva taṃ taṃ sadda paccavekkhaṇa anantaram taṃ taṃ pabheda nicchaya hetu ttā
translated: For that knowledge arises only as it discerns the particular nature and the absence of particular nature in the sound, since it is the cause for the desire to discern the various kinds of sound that follows upon the reviewing of the various kinds of sound.

original: niruttiṃ bhindantaṃ paṭivijjhantameva uppajjatīti ca pabhedagatampi hotīti. Sabhāvaniruttīti
analyzed: niruttim bhindantam paṭivijjhantam eva uppajjati iti ca pabheda gatam pi hoti iti sabhāva nirutti iti
translated: And it is called “having reached the various kinds” because it arises only as it discerns, penetrates, the various kinds of sound.🔽The particular nature and the absence of particular nature in the sound

original: māgadhabhāsā adhippetāti tato aññaṃ sakkaṭanāmādisaddaṃ sandhāya “aññaṃ panā”ti āha.
analyzed: māgadha bhāsā adhippetā ti tatas aññam sakkaṭa nāma ādi saddam sandhāya aññam pana iti āha
translated: are intended here as the Magadhan language. Therefore, referring to a sound such as “cart” that is other than that, he said, “But another kind of sound.”

original: Byañjananti nipātapadamāha.
analyzed: nipāta padam āha
translated: “The letter” : he means the word-base .

original: Kathitaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ. Bodhimaṇḍa-saddo paṭhamābhisambuddhaṭṭhāne eva daṭṭhabbo,
analyzed: kathitam aṭṭhakathā ayam bodhimaṇḍa saddaḥ paṭhama abhisambuddha ṭṭhāne eva daṭṭhabbo
translated: This is stated in the Commentary. The word “bodhi-tree-mound” should be understood as the place of the first enlightenment,

original: na yattha katthaci bodhirukkhassa patiṭṭhitaṭṭhāne. Suvaṇṇasalākanti seṭṭhasalākaṃ,
analyzed: na yattha katthaci bodhi rukkhassa patiṭṭhita ṭṭhāne suvaṇṇa salākam ti seṭṭha salākam
translated: not as the place where any bodhi-tree is established. “The best kind of writing” is the best kind of record.

original: dhammadesanatthaṃ salākaṃ gahetvāti attho, na paṭisambhidāyaṃ ṭhitena pavāritaṃ,
analyzed: dhamma desana tham salākam gahetvā ati atthaḥ na paṭisambhidā ayam ṭhitena pavāritam
translated: The meaning is that he took up the record for the purpose of teaching the Dhamma, not that he was invited by one who was established in the analytical knowledges.

original: tasmā paṭisambhidāto aññeneva pakārena jānitabbato na sakkaṭabhāsājānanaṃ paṭisambhidākiccanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tasmā paṭisambhidātaḥ aññena iva pakārena jānitabbataḥ na sakkaṭa bhāsā jānanam paṭisambhidā kiccanti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Therefore the intention is that the knowledge of the speech of the Sakkas is not the analytical knowledge because it should be known by a different method from the analytical knowledge.

original: Idaṃ kathitanti māgadhabhāsāya sabhāvaniruttitāñāpanatthaṃ idaṃ idāni vattabbaṃ kathitanti
analyzed: idam kathitam ti māgadha bhāsāya sabhāva nirutti tā ñāpana attham idam idāni vattabbam kathitam ti
translated: “This is stated” means that the meaning of the statement in the Magadhan language is now to be explained.

original: attho. Chaddantavāraṇa -tittirajātakādīsu tiracchānesu ca māgadhabhāsā ussannā, na
analyzed: tittirajātaka ādīsu tiracchānesu ca māgadha bhāsāḥ ussannāḥ na
translated: The meaning is that this is what should be said. In the Chaddanta-vāraṇa, Tittirajātaka, and other stories, the Magadhan language is prominent among animals,

original: oṭṭakādibhāsā sakkaṭaṃ vā.
analyzed: oṭṭaka ādi bhāsā sakkaṭam vā
translated: not the speech of the Oṭṭhas, etc. or the Sakka language.

original: Tatthāti māgadhasesabhāsāsu. Sesā parivattanti ekantena kālantare aññathā honti vinassanti
analyzed: tattha ati māgadha sesa bhāsāsu sesā parivattanti ekantena kāla antare aññathā honti vinassanti
translated: “Among them” means among the Magadhan and Sāvatthi languages. The rest change completely, becoming different at another time, perishing.

original: ca. Māgadhā pana katthaci kadāci parivattantīpi na sabbattha sabbadā sabbathā ca
analyzed: ca māgadhā pana katthaci kadāci parivattanti ipi na sabbattha sabbadā sabbathā ca
translated: But the Magadha country does not change in this way everywhere and always.

original: parivattati, kappavināsepi tiṭṭhatiyevāti “ayamevekā na parivattatī”ti āha. Papañcoti
analyzed: parivattati kappa vināse pi tiṭṭhati yā iva ati ayam eva ekā na parivattati iti āha papañcā iti
translated: It remains even when the world is destroyed. So he said, “This one thing does not change.”🔽“Elaboration” :🔽the meaning is “long duration.”

original: cirāyananti attho. Buddhavacanameva cetassa visayo, teneva “nelaṅgo setapacchādo”ti
analyzed: cirāyananti atthaḥ buddha vacanam eva cetassa visayo tena iva nelaṅgo seta pacchādo ti
translated: If the Buddha’s word is the object of his mind, then when he is asked the verse, “With a black spot, white-backed,”

original: gāthaṃ pucchito citto gahapati “‘kiṃ nu kho etaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā bhāsita’nti?
analyzed: gātham pucchitaḥ cittaḥ gahapati kim nu kho etam bhante bhagavatā bhāsitan ti
translated: the householder Citta replies, “‘What is this, revered sir, spoken by the Exalted One?

original: ‘Evaṃ gahapatī’ti. ‘Tena hi, bhante, muhuttaṃ āgametha, yāvassa atthaṃ pekkhāmī”’ti āhāti vadanti.
analyzed: evam gahapati iti tena hi bhante muhuttam āgametha yāva assa attham pekkhāmi iti āha ati vadanti
translated: ‘“Yes, householder.” “‘Then, revered sir, wait a moment while I consider the meaning of it.”

original: Sabbatthakañāṇanti atthādīsu ñāṇaṃ. Tañhi sabbesu tesu tīsu catūsupi vā pavattattā,
analyzed: sabbatthaka ñāṇanti attha ādīsu ñāṇam tat hi sabbesu tesu tīsu catūsu pi vā pavatta ttā
translated: “Knowledge of all the modes” : knowledge of the meaning, etc. That is called “knowledge of all the modes” because it occurs in all the three or four modes,

original: kusalakiriyabhūtāya paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya dhammatthabhāvato tīsu eva vā pavattattā
analyzed: kusala kiriya bhūtāya paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya dhamma attha bhāvataḥ tīsu eva vā pavatta ttā
translated: or because it occurs in the three modes only, as the mode of things and the mode of the meaning, being the inspired speech that is a wholesome activity.

original: “sabbatthakañāṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Imāni ñāṇāni idamatthajotakānīti sātthakānaṃ paccavekkhitabbattā
analyzed: sabba atthaka ñāṇam ti vuttam imāni ñāṇāni idam attha jotakāni iti sa atthakānam paccavekkhitabba ttā
translated: These knowledges are called “having a meaning” because they are to be reviewed as having a meaning,

original: sabbo attho etassātipi sabbatthakaṃ, sabbasmiṃ khittanti vā. Sekkhe pavattā arahattappattiyā🔽visadā hontīti vadanti. Pubbayogo viya pana arahattappatti arahatopi paṭisambhidāvisadatāya
analyzed: sabbaḥ atthaḥ etassa atipi sabbatthakam sabbasmin khittanti vā sekkhe pavattā arahatta ppattiyā  visadāḥ honti iti vadanti pubba yogaḥ viya pana arahatta ppatti arahataḥ api paṭisambhidā visada tāya
translated: “It is called ‘all-purpose’ because all the meaning is in it, or because it is applied to all.🔽They say that it becomes clear in the adept when he reaches Arahantship.🔽But the attainment of Arahantship is not a condition for the clarity of the special knowledges in the Arahant, as it was for the prior effort.

original: paccayo na na hotīti pañcannampi yathāyogaṃ sekkhāsekkhapaṭisambhidāvisadattakāraṇatā yojetabbā.
analyzed: paccayaḥ na na hoti iti pañcannam pi yathāyogam sekkha asekkha paṭisambhidā visa datta kāraṇa tā yojetabbā
translated: So it should be construed that the special knowledges are clear in the five in the way appropriate to each according to whether they are in training or beyond training.

original: Pucchāya parato pavattā kathāti katvā aṭṭhakathā “paripucchā”ti vuttā. Paṭipattiṃ🔽pūretabbaṃ maññissantīti paṭipattigarutāya lābhaṃ hīḷentena satasahassagghanakampi🔽kambalaṃ vāsiyā koṭṭetvā paribhaṇḍakaraṇaṃ mayā kataṃ āvajjitvā lābhagaruno pariyattidharā
analyzed: pucchāya paratas pavattā kathā iti katvā aṭṭhakathā paripucchā iti vuttā paṭipattim  pūretabbam maññissanti iti paṭipatti garutāya lābham hīḷentena sata sahassa gghana kampi  kambalam koṭṭetvā paribhaṇḍa karaṇam mayā katam āvajjitvā lābha garunā pariyatti dharā
translated: The commentary is called “Questions and Answers” because the answers occur in response to the questions.

original: dhammakathikāva bhavituṃ na maññissantīti vuttaṃ hoti. Ettha ca therassa kaṅkhuppattiyā
analyzed: dhamma kathikā ava bhavitum na maññissanti iti vuttam hoti ettha ca therassa kaṅkhuppattiyā
translated: They will think that the practice must be fulfilled: because of the difficulty of the practice, they will not consider gain, and they will not consider themselves able to be expounders of the Dhamma who are bearers of the tradition, but will think that they must make a mat of coarse grass worth a hundred thousand by tearing it with a razor.

original: pubbe avisadataṃ dassetvā arahattappattassa pañhavissajjanena arahattappattiyā visadatā
analyzed: pubbe a visada tam dassetvā arahatta pattassa pañha vissajjanena arahatta ppattiyāḥ visada tā
translated: Having shown his former lack of lucidity, he shows his lucidity in the attainment of Arahantship by answering the question.

original: dassitā. Tissatthero anantaraṃ vutto tissatthero evāti vadanti.
analyzed: dassitā tissa thero anantaram vuttaḥ tissa thero evā ti vadanti
translated: They say that the Elder Tissa mentioned next is the same as the Elder Tissa mentioned above.

original: Pabhedo nāma maggehi adhigatānaṃ paṭisambhidānaṃ pabhedagamanaṃ. Adhigamo tehi paṭilābho,
analyzed: pabhedaḥ nāma maggehi adhigatānam paṭisambhidānam pabheda gamanam adhigamaḥ tehi paṭilābhaḥ
translated: “Analysis” is the analysis of the kinds of discrimination attained by means of the paths. “Attainment” is the obtaining of them.

original: tasmā so lokuttaro, pabhedo kāmāvacaro daṭṭhabbo. Na pana tathāti yathā adhigamassa🔽balavapaccayo hoti, na tathā pabhedassāti attho. Idāni pariyattiyādīnaṃ adhigamassa
analyzed: tasmā so lokuttaraḥ pabhedaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ daṭṭhabbo na pana tathā ati yathā adhigamassa  balava paccayaḥ hoti na tathā pabhedassa ati atthaḥ idāni pariyattiyā ādīnam adhigamassa
translated: Therefore the attainment is supramundane, but the analysis should be regarded as belonging to the sense sphere. “Not so” means not as the attainment is. The meaning is: not as the attainment is, so is the analysis.

original: balavapaccayattābhāvaṃ, pubbayogassa ca balavapaccayattaṃ dassento “pariyattisavanaparipucchā🔽hī”tiādimāha. Tattha paṭisambhidā nāma natthīti paṭisambhidādhigamo natthīti adhippāyo.🔽Idāni yaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, taṃ dassento “ime panā”tiādimāha. Pubbayogādhigamā hi dvepi
analyzed: balava paccaya tta abhāvam pubba yogassa ca balava paccaya ttam dassento pariyatti savana paripucchā 🔽hi iti ādim āha tattha paṭisambhidā nāma natthi iti paṭisambhidā adhigamaḥ natthi iti adhippāyaḥ 🔽idāni yam vuttam hoti tam dassentaḥ ime pana iti ādim āha pubba yoga adhigamāḥ hi dve pi
translated: Now, in order to show how the attainment is not a powerful condition for the learning, etc., and how prior practice is a powerful condition for it, he says, “The learning, the hearing, the questioning,🔽the investigation, the search, the pondering, the weighing, the judging, the seeing, the knowing, the discerning, the penetrating, the realization, the insight, the view, the illumination, the wisdom, the understanding, the light, the knowledge, the attainment, the penetration, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the knowledge of the truths, the realization of the truths, the penetration of the truths, the seeing of the truths, the

original: visadakāraṇāti “pubbayogo pabhedassa balavapaccayo hotī”ti vuttanti.
analyzed: visada kāraṇā ati pubba yogaḥ pabhedassa balava paccayaḥ hoti iti vuttan ti
translated: “The reason for the distinction” is the previous effort, which is the powerful condition for the distinction.

original: Saṅgahavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅgaha vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the section on inclusion is ended.

original: 2. Saccavārādivaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the section on the truths, etc.

original: 719. Hetuvāre kālattayepi hetuphaladhammā “atthā”ti vuttā, tesañca hetudhammā “dhammā”ti,
analyzed: hetu vāre kālattaye pi hetu phala dhammāḥ vuttā tesam ca hetu dhammāḥ dhammā ti
translated: In the case of the section on cause, the states that are cause and fruit in the three periods of time are stated as “present” . And the states that are cause are stated as “mental data” .

original: dhammavāre veneyyavasena atītānañca saṅgahitattā “uppannā samuppannā”tiādi na vuttanti
analyzed: dhammavāre veneyya vasena atīta anañca saṅgahita ttā uppannā samuppannā iti ādi na vuttanti
translated: In the case of the section on states, since the past states are included in the present, they are not stated as “arisen, become, accomplished,” etc.,

original: atītapaccuppannā “atthā”ti vuttā, taṃnibbattakā ca “dhammā”ti idametesaṃ dvinnampi vārānaṃ nānattaṃ.🔽Saccavārādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: atīta paccuppannāḥ atthā ti vuttā tad nibbattakā ca dhammā ti idam etesam dvinnam pi vārānam nānattam  sacca vāra ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: but they are stated as “present” and the states produced by them as “mental data.” This is the difference between these two sections.🔽The exposition of the section on the truths, etc., is ended.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the section on the discourses is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the section on the Abhidhamma

original: 725. Avuttattāti “tesaṃ vipāke ñāṇa”nti sāmaññena vatvā visesena avuttattāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: a vutta ttā ti tesam vipāke ñāṇam ti sāmaññena vatvā visesena a vutta ttā ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “Because they are not stated”: the intention is that, having been stated in general as “knowledge of their ripening,” they are not stated in particular.

original: Ettha ca kiriyānaṃ avipākattā dhammabhāvo na vuttoti. Yadi evaṃ vipākā na hontīti
analyzed: ettha ca kiriyānaṃ avipāka attā dhamma bhāvaḥ na vutto ti yadi evam vipākāḥ na honti iti
translated: And here the states that are not ripening are not stated as “states” because of the absence of ripening in the formed.

original: atthabhāvo ca na vattabboti? Na, paccayuppannattā. Evañce kusalākusalānampi atthabhāvo
analyzed: attha bhāvaḥ ca na vattabbaḥ ti na paccaya uppanna ttā evañce kusala akusalānam pi attha bhāvaḥ
translated: and it is not proper to say that they have an existing state? No, because they are results. If that is so, then it follows that the profitable and unprofitable have an existing state.

original: āpajjatīti. Nappaṭisiddho, vipākassa pana padhānahetutāya pākaṭattā dhammabhāvova
analyzed: āpajjati iti na paṭisiddhaḥ vipākassa pana padhāna hetutāya pākaṭa ttā dhamma bhāvaḥ uva
translated: It is not so because that is not admitted. But the state of being ideas is stated of them because it is obvious that they are the principal cause of the result.

original: tesaṃ vutto. Kiriyānaṃ paccayattā dhammabhāvo āpajjatīti ce? Nāyaṃ doso appaṭisiddhattā,🔽kammaphalasambandhassa pana ahetuttā dhammabhāvo na vutto. Apica “ayaṃ imassa paccayo,🔽idaṃ paccayuppanna”nti evaṃ bhedaṃ akatvā kevalaṃ kusalākusale vipākakiriyadhamme
analyzed: tesam vuttaḥ kiriyānam paccaya ttā dhamma bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti ce na ayam doso appaṭisiddha ttā  kamma phala sambandhassa pana ahetu ttā dhamma bhāvaḥ na vuttaḥ api ca ayam imassa paccayo  idam paccaya uppannam ti evam bhedam a katvā kevalam kusala akusale vipāka kiriya dhamme
translated: If it be said that it follows that the state of being ideas is that of the indeterminate because it is a condition for the profitable and the unprofitable? There is no fault here because that is not admitted.

original: ca sabhāvato paccavekkhantassa dhammapaṭisambhidā atthapaṭisambhidā ca hotītipi tesaṃ🔽atthadhammatā na vuttāti veditabbā. Kusalākusalavāresu ca dhammapaṭisambhidā kusalākusalānaṃ
analyzed: ca sabhāvataḥ paccavekkhantassa dhamma paṭisambhidā attha paṭisambhidā ca hoti iti pi tesam  attha dhamma tā na vuttā iti veditabbā kusala akusala vāresu ca dhamma paṭisambhidā kusala akusalānam
translated: But the state of being ideas is not stated of them because they are not a cause for the continuity of the kamma-result. Besides, the state of being ideas is not stated of them because it is only when the profitable and the unprofitable and the resultant and the functional ideas are reviewed in general without distinguishing their difference thus “This is a condition for that, that is a result of this” that there is the discrimination of ideas and the discrimination of states.

original: paccayabhāvaṃ sattivisesaṃ sanipphādetabbataṃ passantī nipphādetabbāpekkhā hotīti
analyzed: paccaya bhāvam satti visesam sa nipphādetabba tam passantī nipphādetabba apekkhā hoti iti
translated: And in the case of the profitable and unprofitable, the discrimination of ideas is the reviewing of the profitable and unprofitable as conditions, as a particular kind of being, and as what has results to be produced. It is the expectation of what has results to be produced.

original: taṃsambandheneva “tesaṃ vipāke ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā”ti vuttaṃ. Sabhāvadassanamattameva
analyzed: tad sambandhena iva tesam vipāke ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā ti vuttam sabhāva dassana mattam eva
translated: and it is said that “the knowledge of their result is the discernment of meaning” because of its connection with them.🔽But the function of the discernment of meaning is merely to show the individual essence of the states.

original: pana atthapaṭisambhidāya kiccaṃ nipphannaphalamattadassanatoti tassā nipphādakānapekkhattā
analyzed: pana attha paṭisambhidāya kiccam nipphanna phalamatta dassanato ti tassāḥ nipphādaka an apekkha ttā
translated: For it shows only the result that has been produced. And because it does not expect a further production,

original: vipākavāre “tesaṃ vipaccanake ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”ti na vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vipāka vāre tesam vipaccanake ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ti na vuttan ti veditabbam
translated: it should be understood that it is not said of the result-constituent that “the knowledge of their result is the discernment of states.”🔽“Individual essences and individual characteristics”: not the individual essence of a being, etc., or the undistorted individual essence.

original: Sabhāvapaññattiyāti na sattādipaññattiyā, aviparītapaññattiyā vā. Khobhetvāti lomahaṃsajananasādhukāradānādīhi🔽khobhetvā. Puna dhammassavane jānissathāti appassutattā dutiyavāraṃ kathento tadeva
analyzed: sabhāva paññattiyā ti na satta ādi paññattiyā aviparīta paññattiyā vā khobhetvā iti loma haṃsa janana sādhukāra dāna ādīhi  khobhetvā puna dhammassavane jānissatha ati appassuta ttā dutiya vāram kathento tat eva
translated: “Having stirred them up”: having stirred them up by giving good words, etc., that cause the hairs to stand up.

original: kathessatīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: kathessati iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “You will know at the next preaching of the Dhamma”: the intention is that he will be speaking on the same subject again because of his lack of learning.

original: 746. Bhūmidassanatthanti ettha kāmāvacarā lokuttarā ca bhūmi “bhūmī”ti veditabbā, cittuppādā vāti.
analyzed: bhūmi dassana atthanti ettha kāmāvacarā lokuttarā ca bhūmi bhūmī iti veditabbā cittuppādā vā
translated: “To show the plane”: here the plane should be understood as the supramundane plane in the sense sphere, and the occurrences of consciousness.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on the Abhidhamma basket is finished.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the questions

original: 747. Paccayasamuppannañca atthaṃ paccayadhammañcāti vacanehi hetādipaccayasamuppannānaṃ
analyzed: paccaya samuppannam ca attham paccaya dhammam ca ati vacanehi hetu ādi paccaya samuppannānam
translated: The words “arisen by condition” and “a state that is a condition” show🔽

original: kusalākusalarūpānampi atthapariyāyaṃ, hetādipaccayabhūtānaṃ vipākakiriyarūpānampi🔽dhammapariyāyañca dasseti. Paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya kāmāvacaravipākārammaṇatā mahaggatārammaṇatā🔽ca paṭisambhidāñāṇārammaṇatte na yujjati paṭisambhidāñāṇānaṃ kāmāvacaralokuttarakusalesu
analyzed: kusala akusala rūpānam pi attha pariyāyam hetu ādi paccaya bhūtānam vipāka kiriya rūpānam pi  dhamma pariyāyam ca dasseti paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya kāmāvacara vipāka ārammaṇa tā mahaggata ārammaṇa tā  ca paṭisambhidā ñāṇa ārammaṇa tte na yujjati paṭisambhidā ñāṇānam kāmāvacara lokuttara kusalesu
translated: The words “meaning originated by conditions” and “state that is a condition” show the meaning-class of the profitable and unprofitable materiality originated by conditions such as kamma, and the state-class of resultant and functional materiality that is a condition such as kamma.

original: kāmāvacarakiriyālokuttaravipākesu ca uppattito. Sabbañāṇārammaṇatāya sati yujjeyya,
analyzed: kāmāvacara kiriyā lokuttara vipākesu ca uppattito sabba ñāṇa ārammaṇa tāya sati yujjeyya
translated: The conditionality of the kinds of knowledge consisting in the analytical insights is not appropriate as the object of the kinds of knowledge consisting in the analytical insights, because the kinds of knowledge consisting in the analytical insights occur only in the sense sphere and the fine-material sphere,🔽and the kinds of knowledge consisting in the analytical insights are the object of knowledge of all,

original: “yena ñāṇena tāni ñāṇāni jānātī”ti vacanato pana na sabbañāṇārammaṇatāti kathayanti.
analyzed: yena ñāṇena tāni ñāṇāni jānāti iti vacanato pana na sabba ñāṇa ārammaṇa tā iti kathayanti
translated: but they say that it is not appropriate to say that the conditionality of the kinds of knowledge consisting in the analytical insights is the object of knowledge of all because of the words, “By means of that knowledge he knows those knowledges” .

original: Suttantabhājanīye pana “ñāṇesu ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā”ti avisesena vuttattā
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīye pana ñāṇesu ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti avisesena vutta ttā
translated: But in the Suttantabhājana it is said without distinction, “The knowledge of the kinds of knowledge is the analytical insight of intellectual clarit” ,

original: sabbañāṇārammaṇatā siyā. Abhidhammabhājanīyepi cittuppādavasena kathanaṃ niravasesakathananti
analyzed: sabbañāṇa ārammaṇa tā siyā abhidhamma bhājanīye pi cittuppāda vasena kathanam niravasesa kathanan ti
translated: so it may be the object of knowledge of all. And in the Abhidhammabhājana it is said that the statement is made by way of the occurrence of consciousnesses without distinction,

original: yathādassitavisayavacanavasena “yena ñāṇena tāni ñāṇāni jānātī”ti yaṃ vuttaṃ, taṃ🔽aññārammaṇataṃ na paṭisedhetīti. Yathā ca atthapaṭisambhidāvisayānaṃ na niravasesena
analyzed: yathā dassita visaya vacana vasena yena ñāṇena tāni ñāṇāni jānāti iti yam vuttam tam  añña ārammaṇa tam na paṭisedheti iti yathā ca attha paṭisambhidā visayānam na niravasesena
translated: The words “By means of which he knows those knowledges” show that the knowledge of the discernment of perspicuity does not conflict with the knowledge of discernment of language as to the object as seen.

original: kathanaṃ abhidhammabhājanīye, evaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāvisayassapīti. Evaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya🔽sabbañāṇavisayattā “tisso paṭisambhidā siyā parittārammaṇā siyā mahaggatārammaṇā
analyzed: kathanam abhidhamma bhājanīye evam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā visayassa api iti evam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya  sabba ñāṇa visaya ttā tissaḥ paṭisambhidā siyā paritta ārammaṇā siyā mahaggata ārammaṇā
translated: And just as the knowledge of the discernment of meaning does not state the whole of its object in the Abhidhamma, so too the knowledge of the discernment of perspicuity does not.

original: siyā appamāṇārammaṇā”ti vuttā.🔽Yadipi “siyā atthapaṭisambhidā na maggārammaṇā”ti vacanato abhidhammabhājanīye vuttapaṭisambhidāsveva🔽pañhapucchakanayo pavatto. Na hi maggo paccayuppanno na hoti, abhidhammabhājanīye
analyzed: siyā appamāṇa ārammaṇā ti vuttā  yadi api siyā attha paṭisambhidā na magga ārammaṇā ti vacanataḥ abhidhammabhājanīye vutta paṭisambhidāsu eva  pañha pucchaka nayaḥ pavattaḥ na hi maggo paccaya uppannaḥ na hoti abhidhamma bhājanīye
translated: So the knowledge of the discernment of perspicuity is stated thus: “Three discriminations may have a limited object, or they may have an exalted object, or they may have an immeasurable object” .🔽And although the knowledge of the discernment of meaning is not stated in the Abhidhamma as having a path as its object, still the method of questioning is applicable to the discriminations stated there,🔽for the path is not unarisen, and the knowledge of the discernment of perspicuity stated in the Abhidhamma has only the discriminations for its object, not the path,

original: ca paṭisambhidāñāṇavisayā eva paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā vuttāti na tassā mahaggatārammaṇatāti.
analyzed: ca paṭisambhidā ñāṇa visayā eva paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā vuttā ati na tassāḥ mahaggata ārammaṇa tā ti
translated: so it is not stated as having an exalted object.

original: Evamapi dvepi etā pāḷiyo virujjhanti, tāsu balavatarāya ṭhatvā itarāya adhippāyo
analyzed: evam api dve api etā pāḷiyaḥ virujjhanti tāsu balavatarāya itarāya adhippāyaḥ
translated: So in this way too both these passages are contradicted. But the intention of the latter can be deduced by standing by the former.

original: maggitabbo. Kusalākusalānaṃ pana paccayuppannattapaṭivedhopi kusalākusalabhāvapaṭivedhavinimutto🔽natthīti nippariyāyā tattha dhammapaṭisambhidā ekantadhammavisayattā, tathā vipākakiriyānaṃ
analyzed: maggitabbaḥ kusala akusalānam pana paccaya uppanna tta paṭivedhaḥ api kusala akusala bhāva paṭivedha vinimuttaḥ  natthi iti nippariyāyā tattha dhamma paṭisambhidā ekanta dhamma visaya ttā tathā vipāka kiriyānaṃ
translated: And there is no penetration of the state of being a condition of profitable and unprofitable states that is dissociated from penetration of the state of being profitable and unprofitable.

original: paccayabhāvapaṭivedhopi vipākakiriyabhāvapaṭivedhavinimutto natthīti nippariyāyā🔽tattha atthapaṭisambhidā ekantikaatthavisayattā. Kiñci pana ñāṇaṃ appaṭibhānabhūtaṃ
analyzed: paccaya bhāva paṭivedhaḥ api vipāka kiriya bhāva paṭivedha vinimuttaḥ natthi iti nippariyāyā  tattha attha paṭisambhidā ekantika attha visaya ttā kiñci pana ñāṇam appaṭibhāna bhūtam
translated: So in this case the discernment of ideas is literally true in being confined to ideas. Likewise there is no penetration of the state of being a condition of resultant and functional states that is dissociated from penetration of the state of being resultant and functional.🔽So in this case the discernment of meaning is literally true in being confined to meaning.🔽But there is no knowledge that is not illuminating.

original: natthi ñeyyappakāsanatoti sabbasmimpi ñāṇe nippariyāyā paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā bhavituṃ
analyzed: natthi ñeyya ppakāsanato ti sabbasmim pi ñāṇe nippariyāyā paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā bhavitum
translated: So in all cases knowledge is literally true in being illuminating.

original: arahati. Nippariyāyapaṭisambhidāsu pañhapucchakassa pavattiyaṃ dvepi pāḷiyo na virujjhanti.🔽Saddārammaṇattā bahiddhārammaṇāti ettha parassa abhilāpasaddārammaṇattāti bhavitabbaṃ.
analyzed: arahati nippariyāya paṭisambhidāsu pañhapucchakassa pavattiyam dve pi pāḷiyaḥ na virujjhanti 🔽sadda ārammaṇa ttā bahiddha ārammaṇā ti ettha parassa abhilāpa sadda ārammaṇa ttā ati bhavitabbam
translated: And in the case of the literally true discriminations, neither passage is contradicted in the occurrence of the questioner.

original: Na hi saddārammaṇatā bahiddhārammaṇatāya kāraṇaṃ saddassa ajjhattassa ca sabbhāvāti.
analyzed: na hi sadda ārammaṇa tā bahiddha ārammaṇa tāya kāraṇam saddassa ajjhattassa ca sabbhāvā ti
translated: For the fact that sound is the object of sound is not a reason for its being an external object, since sound is internal too.

original: Anuvattamāno ca so eva saddoti visesanaṃ na katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anuvattamānaḥ ca so eva saddo ti visesanam na katam ti daṭṭhabbam  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: And it is not specified as “that same sound” because it is not a repetition.🔽The commentary on the questions is ended.🔽The commentary on the Patisambhidā is ended.

original: Paṭisambhidāvibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽16. Ñāṇavibhaṅgo
analyzed: paṭisambhidā vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  ña aṇ vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The exposition of knowledge

original: 1. Ekakamātikādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the single- and double-characteristic

original: 751. Okāsaṭṭhena sampayuttā dhammā ārammaṇañcāpi ñāṇassa vatthu. Yāthāvakavatthuvibhāvanāti
analyzed: okāsa aṭṭhena sampayuttāḥ dhammāḥ ārammaṇam ca api ñāṇassa vatthu yāthāvaka vatthu vibhāvanā ati
translated: The states associated with the object condition of knowledge are the “ground” in the sense of “place” . The “ground of the known as it really is” is🔽the ground of the known as it really is without distortion, as a single concept, by way of cause, etc.,

original: nahetādiavitathekappakāravatthuvibhāvanā. Yathā ekaṃ nahetu, tathā ekaṃ aññampīti🔽hi gahetabbaṃ avitathasāmaññayuttaṃ ñāṇārammaṇaṃ yāthāvakavatthu. Yāthāvakena vā
analyzed: na hetu ādi avitatha eka pakāra vatthu vibhāvanā yathā ekam na hetu tathā ekam aññam pi iti  hi gahetabbam avitatha sāmañña yuttam ñāṇa ārammaṇam yāthāvaka vatthu yāthāvakena vā
translated: since it is to be taken as “one as to cause, one as to condition, etc.,” and is suitable as a single concept by way of undistorted community of nature.🔽Or alternatively, the “ground of the known as it really is” is the object of knowledge that is the known as it really is by way of the undistorted community of nature.

original: avitathasāmaññena vatthuvibhāvanā yāthāvakavatthuvibhāvanā.
analyzed: avitatha sāmaññena vatthu vibhāvanā yāthāvaka vatthu vibhāvanā
translated: Or the “ground of the known as it really is” is the exposition of the ground by way of the undistorted community of nature.

original: Dukānurūpehīti dukamātikānurūpehīti vadanti. Osānadukassa pana dukamātikaṃ anissāya
analyzed: duka anurūpehi iti duka mātikā anurūpehi iti vadanti osāna dukassa pana duka mātikam a nissāya
translated: “In accordance with the double and single characteristics”: they say that it is in accordance with the double and single mātikās . But the double mātikā is the basis for the last double .

original: vuttattā dukabhāvānurūpehīti vattabbaṃ. Evaṃ tikānurūpehīti etthāpi daṭṭhabbaṃ. Osānaduke
analyzed: vutta ttā duka bhāva anurūpehi iti vattabbam evam tika anurūpehi iti ettha api daṭṭhabbam osāna duke
translated: and so it should be said that they are in conformity with the dyads. So too in the case of the triads.🔽In the last dyad,

original: pana atthoti phalaṃ, anekatthattā dhātusaddānaṃ taṃ janetīti atthajāpikā, kāraṇagatā🔽paññā. Jāpito janito attho etissāti jāpitatthā, kāraṇapaññāsadisī phalappakāsanabhūtā
analyzed: pana atthaḥ ti phalam aneka attha ttā dhātu saddānam tam janeti iti attha jāpikā kāraṇa gatā  paññā jāpitaḥ janitaḥ atthaḥ etissa ati jāpita atthā kāraṇa paññā sadisī phala ppakāsana bhūtā
translated: “meaning” is the fruit; and since the word dhātu has many meanings, it is a “meaning-producer” in the sense of a cause.🔽It is understanding that is a cause.

original: phalasampayuttā paññā.
analyzed: phala sampayuttā paññā
translated: “Meaning-originated” is that which has meaning originated, produced, in it; it is understanding that is associated with the fruit, which is like a cause-understanding that advertises the fruit.

original: 10. Dasakamātikāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dasaka mātikā vaṇṇanā
translated: The tenfold method

original: 760. “Catasso kho imā, sāriputta, yoniyo. Katamā…pe… yo kho maṃ, sāriputta, evaṃ🔽jāna”nti vacanena catuyoniparicchedakañāṇaṃ vuttaṃ, “nirayañcāhaṃ, sāriputta, pajānāmī”tiādinā🔽pañcagatiparicchedakaṃ. “Saṃyuttake āgatāni tesattati ñāṇāni, sattasattati ñāṇānī”ti
analyzed: catasso kho imāḥ sāriputta yoniyaḥ katamā āpe yaḥ kho mama sāriputta evam  jānanti vacanena catu yoni paricchedaka ñāṇam vuttam nirayam ca aham sāriputta pajānāmi itiādinā  pañca gati paricchedakam saṃyuttake āgatāni tesattati ñāṇāni sattasattati ñāṇāni iti
translated: “Sāriputta, there are these four kinds of generation. What four? … He who knows me thus as a truth-finder … “🔽“Sāriputta, I know of an attainment, having entered upon which the mind is not loosed” .🔽In the Saṃyutta Nikāya it is said: “There are seventy-three kinds of knowledge. There are seventy-three kinds of knowledge” .

original: vuttaṃ, tattha pana nidānavagge sattasattati āgatāni catucattārīsañca, tesattati
analyzed: vuttam tattha pana nidāna vagge sattasattati āgatāni catucattārīsañca tesattati
translated: Herein, in the Nidāna Vagga there are seventy-three kinds of knowledge stated, and forty-four in the Saṃyutta Nikāya.

original: pana paṭisambhidāmagge sutamayādīni āgatāni dissanti, na saṃyuttaketi. Aññānipīti
analyzed: pana paṭisambhidā magge suta maya ādīni āgatāni dissanti na saṃyuttaka iti aññāni pi iti
translated: But in the Paṭisambhidā it is given as “what is heard” and so on.🔽“Other kinds too”:

original: etena idha ekakādivasena vuttaṃ, aññattha ca “pubbante ñāṇa”ntiādinā, brahmajālādīsu
analyzed: etena idha ekaka ādi vasena vuttam aññattha ca pubba ante brahmajāla ādīsu
translated: by this he includes what is said here in terms of “one’s own” and so on, and what is said elsewhere in the Brahmajāla Sutta in terms of “knowledge of the past” and so on,

original: ca “tayidaṃ tathāgato pajānāti ‘imāni diṭṭhiṭṭhānāni evaṃ gahitānī’ti”ādinā vuttaṃ
analyzed: ca tayā idam tathāgataḥ pajānāti imāni diṭṭhi ṭhānāni evam gahitāni iti ādinā vuttam
translated: and what is said in the Paṭisambhidā in terms of “The Tathāgata understands these bases for views thus” and so on.

original: anekañāṇappabhedaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Yāthāvapaṭivedhato sayañca akampiyaṃ puggalañca taṃsamaṅgiṃ
analyzed: aneka ñāṇa ppabhedam saṅgaṇhāti yāthāva paṭivedhato sayam ca akampiyam puggalam ca
translated: Because it is unshakable and because it makes the person who possesses it invincible in regard to what is to be known,

original: ñeyyesu adhibalaṃ karotīti āha “akampiyaṭṭhena upatthambhakaṭṭhena cā”ti.
analyzed: ñeyyesu adhibalam karoti iti āha akampiya ṭṭhena upatthambhaka ṭṭhena ca ati
translated: he says “in the sense of being unshakable and in the sense of being a support.”🔽The state of omniscience is the highest position.

original: Seṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ sabbaññutaṃ. Paṭijānanavasena sabbaññutaṃ abhimukhaṃ gacchanti, aṭṭha
analyzed: seṭṭhaṭṭhānam sabbaññutam paṭijānana vasena sabbaññutam abhimukham gacchanti aṭṭha
translated: The eight assemblies go to meet omniscience by acknowledging it.

original: vā parisā upasaṅkamantīti āsabhā, buddhā. Idaṃ panāti buddhānaṃ ṭhānaṃ sabbaññutameva
analyzed: vā parisāḥ upasaṅkamanti iti āsabhāḥ buddhāḥ idam pana ati buddhānam ṭhānam sabbaññutam eva
translated: But the Buddha’s position is omniscience itself.

original: vadati. Tiṭṭhamānovāti avadantopi tiṭṭhamānova paṭijānāti nāmāti attho. Aṭṭhasu parisāsu
analyzed: vadati tiṭṭhamānaḥ uvā ati a vadantaḥ api tiṭṭhamānaḥ iva paṭijānāti nāma ati atthaḥ aṭṭhasu parisāsu
translated: Even when he is silent, he acknowledges it. The meaning is: even when he does not speak, he acknowledges it by remaining silent.

original: “abhijānāmahaṃ, sāriputta, anekasataṃ khattiyaparisaṃ…pe… tatra vata maṃ bhayaṃ vā
analyzed: abhijānām aham sāriputta aneka satam khattiya parisaṃpe tatra vata mam bhayam vā
translated: “Sariputta, I recall having attended many hundreds of assemblies of nobles … there I saw no reason to fear …🔽I saw no reason to be afraid.”

original: sārajjaṃ vā okkamissatīti nimittametaṃ, sāriputta, na samanupassāmī”ti vacanena dassitaakampiyañāṇayutto🔽dasabalohanti abhītanādaṃ nadati. Sīhanādasuttena khandhakavagge āgatena.
analyzed: sārajjam vai okkamissati iti nimittam etam sāriputta na samanupassāmi iti vacanena dassita akampiya ñāṇa yuttaḥ  abhīta nādam nadati sīhanāda suttena khandhaka vagge āgatena
translated: “Possessed of the knowledge that is unshakable,”🔽he roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies.

original: “Devamanussānaṃ catucakkaṃ vattatī”ti suttasesena sappurisūpassayādīnaṃ phalasampatti
analyzed: deva manussānam catu cakkam vattati iti sutta sesena sappurisa upassaya ādīnam phala sampatti
translated: The phrase “the wheel of the four noble truths turns among gods and men” is a reference to the fact that the attainment of the fruit of the noble path is due to the presence of the four noble truths,

original: pavatti, purimasappurisūpassayādiṃ upanissāya pacchimasappurisūpassayādīnaṃ sampatti
analyzed: pavatti purima sappurisa upassaya ādim upanissāya pacchima sappurisa upassaya ādīnam sampatti
translated: or that the attainment of the later noble qualities is due to the presence of the earlier noble qualities.

original: pavatti vā vuttāti ādi-saddena tattha ca cakka-saddassa gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Paṭivedhaniṭṭhattā
analyzed: vā vuttā ti ādi saddena tattha ca cakka saddassa gahaṇam veditabbam paṭivedha niṭṭha ttā
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include the word “wheel” in the phrase “the wheel of the four noble truths.”🔽The knowledge of the path of arahatship is called “penetration” because it is the culmination of penetration.

original: arahattamaggañāṇaṃ paṭivedhoti “phalakkhaṇe uppannaṃ nāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Tena paṭiladdhassapi
analyzed: arahatta magga ñāṇam paṭivedhaḥ ti phala kkhaṇe uppannam nāma ati vuttam tena paṭiladdhassa api
translated: It is said that it arises at the moment of the fruit.

original: desanāñāṇassa kiccanipphattiparassa bujjhanamattena hotīti “aññāsikoṇḍaññassa sotāpattiphalakkhaṇe🔽pavattaṃ nāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Tato paraṃ pana yāva parinibbānā desanāñāṇappavatti tasseva
analyzed: desanā ñāṇassa kicca nipphatti parassa bujjhana mattena hoti iti aññāsi koṇḍaññassa sotāpatti phala kkhaṇe  pavattam nāma ati vuttam tatas param pana yāva parinibbānā desanā ñāṇa ppavatti tassa eva
translated: The knowledge of teaching is the means of accomplishing the function of the knowledge of the way. It arises only in the mere act of knowing. Therefore it is said: “The name that occurs in Koṇḍañña’s consciousness at the moment of the fruit of stream-entry.”

original: pavattitassa dhammacakkassa ṭhānanti veditabbaṃ, pavattitacakkassa cakkavattino cakkaratanaṭṭhānaṃ viya.
analyzed: pavattitassa dhammacakkassa ṭhānan ti veditabbam pavattita cakkassa cakkavattino cakka ratana ṭṭhānam viya
translated: But after that, until the final Nibbāna, the occurrence of the knowledge of teaching is the “station” of that wheel of the Dhamma that is set in motion. It should be understood as the “wheel-gem’s station” for the wheel-turning monarch’s wheel that is set in motion.

original: Samādīyantīti samādānāni, tāni pana samādiyitvā katāni hontīti āha “samādiyitvā katāna”nti.
analyzed: samādīyanti iti samādānāni tāni pana samādiyitvā katāni honti iti āha samādiyitvā
translated: “Undertakings” are what are undertaken. But since they are done after being undertaken, it is said: “done after being undertaken.”

original: Kammameva vā kammasamādānanti etena samādāna-saddassa apubbatthābhāvaṃ dasseti muttagata-sadde gata-saddassa viya.
analyzed: kammam eva vā kamma samādānan ti etena samādāna saddassa apubbattha abhāvam dasseti mutta gata sadde gata saddassa viya
translated: Or else, “undertakings” are simply actions. By this he shows that the word “undertaking” has a meaning not found elsewhere, like the word “gone” in the expression “gone to the village.”

original: Agatigāmininti nibbānagāminiṃ. Vuttañhi “nibbānañcāhaṃ, sāriputta, pajānāmi nibbānagāminiñca paṭipada”nti.
analyzed: agati gāminim ti nibbāna gāminim vuttam hi nibbānam ca aham sāriputta pajānāmi nibbāna gāminim ca paṭipadanti
translated: “Leading to the deathless” : leading to Nibbāna. For it is said: “Sāriputta, I know Nibbāna, and the way leading to Nibbāna” .

original: Hānabhāgiyadhammanti hānabhāgiyasabhāvaṃ, kāmasahagatasaññādidhammaṃ vā. Taṃ kāraṇanti pubbeva katābhisaṅkhārādiṃ.
analyzed: hāna bhāgiya dhammanti hāna bhāgiya sabhāvam kāma sahagata saññā ādi dhammam vā tam kāraṇam ti pubbe eva kata abhisaṅkhāra ādim
translated: “The states partaking of diminution” is either the nature of what partakes of diminution or states such as perception associated with sense desire. “The reason” is the prior volition, etc.

original: “Idānī”ti etassa “iminā anukkamena vuttānīti veditabbānī”ti iminā saha yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: idāni iti etassa iminā anukkamena vuttāni iti veditabbāni iti iminā saha yojanā kātabbā
translated: “Now” should be construed with “should be understood in this way in due course.”

original: Kilesāvaraṇaṃ tadabhāvañcāti kilesāvaraṇābhāvaṃ. Kilesakkhayādhigamassa hi kilesāvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kilesa āvaraṇam tad abhāvam ca ati kilesa āvaraṇa abhāvam kilesa khaya adhigamassa hi kilesa āvaraṇam
translated: “The defilement-obstruction and its absence”: the absence of the defilement-obstruction. For the non-attainment of the destruction of defilements is due to the defilement-obstruction,

original: aṭṭhānaṃ, tadabhāvo ṭhānaṃ. Anadhigamassa kilesāvaraṇaṃ ṭhānaṃ, tadabhāvo aṭṭhānanti.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam tad abhāvaḥ ṭhānam anadhigamassa kilesa āvaraṇam ṭhānam tad abhāvaḥ aṭṭhānanti
translated: and its absence is due to the absence of the defilement-obstruction. The attainment of the destruction of defilements is due to the absence of the defilement-obstruction, and its non-attainment is due to the defilement-obstruction.

original: Tattha tadabhāvaggahaṇena gahitaṃ “atthi dinna”ntiādikāya sammādiṭṭhiyā ṭhitiṃ tabbiparītāya
analyzed: tattha tad abhāva ggahaṇena gahitam atthi dinna nti ādikāya sammādiṭṭhiyā ṭhitim tad biparītāya
translated: Herein, by the phrase “its absence” is included the stability of the right view “There is what is given” , etc., and the absence of the opposite wrong view.

original: ṭhānābhāvañca adhigamassa ṭhānaṃ passantena iminā ñāṇena adhigamānadhigamānaṃ ṭhānāṭṭhānabhūte
analyzed: ṭhāna abhāvañca adhigamassa ṭhānam passantena iminā ñāṇena adhigama anadhigamānam ṭhāna aṭṭhāna bhūte
translated: By this knowledge he sees the defilement-obstruction and its absence as the foundation and non-foundation for the attainment and non-attainment respectively.

original: kilesāvaraṇatadabhāve passati bhagavāti imamatthaṃ sādhento āha “lokiyasammādiṭṭhiṭhitidassanato
analyzed: kilesa āvaraṇa tad abhāve passati bhagavā ti imam attham sādhentaḥ āha lokiya sammā diṭṭhi ṭhiti dassanato
translated: The Blessed One, establishing this meaning, said: “Because he sees the stability of the mundane right view,

original: niyatamicchādiṭṭhiṭhānābhāvadassanato cā”ti. Ettha ca adhigamaṭṭhānadassanameva adhippetaṃ
analyzed: niyatam icchā diṭṭhi ṭhāna abhāva dassanato ca ati ettha ca adhigama ṭṭhāna dassanam eva adhippetam
translated: And here the showing of the plane of the attainment is intended.

original: upari bhabbapuggalavaseneva vipākāvaraṇābhāvadassanādikassa vakkhamānattā. Iminā
analyzed: upari bhabba puggala vasena iva vipāka āvaraṇa abhāva dassana ādikassa iminā
translated: For the rest, namely, the showing of the absence of resultant hindrances, etc., will be stated later on in the chapter dealing with the person of higher development.

original: pana ñāṇena sijjhanato pasaṅgena itarampi vuttanti veditabbaṃ. Dhātuvemattadassanatoti🔽rāgādīnaṃ adhimattatādivasena taṃsahitānaṃ dhātūnaṃ vemattatādassanato, “ayaṃ imissā
analyzed: pana ñāṇena sijjhanataḥ pasaṅgena itaram pi vuttan ti veditabbam dhātu vematta dassanato ti  rāga ādīnam adhimatta tā ādi vasena tad sahitānam dhātūnam vematta tā dassanataḥ ayam imissā
translated: But it should be understood that the other kinds of conduct are mentioned because they are successful by means of this knowledge.

original: dhātuyā adhimattattā rāgacarito”tiādinā cariyāhetūnaṃ vā, rāgādayo eva vā pakatibhāvato🔽dhātūti rāgādivemattadassanatoti attho. Payogaṃ anādiyitvāti santatimahāmattaaṅgulimālādīnaṃ
analyzed: adhimatta ttā vā rāga ādayaḥ eva vā  dhātu uti rāga ādi vematta dassanato ti atthaḥ upayogam an ādiyitvā iti santati mahā matta aṅguli mālā ādīnam
translated: By the seeing of the diversity of elements: by the seeing of the diversity of the elements accompanied by greed, etc., according to their predominance, etc.; or by the seeing of the diversity of greed, etc., as elements in the sense of natural constitution, according to the reason for the kinds of conduct, “This person is of greedy temperament because of the predominance of this element in him,” and so on.

original: viya kāmarāgabyāpādādivasena payogaṃ anādiyitvā.
analyzed: kāma rāga byāpāda ādi vasena
translated: Without taking into account the practice: without taking into account the practice according to greed for sense desires, ill will, etc., as in the case of Sañjiva, Maha-sañjiva, etc., and Angulimala.

original: (1.) Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽761. Na hetumevāti ettha ca na hetū evāti attho, byañjanasiliṭṭhatāvasena pana rassattaṃ
analyzed: 🔽na hetum eva ati ettha ca na hetū eva ati atthaḥ byañjana siliṭṭha tā vasena pana rassattam
translated: The explanation of the first section of the exposition of the knowledge of penetration of moods is completed.

original: ma-kāro ca kato “adukkhamasukhā”ti ettha viya. Imināpi nayenāti ettha purimanayena
analyzed: makāro ca kato adukkham asukhā ti ettha viya iminā api nayena ati ettha purima nayena
translated: and the letter ma is used in the same way as the letter du in the word adukkhamasukhā.

original: hetubhāvādipaṭikkhepo, pacchimanayena nahetudhammādikoṭṭhāsasaṅgahoti ayaṃ viseso🔽veditabbo. Cutiggahaṇena cutiparicchinnāya ekāya jātiyā gahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, bhavaggahaṇena
analyzed: hetu bhāva ādi paṭikkhepo pacchima nayena na hetu dhamma ādi koṭṭhāsa saṅgaho ti ayam viseso  veditabbaḥ cuti ggahaṇena cuti paricchinnāya ekāya jātiyāḥ gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam bhava ggahaṇena
translated: By this method too: here the difference should be understood thus: the denial of the state of cause, etc., is by the former method, and the inclusion of the state of non-cause, etc., is by the latter method.🔽By the mention of death, the inclusion of a single birth delimited by death should be understood, and by the mention of becoming, the inclusion of the becoming stated in nine ways.

original: navadhā vuttabhavassa. Tadantogadhatāya tattha tattha pariyāpannatā vuttā. Uppannaṃ
analyzed: navadhā vutta bhavassa tad antogadha tāya tattha tattha pariyāpanna tā vuttā uppannam
translated: The statement that it is included here and there is a statement of its inclusion in the various kinds of becoming.

original: manoviññāṇaviññeyyamevāti “na rūpaṃ viya uppannā chaviññāṇaviññeyyā”ti rūpato etesaṃ visesanaṃ karoti.
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa viññeyyam evā ti na rūpam viya uppannā cha viññāṇa viññeyyā ati rūpataḥ etesam visesanam karoti
translated: It is only cognizable by the mind that has arisen: it is not cognizable by the six kinds of consciousness that have arisen, like visible form, etc. This is the distinction he makes between these kinds of materiality and visible form, etc.

original: 762. Kappato kappaṃ gantvāpi na uppajjatīti na kadāci tathā uppajjati. Na hi khīrādīnaṃ viya etesaṃ yathāvuttalakkhaṇavilakkhaṇatā atthīti dasseti.
analyzed: kappataḥ kappam gantvā api na uppajjati iti na kadāci tathā uppajjati na hi khīra ādīnam viya etesam yathā vutta lakkhaṇa vilakkhaṇa tā atthi iti dasseti
translated: It does not arise even after a world-cycle: it does not arise at any time in that way. For there is no difference in the characteristics of these kinds of materiality, as there is in the case of milk, etc., he shows.

original: 763. Samodhānetvāti loke vijjamānaṃ sabbaṃ rūpaṃ samodhānetvā. Etena mahattepi avibhāvakattaṃ
analyzed: samodhānetvā ati loke vijjamānam sabbam rūpam samodhānetvā etena mahat te pi a vibhāvaka ttam
translated: Having combined: having combined all the materiality that exists in the world. By this he shows that although it is great in amount, it is not diversified.

original: dassento sukhumattā na vibhāvessatīti vādapathaṃ chindati. Cakkhupasāde mama vatthumhīti
analyzed: dassento sukhuma tā na vibhāvessati iti vāda patham chindati cakkhu upasāde mama vatthumhi iti
translated: The meaning is: “My eye-sensitivity is the basis.”

original: attho. Visayoti issariyaṭṭhānanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: atthaḥ visayaḥ ti issariya ṭṭhānan ti adhippāyo
translated: The intended meaning is: “The domain is the place of sovereignty.”🔽Uninterrupted: not separated, not obstructed, is the meaning. The meaning is: the order of sequence of the defined is rejected by him.

original: 764. Abbokiṇṇāti abyavahitā, anantaritāti attho. Vavatthitānampi paṭipāṭiniyamo tena paṭikkhittoti attho. Anantaratāti anantarapaccayatā etena paṭikkhittāti attho.
analyzed: abbokiṇṇā ati abyavahitā anantaritā ati atthaḥ vavatthitānam pi paṭipāṭi niyamaḥ tena paṭikkhittaḥ iti atthaḥ anantara tā ati anantara paccaya tā etena paṭikkhittā iti atthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the conditionality of immediate-antecedent is rejected by him.

original: 765. Samanantaratāti ca samanantarapaccayatā.🔽766. Ābhujanatoti ābhuggakaraṇato, nivattanato icceva attho. Ettha ca “pañca viññāṇā
analyzed: samanantara tā ati ca samanantara paccaya tā  ābhujanato ti ābhugga karaṇato nivattanato icca iva attho ettha ca pañca viññāṇā
translated: The meaning is: the conditionality of immediate-antecedent.

original: anābhogā”ti ābhogasabhāvā na hontīti attho, “pañcannaṃ viññāṇānaṃ natthi āvaṭṭanā
analyzed: anābhogā ti ābhoga sabhāvāḥ na honti iti attho pañcannam viññāṇānam na atthi āvaṭṭanā
translated: The meaning is: because of the act of bending, because of the turning back. And here the meaning is: the five kinds of consciousness are not associated with the act of bending, is the meaning. The meaning is: there is no turning back of the five kinds of consciousness.

original: vā”tiādīsupi āvaṭṭanabhāvo vātiādinā attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vāti ādīsu pi āvaṭṭana bhāvaḥ vāti ādinā atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The meaning should be seen thus in the passages beginning with “turning back” .

original: Na kañci dhammaṃ paṭivijānātīti ettha na sabbe rūpādidhammā dhammaggahaṇena gahitāti yathādhippetadhammadassanatthaṃ “manopubbaṅgamā dhammāti evaṃ vutta”nti āha.
analyzed: na kañci dhammam paṭivijānāti iti ettha na sabbe rūpa ādi dhammā dhamma ggahaṇena gahitā ati yathā adhippeta dhamma dassana tham manaḥ pubbaṅgamāḥ dhammā ti evam vuttanti āha
translated: “He does not cognize any idea” : all material form, etc., are not included by the word “idea” . So he says “ ‘Ideas have mind as their forerunner’ is said” in order to show the idea as it is intended here.

original: Rūpādīsu abhinipatanaṃ tehi samāgamo tesantipi vattuṃ yujjatīti āha “rūpādīnaṃ abhinipātamatta”nti.
analyzed: rūpa ādīsu abhinipatanam tehi samāgamaḥ vattum yujjati iti āha
translated: It is also proper to say “the meeting with them” for “the impact upon them” . So he says “merely the impact upon materiality, etc.”

original: Kammatthe vā sāmivacanaṃ. Viññāṇehi abhinipatitabbāni hi rūpādīnīti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: kamma atthe vā sāmi vacanam viññāṇehi abhinipatitabbāni hi rūpa ādīni iti idam vuttam
translated: Or the word “their” is in the instrumental case in the sense of object. For materiality, etc., are to be impacted upon by consciousness.

original: hotītiādīsu hi ayaṃ adhippāyo – ārammaṇakaraṇena paṭivijānitabbāni rūpādīni ṭhapetvā
analyzed: hoti itiādīsu hi ayam adhippāyaḥ ārammaṇa karaṇena paṭivijānitabbāni rūpa ādīni ṭhapetvā
translated: This is what is said: “Apart from materiality, etc., which are to be cognized by being made the object,

original: kusalākusalacetanāya taṃsampayuttānañca yathāvuttānaṃ sahajapubbaṅgamadhammena paṭivijānitabbānaṃ🔽paṭivijānanaṃ etesaṃ natthīti. Evañca katvā “dassanādimattato pana muttā aññā etesaṃ
analyzed: kusala akusala cetanāya tad sampayuttānam ca yathāvuttānam sahaja pubbaṅgama dhammena paṭivijānitabbānam  paṭivijānanam etesam natthi iti evam ca katvā dassana ādi mattataḥ pana muttā aññā etesam
translated: there is no cognizing of the profitable, etc., and of the associated states already mentioned, which are to be cognized by the method of ‘ideas have mind as their forerunner’ .

original: kusalādipaṭiviññatti nāma natthī”ti kiccantaraṃ paṭisedheti.
analyzed: kusala ādi paṭiviññatti nāma natthi iti kicca antaram paṭisedheti
translated: And when it is put like this, then the mere seeing, etc., is excluded, and the words ‘there is no other kind of cognizing of these, etc.,’ deny the possibility of any other kind of act of cognizing, such as profitable, etc.”

original: Avipākabhāvena aññaṃ abyākatasāmaññaṃ anivārento kusalākusalaggahaṇañca karotīti
analyzed: a vipāka bhāvena aññam abyākata sāmaññam a nivārento kusala akusala ggahaṇam ca karoti iti
translated: Without denying that there is a general characteristic of the indeterminate apart from the non-resultant, he nevertheless mentions the profitable and unprofitable.🔽And the function ends with death.

original: cavanapariyosānañca kiccaṃ. Pi-saddena sahajavanakāni vīthicittāni sampiṇḍetvā pañcadvāre🔽paṭisedhane ayaṃ adhippāyo siyā – “manasā ce paduṭṭhena…pe… pasannena bhāsati vā
analyzed: cavana pariyosānam ca kiccam pisaddena sahaja vanakāni vīthi cittāni sampiṇḍetvā pañca dvāre  paṭisedhane ayam adhippāyaḥ siyā manasā ce pasannena bhāsati vā
translated: The word “or” in the text includes the impulsions of the cognitive series in the five doors.

original: karoti vā”ti evaṃ vuttā bhāsanakaraṇakarā, taṃsadisā ca sukhadukkhuppādakā balavanto🔽chaṭṭhadvārikā eva dhammaggahaṇena gahitāti na tesaṃ pañcadvārikajavanena paṭivijānanaṃ
analyzed: karoti vā ti evam vuttā bhāsana karaṇa karā taṃsadisā ca sukha dukkha uppādakāḥ balavanto  chaṭṭha dvārikāḥ eva dhamma ggahaṇena gahitā ati na tesam pañca dvārika javanena paṭivijānanam
translated: The intention may be this: “If he speaks or acts with a mind affected by lust … with a mind affected by hate … with a mind affected by delusion” , the speaking and acting are the strong kinds that produce pleasure and pain,🔽and they are included by the words “by mind” in the clause, “By body, by speech, or by mind” .🔽So there is no cognizing of them by the impulsions in the five doors. But the weak kinds are not denied a place in the cognizing there.

original: atthi, dubbalānaṃ pana pubbaṅgamapaṭivijānanaṃ tattha na paṭisiddhaṃ “na kāyakammaṃ
analyzed: atthi dubbalānam pana pubbaṅgama paṭivijānanam tattha na paṭisiddham na kāya kammam
translated: “It does not instigate bodily or verbal action” .

original: na vacīkammaṃ paṭṭhapetī”ti viññattidvayajanakasseva paṭṭhapanapaṭikkhepena dubbalassa
analyzed: na vacī kammam paṭṭhapeti iti viññatti dvaya janakassa iva paṭṭhapana paṭikkhepena dubbalassa
translated: The instigation of the weak kind is allowed by the denial of instigation only in the case of the two kinds that produce the two kinds of intimation.

original: manokammassa anuññātattā. Tathā kāyasucaritādikusalakammaṃ karomīti, tabbiparītaṃ
analyzed: manaḥ kammassa anuññāta ttā tathā kāya su carita ādi kusala kammam karomi iti tad biparītam
translated: Likewise, when someone thinks, “I am doing profitable bodily action, etc.,” or the opposite,

original: akusalaṃ kammaṃ karomīti ca kusalākusalasamādānaṃ pañcadvārikajavanena na hoti. Tathā
analyzed: akusalam kammam karomi iti ca kusala akusala samādānam pañcadvārika javanena na hoti tathā
translated: And the undertaking of profitable and unprofitable action is not by the five-door adverting.

original: paṭiccasamuppādavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttā “pañcadvārikacuti ca na pañcadvārikacittehi hoti🔽cuticittassa ataṃdvārikattā”ti. Yā panāyaṃ pāḷi “pañcahi viññāṇehi na kañci dhammaṃ
analyzed: paṭiccasamuppāda vaṇṇanā ayam vuttā pañca dvārika cuti ca na pañca dvārika cittehi hoti  cuti cittassa a taṃdvārika ttā ati yā pana ayam pāḷi pañcahi viññāṇehi na kañci dhammaṃ
translated: And so too in the description of dependent origination it is said: “And the death consciousness of the five doors is not with the five-door consciousnesses;

original: paṭivijānāti aññatra abhinipātamattā”ti, tassā rūpādīnaṃ āpāthamattaṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ🔽kañci dhammasabhāvaṃ na paṭivijānātīti ayamattho dissati. Na hi rūpaṃ paṭiggaṇhantampi🔽cakkhuviññāṇaṃ rūpanti ca gaṇhātīti. Sampaṭicchanassapi rūpanīlādiākārapaṭivijānanaṃ🔽natthīti kiñci dhammassa paṭivijānanaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ, pañcahi pana viññāṇehi sātisayaṃ
analyzed: paṭivijānāti aññatra abhinipāta mattā ati tassāḥ rūpa ādīnam āpātha mattam muñcitvā aññam  kañci dhamma sabhāvam na paṭivijānāti iti ayam atthaḥ dissati na hi rūpam paṭiggaṇhantam pi  cakkhu viññāṇam rūpanti ca gaṇhāti iti sampaṭicchanassa api rūpa nīla ādi ākāra paṭivijānanam  natthi iti kiñci dhammassa paṭivijānanam paṭikkhittam pañcahi pana viññāṇehi sa atisayam
translated: because the death consciousness has no door” .🔽But the text “He does not cognize any ideas through the five kinds of consciousness, except through the mere fact of arrival” shows that the meaning is this: “He does not cognize any other specific-natured idea apart from the mere arrival of visible data, etc., in the eye’s field, and so on” . For eye-consciousness, though it receives the visible datum, does not apprehend it as “visible datum.” And the apprehending of the visible datum’s mode as “blue,” etc., is not in the consenting either.

original: tassa vijānananti “aññatra abhinipātamattā”ti na vuttaṃ. Yassa pāḷiyaṃ bahiddhāpaccuppannārammaṇatā
analyzed: tassa vijānanam ti aññatra abhinipāta mattā ati na vuttam yassa pāḷiyam bahiddhā paccuppanna ārammaṇa tā
translated: So what is denied is the apprehending of any specific-natured idea, but the five kinds of consciousness are not denied to be the surpassing of that by the apprehending of the mere arrival.🔽But in the text “He does not cognize any ideas through the five kinds of consciousness, except through the mere fact of arrival” the condition of being an external present object is denied.

original: vuttā, tato aññaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidaṃ icchantehi pañcadvārajavanena paṭisambhidāñāṇassa
analyzed: vuttā tatas aññam nirutti paṭisambhidam icchantehi pañca dvāra javanena paṭisambhidā ñāṇassa
translated: and then, wanting to know the other three kinds of discrimination, they are prevented from arising together with the knowledge of the discriminations by the five-door adverting.

original: sahuppatti paṭisiddhā. Rūpārūpadhammeti rūpārūpāvacaradhammeti attho.🔽Pañcadvārikacittena na paṭibujjhatīti kasmā vuttaṃ, nanu rūpādīnaṃ āpāthagamane niddāpaṭibodho
analyzed: sahuppatti paṭisiddhā rūpa arūpa dhammā iti rūpa arūpa avacara dhammā iti attho  pañca dvārika cittena na paṭibujjhati iti kasmā vuttam nanu rūpa ādīnam āpātha gamane niddā paṭibodhaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “the states of the fine-material and immaterial spheres.”

original: hotīti? Na, paṭhamaṃ manodvārikajavanassa uppattitoti dassento āha “niddāyantassa
analyzed: hoti iti na paṭhamam manodvārika javanassa uppattito ti dassentaḥ āha niddāyantassa
translated: Why is it said, “He does not wake up with the five-door consciousness”? Is not waking from sleep due to the arrival of visible data, etc., in the visual domain, etc.?—No. He shows that it is because the first impulsion of the mind-door arises thus: “When he is sleeping”

original: hī”tiādi. Palobhetvā saccasupinena.🔽Abyākatoyeva āvajjanamattasseva uppajjanatoti vadanti. Evaṃ vadantehi manodvārepi
analyzed: hi itiādi palobhetvā sacca supinena  āvajjana mattassa iva uppajjanato ti vadanti evam vadantehi manaḥ dvāre pi
translated: and so on.🔽They say that it is because the adverting occurs only as indeterminate.

original: āvajjanaṃ dvattikkhattuṃ uppajjitvā javanaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā bhavaṅgaṃ otaratīti adhippetanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: āvajjanam dvatti khattum uppajjitvā javanaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā bhavaṅgam otarati iti adhippetanti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: Those who say this should be told that what is intended is that the adverting occurs twenty-eight times at the mind door and then it stops in the place of impulsion and enters the life-continuum.

original: Tassā eva vasenāti tassā vasena ekavidhena ñāṇavatthu hotīti ca, veditabbanti ca yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: tassāḥ eva vasena ati tassāḥ vasena ekavidhena ñāṇa vatthu hoti iti ca veditabbam ti ca yojanā kātabbā
translated: “According to its own method” : the method of the single method of the object of knowledge should be construed as “according to its own method.”

original: Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ekaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on the single method is ended.

original: (2.) Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽767. Attha-saddo aññatra sabhāvaṃ gahetvā adhikaraṇesu pavattamāno adhikaraṇavasena
analyzed: duka niddesa vaṇṇanā  attha saddaḥ aññatra sabhāvam gahetvā adhikaraṇesu pavattamānaḥ adhikaraṇa vasena
translated: (2.) The commentary on the dyad🔽. The intention is that the word “meaning” occurs in the sense of a case-ending, taking the nature of the case-ending as its meaning,

original: liṅgaparivattiṃ gacchatīti adhippāyena jāpitā ca sā atthā cāti jāpitatthāti ayamattho
analyzed: liṅga parivattim gacchati iti adhippāyena jāpitā ca sā atthā ca ati jāpita tthā ati ayam attho
translated: and it is uttered with the meaning of “uttered” and “meaning” as well, so the meaning

original: vibhāvitoti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vibhāvito ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: should be regarded as “uttered meaning.”

original: Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: duka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the dyad is finished.

original: (3.) Tikaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tika niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: (3.) The commentary on the triad

original: 768. Paññāpariṇāmitesūti paññāya paripācitesu. “Yogavihitesūti idañca visayavisesanamattameva,
analyzed: paññā pariṇāmitesu iti paññāya paripācitesu yoga vihitesu iti idam ca visaya visesana mattam eva
translated: . “Brought to perfection by wisdom”: developed by wisdom. “Brought to bear by wisdom”: this is merely a particular instance of the general term.

original: tasmā yāni paññāya vihitāni ahesuṃ honti bhavissanti ca, sabbāni tāni yogavihitānīti🔽daṭṭhabbāni. Sikkhitvā kātabbaṃ sippaṃ, itaraṃ kammaṃ. Ayametesaṃ viseso. Vaḍḍhakīkammanti
analyzed: tasmā yāni paññāya vihitāni ahesum honti bhavissanti ca sabbāni tāni yoga vihitāni iti  daṭṭhabbāni sikkhitvā kātabbam sippam itaram kammam ayam etesam visesaḥ vaḍḍhakī kamman ti
translated: Therefore all those that have been brought to bear by wisdom, that are being brought to bear by wisdom, and that will be brought to bear by wisdom should be regarded as “brought to bear by wisdom.”🔽The craft that should be done after training is a craft; the other is a job. This is the difference between them. “Building work”

original: ca asikkhitvāpi kātabbaṃ thūlakammaṃ “kamma”nti daṭṭhabbaṃ, paññā eva vā tattha tattha
analyzed: ca a sikkhitvā api kātabbam thūlakammam kammanti daṭṭhabbam paññā eva vā tattha tattha
translated: should be regarded as a job that can be done even without training. Or wisdom itself in each case

original: “kammaṃ sippa”nti ca veditabbā. Nāgamaṇḍalaṃ nāma maṇḍalaṃ katvā sappe vijjāya pakkositvā
analyzed: kammam sippanti ca veditabbāḥ nāga maṇḍalam nāma maṇḍalam katvā sappe vijjāya pakkositvā
translated: “Work” should be understood as “craft.” A snake-circle is a circle made by summoning snakes by means of a spell and giving them a sacrificial offering,

original: baliṃ datvā visāpanayanaṃ. Parittaṃ rakkhā, yena “phū”ti mukhavātaṃ datvā visaṃ apanayanti,
analyzed: balim da tvā visa apanayanam parittam rakkhā yena phūti mukha vātam da tvā visam apanayanti
translated: and then removing their poison. A charm is a protection. By means of it one removes poison by blowing on it with the mouth, saying “Phū!”

original: so uṇṇanābhiādimanto phudhamanakamanto. “A ā”tiādikā mātikā “ka kā”tiādiko tappabhedo ca lekhā.
analyzed: so uṇṇa nābhi ādimanto phudhamanakamanto a āti ādikā mātikā tad pabhedo ca lekhā
translated: The “A ā” and so on are the basic series, and the “Ka kā” and so on are the subdivisions of that. Lines are the lines of a palm-leaf leaf.

original: Kusalaṃ dhammaṃ sakaṃ, itaraṃ nosakaṃ. Catunnaṃ saccānaṃ paṭivijjhitabbānaṃ tappaṭivedhapaccayabhāvena🔽anulomanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Pubbe “yogavihitesu vā kammāyatanesū”tiādinā paññā vuttā,
analyzed: kusalam dhammam sakam itaram nosakam catunnam saccānam paṭivijjhitabbānam tad paṭivedha paccaya bhāvena  anulomanam daṭṭhabbam pubbe yoga vihitesu vā kamma āyatanesu iti ādinā paññā vuttā
translated: A profitable idea is one’s own, and the other is not one’s own. The penetration of the four truths should be regarded as the means of penetrating them.🔽Understanding was stated in the first part of the sutta by the words “in the fields of work laid down by rule” ,

original: puna tassā vevacanavasena “anulomikaṃ khanti”ntiādi vuttanti adhippāyena “anu…pe…
analyzed: puna tassāḥ vevacana vasena anulomikam khanti nti ādi vuttanti adhippāyena
translated: and it is stated again by the words “Acceptance in conformity” and so on as a synonym for that. The intention is this: “In conformity” and so on are synonyms for understanding.

original: paññāvevacanānī”ti āha. Ettha ca evarūpinti yathāvuttakammāyatanādivisayaṃ kammassakatasaccānulomikasabhāvaṃ
analyzed: paññāvevacanāni iti āha ettha ca evarūpin ti yathā vutta kamma āyatana ādi visayam
translated: And here “of this kind” is the kind consisting in the object of the fields of work stated thus, and the conformity to the truth of the fact that kamma is one’s own ,

original: aniccādipavattiākārañcāti attho. Yathāvuttā ca bhūmisabhāvapavattiākāraniddesā khantiādīhi
analyzed: anicca ādi pavatti ākāram ca ati atthaḥ yathā vuttā ca bhūmi sabhāva pavatti ākāra niddesā khanti ādīhi
translated: The exposition of the mode of occurrence as the specific nature of the plane should be construed with the words “patience,” etc., in the way already stated.

original: yojetabbā. Yassā paññāya dhammā nijjhānapajānanakiccasaṅkhātaṃ olokanaṃ khamanti
analyzed: yojetabbā yassā paññāya dhammāḥ nijjhāna pajānana kicca saṅkhātam olokanam khamanti
translated: The understanding that is patient with the survey called the function of discerning and penetrating the specific nature of states

original: aviparītasabhāvattā, sā paññā dhammānaṃ nijjhānakkhamanaṃ etissā atthīti dhammanijjhānakkhantīti attho.🔽769. Asaṃvaraṃ muñcatīti samādānasampattaviratisampayuttacetanā “sīlaṃ pūrentassa
analyzed: aviparīta sabhāva ttā sā paññā dhammānam nijjhāna kkhamanam etissā atthi iti dhamma nijjhāna kkhantī iti attho  asaṃvaram muñcati iti samādāna sampatta virati sampayutta cetanā sīlam pūrentassa
