original: Puna “etehī”ti iminā ekuppādanānānirodhanānuppādaekanirodhadīpanavasena pavattā aṭṭhakathāpadesā
analyzed: puna etehi iti iminā eka uppāda nānā nirodha nānuppāda eka nirodha dīpana vasena pavattā aṭṭhakathā apadesā
translated: Again, ‘in these’ should be understood to refer to the passages in the Commentaries that occur in the way beginning ‘arising together, cessation separately, non-arising together, cessation separately’ .

original: gahitāti veditabbaṃ, ubhayatthāpi vā etehi ācariyehīti attho. Tatiyo bhāgo, tena🔽adhikā soḷasacittakkhaṇāyukatā tatiya…pe… yukatā vuttāti sambandho. Tatiya bhāgoti🔽ca uppādaṭṭhitikkhaṇe upādāya bhaṅgakkhaṇo adhippeto. Yasmiṃ ekādasa cittakkhaṇā
analyzed: gahitā iti veditabbam ubhayattha api vā etehi ācariyehi iti attho tatiyaḥ bhāgaḥ tena  adhikā soḷasa cittakkhaṇa āyuka tā yuka tā vuttā ati sambandho tatiya bhāga ti  ca uppāda ṭṭhiti kkhaṇe upādāya bhaṅga kkhaṇaḥ adhippetaḥ yasmin ekādasa cittakkhaṇāḥ
translated: Or the meaning can be taken as ‘by these teachers in both places.’

original: atītā, avasesapañcacittakkhaṇāyuke, yasmiṃ pañcadasa cittakkhaṇā atītā, avasesaekacittakkhaṇāyuke
analyzed: atītāḥ avasesa pañca citta kkhaṇa āyuke yasmin pañcadasa citta kkhaṇāḥ atītāḥ avasesa eka citta kkhaṇa āyuke
translated: The third part, therefore, is stated thus: ‘The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: ‘The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc., is stated thus: “The third part, etc.,

original: tasmiṃyeva ārammaṇeti yojetabbaṃ. Ubhayañcetaṃ yathākkamaṃ manodvāre pañcadvāre ca
analyzed: tasmin yeva ārammaṇā iti yojetabbam ubhayam ca itam yathākkamam manaḥ dvāre pañca dvāre ca
translated: The words “in that same object” should be construed with both. And both should be understood as the object that has come into focus in the mind door and in the five doors respectively.

original: āpāthagataṃ veditabbaṃ. Na kho panevaṃ sakkā viññātuṃ ekacittakkhaṇātītaṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: āpātha gatam veditabbam na kho pana evam sakkā viññātum eka citta khaṇa atītam ārammaṇam
translated: But it is not possible to know that the object has passed away a single thought-moment after it has been cognized.

original: sandhāya paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅgaṭṭhakathāyaṃ tathā vuttanti dassento “na hi sakkā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sandhāya paṭicca samuppāda vibhaṅga ṭṭhakathā ayam tathā vuttanti dassentaḥ na hi sakkā iti ādim āha
translated: The intention of the statement in the Paṭṭhāna commentary is to show that it is not possible to know that the object has passed away a single thought-moment after it has been cognized.

original: Pañcadasāti atirekapañcadasa cittakkhaṇā atītāti sambandho. “Tasmā”tiādinā yattha🔽khaṇekadesaṃ aggahitanti na sakkā vattuṃ, tameva dasseti. Evaṃ tāva na rūpaṃ sattarasacittakkhaṇāyukaṃ,
analyzed: pañcadasā iti atireka pañcadasa cittakkhaṇāḥ atītā ati sambandho tasmā iti ādinā  khaṇa ekadesam aggahitanti na sakkā vattum tam eva dasseti evam tāva na rūpam satta rasa citta khaṇa āyukam
translated: “Fifteen” is connected with “more than.”🔽“Therefore” shows that it is not possible to say that a part of the moment is not included.

original: nāpi tatiyabhāgādhikasoḷasacittakkhaṇāyukaṃ, atha kho soḷasacittakkhaṇāyukamevāti dassitaṃ hoti.
analyzed: na api tatiya bhāga adhika soḷasa citta kkhaṇa āyukam atha kho soḷasa citta kkhaṇa āyukam eva ati dassitam hoti
translated: Thus it is shown that matter is not of the duration of seventeen thought-moments, nor of the duration of sixteen thought-moments plus a third part. It is of the duration of sixteen thought-moments.

original: Kasmā panettha rūpameva samānepi aniccasaṅkhatādibhāve cirāyukaṃ jātanti? Dandhaparivattibhāvato.
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha rūpam eva samāne pi anicca saṅkhata ādi bhāve cira āyukam dandha parivatti bhāvato
translated: But why is it said that matter is of long duration here, although it is impermanent, etc., in common with the other three aggregates? Because of its slow change.

original: Arūpadhammā hi sārammaṇā cittapubbaṅgamā, te yathābalaṃ attano ārammaṇavibhāvanavasena
analyzed: arūpa dhammāḥ hi sa ārammaṇā citta pubbaṅgamā te yathābalam attanaḥ ārammaṇa vibhāvana vasena
translated: For the immaterial states, which have an object, are preceded by consciousness, and they occur by way of the manifestation of their object according to their respective strength.

original: pavattantīti tadatthanipphattisamanantarameva nirujjhanato lahuparivattino. Tenāha
analyzed: pavattanti iti tad attha nipphatti samanantaram eva nirujjhanataḥ lahu parivattinaḥ tena āha
translated: Therefore they cease immediately after the fulfilment of their purpose and so they are “quickly reversible.” Hence the Exalted One said:

original: bhagavā, “nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ,
analyzed: bhagavā na aham bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi evam lahu parivattam
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing that is so quickly reversible as the mind.

original: yadidaṃ, bhikkhave, citta”nti. Rūpadhammā pana anārammaṇā, te ārammaṇavasena arūpadhammehi🔽vibhāvetabbā. Sā ca nesaṃ vohārānuguṇā vibhāvetabbatā attano dandhaparivattitāya,
analyzed: yat idam bhikkhave cittam ti rūpa dhammā pana anārammaṇā te ārammaṇa vasena arūpa dhammehi  vibhāvetabbā sā ca na isam vohāra anuguṇā vibhāvetabba tā attanaḥ dandha parivatti tāya
translated: The mind, bhikkhus, is quickly reversible” . The material states, which have no object, are to be distinguished from the immaterial states by way of their object.

original: tesañca lahuparivattitāya soḷasahi sattarasahi vā cittakkhaṇehi nippajjatīti rūpamevettha
analyzed: tesam ca lahu parivatti tāya soḷasahi sattarasahi vā cittakkhaṇehi nippajjati iti rūpam eva itthā
translated: And this distinction, which is in accordance with their verbal expression, is made in sixteen or seventeen thought-moments, because of the slowness of their occurrence.🔽Therefore it is only the material states that are “long-lived” here.

original: cirāyukaṃ jātaṃ. Kiñca – lahuviññāṇavisayasantatimattādhīnavuttitāya tiṇṇaṃ khandhānaṃ,
analyzed: cira āyukam jātam kiñca lahu viññāṇa visaya santatimattā adhīna vutti tāya tiṇṇam khandhānam
translated: Moreover, the three mental aggregates are “quickly reversible” because their occurrence depends on the mere continuity of the object of the quick consciousness,🔽and consciousness is “quickly reversible” because it has only the mere apprehension of the object. The material states are “long-lived”

original: ārammaṇūpaladdhimattabhāvato viññāṇassa ca lahuparivattitā, dandhamahābhūtappaccayatāya
analyzed: ārammaṇa upaladdhimatta bhāvataḥ viññāṇassa ca lahu parivatti tā dandha mahābhūta ppaccaya tāya
translated: because they are dependent on the slow great primaries.

original: pana rūpassa dandhaparivattitā. Nānādhātūsu tathāgatasseva yathābhūtañāṇaṃ, tena
analyzed: pana rūpassa dandha parivatti tā nānā dhātūsu tathāgatassa iva yathā bhūta ñāṇam tena
translated: but materiality turns over slowly. The Tathāgata’s knowledge of materiality and mentality is in accordance with actuality in the various instances.

original: ca rūpameva purejātapaccayo vutto, pacchājātapaccayo ca tassevāti na ettha aniccasaṅkhatādibhāvasāmaññena
analyzed: ca rūpam eva purejāta paccayaḥ vutto pacchājāta paccayo ca tassa iva āti na ettha anicca saṅkhata ādi bhāva sāmaññena
translated: Therefore he has stated materiality only as a prenascent condition and a postnascent condition for materiality itself. So it should not be concluded that materiality and mentality are of equal duration here by similarity of state consisting in impermanence, etc.,

original: rūpārūpaṃ samānāyukaṃ parikappetabbaṃ. Vuttanayena rūpameva cirāyukanti niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ.🔽Yathā ca rūpassa sattarasacittakkhaṇāyukatā, tatiyabhāgādhikasoḷasacittakkhaṇāyukatā
analyzed: rūpa arūpam samāna āyukam parikappetabbam vutta nayena rūpam eva cira āyukan ti niṭṭham ettha gantabbam  yathā ca rūpassa satta rasa cittakkhaṇa āyuka tā tatiya bhāga adhika soḷasa cittakkhaṇa āyuka tā
translated: but it should be concluded that materiality alone is long-lived in duration.🔽And just as materiality is not of the duration of seventeen or sixteen conscious moments with an excess of a third,🔽he shows that, and then he quotes the passage from the commentary on the Abhidhamma that speaks of the arising of materiality at the moment of consciousness’s presence,

original: vā na hoti, taṃ dassetvā yvāyaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ cittassa ṭhitikkhaṇe rūpuppādo vutto,🔽tattha ṭhitikkhaṇameva tāva cittassa ananujānanto “yo cettha…pe… vicāretabbo”ti vatvā
analyzed: vā na hoti tam dassetvā yvā ayam aṭṭhakathā ayam cittassa ṭhiti khaṇe rūpuppādo vutto  tattha ṭhiti khaṇam eva tāva cittassa an anujānantaḥ vicāretabbaḥ ti vatvā
translated: and he begins the “Consciousness-Pairs” section with the words “In the Consciousness-Pairs section” in order to show that the moment of consciousness’s presence is not admitted in the Abhidhamma, and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the presence of consciousness?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The presence of consciousness is the arising of consciousness” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the presence of materiality?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The presence of materiality is the arising of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the arising of consciousness?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The arising of consciousness is the generation of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the arising of materiality?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The arising of materiality is the generation of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the generation of consciousness?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The generation of consciousness is the generation of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the generation of materiality?”

original: yamake uppannauppajjamānavārādipāḷiṃ āharanto “cittayamake”tiādimāha. Tattha paripuṇṇavissajjaneti
analyzed: yamake uppanna a uppajjamāna vāra ādi pāḷim āharantaḥ citta yamaka iti ādim āha tattha paripuṇṇa vissajjana iti
translated: is given in the Abhidhamma as “The generation of materiality is the generation of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is the generation of materiality?”🔽is given in the Abhidhamma as “The generation of materiality is the generation of materiality” , and in order to show that the answer to the question “What is

original: ubhayampi yamakapadaṃ ahāpetvā katavissajjane. Uppādakkhaṇe anāgatañcāti uppādakkhaṇe🔽ca cittaṃ, anāgatañca cittaṃ na niruddhaṃ, nirujjhamānanti attho. Ṭhitikkhaṇābhāvaṃ
analyzed: ubhayam pi yamaka padam a hāpetvā kata vissajjane uppāda khaṇe anāgatam ca ati uppāda kkhaṇe  ca cittam anāgatam ca cittam na niruddham nirujjhamānanti attho ṭhiti khaṇa abhāvam
translated: and in the answer given without mentioning the pair of terms.🔽At the moment of arising, the future mind is not yet ceased. The meaning is that it is ceasing.🔽He shows that the mind has no moment of presence.

original: cittassa dīpetīti uppannauppajjamānavārādīsu “ṭhitikkhaṇe”ti avacanaṃ cittassa ṭhitikkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: cittassa dīpeti iti uppanna a uppajjamāna vāra ādīsu ṭhiti khaṇa iti avacanam cittassa ṭhiti khaṇam
translated: In the section on the arisen and the arising, etc., the words “at the moment of presence” are not used. He shows, he teaches, this meaning: “There is no moment of presence of the mind.”

original: nāma natthīti imamatthaṃ dīpeti bodheti. Na hi yathādhammasāsane abhidhamme labbhamānassa
analyzed: nāma na atthi iti imam attham dīpeti bodheti na hi yathā dhamma sāsane abhidhamme labbhamānassa
translated: For the reason for not using the word that is found in the Abhidhamma, the Teaching according to the True Idea, is not seen.

original: avacane kāraṇaṃ dissatīti adhippāyo. Na kevalamabhidhamme avacanameva cittassa ṭhitikkhaṇābhāvajotakaṃ,
analyzed: avacane kāraṇam dissati iti adhippāyaḥ na kevalam abhidhamme avacanam eva cittassa ṭhiti khaṇa abhāva jotakam
translated: Not only does the non-use of the word in the Abhidhamma show that the mind has no moment of presence,

original: apica kho suttantapāḷipīti dassento “suttesupī”tiādimāha. Tattha aññathattaṃ nāma
analyzed: apica kho suttanta pāḷipi iti dassentaḥ suttesu pi itiādim āha tattha aññathattam nāma
translated: but also the text of the Suttas does. He says “In the Suttas too” in order to show that.

original: pubbāparaviseso. Khaṇadvayasamaṅgiṃ ṭhitanti paccuppannassa ṭhitabhāvamāha. Aññathattaṃ
analyzed: pubba apara visesaḥ khaṇa dvaya samaṅgim ṭhitanti paccuppannassa ṭhita bhāvam āha aññathattam
translated: Therein, change-of-state is a difference between what is before and what is after. “ Present, possessing a double instant” shows the presence of the present.

original: pana santāneyeva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: pana santāneya iva veditabbam
translated: But change-of-state should be understood only in a continuity.

original: Ettha ca keci “yathābhūto dhammo uppajjati, kiṃ tathābhūtova bhijjati, udāhu aññathābhūto?
analyzed: ettha ca keci yathābhūtaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati kim tathābhūtaḥ iva bhijjati udāhu aññathābhūtaḥ
translated: And here some say this: “When a state has arisen in such a way, does it then cease in just that way, or does it cease in some other way?

original: Yadi tathābhūtova bhijjati, na jaratāya sambhavo. Atha aññathābhūto, añño eva soti
analyzed: yadi tathābhūtaḥ uva bhijjati na jaratāya sambhavaḥ atha aññathābhūtaḥ aññaḥ eva saḥ ti
translated: If it ceases in just that way, then it is not possible for it to be subject to ageing. But if it ceases in some other way, then it is another state that ceases.🔽So in all cases there is no such thing as the instant of its presence.”

original: sabbathāpi ṭhitikkhaṇassa abhāvoyevā”ti vadanti. Tattha ekadhammādhārabhāvepi uppādanirodhānaṃ
analyzed: sabbathā api ṭhiti kkhaṇassa abhāvaḥ yeva ati vadanti tattha eka dhamma ādhāra bhāve pi uppāda nirodhānam
translated: Herein, although a single state is the basis, the arising and the ceasing

original: aññova uppādakkhaṇo, añño nirodhakkhaṇo. Uppādāvatthañhi upādāya uppādakkhaṇo, nirodhāvatthaṃ
analyzed: aññaḥ va uppāda kkhaṇaḥ aññaḥ nirodha kkhaṇaḥ uppāda avattham hi upādāya uppāda kkhaṇaḥ nirodha avattham
translated: are different. The instant of arising is due to the aspect of arising, and the instant of ceasing is due to the aspect of ceasing.

original: upādāya nirodhakkhaṇo. Uppādāvatthāya ca bhinnā nirodhāvatthāti ekasmiṃyeva sabhāvadhamme🔽yathā icchitabbā, aññathā aññova dhammo uppajjati, añño dhammo nirujjhatīti āpajjeyya,
analyzed: upādāya nirodha kkhaṇaḥ uppāda avatthāya ca bhinnā nirodha avatthā ati ekasmiṃ yeva sabhāva dhamme  yathā icchitabbā aññathā aññaḥ va dhammaḥ uppajjati aññaḥ dhammaḥ nirujjhati iti āpajjeyya
translated: And the aspect of ceasing is divided from the aspect of arising in a single state of like kind.🔽So it must be admitted that it is in this way that the arising and the ceasing are different. Otherwise it would follow that it is another state that arises and another that ceases.

original: evaṃ nirodhāvatthāya viya nirodhābhimukhāvatthāyapi bhavitabbaṃ. Sā ṭhiti, jaratā
analyzed: evam nirodha avatthāya bhavitabbam sā jaratā
translated: And just as there is the aspect of ceasing, so too there must be an aspect of facing cessation. That is presence, ageing, and likewise impermanence.

original: cāti sampaṭicchitabbametaṃ. Yadi evaṃ kasmā pāḷiyaṃ ṭhitikkhaṇo na vuttoti? Vineyyajjhāsayānurodhena
analyzed: ca ati sampaṭicchitabbam etam yadi evam kasmā pāḷiyam ṭhiti khaṇaḥ na vuttaḥ ti vineyya jhāsayā anurodhena
translated: and this must be admitted. If that is so, why is the moment of presence not stated in the text? —Because of the inclination of those susceptible of training.

original: nayadassanavasena pāḷi gatāti veditabbā. Abhidhammadesanāpi hi kadāci vineyyajjhāsayānurodhena
analyzed: naya dassana vasena gatā ati veditabbā abhidhamma desanā api hi kadāci
translated: and this must be admitted. If that is so, why is the moment of presence not stated in the text? It should be understood that it is included by the method of teaching. For the teaching of the Abhidhamma sometimes proceeds by way of the inclinations of those requiring training.🔽For thus the arising of materiality is taught by dividing it into “accumulation” and “continuity.”

original: pavattati. Tathā hi rūpassa uppādo “upacayo, santatī”ti bhinditvā desito. Hetusampayuttadukādidesanā🔽cettha nidassitabbā.
analyzed: pavattati tathā hi rūpassa uppādaḥ upacayo santati iti bhinditvā desitaḥ hetu sampayutta duka ādi desanā  ca ittha nidassitabbā
translated: The teaching of the “root, associated, support, and object conditions” should be cited here.

original: “Yassa vā panā”tiādi pucchāvacanaṃ. Tassa “no”ti vissajjanaṃ. Samudayasaccaṃ nirujjhatīti🔽cittuppādassa nirodhakkhaṇo vutto. Ayamettha adhippāyo – yadi cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe
analyzed: yassa vā pana atiādi pucchā vacanam tassa no ti vissajjanam samudaya saccam nirujjhati iti  cittuppādassa nirodha kkhaṇaḥ vuttaḥ ayam ettha adhippāyaḥ yadi cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe
translated: The question is stated in the words “Or is there any materiality that arises without the arising of consciousness?” The answer is “No.”

original: rūpaṃ uppajjeyya, taṃ dukkhasaccanti katvā “no”ti vattuṃ na sakkā, vuttañcetaṃ. Tasmā
analyzed: rūpam uppajjeyya tam dukkha saccanti katvā no ti vattum na sakkā vuttam ca itam tasmā
translated: The cessation of the truth of the origin is stated as the moment of the cessation of consciousness. This is the intention: if materiality were to arise at the moment of the dissolution of consciousness, it could not be said “No” because it would have to be called the truth of suffering. But this is said:

original: viññāyati “cittassa nirodhakkhaṇe rūpuppādo natthī”ti. Tayidamakāraṇaṃ. Arūpalokañhi
analyzed: viññāyati cittassa nirodha kkhaṇe rūpuppādo natthi iti tayidam akāraṇam
translated: Therefore it is known that there is no arising of materiality at the moment of the cessation of consciousness. This is the reason.

original: sandhāya, cittasamuṭṭhānarūpaṃ vā “no”ti sakkā vattunti. Ayañhi yamakadesanāya pakati,
analyzed: sandhāya citta samuṭṭhāna rūpam vā no ti sakkā vattunti ayam hi yamaka desanāya
translated: Or else, it can be said that the materiality originated by consciousness is not so. This is the method of the Twin Statement.

original: yadidaṃ yathāsambhavayojanā. Etena “na ca cittasamuṭṭhānarūpamevā”tiādivacanaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ
analyzed: yat idam yathā sambhava yojanā etena na ca citta samuṭṭhāna rūpam eva ati ādi vacanam paṭikkhittam
translated: This is the way in which the words “and not only materiality originated by consciousness” should be interpreted.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Atha vā paccāsattiñāyena yaṃ samudayasaccaṃ nirujjhati, tena yaṃ dukkhasaccaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam atha vā paccāsatti ñāyena yam samudaya saccam nirujjhati tena yam dukkha saccam
translated: Or alternatively, the words “and not only” should be interpreted by the method of “reversal” .🔽The words “and not only” should be interpreted as follows: “The materiality originated by consciousness, which is the materiality that is bound up with consciousness, is not the only materiality that arises and ceases together with consciousness.

original: uppādetabbaṃ cittacetasikatappaṭibaddharūpasaṅkhātaṃ, tassa tadā uppatti natthīti🔽“no”ti vissajjanaṃ, na sabbassa.
analyzed: uppādetabbam citta cetasikata paṭibaddha rūpa saṅkhātam tassa tadā uppatti natthi iti  no ti vissajjanam na sabbassa
translated: The materiality originated by consciousness is not the only materiality that arises and ceases together with consciousness.🔽The materiality originated by kamma, etc., also arises and ceases together with consciousness.

original: Sahuppādekanirodhavacanatoti “yassa kāyasaṅkhāro nirujjhati, tassa cittasaṅkhāro
analyzed: sahuppāda eka nirodha vacanato ti yassa kāya saṅkhāraḥ nirujjhati tassa citta saṅkhāro
translated: The words “and not only” should be interpreted as follows: “The materiality originated by kamma, etc., is not the only materiality that arises and ceases together with consciousness.

original: nirujjhatīti? Āmantā”ti evaṃ sahuppādasahanirodhavacanato. Tena vacanenāti “yassa
analyzed: nirujjhati iti āmantā ati evam sahuppāda saha nirodha vacanato tena vacanena ati yassa
translated: The materiality originated by consciousness also arises and ceases together with consciousness.”

original: kāyasaṅkhāro”tiādivacanena. Aññarūpānanti kammautuāhārajarūpānaṃ. Sahuppādasahanirodhādikānanti
analyzed: kāya saṅkhāra iti ādi vacanena añña rūpānaṃ anti
translated: The words “and not only” should be interpreted as follows: “The materiality originated by kamma, etc., is not the only materiality that arises and ceases together with consciousness.

original: etthāyaṃ yojanā – appaṭikkhittasahuppādasahanirodhaananuññātanānuppādanānānirodhaanivāritaabyākatabhāvānaṃ
analyzed: ettha ayam yojanā
translated: The construing here is this: the kamma-born, etc., are not prohibited, not conascent, not ceased, not permitted, not arisen, not ceased, not obstructed, and are indeterminate.🔽By this: by the text beginning, “When profitable states are present” ,

original: kammajādīnanti. Etenāti “yassa kusalā dhammā uppajjantī”tiādikena pāṭhena, “na cittasamuṭṭhānarūpamevā”ti
analyzed: kamma ja ādīnam ti etena ati yassa kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti iti ādikena pāṭhena na citta samuṭṭhāna rūpam eva ati
translated: and by the statement of reason, “not only materiality originated by consciousness” .

original: yuttivacanena ca. Yamakapāḷianussaraṇeti yathādassitacittayamakapāḷiyā yathārutavaseneva
analyzed: yutti vacanena ca yamaka pāḷi anussaraṇā iti yathā dassitacitta yamaka pāḷiyā yathā ruta vasena iva
translated: By recalling the pair of triplets: by recalling the pair of triplets on consciousness as shown above, taking them literally,🔽and assuming that they are contradictory.

original: anussaraṇe vijjamāne. Bhijjamānatāti cittassa bhijjamānatā nāma nirujjhamānatā ṭhitiyā
analyzed: anussaraṇe vijjamāne bhijjamāna tā ati cittassa bhijjamāna tā nāma nirujjhamāna tā ṭhitiyā
translated: The “contradiction” of consciousness is its cessation, not its continuance,

original: abhāvato. Sahāyabhāvaṃ nāpi gacchati nissayatthibhāvādinā paccayabhāvābhāvato. Uppādakkhaṇe🔽eva hi anantarādipaccayalābhena cittassa balavatā. Evañca satīti evañca utunāpi bhavaṅgacittassa
analyzed: abhāvataḥ sahāya bhāvam na api gacchati nissaya tthi bhāva ādinā paccaya bhāva abhāvataḥ uppāda kkhaṇe  eva hi anantara ādi paccaya lābhena cittassa balavatā evañca sati iti evañca utunā api bhavaṅga cittassa
translated: because there is no such state as continuance. It does not become a companion to materiality, because it does not become a condition for it in the way of support, etc.🔽For at the moment of arising of consciousness, which is strong, it obtains the conditions of proximity, etc.,🔽And so too: and so too, when materiality is originated by the life-continuum consciousness at the moment of its arising by temperature,

original: uppādakkhaṇeyeva rūpasamuṭṭhāpane sati. Taṃcittakkhaṇeti tassa cittassa khaṇe, khaṇadvayepīti
analyzed: uppāda khaṇe yeva rūpa samuṭṭhāpane sati tad citta khaṇe iti tassa cittassa khaṇe khaṇa dvaye pi iti
translated: At that moment of consciousness: at the moment of that consciousness, in the two moments,

original: attho. Tenevāti atilahuparivattibhāveneva. Atha vā tenevāti dandhaparivattikatāya
analyzed: tena iva ati ati lahu parivatti bhāvena iva atha vā tena iva ati dandha parivattika tāya
translated: “Therefore” means because of the quickness of the revolution. Or alternatively, “therefore” means because of the slowness of the revolution.

original: rūpassa sakalaṃ ekacittakkhaṇaṃ uppajjamānabhāveneva. Tanti cittaṃ. Paṭisandhicittaṃ
analyzed: rūpassa sakalam eka cittakkhaṇam uppajjamāna bhāvena iva tanti cittam paṭisandhi cittam
translated: “Then” means because of the arising of the whole material group in a single moment of consciousness. “That” means the consciousness.

original: sampayuttadhammānaṃ viya sahajātarūpadhammānampi sahajātādipaccayena paccayo hotīti
analyzed: sampayutta dhammānam viya sahajāta rūpa dhammānam pi sahajāta ādi paccayena paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: The rebirth-linking consciousness is a condition for the material phenomena that arise together with it by conascence condition, just as it is for the associated mental phenomena.

original: āha “paṭisandhito uddha”nti. Cittasamuṭṭhānānaṃ cittaṃ sahajātādipaccayo hotiyevāti
analyzed: āha paṭisandhitaḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam cittam sahajāta ādi paccayaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said, “From the rebirth-linking up to the time of death” . The consciousness is a condition for the material phenomena originated by consciousness by conascence condition, and so on.🔽Therefore it is said, “For the material phenomena not originated by consciousness” .

original: vuttaṃ “acittasamuṭṭhānāna”nti. Tadanantaranti yena cittena sahuppannaṃ, tassa cittassa
analyzed: vuttam tad anantaram ti yena cittena sahuppannam tassa cittassa
translated: “Immediately prior to that” means immediately prior to the consciousness with which the material phenomena arise together.

original: anantaraṃ. Tanti rūpaṃ. Tadanantaraṃ cittanti sahuppannacittānantaraṃ cittaṃ. Yadi
analyzed: anantaram rūpam tad anantaram cittanti sahuppanna citta anantaram cittam yadi
translated: “That” means the material phenomena. “The consciousness immediately prior to that” means the consciousness immediately prior to the consciousness with which the material phenomena arise together.

original: evanti yadi sakalaṃ cittakkhaṇaṃ rūpaṃ uppajjamānameva hoti, cittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: evam ti yadi sakalam citta kkhaṇam rūpam uppajjamānam eva hoti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: “If it is so” means if the material group arises in its entirety in a single moment of consciousness, then the beginning of the arising of the material group would be at the very moment of the arising of the consciousness.

original: eva rūpassa uppādārambhoti āha “na, cittanirodhakkhaṇe rūpuppādārambhābhāvato”ti.
analyzed: eva rūpassa uppāda ārambhaḥ ti āha na citta nirodha kkhaṇe rūpa uppāda ārambha abhāvato ti
translated: Therefore it is said, “Because there is no beginning of the arising of material phenomena at the moment of the cessation of consciousness” .

original: Cittakkhaṇeti attanā sahuppannacittassa khaṇe. Tanti rūpaṃ. Rūpasamuṭṭhāpanapurejātapaccayakiccanti
analyzed: citta kkhaṇe ti attanā sahuppanna cittassa khaṇe rūpam rūpa samuṭṭhāpana purejāta paccaya kiccanti
translated: ‘In the consciousness-unit’: in the moment of the consciousness that arises together with it. ‘It’: materiality. ‘The function of the prenascent condition for the production of materiality’:

original: rūpasamuṭṭhāpanakiccañca purejātapaccayakiccañca. Ṭhitippattivisesālābhanti ṭhitippattiyā🔽laddhabbo yo viseso, tassa alābhaṃ. Idaṃ vuttanti “yena sahuppajjati, taṃcittakkhaṇe
analyzed: rūpa samuṭṭhāpana kiccam ca purejāta paccaya kiccam ṭhiti patti visesa alābhanti ṭhiti ppattiyā  laddhabbaḥ yaḥ visesaḥ tassa alābham idam vuttan ti yena sahuppajjati tad citta kkhaṇe
translated: the function of producing materiality and the function of the prenascent condition. ‘The non-arrival of the distinction of the attainment of continuance’:

original: rūpaṃ uppajjamānamevā”ti idaṃ pariyāyena vuttaṃ.🔽Yaṃ yassa sambandhibhāvena vuttaṃ, taṃ dūre ṭhitampi tena sambandhanīyanti āha “tato
analyzed: rūpam uppajjamānam eva ati idam pariyāyena vuttam  yam yassa sambandhi bhāvena vuttam tam dūre ṭhitam api tena sambandhanīyan ti āha tatas
translated: the non-arrival of the distinction that is to be obtained by the attainment of continuance. ‘This is said’: this is said figuratively, ‘The materiality that arises in the moment of the consciousness with which it arises.’

original: paraṃ…pe… etena saha sambandho”ti. Tasmā “tato”ti ettha taṃsaddena cutiṃ paccāmasatīti
analyzed: etena saha sambandho ti tasmā ettha taṃsaddena cutim paccāmasati iti
translated: ‘What is said to be related to what is far removed is to be related to that even though it is far removed.’ Therefore, since the word ‘that’ in the phrase ‘after that’ refers back to death,

original: vuttaṃ “cutito paranti attho”ti.
analyzed: vuttam cutitaḥ paranti attho ti
translated: it is said, ‘The meaning is: after death.’

original: Natthīti katvāti yadipi yathā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ, tathā ekuppādekanirodhatā rūpānaṃ arūpehi, arūpānañca rūpehi natthi. Yathā ca amhehi vuttaṃ, tathā atthevāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: natthi iti katvā ti yadi api yathā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam tathā ekuppāda eka nirodha tā rūpānam arūpehi arūpānam ca rūpehi natthi yathā ca amhehi vuttam tathā attha eva ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: ‘As non-existent’: though it is as stated in the commentary, still there is no single arising and single cessation of materiality and immateriality as there is of the material septad. The intention is that there is such a single arising and single cessation of materiality and immateriality as we have stated it.

original: Catutthassa pakārassa vuccamānattā “tayo pakāre āhā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽“Tesaṃyeva rūpānaṃ kāyavikāro”tiādinā parinipphannānaṃ vikārādibhāvaṃ dassetvā “sabbaṃ
analyzed: catutthassa pakārassa vuccamāna ttā tayo pakāre āha iti vuttam  tesam yeva rūpānam kāya vikāraḥ ti ādinā parinipphannānam vikāra ādi bhāvam dassetvā sabbam
translated: ‘Three kinds of manifestation’ is said because the fourth kind of manifestation is being discussed.🔽‘Bodily intimation’ and so on show the state of being an alteration of the already- existent. The meaning of ‘already-existent’ is shown by the words ‘all that is already-existent is formed’ .

original: parinipphannaṃ saṅkhatamevā”ti vadantena parinipphannatāpariyāyo dassito. Pubbantāparantaparicchinnoti
analyzed: parinipphannam saṅkhatam eva ti vadantena parinipphanna tā pariyāyaḥ dassito pubba anta apara anta paricchinnaḥ ti
translated: ‘Bounded by past and future’: bounded by the manifestation of the past and the disappearance of the future, or bounded by arising and falling.

original: pātubhāvaviddhaṃsabhāvaparicchinno, udayabbayaparicchinno vā. “Ayaṃ datto nāma hotū”tiādinā
analyzed: pātubhāva viddha aṃsabhāva paricchinnaḥ udaya bbaya paricchinnaḥ vā ayam dattaḥ nāma hotu uti ādinā
translated: ‘The naming of it’ is the naming of it thus ‘This is called So-and-so.’

original: nāmakaraṇaṃ nāmaggahaṇaṃ. Samāpajjanaṃ nirodhasamāpattiyā samathavipassanānukkamena
analyzed: nāma karaṇam nāma ggahaṇam samāpajjanam nirodha samāpattiyā samatha vipassanā anukkamena
translated: ‘The attainment’ is the cessation of the mental body only by the order of serenity and insight in the attainment of cessation.

original: nāmakāyassa nirodhameva. Ādi-saddena sattakasiṇādipaññattiyā paññāpanaṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: nāmakāyassa nirodham eva ādi saddena satta kasiṇa ādi paññattiyāḥ paññāpanam saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The word ‘etc.’ includes the description of the seven kasiṇas, and so on.

original: Nipphādiyamānoti sādhiyamāno.
analyzed: nipphādiyamānaḥ iti sādhiyamānaḥ
translated: “Is being produced” means is being accomplished.

original: Pakiṇṇakakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the miscellaneous section is finished.

original: Kamādivinicchayakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the exposition of sensuality, etc.

original: Uppattikkamādīsu desanākkamopi labbhatevāti “cattāro satipaṭṭhānātiādiko desanākkamovā”ti
analyzed: uppatti kkama ādīsu desanā kkamaḥ api labbhate iva ati cattāro sati paṭṭhāna ati ādikaḥ desanā kkamaḥ uvā ti
translated: As regards the order of arising, etc., the order of teaching is also applicable. Hence it is said: “The order of teaching is the order in which the four foundations of mindfulness, etc., are taught.”

original: vuttaṃ. Anupubbukkaṃsatoti dānasīlakāmādīnavādidassananekkhammakathānaṃ anukkamena
analyzed: vuttam anupubba ukkaṃsato ti dāna sīla kāma ādīnava ādi dassana nekkhamma kathānam anukkamena
translated: The order of sequence is stated as the order in which the teaching of generosity, virtue, heaven, and the disadvantages of sensuality, etc., is given in sequence,

original: ukkaṭṭhabhāvato kathānaṃ anupubbukkaṃsatā vuttā. Tena ukkaṃsakkamo nāmāyaṃ visuṃ
analyzed: ukkaṭṭha bhāvataḥ kathānam anupubba ukkaṃsa tā vuttā tena ukkaṃsa kkamaḥ nāma ayam visum
translated: in the sense of their being progressively more refined. Thus he shows that this is a separate order called the order of sequence.

original: kamoti dasseti. Tathāpi dānādīnaṃ desanākkamāvarodhane kāraṇamāha “uppattiādivavatthānābhāvato”ti.🔽Tattha ādi-saddena pahānapaṭipattibhūmikkame saṅgaṇhāti. “Cakkhuādīnampi visayabhūta”nti
analyzed: kamaḥ ti dasseti tathā api dāna ādīnam desanā kkama avarodhane kāraṇam āha uppatti ādi vavatthāna abhāvato ti  tattha ādi saddena pahāna paṭipatti bhūmikkame saṅgaṇhāti cakkhu ādīnam pi visaya bhūtam ti
translated: Nevertheless, he gives the reason for the inclusion of generosity, etc., in the order of teaching: “because there is no distinction in their origination, etc.”🔽Herein, the word “etc.” includes the order of abandoning, the order of practice, and the order of the planes.🔽“The objects of the eye, etc.,” he says, “are also included” in order to show that the objects of the five physical sense faculties are also included.

original: iminā pañcarūpindriyagocaratā adhippetāti āha “ekadesenā”tiādi. Ekadesenāti bāhiroḷārikāyatanehi.
analyzed: iminā pañca rūpa indriya gocara tā adhippetā ati āha ekadesena atiādi ekadesena ati bāhira uḷārika āyatanehi
translated: “In part” means in the external gross sense bases.

original: Etthāti “yaṃ vedayati, taṃ sañjānātī”ti etasmiṃ pade vuttanayena.
analyzed: ettha ati yam vedayati tam sañjānāti iti etasmin pade vutta nayena
translated: “Herein” means in the passage: “What one feels, that one perceives” .

original: Taṃsabhāvatānivattanatthanti anāsavadhammasabhāvatānivattanatthaṃ. Anāsavā khandhesveva🔽vuttāti attho sāsavānampi khandhesu vuttattā. Nanu ca anāsavadhammo khandhesu avuttopi
analyzed: tad sabhāva tā nivattana attham anāsavā khandhesu eva  vuttā ti attho sa āsavānam pi khandhesu vutta ttā nanu ca anāsava dhammaḥ khandhesu a vuttaḥ api
translated: For the purpose of preventing the state of being that is subject to cankers. The meaning is: for the purpose of preventing the state of being that is subject to cankers in the aggregates that are subject to cankers. For the aggregates that are subject to cankers are also called “subject to cankers.”🔽But is not the state of being that is not subject to cankers also found in the aggregates that are not subject to cankers?

original: atthīti? Saccaṃ atthi, khandhādhikāre khandhapariyāpannā eva anāsavā gayhantīti nāyaṃ doso.🔽Yathā phassādayo visesato tadanuguṇavuttitāya saṅkhatābhisaṅkharaṇasabhāvāti saṅkhārakkhandhe
analyzed: atthi iti saccam atthi khandha adhikāre khandha pariyāpannāḥ eva anāsavāḥ gayhanti iti na ayam dosaḥ  yathā phassa ādayaḥ visesataḥ tad anuguṇa vutti tāya saṅkhata abhisaṅkharaṇa sabhāvā ati saṅkhāra kkhandhe
translated: It is true that it is found there, but only the aggregates that are subject to cankers are called “subject to cankers” in the passage under discussion. Therefore there is no fault.

original: samavaruddhā, na evaṃ vedanāsaññāviññāṇānīti rūpadhammā viya tāni visuṃ khandhabhāvena
analyzed: samavaruddhā naḥ evam vedanā saññā viññāṇāni iti rūpa dhammāḥ viya tāni visum khandha bhāvena
translated: Just as contact, etc., are included in the aggregate of volitional formations because they are specifically related to it by their function, so too the aggregates of feeling, perception, and consciousness are included in the aggregate of volitional formations because they are specifically related to it by their function. But they are stated separately as aggregates because they are not included in the aggregate of volitional formations like material form.

original: vuttāni. Etena phassādīnaṃ visuṃ khandhasaddavacanīyatābhāvo vuttoti veditabbo. Tena
analyzed: vuttāni etena phassa ādīnam visum khandha sadda vacanīya tā bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti veditabbaḥ tena
translated: By this it should be understood that contact, etc., are not stated separately as aggregates because they are included in the aggregate of volitional formations.🔽Therefore it is said: “Contact, etc., are included in the aggregate of volitional formations.”

original: vuttaṃ “phusanādayo panā”tiādi. Itiādīnañca suttānanti ettha ādi-saddena “rūpe kho,
analyzed: vuttam phusana ādayaḥ pana atiādi iti ādīnam ca suttānam ti ettha ādi saddena rūpe kho
translated: By the words “and so on” in the phrase “such as the suttas beginning with ‘feeling’ ” , etc., the following suttas are included:

original: bhikkhave, sati rūpaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ abhinivissa uppajjanti saṃyojanābhinivesavinibandhā.🔽Vedanāya…pe… saññāya… saṅkhāresu… viññāṇe sati viññāṇaṃ upādāya viññāṇaṃ abhinivissa
analyzed: bhikkhave sati rūpam upādāya rūpam abhinivissa uppajjanti saṃyojana abhinivesa vinibandhā  saññāya saṅkhāresu viññāṇe sati viññāṇam upādāya viññāṇam abhinivissa
translated: “Bhikkhus, when there is material form, it is dependent on material form, bound to material form, that clinging and misapprehension occur whereby such a self-theory might arise.

original: uppajjanti saṃyojanābhinivesavinibandhā”ti, tathā “ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpanti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī
analyzed: uppajjanti tathā aham rūpam mama rūpam ti pariyuṭṭha ṭhāyī
translated: When there is feeling … perception … volitional formations … consciousness, it is dependent on consciousness, bound to consciousness, that clinging and misapprehension occur whereby such a self-theory might arise” , and “He is one who dwells pursuing the pursuit of self-theory in regard to material form as ‘my self,’ which is based on the material form of the four great elements” , and so on.

original: hotī”ti ca evamādīnaṃ suttapadānaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Etenāti attanā dassitasuttena.
analyzed: hoti iti ca evamādīnam sutta padānam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo etena ati attanā dassita suttena
translated: “By this” : by the sutta just mentioned.

original: Vakkhamānasuttavasena cāti “rūpe kho, bhikkhave, satī”tiādikassa aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vakkhamānassa🔽suttassa vasena. “Parittārammaṇādivasena na vattabbā”ti etena navattabbārammaṇāpi
analyzed: vakkhamāna sutta vasena ca ati rūpe kho bhikkhave sati iti ādikassa aṭṭhakathāyam vakkhamānassa  suttassa vasena paritta ārammaṇa ādi vasena na vattabbā ati etena na vattabba ārammaṇā api
translated: “And by the sutta being commented on” : by the sutta beginning, “Bhikkhus, when there is material form” , which is being commented on in the commentary.

original: diṭṭhi khandhe eva nissāya uppajjati, pageva khandhārammaṇāti dasseti.
analyzed: diṭṭhi khandhe eva nissāya uppajjati pageva khandha ārammaṇā ti dasseti
translated: “They cannot be said to be of limited or exalted object” : this shows that the view that has a non-existent object as its object arises only in dependence on the aggregates, all the more so the view that has the aggregates as its object.

original: Vedanākāraṇāyāti vedanāyātanāya. Chādāpanatoti rocāpanato. Bāhullenāti bahulabhāvena. Upādānakkhandhā hi bāhullappavattikā, na itare.
analyzed: vedanā kāraṇāya ati vedanā yātanāya chādāpanataḥ ti rocāpanataḥ bāhullena ati bahula bhāvena upādāna kkhandhāḥ hi bāhulla ppavattikāḥ na itare
translated: “For the sake of feeling” means for the purpose of tormenting feeling. “For the sake of covering” means for the purpose of concealing. “Abundant” means abundant in occurrence. For the aggregates as objects of clinging occur abundantly, not the others.

original: Puṭaṃ katvāti ca chattasadisaṃ puṭaṃ bandhaṃ katvā. Vatthumhīti cakkhādivatthumhi.
analyzed: puṭam katvā iti ca chatta sadisam puṭam bandham katvā vatthumhi iti cakkha ādi vatthumhi
translated: “Having made a bundle” means having made a bundle like a bundle of sticks. “In the physical bases” means in the physical bases such as the eye.

original: Vaṭṭagatavedanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Sā hi idha daṭṭhabbabhāve ṭhitā. Ūnehīti vatthunā, kilesehi ca ūnehi.
analyzed: vaṭṭa gata vedanam sandhāya vuttam sā hi idha daṭṭhabba bhāve ṭhitā ūnehi iti vatthunā kilesehi ca ūnehi
translated: This is said with reference to the feeling that occurs in the round of rebirths, for that is what is intended here. “With less” means with less physical basis and less defilements.

original: Māyāyāti indajālādimāyāya payogo māyāti adhippāyenāha “māyāya dassitaṃ rūpaṃ ‘māyā’ti🔽āhā”ti. Vatthubhāvāditoti ādi-saddena ārammaṇasampayuttādike saṅgaṇhāti. Katthacīti
analyzed: māyāya ati indajāla ādi māyāya payogaḥ māyā ati adhippāyena āha māyāya dassitam rūpam māyā ati  āha ati vatthu bhāva āditaḥ ti ādi saddena ārammaṇa sampayutta ādike saṅgaṇhāti katthaci iti
translated: “By means of deception” means by means of the practice of deception such as the conjuring of an illusory net. “The form shown by means of deception” is called “deception” .

original: rūpakkhandhādike. Koci visesoti asubhādikova.
analyzed: rūpakkhandha ādike koci viseso ti asubha ādikaḥ uva
translated: “In some place” means in the form aggregate, etc. “Some distinction” means such as foulness, etc.

original: Tassāti ajjhattikarūpassa. Yassa kāmarāgappahānamukhena sabbarāgappahānaṃ sambhavati,
analyzed: tassa ati ajjhattika rūpassa yassa kāma rāga pahāna mukhena sabba rāga ppahānam sambhavati
translated: “Of that” means of the internal form. “For one” means for one in whom the abandoning of all lust is possible by means of the abandoning of lust for sense desires.

original: taṃ sandhāyāha “kāmarāgamukhena vā sabbalobhappahānaṃ vadatī”ti. Yojetabbanti vedanāya
analyzed: tam sandhāya āha kāma rāga mukhena vā sabba lobha ppahānam vadati iti yojetabbanti vedanāya
translated: and so he says: “or he speaks of the abandoning of all greed by way of the abandoning of greed for sense desires.”

original: chandarāgaṃ pajahanto tassā samudayabhūte phassepi chandarāgaṃ pajahatīti yojetabbanti.🔽Pariññattayassa yojanā pākaṭā eva.
analyzed: chanda rāgam pajahanto tassā samudaya bhūte phasse pi chanda rāgam pajahati iti yojetabbanti  pariññattayassa yojanā pākaṭā eva
translated: “Should be construed” with the abandoning of greed for the feeling.🔽The construing of the three kinds of full-understanding is evident.🔽“From that” : because of the non-perception of the production of suffering and the destruction of pleasure.

original: Tatoti dukkhuppādanasukhavināsanānaṃ adassanato. Bhindatīti vināseti. Tanti manosañcetanāhāraṃ ñātatīraṇapariññāhi pariggaṇhāti tīreti.
analyzed: tatas ti dukkha uppādana sukha vināsanānam adassanataḥ bhindati iti vināseti tat ti manaḥ sañcetanā āhāram ñāta tīraṇa pariññāhi pariggaṇhāti tīreti
translated: “He breaks” : he destroys.🔽“He comprehends” : he comprehends by means of the full-understanding of the known and the full-understanding of the investigated.🔽“Abandoning that” : abandoning ignorance.

original: Taṃ pajahantoti avijjaṃ pajahanto. Parāmaṭṭhanti parāmāsasaṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyā niccādivasena
analyzed: tam pajahantaḥ iti avijjam pajahantaḥ parāmaṭṭhanti parāmāsa saṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyāḥ nicca ādi vasena
translated: “Seized” : seized by means of the view called “seizing” , as permanent, etc.,

original: gahitaṃ. Viññāṇaṃ niccato passanto diṭṭhupādānaṃ upādiyatīti ayamattho “tadevidaṃ
analyzed: gahitam viññāṇam niccatas passantaḥ diṭṭhupādānam upādiyati iti ayam attho tat eva idam
translated: “Seeing consciousness as permanent, he clings to the clingings of views” . This is the meaning.

original: viññāṇaṃ sandhāvati saṃsarati, anañña”ntiādisuttapadehi dīpetabbo.🔽Kamādivinicchayakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: viññāṇam sandhāvati saṃsarati anañña nti ādi sutta padehi dīpetabbaḥ  kama ādi vinicchaya kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: “This consciousness runs and wanders on, not another” .🔽The explanation of the exposition of sense desires, etc., is ended.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “Basket of Threads” is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Basket of the Abhidhamma”

original: 34. Taṃ vatvāti taṃ bhūmivasena jānitabbataṃ “sabbāpi catubhūmikavedanā”tiādinā vatvā.🔽Sampayuttato dassitatādīti ettha ādi-saddena hetujātibhūmiindriyavatthusamphassajabhedato
analyzed: tam vatvā iti tam bhūmi vasena jānitabba tam sabbā api catu bhūmika vedanā iti ādinā vatvā  sampayuttataḥ dassita tā ādi iti ettha ādi saddena hetu jāti bhūmi indriya vatthu samphassa ja bhedataḥ
translated: Having said that, he said: “All feeling is of four planes.”

original: dassitataṃ anavasesato saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: anavasesataḥ saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The meaning of the words “shown by association” and so on is this: the word “and so on” includes the meaning of “shown” without exception by way of cause, birth, plane, faculty, object, and contact.

original: Yadipi taṃ-saddo pubbe vuttassa sāmaññato paṭiniddeso, tathāpi anantarameva paccāmasituṃ
analyzed: yadi pi taṃsaddo pubbe vuttassa sāmaññato paṭiniddesaḥ tathā api anantaram eva paccāmasitum
translated: Although the word “that” is a general reference to what was said previously, still it is suitable to refer back to what was immediately before it,

original: yutto itarattha asambhavatoti āha “aṭṭha…pe… yojanā”ti. “Aṭṭhavidhattābhāvato”ti
analyzed: āha itarattha asambhavato ti āha
translated: because it is impossible to refer to the other meaning. Therefore he said: “The explanation is as follows: because of the non-existence of the eightfold.”

original: iminā taṃ asambhavaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: iminā tam asambhavam dasseti
translated: By this he shows the impossibility of the other meaning.

original: Pūraṇatthameva vutto, apubbatābhāvatoti attho.
analyzed: pūraṇa attham eva vuttaḥ apubba tā bhāvato ti attho
translated: The word “that” is used only to fill out the line, because there is no other meaning.

original: Gahaṇavaḍḍhanavasenāti gahaṇassa vaḍḍhanavasena. Gahaṇanti cettha kathanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ,
analyzed: gahaṇa vaḍḍhana vasena ati gahaṇassa vaḍḍhana vasena gahaṇam ti ca ittha kathanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: By way of the increase of the grasping: by way of the increase of the grasping. Here the grasping should be regarded as the speaking,

original: tassa vaḍḍhanaṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ ṭhāne avuttassa kathanaṃ. Tenāha “pubbe gahitato aññassa
analyzed: tassa vaḍḍhanam tasmim tasmim ṭhāne avuttassa kathanam tena āha pubbe gahitataḥ aññassa
translated: the increase of that is the speaking of what was not said previously in that place. Therefore he said: “of what was previously grasped, the speaking of what was not said previously in that place.”

original: gahaṇaṃ vaḍḍhana”nti, tato eva ca “purimagahite aññupacayavasenā”ti vuttaṃ. “Vaḍḍhanasaddo
analyzed: gahaṇam vaḍḍhanan ti tatas eva ca purima gahite aññ upacaya vasena ati vuttam vaḍḍhana saddo
translated: The word “increase” has the meaning of “cutting off.”

original: chedanattho”ti idaṃ yathā asivā “sivā”ti, diṭṭhañca “adiṭṭha”nti vuccati, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: chedana atthaḥ ti idam yathā asivā sivā ati diṭṭham ca adiṭṭham ti vuccati evam daṭṭhabbam
translated: This should be regarded as like the case of the word “sword” which is said to be “not a sword” and the case of what is seen which is said to be “not seen.”

original: Nayanīharaṇanti nīyatīti nayo, desanā, tassa nīharaṇaṃ pavattanaṃ. Vaḍḍhanakanayoti
analyzed: naya nīharaṇam ti nīyati iti nayaḥ desanā tassa nīharaṇam pavattanam vaḍḍhanaka nayo ti
translated: “The removal of the guide”: the guide is the teaching; its removal is its occurrence. The method of increase:

original: yathāvuttavaḍḍhanakavasena pavatto desanānayo. Aññe bhedāti ekavidhacatubbidhādayo
analyzed: yathā vutta vaḍḍhanaka vasena pavattaḥ desanā nayaḥ aññe bhedā ti ekavidha catubbidha ādayo
translated: the method of teaching that occurs by the method of increase as just described. Other divisions: the divisions into one kind, four kinds, etc.

original: bhedā. Yadi avisiṭṭhā, kasmā vuttāti āha “tathāpī”tiādi. Tattha paññāppabhedajananatthanti🔽dhammavisayāya pabhedagatāya paññāya vineyyānaṃ nibbattanatthaṃ, vijjāṭṭhānādivasena
analyzed: bhedāḥ yadi a visiṭṭhā kasmā vuttā iti āha tathā api itiādi tattha paññā appabheda janana tthanti  dhamma visayāya pabheda gatāya paññāya vineyyānam nibbattana attham vijjā ṭṭhāna ādi vasena
translated: If it is not specified, why is it said? He said “Nevertheless” and so on. Herein, for the purpose of producing the discrimination of wisdom:🔽for the purpose of producing in those to be trained the wisdom that has the specific divisions of the Dhamma as its object. For the purpose of producing in those to be trained the discrimination of the Dhamma by way of the bases of knowledge and so on—this is the meaning.

original: vineyyānaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidāya uppādanatthanti attho. Abhiññeyyadhammavibhāgatāya
analyzed: vineyyānam dhamma paṭisambhidāya uppādana tthan ti atthaḥ abhiññeyya dhamma vibhāga tāya
translated: Because of the state of being the object of the section on the investigation of the specific divisions of the Dhamma that is to be directly known,

original: sammasanavārassa visayabhāvato vuttaṃ “ekekassa vārassa gahitassa niyyānamukhabhāvato”ti.
analyzed: sammasana vārassa visaya bhāvataḥ vuttam ekekassa vārassa gahitassa niyyāna mukha bhāvato ti
translated: it is said: “because of the state of being the door of deliverance of each section that is grasped.”

original: Itarepi bhedā vuttāti duvidhatividhabhedānaṃ yaṃ nānattaṃ, tassa vasena itare bhedā
analyzed: itare api bhedāḥ vuttā ati duvidha tividha bhedānam yam nānattam tassa vasena itare bhedāḥ
translated: The diversity of the diversity is mentioned by way of the diversity of the twofold and threefold diversity.

original: anānattāpi yathāvuttakāraṇato vuttā. “Na kevala”ntiādinā bhedānaṃ aññamaññapekkhataṃ
analyzed: anānattā api yathā vutta kāraṇataḥ vuttā na kevala nti ādinā bhedānam
translated: “Not only” etc. shows the mutual dependence of the kinds of diversity.

original: dassetvā “tasmā”tiādinā tesaṃ visiṭṭhataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: dassetvā tasmā ati ādinā tesam visiṭṭha tam dasseti
translated: “Therefore” etc. shows their distinctness.

original: Yathā dukamūlakādīsu bhedā gaṇanānupubbiyā pavattā pabhedantarāpekkhā, na evamete.
analyzed: yathā duka mūlaka ādīsu bhedāḥ gaṇanā anupubbiyā pavattā pabheda antara apekkhāḥ na evam ete
translated: As in the case of the dyads, triads, etc., the kinds of diversity occur in numerical order, being dependent on the other kinds of diversity, so it is not in this case.

original: Ete pana sattavidhādibhedā pabhedantaranirapekkhā kevalaṃ bahuvidhabhāvasāmaññeneva
analyzed: ete pana sattavidha ādi bhedā pabheda antara nirapekkhā kevalam bahuvidha bhāva sāmaññena iva
translated: But these sevenfold, etc., kinds of diversity are not dependent on other kinds of diversity. They are mentioned only by way of the commonality of their being manyfold.

original: vuttāti dasseti “aññappabhedanirapekkhā”tiādinā. Dukatikapadatthānaṃ yathārahaṃ apekkhitabbāpekkhakabhāvena🔽vuttattā yathā duke ṭhapetvā vuttā tikā tattha pakkhittā nāma jātā, evaṃ tikadukapadatthānaṃ
analyzed: vuttā iti dasseti añña ppabheda nirapekkhā iti ādinā duka tika padatthānam yathāraham apekkhitabba apekkhaka bhāvena  vutta ttā yathā duke ṭhapetvā vuttā tikā tattha pakkhittā nāma jātā evam tika duka padatthānam
translated: This is shown by “without regard to other kinds of diversity” etc. Since the meanings of the dyads and triads are mentioned by way of the relation of that which is to be regarded and that which regards,🔽just as the triads are called “included” in the dyads because they are mentioned after the dyads, so the meanings of the triads and dyads

original: apekkhitabbāpekkhakabhāvena vuttattā duke vatvā vuttesupi tikesu te pakkhittā nāma
analyzed: apekkhitabba apekkhaka bhāvena vutta ttā duke vatvā vuttesu pi tikesu te pakkhittāḥ nāma
translated: are mentioned by way of the relation of that which is to be regarded and that which regards. Therefore, even though they are mentioned after the dyads, they are called “included” in the dyads and triads.

original: hontīti āha “parato…pe… yojitattā”ti.
analyzed: honti iti āha
translated: “They are” is said in order to show that they are so because they are yoked to the other.

original: Samānavīthiyanti ekavīthiyaṃ. Cakkhusaṅghaṭṭanāyāti cakkhurūpapaṭighātena. Soti cakkhurūpapaṭighāto.
analyzed: samāna vīthiyam ti eka vīthiyam cakkhu saṅghaṭṭanāya ati cakkhu rūpa paṭighātena saḥ ti cakkhu rūpa paṭighāto
translated: In the same street: in the same cognitive series. By the impact on the eye: by the impact of the eye and visible data. That: the impact of the eye and visible data.

original: Taduppādikāti tassa cakkhusamphassassa uppādikā. Sāti āvajjanavedanā. Nanu ca vedanāpaccayo
analyzed: tad uppādikā ti tassa cakkhu samphassassa uppādikā sā ati āvajjana vedanā nanu ca vedanā paccayo
translated: That which produces that: that which produces that eye-contact. That is the adverting, the feeling, etc. But is not contact said to be a condition for feeling,

original: phasso vutto, na phassapaccayā vedanāti? Na, vedanāsīsena cittuppādassa gahitattāti.
analyzed: phassaḥ vuttaḥ na phassa paccayā vedanā ati na vedanā sīsena cittuppādassa gahita ttā ti
translated: not feeling for contact? No; because the consciousness-born feeling is included under the heading of consciousness.🔽Because it is the purpose of the eye-contact: because it is the purpose of the eye-contact. The purpose is the fruit.

original: Tappayojanattāti cakkhusamphassapayojanattā. Payojayatīti payojanaṃ, phalaṃ.🔽Rūpāvacarārūpāvacarānaṃ vipākānanti adhippāyo. Te hi idha aggahitā. Tenevāha “tesaṃ
analyzed: tad payojana ttā ati cakkhu samphassa payojana ttā payojayati iti payojanam phalam  rūpāvacara arūpāvacarānam vipākānanti adhippāyaḥ te hi idha aggahitā tena iva āha tesam
translated: The intention is that it is the purpose of the eye-contact to produce the resultant eye-consciousness.🔽The resultant eye-consciousness is the purpose of the eye-contact. The resultant eye-consciousness is the fruit of the eye-contact.🔽The resultant eye-consciousness is the purpose of the feeling, etc., born of eye-contact. The feeling, etc., born of eye-contact is the fruit of the resultant eye-consciousness.

original: sayameva manodvārabhūtattā”tiādi. Tatoti bhavaṅgato. Cakkhusamphassapaccayādikusalādīnanti
analyzed: sayam eva manaḥ dvāra bhūta ttā atiādi tatas ti bhavaṅgato
translated: The resultant eye-consciousness is the purpose of the resultant eye-contact. The resultant eye-contact is the fruit of the resultant eye-consciousness.🔽The resultant eye-contact is the purpose of the resultant eye-door adverting. The resultant eye-door adverting is the fruit of the resultant eye-contact.🔽The resultant eye-door adverting is the purpose of the resultant eye-consciousness. The resultant eye-consciousness is the fruit of the resultant eye-door adverting.🔽The resultant eye-consciousness is the purpose of the resultant eye-contact. The resultant eye-contact is the fruit of the resultant eye-consciousness.🔽The resultant eye-contact is the purpose of the resultant eye-door adverting. The resultant eye-door adverting is the fruit of the resultant eye-contact.🔽The resultant eye-door adverting is the purpose of the resultant eye-consciousness. The resultant eye-consciousness is the fruit of the resultant eye-door adverting.🔽The resultant eye-consciousness is the purpose of the resultant eye-contact. The resultant eye-contact is the fruit of the resultant eye-consciousness.

original: ettha purimena ādi-saddena “sotasamphassapaccayā”ti evamādayo saṅgahitā, dutiyena
analyzed: ettha purimena ādi saddena sota samphassa paccayā ti evamādayo saṅgahitāḥ dutiyena
translated: The resultant eye-contact is the purpose of the resultant eye-door adverting. The resultant eye-door adverting is the fruit of the resultant eye-contact.

original: akusalādayo. “Kāmāvacaraaṭṭhakusalacittavasenā”tiādinā kusalābyākatānampi kāmāvacarānaṃyeva
analyzed: akusala ādayaḥ kāmāvacara aṭṭha kusala citta vasena ati ādinā kusala abyākata anampi
translated: “The unprofitable, etc.,”

original: yojitattā vuttaṃ “samānavīthiyaṃ labbhamānatā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttā”ti. Vedanāpītisanidassanattikavajjānaṃ
analyzed: yojita ttā vuttam samāna vīthiyam labbhamāna tā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttā ti
translated: The statement “The occurrence in the same cognitive series is stated in the commentary” is made because only the profitable and indeterminate kinds of consciousness belonging to the sense sphere are included by the words “by means of the eight kinds of sense-sphere profitable consciousness” and so on.

original: ekūnavīsatiyā tikānaṃ vasena ekūnavīsaticatuvīsatikā. Yadi asamānavīthiyampi kusalādīnaṃ
analyzed: ekūnavīsatiyā tikānam vasena ekūnavīsati catuvīsatikāḥ yadi kusala ādīnam
translated: The twenty-nine and the thirty-four kinds are according to the nineteen triplets excluding the two triplets headed by “accompanied by joy” and “accompanied by equanimity” .

original: labbhamānatā yojetabbā, atha kasmā samānavīthiyaṃyeva yojitāti āha “aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: labbhamāna tā yojetabbā atha kasmā samāna vīthiyaṃyeva yojitā iti āha aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: If the occurrence of the profitable, etc., in different cognitive series is to be included, then why is it included only in the same cognitive series?🔽“But in the commentary” and so on is said.

original: panā”tiādi. Tenevāti asamānavīthiyaṃ appaṭikkhittattāyeva.
analyzed: pana atiādi tena iva ati asamāna vīthiyam appaṭikkhitta ttāya iva
translated: “For that very reason” : because it is not excluded in different cognitive series.

original: Cittasambandhoti cittena sambandho cittasambandhaṃ katvā cittasīsena vedanāya kathanaṃ.🔽Tikabhūmivasenāti kusalattikāditikavasena, kāmāvacarādibhūmivasena ca. Dvāratikavasenāti
analyzed: citta sambandhaḥ iti cittena sambandhaḥ citta sambandham katvā citta sīsena vedanāya kathanam  tika bhūmi vasena ati kusalattika ādi tika vasena kāmāvacara ādi bhūmi vasena ca dvāratika vasena ati
translated: “The connection with consciousness” : the connection with consciousness is the explanation of feeling by means of the heading of consciousness, making the connection with consciousness.

original: cakkhādiuppattidvāravasena, kusalattikāditikavasena ca. Yattha katthacīti dīpetabbassa
analyzed: cakkha ādi uppatti dvāra vasena ca yattha katthaci iti dīpetabbassa
translated: “According to the three planes” : according to the three triplets beginning with the profitable triplet, and according to the three planes beginning with the sense sphere. “According to the three doors” : according to the three doors beginning with the eye door, and according to the three triplets beginning with the profitable triplet. “In any given instance” :

original: atthassa visesābhāvato sattavidhabhedādīsu yattha katthaci. Na ca dvāraṃ anāmaṭṭhanti
analyzed: atthassa visesa abhāvataḥ sattavidha bheda ādīsu yattha katthaci na ca dvāram
translated: because there is no difference in meaning, in any of the sevenfold, etc., divisions. And the doors are not mentioned.

original: yojanā. Tena sattavidhabhedato tiṃsavidhabhede visesaṃ dasseti. Yadipi ubhayattha
analyzed: yojanā tena sattavidha bhedataḥ tiṃsavidha bhede visesam dasseti yadi api ubhayattha
translated: This is the explanation. So he shows the difference in the sevenfold and thirtyfold divisions.

original: bhūmiyo āgatā, rūpāvacarādibhūmiāmasanena pana asamānavīthiyaṃ labbhamānatā dassitāti
analyzed: bhūmiyaḥ āgatāḥ rūpāvacara ādi bhūmi āmasanena pana asamāna vīthiyam labbhamāna tā dassitā ati
translated: Although the planes are included in both, still the fact that they are found in different courses is shown by the inclusion of the fine-material sphere, etc., as planes.🔽So he says, “And here the fact that they are found in the same and different courses is very evident.”

original: āha “atibyattā ca ettha samānāsamānavīthīsu labbhamānatā”ti. Sukhadīpanāni honti
analyzed: āha ati byattā ca ettha samāna asamāna vīthīsu labbhamāna tā ati sukha dīpanāni honti
translated: They are illuminating of pleasure,🔽because the feeling aggregate is distributed by the inclusion of the doors and the planes.

original: dvārabhūmiāmasanamukhena vedanākkhandhassa vibhattattā. Na bhūmiyo apekkhitvā ṭhapitāti
analyzed: dvāra bhūmi āmasana mukhena vedanā khandhassa vibhatta ttā na bhūmiyaḥ apekkhitvā ṭhapitā ati
translated: They are not established with reference to the planes,

original: kathetabbabhāvena bhūmiyo apekkhitvā na ṭhapitā, bhūmivibhāgena na kathitāti attho.
analyzed: kathetabba bhāvena bhūmiyaḥ apekkhitvā na ṭhapitā bhūmi vibhāgena na kathitā ati attho
translated: they are not established with reference to the planes as topics to be taught; the meaning is that they are not taught by a distribution of the planes.🔽They are devoid of reference,

original: Apekkhitabbarahitāti dvārabhūmīnaṃ aggahitattā ākaṅkhitabbadvārādivisesarahitā.
analyzed: apekkhitabba rahitā ti dvāra bhūmīnam agga hita ttā ākaṅkhitabba dvāra ādi visesa rahitā
translated: because the doors and the planes are not included, they are devoid of the distinction of the desired doors, etc.

original: “Upanissayakoṭiyā”ti ettha nippariyāyato pariyāyato ca upanissayakoṭidassanamukhena
analyzed: upanissaya koṭiyā ti ettha nippariyāyataḥ pariyāyataḥ ca upanissaya koṭi dassana mukhena
translated: In the phrase “by the end of decisive-support condition”

original: idhādhippetaupanissayakoṭiṃ dassetuṃ “saddhaṃ upanissāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha upanissayānanti🔽vedanāya upanissayabhūtānaṃ. Dassananti cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, disvā vā gahaṇaṃ. Upanissayantabhāvenāti🔽lāmakūpanissayabhāvena. Yadi ghāyanādīni upanissayo bhaveyyuṃ, pakatūpanissayāneva🔽siyuṃ. Pakatūpanissayo ca nānāvīthiyaṃyevāti tadalābhavacanaṃ idha nānāvīthijotakanti
analyzed: idha adhippeta aupanissaya koṭim dassetum saddham upanissāya atiādi vuttam tattha upanissaya ānanti  vedanāya upanissaya bhūtānam dassananti cakkhu viññāṇam disvā vā gahaṇam upanissayanta bhāvena ati  lāmakūpa nissaya bhāvena yadi ghāyana ādīni upanissayaḥ bhaveyyum pakatūpanissayān eva  siyum pakatūpanissayaḥ ca tad alābha vacanam idha nānā vīthi jotakam ti
translated: “With faith as decisive-support” is said to show the extreme of decisive- support in the sense of predominance. Herein, “decisive-support” is🔽the decisive-support for feeling. “Seeing” is eye-consciousness, or the apprehending of what is seen. “As decisive-support” is🔽as a decisive-support that is a condition for the arising of the feeling. If smelling, etc., were decisive-support, they would be only🔽natural decisive-support. And natural decisive-support is only in a single cognitive series. So the expression “there” indicates a single cognitive series.🔽

original: dasseti “ghānādidvāresū”tiādinā. Kasiṇaparikammādīnanti kasiṇaparikammasamāpattinibbattanavipassanāvaḍḍhanādīnaṃ.
analyzed: dasseti ghāna ādi dvāresu utiādinā kasiṇa parikamma ādīnam ti kasiṇa parikamma samāpatti nibbattana vipassanā vaḍḍhana ādīnam
translated: “With faith as decisive-support” is said to show the extreme of decisive- support here. Therein, “decisive-support conditions” are those that are decisive-support for feeling. “Seeing” is eye-consciousness, or the apprehending of visible data. “As decisive-support” is as a weak decisive-support. If smelling, etc., were decisive-support, they would be only ordinary decisive-support. And ordinary decisive-support is only in the same cognitive series. So the words “not obtained” show that it is the same cognitive series that is referred to here. “In the doors of nose, etc.,” etc. “The preliminary work for the kasiṇa, etc.,” is the preliminary work for the kasiṇa, the attainment, the arising of insight, the increase of insight, and so on.

original: Tadalābhoti upanissayālābho, so ca ghāyanādīhi paresaṃ paṭipattiyā jānituṃ asakkuṇeyyattā.
analyzed: tad alābho ti upanissaya alābho so ca ghāyana ādīhi paresam paṭipattiyā jānitum a sakkuṇeyya ttā
translated: “Not obtained” is not obtained as decisive-support, and that is because it is impossible to know by smelling, etc., the practice of others.

original: Antimabhavikabodhisattādīnaṃ savanena vinā taṃphusanaṃ siyā mūlūpanissayoti “yebhuyyenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: antimabhavika bodhisatta ādīnam savanena vinā taṃphusanam siyā mūla upanissayaḥ ti yebhuyyena ati vuttam
translated: “For the most part” is said because there could be touching without hearing in the case of a Bodhisatta in his last existence, and so on.

original: Sampannajjhāsayoti vivaṭṭūpanissayasampattiyā sampannajjhāsayo. Tenāti “evaṃ cakkhuviññāṇa”nti vacanena. Tadupanissayanti tato paraṃ uppannakasiṇarūpadassanādīnaṃ upanissayabhūtaṃ.
analyzed: sampanna ajjhāsayo ti vivaṭṭu upanissaya sampattiyā sampanna ajjhāsayo tena ati evam cakkhu viññāṇanti vacanena tat upanissayanti tatas param uppanna kasiṇa rūpa dassana ādīnam upanissaya bhūtam
translated: “Its condition” : the condition for the kasiṇa-form, etc., that arise later.

original: Thāmagamanaṃ nāma kāmarāgādīnaṃyeva āveṇiko sabhāvoti āha “appahīnakāmarāgādikassa
analyzed: thāma gamanam nāma āveṇikaḥ sabhāvaḥ ti āha appahīna kāma rāga ādikassa
translated: “The state of being a cause” is the individual essence of lust for sense desires, etc., itself. Therefore he says: “of one who has not abandoned lust for sense desires, etc.”

original: vā”ti. “Rāgo uppanno”tiādinā iṭṭhāniṭṭhārammaṇe rāgapaṭighānaṃ uppattivicāraṇāva
analyzed: vā ti rāgaḥ uppannaḥ ti ādinā iṭṭha aniṭṭha ārammaṇe rāga paṭighānam uppatti vicāraṇā ava
translated: “The arising of lust” and so on are stated in order to consider the arising of lust and hostility towards a desirable and undesirable object, respectively.

original: vuttā, na nesaṃ kiccavisesoti kiccavisesena vutte dassento “asamapekkhanāyā”tiādimāha.🔽Pavattā vedanāti attho. Pakārantarenāti cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppannakilesānaṃ samatikkamanasaṅkhātena
analyzed: vuttāḥ na nesam kicca visesaḥ ti kicca visesena vutte dassentaḥ asamapekkhanāya iti ādim āha  pavattā vedanā ti attho pakāra antarena āti cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppanna kilesānam samatikkamana saṅkhātena
translated: But they are not stated in terms of the specific function of lust and hostility. Therefore, in order to show them in terms of the specific function, he says: “without looking at the specific function.”🔽The meaning is: the feeling that occurs.🔽“With the interval of a single occurrence” : with the interval of the single occurrence of the defilements that arise with eye-contact, which is called “surmounting.”

original: pakārantarena. Tathā bhāvanāvasenāti ettha tathā-saddena cakkhusamphassassa catubhūmikavedanāya
analyzed: pakāra antarena tathā bhāvanā vasena āti ettha tathā saddena cakkhu samphassassa catu bhūmika vedanāya
translated: “In the same way, by way of development” : here, the word “same” refers to the fourfold feeling that arises with eye-contact.

original: upanissayabhāvo eva pakārantarena kathitoti imamevatthaṃ ākaḍḍhati. Bhāvanāyevettha pakārantaraṃ.
analyzed: upanissaya bhāvaḥ eva pakāra antarena kathitaḥ ti imam evattham ākaḍḍhati bhāvanāya iva itthā pakāra antaram
translated: The meaning of the last clause is drawn out in order to show that the condition is a condition by way of decisive support.🔽The last clause is the development.

original: Sabbaṃ sammasanaṃ bhāvanāti veditabbā, na nīvaraṇappahānapariññāva.
analyzed: sabbam sammasanam bhāvanā iti veditabbā na nīvaraṇa ppahāna pariññā va
translated: All comprehending should be understood as development, not only the full-understanding of the abandoning of the hindrances.

original: Aññamaññassa cāti phoṭṭhabbamahābhūtesu itarītarassa, āpodhātuyā ca vasena.
analyzed: aññamaññassa ca ati phoṭṭhabba mahābhūtesu itarītarassa āpodhātuyā ca vasena
translated: “And of each other”: in the case of the four primary elements of tangibility, of each other, and in the case of the water element, etc.,🔽“Their” : of birth, etc. The genitive is in the sense of object.

original: Tesanti jātiādīnaṃ, kammatthe cetaṃ sāmivacanaṃ. Sahajātassa manosamphassassa balavapaccayabhāvaṃ🔽dassetīti sambandho. Tassa vā dassanassāti tassa vā jātiādike bhayato dassanavasena
analyzed: tesanti jāti ādīnam kammatthe ca itam sāmivacanam sahajātassa manaḥ samphassassa balava paccaya bhāvam  dasseti iti sambandhaḥ tassa vā dassanassa ati tassa vā jāti ādike bhayataḥ dassana vasena
translated: It shows the strength of the associated contact🔽The construction is this: or of that seeing,

original: pavattassa kāmāvacarañāṇassa.🔽Tadeva attano phalasseva phalabhāvenāti “manosamphasso”ti phassassa kāraṇabhāvena
analyzed: pavattassa kāma avacara ñāṇassa  tat eva attanaḥ phalassa iva phala bhāvena ati manaḥ samphassaḥ ti phassassa kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: of the knowledge of the sense sphere that occurs by way of seeing birth, etc., as fearful.🔽That same consciousness is the condition for the contact that is its own result,🔽which is stated as the condition for the contact that is its own result.🔽“Eye-contact” is stated

original: yaṃ vuttaṃ, tadeva viññāṇaṃ attano phalassa phalabhāvena vuttassa phassassa “cakkhusamphassaja”ntiādinā
analyzed: yat vuttam tat eva viññāṇam attano phalassa phala bhāvena vuttassa phassassa cakkhu samphassa janti ādinā
translated: as the cause of contact.

original: phalabhāvena vattuṃ na yuttaṃ. “Manosamphasso”tiādinā labbhamānopi viññāṇaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: phala bhāvena vattum na yuttam manaḥ samphassaḥ ti ādinā labbhamānaḥ api viññāṇam paṭicca
translated: It is not proper to speak of it as a fruit.

original: phassassa paccayabhāvo hetuphalasaṅkarapariharaṇatthaṃ na vuttoti vatvā yadipi phasso
analyzed: phassassa paccaya bhāvaḥ hetu phala saṅkara pariharaṇa attham na vuttaḥ iti vatvā yadi api phasso
translated: Though the word “consciousness” is found in the phrase “contact at the mind,” the fact that contact is a condition for consciousness is not stated in order to avoid confusion between cause and fruit.

original: viññāṇassa paccayo hoti, na pana phassassa viya viññāṇaṃ so tassa visesapaccayo hotīti
analyzed: viññāṇassa paccayaḥ hoti na pana phassassa viya viññāṇam so tassa visesa paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: Though consciousness is a condition for contact, it is not a specific condition for it as contact is for consciousness.

original: viññāṇassa cakkhusamphassajāditā na vuttāti dassetuṃ “yasmā vā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: viññāṇassa cakkhu samphassa ja ādi tā na vuttā iti dassetum yasmā vā tiādi vuttam
translated: Therefore the phrase “born of eye-contact” is not applied to consciousness.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Abhidhamma basket is finished.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the questions and answers

original: 150. Taṃ taṃ samudāyanti taṃ taṃ cittuppādasaṅkhātadhammasamudāyaṃ, anavasesarūpadhammasamudāyañca.
analyzed: tam tam samudāyanti tam tam cittuppāda saṅkhāta dhamma samudāyam anavasesa rūpa dhamma samudāyam ca
translated: The various groups: the various groups of states called “arising of consciousness,” and the various groups of material states without exception.

original: Yathāsambhavanti copanaṃ patto saṃvaro chaṭṭhadvāre, itaro chasupīti evaṃ yathāsambhavaṃ.
analyzed: yathā sambhavanti copanam patto saṃvaro chaṭṭha dvāre itaro cha supi iti evam yathāsambhavam
translated: According to the way in which they occur: the restraint that has come into focus is in the sixth door, the other in the six doors.

original: Tatoti abhijjhādomanassādito. Yathāyoganti yo saṃvaritabbo, tadanurūpaṃ.
analyzed: tatas ti abhijjhā domanassa āditaḥ yathāyogam ti yo saṃvaritabbo tad anurūpam
translated: From that: from greed and hate, etc. According to the way in which they are applicable: in accordance with what is to be restrained.

original: Katthacīti te eva parivaṭṭe sāmaññena vadati. Katthacīti vā tesu parivaṭṭesu kismiñcipi padese. Kiñcipi appakampi. Ekova paricchedo, na āyatanavibhaṅgādīsu viya nānāti adhippāyo.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: katthaci iti te eva parivaṭṭe sāmaññena vadati katthaci iti vā tesu parivaṭṭesu kismiñcipi padese kiñcipi appakampi ekaḥ iva paricchedaḥ na āyatana vibhaṅga ādīsu viya nānā ati adhippāyaḥ  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: He says “wherever” by way of the general characteristic of the aggregates. “Wherever” means in any of the aggregates. “Any” means even a little. The intention is that there is only one definition, not several as in the case of the exposition of the sense bases, etc.🔽The commentary on the questions is finished.

original: Khandhavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Āyatanavibhaṅgo
analyzed: khandha vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  āyatana vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the aggregates is finished.🔽The exposition of the sense bases

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the sutta section

original: 154. Asādhāraṇatoti āveṇikato. Taṃ nesaṃ asādhāraṇabhāvaṃ vipakkhavasena patiṭṭhāpetuṃ
analyzed: asādhāraṇato ti āveṇikato tam na īsam asādhāraṇa bhāvam vipakkha vasena patiṭṭhāpetum
translated: “In the sense of not shared”: in the sense of not common. In order to establish their uncommonness by way of the opposite,

original: sādhāraṇaṃ udāharaṇavasena dasseti “āyatanasaddattho viyā”ti. Atha vā cakkhādiattho
analyzed: sādhāraṇam udāharaṇa vasena dasseti āyatana sadda atthaḥ viyāti atha vā cakkha ādi atthaḥ
translated: he shows the common meaning by way of an example: “like the meaning of the word ‘sense base.’” Or else, the meaning of eye, etc.,

original: eva cakkhādisaddavisesito āyatanatthoti taṃ tādisaṃ āyatanatthaṃ sandhāyāha “āyatanasaddattho🔽viya asādhāraṇato”ti.
analyzed: eva cakkha ādi sadda visesitaḥ āyatana atthaḥ ti tam tādisam āyatana attham sandhāya āha āyatana sadda atthaḥ  asādhāraṇa tā iti
translated: is distinguished by the word “eye,” etc., and is the meaning of “sense base.” With such a meaning of “sense base” in mind, he says, “in the sense of not shared, like the meaning of the word ‘sense base.’”

original: Yadi visayassādanattho cakkhu-saddo, sotādīnampi ayaṃ samaññā siyāti atippasaṅgaṃ
analyzed: yadi cakkhu saddo sota ādīnam pi ayam samaññā siyāti atippasaṅgam
translated: If the word “eye” means the enjoyment of the object, then this designation would apply to the ear, etc., as well. This is an overextension.

original: pariharanto “satipī”tiādimāha. Dutiye atthavikappe cakkhatīti viññāṇādhiṭṭhitaṃ samavisamaṃ
analyzed: pariharantaḥ sati pi iti ādim āha dutiye attha vikappe cakkhati iti viññāṇa adhiṭṭhitam sama visamam
translated: and in order to avoid this he says “even though there is mindfulness” .🔽In the second interpretation, he sees with the eye of knowledge, which is knowledge of what is possible and impossible, etc.,

original: ācikkhati, ācikkhantaṃ viya, vibhāventaṃ viya vā hotīti attho. Rūpamiva cakkhuviññeyyaṃ🔽viya saviggahamiva sabimbakaṃ viya vaṇṇavācako rūpa-saddo adhippetoti āha “vitthāraṇaṃ
analyzed: ācikkhati ācikkhantam viya vibhāventam viya vā hoti iti atthaḥ rūpam iva cakkhu viññeyyam  viya sa viggaham iva sa bimbakam viya vaṇṇa vācakaḥ rūpa saddaḥ adhippetaḥ ti āha vitthāraṇam
translated: He says “even though there is” in order to avoid that. In the second interpretation: “He sees” means that he describes what is level and unlevel as based on consciousness. The meaning is that he is as if describing, as if discerning. The word “form” is intended in the sense of one that can be cognized by the eye,

original: vā rūpasaddassa attho”ti.
analyzed: vā rūpa saddassa atthaḥ ti
translated: as if it were a form, as if it were a reflection. He says, “Or the meaning of the word ‘form’ is extension,”

original: Vacanamevāti saviññattikasaddameva. Gamīyatīti upanīyati. Ajjhoharaṇassa rasaggahaṇamūlatāvacanena
analyzed: vacanam eva ati sa viññattika saddam eva gamīyati iti upanīyati ajjhoharaṇassa rasa ggahaṇa mūla tā vacanena
translated: “Speech” means speech that is accompanied by consciousness. “Is conveyed” means is brought. By saying that the act of eating is rooted in the apprehension of taste,

original: rasassa paramparāya jīvitahetutaṃ dasseti. Rasanimittañhi rasaggahaṇaṃ, rasaggahaṇanimittaṃ
analyzed: rasassa paramparāya jīvita hetutam dasseti rasa nimittam hi rasa ggahaṇam rasa ggahaṇa nimittam
translated: he shows that taste is indirectly the cause of life. For the apprehension of taste is due to the sign of taste, the act of eating is due to the apprehension of taste,

original: ajjhoharaṇaṃ, taṃnimittaṃ jīvitanti. Rasaggahaṇamūlatā ca ajjhoharaṇassa yebhuyyato
analyzed: ajjhoharaṇam taṃnimittam jīvitanti rasa ggahaṇa mūla tā ca ajjhoharaṇassa yebhuyyataḥ
translated: and life is due to that. And the act of eating should be understood as rooted in the apprehension of taste for the most part.

original: veditabbā. Dissati apadissati etena phalanti deso, hetūti āha “uppattidesoti uppattikāraṇa”nti.
analyzed: veditabbā dissati apadissati etena phalanti desaḥ hetu iti āha uppatti desaḥ ti uppatti kāraṇam ti
translated: The place is the cause of the arising of the act of eating, since it is by means of the place that the act of eating is manifested. Therefore he says, “The place of arising is the cause of arising.”

original: Tathāti cakkhāyatanādippakārena. Manogocarabhūtāti manaso eva gocarabhūtā. Sāmaññalakkhaṇenevāti
analyzed: tathā ti cakkha āyatana ādi ppakārena manaḥ gocara bhūtā ati manasaḥ eva gocara bhūtā sāmañña lakkhaṇena iva ati
translated: “Thus” means by way of the eye-base, etc. “Objects of the mind” means objects of the mind alone. “By way of their general characteristic” means by way of their characteristic of being known.

original: anubhavanādivisesalakkhaṇaṃ aggahetvā dhammabhāvasaṅkhātasādhāraṇalakkhaṇeneva. Ekāyatanattaṃ
analyzed: anubhavana ādi visesa lakkhaṇam aggahetvā dhamma bhāva saṅkhāta sādhāraṇa lakkhaṇena iva eka āyatana ttam
