analyzed: pahātabbassa kiriya bhāvaḥ āpajjati sahāya vekallena a vipāka sabhāva tāya āpādita ttā
translated: If the latter, then generosity, etc., in the continuum of an ordinary man would not be subject to kamma-result, because it is made not subject to perversion by being a co-factor for what is to be abandoned by seeing, like the defilements.

original: khīṇataṇhāvijjāmāne santāne dānādi viya. Atha dutiyo, bhāvanāya pahātabbābhimatassāpi
analyzed: khīṇa taṇhā vijjāmāne santāne dāna ādi viya atha dutiyaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabba abhimatassa api
translated: and in the case of the continuity of one whose craving and ignorance have been destroyed, giving, etc., are not conditions for rebirth-linking.

original: dassanena pahātabbabhāvo āpajjati, paṭisandhidāne sati apāyagamanīyasabhāvānativattanato.🔽Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttameva, tasmā pāḷiyā aṭṭhakathāya ca avirujjhanavasenettha
analyzed: dassanena pahātabba bhāvaḥ āpajjati paṭisandhi dāne sati apāya gamanīya sabhāva anativattanato  yam pana ittha vattabbam tam heṭṭhā vuttam eva tasmai pāḷiyā aṭṭhakathāya ca a virujjhana vasena ittha
translated: But if the second kind of ignorance is also a condition for rebirth-linking, then the state of being bound to be reborn in the states of loss would not be transcended even when rebirth-linking is given.

original: atthavinicchayo vuttanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: attha vinicchayaḥ vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ
translated: But what has to be said here has already been said below, so the exposition of the meaning here should be understood in the way stated, in accordance with the texts and the commentaries.

original: Sāti uddhaccacetanā. Viññāṇapaccayabhāveti sampuṇṇavipākaviññāṇapaccayabhāve. Kāraṇaṃ🔽dassentoti avikalaphaluppādanādhikāre tadabhāvato yadipi uddhaccacetanā viññāṇassa
analyzed: sā ati uddhacca cetanā viññāṇa paccaya bhāve ti sampuṇṇa vipāka viññāṇa paccaya bhāve kāraṇam  dassento ti avikala phala uppādana adhikāre tad abhāvataḥ yadi api uddhacca cetanā viññāṇassa
translated: Sāti is the volition of agitation. Viññāṇapaccayabhāveti is in the state of being a condition for the full-resultant consciousness.

original: paccayabhāve apanetabbā, avijjāya pana paccayuppannabhāve gahetabbāti imaṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: paccaya bhāve apanetabbā avijjāya pana paccayuppanna bhāve gahetabbā ti imam kāraṇam
translated: Showing the reason: although the volition of agitation has to be excluded from the state of being a condition for consciousness in the sense of producing an undiscerned result, it has to be included in the state of being a condition for ignorance in the sense of being a proximate cause.

original: dassento. Sabbāpīti vīsatipi. Tenāha “ekavīsatīti vattabba”nti. Tanti yena kāraṇena
analyzed: dassentaḥ sabbā api iti tena āha ekavīsati iti vattabbanti tat ti yena kāraṇena
translated: Showing this reason, he says, “All … should be stated as twenty-one.” Tena means by what reason.

original: saṅkhāraggahaṇena abhiññācetanāya aggahaṇaṃ, taṃ kāraṇaṃ. Itarāvacanassāpīti uddhaccacetanāvacanassāpi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra ggahaṇena abhiññā cetanāya a ggahaṇam tam kāraṇam itarāvacanassa api iti uddhacca cetanā vacanassa api
translated: The words “and so on” include the words “agitation” .🔽What is that? It is the absence of the condition of consciousness.

original: Kiṃ pana taṃ? Viññāṇassa paccayabhāvābhāvo eva. Bhedābhāvāti kāyavacīsaṅkhāravasena
analyzed: kim pana tam viññāṇassa paccaya bhāva abhāvaḥ eva bheda abhāvā ti kāya vacī saṅkhāra vasena
translated: The absence of division is the absence of division into bodily and verbal formations.

original: vibhāgābhāvato. Saṃyogoti tikantarapadavasena saṃyojanaṃ, tathā saṅgahoti attho.
analyzed: vibhāga abhāvato saṃyogaḥ iti tika antara pada vasena saṃyojanam tathā saṅgahaḥ ti attho
translated: The word “bond” is a synonym for “fetter” .

original: Sukhasaññāya gahaṇaṃ assādananti adhippāyenāha “sukhasaññāya…pe… dassetī”ti. “Sukhasaññāyā”ti
analyzed: sukha saññāya gahaṇam assādananti adhippāyena āha dasseti iti sukha saññāya ati
translated: The words “he shows that there is relishing of perception of pleasure” are said with the intention that the words “perception of pleasure”

original: ca idaṃ karaṇatthe karaṇavacanaṃ. Vipallāso hi dukkhe sukhasaññā. Yaṃ pana aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: ca idam karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam vipallāsaḥ hi dukkhe sukha saññā yam pana aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: are a locative absolute. For the perversion is the perception of pleasure in pain. But the words “through ignorance”

original: “aññāṇenā”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ hetumhi karaṇavacanaṃ vipallāsassādanānaṃ avijjāya hetubhāvadassanato.
analyzed: aññāṇena ati vuttam tam hetumhi karaṇa vacanam vipallāsa ssādanānam avijjāya hetu bhāva dassanato
translated: in the commentary are a locative absolute in the sense of cause, showing that the relishing of perversion is caused by ignorance.

original: “Ratho setaparikkhāro”tiādīsu parivāratthopi parikkhārasaddo hotīti vuttaṃ “taṇhāya
analyzed: rathaḥ seta parikkhāraḥ ti ādīsu parivāra atthaḥ api parikkhāra saddo hoti iti vuttam taṇhāya
translated: The word “chariot” is a synonym for “chariot-equipment” .

original: parivāre”ti. Taṇhāparivāreti ca taṇhāya kiccasādhanena saṅkhārānaṃ sahakārikāraṇabhāvaṃ
analyzed: parivāra iti taṇhā parivāra iti ca taṇhāya kicca sādhanena sahakāri kāraṇa bhāvam
translated: and the craving is their retinue. And the words “the craving is their retinue” are said with reference to the fact that the formations are the co-operating conditions for the craving by accomplishing its function.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Parikkhāraṭṭho saṅkhāraṭṭho viya bhūsanaṭṭho hotīti dassento “saṅkhate
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam parikkhāra aṭṭho saṅkhāra aṭṭhaḥ viya bhūsana ṭṭho hoti iti dassento saṅkhate
translated: The meaning of “equipment” is like the meaning of “formation” . Showing that the meaning of “equipment” is the meaning of “ornament” , he said “when the formed is ornamented” .

original: alaṅkate”ti āha. Parikkharoti yathā phaladānasamatthā honti, tathā saṅkharoti. Amaraṇatthāti
analyzed: āha parikkharoti yathā phala dāna samatthāḥ honti tathā saṅkharoti amaraṇatthā ati
translated: It equips by forming them so that they are able to give a fruit. The meaning of “for the sake of immortality” is the meaning of “for the sake of nibbāna” .

original: amatatthā, nibbānatthāti attho. Dukkarakiriyāti pañcātapatappanādidukkaracariyā.🔽Devabhāvāya tapo devabhāvatthaṃ tapo. Māretīti maro hetuatthaṃ antonītaṃ katvā. Amaṅgalampi
analyzed: amata atthā nibbāna atthā ati atthaḥ dukkara kiriyā ati pañca ātapa tappana ādi dukkara cariyā  deva bhāvāya tapaḥ deva bhāvattham tapaḥ māreti iti maraḥ hetu attham antonītam katvā amaṅgalampi
translated: The meaning of “difficult to do” is the meaning of “difficult practice” , such as the five austerities.

original: maṅgalapariyāyena voharanti maṅgalikāti vuttaṃ “diṭṭhe adiṭṭhasaddo viyā”ti yathā “asive sivā”ti.
analyzed: maṅgala pariyāyena voharanti maṅgalikā iti vuttam diṭṭhe adiṭṭha saddo viyāti yathā asive sivā ti
translated: The austerity for the sake of the state of a god is austerity for the sake of the state of a god. It kills , thus it is death . The meaning of “cause” is implied. They call even an inauspicious thing a “good omen” by the term “good omen” , as in the expression “auspicious is the inauspicious” .

original: Papātaṃ patanadukkhasadisanti katvā vuttaṃ “jātiādipapātadukkha”nti. Indaduddabrahmakūṭasaññitapabbatasikharappapāto marupapāto. Taṃ puññaphalaṃ attho payojanaṃ etassāti tadattho.
analyzed: papātam patana dukkha sadisanti katvā vuttam jāti ādi papāta dukkham ti inda dudda brahmakūṭa saññita pabbata sikhara ppapātaḥ maru papāto tam puñña phalam attho payojanam etassa ti tad attho
translated: The meaning, the purpose, of that fruit of merit is its meaning.🔽The young female wanderer.

original: Paribbājikāya taruṇiyā. Asavaso aserivihārī. Kilesāsucipaggharaṇena paṇḍitehi jigucchanīyaṃ.
analyzed: paribbājikāya taruṇiyā aseri vihārī kilesa asuci paggharaṇena paṇḍitehi jigucchanīyam
translated: The defilements are to be despised by the wise because of the oozing out of the impurity of defilements.🔽It is suffering because of the burning of lust, etc., and because of its bitter ripening.🔽He undertakes, he does.

original: Rāgādipariḷāhena, kaṭukavipākatāya ca dukkhaṃ. Ārabhati karoti. Sabhayassāpi pisācanagarassa
analyzed: rāga ādi pariḷāhena kaṭuka vipāka tāya ca dukkham ārabhati karoti sa bhayassa api pisāca nagarassa
translated: Even of the city of demons,

original: kāmaguṇasamiddhiyā sukhavipallāsahetubhāvo viyāti yojanā. Bhinnajātiyena avomissatā
analyzed: kāma guṇa samiddhiyā sukha vipallāsa hetu bhāvaḥ viyāti yojanā bhinna jātiyena a vomissa tā
translated: because of the abundance of the strands of sensual pleasure, the state of being a cause of the perversion of happiness is like this.🔽The continuity of different kinds is the uninterruptedness.

original: nirantaratā. Jarāya maraṇena ca aññathattaṃ vipariṇāmo.
analyzed: nirantara tā jarāya maraṇena ca aññathattam vipariṇāmo
translated: The change of state through aging and death is the change.🔽Because of the statement: “Evil one, I will not attain final Nibbana until I have monk disciples … and female lay disciples … who are accomplished, trained, skilled,

original: “Na tāvāhaṃ pāpima parinibbāyissāmī”ti vacanato “tāta ehi, tāva idaṃ rajjaṃ paṭipajjāhī”tiādīsu
analyzed: na tāva aham pāpima parinibbāyissāmi iti vacanataḥ tāta ehi tāva idam rajjam paṭipajjāhi itiādīsu
translated: and wise,”

original: yadipi parimāṇaniyamanakamapadapūraṇamattādīsupi tāva-saddo dissati, idha pana vakkhamānattāpekkho
analyzed: yadi pi tāva saddaḥ dissati idha pana vakkhamāna tta apekkhaḥ
translated: Although the word tāva is found in such expressions as “the filling of the measure” and “merely,” it is nevertheless intended here as a particle expressing the expectation of what is to be said next.

original: adhippetoti vuttaṃ “tāvāti vattabbantarāpekkho nipāto”ti. Avijjāpaccayā pana…pe…
analyzed: adhippetaḥ iti vuttam tāva āti vattabba antara apekkhaḥ nipātaḥ ti avijjā paccayā
translated: This is why it is said, “The word tāva is a particle expressing the expectation of what is to be said next.”

original: dassetīti pubbenāparaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ avirujjhanamāha.🔽Rāgādiassādanakālesūti rāgādīnaṃ assādanakālesu. “Rāgadiṭṭhisampayuttāyā”ti ettha
analyzed: dasseti iti pubbena aparam aṭṭhakathāyam a virujjhanam āha  rāga ādi assādana kālesu iti rāga ādīnam assādana kālesu rāga diṭṭhi sampayuttāya ati ettha
translated: “He shows” that the commentary does not contradict the text.🔽“At the time of relishing lust, etc.”: at the time of relishing lust, etc.

original: rāgasampayuttāya tāva avijjāya yojanā hotu rāgassa assādanabhāvato, diṭṭhisampayuttāya
analyzed: rāga sampayuttāya tāva avijjāya yojanā hotu rāgassa assādana bhāvataḥ diṭṭhi sampayuttāya
translated: “Associated with lust and views” means that the lust-accompanied ignorance should be construed as follows: “At the time of relishing lust, etc.”, because lust is relished. But how is the view-accompanied ignorance to be construed?

original: pana kathanti āha “tadavippayuttā ca diṭṭhī…pe… veditabbā”ti. Taṃsampayuttasaṅkhārassāti
analyzed: pana katham ti āha tad a vippayuttā ca diṭṭhīpe veditabbā ati tad sampayutta saṅkhārassa ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “The views that are not separated from it, etc., should be understood in the same way.”🔽“The formations associated with it”: the formations associated with lust, etc.

original: rāgādisampayuttasaṅkhārassa. Avijjārammaṇāditanti avijjāya ārammaṇāditaṃ. Ādi-saddena
analyzed: rāga ādi sampayutta saṅkhārassa avijjā ārammaṇa ādi tat ti avijjāya ārammaṇa āditam ādi saddena
translated: “The object, etc., of ignorance”: the object, the predominance, the object-predominance, and the prenascence conditions of ignorance.

original: ārammaṇādhipatiārammaṇūpanissayapakatūpanissaye, anantarādike ca paccaye saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya pakata upanissaye anantara ādike ca paccaye saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The word “etc.” includes the object-decisive-support condition, the proximity, and other conditions.

original: Anavijjārammaṇassāti na avijjārammaṇassa avijjaṃ anārabbha pavattassa. Ārammaṇādhipatianantarādipaccayavacanesūti
analyzed: anavijja ārammaṇassa ati na avijja ārammaṇassa avijjam an ārabbha pavattassa ārammaṇa adhipati anantara ādi paccayavacanesu uti
translated: “Not having ignorance as its object” means not having ignorance as its object, not occurring with ignorance as its object.🔽“In the statements of object condition, predominance condition, and proximity condition, etc.”🔽means in the statements of object condition, predominance condition, and decisive support condition, the not having ignorance as its object is not stated;

original: ārammaṇādhipatiārammaṇūpanissayapaccayavacanesu avuttassa anavijjārammaṇassa, anantarādipaccayavacanesu
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya paccaya vacanesu avuttassa anavijja ārammaṇassa anantara ādi paccaya vacanesu
translated: in the statements of proximity condition, etc., the first impulsion is not stated;

original: avuttassa paṭhamajavanassa, dvīsupi vuttassa avijjārammaṇassa dutiyādijavanassāti🔽yojetabbaṃ. Anantarapaccayalābhino anantarādinā, sahajātassa hetuādinā, asahajātassa🔽upanissayādinā saṅkhārassa avijjā paccayo hotīti ayamattho “yaṃ kiñcī”tiādinā dassitoti
analyzed: a vuttassa paṭhama javanassa dvīsu pi vuttassa avijja ārammaṇassa dutiya ādi javanassa ati  yojetabbam anantara paccaya lābhino anantara ādinā sahajātassa hetu ādinā asahajātassa  upanissaya ādinā saṅkhārassa avijjā paccayaḥ hoti iti ayam attho yam kiñci itiādinā dassito ti
translated: in both the having ignorance as its object is stated, the second impulsion, etc., are stated.🔽Ignorance is a condition for formations by way of proximity condition, etc., for the conascent formations by way of root condition, etc., and for the non-conascent formations by way of decisive support condition, etc.🔽This meaning is shown by the words “Whatever has ignorance as its condition” and so on.

original: veditabbaṃ. Samatikkamabhavapatthanāvasenāti avijjāsamatikkamatthāya arūpāvacarajjhānāni
analyzed: veditabbam samatikkama bhava patthanā vasena ati avijjā samatikkama thāya arūpāvacara jhānāni
translated: “By way of surmounting and by way of aspiring for becoming” means for one who develops the immaterial jhānas for the purpose of surmounting ignorance,

original: uppādentassa, avijjāsammūḷhattā arūpabhavasampattiyo patthetvā tāneva jhānāni nibbattentassāti
analyzed: uppādentassa avijjā sammūḷha ttā arūpa bhava sampattiyaḥ patthetvā tāni eva jhānāni nibbattentassa ati
translated: and for one who generates those jhānas again for the purpose of aspiring for the excellence of the immaterial becoming, being deluded by ignorance.

original: puññābhisaṅkhāre vuttena nayena, vuttanayānusārenāti attho.
analyzed: puñña abhisaṅkhāre vuttena nayena vutta naya anusārena ati atthaḥ
translated: and the meaning is that he does so by the method stated in the case of the formation of merit.

original: Ekakāraṇavādo āpajjati yathā pakatiissarapajāpatipurisakālādivādā. Ekasmiṃyeva lokassa🔽kāraṇabhūte sati tato sakalāya pavattiyā anavasesato, sabbadā ca pavattitabbaṃ apekkhitabbassa
analyzed: eka kāraṇa vādaḥ āpajjati yathā pakati issara pajāpati purisa kāla ādi vādāḥ ekasmin yeva lokassa  kāraṇa bhūte sati tatas sakalāya pavattiyāḥ anavasesataḥ sabbadā ca pavattitabbam apekkhitabbassa
translated: He falls into the doctrine of a single cause, like those who maintain that the cause of the world is God, or Nature, or Time, or Atoms, or Primordial Matter.

original: kāraṇantarassa abhāvato. Na cetaṃ atthi kameneva pavattiyā dassanato. Kāraṇantarāpekkhatāya
analyzed: kāraṇa antarassa abhāvataḥ na ca itam atthi kamena iva pavattiyāḥ dassanataḥ kāraṇa antara apekkha tāya
translated: For when there is only one cause of the world, then the whole occurrence of the world must be without remainder, and it must occur all the time, since there is no other cause to be sought for the occurrence. But that is not so, as can be seen from the fact that the occurrence is due to kamma.

original: pana ekakāraṇavādo apahato siyā ekassa ca anekasabhāvatābhāvā. Yattakā tato nibbattanti,🔽sabbehi tehi samānasabhāveheva bhavitabbaṃ, na visadisehi, itarathā tassa ekabhāvo
analyzed: pana eka kāraṇa vādaḥ apahataḥ siyā ekassa ca aneka sabhāva tā bhāvā yattakā tatas nibbattanti  sabbehi tehi samāna sabhāvehi iva bhavitabbam na visadisehi itarathā tassa eka bhāvaḥ
translated: But if it were due to the seeking of another cause, then the doctrine of a single cause would be abandoned, since one thing cannot have several natures.

original: eva na siyāti imamatthamāha “sabbassa…pe… pattito cā”ti. Pārisesenāti ekato ekaṃ,
analyzed: eva na siyāti imam attham āha sabbassape pattitaḥ ca ati pārisesena ati ekatas ekam
translated: And all those things that originate from it must have the same nature as it, not a different nature, otherwise it would not have a single nature. This is the meaning of the words “And because of the impossibility of the remainder” .

original: ekato anekaṃ, anekato ekanti imesu tīsu pakāresu avijjamānesu anupalabbhamānesu pārisesañāyena.
analyzed: ekatas anekam anekatas ekam ti imesu tīsu pakāresu a vijjamānesu an upalabbhamānesu pārisesa ñāyena
translated: By the method of remainder: when the three alternatives of one from one, one from many, and many from many are absent, are not found.

original: Anekato anekanti ekasmiṃ catutthe eva ca pakāre vijjamāne. Yadidaṃ “avijjāpaccayā🔽saṅkhārā, phassapaccayā vedanā”tiādinā ekahetuphaladīpanaṃ, taṃ ettha desanāvilāsena,
analyzed: ekatas ekasmin catutthe eva ca pakāre vijjamāne yat idam avijjā paccayā  saṅkhārā phassa paccayā vedanā ati ādinā eka hetu phala dīpanam tam ettha desanā vilāsena
translated: In the many ways: in the many modes. In the one: in the fourth mode only.🔽The teaching of a single cause and effect, namely, “With ignorance as condition there are volitional formations,”

original: vineyyajjhāsayavasena vā dhammānaṃ padhānapākaṭāsādhāraṇabhāvavibhāvanatthanti ekahetuphaladīpanaṃ
analyzed: vineyya ajjhāsaya vasena vā dhammānam eka hetu phala dīpanam
translated: “With contact as condition, feeling,” etc., is given here in order to show the special and common characteristics of the states by the teacher’s skill in teaching or by the inclination of those to be taught.

original: na nupapajjati upapajjatiyevāti dasseti “yasmā”tiādinā.
analyzed: na nu upapajjati upapajjatiyā iva ati dasseti yasmā iti ādinā
translated: The words “It is not so” show that the teaching of a single cause and effect is not impossible.

original: Yathāphassanti sukhavedanīyādicakkhusamphassāditaṃtaṃphassānurūpanti vuttaṃ hotīti
analyzed: yathāphassanti sukha vedanīya ādi cakkhu samphassa ādi tat tat phassa anurūpam ti vuttam hoti iti
translated: “In accordance with the object” means in accordance with the object that is the basis for pleasant feeling, etc.

original: dassento “sukhavedanīya”ntiādiṃ vatvā “vedanāvavatthānato”ti padassa atthaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: dassento sukha vedanīya ntiādim vatvā vedanā vavatthānato ti padassa attham dassetuṃ
translated: In order to show this, he says “With the pleasant feeling” and so on. In order to show the meaning of the words “by the delimitation of feeling,”

original: “samānesū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha samānesūti avisiṭṭhesu. Phassavasenāti sukhavedanīyādiphassavasena.
analyzed: samānesu utiādi vuttam tattha samānesu ti avisiṭṭhesu phassa vasena ati sukha vedanīya ādi phassa vasena
translated: he says “In the case of the same” and so on. Herein, in the case of the same means in the case of the undifferentiated. By the contact means by the contact that is the basis for pleasant feeling, etc.

original: Vipariyāyābhāvatoti byattayābhāvato. Na hi kadāci sukhavedanīyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: vipariyāya abhāvataḥ ti byatta yā abhāvataḥ na hi kadāci sukha vedanīyam phassam paṭicca
translated: Because of the absence of inversion: because of the absence of error. For never does pleasant feeling arise with unpleasant feeling as its condition,

original: dukkhavedanā, dukkhādivedanīyaṃ vā phassaṃ paṭicca sukhavedanā uppajjati. Sukhādicakkhusamphassajādīnanti
analyzed: dukkha vedanā dukkha ādi vedanīyam vā phassam paṭicca sukha vedanā uppajjati sukha ādi cakkhu samphassa ja ādīnam ti
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.

original: sukhādīnaṃ, cakkhusamphassajādīnañca vedanānaṃ. Oḷārikasukhumādīti ādi-saddena hīnapaṇītādisaṅgaho🔽daṭṭhabbo. Tattha yaṃ upādāya yā vedanā “oḷārikā, hīnā”ti vā vuccati, na taṃyeva
analyzed: sukha ādīnam cakkhu samphassa ja ādīnam ca vedanānam oḷārika sukhuma ādi iti ādi saddena hīna paṇīta ādi saṅgahaḥ  daṭṭhabbo tattha yam upādāya yā vedanā oḷārikā hīnā iti vā vuccati na taṃyeva
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.

original: upādāya tassā kadācipi sukhumatā paṇītatā vā atthīti vuttaṃ “oḷārikasukhumādisaṅkarābhāvato”ti.
analyzed: upādāya tassā kadācipi sukhuma tā paṇīta tā vā atthi iti vuttam oḷārika sukhuma ādi saṅkara abhāvato ti
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.

original: Yathāvuttasamphassassāti sukhavedanīyādiphassassa. Sukhavedanīyaphassatoyeva sukhavedanā,
analyzed: yathā vutta samphassassa ati sukha vedanīya ādi phassassa sukha vedanīya phassa toyā iva sukha vedanā
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.

original: na itaraphassato. Sukhavedanīyaphassato sukhavedanāva, na itaravedanā. Tathā sesesupīti
analyzed: na itara phassataḥ sukha vedanīya phassataḥ sukha vedanā va na itara vedanā tathā sesesu pi iti
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.

original: ubhayapadaniyamavasena yathāphassaṃ vedanāvavatthānaṃ, yathāvedanaṃ phassavavatthānanti
analyzed: ubhaya pada niyama vasena yathāphassam vedanā vavatthānam yathāvedanam phassa vavatthānam ti
translated: Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as painful as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a contact to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant as condition.🔽Or pleasant feeling arises with a

original: padadvayena kāraṇantarāsammissatā phalassa, phalantarāsammissatā ca kāraṇassa dassitā🔽paṭhamapakkhe asaṃkiṇṇatāvavatthānanti katvā. Dutiyapakkhe pana paccayabhedabhinnena
analyzed: pada dvayena kāraṇa antara asammissa tā phalassa phala antara asammissa tā ca kāraṇassa dassitā  paṭhama pakkhe a saṃkiṇṇa tā vavatthānam ti katvā dutiya pakkhe pana paccaya bheda bhinnena
translated: By the two phrases the non-mixture of the fruit with other causes and the non-mixture of the cause with other fruits are shown.

original: kāraṇavisesena phalaviseso, phalavisesena ca kāraṇaviseso nicchīyatīti ayamattho🔽dassito sanniṭṭhānaṃ vavatthānanti katvā. Purimasmiñca pakkhe dhammānaṃ asaṅkarato
analyzed: kāraṇa visesena phala visesaḥ phala visesena ca kāraṇa visesaḥ ayam attho  dassitaḥ sanniṭṭhānam vavatthānam ti katvā purimasmin ca pakkhe dhammānam asaṅkarato
translated: In the first case, the definition is by way of non-confusion. In the second case, the definition is by way of the determination of the distinction of the fruit by way of the distinction of the cause, and the determination of the distinction of the cause by way of the distinction of the fruit.

original: vavatthānaṃ vuttaṃ, dutiyasmiñca yathāvavatthitabhāvajānananti ayametesaṃ viseso.🔽Utuādayoti ādi-saddena cittavisamācārā pittavātādayopi saṅgayhanti. Ekasmiṃ dose
analyzed: vavatthānam vuttam dutiyasmin ca yathā vavatthita bhāva jānanan ti ayam etesam visesaḥ  ādi saddena citta visamācārā pitta vāta ādayaḥ api saṅgayhanti ekasmin dose
translated: In the first case, the definition is stated by way of the non-confusion of the dhammas. In the second case, the definition is stated by way of the knowledge of the nature as defined.

original: kupite itarepi khobhaṃ gacchanti. Santesupi tesu semhapaṭikārena rogavūpasamato semho pākaṭoti attho.
analyzed: kupite itare pi khobham gacchanti santesu pi tesu semha paṭikārena roga vūpasamato semho pākaṭaḥ ti attho
translated: By the word “etc.” in “temperature, etc.”, the mental humours such as bile and wind are included. When one humour is disturbed, the others also become disturbed. Even when they are in balance, since the disease is alleviated by the antidote of phlegm, the meaning is that phlegm is manifest.

original: “Bhavo”ti vuttānaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ kāraṇassa pakāraṇaṃ, kāraṇameva vā taṇhāti āha “taṇhāya
analyzed: bhavaḥ ti vuttānam saṅkhārānam kāraṇassa pakāraṇam kāraṇam eva vā taṇhā iti āha taṇhāya
translated: The cause of the volitions spoken of as “becoming” is craving, or the cause itself is craving. Therefore it is said: “craving is the cause of becoming.”

original: saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvassa vuttattā”ti. Tassāpīti taṇhāyapi. Taṇhā hi kāmāsavo bhavāsavo
analyzed: saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvassa vutta ttā ti tassa api iti taṇhāya api taṇhā hi kāma āsavaḥ bhava āsavaḥ
translated: “Of that” : of craving. For craving is the taint of sensual desire and the taint of existence.🔽The taint of sensual desire and the taint of existence are the clinging to sensual desires and the clinging to existence, and the taint of views is the remaining two kinds of clinging.

original: ca. Kāmāsavabhavāsavā kāmupādānaṃ, diṭṭhāsavo itarupādānanti āha “caturupādānabhūtā
analyzed: ca kāma āsava bhava āsavā kāma upādānam diṭṭha āsavaḥ itara upādānam iti āha catur upādāna bhūtā
translated: “The taints of sensual desire, existence, and views are the four kinds of clinging” .

original: kāmabhavadiṭṭhāsavā”ti. Te ca “upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti vacanato upādānañca, “taṇhāpaccayā🔽upādāna”nti vacanato taṇhā ca saṅkhārassa kāraṇanti pākaṭā. Anassādanīyesu anekādīnavavokiṇṇesu🔽saṅkhāresu assādānupassanā avijjāya vinā na hotīti dassento āha “assādānupassino…pe…
analyzed: kāma bhava diṭṭha āsavā ti te ca upādāna paccayāḥ bhavaḥ ti vacanato upādānam ca taṇhā paccayā  upādānam ti vacanato taṇhā ca saṅkhārassa kāraṇanti pākaṭā an assādanīyesu aneka ādīnava vokiṇṇesu  saṅkhāresu assāda anupassanā avijjāya vinā na hoti iti dassentaḥ āha
translated: And since it is said: “With clinging as condition, existence” , clinging is a condition for formations, and since it is said: “With craving as condition, clinging” , craving is a condition for formations.🔽The contemplation of gratification in formations that are full of many dangers and are not to be enjoyed does not occur without ignorance.🔽Showing this, he said: “When one sees formations as … a condition for ignorance” .

original: dassitā hotī”ti. Khīṇāsavassa saṅkhārābhāvatoti byatirekenapi avijjāya saṅkhārakāraṇabhāvaṃ
analyzed: dassitā hoti iti khīṇāsavassa saṅkhāra abhāvataḥ ti byatirekena api avijjāya saṅkhāra kāraṇa bhāvam
translated: Since one who is without cankers does not have formations, he shows by way of the absence of formations that ignorance is a condition for formations.🔽For only one who is without cankers knows this.

original: vibhāveti. Ekantena hi khīṇāsavova viddasu. Etena bālānaṃ eva sambhavato avijjāya
analyzed: vibhāvā iti ekantena hi khīṇa āsavaḥ uva etena bālānam eva sambhavataḥ avijjāya
translated: By this he shows that ignorance is a condition for formations because it occurs only in fools.

original: asādhāraṇatā vuttāti dasseti. Vatthārammaṇādīni hi itaresampi sādhāraṇāni. Vatthārammaṇataṇhupādānādīni
analyzed: asādhāraṇa tā vuttā iti dasseti vattha ārammaṇa ādīni hi itaresam pi sādhāraṇāni vattha ārammaṇa taṇhā upādāna ādīni
translated: He shows that it is not shared by others. For the physical basis, the object, etc., are shared by others too. Like the craving, the assuming, etc.,

original: viya avijjāpi puññābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ sādhāraṇakāraṇanti codanaṃ manasi katvā āha “puññabhavādī”tiādi.🔽Tattha ādi-saddena apuññāneñjabhavā gahetabbā. Puññabhavoti puññābhisaṅkhārahetuko🔽upapattibhavo. Esa nayo sesesu. Ettha ca kiccakaraṇaṭṭhānabhedena kiccavatī avijjā🔽bhinditvā dassitā. Na hi yadavatthā avijjā puññābhisaṅkhārānaṃ upanissayo, tadavatthā🔽eva itaresaṃ upanissayoti sakkā viññātuṃ. Ettha ca bhavādīnavappaṭicchādananti atthato
analyzed: viya avijjā api puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam sādhāraṇa kāraṇanti codanam manasi katvā āha puñña bhava ādi itiādi  tattha ādi saddena apuññā aneñja bhavā gahetabbā puñña bhavaḥ ti puñña abhisaṅkhāra hetuko  upapatti bhavaḥ esa nayo sesesu ettha ca kicca karaṇa ṭṭhāna bhedena kiccavatī avijjā  bhinditvā dassitā na hi yad avatthā avijjā puñña abhisaṅkhārānam upanissayaḥ tad avatthā  eva itaresam upanissayaḥ ti sakkā viññātum ettha ca bhava ādīnava paṭicchādananti atthataḥ
translated: with the physical basis, the object, etc., as their support. After taking up the question, “Is ignorance a shared cause of the formations of merit, etc.,” he says, “The formations of merit, etc.,” etc.

original: puññābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ taṃtaṃbhavasaṅkhātadukkhahetusabhāvānabhisamayanimittatā.
analyzed: puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam taṃ taṃ bhava saṅkhāta dukkha hetu sabhāva an abhisamaya nimitta tā
translated: Herein, the word “etc.” should be understood to include the formations of demerit and of persisting. The “formation of merit” is the rebirth-process that has as its cause the formation of merit. The same method applies to the rest. And here ignorance is shown as having a function by way of the distinction of its being the condition for the arising of the formations. For it is not possible to know that the ignorance which is the support for the formations of merit is the same as that which is the support for the other two. And here the “concealment of the danger in existence” is in fact the cause of the non-penetration of the nature of suffering called “existence” in the three planes of becoming, which is the cause of the formations of merit, etc.

original: Ṭhānanti dharamānatā adhippetāti vuttaṃ “ṭhānaviruddhoti atthitāviruddho”ti. Ṭhānāviruddhā🔽cakkhurūpādayo. “Purimacittañhī”tiādinā ṭhānaviruddho ca udāhaṭoti āha “na idaṃ ekantikaṃ
analyzed: ṭhānam ti dharamāna tā adhippetā ati vuttam ṭhāna viruddho ti atthi tā viruddho ti ṭhāna aviruddhā  cakkhu rūpa ādayo purima cittam hi itiādinā ṭhāna viruddho ca udāhaṭaḥ iti āha na idam ekantikam
translated: “The ‘contradiction of the state’ is the contradiction of non-existence” is said because the state is intended as the existing state.🔽The eye, visible forms, etc., are not contradictory to the state.🔽The first thought, etc., are contradictory to the state. Therefore it is said: “This is not absolute.”

original: siyā”ti. “Cakkhurūpādayo”tiādinā hi parato ṭhānāviruddhā udāharīyantīti. Purimasippādisikkhā🔽hi pacchā pavattamānasippādikiriyānaṃ samodhānāsambhavā ṭhānavirodhoti yathāvuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: siyā ti cakkhu rūpa ādayo ti ādinā hi paratas ṭhāna a viruddhā udāharīyanti iti purima sippa ādi sikkhā  hi pacchā pavattamāna sippa ādi kiriyānam samodhāna asambhavā ṭhāna virodhaḥ ti
translated: Because the eye, visible forms, etc., are stated later as not contradictory to the state.🔽The training in the first craft, etc., is contradictory to the state because it is impossible for it to be combined with the performance of the craft, etc., that occurs later. Therefore, in order to prove the meaning stated thus, it is said: “And the craft, etc., are not contradictory to the state.”

original: samatthetuṃ “na ca sippādīna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tanti paṭisandhiādiṭhānaṃ. Idhāti🔽ṭhānasabhāvakiccādiggahaṇe. Ādi-saddena ārammaṇabhūmisantānādiviruddhā gahetabbā,
analyzed: samatthetum na ca sippa ādīnam tiādi vuttam tattha tat ti paṭisandhi ādi ṭhānam idha āti  ṭhāna sabhāva kicca ādi ggahaṇe ādi saddena ārammaṇa bhūmi santāna ādi viruddhā gahetabbā
translated: Herein, “that” refers to the state of rebirth-linking, etc. “This”🔽refers to the apprehension of the state, the nature, the function, etc.🔽By the word “etc.,” what is contradictory to the object, plane, continuity, etc., should be understood.

original: te ca anulomato gotrabhussa, gotrabhuto maggassa liṅgaparivattanādivasena ca pavattiyaṃ
analyzed: te ca anulomataḥ gotrabhussa gotrabhutaḥ maggassa liṅga parivattana ādi vasena ca pavattiyam
translated: And those occur in the revolution of the sign, etc., of the first thought, etc., in the revolution of the lineage of the path, and in the revolution of the sign, etc., of the path.

original: veditabbā. Namanaruppanavirodhā sabhāvaviruddho paccayoti yojanā. Tattha namanaruppananti
analyzed: veditabbā namana ruppana virodhā sabhāva viruddhaḥ paccayaḥ ti yojanā tattha namana ruppananti
translated: and should be understood. The construction is: “The condition is opposed to the state of being a condition because of opposition to the state of being a condition.”🔽Herein, “opposition to the state of being a condition”

original: arūparūpabhāvameva dasseti. Kammaṃ cetanāsabhāvaṃ, rūpaṃ ruppanasabhāvanti sabhāvaviruddhaṃ.
analyzed: arūpa rūpa bhāvam eva dasseti kammam cetanā sabhāvam rūpam ruppana sabhāvanti sabhāva viruddham
translated: shows the state of being non-material and material. Kamma is of the nature of volition, and materiality is of the nature of the state of being molested. So they are opposed to the state of being a condition because of opposition to the state of being of the same nature.

original: Madhurambilarasādīti khīraṃ madhurarasaṃ pittupasamanaṃ madhuravipākasabhāvaṃ, dadhi
analyzed: madhuram bila rasa ādi iti khīram madhura rasam pitta upasamanam madhura vipāka sabhāvam dadhi
translated: “Sweet and sour tastes, etc.”: milk has a sweet taste, it allays bile, and it is of the nature of a sweet after-effect. Curds

original: ambilarasaṃ pittabrūhanaṃ kaṭukavipākasabhāvanti ato sabhāvavirodhā.🔽Dadhiādīnīti dadhipalālāni. Bhūtiṇakassāti bhūtiṇakanāmakassa osadhivisesassa. Avī
analyzed: ambila rasam pitta brūhanam kaṭuka vipāka sabhāvanti sabhāva virodhā  dadhi ādīni iti dadhi palālāni bhūtiṇakassa ati bhūtiṇaka nāmakassa osadhi visesassa
translated: have a sour taste, they increase bile, and they are of the nature of a bitter after-effect. So they are opposed to the state of being a condition because of opposition to the state of being of the same nature.🔽“Curds, etc.”: curds, whey, etc. “Bhūtiṇaka grass”: a kind of medicinal herb called bhūtiṇaka.

original: nāma eḷakā, tā pana yebhuyyena rattalomakā hontīti vuttaṃ “rattā eḷakā”ti. Vipākānampi
analyzed: nāma eḷakā tā pana yebhuyyena ratta lomakā honti iti vuttam rattā eḷakā ati vipākānam pi
translated: “Vī” is a kind of goat, but they are mostly red-haired, so it is said, “red goats.”

original: paccayabhāvato, avipākānampi paccayuppannabhāvato na vipākadhammavipākāpekkhā paccayapaccayuppannatāti
analyzed: paccaya bhāvataḥ avipākānam pi paccaya uppanna bhāvataḥ na vipāka dhamma vipāka apekkhā paccaya paccaya uppanna tā ti
translated: because they are conditions for results, and because they are present as conditions for non-results, the conditions and the present states are not dependent on results that are states of the nature of results or on non-results.

original: vuttaṃ “vipākāyeva te ca nā”ti. Tenāha “tasmā”tiādi. Tadavipākānanti tassā avijjāya
analyzed: vuttam vipākāya iva te ca na ati tena āha tasmā atiādi tad avipākānam ti tassāḥ avijjāya
translated: Therefore it is said, “They are not results.” “And their non-result” means the non-result of that ignorance.

original: avipākabhūtānaṃ. Na na yujjati yujjati eva paccayuppannatāmattassa adhippetattā.
analyzed: avipāka bhūtānam na na yujjati yujjati eva paccaya uppanna tā mattassa adhippeta ttā
translated: and it is not incompatible with those that are not subject to it. It is quite compatible, since what is intended is merely the condition of being subsequent to ignorance.

original: Tadaviruddhānanti tāya avijjāya aviruddhānaṃ.
analyzed: tat aviruddhānam ti tāya avijjāya
translated: “With those not incompatible with that”: with those not incompatible with that ignorance.

original: Pubbāpariyavavatthānanti kāyapavattigatijātiādīnaṃ yathārahaṃ pubbāparabhāvena pavatti,🔽sā pana kenaci akaṭā akaṭavidhā paṭiniyatasabhāvāti dassetuṃ niyativādinā vuttanidassanaṃ
analyzed: pubba apariya vavatthānan ti kāya pavatti gati jāti ādīnam yathāraham pubba apara bhāvena pavatti  sā pana kenaci akaṭā akaṭavidhā paṭiniyata sabhāvā ti dassetum niyati vādinā vutta nidassanam
translated: “The arrangement in sequence”: the occurrence of the body, destiny, rebirth-linking, birth, etc., in their proper sequence,🔽But that is not made by anyone. It is unmade, unfashioned, of fixed nature. To show this, he has brought in the illustration of the unbreakable gem mentioned in the Acchariyabbhutadhammasutta.

original: āharanto “acchejjasuttāvutābhejjamaṇīnaṃ viyā”ti āha. Dutiyavikappe saṅgatīti adhiccasamuppādo
analyzed: āharantaḥ viya āha dutiya vikappe saṅgatī iti
translated: In the second permutation, “chance” is fortuitous origination.

original: yādicchikatā, yaṃ sandhāya “yadicchāya pavattanaṃ nivattanaṃ yadicchāyā”tiādi vuccati.
analyzed: yāt icchika tā yam sandhāya yat icchāya pavattanam nivattanam yat icchāya atiādi vuccati
translated: “Whim” is the doing of things at will, in reference to which it is said: “The occurrence and cessation of things is due to whim” (Dhp 10), etc.

original: Bhāvoti dhammānaṃ sabhāvasiddhitā, yaṃ sandhāya vadanti “kaṇṭakassa koṭitikhiṇabhāvaṃ,
analyzed: bhāvo ti dhammānam sabhāva siddhitā yam sandhāya vadanti kaṇṭakassa
translated: “Nature” is the established nature of things, in reference to which it is said: “Who fashions the sharpness of thorns,

original: kapiṭṭhaphalassa vaṭṭabhāvaṃ, migapakkhīnaṃ vā vicittavaṇṇasaṇṭhānāditaṃ ko abhisaṅkharoti,
analyzed: kapiṭṭha phalassa vaṭṭa bhāvam miga pakkhīnam vā vicitta vaṇṇa saṇṭhāna āditam kaḥ abhisaṅkharoti
translated: the roundness of beans, the variety of colors and shapes in the bodies of animals and birds?

original: kevalaṃ sabhāvasiddhovāyaṃ viseso”ti. Tenāha “sabbe sattā, sabbe pāṇā, sabbe bhūtā,
analyzed: kevalam sa bhāva siddhaḥ uva ayam visesaḥ iti tena āha sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā sabbe bhūtā
translated: but the difference is established by its own individual essence alone. Hence it is said: “All beings, all breathing things, all creatures, all persons,

original: sabbe jīvā avasā abalā avīriyā niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇatā”ti. Etehi vikappanehīti
analyzed: sabbe jīvāḥ avasā abalāḥ a vīriyāḥ niyati saṅgati bhāva pariṇatā ati etehi vikappanehi iti
translated: are helpless, powerless, without control, subject to the changes of destiny, chance, and nature” .

original: cutiādīsu sammūḷhatāya “satto maratī”tiādivikappanehi kāraṇabhūtehi. Akusalaṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: cuti ādīsu sammūḷha tāya sattaḥ marati iti ādi vikappanehi kāraṇa bhūtehi akusalam cittam
translated: By the various ways of conceiving : by the various ways of conceiving that are the causes for the conceiving of “a being dies” and so on, because of confusion about death, etc.

original: katvāti ayonisomanasikāraparibrūhanena cittaṃ akusalaṃ katvā.
analyzed: katvā ati a yoni soma nasikāra paribrūhanena cittam akusalam katvā
translated: Having made the mind unwholesome : having made the mind unwholesome by the development of wrong reflection.

original: Suttādidhammanti suttageyyādipariyattidhammaṃ. Pariyattidhammañhi sammadeva jānanto
analyzed: sutta ādi dhammam ti sutta geyya ādi pariyatti dhammam pariyatti dhammam hi sammat eva jānantaḥ
translated: The Dhamma of the discourses, etc. : the Dhamma of the discourses, etc., as texts. For one who knows the Dhamma of the texts well

original: paṭipattidhammaṃ paripūretvā paṭivedhadhamme patiṭṭhahati. Tanti taṃ jānanaṃ, nibbānābhisamayoti attho.
analyzed: paṭipatti dhammam paripūretvā paṭivedha dhamme patiṭṭhahati tam ti tam jānanam nibbāna abhisamayaḥ ti attho
translated: establishes himself in the Dhamma of practice and in the Dhamma of penetration. “That” : that knowledge; the meaning is: the penetration of Nibbāna.

original: Saṅkhārapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅkhāra pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the description of determinations is finished.

original: Viññāṇapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: viññāṇa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of consciousness

original: 227. Yathāvuttasaṅkhārapaccayāti puññābhisaṅkhārādivuttappakārasaṅkhārapaccayā. Viññāṇādayo
analyzed: yathā vutta saṅkhāra paccayā ti puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādi vutta pakāra saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇa ādayaḥ
translated: With the determinations stated thus : with the determinations stated as the meritorious determinations, etc. Consciousness, etc.,

original: vedanāpariyosānā etarahi vipākavaṭṭabhūtā idhādhippetāti āha “taṃkammanibbattameva🔽viññāṇaṃ bhavituṃ arahatī”ti. Ayañca atthavaṇṇanā dhātukathāpāḷiyā na sametīti dassento🔽“dhātukathāyaṃ panā”tiādimāha. Tattha dhātukathāyaṃ vacanato sabbaviññāṇaphassavedanāpariggaho
analyzed: vedanā pariyosānā etarahi vipāka vaṭṭa bhūtā idha adhippetā iti āha tat kamma nibbattam eva  viññāṇam bhavitum arahati iti ayam ca attha vaṇṇanā dhātu kathā pāḷiyā na sameti iti dassento  dhātu kathā ayam pana ati ādim āha tattha dhātu kathā ayam vacanato sabba viññāṇa phassa vedanā pariggaho
translated: The consciousness that is reborn is the consciousness that is the result of kamma, which is the end of the feeling that is the result of kamma, and which is what is intended here. That is why he says: “The consciousness that is reborn is the consciousness that is the result of kamma.”🔽But this explanation does not agree with the text of the Dhammasangani. That is why he says: “In the Dhammasangani,” etc. Herein, the meaning of the words should be understood in this way: “In the Dhammasangani, by the words ‘The resultant consciousness that is reborn’ all consciousness, all contact, and all feeling are included.

original: kato dhātukathāyanti yojanā. Sappadesāti sāvasesā, vipākā evāti adhippāyo. Viññāṇādīsu
analyzed: kataḥ dhātukathāyanti yojanā sappadesā ati sa avasesā vipākā eva ati adhippāyaḥ viññāṇa ādīsu
translated: The meaning of the words ‘In the Dhammasangani’ is this: the inclusion is made in the Dhammasangani by the words ‘The resultant consciousness that is reborn.’ The inclusion is ‘partial’ because it is not exhaustive. The intention is that only the results are intended among the consciousness, etc.,

original: hi vipākesuyeva adhippetesu yathā –🔽“Vipākehi dhammehi ye dhammā vippayuttā, te dhammā asaṅkhataṃ khandhato ṭhapetvā
analyzed: hi vipākesu yeva adhippetesu yathā  vipākehi dhammehi ye dhammāḥ vippayuttā te dhammāḥ asaṅkhatam khandhato ṭhapetvā
translated: For when only the results are intended among the consciousness, etc., it is said:

original: pañcahi khandhehi dvādasahāyatanehi terasahi dhātūhi saṅgahitā. Katihi asaṅgahitā?
analyzed: pañcahi khandhehi dvādasahi āyatanehi terasahi dhātūhi saṅgahitā katihi a saṅgahitā
translated: “Those states that are dissociated from resultant states are included under the four aggregates, under two bases and under two elements, under the aggregate of material form, under the remaining bases and elements. Under how many are they not included?

original: Na kehici khandhehi na kehici āyatanehi pañcahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā”ti –
analyzed: na kehici khandhehi na kehici āyatanehi pañcahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā ati
translated: They are not included under any aggregate, under no base, under five elements” .

original: Vipākavippayuttānaṃ saṅgahāsaṅgahā vissajjitā, evamidhāpi vissajjitabbaṃ siyā. Tenāha
analyzed: vipāka vippayuttānam saṅgaha asaṅgahāḥ vissajjitāḥ evam idha api vissajjitabbam siyā tena āha
translated: The answer to the question “Are those dissociated from result included or not included?” is to be given in the same way. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽Since the terms “included” and “not included” in the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”

original: “vipākā dhammāti imassa viya vissajjanaṃ siyā”ti. Tasmāti yasmā vippayuttena saṅgahitāsaṅgahitapadaniddese
analyzed: vipākāḥ dhammā ti imassa viya vissajjanam siyāti tasmā iti yasmā vippayuttena saṅgahita asaṅgahita pada niddese
translated: are not illustrated by examples, therefore he says: “So the answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”

original: nippadesāva viññāṇaphassavedanā gahitā, tasmā. Tatthāti dhātukathāyaṃ. Abhidhammabhājanīyavasenāti🔽imasmiṃ paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅge abhidhammabhājanīyavasena. Tenāha “avijjāpaccayā🔽saṅkhārā cā”tiādi. Tena yathāvuttaatthavaṇṇanā suttantabhājanīyavasena vuttāti yathādassitaṃ
analyzed: nippadesā ava viññāṇa phassa vedanā gahitā tasmā tattha ati dhātu kathā ayam abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena ati  imasmin paṭiccasamuppāda vibhaṅge abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena tena āha avijjā paccayā  saṅkhārā ca atiādi tena yathā vutta attha vaṇṇanā suttanta bhājanīya vasena vuttā iti yathā dassitam
translated: is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”🔽is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”🔽is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”🔽is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”🔽In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”🔽is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way as for the question ‘Are resultant states …? ‘”

original: virodhaṃ pariharati. Yadi abhidhammabhājanīyavasena dhātukathāpāḷi pavattā, atha🔽kasmā “kāmabhavo pañcahi khandhehi ekādasahāyatanehi sattarasahi dhātūhi saṅgahito.
analyzed: virodham pariharati yadi abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena dhātu kathā pāḷi pavattā atha 🔽kasmai kāmabhavaḥ pañcahi khandhehi ekādasahi āyatanehi sattarasahi dhātūhi saṅgahitaḥ
translated: In the case of the exposition of the dependent origination, the answer to the question “Are states dissociated from result …? ”🔽is given in terms of the Abhidhamma method. That is why he says: “The answer could be given in the same way

original: Rūpabhavo pañcahi khandhehi pañcahāyatanehi aṭṭhahi dhātūhi saṅgahito”tiādinā upādinnakkhandhavasena🔽bhavo vissajjitoti codanaṃ manasi katvā āha “bhavo pana…pe… na abhidhammabhājanīyavasena
analyzed: rūpa bhavo pañcahi khandhehi pañcahā āyatanehi aṭṭhahi dhātūhi saṅgahito ti ādinā upādinna khandha vasena  bhavaḥ vissajjitaḥ iti codanam manasi katvā āha bhavaḥ panape na abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena
translated: “The becoming of the form-sphere is included in the five aggregates, in the five sense-bases, and in eight elements.”🔽Thus he answers the question by showing that the aggregates that are clung to are included in the aggregates, etc.🔽“But the becoming that is included in the aggregates, etc., is not included in the Abhidhamma as a subject for analysis.🔽” “Thus” means: because it is not included in the Abhidhamma as a subject for analysis.

original: gahito”ti. Evañca katvāti abhidhammabhājanīyavasena aggahitattā eva. Tatthāti dhātukathāyaṃ.
analyzed: gahito ti evam ca katvā iti abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena eva tattha ati dhātu kathā ayam
translated: “There” means in the Dhammasangani.

original: Vipākañhetanti hi-saddo hetuattho. Yasmā yathāvuttabāttiṃsavidhaviññāṇaṃ vipākaṃ,
analyzed: vipākam hetan ti hi saddaḥ hetu atthaḥ yasmai yathā vutta bāttiṃsavidha viññāṇam vipākam
translated: The word “too” has the meaning of a reason. Since the thirty-two kinds of consciousness mentioned above are results of kamma,

original: tasmā taṃ saṅkhārapaccayanti imamatthaṃ dassento “viññāṇassa vipākattā”tiādimāha.🔽“Somanassasahagatāneva sandhāya vutta”nti idaṃ vicāretabbaṃ upekkhāsahagatakusalākusalajavanānantarampi
analyzed: tasmā tam saṅkhāra paccayanti imam attham dassentaḥ viññāṇassa vipāka ttā atiādim āha  somanassa sahagatān eva sandhāya vuttan ti idam vicāretabbam upekkhā sahagata kusala akusala javana anantaram pi
translated: he says: “Because consciousness is a result,” etc., in order to show that they are conditioned by formations.🔽“The statement should be understood as referring only to the consciousness accompanied by joy,” for the consciousness accompanied by equanimity is also admitted as a condition for the consciousness accompanied by joy that has it as its object.

original: somanassasahagatatadārammaṇassa icchitattā. Tathā hi aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “catunnaṃ pana
analyzed: somanassa sahagata tad ārammaṇassa icchita ttā tathā hi aṭṭhakathā ayam catunnam pana
translated: For the commentary says: “But the consciousness accompanied by joy that arises next to the consciousness accompanied by equanimity is a condition for the latter by way of decisive support.”

original: duhetukakusalacittānaṃ aññatarajavanassa pariyosāne ahetukacittaṃ tadārammaṇabhāvena
analyzed: du hetuka kusala cittānam aññatara javanassa pariyosāne ahetuka cittam tad ārammaṇa bhāvena
translated: At the end of the other’s impulsions, the resultant consciousness occurs with that object as its object. ”

original: patiṭṭhātī”ti vatvā “iṭṭhārammaṇe pana santīraṇampi tadārammaṇampi somanassasahagatamevā”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Kusalākusalañhi abhiiṭṭhampi ārammaṇaṃ tathābhisaṅkharaṇena kadāci na majjhattaṃ🔽katvā na pavattati, vipākaṃ pana yathāsabhāvatova ārammaṇarasaṃ anubhavati. Tenāha
analyzed: patiṭṭhāti iti vatvā iṭṭha ārammaṇe pana santi īraṇam pi tad ārammaṇam pi somanassa sahagatam eva ati  vuttam kusala akusalam hi abhiiṭṭham pi ārammaṇam tathā abhisaṅkharaṇena kadāci na majjhattam  katvā na pavattati vipākam pana yathā sabhāvataḥ va ārammaṇa rasam anubhavati tena āha
translated: But when the object is a desirable one, the determining consciousness and the registration are accompanied by joy.🔽For though the object is impinged upon, it is not sometimes experienced as neutral by the impulsions of profitable and unprofitable kinds, because of the way in which they are formed.

original: “na sakkā vipākaṃ vañcetu”nti. Kiriyajavanānaṃ pana visayābhisaṅkharaṇassa balavabhāvato
analyzed: na sakkā vipākam vañcetun ti kiriya javanānam pana visaya abhisaṅkharaṇassa balava bhāvato
translated: But the resultants experience the object’s taste according to its nature. That is why it is said, “It is not possible to deceive a resultant.”

original: tadanantarānaṃ tadārammaṇānaṃ yathāvisayaṃ vedanāvasena tadanuguṇatā icchitā. Ye
analyzed: tad ārammaṇānam yathāvisayam vedanā vasena tad anuguṇa tāḥ icchitāḥ ye
translated: But because of the strength of the impulsion’s forming of the object, the registration that follows it is held to be in conformity with the feeling according to the object.

original: pana kiriyajavanānantaraṃ tadārammaṇaṃ na icchanti, tesaṃ vattabbameva natthi. Yaṃ
analyzed: pana kiriya javana anantaram tad ārammaṇam na icchanti tesam vattabbam eva natthi yam
translated: But those who do not admit registration with that object have nothing to be said to them.

original: pana “javanena tadārammaṇaṃ niyametabba”nti vuttaṃ, taṃ kusalaṃ sandhāya vuttanti
analyzed: pana javanena tad ārammaṇam niyametabbam ti vuttam tam kusalam sandhāya vuttan ti
translated: But what was said above, namely, that “registration must be determined by the impulsion,” was said with reference to profitable impulsion.

original: ca vuttaṃ. Tasmā yathāvutto vicāretabbo. Tihetukajavanāvasāne ca duhetukajavanāvasāne
analyzed: ca vuttam tasmā yathā vuttaḥ vicāretabbaḥ ti hetuka javana avasāne ca du hetuka javana avasāne
translated: And at the end of profitable triple-root impulsions and at the end of double-root impulsions,

original: cāti samuccayattho ca-saddo. Keci pana vibhāgaṃ akatvā “kusalajavanāvasānepi ahetukatadārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: ca ati samuccaya tthaḥ ca saddo keci pana vibhāgam a katvā kusala javana avasāne pi ahetuka tad ārammaṇam
translated: the word “and” has the meaning of “together with.” But some, without making a distinction, say that “in the main” is said because “at the end of profitable impulsions too, that with root-cause is next to the unprofitable” .

original: hotīti ‘yebhuyyenā’ti vutta”nti vadanti. Lobhacittassa vā sattānaṃ bahulaṃ uppajjanato🔽“yebhuyyenā”ti vuttaṃ. “Sakiṃ vā”ti vacanasiliṭṭhatāvasena vuttaṃ yathā “aṭṭha vā
analyzed: hoti iti yebhuyyena ati vuttam ti vadanti lobha cittassa vā sattānam bahulam uppajjanato  yebhuyyena iti vuttam sakim vā iti vacana siliṭṭha tā vasena vuttam yathā aṭṭha vā
translated: Or alternatively, “in the main” is said because of the frequent occurrence of the kind of unprofitable consciousness called “with hate” in beings.🔽“Once” is said according to the rule of grammar. It should be understood as in the case of “three days, four days, etc.,” in order to show that it is “eight or ten” .

original: dasa vā”ti dassetuṃ “dirattatirattādīsu viya veditabba”nti āha. Vā-saddassa abhāvāti
analyzed: dasa vā ati dassetum diratta tiratta ādīsu viya veditabbanti āha abhāvā ti
translated: Because there is no word “or” ,

original: suyyamānassa vā-saddassa abhāvena vuttaṃ. Atthato pana tatthāpi vā-saddo labbhateva.🔽Tirattaṃ pana vāsādike labbhamāne diratte vattabbameva natthīti dirattaggahaṇaṃ visuṃ
analyzed: suyyamānassa vā saddassa abhāvena vuttam atthataḥ pana tattha api vā saddaḥ labbhateva  tirattam pana vāsa ādike labbhamāne diratte vattabbam eva natthi iti diratta ggahaṇam visum
translated: it is said because there is no word “or” in the text. But in fact the word “or” is found there too.

original: na yojetīti adhippāyena “vacanasiliṭṭhatāmattenā”ti vuttaṃ. Kevalaṃ “tiratta”nti
analyzed: na yojeti iti adhippāyena vacana siliṭṭha tā mattena ati vuttam kevalam tirattanti
translated: But since it is found in the case of “three days, etc.,” there is no need to mention “four days, etc.,” so the word “or” is not connected separately. The intention is that it is said “according to the rule of grammar” .🔽“Three days” is said

original: vutte aññattha vāsādinā antaritampi tirattaṃ gaṇheyya, dirattavisiṭṭhaṃ pana tirattaṃ
analyzed: vutte aññattha vāsa ādinā antaritam pi tirattam gaṇheyya diratta visiṭṭham pana tirattam
translated: If it were stated thus, he would take the two nights as interrupted by the other place, but the two nights are distinguished by the word “uninterrupted” (nirantara).

original: vuccamānaṃ tena anantaritameva tirattaṃ dīpetīti āha “nirantaratirattadassanatthaṃ
analyzed: vuccamānam tena anantaritam eva tirattam dīpeti iti āha nirantara tiratta dassana attham
translated: But when the word “uninterrupted” is used, it shows that the two nights are uninterrupted by anything else. That is why he says “or in order to show the two nights as uninterrupted.”

original: vā”ti. Balavarūpādike ārammaṇeti atimahati rūpādiārammaṇe. “Adhippāyo”ti etena ekacittakkhaṇāyukepi
analyzed: vāti balava rūpa ādike ārammaṇe iti ati mahati rūpa ādi ārammaṇe adhippāyaḥ ti etena eka citta kkhaṇa āyuke pi
translated: “In a very large object such as a mountain”: in a very large object such as a mountain, etc.

original: visaye kadāci tadārammaṇaṃ uppajjeyyāti “sakiṃ evā”tiādinā vuttamatthaṃ ulliṅgeti.
analyzed: visaye kadāci tad ārammaṇam uppajjeyya ti sakim eva iti ādinā vuttam attham ulliṅgeti
translated: By the word “intention” he implies the meaning stated by the words “sometimes, in the object that lasts for a moment only” .

original: “Sabbadvāresu tadārammaṇe dve eva cittavārā āgatā”ti vuttattā ayampi attho vicāretvā
analyzed: sabba dvāresu tad ārammaṇe dve eva citta vārāḥ āgatā ti vutta ttā ayam pi atthaḥ vicāretvā
translated: “At that time, two consciousnesses only are found in the object in all doors.” Therefore, this meaning should be understood by considering the matter.

original: gahetabbo. Anurūpāya paṭisandhiyāti attano attano anucchavikena paṭisandhānakiccena.🔽“Kati paṭisandhiyo, kati paṭisandhicittānī”tiādinā paṭisandhivicāro parato vitthārato
analyzed: gahetabbaḥ anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā ati attanaḥ attanaḥ anucchavikena paṭisandhāna kiccena  kati paṭisandhiyaḥ kati paṭisandhi cittāni iti ādinā paṭisandhi vicāro paratas vitthārato
translated: “In a rebirth-linking that is appropriate to it”: in a rebirth-linking that is suitable to it.

original: kathīyatīti āha “paṭisandhikathā mahāvisayāti katvā pavattimeva tāva dassento”ti.
analyzed: kathīyati iti āha paṭisandhi kathā mahā visayā iti katvā pavattim eva tāva dassento ti
translated: “The discussion of rebirth-linking will be given in detail later on in the section dealing with the question, ‘How many kinds of rebirth-linking are there? How many kinds of rebirth-linking consciousnesses are there?’” Therefore he says, “Having left out the discussion of rebirth-linking, which is a large subject, he shows only the process of becoming.”

original: Ahetukadvayādīnanti ādi-saddena mahāvipākamahaggatavipāke saṅgaṇhāti. Dvāraniyamāniyamāvacananti
analyzed: ahetuka dvaya ādīn anti ādi saddena mahā vipāka mahaggata vipāke saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “From the two non-causals, etc.,” etc. The word “etc.” includes the great-resultant and the resultant of the great. “The words ‘determinate and indeterminate as to door’ ”:

original: dvārassa niyatāniyatāvacanaṃ, niyatadvāraṃ aniyatadvāranti vā avacananti attho. Anuppattitoti🔽na uppajjanato. Yadipi “anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā”ti paṭisandhipi heṭṭhā gahitā, “pavattiyaṃ
analyzed: dvārassa niyata aniyata avacanam niyata dvāram aniyata dvāranti vā avacanam ti atthaḥ anuppattito ti  na uppajjanataḥ yadi pi anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā ati paṭisandhi pi heṭṭhā gahitā pavattiyam
translated: the meaning is that there is no mention of a determinate door or an indeterminate door. “From non-arising” :

original: panā”ti adhikatattā pana pavattiyeva paccāmaṭṭhā. Paccayuppannabhāvena paṭhamuddiṭṭhāni
analyzed: pana ati adhikatattā pana pavattiyā iva paccāmaṭṭhā paccayuppanna bhāvena paṭhama uddiṭṭhāni
translated: not from arising. Although rebirth-linking is included below in the words “in conformity with the rebirth-linking” , still it is the occurrence that is referred to here because it is the more usual.🔽All the mundane resultant consciousnesses mentioned by way of the present becoming

original: sabbānipi lokiyavipākacittāni anvādesaṃ arahantīti āha “tatrassāti pavattiyaṃ bāttiṃsavidhassā”ti.🔽Yathā kāmāvacarapaṭisandhiviññāṇasaṅkhātassa bījassa abhāvepi rūpabhave cakkhusotindriyapavattiānubhāvato
analyzed: sabbāni api lokiya vipāka cittāni anvādesam arahanti iti āha tatrassa ati pavattiyam bāttiṃsavidhassa ati  yathā kāmāvacara paṭisandhi viññāṇa saṅkhātassa bījassa abhāve pi rūpa bhave
translated: are included in the description because they exist by way of present becoming.🔽“In that, i.e. in the occurrence of thirty-two kinds” :

original: cakkhusotaviññāṇānaṃ sambhavo, evaṃ teneva kāraṇena sampaṭicchanādīnampi tattha sambhavoti
analyzed: cakkhu sota viññāṇānam sambhavaḥ evam tena iva kāraṇena sampaṭicchana ādīnam pi tattha sambhavaḥ ti
translated: Just as, although there is no seed called sense-sphere rebirth-linking consciousness, eye and ear consciousness arise in the fine-material sphere because of the occurrence of the eye and ear faculties there, so too the arising of the receiving, investigating, and determining consciousnesses there should be understood in the same way.

original: dassento “indriyapavattiānubhāvato evā”tiādimāha. Tattha cakkhusotadvārabhedenāti
analyzed: dassentaḥ indriya pavatti ānubhāvataḥ eva ati ādim āha tattha cakkhu sota dvāra bhedena ati
translated: “It is only by the power of the occurrence of the faculties” is said. Herein, by the distinction of the eye and ear doors:

original: cakkhusotadvāravisesena bhavitabbanti sambandho. Tassāti cakkhusotadvārassa. Dvāravantāpekkho
analyzed: cakkhu sota dvāra visesena bhavitabbanti sambandhaḥ tassa ti cakkhu sota dvārassa dvāravanta apekkho
translated: it should be by the distinction of the eye and ear doors. His: of the eye and ear doors. The state of being a door:

original: dvārabhāvoti āha “viññāṇavīthibhedāyattattā”ti. Tasmiñca satīti tasmiṃ dvārabhede
analyzed: dvāra bhāvaḥ ti āha viññāṇa vīthi bheda āyatta tā ati tasmin ca sati iti tasmin dvāra bhede
translated: he says this because it is dependent on the end of the door. And when that exists: when that distinction of the door exists,

original: vīthibhede ca sati. Bhāvoti uppatti. Janakaṃ anubandhati nāmāti taṃsadise tabbohāraṃ katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vīthi bhede ca sati bhāvaḥ ti uppatti janakam anubandhati nāma ati tad sadise tad bohāram katvā vuttam
translated: and when the distinction of the cognitive series exists. The state of being: arising. It is said that it follows the producer: it is said after making a double reference to that kind.

original: Idaṃ pana vatvāti rūpārūpāvacaradhamme ārabbha tadārammaṇānuppattiṃ vatvā. Bhāvanāyāti
analyzed: idam pana vatvā ati rūpa arūpa avacara dhamme ārabbha tad ārammaṇa anuppattim vatvā bhāvanāya ati
translated: But after saying this: after saying the non-arising of the object of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas. By development:

original: akusalabhāvanāya saṃkilesavaḍḍhanena, saṃkiliṭṭhasamādhānenāti attho. Tathā hi lobhadosasahagatacittuppādepi
analyzed: akusala bhāvanāya saṃkilesa vaḍḍhanena saṃkiliṭṭha samādhānena ati tathā hi lobha dosa sahagata cittuppāde pi
translated: by the development of the unprofitable, by the increase of defilement; the meaning is, by concentration that is defiled. For thus it is said of concentration even in the case of the unprofitable consciousness associated with greed and hate:

original: samādhi “avaṭṭhiti avisāhāro avikkhepo avisāhaṭamānasatā”tiādinā niddiṭṭho. Avatthubhāvadassanatthanti
translated: “It is steadiness, non-distraction, non-dispersal, unification of cognizance” , and so on. In order to show that it is not a basis:

original: aṭṭhānabhāvadassanatthaṃ, anārammaṇabhāvadassanatthanti attho.
analyzed: aṭṭhāna bhāva dassana ttham anārammaṇa bhāva dassana ttham ti attho
translated: The meaning is: in order to show that it is impossible, that it has no object.

original: “Kena katthā”ti padassa “kena cittena kasmiṃ bhave”ti saṅkhepena vuttamatthaṃ vitthārato🔽dassetuṃ “ekūnavīsatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tena tena cittenāti tena tena ahetukadvayādicittena
analyzed: kena katthā ati padassa kena cittena kasmin bhave ti saṅkhepena vuttam attham vitthārato  dassetum ekūnavīsati iti ādi vuttam tattha tena tena cittena ati tena tena ahetuka dvaya ādi cittena
translated: The words “By what? Where?” are stated in brief. In order to show their meaning in detail,

original: saddhiṃ pavattamānā paṭisandhikkhaṇe rūpārūpadhammā ekūnavīsati paṭisandhiyoti yojanā.
analyzed: saddhim pavattamānā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe rūpa arūpa dhammā ekūnavīsati paṭisandhiyo ti yojanā
translated: it is said: “Nineteen kinds of rebirth-linking” and so on. Herein, the nineteen kinds of rebirth-linking, which are material and immaterial dhammas occurring together with the respective kinds of consciousness beginning with the two kinds of root-causeless consciousness, are to be construed as follows:

original: Tena tena cittena sahajātādipaccayatāya hetubhūtena, karaṇabhūtena vā. Tattha tattha bhave.
analyzed: tena tena cittena sahajāta ādi paccaya tāya hetu bhūtena karaṇa bhūtena vā tattha tattha bhave
translated: “By that, that rebirth-linking” means by that consciousness which is a cause or instrument by way of conascence condition, etc., “that rebirth-linking” occurs “in that becoming.”

original: Anussaraṇattho byāpāro anussaraṇabyāpāro. Kecīti dhammasirittheraṃ sandhāya vadati.🔽Tīsu javanavāresu…pe… bhavitabbanti kammādiupaṭṭhānassa parato tīhi javanavārehi
analyzed: anussaraṇa atthaḥ byāpāraḥ anussaraṇa byāpāraḥ keci iti dhammasiri ttheram sandhāya vadati  tīsu bhavitabbanti kamma ādi upaṭṭhānassa paratas tīhi javana vārehi
translated: The meaning of “recollection” is “recollecting.” “Malice” is “recollecting malice.” “Some” refers to the Elder Dhammasiri.🔽In the three impulsions …

original: pavattitabbanti attho. Tenāha “aneka…pe… abhippalambanañca hotī”ti. Tasmāti yasmā
analyzed: pavattitabbanti atthaḥ tena āha aneka pe abhippalambanam ca hoti iti tasmā iti yasmā
translated: The meaning is: after the appearance of the kamma, etc., it must occur by way of the three impulsions. Therefore he said: “There is also a repeated adverting and a repeated apprehension.” Because …

original: ekajavanavārasseva kammādiupaṭṭhānena maraṇaṃ na sambhavati, tasmā. Phoṭṭhabbassāti🔽pahāraphoṭṭhabbassa. Bhavaṅgacitte vattamāne, antarantarā pañcadvāravīthiyā vā vattamānāya
analyzed: eka javana vārassa iva kamma ādi upaṭṭhānena maraṇam na sambhavati tasmā phoṭṭhabbassa āti  pahāra phoṭṭhabbassa bhavaṅga citte vattamāne antar antarā pañca dvāra vīthiyā vā vattamānāya
translated: Death does not occur through the mere occurrence of a single javana process. Therefore,🔽‘By contact’: by the contact of a blow. While the life-continuum consciousness is occurring,🔽or while the five-door adverting is occurring,

original: phoṭṭhabbasamāyoge paṭhamaṃ kāyadvārāvajjanuppatti yuttā, tathāpi kismiñci cintiyamāne🔽tamevārabbha ekasmiṃ javanavāre pavatte pacchā kāyadvārāvajjanuppatti siyā cittassa
analyzed: phoṭṭhabba samāyoge paṭhamam yuttā tathā api kismiñci cintiyamāne  tam eva ārabbha ekasmin javana vāre pavatte pacchā siyā cittassa
translated: the occurrence of the adverting at the five doors is appropriate. But when something is being thought of,

original: lahuparivattibhāvatoti kecivādassa adhippāyo. Yathā niddāyantassa phoṭṭhabbasamāyogena🔽pabujjhanakāle manodvārāvajjanameva āvaṭṭeti, na kāyadvārāvajjanaṃ. “Pañcahi viññāṇehi
analyzed: lahu parivatti bhāvato ti keci vādassa adhippāyaḥ yathā niddāyantassa phoṭṭhabba samāyogena  pabujjhana kāle manaḥ dvāra āvajjanam eva āvaṭṭeti na kāya dvāra āvajjanam pañcahi viññāṇehi
translated: the occurrence of the adverting at the five doors may be later than the occurrence of the javana process that has that as its object, because the mind turns quickly. This is the intention of some.

original: na paṭibujjhatī”ti hi vuttaṃ. Evaṃsampadaṃ vā etaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Lahukapaccupaṭṭhānanti
analyzed: na paṭibujjhati iti hi vuttam evaṃsampadam vā etam daṭṭhabbam lahuka paccupaṭṭhānam ti
translated: Just as when one is falling asleep, the adverting at the mind door occurs at the time of waking up through the contact of a blow, not the adverting at the five doors. For it is said, ‘He does not wake up through the five consciousnesses’ .🔽Or this should be regarded as a case of the quick succession of the occurrence of the javana process and the adverting at the five doors. ‘Quick occurrence’ means

original: lahuupaṭṭhānaṃ. Manodvārassa visayo kammādiko. Lahukatāti lahupaṭṭhānatā. Rūpānanti
analyzed: lahu upaṭṭhānam manaḥ dvārassa visayaḥ kamma ādiko lahuka tā ati lahu upaṭṭhāna tā rūpa ananti
translated: quick appearance. The object of the mind door is kamma, etc. ‘Quickness’ means quick appearance. ‘By visible data’ means

original: cakkhādirūpadhammānaṃ. Visayabhāvepīti rūpāyatanādivisayasabbhāvepi. Yesaṃ visayo
analyzed: cakkha ādi rūpa dhammānam visaya bhāve pi iti rūpa āyatana ādi visaya sabbhāve pi yesam visayo
translated: Even though they are objects: even though they are objects of the eye-sensitivity, etc.🔽Those that have an object: those that have an object in the absolute sense.

original: atthīti yesaṃ nippariyāyena visayo atthi. Taṃdassanatthamevāti tesaṃ sārammaṇānaṃyeva
analyzed: atthi iti yesam nippariyāyena visayaḥ atthi tad dassana ttham eva ati tesam sārammaṇānam yeva
translated: For the purpose of showing them: for the purpose of showing those that have an object.

original: dassanatthaṃ. Tenāti tasmā.
analyzed: dassana attham tena ati tasmai
translated: Therefore: for that reason.

original: “Bhūmicittuppādādivasenā”ti idaṃ kammaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, kammanimittassapi vasena labbhateva tassa chaḷārammaṇabhāvato. Gatinimittassa pana pabhedo nīlādikoyeva.
analyzed: bhūmi cittuppāda ādi vasena ati idam kammam sandhāya vuttam kamma nimittassa api vasena labbhateva tassa chaṭṭha ārammaṇa bhāvataḥ gati nimittassa pana pabhedaḥ
translated: “By the arising of the earth-kasiṇa jhāna, etc.,” is said with reference to kamma. It is also found by the sign of kamma, because that is the sixfold object. But the classification of the sign of destiny is only blue, etc.🔽When it is not cut off: when it is not abandoned by the path.

original: Anupacchinnesu maggena appahīnesu. Tañca kammādiṃ. Bhavantaraninnāditā cittasantānassa🔽bhavapatthanāya tathābhisaṅkhatattā. Yasmiñhi cittasantāne puññādicetanāya viya bhavapatthanāya
analyzed: anupacchinnesu maggena appahīnesu tam ca kamma ādim citta santānassa  bhava patthanāya yasmin hi citta santāne puñña ādi cetanāya viya bhava patthanāya
translated: And that kamma, etc.: the continuity of consciousness is led into the next becoming🔽because of the aspiration for becoming, since it is formed thus by the aspiration for becoming. For in that continuity of consciousness where the development of the aspiration for becoming is not cut off, as is the development of the volition of merit, etc.,

original: paribhāvanā anupacchinnā, tattheva bhavantarapariyāpannacittuppatti. Taṃ pana cittaṃ
analyzed: paribhāvanā anupacchinnā tattha iva bhava antara pariyāpanna citta uppatti tam pana cittam
translated: there is the arising of consciousness included in the next becoming. But that consciousness is

original: tathā uppajjamānaṃ tāya vināmitaṃ viya hotīti vuttaṃ “anupacchinnakilesabalavināmita”nti.
analyzed: tathā uppajjamānam tāya vināmitam viya hoti iti vuttam anupacchinna kilesa bala vināmitan ti
translated: and so it is said that it is “bent by the force of the defilements that have arisen without break.”

original: Sabbatthāti sugatiduggatīsu. Itarāyāti sugatipaṭisandhininnāya cutiyā. “Nicchinantī”ti
analyzed: sabbattha āti sugati duggatīsu itarāya ati sugati paṭisandhi ninnāya cutiyā nicchinanti iti
translated: “Everywhere”: in happy and unhappy destinies. “The other”: the death that leads to rebirth-linking in a happy destiny.

original: vuttassa nicchayassa nibandhanaṃ āgamaṃ dassento “nimittassādagadhitaṃ vā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vuttassa nicchayassa nibandhanam āgamam dassentaḥ vā ti ādim āha
translated: “The reason why it is said that it is ‘bent’ ”: he gives the reason in the words “or by the taste for the sign.”

original: Akusale hi duggatūpanissaye niyamite kusalaṃ sugatūpanissayoti niyamitameva hotīti.
analyzed: akusale hi duggata upanissaye niyamite kusalam sugata upanissayo ti niyamitam eva hoti iti
translated: For when unwholesome kamma that is a condition for an unhappy destiny is determined, then wholesome kamma that is a condition for a happy destiny is also determined.

original: Aniṭṭhaṃ ārammaṇaṃ āha yato duggatipaṭisandhi dassīyatīti adhippāyo. Yadi evaṃ “rāgādihetubhūta”nti
analyzed: aniṭṭham ārammaṇam āha yatas duggati paṭisandhi dassīyati iti adhippāyaḥ yadi evam rāga ādi hetu bhūtan ti
translated: The intention is that an unpleasant object is mentioned because it shows rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny.🔽If that is so, why is it said that it is “the cause of lust, etc.,”

original: kasmā vuttanti āha “tampi hi…pe… hotī”ti. Tampīti aniṭṭhārammaṇampi. Yasmā pana hīnaṃ
analyzed: kasmā vuttanti āha tam pi hipe hoti iti tam pi iti aniṭṭha ārammaṇam pi yasmā pana hīnam
translated: and so on? He says, “For that too,” etc. “That too” refers to the unpleasant object.🔽But since a low object is intended,

original: ārammaṇanti ārammaṇabhūtakammanimittaṃ adhippetaṃ, tasmā “akusalavipākajanakakammasahajātānaṃ
analyzed: ārammaṇanti ārammaṇa bhūta kamma nimittam adhippetam tasmai akusala vipāka janaka kamma sahajātānam
translated: the sign of kamma that is the object is intended. Therefore, “the reason why it is said that it is ‘bent’ ” is given in the words “because it is the cause of the kamma that generates an unwholesome result and is associated with it.”

original: vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kammanimittabhūtañhi ārammaṇaṃ yaṃ vipākassa janakaṃ kammaṃ, tena
analyzed: vā tiādi vuttam kamma nimitta bhūtam hi ārammaṇam yam vipākassa janakam kammam tena
translated: “And so on” is said. For the object that is the sign of the kamma is the cause of the kamma that generates the result.

original: sahajātānaṃ, tassa kammassa sadisāsannajavanasahajātānañca rāgādīnaṃ ārammaṇapaccayasaṅkhāto
analyzed: sahajātānam tassa kammassa sadisa āsanna javana sahajātānam ca rāga ādīnam ārammaṇa paccaya saṅkhāto
translated: It is the condition by way of object condition for the conascent states of that kamma and for the conascent greed, etc., that are similar to that kamma and proximate to it.

original: hetu hoti, so eva cassa hīnabhāvoti dassetuṃ “tañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kammavasena aniṭṭhanti🔽hīnassa akusalakammassa ārammaṇato ārammaṇatāvasena hīnanti katvā aniṭṭhaṃ, sabhāvena🔽iṭṭhampīti adhippāyo. “Aññathā cā”tiādinā kammanimittārammaṇassa akusalavipākassa
analyzed: hetu hoti saḥ eva cassa hīna bhāvaḥ ti dassetum tat hi itiādi vuttam kamma vasena aniṭṭhanti  hīnassa akusala kammassa ārammaṇataḥ ārammaṇa tā vasena hīna nti katvā aniṭṭham sabhāvena  iṭṭham pi iti adhippāyaḥ aññathā ca ati ādinā kamma nimitta ārammaṇassa akusala vipākassa
translated: “That is why” is said to show that that is its inferior state. The undesirable by way of kamma is undesirable🔽because of its inferiority as the object of unwholesome kamma. The intention is that it is desirable by nature.

original: na sambhavoti dasseti. Āsannakatakammārammaṇasantatiyanti āsannakatassa kammassa🔽ārammaṇasantāne. Taṃsadisanti yathāvuttakammārammaṇasadisaṃ. Paṭisandhiārammaṇūpaṭṭhāpakanti
analyzed: na sambhavaḥ ti dasseti āsanna kata kamma ārammaṇa santatiyanti āsanna katassa kammassa  ārammaṇa santāne tad sadisanti yathā vutta kamma ārammaṇa sadisam paṭisandhi ārammaṇa upaṭṭhāpakanti
translated: “And otherwise” shows that the sign of the kamma as object is not the cause of unwholesome result.🔽In the continuity of the object of the kamma that is done recently is in the continuity of the object of the kamma that is done recently.🔽Similar to that is similar to the object of the kamma as described.

original: paṭisandhiyā ārammaṇassa upaṭṭhāpakaṃ. Cutiāsannajavanānaṃ paṭisandhijanakatte ayamattho
analyzed: paṭisandhiyāḥ ārammaṇassa upaṭṭhāpakam cuti āsanna javanānam paṭisandhi janaka tte ayam attho
translated: Causing the object of rebirth-linking to appear is causing the object of rebirth-linking to appear.🔽This is the meaning of the proximate impulsions near to death that generate rebirth-linking.

original: labbheyyāti codanaṃ manasi katvā āha “na ca paṭisandhiyā”tiādi. Taṃsamānavīthiyanti
analyzed: codanam manasi katvā āha na ca paṭisandhiyā ati ādi
translated: He says “Nor does it give rebirth-linking” in order to take into account the objection.🔽In the same street as that:

original: tāya paṭisandhiyā ekavīthiyaṃ. Na assāditānīti assādanabhūtāya taṇhāya na āmaṭṭhāni.
analyzed: tāya paṭisandhiyā eka vīthiyam na assāditāni iti assādana bhūtāya taṇhāya na āmaṭṭhāni
translated: in the same street as that rebirth-linking. Not relished: not savoured by craving that has the nature of relishing.

original: Samattāti paripuṇṇā, pariyattā vā. “Maraṇakāle…pe… samādinnā”ti vacanato yathāvuttacutiāsannajavanānaṃ
analyzed: samattā ati paripuṇṇā pariyattā vā maraṇa kālepe samādinnā ati vacanataḥ yathā vutta cuti āsanna java nānam
translated: Complete: fulfilled, finished. Since it is said, “At the time of death … are brought to mind” ,

original: paṭisandhidānaṃ siddhanti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “na ca dubbalehī”tiādi. “Vakkhati cā”tiādinā🔽vuttamevatthaṃ upacayena pākaṭataraṃ karoti. Ñāṇavatthuvibhaṅgavaṇṇanāyañhi “pañcahi
analyzed: paṭisandhi dānam siddhanti codanam sandhāya āha na ca dubbalehi itiādi vakkhati ca ati ādinā  vuttam eva attham upacayena pākaṭataram karoti ñāṇa vatthu vibhaṅga vaṇṇanāyan hi pañcahi
translated: it is established that the impulsion-consciousnesses that are near to death give rebirth-linking. He says “Nor is it weak” in order to take into account the objection.

original: viññāṇehi na kañci dhammaṃ paṭivijānātī”ti padānaṃ atthaṃ vivaranto vakkhati “sabbampi…pe…
analyzed: viññāṇehi na kañci dhammam paṭivijānāti iti padānam attham vivarantaḥ vakkhati
translated: By “and it is said” he makes the meaning that was stated by the words “it is said” clearer by amplification. For in the Description of the Bases of Knowledge he says “No one cognizes any idea by means of the five kinds of consciousness” , and in explaining the meaning of that he says “All … are excluded” .

original: paṭikkhittānī”ti. Tattha paṭivijānanādīti ādi-saddena iriyāpathakappanakāyavacīkammupaṭṭhāpanakusalākusaladhammasamādānasamāpajjanavuṭṭhānāni
analyzed: paṭikkhittāni iti tattha paṭivijānana ādi iti ādi saddena iriyāpatha kappana kāya vacī kamma upaṭṭhāpana kusala akusala dhamma samādāna samāpajjana vuṭṭhānāni
translated: Herein, the words “cognizes, etc.” include the postures, the conceivings, the manifestation of bodily and verbal action, the undertaking of profitable and unprofitable ideas, and the attainment and emergence from jhānas.

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Upapajjanasupinadassanādīnaṃ manodvārikacitteneva pavatti pākaṭāti tāni
