original: paccayo hotīti pākaṭoyamatthoti taṃ avibhajitvā “sabbapuññābhisaṅkhāraṃ saha saṅgaṇhāti”cceva
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti iti pākaṭaḥ yam atthaḥ ti tam a vibhajitvā sabba puñña abhisaṅkhāram saha saṅgaṇhāti icca iva
translated: And although it is said in the Vibhaṅga that “the kāmāvacara meritorious volitions are a condition, as a condition not directly antecedent, for the five consciousnesses beginning with eye-consciousness, and the other is a condition, as a condition not directly antecedent, for the occurrence of the result of the first jhāna, and so on, and for rebirth-linking” , still the meaning is obvious, so it is said without analysis that “it includes all meritorious volitions together with their associated states.”

original: vuttaṃ. Dvādasākusalacetanābhedoti nayidaṃ samāsapadaṃ, sandhivasena panetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam dvādasa akusala cetanā bhedaḥ ti na idam samāsa padam sandhi vasena pana itam vuttam
translated: The twelve unprofitable volitions: this is not a compound word, but it is said with a sandhi-linking of the words.

original: Dvādasāti ca bhummatthe paccattavacanaṃ, dvādasasu akusalacetanāsu. Akusalacetanābhedoti🔽ekādasākusalacetanāpabhedo, dvādasākusalacetanāpabhedo cāti attho veditabbo. Evañhi
analyzed: dvādasā iti ca bhumma tthe paccatta vacanam dvādasasu akusala cetanāsu akusala cetanā bhedo ti  ekādasa akusala cetanā apabhedaḥ dvādasa akusala cetanā apabhedaḥ ca ati atthaḥ veditabbo evam hi
translated: And the word dvādasa is a numeral in the sense of a class, thus the meaning should be understood as “the twelve unprofitable volitions,”🔽or “the class of twelve unprofitable volitions,” or “the class of the twelve unprofitable volitions.” For if it is taken thus, there is nothing here to be puzzled out, since it has been given in detail below .

original: sati na ettha kiñci vicāretabbaṃ heṭṭhā vitthāritattā. Keci pana “dvādasākusalacetanābhedoti
analyzed: sati na ettha kiñci vicāretabbam heṭṭhā vitthārita ttā keci pana dvādasa akusala cetanā bhedā ti
translated: But some say that the meaning should be understood as “the class of the twelve unprofitable volitions,”

original: idaṃ ‘channaṃ pavatte’tiādinā yojetabba”nti vadanti, tesaṃ matena uddhaccacetanāya
analyzed: idam channam pavatta iti ādinā yojetabbanti vadanti tesam matena uddhacca cetanāya
translated: “This should be construed thus: ‘In the occurrence of the six kinds of consciousness’ ” .

original: gahaṇe payojanaṃ vicāretabbameva paṭisandhiyāpi paccayabhāvassa vuttattā. Ekassāti
analyzed: gahaṇe payojanam vicāretabbam eva paṭisandhiyā api paccaya bhāvassa vuttattā ekassa ati
translated: The purpose of including the volition of agitation must be investigated, since it is said to be a condition for rebirth-linking.🔽As regards the words “of one only,” the particle eva is construed with paccayabhāvaniyamo .

original: ettha eva-saddo luttaniddiṭṭhoti āha “ekasseva paccayabhāvaniyamo”ti. Milātamālādīnanti
analyzed: ettha eva saddaḥ lutta niddiṭṭhaḥ ti āha ekassa iva paccaya bhāva niyamaḥ ti milāta mālā ādīnam ti
translated: “Of the faded garland, etc.,” etc.

original: milātamālakiliṭṭhavatthādīnaṃ. Manopadosikānaṃ tadaññavatthūnampi aniṭṭhatā kathaṃ🔽na siyā, siyā evāti adhippāyo. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana pacuratābhāvato taṃ anāmasitvā
analyzed: milāta māla kiliṭṭha vattha ādīnam mana upadosikānam tad añña vatthūnam pi aniṭṭha tā katham  na siyā siyā eva ati adhippāyaḥ aṭṭhakathā ayam pana pacura tā bhāvato tam an āmasitvā
translated: How can it be that what is undesirable does not exist in the other physical bases of those subject to mental obsessions? It is the intention that it does exist.🔽But in the commentary the words “in the same way in the sense-sphere divine world” are stated without mentioning the other bases because they are not a basis for the feeling of displeasure.

original: “tathā kāmāvacaradevalokepī”ti vuttaṃ. Keci pana “devaloke aniṭṭhaṃ nāma parikappanavasena,
analyzed: tathā kāmāvacara deva loke pi iti vuttam keci pana deva loke aniṭṭham nāma parikappana vasena
translated: But some say that what is undesirable in the divine world is only assumed to be so by imagination,

original: sabhāvato pana tatthuppannaṃ iṭṭhamevā”ti vadanti.
analyzed: sabhāvataḥ pana tattha uppannam iṭṭham eva ati vadanti
translated: and that what occurs there is actually desirable in its very nature.

original: “Ekūnatiṃsacetanābhedampī”ti iminā uddhaccacetanāyapi pavattivipākadāyitaṃ anujānāti,
analyzed: ekūnatiṃsa cetanā bhedam pi iti iminā anujānāti
translated: By the words “of the nineteen kinds of consciousness” he allows that the volition of agitation also gives results in the occurrence of rebirth-linking.

original: aṭṭhakathāadhippāyavasena vā evamāha. Pañcadasannaṃ ahetukavipākaviññāṇānaṃ pañcaṭṭhānāni
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā adhippāya vasena vā evam āha ahetuka vipāka viññāṇānam pañca ṭṭhānāni
translated: The five bases of the fifteen kinds of resultants without root-cause are

original: dve apanetvā avasesānaṃ terasannaṃ. Dve dve cakkhusotasampaṭicchanaviññāṇāni, tīṇi🔽santīraṇānīti navannaṃ. Ekadesapaccayabhāvenāti ekadesassa vīsaticetanābhedassa kāmāvacaracittasaṅkhārassa
analyzed: dve apanetvā avasesānam dve dve cakkhu sota sampaṭicchana viññāṇāni tīṇi  santi īraṇāni iti eka desa paccaya bhāvena ati eka desassa vīsati cetanā bhedassa kāmāvacara citta saṅkhārassa
translated: the five bases of the thirteen kinds of resultants without root-cause, omitting the two kinds of eye-consciousness and ear-consciousness.🔽The two kinds of eye- and ear-contact, the three kinds of mind-contact, and the nine kinds of resultant consciousnesses are the five bases.🔽By the conditionality of a part: by the conditionality of a part of the aggregate of mental formations consisting of the twenty kinds of volition of the sense sphere,🔽a collection consisting of twenty-nine kinds of volition is spoken of.

original: paccayabhāvena ekūnatiṃsacetanābhedo samudāyo vutto. Svevāti avayavagatenāpi visesena
analyzed: paccaya bhāvena ekūnatiṃsa cetanā bhedo samudāyaḥ vutto su eva ati avayava gatena api visesena
translated: By itself: the collection is spoken of by means of a distinction of a part.

original: samudāyo voharīyati yathā “alaṅkato rājakumāro”ti.🔽Yatthāti pañcavokārabhavaṃ sandhāyāha. Tattha hi “kāmāvacarasugatiyaṃ tāva ṭhitassā”tiādinā
analyzed: samudāyaḥ yathā alaṅkataḥ  yattha iti pañcavokāra bhavam sandhāya āha tattha hi kāmāvacara sugatiyam tāva ṭhitassa ati ādinā
translated: Just as it is said, “The prince is adorned.”🔽Where: he says this referring to the five-constituent existence.🔽For there the explanation of the result in rebirth-linking and in the course of an existence is given in the passage beginning, “First, in the happy destinies of the sense sphere” .

original: paṭisandhiyaṃ pavattiyañca vipākassa vitthārappakāsanaṃ kataṃ. Catutthajjhānabhūmīti
analyzed: paṭisandhiyam pavattiyam ca vipākassa vitthāra ppakāsanam katam catuttha jhāna bhūmi iti
translated: The plane of the fourth jhāna:🔽he refers to the plane of the fruition attainment. Therefore he says, “except for the immaterial sphere.”

original: vehapphalabhūmiṃ vadati. Tenāha “asaññāruppavajjā”ti. Catutthajjhānameva hi bhāvanāvisesappavattaṃ
analyzed: vehapphala bhūmim vadati tena āha asaññā aruppa vajjā ti catuttha jhānam eva hi bhāvanā visesa ppavattam
translated: For the fourth jhāna itself, occurring through the distinction of development,

original: asaññabhūmiṃ āruppabhūmiñca nipphādeti, catukkanayavasena vā saṃvaṇṇanā vuttāti veditabbā.
analyzed: asañña bhūmim āruppa bhūmiñca nipphādeti catukka naya vasena vā saṃvaṇṇanā vuttā iti veditabbā
translated: and the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception and the base consisting of nothingness. Or else the exposition should be understood as given according to the fourfold method.

original: Aṭṭha mahāvipākā, parittavipākesu pacchimo, pañca rūpāvacaravipākāti evaṃ cuddasannaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭha mahā vipākā paritta vipākesu pacchimaḥ pañca rūpāvacara vipākā ati evam
translated: The eight great fruits, the last of the small fruits, and the five of the fine-material sphere: thus of fourteen.

original: Sattannanti sesānaṃ parittavipākānaṃyeva sattannaṃ.🔽Bhavādayoti bhavayonigatisattāvāse. Tiṇṇaṃ viññāṇānanti purimānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ āruppavipākaviññāṇānaṃ.
analyzed: sattannam ti sesānam paritta vipākānam yeva  bhava ādayaḥ ti bhava yoni gati sattā vāse tiṇṇam viññāṇānam ti purimānam tiṇṇam āruppa vipāka viññāṇānam
translated: Seven: of the remaining seven small fruits.🔽In the three kinds of becoming, etc.: in the three kinds of becoming, four kinds of generation, five kinds of destiny, seven stations of consciousness, and nine abodes of beings.🔽In the three kinds of consciousness: in the three kinds of fine-material-sphere resultant consciousness.

original: Tīsūti pañcamādīsu tīsu viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu. Vuttanayenāti “kāmabhave pana duggatiyaṃ
analyzed: tīsu iti pañcama ādīsu tīsu viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu vutta nayena ati kāma bhave pana duggatiyam
translated: In the three stations of consciousness: in the three stations of consciousness beginning with the fifth.

original: aṭṭhannampi parittavipākaviññāṇānaṃ tatheva paccayo pavatte, no paṭisandhiya”ntiādinā vuttanayeneva.
analyzed: aṭṭhannam pi paritta vipāka viññāṇānam tathā iva paccayaḥ pavatte no paṭisandhiyan ti ādinā vutta nayena iva
translated: In the way stated: “In the fine-material becoming, however, in the unhappy destinies, the eight kinds of small resultant consciousness are a condition in the way already stated, that is, as conascence, etc., only for the kinds of materiality that occur in the cognitive series, not for rebirth-linking” .

original: Viññāṇapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: viññāṇa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the clause “consciousness” is ended.

original: Nāmarūpapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nāma rūpa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the clause “mentality-materiality”

original: 228. Yadipi suttante abhidhamme ca paṭiccasamuppādaniddese rūpapadassa desanābhedo
analyzed: yadi api suttante abhidhamme ca paṭiccasamuppāda niddese rūpa padassa desanā bhedaḥ
translated: Although in the Suttas and in the Abhidhamma the teaching of dependent origination is given in different ways in the clause on materiality,

original: natthi, abhidhamme pana “sabbaṃ rūpaṃ na hetū”tiādinā suttantato tassa desanābhedo
analyzed: natthi abhidhamme pana sabbam rūpam na hetu uti ādinā suttantataḥ tassa desanā bhedaḥ
translated: But in the Abhidhamma there is a different teaching in the Suttanta, beginning, “All materiality is not a cause” .

original: atthevāti āha “suttantā…pe… bhedo”ti. Saṅkhyeyyesu paricchedato gahitesu atthasiddho
analyzed: atthā iva ati āha bhedo ti saṅkhyeyyesu paricchedataḥ gahitesu attha siddho
translated: That is why he says, “The difference is in the Suttanta … etc.”🔽When the classifiable is taken as limited, the meaning is established.

original: tattha saṅkhyāparicchedoti vuttaṃ “atthato pana vuttameva hotī”ti.🔽Opapātikasattesūti vā sāmaññato sabbe opapātikā vuttā. Tesu brahmakāyikādiggahaṇena
analyzed: tattha saṅkhyā paricchedo ti vuttam atthataḥ pana vuttam eva hoti iti  opapātika sattesu iti vā sāmaññato sabbe opapātikā vuttā tesu brahmakāyika ādi gahaṇena
translated: So it is said, “But the meaning is stated in the Suttanta” .🔽Or all the beings of apparitional generation are referred to in general as “apparitional beings.”🔽And only the fine-material beings are referred to by the words “Brahma-world beings” and so on.

original: rūpāvacarāva vuttāti tadaññe sandhāya sesaopapātikānanti sesaggahaṇaṃ sātthakameva.
analyzed: rūpāvacarā va vuttā ti tad aññe sandhāya sesa opapātikānam ti sesa ggahaṇam sātthakam eva
translated: So the words “the rest of the apparitional beings” are meaningful.

original: Vuttanayenāti “dve vā tayo vā dasakā, omato ādinā sahā”tiādinā rūpamissakaviññāṇe vuttanayena.
analyzed: vutta nayena ati dve vā tayaḥ vā dasakāḥ omataḥ ādinā saha ati ādinā rūpa missaka viññāṇe vutta nayena
translated: In the way stated: in the way stated in the section on consciousness accompanied by materiality, beginning, “Two or three decades, and so on, with the beginning” .

original: “Dve santatisīsānī”ti ārabbha yāva “satta santatisīsānī”ti ettakaṃ aṭṭhakathāpāṭhaṃ
analyzed: dve santati sīsāni iti ārabbha yāva satta santati sīsāni iti ettakam aṭṭhakathā pāṭham
translated: The words “ending with the septuple” are said referring to the commentary passage beginning, “There are two heads of continuity” , up to “There are seven heads of continuity” .

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ “sattakapariyosāna”nti. Ekekacittakkhaṇe tikkhattuṃ rūpuppattiṃ ananujānanto
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam sattaka pariyosānam ti ekeka citta khaṇe tikkhattum rūpa uppattim an anujānanto
translated: Not allowing the occurrence of materiality three times in each conscious moment,

original: āha “iminādhippāyenā”ti. Cittassa uppādakkhaṇeyeva sabbaṃ rūpaṃ uppajjatīti hi attano adhippāyo.
analyzed: āha iminā adhippāyena ati cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe yeva sabbam rūpam uppajjati iti hi attanaḥ adhippāyaḥ
translated: He says “with this intention.” For his intention is that all materiality arises at the very moment of the consciousness’s arising.

original: “Rūpājanakakammaja”nti idaṃ bhūtakathanamattaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ pañcaviññāṇānaṃ ataṃsabhāvatābhāvā.
analyzed: rūpa ajanaka kamma janti idam bhūta kathana mattam daṭṭhabbam pañca viññāṇānam a taṃsa bhāva tā bhāvā
translated: “Kamma-born that generates materiality” should be regarded as a mere statement of the primary elements, since the five consciousnesses do not have a continuum.

original: Rūpājanakakammajanti vā cuticittaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Paṭisandhicittaṃ pana “pavattiya”nti
analyzed: rūpa ajanaka kamma janti vā cuti cittam sandhāya vuttam paṭisandhi cittam pana pavattiyanti
translated: Or alternatively, the statement can be taken as referring to the death consciousness. But the rebirth-linking consciousness is included by the words “in the course of an existence.”

original: imināva nivattitaṃ. “Sabbesampi cuticittaṃ rūpaṃ na samuṭṭhāpetī”ti aṭṭhasālinīṭīkāyaṃ
analyzed: iminā ava nivattitam sabbesam pi cuti cittam rūpam na samuṭṭhāpeti iti aṭṭhasālinīṭīkāyam
translated: The meaning stated in the Atthasālinī, namely, that “the death consciousness does not generate materiality,”

original: vuttovāyamattho. Pañcaviññāṇakkhaṇe tappaccayā rūpuppattiyā abhāvena vuttaṃ “pañcaviññāṇappavattikālaṃ
analyzed: vuttaḥ uva ayam attho pañca viññāṇa kkhaṇe tad paccayāḥ rūpa uppattiyāḥ abhāvena vuttam pañca viññāṇa ppavatti kālam
translated: is included by the words “in the course of an existence.” For the five consciousnesses do not generate materiality because there is no arising of materiality due to that as condition in the moment of the five consciousnesses.

original: sandhāyā”ti. Tatthāpi asahajātaviññāṇapaccayā attheva rūpuppattīti āha “sahajātaviññāṇapaccayañcā”ti.
analyzed: sandhāya āti tattha api asahajāta viññāṇa paccayā atthā iva rūpa uppatti iti āha sahajāta viññāṇa paccayam ca ati
translated: Therefore it is said, “in the course of an existence,” and also “due to conascent consciousness” because there is arising of materiality due to conascent consciousness as condition there too.

original: Bhavaṅgādīti bhavaṅgasampaṭicchanasantīraṇatadārammaṇāni. Aññenāti yathāvuttakammaviññāṇato
analyzed: bhavaṅga ādi iti bhavaṅga sampaṭicchana santīraṇa tad ārammaṇāni aññena āti yathā vutta kamma viññāṇato
translated: “Bhavaṅgādayo” : bhavaṅga, receiving, investigating, and registration. “By another” : by kamma-consciousness as described.

original: aññena abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇena. Rūpameva hi kusalākusalakiriyacittappavattikkhaṇe abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇapaccayā🔽uppajjati, na nāmaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ. Taṃjanakenāti bhavaṅgādijanakena. Kammaviññāṇappaccayā
analyzed: aññena abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇena rūpam eva hi kusala akusala kiriya citta ppavatti kkhaṇe abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇa paccayā  uppajjati na nāmam bhavaṅgam tad janakena ati bhavaṅga ādi janakena kamma viññāṇa ppaccayā
translated: by another kind of kamma-born consciousness. For materiality only arises with the life-continuum consciousness as its condition at the moment of the occurrence of profitable, unprofitable, and functional consciousness, not mentality. ‘By that which generates it’: by that which generates the life-continuum, etc. ‘With kamma-born consciousness as condition’

original: vipākacittappavattikāle vipākanāmassa kammasamuṭṭhānarūpassa ca vasena. Sahajātaviññāṇapaccayā🔽pana itaracittappavattikālepi vipāko vipākanāmavasena, cittasamuṭṭhānarūpavasena
analyzed: vipāka citta pavatti kāle vipāka nāmassa kamma samuṭṭhāna rūpassa ca vasena sahajāta viññāṇa paccayā  pana itara citta ppavatti kāle pi vipākaḥ vipāka nāma vasena citta samuṭṭhāna rūpa vasena
translated: at the time of the occurrence of resultant consciousness, by means of the materiality that is generated by kamma and called ‘mentality.’ ‘With consciousness as its condition’

original: ca nāmarūpassa sambhavo dassetabboti āha “sahajāta…pe… yojetabba”nti. Rūpasaddena🔽ca attano ekadesenāti sambandho. “Sarūpānaṃ ekadeso ekavibhattiya”nti (pāṇinī 1.2.64)
analyzed: ca nāma rūpassa sambhavaḥ dassetabbo ti āha yojetabbanti rūpa saddena  ca eka desena ati sambandhaḥ sarūpānam eka desaḥ
translated: but at the time of the occurrence of other kinds of consciousness, the arising of mentality and materiality should be demonstrated by means of the resultant and by means of the materiality generated by consciousness and called ‘mentality.’ That is why it is said: ‘With consciousness as condition … should be construed in the same way.’🔽And the construction is: ‘with materiality as its condition, with materiality as one part’🔽. The word ‘materiality’ is used in the definition of ‘one part’ in the sense of ‘one case’ ,

original: saddalakkhaṇaṃ sandhāyāha “sarūpānaṃ ekadeso”ti. Icchito hi ekadesarūpānampi ekadeso
analyzed: sadda lakkhaṇam sandhāya āha ekadesaḥ iti icchitaḥ hi ekadesa rūpānam pi ekadesaḥ
translated: according to the rule ‘sarūpāṇām ekadeśo ekavibhaktiḥ’ . But the ‘one part’ is intended as one part of materiality.

original: yathā “nidassitavipakkhehī”ti. Nidassito ca nidassitavipakkho ca nidassitavipakkhoti
analyzed: yathā nidassita vipakkhehi iti nidassitaḥ ca nidassita vipakkhaḥ ca nidassita vipakkhaḥ
translated: as in the expression “nidassitavipakkhehi.” And nidassito and nidassitavipakkho are nidassitavipakkho.

original: ayañhettha attho. “Ṭhāna”nti iminā sesasaddassa atthaṃ vadati. Sarūpena ṭhapanañhi idha sesanaṃ.
analyzed: ayam ha ittha atthaḥ ṭhānam ti iminā sesa saddassa attham vadati sarūpena ṭhapanam hi idha sesanam
translated: This is the meaning here. By “place” he shows the meaning of the word “remainder.” For the placing by similarity is the “reminding” here.

original: Yaṃ-taṃ-saddānaṃ abyabhicāritasambandhattā avuttampi tato-saddaṃ ānetvā āha “tato🔽yuttameva idanti yojetabba”nti. Vipākassa ajanakaṃ vipākājanakaṃ, nissandaphalamattadāyakakammaṃ,
analyzed: abyabhicārita sambandha ttā a vuttam pi tatas saddam ānetvā āha tatas  yuttam eva idam ti yojetabbanti vipākassa ajanakam vipāka ajanakam nissanda phala matta dāyaka kammaṃ
translated: Because of the invariable connection between the words yam tam and tato, he brings in the word tato, although it is not actually stated, and says, “It should be construed thus: ‘From that,🔽what is suitable here is to be construed.’ ” An action that is not a producer of kamma-result is an action that produces no kamma-result. It is an action that gives only the fruit of kamma-result.

original: taṃ samuṭṭhānaṃ etassāti vipākājanakakammasamuṭṭhānaṃ. Vuttanayenāti “vatthukāyavasena
analyzed: tam samuṭṭhānam etassa ati vipāka ajanaka kamma samuṭṭhānam vutta nayena ati vatthu kāya vasena
translated: That is the source of this, thus it is of the nature of an action that produces no kamma-result.🔽By the method stated thus: “In the case of the material septad, there are two septa of consciousness and mental factors, and three immaterial septa” .

original: rūpato dve santatisīsāni, tayo ca arūpino khandhā”tiādinā vuttena nayena. Ubhayanti nāmaṃ rūpañca.
analyzed: rūpataḥ dve santati sīsāni tayo ca arūpino khandhā ti ādinā vuttena nayena ubhayanti nāmam rūpam ca
translated: Both: that is, mentality and materiality.

original: Kammārammaṇapaṭisandhiādikāleti ettha ādi-saddena sammasanādikālasaṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Tanti abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ.
analyzed: kamma ārammaṇa paṭisandhi ādi kāla iti ettha ādi saddena sammasana ādi kāla saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo tanti abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇam
translated: By the time of rebirth-linking, etc., etc.: the word “etc.” should be understood to include the time of adverting, and so on. That: the consciousness that is the result of past action.

original: Yadipi “atthi rūpaṃ cittasamuṭṭhāna”ntiādivacanato rūpassapi viññāṇapaccayatā suttato🔽jānitabbā, viññāṇasannissitā iṭṭhānubhavanādayo tasmiṃ sati sabbhāvato, asati ca
analyzed: yadi pi atthi rūpam citta samuṭṭhāna nti ādi vacanato rūpassa api viññāṇa paccaya tā suttato  jānitabbāḥ viññāṇa sannissitāḥ iṭṭha anubhavana ādayaḥ tasmin sati sabbhāvataḥ asati ca
translated: Although the fact that materiality is a condition for consciousness can be known from the sutta statement, “There is materiality originated by consciousness” ,

original: abhāvato yathā saddheyyādivatthumhi saddhādayoti nāmassapi yuttito viññāṇapaccayatā
analyzed: abhāvataḥ yathā saddheyya ādi vatthumhi saddhā ādayaḥ ti nāmassa api yuttitaḥ viññāṇa paccaya tā
translated: nevertheless the fact that mentality is a condition for consciousness is established by the method of agreement and difference, since the states of experiencing what is desirable, etc., are dependent on consciousness, and when there is consciousness there is the state of being in its true nature, and when there is not, there is not,🔽like faith, etc., in a trustworthy person, etc.

original: siddhā, aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana vuttamatthaṃ dassento “suttato nāmaṃ…pe… jānitabba”nti🔽āha. Yāvadeva paccayapaccayuppannadhammamattatāvibhāvanamukhena aviparītato pavattinivattisandassanaṃ🔽paṭiccasamuppādadesanā, tāvadeva ca dhammacakkappavattananti dassento “yasmā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: siddhā aṭṭhakathā ayam pana vutta mattham dassento suttataḥ jānitabbanti  āha yāvat eva paccaya paccaya uppanna dhamma matta tā vibhāvana mukhena aviparītataḥ pavatti nivatti sandassanam  paṭicca samuppāda desanā tāvat eva ca dhamma cakka ppavattananti dassentaḥ yasmā iti ādim āha
translated: But the intention of the commentary is to show that the fact that mentality is a condition for consciousness can be known from the sutta, and so it says, “The fact that mentality is a condition for consciousness can be known from the sutta. ”🔽The teaching of dependent origination is the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dhamma, since it shows the occurrence and cessation of states by way of the mere condition and the mere conditionally arisen states without distortion.

original: Yasmā pana pavattinivattivibhāvanato saccadesanāva paccayākāradesanā, saccadesanā
analyzed: yasmā pana pavatti nivatti vibhāvanato sacca desanā ava paccaya ākāra desanā sacca desanā
translated: The Exalted One said, “Because” in order to show that the teaching of the conditions is the teaching of the truths, since it is the teaching of the truths by way of the teaching of the conditions, and that the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dhamma is the teaching of the truths.

original: ca dhammacakkappavattanaṃ. Yathāha “idaṃ dukkhanti me bhikkhave…pe… bārāṇasiyaṃ isipatane
analyzed: ca dhamma cakka ppavattanam yathā āha idam dukkhan ti me bhikkha vepe bārāṇasiyam isipatane
translated: For it is said, “Bhikkhus, when I was staying at Bārāṇasī in the Deer Park at Isipatana, I set in motion the wheel of the Dhamma,

original: migadāye anuttaraṃ dhammacakkaṃ pavattita”ntiādi, tasmā “viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpa”nti
analyzed: anuttaram dhammacakkam tasmā viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpanti
translated: “In the Deer Park at Isipatana near Benares I set rolling the wheel of the Dhamma that is thrice-revolved and twelve-fold with reference to the four noble truths.”🔽So it is said in order to show that the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dhamma is indicated by the exposition of the four truths in the phrase “With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality”

original: padassa saccadesanābhāvadīpanena dhammacakkappavattanabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “nāmarūpamattatāvacaneneva vā”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Nāmarūpapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: padassa sacca desanā bhāva dīpanena dhamma cakka ppavattana bhāvam dassetum nāma rūpa matta tā vacanena iva vā ti ādi vuttam  nāma rūpa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: or by the mere statement of the bare fact of mentality-materiality.

original: Saḷāyatanapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section of the exposition of the words “consciousness” and “mentality-materiality” is ended.

original: 229. Yathāsambhavanti sambhavānurūpaṃ. Tena catunnaṃ tāva bhūtānaṃ sahajātanissayaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: yathā sambhavanti sambhava anurūpam tena catunnam tāva bhūtānam sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata vasena
translated: As to how it occurs: in accordance with the way in which it occurs. In other words, firstly, as conascence, support, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, the five beginning with the eye base are conditions for the four primary elements.🔽But as conascence, support, mutuality, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, the sixth base, the heart-basis, is a condition for the materiality of the physical heart- basis in rebirth-linking.

original: cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ paccayabhāvo, vatthūsu pana hadayavatthuno chaṭṭhāyatanassa
analyzed: cakkha āyatana ādīnam pañcannam paccaya bhāvaḥ vatthūsu pana hadaya vatthuno chaṭṭha āyatanassa
translated: In the course of an existence, the heart-basis is a condition for the five beginning with the eye base

original: paṭisandhiyaṃ sahajātanissayaaññamaññavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena, pavattiyaṃ yasmā🔽anantaracittena saddhiṃ uppannameva vatthu ṭhitippattiyā balavabhāvena tassa nissayo
analyzed: paṭisandhiyam sahajāta nissaya aññamañña vippayutta atthi avigata vasena pavattiyam yasmā 🔽anantaracittena saddhim uppannam eva vatthu ṭhiti pattiyā balava bhāvena tassa nissayo
translated: as support condition, since it is the support for the materiality that occurs in the course of an existence.

original: bhavituṃ sakkoti, na sahajātaṃ, tasmā purejātanissayavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena.
analyzed: bhavitum sakkoti na sahajātam tasmā purejāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigata vasena
translated: it is not a conascence, and so it is stated in the way beginning, “pre-nascent, as object, support, dissociation, presence, absence.”

original: Itaravatthūnaṃ pañcaviññāṇasaṅkhātassa chaṭṭhāyatanassa indriyapaccayavasena ca,
analyzed: itara vatthūnam pañca viññāṇa saṅkhātassa chaṭṭha āyatanassa indriya paccaya vasena ca
translated: The other bases’ is the five-door consciousness, and the sixth base called the mind base, by way of the condition being stated as faculty condition.🔽And the life faculty’s is by way of the condition being stated as presence and absence.

original: jīvitassa indriyaatthiavigatavasena paccayabhāvo vuttoti daṭṭhabbo. Ekappakārenevāti
analyzed: jīvitassa indriya atthi avigata vasena paccaya bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbaḥ eka ppakārena eva āti
translated: By a single means:

original: yathā cakkhādīnaṃ manāyatanassa paṭiniyatadassanādikiccānuvidhānato niyato ekappakāreneva
analyzed: yathā cakkha ādīnam manāyatanassa paṭiniyata dassana ādi kicca anuvidhānataḥ niyataḥ eka ppakārena iva
translated: just as the eye base, etc., have a fixed condition as a condition by a single means, in accordance with their respective functions of seeing, etc.,

original: paccayabhāvo, na evaṃ rūpāyatanādīnaṃ, tesaṃ pana rūpārammaṇādinā pakārantarena tassa🔽paccayabhāvoti “aniyamato”ti vuttaṃ. Keci pana “niyamato”ti padaṃ “sasantatipariyāpanna”nti
analyzed: paccaya bhāvaḥ na evam rūpa āyatana ādīnam tesam pana rūpa ārammaṇa ādinā pakāra antarena tassa  paccaya bhāvaḥ ti aniyamato ti vuttam keci pana niyamato ti padam sa santati pariyāpannanti
translated: so the visible-data base, etc., do not have a fixed condition as a condition, but their condition as a condition is by a different means, by way of object.🔽That is why it is said, “Unfixed.”

original: iminā sambandhitvā atthaṃ vadanti “ekantena sasantatipariyāpanna”nti.
analyzed: iminā sambandhitvā attham vadanti ekantena sa santati pariyāpannanti
translated: But some explain the words “niyamato” as “ekantena” , and they construe it with the words “sasantatipariyāpanna” , taking it to mean “entirely included in one’s own continuity.”

original: “Chaṭṭhāyatanañca manāyatanañca chaṭṭhāyatana”nti iminā viggahena atthato, itarehi
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatanam ca manāyatanam ca chaṭṭha āyatanam ti iminā viggahena atthataḥ itarehi
translated: “The sixth base and the mind base are the sixth base” : the meaning is that they are so in the sense of being the same thing.

original: dvīhi saddatopi atthatopi sarūpataṃ dasseti. “Cakkhādīhi saha ‘saḷāyatana’nti vutta”nti
analyzed: dvīhi saddataḥ api atthataḥ api sarūpatam dasseti cakkha ādīhi saha saḷāyatanam ti vuttan ti
translated: and by the two words “with” and “in” he shows the state of being of the same essence. “With the eye, etc., it is said ‘the sixfold base.’ ”🔽🔽

original: vuttanayena ekasesaṃ katvā manāyatanaṃ cakkhādīhi saddhiṃ “saḷāyatana”nti pāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: vutta nayena ekasesam katvā mana āyatanam cakkha ādīhi saddhim saḷāyatanam ti pāḷiyam
translated: and by the two words “with” and “as” he shows the identity of the meaning. “The mind base is called ‘sixfold base’ with the eye, etc., in the way stated thus: ‘With the eye, etc., the sixfold base is stated’ .🔽In the text it is stated thus: ‘With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base’ .

original: vuttaṃ “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”nti. Yathāvuttoti “chaṭṭhāyatanañca manāyatanañcā”tiādinā
analyzed: vuttam nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatananti yathā vuttaḥ ti chaṭṭha āyatanam ca manāyatanam ca atiādinā
translated: ‘As stated’ : in the way stated thus: ‘The sixth base and the mind base’ .

original: attanā vuttappakāro. Sabbatthāti nāmarūpasaddena saḷāyatanasaddena ca saddasarūpatāsu,
analyzed: attanā vutta ppakāraḥ sabbattha ati nāma rūpa saddena saḷāyatana saddena ca sadda sarūpa tāsu
translated: ‘Everywhere’ : in the cases of identity of meaning and identity of expression by the words ‘mentality-materiality’ and ‘sixfold base’ ,🔽or in the cases of identity of meaning and identity of expression by the words ‘sixfold base’ and ‘mentality-materiality.’

original: atthasarūpatāsu vā. Yadi suttantabhājanīye vipākachaṭṭhāyatanameva adhippetaṃ, atha
analyzed: attha sarūpa tāsu vā yadi suttanta bhājanīye vipāka chaṭṭha āyatanam eva adhippetam atha
translated: If only the resultant sixth base is intended here in the sutta passage,

original: kasmā “itaraṃ panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Avipākañhi tattha itaranti adhippetanti codanaṃ
analyzed: kasmai itaram pana atiādi vuttam avipākam hi tattha itaranti adhippetanti codanam
translated: why is it said, ‘The other, etc.’? For the non-resultant is intended there as ‘the other.’

original: sandhāyāha “paccayanaye panā”tiādi.
analyzed: sandhāya āha paccaya naye pana atiādi
translated: With reference to this objection he says, ‘But in the method of condition, etc.’ .

original: Sahajātādīsu hetuāhārindriyapaccaye pakkhipitvā dasadhā, tato ekaṃ apanetvā navadhā,
analyzed: sahajāta ādīsu hetu āhāra indriya paccaye pakkhipitvā dasadhā tatas ekam apanetvā navadhā
translated: It is included in the ten kinds of condition, namely, as root-cause, condition by way of decisive support, prenascence, postnascence, and so on, and in the nine kinds of condition, namely, as the above except the decisive-support condition.

original: tato ekaṃ apanetvā aṭṭhadhā paccayabhāvo veditabbo. Evamettha sādhāraṇavasena avakaṃso,
analyzed: tatas ekam apanetvā aṭṭhadhā paccaya bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ evam ettha sādhāraṇa vasena avakaṃso
translated: Thus the brief treatment is by way of the common characteristics,

original: hetuādiasādhāraṇavasena ukkaṃsoti jhānādīnampi vasena veditabbo.
analyzed: hetu ādi asādhāraṇa vasena ukkaṃsaḥ iti jhāna ādīnam pi vasena veditabbo
translated: and the detailed treatment is by way of the special characteristics of the jhānas, etc.

original: Paṭisandhiyaṃ arūpadhammā kammajarūpassa uppādakkhaṇe paccayā hontīti “pavatte”ti viseseti. “Pacchājātavippayuttādayo evā”ti niyamena sahajātapurejātavippayuttādayo nivatteti.
analyzed: paṭisandhiyam arūpa dhammā kamma ja rūpassa uppāda kkhaṇe paccayāḥ honti iti pavatteti viseseti pacchājāta vippayutta ādayaḥ eva ati niyamena sahajāta purejāta vippayutta ādayaḥ nivatteti
translated: The immaterial states in rebirth-linking are conditions for the materiality originated by kamma at the moment of arising, thus he specifies “in the course of an existence.” “Only post-nascence, pre-arising, dissociation, etc.,” he says in order to exclude the conascence, prior, and dissociation conditions, etc.,

original: “Avasesamanāyatanassā”ti avasesaggahaṇampi pakaraṇato visiṭṭhavisayamevāti dassetuṃ
analyzed: avasesam anāyatanassa ti avasesa ggahaṇam pi pakaraṇataḥ visiṭṭha visayam eva ti dassetuṃ
translated: and the “and the rest” in “the rest of the bases” in order to show that it refers to a particular subject.🔽He says “in the five aggregates as aggregates” in order to show that the “rest” is not a mere residue,

original: “pañcakkhandhabhave”tiādimāha, yato aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “vatthurūpa”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Yathāsambhavaṃ
analyzed: pañca kkhandha bhava iti ādim āha yatas aṭṭhakathā ayam vatthu rūpam tiādi vuttam yathāsambhavam
translated: since in the commentary the “rest” is said to be “materiality that is the physical basis” .

original: yojetabboti nāmarūpassa paṭisandhiyaṃ sahajātaaññamaññanissayaatthiavigatādipaccayabhāvo
analyzed: yojetabbaḥ ti nāma rūpassa paṭisandhiyam sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata ādi paccaya bhāvo
translated: The conascence, etc., conditions for mentality-materiality in rebirth-linking should be understood as appropriate.

original: sahajātādisādhāraṇapaccayabhāvo, sampayuttavipākahetuāhārindriyādipaccayabhāvo sampayuttādiasādhāraṇapaccayabhāvo
analyzed: sahajāta ādi sādhāraṇa paccaya bhāvo sampayutta vipāka hetu āhāra indriya ādi paccaya bhāvo sampayutta ādi asādhāraṇa paccaya bhāvo
translated: The state of being a condition by way of the associated condition, the condition by way of the condition being a conascent condition, etc., the state of being a condition by way of the condition being a conascent condition, the condition being a conascence condition, the condition being a mutuality condition, the condition being a support condition, the condition being a foundation condition, the condition being a object-of-consciousness condition, the condition being a prenascence condition, the condition being a postnascence condition, the condition being a nutriment condition, the condition being a faculty condition, the condition being a absorption condition, the condition being a path condition, the condition being a association condition, the condition being a dissociation condition, the condition being a presence condition, the condition being a absence condition, the condition being a disappearance condition, the condition being a non-disappearance condition, the state of being a condition by way of the condition being a conascence condition, the condition being a kamma condition, the condition being a result condition, the condition being a nutriment condition, the condition being a faculty condition, etc., the state of being a condition by way of the condition being an association condition, etc.

original: nāmassa, rūpassa pana vippayuttapaccayabhāvo yojetabbo.
analyzed: nāmassa rūpassa pana vippayutta paccaya bhāvaḥ yojetabbaḥ
translated: The state of being a condition by way of the condition being a dissociation condition should be applied to materiality.

original: Saḷāyatanapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the section of the base of the sixfold base is finished.

original: Phassapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section of contact

original: 230. Tadabhedavasenāti tassa phassassa abhedavasena, phassabhāvasāmaññenāti attho.
analyzed: tad abheda vasena āti tassa phassassa abheda vasena phassa bhāva sāmaññena ati attho
translated: By way of its non-differentiation: by way of its non-differentiation, by way of the commonality of the state of being contact.🔽It is not proper to speak of one alone. Of another also: of another also, apart from the one mentioned. For from all the bases

original: Na yuttaṃ ekasseva vacanaṃ. Aññassāpīti yathāvuttato aññassāpi. Sabbāyatanato hi🔽ekassa phassassa asambhavacodanāyaṃ tappasaṅgena ekāyatanato anekassāpi sambhavo
analyzed: na yuttam ekassa iva vacanam aññassa api iti yathā vuttataḥ aññassa api sabba āyatanataḥ hi  ekassa phassassa asambhava codanā ayam tad pasaṅgena eka āyatanataḥ anekassa api sambhavaḥ
translated: there is no arising of a single contact. In the objection, by the word “also” he shows that there is no arising of many contacts from a single base.

original: natthīti codanā “īdisī dhammatā natthī”ti ñāpanatthāti dasseti “aññassāpī”tiādinā.
analyzed: natthi iti codanā īdisī dhamma tā natthi iti ñāpana tthā ati dasseti aññassa api itiādinā
translated: “There is no such rule” is the answer. “Of another also” and so on shows that the answer is given in order to make known that “there is no such rule.”

original: Nidassanavasenāti udāharaṇadassanavasena. Ekaphassassa sambhavatoti kāraṇāpadeso.
analyzed: nidassana vasena ati udāharaṇa dassana vasena eka phassassa sambhavato ti kāraṇa apadesaḥ
translated: By way of illustration: by way of the showing of an example. Because of the arising of a single contact: this is the statement of the reason.

original: Ekaphassasambhavassa labbhamānattā “saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti bhagavatā vuttanti
analyzed: eka phassa sambhavassa labbhamāna ttā saḷāyatana paccayā phasso ti bhagavatā vuttanti
translated: because it is possible to take it as a single condition, it is said by the Blessed One: ‘With the sixfold base as condition, contact’ .

original: parihāraṃ dassentoti yojanā. Sesesūti ekantiādīsu. Navadhā paccayatte ekaṃ vipākamanāyatanaṃ
analyzed: parihāram dassento ti yojanā sesesu uti eka nti ādīsu navadhā paccayatte ekam vipākam anāyatanam
translated: The construction is: ‘showing the answer’. In the rest, in the case of ‘one’ and the rest, he should elaborate the single resultant base as a condition in nine ways.

original: vibhāvaye. Tathā cāti ārammaṇapurejātaatthiavigatavasena. Yvāyaṃ paccayabhāvo yādisānaṃ
analyzed: vibhāvaye tathā ca ati ārammaṇa purejāta atthi avigata vasena yvā ayam paccaya bhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way: as object, as prenascence, as dissociation, and as absence.🔽In order to show what kind of condition it is, he said: ‘With reference to the present, etc.’.

original: hoti, taṃ dassetuṃ “paccuppannāni…pe… sandhāya vutta”nti āha. Atītānāgatakālavimuttānampi
analyzed: hoti tam dassetum paccuppanna ānipe sandhāya vuttan ti āha atīta anāgata kāla vimuttānam pi
translated: Although they are free from past and future times,🔽he said: ‘With reference to the object, etc.’, because they are possible as mere objects.

original: ārammaṇamattatāya sambhavato āha “ārammaṇa…pe… sandhāya vutta”nti. Tattha tanti rūpāyatanādiṃ.
analyzed: ārammaṇa matta tāya sambhavataḥ āha sandhāya vuttanti tattha tanti rūpa āyatana ādiṃ
translated: Herein, ‘that’ is the base consisting of visible data, etc.

original: Phassapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: phassa pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the explanation of the words of the clause on contact is ended.

original: Vedanāpadaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽231. Anantarādīhīti anantarasamanantarūpanissayanatthivigatapaccayehi. Upanissayeti
analyzed: vedanā pada niddesa vaṇṇanā  anantara ādīhi iti anantara samanantara ūpa nissaya natthi vigata paccayehi upanissaye ti
translated: In the case of the clause on feeling🔽In the case of the rest, etc.: in the case of the rest, namely, the proximity condition, the contiguity condition, the support condition, the decisive-support condition, the presence condition, and the absence condition.

original: anantarūpanissaye. Anantarasamanantarapaccayā hi anantaratāvaseneva anantarūpanissaye
analyzed: anantara ūpa nissaye anantara samanantara paccayā hi anantara tā vasena iva ananta rūpa nissaye
translated: In the support condition: in the proximity-support condition.🔽For the proximity condition and the contiguity condition are the proximity-support condition in the sense of mere proximity.

original: antogadhā. Natthivigatapaccayā pana anantarasamanantarapaccayadhammānaṃyeva tathābhāvato
analyzed: antogadhā natthi vigata paccayā pana anantara samanantara paccaya dhammānaṃ yeva tathābhāvato
translated: and they are included there. But the non-existent and the past conditions are included there too because they are of the same nature as the conditions of immediate and proximate sequence.

original: tadantogadhā. Tassāti upanissayassa.
analyzed: tad anta gadhā tassa ati upanissayassa
translated: ‘That’ is the decisive-support condition.

original: Sabbassāti vipākassa, avipākassa ca. Paṭisandhibhavaṅgacuticittasampayuttāya hi vedanāya
analyzed: sabbassa ati vipākassa avipākassa ca paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti citta sampayuttāya hi vedanāya
translated: ‘All’ is resultant and non-resultant. For the feeling associated with the rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death consciousnesses

original: sahajātamanosamphasso vuttanayena aṭṭhadhā paccayo hoti. Anantaro anantarādinā, anānantaro
analyzed: sahajāta manaḥ samphassaḥ vutta nayena aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ hoti anantaraḥ anantara ādinā anānantaraḥ
translated: is a condition in eight ways, as conascence, etc., for the conascent mind-element and mind-consciousness-element. It is a condition in the way already stated as object, predominance, and support,

original: upanissayavaseneva paccayo hoti. Sambhavadassanañcetaṃ, na tāsaṃ manodvārikabhāvadassananti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: upanissaya vasena iva paccayaḥ hoti sambhava dassanam ca itam na tāsam manodvārika bhāva dassanan ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and it is a condition as decisive-support only, not as proximity, proximity-decisive-support, or post-nascence. But this is said only by way of possibility; for it should be understood that the post-nascence condition is not mentioned because they are not states of the mind door.

original: Vedanāpadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vedanā pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the clause on feeling is ended.

original: Taṇhāpadaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: taṇhā pada niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the clause on craving

original: 232. Yathā ca rasāyanajāni ojājīvitāni, evaṃ taṃnimittaṃ sukhaṃ, tadapaneyyaṃ jarādidukkhañca dhammārammaṇabhāvena yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: yathā ca rasāyana jāni ojā jīvitāni evam tad nimittam sukham tad apaneyyam jarā ādi dukkham ca dhamma ārammaṇa bhāvena yojetabbam
translated: Just as the saps, the juices, and the life-essence are to be construed as the pleasure that has that as its object and the ageing, etc., that are to be abandoned by that, so too the kamma-process should be construed as the pleasure that has that as its object and the ageing, etc., that are to be abandoned by that.

original: Kammaphalābhipatthanāvasena sattā kammānipi āyūhantīti sātisayaṃ taṇhāya vipākavedanā
analyzed: kamma phala abhipatthanā vasena sattā kammāni api āyūhanti iti sa atisayam taṇhāya vipāka vedanā
translated: For beings accumulate kamma by craving for the result of kamma.

original: upanissayo, na tathā itarāti āha “vipākā visesena…pe… avisesena itarā cā”ti. Itarāti🔽avipākāti attho. “Sukhamicceva bhāsitā”ti idaṃ iṭṭhasabhāvaṃyeva upekkhaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: upanissayaḥ na tathā itarā iti āha vipākā avisesena itarā ca ati itarā iti  avipākā ti attho sukham icca iva bhāsitā ati idam iṭṭha sabhāvam yā iva upekkham sandhāya
translated: and the other is not so. That is why he said: “The resultant is distinguished by the distinction of the other, and the other is not distinguished by the distinction of the resultant.” The other is not distinguished by the distinction of the resultant: the meaning is that it is not resultant. The word “only” in the words “pleasure only” is stated with reference to the kind of equanimity that is a desirable state.

original: vuttaṃ, na aniṭṭhasabhāvaṃ. Tenāha “upekkhā panā”tiādi. Sabbassāti avītarāgassa vītarāgassa🔽ca vedanāvato puggalassa.
analyzed: vuttam na aniṭṭha sabhāvam tena āha upekkhā pana atiādi sabbassa ati avīta rāgassa vīta rāgassa  ca vedanāvato puggalassa
translated: and the other is not so. That is why he said, “The resultant is distinguished by the distinction in the kamma that generates it, and the other is not so distinguished.” The other is the non-resultant. “Pleasure is spoken of only” is said with reference to the kind of equanimity that has a desirable nature, not with reference to the kind that has an undesirable nature. That is why he said, “But equanimity” and so on. “Of all” means of the person who has feeling whether he be one not yet free from lust or one who is free from lust.

original: Vedanāpaccayā evāti ayaṃ niyamo niyamantaranivattanaparoti nāssa paccayantaranivattanatthatā daṭṭhabbā. Etena paccayuppannantarapaṭikkhepopi nivattito hoti.
analyzed: vedanā paccayāḥ evā ti ayam niyamaḥ niyama antara nivattana paraḥ ti na assa paccaya antara nivattana tā daṭṭhabbā etena paccaya uppanna ntara paṭikkhepaḥ api nivattitaḥ hoti
translated: “With feeling as condition” is a restriction, and its purpose is to exclude other conditions. It should not be taken to exclude other conditions. And by this the exclusion of what is immediately prior to the condition is also excluded.

original: Taṇhāpadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: taṇhā pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of craving as a footing for the manifestation of suffering is ended.

original: Upādānapadaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽233. Purimadiṭṭhinti “sassato attā”ti pageva abhiniviṭṭhaṃ sassatagāhaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: upādāna pada niddesa vaṇṇanā  purima diṭṭhin ti sassataḥ attā ati pagā iva abhiniviṭṭham sassata gāham sandhāya
translated: Description of Clinging as a Footing for the Manifestation of Suffering

original: vuttaṃ. Tenāha “attaggahaṇaṃ…pe… daṭṭhabba”nti. Upādiyamānanti gaṇhantaṃ. Lokoti
analyzed: vuttam tena āha atta ggahaṇam pe daṭṭhabbanti upādiyamānanti gaṇhantam lokoti
translated: “Previous view” is said with reference to the grasping of eternalism by one who is already obsessed with the view “The self is eternal.” That is why he said, “The apprehension of a self should be seen as the grasping of eternalism” and so on. “What is clung to” is what is grasped.

original: vā gahaṇanti yaṃ “loko sassato”ti gahaṇaṃ, sā diṭṭhīti attho. Tenāha “diṭṭhupādānabhūta”nti.
analyzed: vā gahaṇanti yam loko sassatoti gahaṇam sā diṭṭhī iti attho tena āha diṭṭha upādāna bhūtanti
translated: “Or grasping” is the grasping of the view that the world is eternal. The meaning is: that view. Therefore he said: “which is the grasping of views.”

original: “Dhammasaṅkhepa…pe… diṭṭhimattamevā”ti idaṃ byavahitānaṃ padānaṃ sambandhadassanaṃ.
analyzed: diṭṭhimattam eva ati idam byavahitānam padānam sambandha dassanam
translated: “The brief and detailed explanation of ideas … is mere view” is the showing of the connection between the interrupted terms.

original: Tattha saṅkhepato taṇhādaḷhattaṃ, saṅkhepato diṭṭhimattameva cattāri upādānānīti
analyzed: tattha saṅkhepato taṇhā daḷha ttam saṅkhepataḥ diṭṭhimattam eva cattāri upādānāni iti
translated: Herein, the intention is this: the brief explanation of craving and the brief explanation of mere view are the four kinds of grasping.

original: adhippāyo. Dhammasaṅkhepavitthāratoti samudāyabhūtato dhammasaṅkhepavitthārato tadavayavabhūtaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ dhamma saṅkhepa vitthārato ti samudāya bhūtataḥ dhamma saṅkhepa vitthārato tad avayava bhūtam
translated: “The brief and detailed explanation of ideas” : the brief and detailed explanation of the ideas that are the collection is the brief and detailed explanation of the ideas that are the parts of that collection.

original: saṅkhepaṃ vitthārañca niddhāreti.
analyzed: saṅkhepam vitthāram ca niddhāra iti
translated: “The grasping of self” is the interpretation.

original: Sassatagāhapubbaṅgamo, ucchedagāhapubbaṅgamo ca attagāhoti yojanā. Tesanti yathāvuttasassatucchedagāhānaṃ
analyzed: sassata gāha pubbaṅgamaḥ uccheda gāha pubbaṅgamaḥ ca attagāho ti yojanā tesan ti yathā vutta sassatu cheda gāhānam
translated: The grasping of self is the prior condition for the grasping of eternalism and the grasping of annihilationism. “These” are the eternalist and annihilationist graspings mentioned above.🔽He is “the owner” because he is the originator by being the root of those two.

original: mūlabhāvena vidhāyakattā sāmibhūto. Ādinā vāti “paṭhamaṃ attavādupādāna”ntiādinā vā vākyena.
analyzed: mūla bhāvena ādinā vāti vā vākyena
translated: “At the beginning” is by the sentence beginning “First, the grasping of self-view.”

original: Yena bhavassādena gadhitacitto bhavanibbattakaṃ kammaṃ katvā upapanno, sā bhavanikanti
analyzed: yena bhava ssādena gadhita cittaḥ bhava nibbattakam kammam katvā upapannaḥ sā bhava nikanti
translated: The “descent into becoming” is that by means of which, with his mind attracted by the expression “becoming,” he has made kamma that leads to rebirth and has been reborn.

original: santāne cirānubandhā abhiṇhuppattikā upapannamattassa uppajjatīti āha “yadipi…pe…
analyzed: santāne cira anubandhā abhiṇhuppattikā upapanna mattassa uppajjati iti āha yadipipe
translated: It arises in one who is reborn, since it occurs in a continuity that has long persisted and that arises frequently.🔽“Though it is not a condition for the arising of the aggregates, it is a condition for their occurrence.”

original: pavattitabbattā”ti. Arahattamaggavajjhattā bhavarāgassapi kāmupādānabhāvo atthevāti
analyzed: pavattitabba ttā ti arahatta magga vajjhattā bhava rāgassa api kāma upādāna bhāvaḥ attha iva ati
translated: Since the craving for existence is also a clinging to sense pleasures in the sense that it is abandoned by the path of arahantship,

original: āha “taṇhādaḷhattaṃ na hotīti maññamāno”ti. Bhavarāgopi hi savisaye daḷhaṃ pavattatīti.
analyzed: āha taṇhā daḷha ttam na hoti iti maññamānaḥ iti bhava rāgaḥ api hi sa visaye daḷham pavattati iti
translated: he says, “thinking that it is not strong in craving.” For craving for existence also occurs strongly in its own field.

original: Sabbāpi taṇhā kāmupādānanti etthāpi tassa arahattamaggavajjhatā vuttāti ānetvā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabbā api taṇhā kāma upādānanti ettha api tassa arahatta magga vajjha tā vuttā iti ānetvā yojetabbam
translated: “All craving is clinging to sense pleasures” should be construed in the same way as the above statement about craving for existence.

original: Uppattiṭṭhānabhūtā na ārammaṇabhūtāti adhippāyo. Tenāti khandhānaṃ ālayabhāvena.🔽Ārammaṇānantarapakatūpanissayāti ārammaṇūpanissayaanantarūpanissayapakatūpanissayā.
analyzed: uppatti ṭṭhāna bhūtā na ārammaṇa bhūtā ati adhippāyo tena ati khandhānam ālaya bhāvena  ārammaṇa anantara pakatu upanissayā ti ārammaṇa upanissaya anantara upanissaya pakatu upanissayā
translated: The intention is that the aggregates are the place of origin, not the object.

original: Anantarapaccayādīnanti anantarasamanantaraārammaṇapaccayādīnaṃ.
analyzed: anantara paccaya ādīnam ti anantara samanantara ārammaṇa paccaya ādīnam
translated: “Object condition, proximity condition, and decisive support condition” means object condition, proximity condition, and decisive support condition that is a prior condition.

original: Upādānapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: upādāna pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the term “clinging” is finished.

original: Bhavapadaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhava pada niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Exposition of the term “existence”

original: 234. “Bhavatī”ti idaṃ upapattibhavanibbacanaṃ. Dvayassāti kammupapattibhavadvayassa. Nipphādanaphalaṃ phalassa uppādanasamatthatā. Nibbattanaṃ nipphādanaṃ.🔽“Bhagavaṃmūlakā”ti viya “saññāvaṃbhavo”ti vattabbe atthi-atthe vā vaṃ-saddo luttaniddiṭṭhoti
analyzed: bhavati iti idam upapatti bhava nibbacanam dvayassa ati kamma upapatti bhava dvayassa nipphādana phalam phalassa uppādana samattha tā nibbattanam nipphādanam  bhagavaṃmūlakā ati viya saññā avaṃbhavo ti vattabbe atthi atthe vā vaṃsaddaḥ lutta niddiṭṭho ti
translated: “Becoming” is a designation for rebirth-process becoming. “Of the two” : of the two kinds of becoming, kamma-process becoming and rebirth-process becoming. “The fruit of producing” is the ability to produce the fruit. “Production” is producing.🔽“With the word ‘becoming’ … in the sense of ‘is’” : the word “becoming” should be explained as “is-becoming” in the sense of “is” .

original: āha “saññābhavo”ti. Tassa vā attheti tassa vantusaddassa atthe, atthi-attheti attho.
analyzed: āha saññā bhavo ti tassa vā atthe iti tassa vantu saddassa atthe atthi atthe iti attho
translated: “In the sense of that” : in the sense of that word “is” . The meaning is: in the sense of “is” .

original: Akāraṃ katvāti yathā “pītisukhaṃ assa atthī”ti atthe akāraṃ katvā uppādetvā jhānaṃ
analyzed: akāram katvā iti yathā pīti sukham assa atthi iti atthe akāram katvā uppādetvā jhānam
translated: “With the letter a” : just as the jhāna is called “accompanied by bliss” when the letter a is prefixed to make the word “bliss” ,🔽and it is called “accompanied by happiness” when the letter a is prefixed to make the word “happiness” ,🔽so too, when the letter a is prefixed to make the word “becoming” , it is called “with the letter a” .

original: pītisukhanti vuccati, evaṃ saññā assa atthīti sañño, bhavo, sova saññabhavo. Ekasminti🔽rūpakkhandhe eva. Pavattattāti pavattakapavattanaṭṭhānānaṃ abhedepi upacāravasena
analyzed: pīti sukhanti vuccati evam saññā assa atthi iti sañño bhavo saḥ uva sañña bhavo ekasmin ti  rūpa kkhandhe eva pavatta ttā ti pavattaka pavattana ṭṭhānānam abhede pi upacāra vasena
translated: “In one” : in the materiality aggregate only.

original: bhinnaṃ viya katvā dasseti.
analyzed: bhinnam viya katvā dasseti
translated: “In the occurrence” : although there is no difference between the occurrence and that in which it occurs, he shows as if there were a difference by way of a conventional expression.

original: Kammasaṅkhātatanti “kamma”nti vattabbataṃ, kammakoṭṭhāsataṃ vā. “Cetanāhaṃ, bhikkhave,
analyzed: kamma saṅkhāta tam ti kammanti vattabba tam kamma koṭṭhāsa tam vā cetanā aham bhikkhave
translated: “The formation called kamma” is the hundredfold division of kamma that should be called “kamma.” “It is volition, bhikkhus,

original: kammaṃ vadāmī”tiādinā suttepi cetanāya kammabhāvo āgatova. Nippariyāyena pana cetanāva
analyzed: kammam vadāmi iti ādinā sutte pi cetanāya kamma bhāvaḥ āgataḥ uva nippariyāyena pana
translated: “As kamma-formation”: as what should be called “kamma” or as the hundred modes of kamma. And in the sutta too, in the passage, “Bhikkhus, I say that kamma is volition” , the state of being kamma belongs to volition. But in the ultimate sense,

original: kammabhavoti vuttamatthaṃ abhidhammapāḷiyāva sādhento “vuttañhī”tiādimāha. Imāya🔽hi vedanāsaññāviññāṇakkhandhehi, manāyatanamanoviññāṇadhātūhi, saṅkhārakkhandhadhammāyatanadhammadhātuekadesena🔽ca kammabhavassa sampayuttataṃ vadantiyā dhātukathāpāḷiyā tassa cetanābhāvo dīpitoti.
analyzed: kamma bhavaḥ ti vuttam attham abhidhamma pāḷiyā ava sādhentaḥ vuttam hi itiādim āha imāya  hi vedanā saññā viññāṇa kkhandhehi manā āyatana manaḥ viññāṇa dhātūhi saṅkhāra kkhandha dhammāyatana dhammadhātu ekadesena  ca kamma bhavassa sampayuttatam vadantiyā dhātu kathā pāḷiyā tassa cetanā bhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ ti
translated: volition alone is kamma-process. The meaning stated thus is established by the Abhidhamma text itself, which is given in the words, “For this is said” .🔽For in the text of the Dhammasangani, which shows that the kamma-process is associated with the aggregates of feeling, perception, and consciousness, with the mind base and mind-consciousness element, and with part of the formations aggregate, the mental-data base, and the mental-data element, volition is shown to be the kamma-process.

original: Dhammabhedatoti cetanācetanāsampayuttabhāvena, kusalākusalābyākatabhāvena ca dhammavibhāgato.
analyzed: dhamma bhedato ti cetanā acetanā sampayutta bhāvena kusala akusala abyākata bhāvena ca dhamma vibhāgato
translated: “By the analysis of states”: by the analysis of states into volition and what is associated with volition, and into profitable, unprofitable, and indeterminate.

original: “Punavacana”nti imināva punaruttidosāpatti paṭiññātāti parassa āsaṅkaṃ dassento “sātthakamevidaṃ
analyzed: punavacanam ti punarutti dosa āpatti paṭiññātā ti parassa āsaṅkam dassento sa atthakam eva idam
translated: “By the repetition” : by the repetition of the words “kamma-process, kamma-process.” By this he shows the other’s assumption that the fault of repetition of the words “kamma-process” is admitted.

original: punavacananti etaṃ na yuttanti ce”ti āha. Bhavekadesabhāvenāti kammabhavassa ekadesattā
analyzed: punavacanam iti etam na yuttam ti ca iti āha bhava ekadesa bhāvena ati kamma bhavassa eka desa ttā
translated: “If it be said that it is not proper to repeat it, ” he said. As a part of becoming: as a part of kamma-process becoming.

original: saṅkhārānaṃ. Tena yesaṃ dhammānaṃ samudāyo bhavo vutto, tadekadesā saṅkhārā, samudāyekadesā🔽ca atthato bhinnā evāti vuttamevetanti dasseti. Puna yathāvuttameva bhedaṃ manasi
analyzed: saṅkhārānam tena yesam dhammānam samudāyaḥ bhavaḥ vutto tad ekadesā saṅkhārā samudāya ekadesā  ca atthataḥ bhinnāḥ evā ati vuttam evā itan ti dasseti puna yathāvuttam eva bhedam manasi
translated: Thus he shows that the formations are a part of the states of which the totality is called becoming, and that they are different in meaning from the totality.

original: katvā atthato punavacanābhāvaṃ dassento “parena vā”tiādimāha.🔽Antogadheti kāmabhavādiantogadhe saññābhavādike. Kāmabhavādiketi kāmarūpārūpabhave.
analyzed: katvā atthataḥ punavacana abhāvam dassentaḥ parena vā iti ādim āha  antogadhā iti kāma bhava ādi antogadhe saññā bhava ādike kāma bhava ādikā iti kāmarūpa arūpa bhave
translated: Again, after adverting to the distinction already stated, he shows that there is no repetition of meaning by saying “Or else” .

original: Upādānabhedanti kāmupādānādiupādānavisesaṃ.
analyzed: upādāna bhedanti kāma upādāna ādi upādāna visesam
translated: Included: included in the end of sense-desire becoming, etc., namely, in the kinds of becoming with perception, and so on. Sense-desire becoming, etc.: sense-desire, fine-material, and immaterial kinds of becoming.🔽Distinction in clinging: distinction in the kinds of clinging, namely, sense-desire clinging, etc.🔽By that: by virtue-and-duty clinging.

original: Tenāti sīlabbatupādānena. Vakkhamānenāti “idaṃ sīlabbataṃ nāmā”tiādinā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: tena ati sīlabbata upādānena vakkhamānena ati idam sīlabbatam nāma ati ādinā aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: By the method stated: by the method stated in the commentary beginning, “This virtue and this duty are called … ” .

original: vakkhamānena pakārena. Purāṇaṃ brahmaṇḍaliṅgakhandapurāṇādi. “Setavadhayajjaṃ ārabhate
analyzed: pakārena purāṇam brahmaṇḍa liṅga khanda purāṇa ādi seta vadha yajjam ārabhate
translated: The ancient Brahmajāla Sutta, the Khandha Parāyana, and so on. The animal sacrifice beginning with the white-garmented one,

original: bhūtikāmo”tiādinā pasumāraṇavidhānayutto yaññavidhi pasubandhavidhi.
analyzed: bhūti kāmaḥ ti ādinā pasu māraṇa vidhāna yuttaḥ
translated: which is connected with the method of killing animals, namely, the method of sacrifice.

original: Attano suddhimaggaparāmāsamattattā sīlabbatupādānassa attavādupādānanimittaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: attanaḥ suddhi magga parāmāsa matta ttā sīla bbata upādānassa attavāda upādāna nimittam vuttam
translated: The clinging to rules and rituals is said to be the cause of the clinging to a doctrine of self because it is merely the path to the purification of one’s own self.

original: Maggapaccayā honti micchāniyyānasabhāvattā. Anantarassa pana kāmakammabhavassa anantarasamanantaraanantarūpanissayanatthivigatāsevanapaccayehi
analyzed: magga paccayāḥ honti micchā niyyāna sabhāvattā anantarassa pana kāma kamma bhavassa anantara samanantara ananta rūpa nissaya natthi vigata āsevana paccayehi
translated: They are conditions for the path because they are of the nature of wrong practice. But the conditions for the clinging that is the proximate cause of the sensual-desire realm existence are obvious by way of the proximity, contiguity, proximity-contiguity, root-cause, support, absence, disappearance, and repetition conditions.

original: upādānassa paccayabhāvo pākaṭoyevāti na vutto.
analyzed: upādānassa paccaya bhāvo pākaṭaḥ yeva ati na vutto
translated: Therefore they are not mentioned.

original: Bhavapadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhava pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section on the terms for the kinds of becoming is ended.

original: Jātijarāmaraṇādipadaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽235. Upapattibhavuppattīti upapattibhave, upapattibhavabhāvena vā upādinnakkhandhānaṃ
analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇa ādi pada niddesa vaṇṇanā  upapatti bhava uppattī iti upapatti bhave upapatti bhava bhāvena vā upādinna kkhandhānam
translated: The explanation of the section on the terms for birth, aging, and death, etc.

original: uppatti. Jāyamānassa khandhassa. Jāti nibbattivikāro. Upapattibhavopi jātiyā paccayo.
analyzed: uppatti jāyamānassa khandhassa jāti nibbatti vikāraḥ upapatti bhavaḥ api jātiyā paccayo
translated: The arising of the aggregates that have been acquired in the rebirth-process existence or the arising of the aggregates in the rebirth-process existence is birth. The arising of the aggregates is birth. The manifestation of the aggregates that are in the process of arising is aging. The passing away of the aggregates that are in the process of aging is death.

original: Kasmā? Upapattibhave asati jātiyā abhāvāti yojanā. “Jāyamānarūpapadaṭṭhānatā”tiādināpi🔽tassa jātiyā paccayabhāvaṃyeva vibhāveti.
analyzed: kasmai upapatti bhave asati jātiyāḥ abhāvā ati yojanā jāyamāna rūpa padaṭṭhāna tā ati ādinā api 🔽tassa jātiyā paccaya bhāvaṃya iva vibhāveti
translated: Why is the rebirth-process existence a condition for birth? Because if the rebirth-process existence did not exist, birth would not occur. The meaning should be construed in this way.🔽By the phrase “the state of being the physical basis for the aggregates that are in the process of arising” he explains only the condition for birth that is the rebirth-process existence.

original: Satipi sukkasoṇitādike pitugatavisesādikāraṇe bāhire paccaye tassa pana aniyatattā, hīnapaṇītādivisesassa ca adhippetattā vuttaṃ “ajjhatta…pe… abhāvā”ti.
analyzed: sati api sukka soṇita ādike bāhire paccaye tassa pana aniyata ttā hīna paṇīta ādi visesassa ca adhippeta ttā vuttam ajjhatta pe abhāvā ti
translated: Although there is an external condition such as the father’s special seed in the case of semen, blood, etc., still, because that is not invariable and because what is intended is the distinction of inferiority and superiority, it is said: “because of the absence of an external condition” .

original: Jātijarāmaraṇādipadaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇa ādi pada niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the terms birth, aging, and death, etc., is ended.

original: Bhavacakkakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Wheel of Becoming.

original: 242. Sambandhaṃ itaṃ gatanti samitaṃ. Tenāha “saṅgata”nti.
analyzed: sambandham itam samitam tena āha
translated: “Gone together” is “come together” . That is why it is said: “connected” .🔽“Desire for becoming” is lust for becoming .

original: Bhavacchando bhavarāgo. Tassāruppakathāsavananti tassa bālabhāvassa ayuttakāritāya
analyzed: bhava chandaḥ bhava rāgaḥ tassa āruppa kathā savanan ti tassa bāla bhāvassa ayutta kāri tāya
translated: “Hearing talk that is not conducive” to the state of a fool, to the state of one who acts unsuitably. By this he shows the suffering that has talk that is not conducive to the state of a fool as its cause.

original: anucchavikakathāsavanaṃ. Etena parūpavādahetukādidukkhaṃ dasseti, “kammakāraṇādassana”nti🔽iminā daṇḍahetukaṃ, itarena duggatinibbattihetukaṃ. Gamentīti ñāpenti. Phalenāpi
analyzed: anucchavika kathā savanam etena parūpavāda hetuka ādi dukkham dasseti kamma kāraṇa adassanam ti  iminā daṇḍa hetukam itarena duggati nibbatti hetukam gamenti iti ñāpenti phalena api
translated: By “not seeing the reason for kamma” he shows the suffering that has punishment as its cause. By the other phrase he shows the suffering that has rebirth in an unhappy destiny as its cause.

original: hi abyabhicārinā hetu ñāyati, vuṭṭhinimittena viya mahoghena uparidese vuṭṭhinipāto.
analyzed: hi abyabhicārinā hetu ñāyati vuṭṭhi nimittena viya mahā oghena upari dese vuṭṭhi nipāto
translated: “They make known” : by the result, too, the invariable reason is known, just as the downpour of rain above is known by the signs of the wind.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “bodhentī”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam bodhenti iti
translated: That is why it is said: “they inform” .

original: Visesanivattiattho mattasaddo “avitakkavicāramattā”tiādīsu viya. Appahīnāvijjā kāraṇalābhe
analyzed: visesa nivatti atthaḥ matta saddaḥ avitakka vicāra matta ati ādīsu viya appahīna avijjā kāraṇa lābhe
translated: The word “only” is used to show that the ignorance that is not abandoned is not a condition for the arising of the other two.🔽“He knows” means he feels.

original: uppattiarahatāya samīpeyevāti āha “sannihitabhāvakaraṇenā”ti. Vedetīti vedayati.
analyzed: uppatti arahatāya āha sannihita bhāva karaṇena ati veda iti iti vedayati
translated: He experiences the meaning of that.

original: Tassa atthavacanaṃ anubhavatīti. Vedaṃ vā ñāṇaṃ karoti uppādetīti vedeti. Tassa atthavacanaṃ🔽jānātīti. Vediyatīti pana kammakattukammānaṃ vasena niddesoti tassapi atthaṃ dassento🔽“jānāti, ñāyati cā”ti āha. Ca-saddatthoti samuccayattho, brahmādinā ca kārakena,
analyzed: tassa atthavacanam anubhavati iti vedam vā ñāṇam karoti uppādeti iti vedeti tassa atthavacanam  jānāti iti vediyati iti pana kamma kattu kammānam vasena niddesaḥ ti tassa api attham dassento  jānāti ñāyati ca ati āha samuccaya tthaḥ brahma ādinā ca kārakena
translated: Or he makes, he produces, the knowledge of that, thus he knows. He understands the meaning of that.🔽“He knows” and “he is known” are stated by way of the active and passive voices.🔽The meaning of the word “and” is the meaning of “together with.” The meaning is: devoid of a maker such as Brahmā, etc., and of a feeler as a self, etc.

original: attanā ca vedakena rahitanti attho. Ca-saddatthasamāsanti dvandasamāsamāha.
analyzed: ca vedakena dvanda samāsam āha
translated: The compound “and-meaning” is a copulative compound.

original: Catubbidhampi vā suññatanti dhuvabhāvādisuññataṃ, attādisuññatañca sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: catubbidham pi vā suññatanti dhuva bhāva ādi suññatam atta ādi suññatam ca sandhāya vadati
translated: Or he says this with reference to the emptiness of permanence, etc., and the emptiness of self, etc.

original: Pubbantatoti atītakoṭṭhāsato. Vedanāvasānampi bhavacakkaṃ paripuṇṇamevāti dassetuṃ
analyzed: pubbantataḥ ti atīta koṭṭhāsataḥ vedanā avasānam pi bhava cakkam paripuṇṇam eva ati dassetuṃ
translated: “From the beginning”: from the past section.

original: “vedanā vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Avijjāgahaṇena vā taṇhupādānāni, saṅkhāraggahaṇena bhavo,
analyzed: vedanā vā ati ādi vuttam avijjā gahaṇena vā taṇhu pādānāni saṅkhāra ggahaṇena bhavaḥ
translated: “Or feeling, etc.,” is said. Or by the inclusion of ignorance, craving and assuming are included, by the inclusion of formations, becoming is included,🔽by the inclusion of consciousness, etc., birth, ageing and death, sorrow, etc., are included. Thus the wheel of existence ends with feeling.

original: viññāṇādiggahaṇena jātijarāmaraṇāni sokādayo ca gahitāti evampi vedanāvasānaṃ bhavacakkanti🔽yuttamevetaṃ. Taṇhāmūlake cāti taṇhupādānaggahaṇena avijjā gahitātiādinā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: viññāṇa ādi gahaṇena jāti jarā maraṇāni soka ādayo ca gahitā ati evam pi vedanā avasānam bhava cakkanti  yuttam eva etam taṇhā mūlake ca ati taṇhā upādāna ggahaṇena avijjā gahitā ati ādinā yojetabbam
translated: This is quite correct. And by the inclusion of craving, etc., ignorance, etc., are included.

original: Tenāha “dvinnaṃ…pe… hotī”ti. Tattha dvinnanti purimapacchimānaṃ ubhinnaṃ hetuphalavajjānaṃ.
analyzed: tena āha hoti iti tattha dvinnam pe hoti iti tattha dvinnam ti purima pacchimānam ubhinnam
translated: Therefore it is said: “From the arising of two things, etc., comes to be.” Herein, two things means both the prior and the subsequent, which are devoid of cause and effect.

original: Viparītābhinivesaṃ karontīti nimittaṃ kattuupacārena vadati. Anupacchedameva pakāsetīti yojanā.
analyzed: viparīta abhinivesam karonti iti nimittam kattu upacārena vadati an upacchedam eva pakāseti iti yojanā
translated: It makes a false assumption means it makes a sign by a figure of speech. The construction is: it shows only non-interruption.

original: Hetuphalasandhi, phalahetusandhi, punapi hetuphalasandhīti evaṃ hetuādipubbakā hetuphalahetupubbakā.🔽Hetuphalahetuphalavasenāti avijjādihetu, viññāṇādiphala, taṇhādihetu, jātiphalavasena.
analyzed: hetu phala sandhi phala hetu sandhi puna api hetu phala sandhi iti evam hetu ādi pubbakā hetu phala hetu pubbakā 🔽hetu phala hetu phala vasena ati
translated: The connection of cause and effect, the connection of effect and cause, and the connection of cause and effect again, thus the prior cause, etc., the prior cause and effect,🔽the prior cause and effect and the prior effect and cause, the prior effect and cause and the prior cause and effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and effect and the prior effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior effect, the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause and effect and the prior cause, the prior cause and

original: Upasaggavisesena atthaviseso hotīti “ākirīyantī”ti padassa pakāsīyantīti attho vutto.
analyzed: upasagga visesena attha visesaḥ hoti iti ākirīyanti iti padassa pakāsīyanti iti atthaḥ vuttaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word “are heaped up” is stated as “are manifested” because there is a difference in meaning due to a difference in the mode of appearance.

original: Kilesakammavipākāti avijjādike vedanāpariyosāne vadati. Vipākakilesakammehīti viññāṇādīhi
analyzed: kilesa kamma vipākā ti avijjā ādike vedanā pariyosāne vadati vipāka kilesa kammehi iti viññāṇa ādīhi
translated: He says “defilement, kamma, and result” from ignorance to feeling. “Result, defilement, and kamma” from consciousness to

original: bhavapariyosānehi. Puna kammassa vipākasambandho vuttanayattā na gahito. “Vaṭṭānī”ti
analyzed: bhava pariyosānehi puna kammassa vipāka sambandhaḥ vutta naya ttā na gahitaḥ vaṭṭāni iti
translated: existence. The connection with the result of kamma is not mentioned again because it has already been stated. “The round” is mentioned

original: ca idaṃ “tīṇi vaṭṭānī”ti viggahavasena labbhamānaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ.🔽“Purimakammabhavasmiṃ moho”tiādinā aṭṭhakathāya āgatattā āsannapaccakkhataṃ sandhāya
analyzed: ca idam tīṇi vaṭṭāni iti viggaha vasena labbhamānam gahetvā vuttam  purima kamma bhavasmim moho ti ādinā aṭṭhakathāya āgata ttā āsanna paccakkha tam sandhāya
translated: taking the word “round” in the sense of “the three rounds.”🔽“In the previous kamma-process existence, delusion” is stated in the commentary. “In this” is said with reference to the nearness of the condition.

original: vuttaṃ “imissā”ti. Vibhaṅgapāḷiyā vasena dassitaṃ, tasmā na aṭṭhakathāya pubbāparavirodho🔽yathāpāṭhaṃ atthassa pakāsitattāti adhippāyo. Tattha cetanāsampayuttānañca cetanāya
analyzed: vuttam imissā ati vibhaṅga pāḷiyā vasena dassitam tasmā na aṭṭhakathāya pubba apara virodho  yathāpāṭham atthassa pakāsita ttā ti adhippāyaḥ tattha cetanā sampayuttānam ca cetanāya
translated: It is stated according to the Vibhanga text, therefore there is no contradiction between the commentary and the text,🔽because the meaning is stated according to the text. The intention is this: and also the volition and what is associated with volition should be stated as kamma-process existence by way of the nature of kamma-process and kamma-process existence.

original: ca saṅkhārabhāvena kammabhavabhāvena ca vattabbamevāti pāḷidvayādhippāyavivaraṇavasena
analyzed: ca saṅkhāra bhāvena kamma bhava bhāvena ca vattabbam evā ti pāḷi dvaya adhippāya vivaraṇa vasena
translated: By way of explaining the intention of the two texts

original: dassetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bhavassāti upapattibhavassa. “Bhavo”ti vuttā cetanāsampayuttāti
analyzed: dassetum tattha atiādi vuttam bhavassa ati upapatti bhavassa bhavaḥ ti vuttā cetanā sampayuttā ati
translated: “Therein” is said to show that. “In the becoming” : in the rebirth-process. The volition spoken of as “becoming” is associated with the three roots of the unwholesome.

original: sambandho. Gahaṇanti nikāmanavasena ārammaṇassa gahaṇaṃ. Tenāha “kāmupādānaṃ kiccenāhā”ti.🔽Itarāni kiccenāhāti yojanā. Tīsu atthavikappesūti “taṃ kammaṃ karoto purimā cetanāyo”tiādinā
analyzed: sambandhaḥ gahaṇam ti nikāmana vasena ārammaṇassa gahaṇam tena āha kāma upādānam kiccena āha ati  itarāni kiccena āha ati yojanā tīsu attha vikappesu ti tam kammam purimā cetanāya iti ādinā
translated: The meaning is: it is associated with them. “Grasping” : the grasping of an object by way of desire. Therefore it is said: “The volition of the first two kinds of kamma is grasping by way of its function.”🔽The meaning is: the other three kinds of kamma are grasping by way of their function.

original: vuttesu tīsu āyūhanacetanānaṃ atthavikappesu. Nanu ca tatiye atthavikappe āyūhanassa
analyzed: vuttesu tīsu āyūhana cetanānam attha vikappesu nanu ca tatiye attha vikappe āyūhanassa
translated: In the three ways of interpreting the meaning : in the three ways of interpreting the meaning of the volitions of accumulation, as stated in the passage beginning: “The first two kinds of kamma are the volition of accumulation.”🔽But is not volition at the end of accumulation not mentioned in the third interpretation of the meaning? Although it is not mentioned in its own form,

original: avasāne cetanā na vuttāti? Yadipi sarūpato na vuttā, “taṃsampayuttā”ti pana saddato
analyzed: avasāne cetanā na vuttā ati yadi api sarūpataḥ na vuttā tad sampayuttā ti pana saddataḥ
translated: it is mentioned by the word “associated with that” .

original: padhānabhāvena vuttassa āyūhanassa appadhānabhāvena vuttā avasāne pacchato vuttā
analyzed: padhāna bhāvena vuttassa āyūhanassa appadhāna bhāvena vuttā avasāne pacchatas vuttā
translated: Since the volition at the end of accumulation is mentioned by way of non-predominance, it is as if it were mentioned after the other volitions.

original: viya hotīti imaṃ pariyāyaṃ sandhāya “tīsupi…pe… avasāne”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: viya hoti iti imam pariyāyam sandhāya avasāne iti vuttam
translated: With this interpretation in mind, it is said: “In the three ways of interpreting the meaning … at the end.”

original: Nippariyāyena pana yesu āyūhanassa avasāne cetanā vuttā, te dassetuṃ “dvīsu…pe… āhā”ti
analyzed: nippariyāyena pana yesu āyūhanassa avasāne cetanā vuttā te dassetum dvīsupe āha ati
translated: But in order to show the places where volition at the end of accumulation is mentioned literally, it is said: “In the two ways of interpreting the meaning … by way of its function.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tatiye atthavikappe vutte āyūhanasaṅkhāre taṃsampayuttāti āhāti yojanā. Kammassa🔽paccayabhūtanti saṅkhārapaccayaṃ. Tena “kammakaraṇakāle”ti ettha kamma-saddena sabbassapi
analyzed: vuttam tatiye attha vikappe vutte āyūhana saṅkhāre tad sampayuttā iti āha ati yojanā kammassa  paccaya bhūtanti saṅkhāra paccayam tena kamma karaṇa kāle ti ettha kamma saddena sabbassa api
translated: This is said. When the third method of interpretation is stated, the construction is: “The accumulation-kamma-formations and what is associated with them.”

original: saṅkhārassa gahitataṃ dasseti. Tenāha “na kammasampayuttamevā”ti.🔽Kammānevāti kammāniyeva. Vipākadhammatāya kammasarikkhakā. Sahajātakoṭiyā, upanissayakoṭiyā
analyzed: saṅkhārassa gahita tam dasseti tena āha na kamma sampayuttam eva ti  kammānā iva ati kammāniyā iva vipāka dhamma tāya kamma sarikkhakā sahajāta koṭiyā upanissaya koṭiyā
translated: Kamma-condition: condition by way of kamma-formation. Therefore, in the passage, “at the time of the performance of kamma,” he shows that by the word kamma all the kamma-formations are included. Therefore he says, “not only what is associated with kamma.”

original: ca tassa kammassa upakārakāti tadupakārakā. Saṃkhippantīti saṃkhipīyanti saṃyūhīyanti.
analyzed: ca tassa kammassa upakārakā ati tad upakārakā saṃkhippanti iti saṃkhipīyanti saṃyūhīyanti
translated: Kamma-niyeyya: kamma-niyeyya-dhammā. They are similar to kamma by way of being states that are results of kamma. By way of being conascent and by way of being a decisive support, they are helpful to that kamma. Therefore they are helpful to that. They are contracted: they are contracted, they are collected.

original: “Saṃkhippanti etthā”ti adhikaraṇasādhanavasena saṅkhepasaddassa atthaṃ vatvā puna
analyzed: ettha ati adhikaraṇa sādhana vasena saṅkhepa saddassa attham vatvā puna
translated: “They are contracted here” — after stating the meaning of the word saṅkhepa by way of the accomplishment of the basis, he says “they are contracted” in order to state it again by way of the accomplishment of kamma.

original: kammasādhanavasena vattuṃ “saṃkhipīyatī”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Tatthāpīti “kamma”nti vuttakammasambhārepi. Gamanadhammanti bhaṅgupagamanadhammaṃ.
