analyzed: kamma sādhana vasena vattum saṃkhipīyati itiādi vuttam 🔽tattha api iti kammam ti vutta kamma sambhāre pi gamana dhammam ti bhaṅga upagamana dhammam
translated: There also: in the requisites of kamma stated as “kamma.” Subject to destruction: subject to the destruction of dissolution.

original: Tena ittaranti bhaṅgaparanti vuttaṃ hoti. Tenāti vinassanadhammatādīpakena ittarasaddena.🔽Nissārataṃ attasārābhāvaṃ dīpeti. Evaṃ “ittara”ntiādinā aniccaṃ calaṃ ittaraṃ addhuvanti
analyzed: tena ittaranti bhaṅga paranti vuttam hoti tena ati vinassana dhamma tā dīpakena ittara saddena  dīpeti evam aniccam calam
translated: “It is perishable” means it is subject to destruction. “By that”: by the word “perishable” which signifies the state of being subject to destruction.🔽“It is void” means it is devoid of a self-essence. Thus, by the words “perishable” and so on, he shows the difference in the meaning of the four terms “impermanent,” “momentary,” “perishable,” and “transient.”

original: catunnaṃ padānaṃ atthavisesavācitaṃ dasseti. Ṭhānasoti ettha vuttaṭṭhānaṃ nāma paccayo.
analyzed: catunnam padānam attha visesa vācitam dasseti ṭhānaso ti ettha vutta ṭṭhānam nāma paccayaḥ
translated: “The state” here is a condition.

original: Aññampīti aññattha vuttaṃ. Tassa tassa phalassa. Dhammamattasambhave sati vaṭṭupacchede
analyzed: aññam pi iti aññattha vuttam tassa tassa phalassa dhamma matta sambhave sati vaṭṭa upacchede
translated: “Another”: that stated elsewhere. “Of that and that fruit”: when the mere states of phenomena exist, when the round of rebirths is interrupted.

original: satīti yojanā. Evanti vuttappakārena samuccayatthe ca-sadde sati.
analyzed: sati iti yojanā evam ti vutta ppakārena samuccaya tthe ca sadde sati
translated: The construction is: “there is.” “Thus”: when the word “and” has the meaning of “combination.”

original: Saccāniyeva pabhavoti samānādhikaraṇapakkhaṃ sandhāyāha “saccappabhavatoti saccato”ti. “Yassa pahānatthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī”ti evaṃbhūtaṃ ariyasaccaṃ visesaṃ akatvā.
analyzed: sacca aniyā iva pabhavo ti samāna adhikaraṇa pakkham sandhāya āha sacca ppabhavato ti saccato ti yassa pahāna attham bhagavati brahmacariyam vussati iti evaṃbhūtam ariya saccam visesam a katvā
translated: “The origin of the truths”: he says this with reference to the side of identity. “From the truth” means “from the state of truth.” Without making a distinction of the noble truth of the kind stated thus: “For the abandoning of that, the life of purity is lived under the Blessed One.”

original: Tehi sokādīhi. “Sokadomanassupāyāsā avijjāya aviyogino”tiādinā pubbe vuttanayena siddhāya avijjāya. Attanoyevāti paccayuppannaṃ anapekkhitvā attanoyeva pavattasaṅkhātakiccato.
analyzed: tehi soka ādīhi soka domanassa upāyāsāḥ avijjāya aviyoginaḥ ti ādinā pubbe vutta nayena siddhāya avijjāya attano yeva āti paccaya uppannam an apekkhitvā attano yeva pavatta saṅkhāta kiccato
translated: By itself: because of the function called “occurrence by itself” without regard to a condition arising next to it.

original: Sokādayopi hīti ettha hi-saddo hetuattho. Yasmā “sokādayo paccayāyattā avasavattino”ti
analyzed: soka ādayaḥ api hi iti ettha hi saddaḥ hetu atthaḥ yasmā soka ādayaḥ paccaya āyattāḥ avasavattino ti
translated: The word “and” in the phrase “sorrow and so on” has the meaning of a causal particle. Because sorrow and so on are dependent for their occurrence on conditions and are not self-determining,

original: idaṃ “jātipaccayā…pe… sambhavantī”ti etena vacanena siddhaṃ, tasmā taṃ “attā socatī”tiādidassananivāraṇanti attho.
analyzed: idam sambhavanti iti etena vacanena siddham tasmā tam attā socati iti ādi dassana nivāraṇanti atthaḥ
translated: this is established by the passage beginning, “With birth as condition: sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair are originated” . Therefore the meaning of the passage is: “in order to prevent the view that ‘the self sorrows’ and so on.”

original: Sati ca pariggahe rajjaṃ viya gatiyo anekānatthānubandhanā, tāhi ca viññāṇassa upaddutatāti
analyzed: sati ca pariggahe rajjam viya gatiyaḥ aneka anattha anubandhanā tāhi ca viññāṇassa upadduta tā ti
translated: And when there is appropriation, the destinies, like a kingdom, are attended by many misfortunes. And consciousness is oppressed by them.

original: dassetuṃ “saṅkhārapariggahitaṃ…pe… rajje”ti vuttanti evaṃ vā ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: dassetum rajjā iti vuttam ti evam vā ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: In order to show this, the passage beginning, “Appropriated by formations … like a kingdom” is stated. The meaning should be seen in this way.

original: Yathāupaṭṭhitāni kammādīni cutiāsannajavanehi parikappetvā viya gahitāni paṭisandhiviññāṇenapi
analyzed: yathā upaṭṭhitāni kamma ādīni cuti āsanna javanehi parikappetvā viya gahitāni paṭisandhi viññāṇena api
translated: The formations that have been appropriated by the rebirth-linking consciousness are as if they had been selected by the impulsions that are close to death, as if they had been chosen.

original: parikappitāni viya honti, taṃ panassa parikappanaṃ atthato ārammaṇakaraṇamevāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: parikappitāni viya honti tam panassa parikappanam atthataḥ ārammaṇa karaṇam eva ati vuttam
translated: they are as if they were already made up. But the making up of them is in fact the apprehending of them as objects, thus it was said:🔽“Pari…pe… to” .

original: “pari…pe… to”ti. Saṅkappanaṃ vā parikappananti vuttaṃ “vitakkena vitakkanato”ti.
analyzed: toti saṅkappanam vā parikappananti vuttam vitakkena vitakkanato ti
translated: Or the words “making up” and “apprehending” are said to be “thinking and pondering with applied thought” .

original: Sasambhāracakkhuādayo saḷāyatanassa patiṭṭhāviseso.🔽Yadākārāya jātiyā yadākāraṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ sambhavati, sambhavantañca yathānupubbaṃ
analyzed: sa sambhāra cakkhu ādayo saḷāyatanassa patiṭṭhā viseso  yad ākārāya jātiyā yad ākāram jarā maraṇam sambhavati sambhavantam ca yathānupubbam
translated: The eye, etc., with their accessories are a special kind of support for the six bases.

original: pavattaṃ, so attho jātipaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho, sahitassa samuditassa puggalassa🔽jīraṇabhijjanāvatthā dhammā jarāmaraṇāpadesena vuttā, sā ca nesaṃ avatthā jātipubbikā,🔽te ca samuditā eva pavattantīti evaṃ jātito jarāmaraṇassa sambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho
analyzed: pavattam saḥ atthaḥ jāti paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭho sahitassa samuditassa puggalassa  jīraṇa bhijjana avatthāḥ dhammāḥ jarā maraṇa apadesena vuttā sā ca na isam avatthā jāti pubbikā  te ca samuditāḥ eva pavattanti iti evam jātitaḥ jarā maraṇassa sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ
translated: The meaning of “originated” and “come about” is the meaning of “originated” and “come about” with the condition of birth. The states that are the state of ageing-and-death in one who is born and who is ageing-and-dying, and which occur in due succession,🔽are called “ageing-and-death” in the sense of the state of ageing-and-death in one who is born. And that state of ageing-and-death is preceded by birth,

original: veditabbo. Jātito jarāmaraṇaṃ na na hoti hotiyeva ekantena jātassa jarāmaraṇasambhavato,
analyzed: veditabbaḥ jātitaḥ jarā maraṇam na na hoti ekantena jātassa jarā maraṇa sambhavato
translated: and they occur only when they are combined, thus the meaning of “originated” and “come about” in the case of ageing-and-death should be understood in this way. Ageing-and-death is not absent in one who is born; it is present in him absolutely, since it is certain that ageing-and-death will occur in one who is born.

original: na ca jātiṃ vinā hoti ajātassa tadabhāvatoti jarāmaraṇassa jātipaccayataṃ anvayabyatirekehi
analyzed: na ca jātim vinā hoti ajātassa tad abhāvato ti jarā maraṇassa jāti paccayatam anvaya byatirekehi
translated: and without birth there is no ageing-and-death, because of the absence of the born one, thus the following of the order and the reverse of the order in the way beginning, “Not from birth” shows the conditionality of ageing-and-death by birth.

original: vibhāveti “na jātito”tiādinā. Itthanti jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇassa nibbattākāraṃ vadati.
analyzed: vibhāveti na jātitaḥ tiādinā itthanti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇassa nibbatta ākāram vadati
translated: The word “thus” indicates the mode of occurrence of ageing-and-death as a condition for birth.

original: Nirodhā nirodhasaṅkhātanti paccayanirodhā paccayuppannanirodhasaṅkhātaṃ. Anulomadesanāya ca vemajjhato paṭṭhāyāti yojanā.
analyzed: nirodhā nirodha saṅkhātanti paccaya nirodhā paccaya uppanna nirodha saṅkhātam anuloma desanāya ca vemajjhataḥ paṭṭhāya ati yojanā
translated: “From cessation of that, that ceases”: from cessation of the condition, that conditionally arisen ceases. And the construction is “from the middle onwards” in the case of the forward order teaching.🔽The unprofitable is called “with lust” because it is associated with lust and because it is the basis for lust.

original: Apuññābhisaṅkhārekadeso sarāgo rāgena sahajekaṭṭhoti katvā. Sabbopi apuññābhisaṅkhāro
analyzed: apuñña abhisaṅkhāra eka desaḥ sa rāgaḥ rāgena sahajā ekaṭṭhaḥ ti katvā sabbaḥ api apuñña abhisaṅkhāro
translated: All unprofitable kamma-formation is “with lust” because it is the basis for abandoning lust.

original: sarāgo pahānekaṭṭhabhāvato. Yasmā pana akusaladhammo akusaladhammassa sabhāgo, anakusaladhammo
analyzed: sa rāgaḥ yasmā pana akusala dhammo akusala dhammassa sabhāgaḥ anakusala dhammo
translated: But since an unprofitable state is a similar cause for an unprofitable state, and a dissimilar cause for a profitable state,

original: visabhāgo, yathārahaṃ paccayo ca hoti, tasmā “apaṭipakkhabhāvato, rāgappavaḍḍhako”ti
analyzed: visabhāgaḥ yathāraham paccayaḥ ca hoti tasmai a paṭipakkha bhāvataḥ rāga ppavaḍḍhakaḥ ti
translated: and is a condition in the appropriate way, it is said to be “not opposed” and “a promoter of lust.”

original: ca vuttaṃ. “Tadeva viññāṇaṃ sandhāvati saṃsaratī”ti micchābhinivesasabbhāvato saṃsaraṇakiriyāyapi
analyzed: ca vuttam tat eva viññāṇam sandhāvati saṃsarati iti micchā abhinivesa sabbhāvato saṃsaraṇa kiriyāya api
translated: And because of the similarity of the function of wandering on in the round of rebirths, it is said that “that same consciousness wanders on.”

original: sabyāpāratā viññāṇassa vuttā. Sabyāpāratābhinivesabalavatāya, saṅkantiabhinivesabalavatāyāti🔽paccekaṃ yojetabbaṃ. “Asahavattanato, sahavattanato”ti etena asahavutti vinibbhogo,
analyzed: sa byāpāra tā viññāṇassa vuttā sa byāpāra tā abhinivesa balavatāya saṅkanti abhinivesa balavatāya ati  paccekam yojetabbam a sahavattanataḥ sahavattanataḥ ti etena a sahavutti vinibbhogaḥ
translated: The words “with hate” are said of consciousness. The words “with the strength of adherence to the strength of adherence to going” should be construed with each of the terms “with hate” and “with delusion.”🔽By the words “because of non-concurrence” and “because of concurrence” he shows that non-concurrence is non-interpenetration,

original: sahavutti avinibbhogoti dasseti.
analyzed: sahavutti avinibbhogaḥ ti dasseti
translated: and concurrence is interpenetration.

original: Sabhāvādhigamanimittatā obhāsanaṃ. Cakkhādisannissayena hi pañcaviññāṇāni rūpādisabhāvaṃ upalabhanti. Itare phusanasaṅgatisannipātaṭṭhā. Channanti channampi samphassānaṃ.
analyzed: sabhāva adhigama nimitta tā obhāsanam cakkha ādi sannissayena hi pañca viññāṇāni rūpa ādi sabhāvam upalabhanti itare phusana saṅgati sannipāta ṭṭhā channanti channam pi samphassānam
translated: The meaning of “illumination” is the meaning of “reaching the individual essence.” For the five consciousnesses reach the individual essences of visible data, etc., by means of the eye, etc., as their respective supports. The other three are the meaning of “touching,” the meaning of “meeting,” and the meaning of “coming together.” “The meaning of ‘concealment’ is the meaning of ‘covering up’ of the four kinds of clinging.

original: Ādānanti upasaddena vināpi daḷhagāho adhippetoti āha “ādānaṭṭho catunnampi upādānānaṃ🔽samāno”ti. Gahaṇanti nikāmanavasena visayassa paṭicchannanti vuttaṃ “gahaṇaṭṭho kāmupādānassā”ti.
analyzed: ādānam ti upasaddena vinā api daḷha gāhaḥ adhippetaḥ ti āha catunnam pi  samānaḥ ti gahaṇanti nikāmana vasena visayassa paṭicchannanti vuttam gahaṇa ṭṭho kāma upādānassa ati
translated: The meaning of ‘grasping’ is the meaning of ‘holding on’ to the object by the four kinds of clinging, whether or not the word ‘up’ is prefixed.🔽The meaning of ‘concealment’ is the meaning of ‘covering up’ of sense-desire clinging.

original: Itaresanti diṭṭhupādānādīnaṃ. Tasmāti vibhattiyā aluttabhāvato. Tenāti khipanasaddena.
analyzed: itaresan ti diṭṭhupādāna ādīnam tasmā iti vibhattiyāḥ a lutta bhāvataḥ tena ati khipana saddena
translated: The other three are the meanings of the three kinds of clinging beginning with the false view of individuality. ‘Because’ is because of the absence of the elision of the locative case ending. ‘By that’ is by the word ‘hurling.’

original: Hāni vā khīṇabhāvo khayoti “khayaṭṭho vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dvinnanti jarāmaraṇānaṃ. Maraṇūpanayanarasattā
analyzed: hāni vā khīṇa bhāvaḥ khayo ti khayaṭṭho vā atiādi vuttam dvinnam ati jarā maraṇānam maraṇa upanayana rasa ttā
translated: “Or the state of exhaustion is the state of having been exhausted” is said by way of the state of exhaustion.

original: vā jarāyapi maraṇaṭṭho eva dassito.
analyzed: vā maraṇa ṭṭhaḥ eva dassitaḥ
translated: “Of the two” means of aging and death. Or the state of death is shown by way of aging itself because of the nature of bringing about death.

original: Nīyanti gamentīti nayā, ekattādayo. Kehi nīyanti? Avijjādiatthehīti imamatthamāha
analyzed: nīyanti gamenti iti nayāḥ ekatta ādayaḥ kehi nīyanti avijja ādi atthehi iti imam attham āha
translated: “The unities” are the unities, etc., to which things are led. By what are they led? By the meanings of ignorance, etc. He states the meaning of this as follows:

original: “avijjādī”tiādinā. Sena bhāvenāti sakena avijjādibhāvena, taṃ amuñcitvā eva. Na hi🔽avijjādivinimuttaṃ ekattaṃ nāma kiñci paramatthato atthi. Sena bhāvenāti vā sakena🔽ekattādibhāvena. Avijjādīsu viññāyamāno hetuphaladhammānaṃ ekasantatipatitādisaṅkhāto🔽ekattādibhāvo teneva sabhāvena ñāyati, na avijjādibhāvenāti. Te hi netabbāti tesaṃ
analyzed: avijja ādi iti ādinā sena bhāvena ati sakena avijja ādi bhāvena tam a muñcitvā eva na hi  avijjā ādi vinimuttam ekattam nāma kiñci paramatthataḥ atthi sena bhāvena ati vā sakena  ekatta ādi bhāvena avijjā ādīsu viññāyamānaḥ hetu phala dhammānam eka santati patita ādi saṅkhāto  ekatta ādi bhāvaḥ tena iva sa bhāvena ñāyati na avijjā ādi bhāvena ati te hi netabbā ati tesam
translated: “By ignorance, etc.” means by their own nature as ignorance, etc., without abandoning that. For there is nothing called unity that is absolutely separate from ignorance, etc.🔽Or “by their own nature” means by their own nature as unities, etc. The state of unity, etc., which is called the falling of the phenomena of cause and fruit into one continuity, etc., is known by that very nature, not by the nature of ignorance, etc.

original: nayā. Atthā eva vā avijjādayo. Anekepi samānā dhammā yena santānānupacchedena “eka”nti
analyzed: nayāḥ atthāḥ eva vā avijjā ādayaḥ aneke pi samānāḥ dhammāḥ yena santāna an upacchedena ekam ti
translated: For they are led by those, thus they are the unities, etc. Or the meanings of ignorance, etc., are the unities, etc. Although many, the phenomena are the same by the non-breaking of the continuity, thus they are “one.”

original: ñāyanti voharīyanti, so tattha karaṇabhāvena vattabbataṃ arahati, tathā itarepīti
analyzed: ñāyanti voharīyanti saḥ tattha karaṇa bhāvena vattabba tam arahati tathā itare pi iti
translated: They are known, they are spoken of, and so he is to be spoken of as a condition in this way. So too the other.

original: āha “ekattādīhi ca atthā ‘eka’ntiādinā nīyantī”ti. Tattha nīyantīti ñāyanti, paññāpīyanti
analyzed: āha ekatta ādīhi ca atthāḥ ekanti ādinā nīyanti iti tattha nīyanti iti
translated: Hence he said: “And by ‘singleness’ and so on they are known as ‘one’ and so on.” Herein, they are known, they are spoken of,

original: ca. Purimapacchimānaṃ dhammānaṃ nirodhuppādanirantaratāya nāmakāyassa, sambandhavuttitāya
analyzed: ca purima pacchimānam dhammānam nirodha uppāda nirantara tāya nāmakāyassa sambandha vutti tāya
translated: because of the cessation and arising of the successive states, in the case of the mental body, and because of their being related and occurring,🔽in the case of the material body, and because of their mutual dependence, in the case of both.🔽The continuity is the uninterrupted occurrence of that in that way.🔽The singleness is the continuity’s non-interruption.

original: rūpakāyassa, ubhayassa ca aññamaññasannissitatāya duviññeyyanānato ekībhūtassa viya
analyzed: rūpa kāyassa ubhayassa ca aññamañña sannissita tāya du viññeyya nānataḥ ekībhūtassa viya
translated: The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.

original: ghanabhāvappabandho hetuphalabhāvena sambandho sammā tānoti santāno, tassa anupacchedo
analyzed: ghana bhāva ppabandhaḥ hetu phala bhāvena sambandhaḥ sammā tānoti santāno tassa an upacchedo
translated: The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.

original: tathāpavatti ekattanti āha “santānānupacchedo ekatta”nti.
analyzed: tathāpavatti ekattam iti āha santāna an upacchedaḥ ekattam iti
translated: The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.🔽The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.

original: Sambandharahitassāti hetuphalabhāvena aññamaññasambandhabhāvarahitassa. Sattantaroti
analyzed: sambandha rahitassa ati hetu phala bhāvena aññamañña sambandha bhāva rahitassa
translated: The continuity’s non-interruption is the singleness.

original: añño satto. Ucchedadiṭṭhimupādiyatīti yathānurūpakāraṇato phalappavattiṃ asamanupassanto
analyzed: aññaḥ sattaḥ uccheda diṭṭhim upādiyati iti yathā anurūpa kāraṇataḥ phala ppavattim a samanupassanto
translated: The continuity

original: nānāsantāne viya asambandhanānattadassanato hetubhāvarahitānaṃ nippayojanānaṃ purimuppannānaṃ
analyzed: nānā santāne viya asambandha nānatta dassanataḥ hetu bhāva rahitānam nippayojanānam purima uppannānam
translated: and because there is no fixed rule about the cause of the cessation of the previously arisen dhammas that are unrelated and useless,🔽it is not logically possible for them to arise in one way only,

original: dhammānaṃ nirodhe hetuniyamābhāvato ekantena uppatti na yuttā, tathā santānena uppatti,
analyzed: dhammānam nirodhe hetu niyama abhāvato ekantena uppatti na yuttā tathā santānena uppatti
translated: or for them to arise in the same way,

original: sadisabhāvena uppatti, samānajātidesapariṇāmavayarūpabalasaṇṭhānānaṃ uppatti na yuttātiādīni
analyzed: sadisa bhāvena uppatti samāna jāti desa pariṇāma vaya rūpa bala saṇṭhānānam uppatti na yutta ati ādīni
translated: or for the same kind of primary and derived materiality, colour, etc., to arise.

original: vikappento ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ gaṇhāti.
analyzed: vikappentaḥ uccheda diṭṭhim gaṇhāti
translated: He thus takes up the annihilationist view.🔽Why should there be no arising? Just as oil does not arise from sesame seeds,

original: Kasmā uppatti na siyāti vālikāhi viya tilehipi telassa, ucchuto viya gāvitopi khīrassa
analyzed: kasmai uppatti na siyāti vālikāhi viya tilehi pi telassa viya khīrassa
translated: so milk does not arise from cows, which are different from it.

original: aññābhāvato kena kāraṇena tehi tesaṃ uppatti na siyā, itarehi eva ca nesaṃ uppatti
analyzed: aññābhāvato kena kāraṇena tehi tesam uppatti na siyā itarehi eva ca nesam uppatti
translated: Why should there be no arising of the one from the other, and why should there be arising of it only from the other?

original: hotīti. Tasmāti aññassa aññato uppattiyaṃ sabbassa sabbaso uppattiyā bhavitabbaṃ,
analyzed: hoti iti tasmā ati aññassa aññatas uppattiyam sabbassa sabbasaḥ uppattiyā bhavitabbam
translated: Because if there were arising of one from another, there would have to be arising of everything from everything,🔽and that is not so. Therefore,

original: na cetaṃ atthi, tasmā. Yasmā niyativādī anurūpā hetuto phaluppattiṃ na icchati, sabhāvasiddhameva
analyzed: na atthi tasmai yasmai niyati vādī anurūpāḥ hetutaḥ phala uppattim na icchati sa bhāva siddham eva
translated: because the fatalist does not admit the arising of an effect from a cause that is appropriate to it, but maintains that it arises

original: ca dhammappavattiṃ icchati, tasmā “avijjamānepi hetumhī”ti vuttaṃ. Sabhāvasiddhā
analyzed: ca dhamma ppavattim icchati tasmai a vijjamāne pi hetumhi iti vuttam sabhāva siddhā
translated: and he wishes to have the occurrence of the ideas, therefore it is said, “even though the causes are not present.”

original: eva hi acchejjasuttāvutābhejjamaṇi viya kamalaṅghanarahitā tathā tathā sarīrindriyasukhādibhāvapariṇāmāya
analyzed: eva hi kama laṅghana rahitā tathā tathā sarīḥ indriya sukha ādi bhāva pariṇāmāya
translated: For the bodies come together in such and such a way for the change to the state of the body, faculty, pleasure, etc., just as the unbreakable gem mentioned in the Acelakavagga does, without any breaking, as if by destiny,

original: niyatiyāva kāyā samāgacchanti, yato gatijātibandhā, apavaggo ca hotīti niyativādo.
analyzed: niyatiyā va kāyā samāgacchanti yatas gati jāti bandhāḥ apavaggo ca hoti iti niyati vādo
translated: from which there is destiny, rebirth-linking, bondage, and no escape, thus it is the doctrine of destiny.

original: Tenāha “niyatatāya…pe… pavattantī”ti. Niyatiattho vuttoyeva.🔽Etassa atthassa sādhakaṃ suttaṃ. Ākulameva, ākulabhāvo vā ākulakaṃ. Jaṭitāti heṭṭhupariyavasena🔽pavattamānehi kilesakammavipākehi jātajaṭā. Nīḍanti kulāvakaṃ. Saṃsāranti idha sampattibhavappabandhamāha🔽apāyādipadehi duggatippabandhassa vuttattā.🔽Bhavacakkakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tena āha niyata tāyape pavattanti iti niyati atthaḥ  etassa atthassa sādhakam suttam ākulam eva ākula bhāvaḥ vā ākulakam jaṭitā ati heṭṭhu pariya vasena  pavattamānehi kilesa kamma vipākehi jāta jaṭāḥ nīḍanti kulāvakam saṃsāranti idha sampatti bhava ppabandham āha  apāya ādi padehi duggati ppabandhassa vutta ttā  bhava cakka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Hence it is said, “By the law of destiny … they occur.” The meaning of destiny has already been stated.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽
translated: The sutta that proves this meaning is: “The world is agitated, bhikkhus, by agitation, or the world is agitated, bhikkhus, as agitation, or the world is agitated, bhikkhus, in agitation. The world is entangled, bhikkhus, by entanglement, or the world is entangled, bhikkhus, as entanglement, or the world is entangled, bhikkhus, in entanglement. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a snare, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a snare, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a snare. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a thicket, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a thicket, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a thicket. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a mesh, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a mesh, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a mesh. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a stream, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a stream, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a stream. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a whirlpool, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a whirlpool, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a whirlpool. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a pit, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a pit, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a pit. The world is caught, bhikkhus, in a crevasse, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, as a crevasse, or the world is caught, bhikkhus, in a crevasse. The world is

original: 243. Taṃ paṭiccasamuppādaṃ. Ekekacittāvaruddhanti abhidhammabhājanīye viya ekekasmiṃ🔽citte avaruddhaṃ antogadhaṃ akatvā. Asahajātānañca “asahajātānaṃ, sahajātānañcā”ti
analyzed: tam paṭiccasamuppādam ekeka citta avaruddhanti abhidhamma bhājanīye viya ekekasmin  citte avaruddham antogadham a katvā asahajātānam ca asahajātānam sahajātānam ca ati
translated: He has not included it in each consciousness, as in the Abhidhamma Basket,

original: evaṃ paṭhamapade ekasesaniddeso daṭṭhabbo. “Saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇa”nti asahajātāyeva🔽paccayapaccayuppannā dassitā vipākaviññāṇasseva adhippetattā. “Avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā,
analyzed: evam paṭhama pade ekasesa niddeso daṭṭhabbo saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇan ti asahajātāya eva  paccaya paccaya uppannā dassitā vipāka viññāṇassa iva adhippeta ttā avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā
translated: without keeping it outside in each consciousness. And the general statement in the first part of the clause, “not conascent, and also not conascent,” should be regarded as a reference to the rest.🔽“With formations as condition, consciousness” shows only not conascent conditions and results, because only resultant consciousness is intended.

original: viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpa”nti ca evamādīsu asahajātā, sahajātā ca. “Ekekena nayenā”ti
analyzed: viññāṇa paccayāḥ nāma rūpanti ca evamādīsu asahajātā sahajātā ca ekekena nayena ati
translated: “With ignorance as condition there are formations, with consciousness as condition: mentality-materiality” shows both conascent and not conascent.

original: purātano pāṭho, etarahi pana “ekekena catukkena” icceva bahūsu potthakesu pāṭho.
analyzed: purātanaḥ pāṭho etarahi pana ekekena catukkena icca iva bahūsu potthakesu pāṭho
translated: “By one method” is the old reading. But in many books the reading is now “by one of the four methods.”

original: Nayacatukkavārāti nayesu catukkānaṃ vārā, avijjāmūlakādīsu navasu nayesu paccekaṃ
analyzed: naya catukka vārā ati nayesu catukkānam vārā avijjā mūlaka ādīsu navasu nayesu paccekam
translated: “The section on the four method-sets” is the section on the four sets of four, namely, the condition-set, the origination-set, the disappearance-set, and the danger-set, in the nine methods beginning with ignorance as root-cause.

original: paccayacatukkādīnaṃ catunnaṃ catukkānaṃ “nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatana”ntiādivisesabhinnā
analyzed: paccaya catukka ādīnam catunnam catukkānam nāma paccayā chaṭṭha āyatana nti ādi visesa bhinnā
translated: In each method the four sets are distinguished by the different terms “With mentality as condition, the sixth sense base” and so on.

original: cattāro vārāti attho. Vavatthitāti yathāvuttavisesena asaṃkiṇṇā. Catukkānanti vāracatukkānaṃ
analyzed: cattāro vārā ti atthaḥ vavatthitā ati yathā vutta visesena asaṃkiṇṇā catukkānam ti vāra catukkānam
translated: The meaning is: four sections. Distinctly: not mixed up by the aforesaid distinctions. In the four-sectioned: in the four-sectioned sixteen-sectioned.

original: vārasoḷasakassa nayabhāvatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vāra soḷasakassa naya bhāvato ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is: because of the method.

original: 1. Paccayacatukkavaṇṇanā🔽Paccayasahitapaccayuppannāni aṅgabhāvena vuttāni, na kevalaṃ paccayā. Tasmā “chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā
analyzed: paccaya catukka vaṇṇanā  paccaya sahita paccaya uppannāni aṅga bhāvena vuttāni na kevalam paccayā tasmā chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā
translated: The Description of the Four-Sectioned Dependent Origination

original: phasso”ti ettha na chaṭṭhāyatanassa aṅgatā. Tena vuttaṃ “na, tassa anaṅgattā”ti.🔽Evañca katvāti paccayasahitassa paccayuppannassa aṅgabhāvato. Tīsu pakāresūti “paṭhamo
analyzed: phasso ti ettha na chaṭṭha āyatanassa aṅga tā tena vuttam na tassa anaṅga ttā ti  evam ca katvā iti paccaya sahitassa paccaya uppannassa aṅga bhāvato tīsu pakāresu iti paṭhamaḥ
translated: The factors that are stated as factors of the condition and the conditionally-arisen are not only conditions. Therefore, “with the sixth sense sphere as condition, contact” is not a factor of the sixth sense sphere. Thus it is said: “not because it is not a factor of that.”

original: sabbasaṅgāhikaṭṭhenā”tiādinā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttesu tīsupi pakāresu. Paccayavisesādīti
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhika ṭṭhena ati ādinā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttesu tīsu pi pakāresu paccaya visesa ādi iti
translated: Thus: because of the factorhood of the condition and the conditionally-arisen together with the conditions. In the three sections: in the three sections stated in the commentary thus: “The first … by way of the all-inclusive sense sphere” , etc. The difference in conditions, etc.:

original: ettha nāmaṃ, chaṭṭhāyatanañca paccayaviseso. Ādi-saddena yoniviseso, āyatanānaṃ apāripūripāripūribhavaviseso
analyzed: ettha nāmam chaṭṭha āyatanam ca paccaya visesaḥ ādi saddena yoni visesaḥ āyatanānam apāripūri pāripūri bhava viseso
translated: Herein, the name and the sixth sense sphere are the difference in conditions. By the word “etc.” the difference in the kinds of rebirth, the difference in the kinds of existence due to the incomplete and complete sense spheres,

original: ca gahito. Te hi dutiyavārādīnaṃ nānattakarā. Atthavisesenāti yadipi aññattha “saḷāyatanapaccayā
analyzed: ca gahitaḥ te hi dutiya vāra ādīnam nānatta karāḥ attha visesena ati yadi pi aññattha saṅgāyatana paccayā
translated: and the condition clause is included. For these are the means of distinguishing the second and subsequent sections.

original: phasso”ti saḷāyatanapaccayo vutto, tathāpi sahajātādināmasannissayena pavattanato🔽nāmamattapaccayāpi so hotīti paṭiccasamuppādassa nānānayavicittatānumitassa gambhīrabhāvassa🔽vibhāvanasaṅkhātena, anavasesanāmapaccayadassanasaṅkhātena ca atthavisesena. Tathā
analyzed: phasso ti saṅgāyatana paccayaḥ vuttaḥ tathā api sahajāta ādi nāma sannissayena pavattanato  nāma matta paccayā api so hoti iti paṭiccasamuppādassa nānā naya vicitta tā anumitassa gambhīra bhāvassa  vibhāvana saṅkhātena anavasesa nāma paccaya dassana saṅkhātena ca attha visesena tathā
translated: As to difference in meaning: although the condition consisting of the sixfold base is stated in other places as “With the sixfold base as condition, contact” , still it is a condition for contact by way of conascence, etc., and by way of decisive support, etc.,🔽and so it is a condition not only by way of faculty.🔽So the meaning of dependent origination, which is inferred as having various methods and as being profound,🔽is shown by way of the difference in meaning consisting in the exposition of the conditions without remainder.

original: hi “yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti
analyzed: hi yehi ānanda ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti
translated: For the teaching of the Great Advice occurs by way of the exposition of the condition consisting of mental data for contact, thus: “Now, Ananda, if there were the six bases for contact, would the condition for the arising of contact be seen?”🔽“No, venerable sir.”🔽“If there were no six bases for contact, would the condition for the arising of contact be seen?”🔽“No, venerable sir.”

original: hoti, tesu ākāresu…pe… uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpakāye adhivacanasamphasso paññāyethā”ti🔽phassassa nāmapaccayatāvibhāvanavasena mahānidānadesanā pavattā. Tathā “nāmarūpapaccayā
analyzed: hoti tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpa kāye adhivacana samphassaḥ paññāyetha ati 🔽phassassa nāma paccaya tā vibhāvana vasena mahā nidāna desanā pavattā tathā nāma rūpa paccayā
translated: “Now, Ananda, if there were mental data as objects, would the condition for the arising of contact be seen?”

original: phassoti iccassa vacanīya”nti “nāmarūpapaccayā”ti vadantena “nāmapaccayā”tipi vuttameva hotīti.
analyzed: phasso ti iccassa vacanīyanti nāma rūpa paccayā ti vadantena nāma paccayā ti pi vuttam eva hoti iti
translated: By saying “Conditioned by mentality-materiality,” he has also said “Conditioned by mentality.”

original: Vāracatukke “saṅkhāro”ti vuttaṃ, sokādayo na vuttā, purimasmiṃ vāradvaye rūpaṃ na vuttaṃ, vārattaye saḷāyatanaṃ na vuttanti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vāra catukke saṅkhāraḥ iti vuttam soka ādayaḥ na vuttā purimasmim vāra dvaye rūpam na vuttam vāra ttaye saḷāyatanam na vuttan ti yojetabbam
translated: In the fourfold series, “formations” are mentioned, but sorrow, etc., are not mentioned; or in the first two sections, materiality is not mentioned, but in the third section the sixfold base is not mentioned.

original: Sabba…pe… raṇatoti sabbassa viññāṇassa pavattiṭṭhānabhūtasabbabhavasādhāraṇato, viññāṇassa
analyzed: raṇato ti sabbassa viññāṇassa pavatti ṭṭhāna bhūta sabba bhava sādhāraṇataḥ viññāṇassa
translated: Because of the inclusion of all kinds of becoming, etc.: because of the inclusion of all kinds of becoming that are the basis for the occurrence of all kinds of consciousness.🔽Or because of the inclusion of all kinds of becoming that are the basis for the occurrence of consciousness.

original: vā pavattiṭṭhānabhūtasabbabhavasādhāraṇato. Samānaṃ phalaṃ samāno paccayo sahajātādipaccayehi
analyzed: vā pavatti ṭṭhāna bhūta sabba bhava sādhāraṇataḥ samānam phalam samānaḥ paccayaḥ sahajāta ādi paccayehi
translated: Because of the similarity of the fruit and the similarity of the condition: because of the similarity of the fruit and the similarity of the condition by the joint conditions, etc.,🔽because of the helpfulness.🔽Of that consciousness: of the consciousness that is reborn.

original: upakattabbato, upakārakato ca. Tassa viññāṇassa. Viññāṇāharaṇanti vipākaviññāṇanibbattanaṃ. Assa viññāṇassa.
analyzed: upakattabbataḥ upakārakataḥ ca tassa viññāṇassa viññāṇa āharaṇam ti vipāka viññāṇa nibbattanam assa viññāṇassa
translated: The carrying of consciousness: the production of resultant consciousness.

original: Gatisūcakoti hi-saddaṃ loke gatiatthaṃ vadantīti katvā vuttaṃ. “Vigata”nti ettha
analyzed: gati sūcakaḥ iti hi saddam loke gati attham vadanti iti katvā vuttam vigata nti ettha
translated: Of that consciousness: because in the world the word “go” is said to have the meaning of direction.

original: vi-saddo paṭisedhadīpakoti dve paṭisedhā pakatiṃ ñāpentīti āha “vigatatānivāraṇavasena gati eva hotī”ti.
analyzed: visaddaḥ paṭisedha dīpako ti dve paṭisedhā pakatim ñāpenti iti āha vigata tā nivāraṇa vasena eva hoti iti
translated: The prefix vi- indicates a denial, so the two denials show the normal state. That is why he said: “It is only a going by way of the removal of the hindrances.”

original: Tidhā catudhā pañcadhā vāti ettha saññāmanasikārādayo sahajātanissayaatthipaccayavasena
analyzed: tidhā catudhā pañcadhā vā ti ettha saññā manasikāra ādayo sahajāta nissaya atthi paccaya vasena
translated: In the three ways, four ways, and five ways: here, perception, applied thought, etc., are a condition in three ways as conascence, support, and presence conditions.

original: tidhā, phassacetanādayo tesañceva āhārādīnañca vasena catudhā, vedanāvitakkādayo
analyzed: tidhā phassa cetanā ādayo tesam ca iva āhāra ādīnam ca vasena catudhā vedanā vitakka ādayo
translated: Contact, volition, etc., are a condition in four ways as the above and also as nutriment, etc. Feeling, applied thought, etc.,

original: tesañceva jhānindriyādīnañca vasena pañcadhā. Yathā samādhi, evaṃ vīriyampi daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: tesam ca iva jhānindriya ādīnam ca vasena pañcadhā yathā samādhi evam vīriyam pi daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: are a condition in five ways as the above and also as jhāna, faculty, etc. So too, energy should be regarded.

original: Tampi hi adhipatindriyamaggapaccayehi chadhā paccayo hoti.
analyzed: tat pi hi adhipati indriya magga paccayehi chadhā paccayaḥ hoti
translated: For that is a condition in six ways as predominance, faculty, and path conditions.

original: “Vacanavasenā”ti iminā imasmiṃ catukke sahajātapaccayaṃ dhuraṃ katvā desanā pavattāti
analyzed: vacana vasena ati iminā imasmin catukke sahajāta paccayam dhuram katvā desanā pavattā ati
translated: By the words “in the sense” he shows that in this tetrad the teaching proceeds by making the conascence condition the principal one.

original: tesaṃ adhippāyoti dasseti. Atthoti paccayadhammo. Katthacīti kismiñci vāre attano
analyzed: tesam adhippāyaḥ ti dasseti attho ti paccaya dhammo katthaci iti kismiñci vāre attano
translated: The meaning is the conditioned states. In some instance, in some turn,

original: paccayuppannassa yathāsakehi paccayo na na hoti. “Atthato”ti ca pāṭho. “Bhavapaccayā
analyzed: paccaya uppannassa yathāsakehi paccayaḥ na na hoti atthataḥ ti ca pāṭhaḥ bhava paccayā
translated: it is not that the condition is not a condition for what is originated by the condition. The reading is also “atthato.”🔽With the words “With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘With the words ‘

original: jātī”tiādi na vattabbaṃ siyā, vuttañca taṃ. Tasmā sahajātapaccayavaseneva paṭhamacatukko🔽vuttoti na gahetabbanti dasseti. Tenāha “na ca taṃ na vutta”ntiādi. Imassa ca “bhavapaccayā
analyzed: jāti itiādi na vattabbam siyā vuttam ca tam tasmā sahajāta paccaya vasena iva paṭhama catukkaḥ  vuttaḥ iti na gahetabbanti dasseti tena āha na ca tam na vutta ntiādi imassa ca bhava paccayā
translated: and so on, could not be stated, but it is stated. Therefore he shows that the first tetrad should not be taken as stated by way of the conascent condition. Hence he says, “But that is not unstated.” And the connection of this with the words “and so on” should be understood as follows: “Bhava-paccayā jāti could not be stated.”

original: jātītiādi na vattabbaṃ siyā”ti iminā sambandho veditabbo. Paccayavacanamevāti “avijjāpaccayā”tiādīsu
analyzed: jāti itiādi na vattabbam siyā iti iminā sambandhaḥ veditabbaḥ paccaya vacanam eva ati avijjā paccaya atiādīsu
translated: “The words of the condition” means the words of the condition stated in the passage beginning “With ignorance as condition there are formations.”

original: vuttapaccayavacanameva ca. Tesanti tesaṃ ācariyānaṃ. Ayojetvā vuttanti sambandho.🔽Kathaṃ pana vuttanti āha “sāmaññena…pe… sandhāya vutta”nti. Ettha ca “sahajātasūcaka”ntiādinā
analyzed: vutta paccaya vacanam eva ca tesan ti tesam ācariyānam a yojetvā vuttan ti sambandhaḥ  katham pana vuttanti āha sandhāya vuttanti ettha ca sahajāta sūcaka nti ādinā
translated: “Their” = the teachers’. The construction is: “without connecting.”

original: yathādhippetassa atthassa vacanato asiddhimāha, “sahajātato”tiādinā pana atthāpattito.
analyzed: yathā adhippetassa atthassa vacanataḥ asiddhim āha sahajāta to ti ādinā pana atthāpattitaḥ
translated: But how is it stated? He says: “In general … referring to … stated.” And here he shows non-establishment by the words “signifying conascence” and so on, because of the statement of the meaning intended. But he shows the contradiction of the meaning by the words “from the conascent” and so on.

original: Asambhave hi aññassa atthato sijjheyya vacanato vā atthato vā adhippetatthasādhanāti.
analyzed: asambhave hi aññassa atthataḥ sijjheyya vacanataḥ vā atthataḥ vā adhippeta ttha sādhanā ti
translated: For if there is no other, it would be established either by the statement or by the meaning.

original: Aññatthāti aññasmiṃ sutte. Atītaddhaṃ niddhāretvā paccuppannānāgatehi saddhiṃ addhattayadassanatthaṃ.🔽Taṃdesanāpariggahatthanti mahānidānadesanāpariggahatthaṃ. So ca ubhinnaṃ desanānaṃ
analyzed: aññattha ati aññasmin sutte atīta ddham niddhāretvā paccuppanna anāgatehi saddhim  tat desanā pariggaha ttham ti mahānidāna desanā pariggaha ttham saḥ ca ubhinnam desanānam
translated: ‘In another place’ means in another sutta. It is for the purpose of showing the two-and-a-half aggregates in the present and future by excluding the past aggregate.

original: aññamaññaṃ saṃsandanabhāvadassanatthaṃ. Evaṃ sabbaññubuddhabhāsitā desanā aññadatthu saṃsandatīti.
analyzed: aññam aññam saṃsandana bhāva dassana attham evam sabbaññu buddha bhāsitā desanā añña datthu saṃsandati iti
translated: ‘For the purpose of discerning the teaching’: for the purpose of discerning the teaching of the Great Discourse on Causation. And that is for the purpose of showing the mutual connection of the two teachings. Thus the teaching spoken by the Omniscient Buddha is connected in another way.

original: Imassāti imassa tatiyavārassa.
analyzed: imassa ati imassa tatiya vārassa
translated: ‘This’: this third section.

original: Aparāpekkhatāya, aparikiliṭṭhupapattitāya, asuciamakkhitatāya kāmāvacaradevānaṃ,
analyzed: apara apekkha tāya aparikiliṭṭha upapatti tāya asuci amakkhita tāya kāmāvacara devānam
translated: The predominance of the apparitional birth should be understood as follows: because of the absence of looking for another womb, the absence of defilement by the womb, and the absence of defilement by the womb’s discharge, among the gods of the sense sphere,

original: sabbesañca brahmānaṃ tathā upapajjanato ca opapātikayoniyā padhānatā veditabbā. Saṅgahanidassanavasenāti🔽opapātikayoniyā eva saṃsedajayoniyā saṅgahassa nidassanavasena udāharaṇavasena. Ārammaṇapaccayassāpi
analyzed: sabbesam ca brahmānam tathā upapajjanato ca opapātika yoniyā padhāna tā veditabbā saṅgaha nidassana vasena ati  opapātika yoniyā eva saṃseda ja yoniyā saṅgahassa nidassana vasena udāharaṇa vasena ārammaṇa paccayassa api
translated: and because of being reborn in that way among all the Brahmas. ‘By way of showing the inclusion’:🔽by way of showing the inclusion of the apparitional birth in the egg-born birth by way of an example. Although the condition of object

original: phassassa satipi pavattihetubhāve so pana sahajātādipaccayabhūtassa ajjhattikassa
analyzed: phassassa sati pi pavatti hetu bhāve saḥ pana sahajāta ādi paccaya bhūtassa ajjhattikassa
translated: exists for contact, it is a condition for the internal

original: chaṭṭhāyatanassa viya na sātisayoti vuttaṃ “ārammaṇapaccayo cettha pavattako na hotī”ti.
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatanassa viya na sa atisayaḥ ti vuttam ārammaṇa paccayo ca ittha pavattakaḥ na hoti iti
translated: and it is not said that it is a condition in the way stated for the sixfold base.

original: Kesañcīti paripuṇṇāyatanānaṃ gabbhaseyyakānaṃ. “Pacchima…pe… sadā sambhavatī”ti idaṃ
analyzed: kesañci iti paripuṇṇa āyatanānam gabbhaseyyakānam pacchima pe sadā sambhavati iti idam
translated: “Some” are those who are fully formed in the womb. “The last” is the last of the three kinds of rebirth-linking. “Always” means that it is always.

original: gabbhaseyyakānaṃ viya itarayonikānaṃ kamena āyatanuppatti natthīti vuttaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: gabbhaseyyakānam viya itara yonikānam kamena āyatana uppatti natthi iti vuttam tathā
translated: This is said because there is no rebirth-linking for those born from the womb in the way there is for those born from eggs, etc.

original: cāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “sahuppattidīpanato”ti.
analyzed: ca āha aṭṭhakathā ayam sahuppatti dīpanato ti
translated: And so it is said in the commentary: “Because it illustrates co-arising” .🔽The section on the four conditions is ended

original: Paccayacatukkavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Hetucatukkavaṇṇanā🔽244. Abhāvatoti bhāvābhāvato. Yañhi jātikkhaṇamatteyeva bhavati, na tato paraṃ, taṃ
analyzed: paccaya catukka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  hetu catukka vaṇṇanā  abhāvato ti bhāva abhāvato yat hi bhavati na tatas param tam
translated: The exposition of the four conditions is ended.🔽2. Exposition of the four causes🔽“Because of non-existence”: because of the non-existence of what is present. For what is present only at the moment of birth and not afterwards

original: jātiyā avigatapaccayo siyā avigatapaccayaniyamasabbhāvato. Bhavo pana yasmā jātikkhaṇato
analyzed: jātiyāḥ avigata paccayo siyā avigata paccaya niyama sabbhāvataḥ bhavaḥ pana yasmā jāti kkhaṇato
translated: Because of non-existence: because of non-presence. For that which exists only at the moment of birth and not afterwards is a condition for birth that is not dissociated from it, because it is invariably a condition for it. But since existence exists after the moment of birth,

original: parampi bhavati, tasmā na so tassā avigatapaccayo hoti. Tena vuttaṃ “tato uddhaṃ
analyzed: param pi bhavati tasmā na saḥ tassā avigata paccayaḥ hoti tena vuttam tatas uddham
translated: it is not a condition for birth that is not dissociated from it. That is why it is said: “The meaning is that it exists afterwards.”

original: bhāvatoti attho”ti. Bhaveti bhavapade, bhave vā nipphādetabbe. Esa nayo jātiādīsūti
analyzed: bhāvato ti attho ti bhava iti bhava pade bhave vā nipphādetabbe esa nayaḥ jāti ādīsu iti
translated: In the state of existence: in the state of becoming, or in the production that is called “existence.” The same method applies to birth, etc.

original: etthāpi. “Yathā panā”tiādinā “avigatapaccayassa abhāvato, niyamābhāvato cā”ti vuttānaṃ
analyzed: ettha api yathā pana ati ādinā avigata paccayassa abhāvataḥ niyama abhāvataḥ ca ati vuttānam
translated: Herein, “But as to the words ‘because there is no condition that is not abandoned’ and ‘because there is no rule’ ” , etc.,

original: hetūnaṃ vuttanayena abyāpibhāvavibhāvanena akāraṇataṃ dasseti ayāvabhāvino paccayuppannassa,🔽paccayadhammassa ca avigatapaccayabhāvadassanato. Saṅkhārakkhandhetiādi maggasodhanavasena🔽vuttaṃ. Tassa parihāraṃ sayameva vadati. So khaṇo etassa atthīti taṅkhaṇiko, na taṅkhaṇiko
analyzed: hetūnam vutta nayena abyāpi bhāva vibhāvanena akāraṇa tam dasseti ayāvabhāvino paccaya uppannassa  paccaya dhammassa ca avigata paccaya bhāva dassanato saṅkhāra kkhandha itiādi magga sodhana vasena  vuttam tassa parihāram sayam eva vadati saḥ khaṇaḥ etassa atthi iti taṅkhaṇikaḥ na taṅkhaṇikaḥ
translated: Here too, by the words “But if it is asked, etc.,” he shows that the conditions are not causes because they do not pervade, in the way stated, by the absence of the condition of non-disappearance and by the absence of a rule .

original: ataṅkhaṇiko, tassa sabbhāvā, ayāvabhāvikasabbhāvāti attho. Yathā pana hetū honti,
analyzed: ataṅkhaṇikaḥ tassa sabbhāvāḥ ayāvabhāvika sabbhāvā ti atthaḥ yathā pana hetū honti
translated: For the arisen, which is not of the nature to last, has the condition of non-disappearance as a condition, and the condition itself has the condition of non-disappearance.

original: taṃ dassetuṃ “saṅkhatalakkhaṇānaṃ panā”tiādimāha.🔽Evanti evaṃ yathāvuttanaye sati, evaṃ santeti attho. “Na hi…pe… atthī”ti iminā jātiādīnaṃ
analyzed: tam dassetum saṅkhata lakkhaṇānam pana ati ādim āha  evam ti evam yathā vutta naye sati evam santā iti atthaḥ na hipe atthi iti iminā jāti ādīnam
translated: The words “The aggregate of formations, etc.” are said in order to purify the path. He himself gives the answer to that:🔽It has that moment, thus it is of that moment; not of that moment is not-of-that-moment. It has the nature of that, thus it is of the nature of that; the meaning is, it has the nature of what is not of the nature to last. But in order to show how they are conditions, he says, “But the characteristics of the formed, etc.”

original: avigatapaccayavasena paccayuppannabhāvo viya paccayabhāvopi natthīti dasseti. Tattha
analyzed: avigata paccaya vasena paccaya uppanna bhāvaḥ viya paccaya bhāvaḥ api natthi iti dasseti tattha
translated: Thus: if it is so, in the way stated; if it is thus, is the meaning. By the words “For there is no … condition” he shows that, just as there is no state of being arisen with the condition of non-disappearance as condition, so too there is no state of being a condition. Herein,

original: kāraṇamāha “asabhāvadhammattā”ti.
analyzed: kāraṇam āha asabhāva dhamma ttā iti
translated: He gives the reason: “because they are not of the nature of conditions.”

original: Kathaṃ pana asabhāvadhammānaṃ jātiādīnaṃ paccayuppannatā, paccayatā cāti āha “jāyamānānaṃ
analyzed: katham pana asabhāva dhammānam jāti ādīnam paccaya uppanna tā paccaya tā ca ati āha jāyamānānam
translated: But how can birth, etc., which are not of the nature of conditions, be the prenascent and the object-condition for aging-and-death? He says: “For the prenascent …

original: panā”tiādi. Tassāti jātijarāmaraṇassa. Vattabbapadesoti “ṭhapetvā”ti vattabbapadeso.
analyzed: pana atiādi tassa ati jāti jarā maraṇassa vattabba padeso ti ṭhapetvā ati vattabba padeso
translated: of the states … ” The “states” are birth, aging, and death. The “word to be supplied” is “except.”

original: Ko pana soti? Yathāvuttaṃ nāmaṃ, nāmarūpañca saṅkhārakkhandhena rūpakkhandhena ca🔽jarāmaraṇānaṃ saṅgahitattā. “Yo bhavo jātiyā paccayo”ti etena bhavasaṅgahitānipi
analyzed: kaḥ pana saḥ ti yathāvuttam nāmam nāma rūpam ca saṅkhāra kkhandhena rūpa kkhandhena ca  jarā maraṇānam saṅgahita ttā yaḥ bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayaḥ ti etena bhava saṅgahitāni pi
translated: But what is that? The name stated as above and the materiality included in the formations aggregate and the materiality aggregate,

original: jātiādīni jātiyā appaccayattā eva “ṭhapetvā”ti na vuttānīti dasseti, paccayabhāvāsaṅkā
analyzed: jāti ādīni jātiyāḥ appaccaya ttā eva ṭhapetvā ati na vuttāni iti dasseti paccaya bhāva āsaṅkā
translated: because aging-and-death is included in the aggregates of feeling, perception, and consciousness. By the words “Becoming is a condition, as kamma condition, for kamma-originated mentality-materiality” he shows that birth, etc., included in becoming are not stated as “except” because they are not conditions for aging-and-death, though they are for birth.

original: eva nesaṃ tassā natthīti adhippāyo. Teneva ṭhapetabbagahetabbavisese satīti sāsaṅkaṃ vadati.🔽Hetucatukkavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: eva nesam tassā natthi iti adhippāyaḥ tena iva ṭhapetabba gahetabba visese sati iti sa āsaṅkam vadati  hetu catukka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The intention is that there is no doubt that they are not conditions for it. That is why he says “if there were a distinction to be made as to what should be excepted and what should be included.”🔽The section on the four conditions is ended.

original: 4. Aññamaññacatukkavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aññamañña catukka vaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the two conditions of mutuality

original: 246. Paccayuppannassāti paccayuppannabhāvino. Visuṃ ṭhitassāti bhavena asaṅgahitassa.
analyzed: paccaya uppannassa ati paccaya uppanna bhāvinaḥ visum ṭhitassa ati bhavena asaṅgahitassa
translated: “Prenascent” means “arisen before.” “Distinct” means not included in becoming.

original: Sappadesameva gahitaṃ idha vedanādikkhandhattayasseva adhippetattā niruḷhattā ca.
analyzed: sa ppadesam eva gahitam idha vedanā ādi khandha ttayassa iva adhippeta ttā niruḷha ttā ca
translated: For only the place of origin is taken here, since only the three aggregates beginning with feeling are intended and are well known.

original: Paccayuppannaṃ ṭhapetvā paccayabhūtaṃyeva nāmaṃ gahitaṃ, avigatapaccayaniyamābhāvo
analyzed: paccaya uppannam ṭhapetvā paccaya bhūtam yeva nāmam gahitam avigata paccaya niyama abhāvaḥ
translated: Only the name of the condition is taken, leaving aside the name of the resultant, because there is no fixed conditionality of non-disappearance,

original: viya bhave upādānassa aññamaññapaccayaniyamābhāvoti yojanā. Vuttanayenāti “saṅkhatalakkhaṇānaṃ
analyzed: viya bhave upādānassa aññamañña paccaya niyama abhāvaḥ ti yojanā vutta nayena āti
translated: like that of becoming in relation to clinging. The construction is this: “There is no fixed conditionality of mutual conditionality in becoming in relation to clinging.”

original: panā”tiādinā vuttanayena.
analyzed: pana ati ādinā vutta nayena
translated: “In the aforesaid way” means in the way stated in the passage beginning, “The characteristics of the formed, however” .

original: Aññamaññapaccayo viya aññamaññapaccayoti ayamattho idhādhippetoti dassento “aññamañña…pe…
analyzed: aññamañña paccayaḥ viya aññamañña paccayo ti ayam atthaḥ idha adhippeto ti dassento aññamaññape
translated: The meaning intended here is “mutual conditionality like mutual conditionality,” showing this, he said, “mutual conditionality … is intended.”

original: adhippeto siyā”ti āha. Tathā ca vadanti “aññamaññañcettha na paṭṭhāne āgataaññamaññavasena
analyzed: adhippetaḥ siyā ti āha tathā ca vadanti aññamaññam ca ittha na paṭṭhāne āgata aññamañña vasena
translated: And they say this: “Here mutual conditionality should not be taken as mutual conditionality that has come down in the Paṭṭhāna.”

original: gahetabba”nti. Cakkhāyatanupacayādīnanti uparūpari citāni viya uppannacakkhāyatanādīni,
analyzed: gahetabbanti cakkha āyatana upacaya ādīnam upari upari citāni viya uppanna cakkha āyatana ādīni
translated: The “accumulation of the eye base, etc.” are the eye bases, etc., that have arisen like layers one above the other,

original: cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ vā upatthambhakāni cakkhāyatanupacayādīni.
analyzed: cakkhu āyatana ādīnam vā upatthambhakāni cakkhu āyatana upacaya ādīni
translated: or the accumulation of the eye base, etc., are those that support the eye base, etc.

original: Aññamaññacatukkavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aññamañña catukka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on mutual conditionality is finished.

original: Saṅkhārādimūlakanayamātikāvaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the mātikā of the method based on formations, etc.

original: 247. Yadipi sāmaññato gataviseso, tathāpi sāmaññaggahaṇena nayagato viseso sarūpato
analyzed: yadi pi sāmaññataḥ gata viseso tathā api sāmañña ggahaṇena naya gataḥ viseso sarūpataḥ
translated: Although the distinction has been stated in a general way, still the distinction that is to be understood is stated in its individual essence by the words “in a general way.”

original: dassito hotīti “nāmapaccayā avijjā”ti vatvāpi nāmavisesānaṃ tassā paccayabhāvo dassetabboti🔽āha “nāmavisesānaṃ…pe… vuttā”ti. “Yadeva pana nāma”ntiādi kasmā vuttaṃ, nanu nāmaggahaṇena
analyzed: dassitaḥ hoti iti nāma paccayāḥ avijjā ti vatvā api nāma visesānam tassā paccaya bhāvaḥ dassetabbo ti  āha nāma visesānam pe vuttā ati yat eva pana nāma nti ādi kasmā vuttam nanu nāma ggahaṇena
translated: Although the distinction has been stated in a general way, still the distinction that is included in the method is shown in its individual essence by the general statement. Therefore, although it is said, “With name as condition, ignorance,” the conditionality of the distinctions of name must be shown.🔽Thus he says, “The conditionality of the distinctions of name, etc., is stated.”🔽Why is it said, “But what is that name, etc.,” since birth, etc., which are not included in the statement of name, are shown to be included in the statement of becoming?

original: aggahitopi jātiādi bhavaggahaṇena gahitoti dassitovāyamatthoti codanaṃ sandhāyāha🔽“bhavaggahaṇena cā”tiādi. Idhāpīti “bhavapaccayā avijjā”ti idhāpi. Na siyāti “avijjāpaccayā
analyzed: aggahitaḥ api jāti ādi bhava ggahaṇena gahitaḥ iti dassitaḥ uva ayam attho ti codanam sandhāya āha  bhava ggahaṇena ca atiādi idha api iti bhava paccayā avijjā ati idha api na siyā ati avijjā paccayā
translated: The answer is, “And also by the statement of becoming,” etc.🔽Here also means also in the statement, “With becoming as condition, ignorance.”🔽It would not be said means it would not be said, “With ignorance as condition, ignorance.”

original: avijjā”ti vuttaṃ na siyā. Tasmāti yasmā sāmaññacoditaṃ visesacoditameva na hoti,
analyzed: avijjā iti vuttam na siyā tasmā iti yasmā sāmañña coditam visesa coditam eva na hoti
translated: Therefore means because the distinction that is stated in a general way is not stated in a particular way.

original: tasmā. Soti bhavo. Tenāti sabhāvāsabhāvadhammasaṅgahaṇena.
analyzed: tasmā saḥ ti bhavaḥ tena ati sabhāva asabhāva dhamma saṅgahaṇena
translated: That means becoming. By that means by the inclusion of states that are of the same nature and those that are not.

original: Upādānassapi bhavekadesattā vuttaṃ “upādānapaccayā…pe… aggahite”ti. “Bhavapaccayā
analyzed: upādānassa api bhava ekadesa ttā vuttam upādāna paccaya āpe aggahitā iti bhava paccayā
translated: Since clinging is a part of becoming, it is said, “With clinging as condition, etc., are not included.”

original: jātī”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ sandhāyāha “bhavasaddo…pe… vuccamāno”ti. “Nāmapaccayā avijjā”ti
analyzed: jāti iti idam vacanam sandhāya āha bhava sadda ope vuccamānaḥ iti nāma paccayā avijjā ti
translated: “The word ‘becoming’ is said to be a designation for the four aggregates that occur in the three planes of existence.” “The word ‘name’ is said to be a designation for the four aggregates that are not material.”

original: ettha paccayuppannaṃ ṭhapetvā paccayassa gahaṇato avijjāvinimuttā eva cattāro khandhā
analyzed: ettha paccaya uppannam ṭhapetvā paccayassa gahaṇataḥ avijjā vinimuttāḥ eva cattāro khandhāḥ
translated: Herein, the aggregates are called “name” because the word “name” is used to denote the four aggregates that are not material.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas.

original: nāmasaddena vuccantīti āha “na nāmasaddo niravasesabodhako”ti. Na cettha ekaṃsato
analyzed: nāma saddena vuccanti iti āha na nāma saddaḥ niravasesa bodhakaḥ ti na ca ittha ekaṃsataḥ
translated: The word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.

original: kāraṇaṃ maggitabbaṃ. Yena bhava-saddo niravasesabodhako, na nāma-saddoti āha “evaṃsabhāvā🔽hi etā niruttiyo”ti. Iminā adhippāyenāti bhavasaddo niravasesabodhako upādinnacatukkhandhavisayattāti
analyzed: kāraṇam maggitabbam yena bhava saddaḥ niravasesa bodhakaḥ na nāma saddaḥ iti āha evam sabhāvā  hi etāḥ niruttiyaḥ ti iminā adhippāyena ati bhava saddaḥ niravasesa bodhakaḥ upādinna catukkhandha visaya ttā ti
translated: The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.

original: iminā adhippāyena. Jāyamānādidhammavikārabhāvato jāyamānādikkhandhapaṭibaddhā jātiādayo
analyzed: iminā adhippāyena jāyamāna ādi dhamma vikāra bhāvataḥ jāyamāna ādi kkhandha paṭibaddhāḥ jāti ādayaḥ
translated: The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.

original: vucceyyuṃ, na pana jātiādipaṭibaddhā jāyamānādikkhandhāti na ekacittakkhaṇe jātiādīnaṃ
analyzed: vucceyyum na pana jāti ādi paṭibaddhāḥ jāyamāna ādi kkhandhā ti na eka citta khaṇe jāti ādīnam
translated: The word “name” is not used to denote all dhammas, but the word “becoming” is used to denote all dhammas.🔽The

original: avijjāya paccayabhāvo sambhavatīti imamatthamāha “jāyamānānaṃ panā”tiādinā. Nānācittakkhaṇe
analyzed: avijjāya paccaya bhāvaḥ sambhavati iti imam attham āha jāyamānānam pana ati ādinā nānā citta kkhaṇe
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the words “But as to the arising of the aggregates” .🔽But birth, etc., are a condition for ignorance only in the sense of decisive support in the case of the arising of the aggregates in different consciousness moments.

original: pana jātiādayo avijjāya upanissayapaccayo hontīti “ekacittakkhaṇe”ti visesitaṃ. Tenevāti asambhaveneva.
analyzed: pana jāti ādayaḥ avijjāya upanissaya paccayaḥ honti iti eka citta kkhaṇa iti visesitam tena eva ati asambhavena iva
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible,

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Schedule is ended.

original: Akusalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: akusala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the description of unprofitable kamma

original: 248-9. Tanti diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Itarassāti kāmupādānassa. Taṇhāgahaṇenāti “taṇhāpaccayā”ti
analyzed: tat ti diṭṭhupādānam itarassa ati kāma upādānassa taṇhā gahaṇena ati taṇhā paccayā ti
translated: Tanti diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Itarassāti kāmupādānassa. Taṇhāgahaṇenāti “taṇhāpaccayā”ti

analyzed: ettha taṇhā gahaṇena gahita ttā yadi evam nāma gahaṇena gahitā taṇhā kasmā puna vuttā ati
translated: ettha taṇhāgahaṇena gahitattā. Yadi evaṃ nāmaggahaṇena gahitā taṇhā kasmā puna vuttāti

original: āha “nāme viya visesapaccayattābhāvā”ti. “Nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatana”nti ettha hi
analyzed: āha nāme viya visesa paccaya ttā abhāvā ti nāma paccayā chaṭṭha āyatanan ti ettha hi

analyzed: atthi tattha visesa paccaya ttam upādānassa pana bhava saṅgahaḥ api atthi iti taṇhā paccayā

analyzed: upādānam ti etena kāma upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ ti etassa nattha iva viseso ti vuttam nāme

analyzed: viya visesa paccaya ttā abhāvāti taṇhā etissā paccayaḥ ti taṇhā paccayā diṭṭhi bhavassa

analyzed: paccaya bhūtā ti duvidhassa api bhavassa kāraṇa bhūtā ubhayena api upādānassa bhava niddese

analyzed: ṭhapetabba tam yeva vibhāveti paccaya uppannam paccayaḥ ca ekam eva ati taṇhā paccayā upādānam ti
translated: “Craving is a condition for clinging” is the same as “With craving as condition, clinging.”🔽“Craving is a condition for clinging” is the same as “With craving as condition, clinging.”

original: ettha vuttapaccayuppannaṃ, “upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti ettha vuttapaccayo ca eko evattho,🔽tasmā paccayo visuṃ paccayuppannato bhinnaṃ katvā na vibhatto.
analyzed: ettha vutta paccaya uppannam upādāna paccayā bhavo ti ettha vutta paccayaḥ ca ekaḥ eva attho  tasmā paccayaḥ visum paccaya uppannataḥ bhinnam katvā na vibhattaḥ
