original: 252. Upatthambhakasamuṭṭhāpanapacchājātapaccayavasenāti upatthambhakassa cittasamuṭṭhānarūpassa samuṭṭhāpanavasena, pacchājātapaccayavasena ca.
analyzed: upatthambhaka samuṭṭhāpana pacchājāta paccaya vasena ati upatthambhakassa citta samuṭṭhāna rūpassa samuṭṭhāpana vasena pacchājāta paccaya vasena ca
translated: “Craving is a condition for clinging” is the same as “With craving as condition, clinging.”🔽“Craving is a condition

original: 254. Pañcannanti cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ. Sahajātādipaccayoti sahajātanissayaatthiavigatādipaccayo.
analyzed: pañcannam ti cakkhu āyatana ādīnam pañcannam sahajāta ādi paccayaḥ ti sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata ādi paccayaḥ
translated: “Five”: the five beginning with the eye base. “Conascence condition, etc.,” means conascence, support, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance conditions.

original: Vatthusaṅkhātaṃ rūpaṃ. Purejātādipaccayoti purejātanissayavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayo.
analyzed: vatthu saṅkhātam rūpam purejāta ādi paccayaḥ ti purejāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigata paccayaḥ
translated: Materiality called “physical basis.” “Preceding, etc.,” means preceding, support, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance conditions.

original: Pacchājātādipaccayoti pacchājātavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayo. Chaṭṭhassa sahajātādīti
analyzed: pacchājāta ādi paccayaḥ ti pacchājāta vippayutta atthi avigata paccayaḥ chaṭṭhassa sahajāta ādi iti
translated: “Succeeding, etc.,” means succeeding, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance conditions. “The sixth, conascence, etc.,”

original: ādi-saddena aññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatādayo gahitā.
analyzed: ādi saddena aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata ādayaḥ gahitā
translated: means the sixth, which is the mind base, has conascence, etc., conditions. The word “etc.” includes mutuality, support, association, presence, non-disappearance conditions.

original: 264. Yassāti “yassa ca hotī”ti ettha vuttaṃ “yassā”ti padaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tenāha “hotīti yojetabba”nti.
analyzed: yassa ati yassa ca hoti iti ettha vuttam yassa ati padam sandhāya vuttam tena āha hoti iti yojetabbam ti
translated: “Whose”: this is said with reference to the words “and which is” in the passage “and which is the condition for the sixfold base” . That is why it is said, “the words ‘and which is’ should be construed” .

original: 280. Tassāti “balavakilesabhūtāya vicikicchāyā”ti padassa. Tenāti “taṇhāṭṭhāne”ti
analyzed: tassa ati balava kilesa bhūtāya vicikicchāya ati padassa tena ati taṇhā aṭṭhāna iti
translated: “That”: this is said with reference to the words “doubt, which is a strong defilement” . “That”: this is said with reference to the words “in the place of craving” .

original: padena. Cittuppādakaṇḍādīsūti ādi-saddena imasmiṃ paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅge suttantabhājanīyādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: padena cittuppāda kaṇḍa ādīsu iti ādi saddena imasmin paṭiccasamuppāda vibhaṅge suttanta bhājanīya ādim saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “The chapter on the production of consciousness, etc.,” etc.: the word “etc.” includes the suttas, the sections on the requisites, etc., in this exposition of dependent origination.

original: Akusalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: akusala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the description of the unprofitable is ended.

original: Kusalābyākataniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kusala abyākata niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the profitable and indeterminate

original: 306. Sabyāpārānīti saussāhāni, vipākadhammānīti attho. Parihīnaṃ avijjāṭṭhānaṃ etesanti parihīnāvijjāṭṭhānā.
analyzed: sa byāpārāni iti saussāhāni vipāka dhammāni iti attho parihīnam avijjāṭṭhānam etesan ti parihīna avijjāṭṭhānā
translated: With effort: with exertion; the meaning is, with ripening as their nature. They have abandoned the plane of ignorance: they have abandoned the plane of ignorance.

original: Sandhāyāti adhippāyaṃ vibhāvento viya vadati, sarūpeneva pana “na ca cakkhuviññāṇādīni rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpentī”ti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Nāmarūpaṃ na na labbhatīti yojanā.🔽Kusalābyākataniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sandhāya iti adhippāyam vibhāventaḥ viya vadati sarūpena iva pana na ca cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni rūpam samuṭṭhāpenti iti aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam nāma rūpam na na labbhati iti yojanā  kusala abyākata niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: He speaks as if he were explaining the intention, but in the commentary itself it is said: “Nor do eye-consciousness, etc., generate materiality,” and the construction is: “materiality is not not found.”

original: Avijjāmūlakakusalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: avijjā mūlaka kusala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the kinds of consciousness without root-cause is ended🔽. Description of the kinds of profitable consciousness with root-cause

original: 334. Kusalaphaleti kusalavipākapaṭisandhiviññāṇassa gahitattā tassa sādurasavisarukkhabījasadisatā vuttā.
analyzed: kusala phala iti kusala vipāka paṭisandhi viññāṇassa gahita ttā tassa sādu rasa visa rukkha bīja sadisa tā vuttā
translated: . In the fruit of profitable : because profitable resultant rebirth-linking consciousness is included, it is said to be like a tree with a straight trunk and good roots.

original: Yadipi “saṅkhārahetuka”ntiādinā yojanā labbhati, avigatacatukkādīni pana na labbhanti yathālābhayojanāya dassitattā.🔽Avijjāmūlakakusalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yadi api saṅkhāra hetukanti ādinā yojanā labbhati avigata catukka ādīni pana na labbhanti yathā lābha yojanāya dassita ttā  avijjā mūlaka kusala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Although the construction “with formations as its condition” is allowable, nevertheless the three tetrads beginning with the non-disappearance condition are not allowable because they have already been shown in the exposition of the kinds of consciousness according to the most important condition.🔽The description of the kinds of profitable consciousness with root-cause is ended

original: Kusalamūlakavipākaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kusala mūlaka vipāka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: . Description of the kinds of resultant consciousness with root-cause

original: 343. Kammaṃ viya paccayo hoti vipākabhāvatoti adhippāyo. Vipākassa kammaṃ paccayo
analyzed: kammam viya paccayaḥ hoti vipāka bhāvato ti adhippāyaḥ vipākassa kammam paccayaḥ
translated: The intention is that the condition is like kamma in being a condition for its result.

original: hontaṃ sātisayaṃ hotīti tassa nippariyāyatā, taṃsampayuttānaṃ pariyāyatā siyāti adhippāyena
analyzed: hontam sa atisayam hoti iti tassa nippariyāya tā tad sampayuttānam pariyāya tā siyāti adhippāyena
translated: When it is a condition for result it is a condition in a special sense. The intention is that it is a special condition for that, but it is a general condition for what is associated with it.

original: “pariyāyena upanissayapaccayoti vuttānī”ti āha. “Kusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa🔽upanissayapaccayena paccayo, akusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa, vipākadhammadhammo
analyzed: pariyāyena upanissaya paccayaḥ ti vuttāni iti āha kusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa  upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: So he said, “It is called a condition in a special sense, as a decisive-support condition.”

original: nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo”ti pana vacanato nippariyāyena
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ti pana vacanataḥ nippariyāyena
translated: “A profitable state is a condition, as a decisive-support condition, for a resultant state. An unprofitable state is a condition, as a decisive-support condition, for a resultant state. A state that is a kamma-result is a condition, as a decisive-support condition, for a state that is neither kamma nor a kamma-result” .

original: sabbepi kusalākusalā dhammā vipākassa upanissayapaccayo hotīti ayamattho dissati.🔽“Kusalamūlaṃ akusalamūla”nti imesaṃ anvādesopi paccayasaddāpekkhāya “esā”ti pulliṅgavasena
analyzed: sabbe api kusala akusalāḥ dhammāḥ vipākassa upanissaya paccayaḥ hoti iti ayam attho dissati  kusala mūlam akusala mūlam ti imesam anvādesaḥ api paccaya sadda apekkhāya esā ati pulliṅga vasena
translated: From this it appears that all profitable and unprofitable states are a condition, as a decisive-support condition, for a kamma-result.🔽The words “a profitable root, an unprofitable root” are in the masculine gender.

original: vuttoti dassento āha “esāti…pe… yojetabba”nti.
analyzed: vuttaḥ iti dassentaḥ āha esātipe yojetabbanti
translated: To show that this is because of the need for the word “condition” to be construed, he said “This … should be construed in the way beginning ‘This is a profitable root’” .

original: “Manasikāropī”tiādinā appahīnāvijjānampi kiriyāya kusalākusalamūlāni, avijjā ca upanissayā🔽na hontīti dasseti. Kammavaṭṭavipākavaṭṭabhūtāniyeva saṅkhāraviññāṇāni pacchimanaye
analyzed: manasikāraḥ upi iti ādinā appahīna avijjānam pi kiriyāya kusala akusala mūlāni avijjā ca upanissayā  na honti iti dasseti kamma vaṭṭa vipāka vaṭṭa bhūtāniyā iva saṅkhāra viññāṇāni pacchima naye
translated: “The wholesome and unwholesome roots and ignorance are not decisive support conditions for the kamma-formations and consciousness in the later method, though they are in the former method, because ignorance is not abandoned.”🔽The kamma-process and the resultant-process are represented by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the later method.🔽The meaning of the words “The kamma-process, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the later method.

original: adhippetānīti vuttaṃ “kiriyāni pana…pe… gacchantī”ti. Tesaṃ paccayānaṃ vasena anekappakāratoti adhippāyoti yojanā.🔽Navādibhedānanti navaaṭṭhasattachāti evaṃpabhedānaṃ. Catunnaṃ catukkānanti purimanaye
analyzed: adhippetāni iti vuttam kiriyāni pana pe gacchanti iti tesam paccayānam vasena aneka ppakārato ti adhippāyaḥ iti yojanā  nava ādi bhedānam anti catunnam purima naye
translated: The meaning of the words “In the former method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the former method.🔽The meaning of the words “In the latter method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the latter method.🔽The meaning of the words “In the former method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the former method.

original: pacchimanaye ca āgatānaṃ yathālābhaṃ catunnaṃ catunnaṃ catukkānaṃ. “Kusalākusalānaṃ🔽pana vipāke cā”ti ca-saddena kusalākusale cāti samuccetabboti āha “kusala…pe… vattabba”nti.
analyzed: pacchima naye ca āgatānam yathālābham catunnam catunnam catukkānam kusala akusalānam  pana vipāke ca āti ca saddena kusala akusale ca āti samuccetabbaḥ iti āha vattabbam ti
translated: The meaning of the words “In the latter method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the latter method.

original: Mūlapadekapaccayatāvasenāti mūlapadassa ekapaccayabhāvavasena upanissayapaccayatāvasena.
analyzed: mūla pada eka paccaya tā vasena ati mūla padassa eka paccaya bhāva vasena upanissaya paccaya tā vasena
translated: The meaning of the words “In the former method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the former method.🔽The meaning of the words “In the latter method, etc., is shown” is this: the kamma-process and the resultant-process are shown by the kamma-formations and consciousness in the latter method.

original: Ekasseva nayassāti kusalākusalesu avijjāmūlakassa, vipākesu kusalākusalamūlakassāti
analyzed: ekassa iva nayassa ati kusala akusalesu avijjā mūlakassa vipākesu kusala akusala mūlakassa ati
translated: By the single method: by the method of the single root, namely, ignorance, in the case of profitable and unprofitable kamma, and by the method of the two roots, namely, profitable and unprofitable, in the case of resultant-formation kamma.

original: evaṃ ekasseva nayassa vasena. Dhammapaccayabhedeti dhammassa paccayabhūtassa, paccayuppannassa
analyzed: evam ekassa iva nayassa vasena dhamma paccaya bhede ti dhammassa paccaya bhūtassa paccaya uppannassa
translated: By the division of conditions for states: by the division of conditions for states that are conditions for a state, or for a state that has arisen.

original: vā paccayabhāvena bhedeti imamatthaṃ dassento “avijjādīna”ntiādiṃ vatvā puna tameva🔽“taṃtaṃcittuppādā”tiādinā pakārantarena vibhāveti.
analyzed: vā paccaya bhāvena bheda iti imam attham dassentaḥ avijjā ādīn anti ādim vatvā puna tam eva  taṃ taṃ cittuppāda ati ādinā pakāra antarena vibhāva iti
translated: Having shown the meaning in this way, he again analyses it in another way with the words “With the arising of ignorance, etc.,”

original: Kusalamūlakavipākaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kusala mūlaka vipāka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of resultant-formation rooted in profitable kamma is ended.🔽The description of the Abhidhamma is ended.🔽The description of the Dependent Origination is ended.

original: Paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽7. Satipaṭṭhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: paṭiccasamuppāda vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sati paṭṭhāna vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Description of the Arousing of Mindfulness🔽The Description of the Basket of Suttas

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ🔽Uddesavāravaṇṇanā🔽355. Samānasaddavacanīyānaṃ atthānaṃ uddharaṇaṃ atthuddhāro. So yasmā saddatthavicāro🔽na hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “na idha…pe… atthadassana”nti. Pa-saddo padhānatthadīpako “paṇītā
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam  uddesa vāra vaṇṇanā  samāna sadda vacanīyānam atthānam uddharaṇam atthuddhāro saḥ yasmā saddattha vicāro  na hoti tasmā vuttam attha dassananti
translated: The Description of the Recitation-Section

original: dhammā”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: dhamma ati ādīsu viya
translated: The extraction of the meanings that are expressed by the same terms is the extraction of the meaning. Since there is no investigation of the meaning of the terms here, it is said, “Here, however, the meaning is not seen by the investigation of the terms.” The prefix pa- is used in the sense of pre-eminence, as in “excellent things” .

original: Anavassutatā anupakiliṭṭhatā. Tenāha “tadubhayavītivattatā”ti.
analyzed: an avassuta tā an upakiliṭṭha tā tena āha tad ubhaya vītivatta tā iti
translated: Non-greed and non-delusion. Hence it is said: “The transcending of both” .

original: Bhusatthaṃ pakkhandananti bhusatthavisiṭṭhaṃ pakkhandanaṃ anupavisanaṃ.🔽Assādassāti taṇhāya. “Niccaṃ attā”ti abhinivesavatthutāya diṭṭhiyā visesakāraṇānaṃ🔽cittadhammānaṃ taṇhāyapi vatthubhāvato visesaggahaṇaṃ, tathā kāyavedanānaṃ diṭṭhiyāpi🔽vatthubhāvasambhavato “visesenā”ti vuttaṃ. Sarāgavītarāgādivibhāgadvayavaseneva cittānupassanāya
analyzed: bhusattham pakkhandananti bhusattha visiṭṭham pakkhandanam anupavisanam  taṇhāya niccam attā ati abhinivesa vatthu tāya diṭṭhiyāḥ visesa kāraṇānam  citta dhammānam taṇhāya api vatthu bhāvataḥ visesa ggahaṇam tathā kāya vedanānam diṭṭhiyā api  vatthu bhāva sambhavataḥ visesena ati vuttam sa rāga vīta rāga ādi vibhāga dvaya vasena iva citta anupassanāya
translated: “The penetrating of the penetrable”: the penetrating, the entering into, what is penetrable, distinguished by the penetrable.🔽“The tasting of the taste”: of craving. The distinction of the mental states that are the cause of the distinction of the view that misapprehends the impermanent as permanent is made by the word “taste” in order to show that craving also has the same object as the view. Likewise, the distinction of the body and feeling is made by the word “taste” in order to show that the view also has the same object as craving. The contemplation of mind is said not to have reached the highest distinction because it is stated only in terms of the two distinctions of being associated with lust, etc., and being free from lust, etc.

original: vuttattā taṃ “nātipabhedagata”nti vuttaṃ. Dhammāti idha saññāsaṅkhārakkhandhā adhippetā,
analyzed: vutta ttā tam na ati pabheda gatan ti vuttam dhammā ti idha saññā saṅkhāra kkhandhāḥ adhippetā
translated: The word “mental objects” here refers to the aggregates of perception and formations.

original: saṅkhārakkhandho ca phassādivasena anekabhedoti dhammānupassanā “atipabhedagatā”ti
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho ca phassa ādi vasena aneka bhedaḥ ti dhamma anupassanā ati pabheda gatā ati
translated: The aggregate of formations is of many kinds, such as contact, etc. Therefore the contemplation of mental objects is said to have reached the highest distinction.

original: vuttā. Sarāgādivibhāgavasena soḷasabhedattā vā cittānupassanā nātipabhedagatā vuttā,
analyzed: vuttā sa rāga ādi vibhāga vasena soḷasa bheda ttā vā citta anupassanā na ati pabheda gatā vuttā
translated: Or the contemplation of mind is said not to have reached the highest distinction because it is of only sixteen kinds, distinguished by the distinctions of being associated with lust, etc.

original: sutte āgatanayena nīvaraṇādivasena anekabhedattā dhammānupassanā atipabhedagatā vuttā.
analyzed: sutte āgata nayena nīvaraṇa ādi vasena aneka bheda ttā dhamma anupassanā ati pabheda gatā vuttā
translated: The contemplation of ideas is said to have many divisions because of the many kinds of division such as the hindrances, etc., that are given in the texts.🔽The words “called the Path of Purification” should be brought in here too.

original: “Visuddhimaggoti vuttānī”ti ānetvā yojetabbaṃ. Tā anupassanā etesanti tadanupassanā,
analyzed: visuddhi maggaḥ ti vuttāni iti ānetvā yojetabbam tāḥ anupassanāḥ etesan ti tad anupassanā
translated: They are contemplations of that, thus they are contemplations of that ;

original: cittadhammānupassino puggalā, tesaṃ.
analyzed: citta dhamma anupassinaḥ puggalā tesam
translated: they are persons who contemplate mind and mental qualities, thus they are contemplations of that for them.

original: Tattha “asubhabhāvadassanenā”ti yathāṭhitavasenāpi yojanā labbhateva. Bhavoghassa
analyzed: tattha asubha bhāva dassanena ati yathā aṭhita vasena api yojanā labbhatā iva bhava oghassa
translated: Herein, the words “by seeing foulness” can be construed also as “by seeing as it actually is the nature of what is” .🔽The feeling is the footing for the flood of sense desires because of the taste of being.

original: vedanā vatthu bhavassādabhāvato. Niccaggahaṇavasenāti attābhinivesavisiṭṭhassa niccaggahaṇassa
analyzed: vedanā vatthu bhava ssāda bhāvataḥ nicca ggahaṇa vasena ati attā abhinivesa visiṭṭhassa nicca ggahaṇassa
translated: By the apprehension of permanence: by the apprehension of permanence specified by self-affixation.🔽For this is said: “Of a self that is permanent” .

original: vasena. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “sassatassa attano”ti. Oghesu vuttanayā eva yogāsavesupi
analyzed: vasena tathā hi vuttam oghesu vutta nayāḥ eva yoga āsavesu pi
translated: The application in the case of the taints is the same as that in the case of the floods.🔽The application in the case of the round is the same as that in the case of the knots.🔽The application in the case of the clingings is the same as that in the case of the floods.🔽The application in the case of the hindrances is the same as that in the case of the round.🔽The application in the case of the ties is the same as that in the case of the clingings.🔽The application in the case of the inherent tendencies is the same as that in the case of the ties.

original: yojanā atthato abhinnattāti te na gahitā. Niccaggahaṇavasenāti attābhinivesavisiṭṭhassa
analyzed: yojanā atthataḥ abhinna ttā ati te na gahitāḥ nicca ggahaṇa vasena ati attā abhinivesa visiṭṭhassa
translated: The application in the case of the taints is the same as that in the case of the inherent tendencies.🔽The application in the case of the floods is the same as that in the case of the taints.🔽The application in the case of the round is the same as that in the case of the floods.🔽The application in the case of the knots is the same as that in the case of the round.

original: niccaggahaṇassa vasena. Paṭhamoghatatiyacatutthaganthayojanāyaṃ vuttanayeneva kāyacittadhammānaṃ
analyzed: nicca ggahaṇassa vasena vutta nayena iva kāya citta dhammānam
translated: The application in the case of the clingings is the same as that in the case of the knots.🔽The application in the case of the hindrances is the same as that in the case of the clingings.🔽The application in the case of the inherent tendencies is the same as that in the case of the hindrances.🔽The application in the case of the taints is the same as that in the case of the inherent tendencies.🔽The application in the case of the floods is the same as that in the case of the taints.🔽The application in the case of the round is

original: itarupādānavatthutā gahetabbāti vedanāya diṭṭhupādānavatthutā dassitā. Tathā kāyavedanānaṃ
analyzed: itara upādāna vatthu tā gahetabbā ati vedanāya diṭṭha upādāna vatthu tā dassitā tathā kāya vedanānam
translated: The object of the grasping of views is shown by the words “the object of the grasping of views is the feeling of pleasure” .

original: chandadosāgativatthutā kāmoghabyāpādakāyaganthavatthutāvacanena vuttāti. Tenāha “avuttānaṃ
analyzed: chanda dosa āgati vatthu tā kā mogha byāpāda kāya gantha vatthu tā vacanena vuttā ati tena āha a vuttānam
translated: So too, the object of the lust for bodily form, etc., is shown by the words “the object of the flood of sensual desire, the object of the shackle of sensual desire, the object of the bodily tie of ill will” .

original: vuttanayena vatthubhāvo yojetabbo”ti.
analyzed: vutta nayena vatthu bhāvaḥ yojetabbaḥ ti
translated: That is why it is said: “The state of object of those not mentioned should be construed in the way already stated” .

original: Dhāraṇatā asammussanatā, anussaraṇameva vā. Ekatteti ekasabhāve nissaraṇādivasena.🔽Samāgamo sacchikiriyā. Satipaṭṭhānasabhāvo sammāsatitā niyyānasatitā samānabhāgatā
analyzed: dhāraṇa tā asammussana tā anussaraṇam eva vā ekattā iti eka sabhāve nissaraṇa ādi vasena  samāgamaḥ sacchikiriyā sati paṭṭhāna sabhāvo sammā sati tā niyyāna sati tā samāna bhāga tā
translated: “Retention” is non-forgetting. Or it is the remembering. “In unity” means in a single nature, as the escape, etc., are.🔽“The meeting” is the realization. “The nature of the establishment of mindfulness” is the state of right mindfulness. “The going out by means of mindfulness” is the state of mindfulness as the outlet. “The state of unity” is the state of a single category.

original: ekajātitā sabhāgatā. Purimasminti “ekatte nibbāne samāgamo ekattasamosaraṇa”nti etasmiṃ
analyzed: eka jāti tā sabhāga tā purimasmin ti ekatte nibbāne samāgamaḥ ekatta samosaraṇam ti etasmin
translated: “In the former” , in the meaning “the meeting in unity is the coming together in unity” .

original: atthe. Visunti nānāatthadvayabhāvena. Tadeva gamanaṃ samosaraṇanti satisaddatthantarābhāvā…pe…
analyzed: atthe nānā attha dvaya bhāvena tat eva gamanam
translated: “The diversity” is the twofold meaning of “unity” . The “going” is the same as the “coming together” . …

original: ekabhāvassāti yojetabbaṃ. Satisaddatthavasena avuccamāneti “eko satipaṭṭhānasabhāvo
analyzed: eka bhāvassa iti yojetabbam sati saddattha vasena a vuccamāna iti ekaḥ sati paṭṭhāna sabhāvaḥ
translated: “The state of unity” should be construed as follows: “The state of unity is the state of a single category” .🔽“The state of the establishment of mindfulness” is not mentioned as a meaning of the word satipatthāna.

original: ekatta”ntiādinā avuccamāne, “ekatte nibbāne samāgamo ekattasamosaraṇa”nti evaṃ vuccamāneti🔽attho. Dhāraṇatāva satīti “saraṇatā”ti vuttadhāraṇatā eva satīti katvā. Satisaddatthantarābhāvāti
analyzed: ekatta nti ādinā a vuccamāne ekatte nibbāne samāgamaḥ ekatta samosaraṇam ti evam vuccamānā iti  atthaḥ dhāraṇatā ava satī iti saraṇatā ati vutta dhāraṇatā eva satī iti katvā
translated: If it were not said thus, then when it is said thus, “The unification in the extinction that is one” it would be necessary to construe it thus: “The unification is the coming together, the unification in the extinction that is one.”

original: satisaṅkhātassa saraṇekattasamosaraṇasaddatthato aññassa atthassa abhāvā. Purimanti🔽saraṇapadaṃ. Nibbānasamosaraṇepīti yathāvutte dutiye atthe saraṇekattasamosaraṇapadāni🔽sahitāneva satipaṭṭhānekabhāvassa ñāpakāni, evaṃ nibbānasamosaraṇepi “ekatte nibbāne
analyzed: sati saṅkhātassa saraṇa ikatta samosaraṇa sadda tthataḥ aññassa atthassa abhāvā purimanti  saraṇa padam nibbāna samosaraṇe pi iti yathā vutte dutiye atthe saraṇa ikatta samosaraṇa padāni  sahitāni eva sati paṭṭhāna eka bhāvassa ñāpakāni evam nibbāna samosaraṇe pi ekatte nibbāne
translated: The meaning is this. “The state of being a refuge is present”: the state of being a refuge is present, taking it thus. “Because there is no other meaning for the word ‘recollection’”: because there is no other meaning for the word “recollection” which is a synonym for the state of being a refuge, the unification in the coming together.🔽The first:🔽the expression “refuge.” “In the case of the coming together in extinction too”: just as the expressions “the unification in the coming together” and “the unification in the coming together in the one extinction” are the reasons for the establishment of the single state of recollection in the case of the second meaning stated thus,

original: samāgamo ekattasamosaraṇa”nti etasmimpi atthe sati…pe… kāraṇāni.
analyzed: samāgamaḥ etasmim pi atthe kāraṇāni
translated: so too in the case of the coming together in extinction: “The unification in the extinction that is one is the coming together, the unification in the coming together in the extinction that is one.”

original: Ānāpānapabbādīnanti ānāpānapabbairiyāpathacatusampajañña koṭṭhāsa dhātumanasikāranavasivathikapabbānīti
analyzed: āna apāna pabba ādīnam ti āna apāna pabba airiyāpatha catu sampajañña koṭṭhāsa dhātu manasikāra nava sivathika pabbāni iti
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of in-breathing and out-breathing, the postures, the four kinds of full awareness, the parts of the meditation subject, the directions for attention, and the surmountings.

original: etesaṃ. Imesu pana yasmā kesuci devānaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ na ijjhati, tasmā tāni anāmasitvā
analyzed: etesam imesu pana yasmā kasuci devānam kammaṭṭhānam na ijjhati tasmā tāni an āmasitvā
translated: In these, however, some meditators’ meditation subject does not succeed. Therefore, without mentioning them,

original: yadipi koṭṭhāsadhātumanasikāravasenevettha desanā pavattā, desanantare pana āgataṃ
analyzed: yadi pi koṭṭhāsa dhātu manasikāra vasena iva itthā desanā pavattā desana antare pana āgatam
translated: although the teaching here proceeds by way of the parts and elements,

original: anavasesaṃ kāyānupassanāvibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ “cuddasavidhena kāyānupassanaṃ bhāvetvā”ti
analyzed: anavasesam kāya anupassanā vibhāgam dassetum cuddasavidhena kāya anupassanam bhāvetvā ati
translated: in order to show the exposition of the contemplation of the body in its entirety, which is given in another text,🔽it is said, “Having developed the contemplation of the body in its fourteen aspects.” Hence it is said, “as given in the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tenāha “mahāsatipaṭṭhānasutte vuttāna”nti. “Tathā”ti iminā “mahāsatipaṭṭhānasutte🔽vuttāna”nti imameva upasaṃharati. Pañcavidhenāti nīvaraṇaupādānakkhandhāyatanabojjhaṅgaariyasaccānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tena āha mahāsatipaṭṭhāna sutte vuttānam ti tathā iti iminā mahāsatipaṭṭhāna sutte  vuttānam ti imam eva upasaṃharati pañcavidhena ati nīvaraṇa aupādāna khandha āyatana bojjhaṅga ariya saccānam
translated: By the word “also” the exposition of the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta is included.🔽The fivefold is the fivefold method of contemplation of the hindrances, of the aggregates subject to clinging, of the sense bases, of the enlightenment factors, and of the noble truths.

original: vasena pañcadhā. Bhāvanānubhāvo ariyamaggaggahaṇasamatthatā.
analyzed: vasena pañcadhā bhāvanā anubhāvaḥ ariya magga ggahaṇa samattha tā
translated: The power of development is the ability to take up the noble path.

original: Taṃniyamatoti tassā kāyānupassanādipaṭipattiyā niyamato. Tassā bhikkhubhāve niyate sāpi bhikkhubhāve niyatāyeva nāma hoti.
analyzed: tad niyamataḥ ti tassā kāya anupassanā ādi paṭipattiyāḥ niyamataḥ tassāḥ bhikkhu bhāve niyate sā api bhikkhu bhāve niyatāya iva nāma hoti
translated: In accordance with the rule: when that is fixed in the state of a bhikkhu, then that too is called fixed in the state of a bhikkhu.

original: Kāyānupassanāuddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kāya anupassanā uddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the contemplation of the body is ended.

original: Etthāti kāye. Avayavā assa atthīti avayavī, samudāyo, samūhoti attho, so pana avayavavinimuttaṃ
analyzed: ettha ati kāye avayavā assa atthi iti avayavī samudāyaḥ samūhaḥ ti attho saḥ pana avayava vinimuttam
translated: Here means in the body. It has parts, thus it is a part-possessor; the meaning is, a collection, a combination. But that is not a part-possessor separate from the parts.

original: drabyantaranti gāho laddhi avayavīgāho. Hatthapādādiaṅgulinakhādiaṅgapaccaṅge sannivesavisiṭṭhe🔽upādāya yāyaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgasamaññā ceva kāyasamaññā ca, taṃ atikkamitvā itthipurisarathaghaṭādidrabyantiparikappanaṃ
analyzed: gāhaḥ laddhi avayavīgāhaḥ hattha pāda ādi aṅguli nakha ādi aṅga paccaṅge sannivesa visiṭṭhe  upādāya yā ayam aṅga paccaṅga samaññā ca iva kāya samaññā ca tam atikkamitvā itthi purisa ratha ghaṭa ādi dravya anti parikappanam
translated: ‘Here’ means in the body. ‘It has parts’ means it has a collection, a combination. But the apprehension of it as a ‘whole’ apart from its parts is the ‘apprehension of a whole’. The ‘apprehension of parts’ is the apprehension of the parts of the body, such as the hands, feet, fingers, nails, etc., which are distinguished by their different positions.

original: samaññātidhāvanaṃ. Atha vā yathāvuttasamaññaṃ atikkamitvā pakatiādidrabyādijīvādikāyādipadatthantaraparikappanaṃ
analyzed: samaññā atidhāvanam atha vā yathāvutta samaññam atikkamitvā pakati ādi drabya ādi jīva ādi kāya ādi padattha antara parikappanam
translated: The ‘running beyond the conventional designation’ is the imagining of the body as a substance, such as a woman, a man, a pot, etc., after passing over the conventional designation which is the designation of the parts and the designation of the body, such as ‘hand’, ‘foot’, etc. Or else, the ‘running beyond the conventional designation’ is the imagining of a different meaning of the word ‘body’, such as ‘nature’, etc., after passing over the conventional designation as stated above.

original: samaññātidhāvanaṃ. Niccasārādigāhabhūto abhiniveso sārādānābhiniveso.
analyzed: samaññā atidhāvanam nicca sāra ādi gāha bhūtaḥ abhiniveso sāra ādāna abhinivesaḥ
translated: The ‘adherence to the holding as true’ is the adherence to the holding as true of the body as a permanent entity, etc.

original: Na taṃ diṭṭhanti taṃ itthipurisādi diṭṭhaṃ na hoti. Diṭṭhaṃ vā itthipurisādi na hotīti yojanā. Yathāvuttanti kesādibhūtupādāyasamūhasaṅkhātaṃ.
analyzed: na tam diṭṭhanti tam itthi purisa ādi diṭṭham na hoti diṭṭham vā itthi purisa ādi na hoti iti yojanā yathā vuttam ti kesa ādi bhūta upādāya samūha saṅkhātam
translated: ‘That is not seen’ means that woman, man, etc. are not seen. The construction is: that which is seen is not a woman, man, etc. ‘As stated above’ means the body which is a collection of hair, etc., the primary elements, and the derivatives.

original: Kesādipathavinti kesādisaññitaṃ sasambhārapathaviṃ. Pubbāpariyabhāvenāti santānavasena. Aññatthāti “āpokāya”nti evamādīsu.🔽Ajjhattabahiddhāti saparasantāne kāyo vuttoti. “Kāyo”ti cettha sammasanupagā rūpadhammā
analyzed: kesa ādi pathavinti kesa ādi saññitam sa sambhāra pathavim pubba apariya bhāvena ati santāna vasena aññattha āti āpokāyanti evamādīsu  ajjhatta bahiddhā ti sa para santāne kāyaḥ vutto ti kāyo ti ca ittha sammasa anupagāḥ rūpa dhammāḥ
translated: The “earth element in the form of head hairs” is the earth element together with its appurtenants, which is called “head hairs.” “In the past and future” means in the past and future individualities. “In another sense” means in such passages as “the water element is called tears” .🔽“Internally and externally” means the body is spoken of in one’s own and another’s continuum. “Body” here is material phenomena suitable for comprehending .

original: adhippetāti āha “ajjhattabahiddhādhammāna”nti. Ghaṭitaṃ ekābaddhaṃ ārammaṇaṃ ghaṭitārammaṇaṃ,
analyzed: adhippetā iti āha ajjhatta bahiddhā dhammānam ti ghaṭitam eka ābaddham ārammaṇam ghaṭita ārammaṇam
translated: Therefore it is said: “internal and external phenomena.” “Conjoined” means bound together. “Conjoined object” is the object that is bound together.

original: ekārammaṇabhūtanti attho. Tenāha “ekato ārammaṇabhāvo natthī”ti.
analyzed: eka ārammaṇa bhūtanti attho tena āha ekatas ārammaṇa bhāvaḥ na atthi iti
translated: The meaning is: that which has become a single object. Therefore it is said: “There is no single object.”

original: Antoolīyanā antosaṅkoco antarāvosānaṃ.
analyzed: antoolīyanā antosaṅkocaḥ antarā avosānam
translated: “Contraction” is the drawing in of the mind, the turning in of the mind.

original: Dvīhīti abhijjhāvinayadomanassavinayehi.
analyzed: dvīhi iti abhijjhā vinaya domanassa vinayehi
translated: “By two” means by the abandoning of covetousness and by the abandoning of grief.

original: Sati ca sampajaññañca satisampajaññaṃ, tena. Etena karaṇabhūtena. Vipakkhadhammehi anantaritattā avicchinnassa. Tassa sabbatthikakammaṭṭhānassa.🔽Kāyānupassanāuddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Vedanānupassanādiuddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sati ca sampajaññañca satisampajaññam tena etena karaṇa bhūtena vipakkha dhammehi anantarita ttā avicchinnassa tassa sabbatthika kammaṭṭhānassa 🔽kāya anupassanā uddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽vedanā anupassanā ādi uddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: “With full awareness and clear comprehension” means with full awareness and clear comprehension. By that, which is the instrument. Because it is uninterrupted by opposing phenomena. Of that universal meditation subject.

original: Sukhādīnanti sukhadukkhādukkhamasukhānaṃ.
analyzed: sukha ādīnam ti sukha dukkha adukkha masukhānam
translated: “Pleasure, etc.,” means pleasure, pain, neither-pain-nor-pleasure.

original: Rūpādiārammaṇanānattabhedānaṃ vasena yojetabbanti sambandho. Tathā ca sesesupi. Savatthukāvatthukādīti
analyzed: rūpa ādi ārammaṇa nānatta bhedānam vasena yojetabbanti sambandhaḥ tathā ca sesesu pi savatthuka avatthuka ādi iti
translated: The construction should be made by way of the variety of objects such as visible forms, etc. The same method applies to the rest. “With and without object, etc.,”

original: ādi-saddena hīnādiyoniādibhedaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Visuṃ visuṃ na vattabbanti codanaṃ dassetīti
analyzed: ādi saddena hīna ādi yoni ādi bhedam saṅgaṇhāti visum visum na vattabbanti codanam dasseti iti
translated: The word “etc.” includes the distinctions of the inferior, etc., and the womb-birth, etc. He shows the objection that it should not be stated separately.

original: yojanā. Ekatthāti kāyādīsu ekasmiṃ. Purimacodanāyāti “pubbe pahīnattā puna pahānaṃ
analyzed: yojanā ekattha ati kāya ādīsu ekasmin purima codanāya ati pubbe pahīna ttā puna pahānam
translated: The construction is this. “In one place” means in one of the three, body, etc. “The previous objection” is the objection that it should not be stated because it is already abandoned.

original: na vattabba”nti codanāya. Pahīnanti vikkhambhitaṃ. Paṭipakkhabhāvanāyāti maggabhāvanāya.
analyzed: na vattabbanti codanāya pahīnanti vikkhambhitam paṭipakkha bhāvanāya ati magga bhāvanāya
translated: “Abandoned” means suppressed. “By the development of the opposition” means by the development of the path.

original: Ubhayatthāti ubhayacodanāya. Ubhayanti parihāradvayaṃ. Yasmā purimacodanāya nānāpuggalaparihāro,
analyzed: ubhayatthā ati ubhaya codanāya parihāra dvayam yasmai purima codanāya nānā puggala parihāraḥ
translated: “In both places” means in both objections. “Both” means the two kinds of falling away. Since the previous objection can be made in regard to the falling away of different persons

original: nānācittakkhaṇikaparihāro ca sambhavati, dutiyacodanāya pana nānācittakkhaṇikaparihāroyeva,
analyzed: nānā citta khaṇika parihāro ca sambhavati dutiya codanāya pana
translated: and the falling away in different moments of consciousness, and the second objection can be made only in regard to the falling away in different moments of consciousness,

original: tasmā vuttaṃ “sambhavato yojetabba”nti. Maggasatipaṭṭhānabhāvanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā vuttam sambhavataḥ yojetabban ti magga sati paṭṭhāna bhāvanam sandhāya vuttam
translated: it is said that the construction should be made according to the possibility. This is said with reference to the development of the foundations of mindfulness as the path.

original: Sabbatthāti sabbesu kāyādīsu.
analyzed: sabbattha āti sabbesu kāya ādīsu
translated: In all instances: in all instances of body, etc.

original: Vedanānupassanādiuddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vedanā anupassanā ādi uddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the section on contemplation of feelings, etc., is ended.

original: Uddesavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Kāyānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā🔽356. Ajjhattādīti ādi-saddena idha vuttā bahiddhāajjhattabahiddhāanupassanappakārā
analyzed: uddesa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  kāya anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā  ajjhatta ādi iti ādi saddena idha vuttā bahiddhā ajjhatta bahiddhā anupassana ppakārā
translated: The description of the section on the directions for development is ended.🔽Inward, etc.: the word “etc.” includes the modes of contemplation of the body as external, as both internal and external, and as subject to origination and dissolution, which are given in the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta .

original: viya mahāsatipaṭṭhānasutte vuttā samudayadhammānupassiādianupassanappakārāpi kāyānupassanābhāvato
analyzed: viya mahāsatipaṭṭhāna sutte vuttā samudaya dhamma anupassi ādi anupassana ppakārā api kāya anupassanā abhāvato
translated: The contemplation of the body as a physical frame is included because it is a kind of contemplation of the body.

original: gahitā icceva veditabbaṃ. Tatthāti ajjhattādianupassanāyaṃ. Cuddasa pakārā mahāsatipaṭṭhānasutte🔽āgatacuddasappakārādike apekkhitvā idha vuttā. Ajjhattādippakāro eko pakāroti āha
analyzed: gahitāḥ iccā iva veditabbam tattha ati ajjhatta ādi anupassanā ayam cuddasa pakārāḥ mahāsatipaṭṭhāna sutte  āgata cuddasa pakāra ādike apekkhitvā idha vuttā ajjhatta ādi ppakāro ekaḥ pakāro ti āha
translated: There: in the contemplation of the body as internal, etc.🔽The modes are fourteen: the fourteen modes given in the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta .🔽The mode of contemplation of the body as internal, etc., is one mode, according to the commentator,🔽because it is mentioned by the single expression “contemplation of the body.”

original: “ekappakāraniddesenā”ti. Bāhiresūti ekaccesu aññatitthiyesu. Tesampi hi ānāpānādivasena
analyzed: eka ppakāra niddesena ati bāhiresu ti ekaccesu añña titthiyesu tesam pi hi āna apāna ādi vasena
translated: External: some other sectarians.🔽For they too have a contemplation of the body that is a condition for serenity, which is based on mindfulness of breathing, etc.

original: samathapakkhikā kāyānupassanā sambhavati. Tenāha “ekadesasambhavato”ti.
analyzed: samatha pakkhikā kāya anupassanā sambhavati tena āha eka desa sambhavataḥ ti
translated: That is why the commentator says “because it exists in part.”

original: Tacassa ca atacaparicchinnatā tacena aparicchinnatā atthīti yojanā. “Dīghabāhu naccatū”tiādīsu🔽viya aññapadatthepi samāse avayavapadatthasaṅgaho labbhatevāti vuttaṃ “kāyekadesabhūto
analyzed: tacassa ca a taca paricchinna tā tacena a paricchinna tā atthi iti yojanā dīgha bāhu nacca tu uti ādīsu  viya añña padatthe api samāse avayava padattha saṅgaho labbhate iva iti vuttam kāya ekadesa bhūto
translated: In such passages as “The long-armed one dances”🔽the meaning of the component words is included in the meaning of the compound, though the compound has a different meaning.

original: taco gahito evā”ti. Tacapaṭibaddhānaṃ nakhadantanhārumaṃsānaṃ, tacapaṭibaddhānaṃ
analyzed: tacaḥ eva ati taca paṭibaddhānam nakha danta nhāru maṃsānam taca paṭibaddhānam
translated: That is why it is said, “The skin, which is a part of the body, is included.”🔽The nails, teeth, and head-hairs, which are bound up with the skin,

original: tadanuppaviṭṭhamūlānaṃ kesalomānaṃ, tappaṭibaddhapaṭibaddhānaṃ itaresaṃ samūhabhūto
analyzed: tad anuppaviṭṭha mūlānam kesa lomānam tad paṭibaddha paṭibaddhānam itaresam samūha bhūtaḥ
translated: the body-hairs and the down, which are rooted in the skin,🔽and the rest of the body, which is a collection bound up with what is bound up with the skin,🔽are all called “the skin and what is bound up with the skin.”

original: sabbo kāyo “tacapariyanto”tveva vuttoti dassento “tappaṭibaddhā”tiādimāha. Atthi
analyzed: sabbo kāyo taca pariyantaḥ tu eva vuttaḥ ti dassento tad paṭibaddhā iti ādim āha atthi
translated: The construction is: “There are head-hairs, there are body-hairs.”

original: kesā, atthi lomāti sambandho. Tattha atthīti puthuttavācī ekaṃ nipātapadaṃ, na kiriyāpadaṃ.🔽Kiriyāpadatte hi santīti vattabbaṃ siyā, vacanavipallāsena vā vuttanti.
analyzed: kesāḥ atthi loma ati sambandhaḥ tattha atthi iti puthutta vācī ekam nipāta padam na kiriyā padam  kiriyā apadatte hi santi iti vattabbam siyā vacana vipallāsena vā vuttan ti
translated: Herein, “there are” is a single indeclinable word expressing separateness, not a verb.🔽For if it were a verb, it would have to be “there are” in the present tense, or it would have to be stated by perversion of speech as “there were.”

original: Kammaṭṭhānassa vācuggatakaraṇādinā uggaṇhanaṃ uggaho. Koṭṭhāsapāḷiyā hi vācuggatakaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānassa vācuggata karaṇa ādinā uggaṇhanam uggahaḥ koṭṭhāsa pāḷiyā hi vācuggata karaṇam
translated: The learning of the meditation subject by making it the object of attention, etc., is “learning.”

original: manasikiriyāya kesādīnaṃ vaṇṇādito upadhāraṇassa ca paguṇabhāvāpādanaṃ idha uggaho.
analyzed: manasikiriyāya kesa ādīnam vaṇṇa āditaḥ upadhāraṇassa ca paguṇa bhāva āpādanam idha uggahaḥ
translated: The bringing about of proficiency in the apprehending of the colour, etc., of the head hairs, etc., by means of attention is “learning” here.

original: Yena pana nayena yogāvacaro tattha kusalo hoti, so vidhīti vutto.🔽Purimehīti purimapurimehi pañcakachakkehi sambandho vutto. “Maṃsaṃ…pe… vakka”nti
analyzed: yena pana nayena yogāvacaro tattha kusalaḥ hoti saḥ vidhi iti vutto  purimehi iti purima purimehi pañcaka chakkehi sambandhaḥ vuttaḥ
translated: But the method by which the meditator becomes proficient is called “the rule.”

original: hi anulomato vakkapañcakassa puna “vakkaṃ…pe… kesā”ti vakkapañcakassa, tacapañcakassa
analyzed: hi anulomataḥ vakka pañcakassa puna vakkaṃpe kesā ati vakka pañcakassa taca pañcakassa
translated: “The preceding” : the connection is stated with the preceding five sets. For the order of recitation is shown by the forward order of the five sets beginning with flesh, and by the reverse order of the five sets beginning with the bladder, and by the forward and reverse order of the five sets beginning with skin.

original: ca paṭilomato sajjhāyakkamo sambandho dassito. Svāyaṃ sajjhāyoti sambandho. Visuṃ
analyzed: ca paṭilomato sajjhāya kkamaḥ sambandho dassito svāyam sajjhāyaḥ iti sambandhaḥ visum
translated: This is the “recitation” that is the connection.

original: tipañcāhanti anulomato pañcāhaṃ, paṭilomato pañcāhaṃ, anulomapaṭilomato pañcāhanti🔽evaṃ pañcakachakkesu paccekaṃ tipañcāhaṃ. Purimehi ekato tipañcāhanti tacapañcakādīhi
analyzed: ti pañcāhanti anulomataḥ pañcāham paṭilomataḥ pañcāham anuloma paṭilomataḥ pañcāhanti  evam pañcaka chakkesu paccekam ti pañcāham purimehi ekatas ti pañcāhanti taca pañcaka ādīhi
translated: “Five times each” : the forward order five times, the reverse order five times, the forward and reverse order five times.🔽Thus there are five sets of three days each in the five sets.

original: saddhiṃ anulomato vakkapañcakādīni ekajjhaṃ katvā vuttanayeneva tipañcāhaṃ. Ādiantadassanavasenātiādibhūtassa
analyzed: saddhim anulomataḥ vakka pañcaka ādīni ekajjham katvā vutta nayena iva ti pañca aham ādi anta dassana vasena ati ādi bhūtassa
translated: “With the preceding” : the five sets beginning with the bladder, etc., are put together with the five sets beginning with skin, and the three days are recited in the way already described.

original: anulomato sajjhāyassa, anulomapaṭilomato sajjhāye antabhūtassa paṭilomato sajjhāyassa🔽dassanavasena. Tenāha “anuloma…pe… antimo”ti. Etampīti yadidaṃ purimehi saddhiṃ pacchimassa
analyzed: anulomataḥ sajjhāyassa anuloma paṭilomataḥ sajjhāye anta bhūtassa paṭilomataḥ sajjhāyassa  dassana vasena tena āha anuloma pe antimaḥ ti etam pi iti yat idam purimehi saddhim pacchimassa
translated: The “conforming” is the recitation in conformity with the order of the parts. The “reverse” is the recitation in reverse order. The “middle” is the recitation of the middle part.

original: pañcakādino ekato sajjhāyakaraṇaṃ, pañcakādīnaṃ paccekaṃ anulomādinā sajjhāyappakārato🔽añño sajjhāyappakāro esoti attho. Dvinnaṃ hatthānaṃ ekamukhā aññamaññasambandhā ṭhapitā🔽aṅguliyo idha hatthasaṅkhalikāti adhippetāti āha “aṅgulipantī”ti. Asubhalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: ekatas sajjhāya karaṇam pañcaka ādīnam paccekam anuloma ādinā sajjhāya ppakārato  aññaḥ sajjhāya ppakāraḥ esaḥ ti atthaḥ dvinnam hatthānam eka mukhā aññamañña sambandhā ṭhapitā  aṅguliyaḥ idha hattha saṅkhalikā iti adhippetā ati āha aṅguli pantī iti asubha lakkhaṇam
translated: The “conforming” is the recitation in conformity with the order of the parts. The “reverse” is the recitation in reverse order. The “middle” is the recitation of the middle part.🔽The “conforming” is the recitation in conformity with the order of the parts. The “reverse” is the recitation in reverse order. The “middle” is the recitation of the middle part.

original: kesādīnaṃ paṭikkūlabhāvo. Thaddhādibhāvo dhātulakkhaṇaṃ.🔽Attano koṭṭhāso, samāno vā koṭṭhāso sakoṭṭhāso, tattha bhavo sakoṭṭhāsiko, kammaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: kesa ādīnam paṭikkūla bhāvaḥ thaddhā ādi bhāvaḥ dhātu lakkhaṇam 🔽attano koṭṭhāso samānaḥ vā koṭṭhāso sa koṭṭhāso tattha bhavaḥ sakoṭṭhāsiko kammaṭṭhānaṃ
translated: The “conforming” is the recitation in conformity with the order of the parts. The “reverse” is the recitation in reverse order. The “middle” is the recitation of the middle part.🔽The “conforming” is the recitation in conformity with the order of the parts. The “reverse

original: Kāyānupassanaṃ hitvāti asubhato vā dhātuto anupassanaṃ manasikāraṃ akatvā. Pubbe viya pariyantatālañca āditālañca agantvā.
analyzed: kāya anupassanam hitvā ti asubhataḥ vā dhātutaḥ anupassanam manasikāram a katvā pubbe viya pariyanta tālam ca ādi tālam ca a gantvā
translated: “Having left off contemplation of the body”: having left off the contemplation of the unattractiveness of the body or the contemplation of its elements, he should not give attention to it.

original: Samādhānādivisesayogena adhikaṃ cittanti adhicittaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “samathavipassanācitta”nti.🔽Manasikaraṇaṃ cittanti ekantaṃ samādhinimittasseva samannāhārakaṃ cittaṃ. Vikkhepavasena
analyzed: samādhāna ādi visesa yogena adhikam cittanti adhicittam tena vuttam samatha vipassanā cittan ti  manasikaraṇam cittanti ekantam samādhi nimittassa iva samannāhārakam cittam vikkhepa vasena
translated: “The higher mind”: the mind that is superior by virtue of the special qualities of concentration, etc. Hence it is said, “the consciousness of serenity and insight.”🔽“Giving attention”: the mind that is solely the instigator of the concentration object.🔽“Breaking up”: the mind’s occurrence in various objects by way of distraction.

original: cittassa nānārammaṇe visaṭappavatti idha pabhañjanaṃ, samādhānena tadabhāvato na
analyzed: cittassa nānā ārammaṇe pabhañjanam samādhānena tad abhāvataḥ na
translated: “Not breaking up”: the mind’s non-occurrence in various objects by way of distraction, because of concentration.

original: ca pabhañjanasabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: ca pabhañjana sa bhāvam
translated: “The state of being a witness”: the state of being a direct perceiver.🔽“The previous cause, etc.”: the word “etc.” includes the appropriate attention, practice, etc.

original: Sakkhibhavanatā paccakkhakāritā. Pubbahetādiketi ādi-saddena tadanurūpamanasikārānuyogādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: sakkhi bhavana tā paccakkha kāri tā pubbahetā ādikā iti ādi saddena tad anurūpa manasikāra anuyoga ādim saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “Occurring evenly”: free from sloth and restlessness.

original: Samappavattanti līnuddhaccarahitaṃ. Tathāpavattiyāti majjhimasamathanimittaṃ paṭipattiyā,
analyzed: samappavattanti līn uddhacca rahitam tathā pavattiyā ati majjhima samatha nimittam paṭipattiyā
translated: “Occurring thus”: occurring in the object of the middle way, which is the antidote to the occurrence of sloth and restlessness.

original: tattha ca pakkhandanena siddhāya yathāvuttasamappavattiyā. Paññāya tosetīti yāyaṃ
analyzed: tattha ca pakkhandanena siddhāya yathā vutta sama ppavattiyā paññāya toseti iti yā ayam
translated: “Satisfies the wisdom”: the wisdom that is satisfied by the previously mentioned even occurrence.

original: tattha jātānaṃ dhammānaṃ anativattanā, indriyānaṃ ekarasatā, tadupagavīriyavāhanā,🔽āsevanāti imāsaṃ sādhikā bhāvanāpaññā, tāya adhicittaṃ toseti pahaṭṭhaṃ karoti. Yathāvuttavisesasiddhiyāva
analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam anativattanā indriyānam ekarasa tā tad upaga vīriya vāhanā  āsevanā ti imāsam sādhikā bhāvanā paññā tāya adhicittam toseti pahaṭṭham karoti yathā vutta visesa siddhiyā ava
translated: Herein, non-return of the ideas arisen is the single function of the faculties, and the carrying of the energy that is in conformity with that is the development.🔽“He develops” is the further fivefold understanding of development. By means of that he “encourages” the higher consciousness, he makes it glad.

original: hi taṃsādhikāya paññāya taṃ cittaṃ sampahaṃsitaṃ nāma hoti. Evaṃ sampahaṃsanto ca
analyzed: hi taṃsa adhikāya paññāya tam cittam sampahaṃsitam nāma hoti evam sampahaṃsanto ca
translated: For that consciousness is called “encouraged” when it is gladdened by that further understanding that has the success of the special qualities mentioned above as its fruit.🔽And while he is encouraging it thus,🔽since it is said that he “cleanses consciousness” by the complete purification of all its impediments,

original: yasmā sabbaso paribandhavisodhanena paññāya cittaṃ vodāpetīti ca vuccati, tasmā “samuttejeti
analyzed: yasmai sabbaso paribandha visodhanena paññāya cittam vodāpeti iti ca vuccati tasmai samuttejeti
translated: therefore it is said that he “encourages it” .

original: cā”ti vuttaṃ. Nirassādanti pubbenāparaṃ visesālābhena bhāvanārasavirahitaṃ. Sampahaṃsetīti
analyzed: ca ati vuttam nirassādanti pubbena aparam visesa alābhena bhāvanā rasa virahitam sampahaṃseti iti
translated: “Without relish” : devoid of the relish of development owing to the non-attainment of further distinction in each instance.🔽“He encourages” : he encourages consciousness by development.

original: bhāvanāya cittaṃ sammā pahāseti pamodeti. Samuttejetīti sammā tattha uttejeti.
analyzed: bhāvanāya cittam sammā pahāseti pamodeti samuttejeti iti sammā tattha uttejeti
translated: “He gladdens” : he gladdens it by encouraging it.

original: Āsayo pavattiṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: āsayaḥ pavatti ṭṭhānam
translated: “The station” is the occurrence-station.

original: Vavatthitatanti asaṃkiṇṇataṃ.
analyzed: vavatthita tanti a saṃkiṇṇa tam
translated: “The delimitation” is the non-mixture.

original: Antoti abbhantare koṭṭhāse. Sukhumanti sukhumanhāruādiṃ sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: antare iti abbhantare koṭṭhāse sukhumanti sandhāya vadati
translated: “The inside” is the internal physical frame. “The subtle” is said with reference to the fine sinews, etc.

original: Tālapaṭṭikā tālapattavilivehi katakaṭasārako.🔽Gaṇanāya mattā-saddo katipayehi ūnabhāvadīpanatthaṃ vuccati. Dantaṭṭhivajjitāni tīhi
analyzed: katakaṭasārakaḥ  gaṇanāya mattā saddaḥ katipayehi ūna bhāva dīpana attham vuccati danta ṭṭhi vajjitāni tīhi
translated: The “palm-leaf” is a kind of hard sugar made from the sap of the palmyra palm.🔽The word “about” in the phrase “about thirty-two” is used to indicate that there are less than thirty-two.🔽The “thirty-two” are thirty-two less than three hundred bones.

original: ūnāni tīṇi aṭṭhisatāni. Tasmā “timattānī”ti vuttaṃ. Yaṃ pana visuddhimagge “atirekatisataaṭṭhikasamussaya”nti🔽vuttaṃ, taṃ dantaṭṭhīnipi gahetvā sabbasaṅgāhikanayena vuttaṃ. “Gopphakaṭṭhikādīni
analyzed: ūnāni tīṇi aṭṭhi satāni tasmā ti mattāni iti vuttam yam pana visuddhi magge  vuttam tam danta ṭṭhīni pi gahetvā sabba saṅgāhika nayena vuttam goppha kaṭṭhika ādīni
translated: But in the Visuddhimagga it is said that there are more than three hundred bones,🔽including the teeth. The “ankle bones” and so on are not mentioned in the text,

original: avuttānī”ti na vattabbaṃ “ekekasmiṃ pāde dve gopphakaṭṭhīnī”ti vuttattā, “ānisadaṭṭhiādīnī”ti pana vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: avuttāni iti na vattabbam ekekasmin pāde dve goppha kaṭṭhīni iti vuttattā ānisada ṭṭhi ādīni iti pana vattabbam
translated: but they should not be omitted. For it is said that there are two ankle bones in each foot.

original: Tena aṭṭhināti ūruṭṭhinā.
analyzed: tena aṭṭhināti ūruṭṭhinā
translated: “The ‘bones’ are the thigh bones.

original: Marumpehīti marumpacuṇṇehi.
analyzed: marumpehi iti marumpa cuṇṇehi
translated: ‘With the dust of red ocher’: with the powder of red ocher.

original: Susamāhitacittena hetubhūtena. Nānārammaṇavipphandanavirahenāti nānārammaṇabhāvena
analyzed: su samāhita cittena hetu bhūtena nānā ārammaṇa vipphandana virahena ati nānā ārammaṇa bhāvena
translated: ‘With a mind well concentrated’: with a cause that is a mind well concentrated. ‘Without wavering’: without wavering due to the occurrence of different objects.🔽‘Without wavering due to different objects’ is ‘without wavering.’

original: vipphandanaṃ nānārammaṇavipphandanaṃ, tena virahena. Anatikkantapītisukhassa jhānacittassa.
analyzed: vipphandanam nānā ārammaṇa vipphandanam tena virahena an atikkanta pīti sukhassa jhāna cittassa
translated: ‘With a jhāna consciousness that has not lost its happiness and pleasure’:

original: Taṃsamaṅgīpuggalassa vā.
analyzed: tad samaṅgī puggalassa vā
translated: or with a person who is in such a jhāna.

original: Paṭikkūladhātuvaṇṇavisesanti paṭikkūlavisesaṃ, dhātuvisesaṃ, vaṇṇakasiṇavisesaṃ.🔽Vakkapañcakādīsu pañcasu visuṃ, heṭṭhimehi ekato ca sajjhāye channaṃ channaṃ pañcāhānaṃ
analyzed: paṭikkūla dhātu vaṇṇa visesanti paṭikkūla visesam dhātu visesam vaṇṇa kasiṇa visesam  vakka pañcaka ādīsu pañcasu visum heṭṭhimehi ekato ca sajjhāye channam channam pañca ahānam
translated: The special qualities of the foulness element and of the colour kasiṇa are the special qualities of foulness, the special qualities of the element, and the special qualities of the colour kasiṇa.🔽In the five pentad-sets beginning with the five on the corpse, the five sets of five days are completed by the repetition of each separately and of all together.🔽But in the case of the five on the corpse the five sets of five days are completed by the repetition of each separately.🔽“In a fortnight, less a day” means that the repetition is completed in a fortnight less a day.

original: vasena pañca māsā paripuṇṇā labbhanti, tacapañcake pana visuṃ tipañcāhamevāti āha
analyzed: vasena pañca māsā paripuṇṇāḥ labbhanti taca pañcake pana visum ti pañca aham eva iti āha
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.

original: “addhamāse ūnepī”ti. Māsantaragamanaṃ sajjhāyassa sattamādimāsagamanaṃ.🔽Yamentanti bandhentaṃ.
analyzed: addha māse ūne pi iti māsa antara gamanam sajjhāyassa sattama ādi māsa gamanam  bandhentam
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.

original: “Nīlaṃ pīta”ntiādinā saṅghāṭe nīlādivavatthānaṃ taṃnissayattā mahābhūte upādāyāti
analyzed: nīlam pītam iti ādinā saṅghāṭe nīla ādi vavatthānam tad nissaya tā mahābhūte upādāya ati
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.

original: āha “mahābhūtaṃ…pe… duggandhantiādinā”ti. Upādāyarūpaṃ mahābhūtena paricchinnanti
analyzed: āha upādāya rūpam mahābhūtena paricchinnanti
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.

original: yojanā. Tassāti upādārūpassa. Tatoti mahābhūtato. Chāyāya ātapapaccayabhāvo ātapo
analyzed: yojanā tassa ati upādā rūpassa tatas ti mahābhūtataḥ chāyāya ātapa paccaya bhāvaḥ ātapo
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.

original: paccayo etissāti, ātapassa chāyāya uppādakabhāvo chāyātapānaṃ ātapapaccayachāyuppādakabhāvo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ etissa ati ātapassa chāyāya uppādaka bhāvaḥ chāyā ātapānam ātapa paccaya chāyā uppādaka bhāvaḥ
translated: “In a month” means that the repetition is completed in a month less a day.🔽“In a month” means that the

original: Tena uppādetabbauppādakabhāvo aññamaññaparicchedakatāti dasseti. Āyatanāni ca dvārāni
analyzed: tena uppādetabba auppādaka bhāvaḥ aññamañña paricchedaka tā ti dasseti āyatanāni ca dvārāni
translated: He shows that the state of being what is produced and the state of being a producer are the means by which the individual essences of the states are delimited.

original: cāti dvādasāyatanāni, tadekadesabhūtāni dvārāni ca.
analyzed: ca ati dvādaśa āyatanāni tad eka desa bhūtāni dvārāni ca
translated: The bases and the doors: the twelve bases and the doors that are a part of them.

original: Sappaccayabhāvāti sappaccayattā.
analyzed: sappaccaya bhāvā ati sappaccaya ttā
translated: The state of having conditions: the state of having conditions.

original: Yathāvuttena ākārenāti “iti idaṃ sattavidhaṃ uggahakosallaṃ suggahitaṃ katvā”tiādinā,
analyzed: yathā vuttena ākārena ati iti idam sattavidham uggaha kosallam suggahitam katvā ati ādinā
translated: In the way stated: in the way stated in the passage beginning, “Having thus made sure that the sevenfold skill in learning is properly accomplished” ,

original: “imaṃ pana kammaṭṭhānaṃ bhāvetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇitukāmenā”tiādinā vā vuttappakārena
analyzed: imam pana kammaṭṭhānam bhāvetvā arahattam pāpuṇitu kāmena ati ādinā vā vutta ppakārena
translated: and in the passage beginning, “One who wants to reach Arahantship by developing this meditation subject should” .

original: vidhinā. “Avisesato pana sādhāraṇavasena evaṃ veditabbā”ti, “ito paṭṭhāyā”ti ca vadanti.
analyzed: vidhinā avisesato pana sādhāraṇa vasena evam veditabbā ati itas paṭṭhāya ati ca vadanti
translated: They say that this should be understood in the general way without distinction, and that the words “from here” are superfluous.🔽By way of colour, etc., as object: by way of the object consisting of foulness, emptiness, etc.

original: Vaṇṇādimukhenāti vaṇṇapaṭikkūlasuññatāmukhena. Upaṭṭhānanti kammaṭṭhānassa upaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: vaṇṇa ādi mukhena āti vaṇṇa paṭikkūla suñña tā mukhena upaṭṭhānam ti kammaṭṭhānassa upaṭṭhānam
translated: The establishment: the establishment of the meditation subject,

original: yo uggahoti vutto. Etthāti catukkapañcakajjhānapaṭhamajjhānavipassanāsu ekasmiṃ sandhīyati.
analyzed: yaḥ uggahaḥ ti vuttaḥ ettha ati catukka pañcaka jhāna paṭhama jhāna vipassanāsu ekasmin sandhīyati
translated: which is called “learning.” “Here” is in one of the four or five jhānas, or in the first jhāna of the fine-material sphere, or in insight.

original: Kena? Kammaṭṭhānamanasikāreneva, tasmā uggahova sandhi uggahasandhīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: kena kammaṭṭhāna manasikārena iva tasmai uggahaḥ uva sandhi uggaha sandhi iti veditabbam
translated: By what? By the mere attention given to the meditation subject. So the “link” should be understood as the learning itself.

original: Uṭṭhānakaṃ uppajjanakaṃ. Sātirekāni cha ambaṇāni kumbhaṃ. Tatoti mukhadhovanakhādanabhojanakiccato. Nivattatīti arahattādhigamena accantanivattivasena nivattati.
analyzed: uṭṭhānakam uppajjanakam sa atirekāni cha ambaṇāni kumbham tatas iti mukha dhovana khādana bhojana kiccataḥ nivattati iti arahatta adhigamena accanta nivatti vasena nivattati
translated: “Turns back” : turns back by way of final turning back through the attainment of arahatship.🔽“Merely action” : merely attention-action.

original: Kammamevāti manasikārakammameva. Ārammaṇanti pubbabhāgabhāvanārammaṇaṃ.
analyzed: kammam eva āti manasikāra kammam eva ārammaṇam ti pubbabhāga bhāvanā ārammaṇam
translated: “Object” : the object of development in the prior stage.

original: Tathāti vanamakkaṭo viya.
analyzed: tathā ati vana makkaṭaḥ
translated: “Like a forest monkey” : like a monkey in a forest.

original: Ekanti ekaṃ koṭṭhāsaṃ.
analyzed: ekam ti ekam koṭṭhāsam
translated: “One” : one part.🔽“Without the taking of seven” : this is said because it is taught without even mentioning the seven descriptions.

original: Sattagahaṇarahiteti sattapaññattimpi anāmasitvā desitattā vuttaṃ. Sasantānatāya ahaṃkāravatthumhi
analyzed: satta gahaṇa rahitā iti satta paññattim pi an āmasitvā desita ttā vuttam sa santāna tāya ahaṃkāra vatthumhi
translated: “In the object of conceit” : in the object of the conceit “I am,” which is the same continuum.🔽“In one who has not abandoned conceit” : in one who has not abandoned the conceit “I am,” but who has abandoned the appearance of it.

original: appahīnamānassa pahīnākāraṃ sandhāyāha “viddhastāhaṃkāre”ti. Tatthāti parassa kāye.
analyzed: appahīna mānassa pahīna ākāram sandhāya āha tattha ati parassa kāye
translated: “There” : in another’s body.

original: 357. Ādimhi sevanā manasikārassa uppādanā ārambho.
analyzed: ādimhi sevanā manasikārassa uppādanā ārambho
translated: “Beginning” : the beginning of attention is the arousing of it.

original: 362. Gamitāti vigamitā.
analyzed: gamitā ati vigamitā
translated: “Gone” : gone away.

original: Kāyānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Vedanānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kāya anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  vedanā anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the description of the contemplation of the body is finished.🔽Description of the contemplation of feeling

original: 363. Sampajānassāti sammā pakārehi jānantassa, vatthārammaṇehi saddhiṃ sukhasāmisādippakārehi
analyzed: sampajānassa ati sammā pakārehi jānantassa vattha ārammaṇehi saddhim sukha sāmisa ādi ppakārehi
translated: “Understanding” : knowing by way of the right aspects, by way of the aspects of pleasure mixed with pain, and so on, together with the object and the basis.

original: aviparītaṃ vedanaṃ jānantassāti attho. Pubbabhāgabhāvanā vohārānusāreneva pavattatīti
analyzed: aviparītam vedanam jānantassa ati attho pubbabhāga bhāvanā vohāra anusārena iva pavattati iti
translated: The development in the earlier stage proceeds by way of the conventional expression.🔽Therefore it is said, “merely by way of the conventional expression.”

original: āha “vohāramattenā”ti. Vedayāmīti “ahaṃ vedayāmī”ti attupanāyikā vuttāti, pariññātavedanopi
analyzed: āha vohāra mattena ati vedayāmi iti aham vedayāmi iti attupanāyikā vuttā ati pariññāta vedanā api
translated: “I feel” is said with reference to oneself.

original: vā uppannāya sukhavedanāya lokavohārena “sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī”ti jānāti, voharati
analyzed: vā uppannāya sukha vedanāya loka vohārena sukham vedanam vedayāmi iti jānāti voharati
translated: Even one who has fully understood feeling knows and speaks by way of the conventional expression of the world, “I feel a pleasant feeling,” when a pleasant feeling has arisen.

original: ca, pageva itaro. Tenāha “vohāramattena vutta”nti.
analyzed: ca pagā iva itaro tena āha vohāra mattena vuttanti
translated: How much more so the other person. Therefore it is said, “merely by way of the conventional expression.”🔽“Both” refers to energy and concentration.🔽“Having yoked together” means having made them neither deficient nor excessive because of their common function.

original: Ubhayanti vīriyasamādhiṃ. Saha yojetvāti samadhurakiccato anūnādhikaṃ katvā. Atthadhammādīsu sammohaviddhaṃsanavasena pavattā maggapaññā eva lokuttarapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: ubhayanti vīriya samādhim saha yojetvā iti sa madhura kiccataḥ anūna adhikam katvā attha dhamma ādīsu sammoha viddhaṃsana vasena pavattā magga paññā eva lokuttara paṭisambhidā
translated: The wisdom of the path, which occurs by way of the destruction of confusion about meaning, ideas, etc., is the supramundane discrimination of perspicuity.🔽In the three doors beginning with the visible-form door.🔽“The object” is the formless object.

original: Vaṇṇamukhādīsu tīsupi mukhesu. Pariggahassāti arūpapariggahassa. “Vatthu nāma karajakāyo”ti
analyzed: vaṇṇa mukha ādīsu tīsu pi mukhesu pariggahassa ati arūpa pariggahassa vatthu nāma karaja kāyo ti
translated: “The bases are the physical heart-basis”🔽is said in order to exclude the six bases beginning with the eye.

original: vacanena nivattitaṃ dassento “na cakkhādīni cha vatthūnī”ti āha. Aññamaññupatthambhena
analyzed: vacanena nivattitam dassentaḥ na cakkha ādīni cha vatthūni iti āha aññamañña upatthambhena
translated: “Not the six bases” is said in order to exclude the six bases beginning with the eye.🔽“By mutual support” means

original: ṭhitesu dvīsu naḷakalāpesu ekassa itarapaṭibaddhaṭṭhititā viya nāmakāyassa rūpakāyapaṭibaddhavuttitādassanañhetaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitesu dvīsu naḷa kalāpesu ekassa itara paṭibaddha ṭṭhiti tā viya nāmakāyassa rūpa kāya paṭibaddha vutti tā dassanam hetam
translated: It shows that the mental body has its occurrence bound up with the material body, as the two bundles of reeds have their stability bound up with each other.

original: nissayapaccayavisesadassananti.
analyzed: nissaya paccaya visesa dassananti
translated: It is a special instance of support condition.

original: Tesanti yesaṃ phassaviññāṇāni pākaṭāni, tesaṃ. Aññesanti tato aññesaṃ, yesaṃ phassaviññāṇāni
analyzed: tesam ti yesam phassa viññāṇāni pākaṭāni tesam aññesanti tatas aññesam yesam phassa viññāṇāni
translated: “Theirs”: of those whose contact and consciousness are evident. “Others’”: of those other than them, whose contact and consciousness are not evident.

original: na pākaṭāni. Sukhadukkhavedanānaṃ suvibhūtavuttitāya vuttaṃ “sabbesaṃ vineyyānaṃ🔽vedanā pākaṭā”ti. Vilāpetvā vilāpetvāti suvisuddhaṃ navanītaṃ vilāpetvā sītibhūtaṃ
analyzed: na pākaṭāni sukha dukkha vedanānam su vibhūta vutti tāya vuttam sabbesam vineyyānam  vedanā pākaṭā ati vilāpetvā vilāpetvā ati su visuddham navanītam vilāpetvā sīti bhūtam
translated: Because the occurrence of pleasant and painful feelings is evident, it is said: “Feelings are evident to all who are trainable.

original: atisītale udake pakkhipitvā patthinnaṃ ṭhitaṃ matthetvā paripiṇḍetvā puna vilāpetvāti
analyzed: ati sītale udake pakkhipitvā patthinnam ṭhitam matthetvā paripiṇḍetvā puna vilāpetvā ati
translated: ” “Having churned and churned”: having churned well-clarified butter, and having put it in very cold water, it stands mixed with the water. Having taken it out and kneaded it, and having churned it again,

original: satavāraṃ evaṃ katvā.
analyzed: evam katvā
translated: having done it a hundred times in this way.

original: Tatthāpīti yattha arūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ eva…pe… dassitaṃ, tatthāpi. Yesu suttesu tadantogadhaṃ rūpakammaṭṭhānanti yojanā.
analyzed: tattha api iti yattha arūpa kammaṭṭhānam dassitam tattha api yesu suttesu tad antogadham rūpa kammaṭṭhānam ti yojanā
translated: “There too”: where the immaterial meditation subject is demonstrated, there too. The application is to be understood in the way already stated in the case of the material meditation subject included in those same suttas.

original: Vedanānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vedanā anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the contemplation of feelings is ended.

original: Cittānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the contemplation of consciousness

original: 365. Kilesasampayuttānaṃ na visuddhatā hotīti sambandho. Itarehipīti attanā sampayuttakilesato
analyzed: kilesa sampayuttānam na visuddha tā hoti iti sambandho itarehi pi iti attanā sampayutta kilesato
translated: The construction is: “There is no purity in what is associated with defilements.” “In the other” means in the other, that is, in the defilements not associated with it.

original: itarehipi asampayuttehi. Visuṃ vacananti aññākusalato visuṃ katvā vacanaṃ. Visiṭṭhaggahaṇanti
analyzed: itarehi pi asampayuttehi visum vacanan ti añña akusalataḥ visum katvā vacanam visiṭṭha ggahaṇam ti
translated: “Separate mention” means separate mention from other unprofitable states. “Special mention” means

original: visiṭṭhatāgahaṇaṃ, āveṇikasamohatādassananti attho, yato tadubhayaṃ momūhacittanti vuccati.
analyzed: visiṭṭha tā gahaṇam āveṇika sa moha tā dassananti atthaḥ yatas tat ubhayam momūha cittam ti vuccati
translated: special mention, the meaning is, the showing of a delusion not shared in common. For both these are called “a deluded mind.”

original: Cittānupassanāniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: citta anupassanā niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the contemplation of consciousness is ended.

original: Dhammānupassanāniddeso
translated: Description of the Contemplation of Mental Objects

original: Ka. nīvaraṇapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ka nīvaraṇa pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the hindrances

original: 367. Ekasmiṃ yuge baddhagoṇānaṃ viya ekato pavatti yuganaddhatā.
analyzed: ekasmin yuge viyat ekatas pavatti yuga naddha tā
translated: The “coupling” is the occurrence of the two together like a pair of oxen yoked together.🔽“Mode of taking” is the mode of taking the object as “beautiful” in the case of foulness.

original: Gahaṇākārenāti asubhepi ārammaṇe “subha”nti gahaṇākārena. Nimittanti cāti subhanimittanti
analyzed: gahaṇa ākārena ati asubhe pi ārammaṇe subhanti gahaṇa ākārena nimittanti ca ati subha nimittanti
translated: “Sign” is what is called the “sign of the beautiful.”

original: ca vuccatīti yojanā. Ekaṃsena sattā attano attano hitasukhameva āsīsantīti katvā
analyzed: ca vuccati iti yojanā ekaṃsena sattāḥ attanaḥ attanaḥ hita sukham eva āsīsanti iti katvā
translated: The construction is: “it is said.” Since beings are intent only on their own welfare and happiness,

original: vuttaṃ “ākaṅkhitassa hitasukhassā”ti. Anupāyo eva ca hitavisiṭṭhassa sukhassa ayonisomanasikāro,
analyzed: vuttam ākaṅkhitassa hita sukhassa ati anupāyaḥ eva ca hita visiṭṭhassa sukhassa a yoniso manasikāraḥ
translated: it is said: “on the welfare and happiness they long for.” And wrong mental attention is the wrong means for the special kind of happiness that consists in welfare,

original: ākaṅkhitassa vā yathādhippetassa hitasukhassa anupāyabhūto. Avijjandhā hi tādisepi
analyzed: ākaṅkhitassa vā yathā adhippetassa hita sukhassa anupāya bhūtaḥ avijjandhā hi tādise pi
translated: Or it is a non-means for the welfare and happiness desired or intended. For the blind with ignorance go to such things

original: pavattantīti. Nipphādetabbeti ayonisomanasikārena nibbattetabbe kāmacchandeti attho.🔽Tadanukūlattāti tesaṃ asubhe “subha”nti, “asubha”nti ca pavattānaṃ ayonisomanasikārayonisomanasikārānaṃ
analyzed: pavattanti iti nipphādetabba iti ayoniso manasikārena nibbattetabbe kāmacchanda iti attho  tad anukūla ttā ati tesam asubhe subhanti asubhanti ca pavattānam a yonisoma nasikāra yonisoma nasikārānam
translated: as that. To be produced: to be generated by unwise attention. The meaning is: sensual lust.🔽Because of its conformity: because of its conformity to the unwise attention and wise attention that occur thus: “What is ugly is beautiful” and “What is beautiful is ugly.”

original: anukūlattā. Rūpādīsu aniccādiabhinivesassa, aniccasaññādīnañca yathāvuttamanasikārūpanissayatā tadanukūlatā.
analyzed: anukūla ttā rūpa ādīsu anicca ādi abhinivesassa anicca saññā ādīnam ca yathā vutta manasikā rūpa nissaya tā tad anukūla tā
translated: The conformity of the determinations to the adherence to the impermanent, etc., as permanent, etc., and to the attention described as the perception of the impermanent, etc., is their conformity to the latter.🔽The construction is: he arouses the perception of the foul in regard to nutriment.

original: Āhāre paṭikkūlasaññaṃ so uppādetīti sambandho. Tabbipariṇāmassāti bhojanapariṇāmassa
analyzed: āhāre paṭikkūla saññam so uppādeti iti sambandho tad vipariṇāmassa ati bhojana pariṇāmassa
translated: The outcome of its change: the outcome of the change of the nutriment.

original: nissandādikassa. Tadādhārassāti udarassa, kāyasseva vā. Soti bhojanemattaññū. Suttantapariyāyena
analyzed: nissanda ādikassa tad ādhārassa ati udarassa kāyassa iva vā saḥ ti bhoja nematta ññū suttanta pariyāyena
translated: The outcome of its digestion, etc. Its basis: the belly, or the body. He: the one who knows the right amount in eating.

original: kāmarāgo “kāmacchandanīvaraṇa”nti vuccatīti āha “abhidhammapariyāyenā”ti. Abhidhamme
analyzed: kāma rāgaḥ kāmacchanda nīvaraṇanti vuccati iti āha abhidhamma pariyāyena ati abhidhamme
translated: In the text of the sutta, lust for the five strands of sense pleasure is called “the hindrance of sensual desire,” thus it is said “in the Abhidhamma” .🔽In the Abhidhamma

original: hi “nīvaraṇaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca nīvaraṇo dhammo uppajjati napurejātapaccayā”ti etassa🔽vibhaṅge “arūpe kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ paṭicca thinamiddhanīvaraṇaṃ uddhaccanīvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: hi nīvaraṇam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati na purejāta paccayā ati etassa  vibhaṅge arūpe kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam paṭicca thinamiddha nīvaraṇam uddhacca nīvaraṇam
translated: “A state that is a Hindrance is a condition, as a Hindrance condition, for a state that is a Hindrance” .

original: avijjānīvaraṇaṃ uppajjatī”tiādivacanato bhavarāgopi kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ vuttanti
analyzed: avijjā nīvaraṇam uppajjati iti ādi vacanataḥ bhava rāgaḥ api kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam vuttan ti
translated: In the Description of the Conditioned under the heading of this condition it is said: “With a Hindrance consisting in sensual desire as condition there arises a Hindrance consisting in sloth-and-torpor … a Hindrance consisting in worry-and-flurry … a Hindrance consisting in ignorance” .🔽So it is evident that existence-lust is called the Hindrance of sensual desire.

original: viññāyati. Tenāha “sabbopi lobho kāmacchandanīvaraṇa”nti.🔽Sīmābhede kateti attādimariyādāya bhinnāya, attādīsu sabbattha ekarūpāya mettābhāvanāyāti
analyzed: viññāyati tena āha sabbaḥ api lobho kāmacchanda nīvaraṇan ti  sīmā bhede katā iti atta ādi mariyādāya bhinnāya atta ādīsu sabbattha ekarūpāya mettā bhāvanāya ati
translated: Hence it is said, “All greed is the Hindrance of sensual desire” .🔽When the boundary is broken down: when the boundary of self, etc., is broken down; the meaning is that when loving-kindness is developed as one in all, in self and in what pertains to self, etc.

original: attho. Vihārādiuddesarahitanti vihārādipadesaparicchedarahitaṃ. Uggahitāya mettāya.🔽Aṭṭhavīsatividhāti itthiādivasena sattavidhā paccekaṃ averādīhi yojanāvasena aṭṭhavīsatividhā.
analyzed: atthaḥ vihāra ādi uddesa rahitanti vihāra ādi padesa pariccheda rahitan uggahitāya mettāya  aṭṭhavīsatividhā ti itthi ādi vasena sattavidhā paccekam aveḥ ādīhi yojanā vasena aṭṭhavīsatividhā
translated: Without reference to a dwelling, etc., as object: without defining an area such as a dwelling, etc., as object.🔽When loving-kindness has been taken up.🔽Twenty-eight kinds: seven kinds as “woman,” etc., and twenty-eight kinds by taking each one in association with non-aversion, etc.

original: Sattādiitthiādiaverādiyogenāti ettha sattādiaverādiyogena vīsati, itthiādiaverādiyogena
analyzed: satta ādi itthi ādi avera ādi yogena ati ettha satta ādi avera ādi yogena itthi ādi avera ādi yogena
translated: By the association of “being” with “non-aversion,” etc., there are twenty; by the association of “woman,” etc., with “non-aversion,” etc., there are twenty-eight.

original: aṭṭhavīsatīti aṭṭhacattārīsaṃ ekissā disāya. Tathā sesadisāsupīti sabbā saṅgahetvā🔽āha “asītādhikacatusatappabhedā”ti.🔽Katākatānusocanañca na hotīti yojanā. “Bahukaṃ sutaṃ hoti suttaṃ geyya”ntiādivacanato🔽bahussutatā navaṅgassa sāsanassa vasena veditabbā, na vinayamattassevāti vuḍḍhataṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhavīsati iti ekissā disāya tathā sesa disāsu pi iti sabbā saṅgahetvā  āha  kata akata anusocanam ca na hoti iti yojanā bahukam sutam hoti suttam  bahu ssuta tā navaṅgassa sāsanassa vasena veditabbā na vinaya mattassa iva ati vuḍḍha tatam
translated: Adding them all together, he said ‘divided into more than two hundred and eighty’.🔽And there is no more sorrow over what is done and what is not done.🔽The state of being learned should be understood as being in the ninefold Buddha Word, according to the words ‘He has much heard, the discourses, the mixed prose and verse’ ,

original: pana anapekkhitvā icceva vuttaṃ, na bahussutatañcāti.
analyzed: pana an apekkhitvā iccā iva vuttam na
translated: and so on, not merely in the Vinaya. But the words ‘and not merely the state of being learned’ are said without regard to the state of being an elder,🔽and not merely because of the state of being learned.

original: Tiṭṭhati anuppannā vicikicchā ettha etesu “ahosiṃ nu kho ahamatītamaddhāna”ntiādikāya pavattiyā anekabhedesu purimuppannesu vicikicchādhammesūti te ṭhānīyā vuttā.
analyzed: tiṭṭhati anuppannā vicikicchā ettha etesu ahosim nu kho aham atītam addhā an anti ādikāya pavattiyā aneka bhedesu purima uppannesu vicikicchā dhammesu iti te ṭhānīyāḥ vuttā
translated: ‘Doubt that has not arisen does not arise’ means that the states of doubt that have arisen in the past in the many ways beginning with ‘Did I exist in the past?’ are said to be ‘the states of doubt that should arise’.

original: Aṭṭhavatthukāpīti na kevalaṃ soḷasavatthukā, nāpi ratanattayavatthukā ca, atha kho
