analyzed: aṭṭha vatthukā api iti na kevalam soḷasa vatthukā na api rata nattaya vatthukā ca atha kho
translated: ‘In the eight cases’ means not only in the sixteen cases, nor only in the three cases of the Three Jewels,

original: aṭṭhavatthukāpi. Ratanattaye saṃsayāpannassa sikkhādīsu kaṅkhāsambhavato, tattha
analyzed: rata nattaye saṃsaya āpannassa sikkhā ādīsu kaṅkhā sambhavato tattha
translated: but also in the eight cases. For when one has doubts about the Three Jewels, doubt arises in the training, etc.,🔽and

original: nibbematikassa tadabhāvato ca sesavicikicchānaṃ ratanattayavicikicchāmūlikatā daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: nibbematikassa tad abhāvato ca sesa vicikicchānam ratana ttaya vicikicchā mūlika tā daṭṭhabbā
translated: and because of the absence of the latter, the rest of the doubts should be regarded as rooted in doubt about the Three Jewels.

original: Anupavisanaṃ “evameta”nti saddahanavasena ārammaṇassa pakkhandanaṃ.
analyzed: anupavisanam evam etat ti saddahana vasena ārammaṇassa pakkhandanam
translated: “He does not enter upon” means that he does not plunge into the object by approving it with the thought, “It is thus.”

original: Nīvaraṇapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the hindrances is ended

original: Kha. bojjhaṅgapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bojjhaṅga pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the enlightenment factors

original: Tenāti atthasannissitaggahaṇena.
analyzed: tena ati attha sannissita ggahaṇena
translated: “By that”: by the apprehension of the meaning.

original: Paccayavasena dubbalabhāvo mandatā.
analyzed: paccaya vasena dubbala bhāvaḥ manda tā
translated: “Weakness” is the condition of being weak.

original: Pabbatapadesavanagahanantaritopi gāmo na dūre, pabbataṃ parikkhipitvā gantabbatāya āvāso araññalakkhaṇūpeto, tasmā maṃsasoteneva assosīti vadanti.
analyzed: pabbata padesa vana gahana antaritaḥ api gāmaḥ na dūre pabbatam parikkhipitvā gantabba tāya āvāso arañña lakkhaṇa upeto tasmā maṃsa sotena iva assosi iti vadanti
translated: “The village is not far away even though it is hidden by a mountain spur and a forest thicket”: so they say, because it is accessible by going round the mountain.

original: Sampattihetutāya pasādo sinehapariyāyena vutto.
analyzed: sampatti hetu tāya pasādaḥ sineha pariyāyena vutto
translated: “Confidence” is said by the way of affection because it is the cause of excellence.

original: Indriyānaṃ tikkhabhāvāpādanaṃ tejanaṃ. Tosanaṃ pamodanaṃ.
analyzed: indriyānam tikkha bhāva āpādanam tejanam tosanam pamodanam
translated: “Stirring up” is arousing the keenness of the faculties. “Satisfying” is gladdening.

original: Bojjhaṅgapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bojjhaṅga pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the enlightenment factors is ended

original: Samathavipassanāvasena paṭhamassa satipaṭṭhānassa, suddhavipassanāvasena itaresaṃ.
analyzed: samatha vipassanā vasena paṭhamassa sati paṭṭhānassa suddha vipassanā vasena itaresam
translated: The first foundation of mindfulness is by way of serenity and insight, the others by way of mere insight.

original: Āgamanavasena vuttaṃ aññathā maggasammāsatiyā kathaṃ kāyārammaṇatā siyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: āgamana vasena vuttam aññathā magga sammāsatiyā katham kāya ārammaṇa tā siyāti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that it is said in terms of the arrival of the object, otherwise how could right mindfulness of the path have the body as its object?🔽Of the four kinds of persons stated in the passage beginning, “One who abides contemplating the body in the body” . That is why he says, “For it is not possible to say of any one of them …

original: Kāyānupassiādīnaṃ catubbidhānaṃ puggalānaṃ vuttānaṃ. Tenāha “na hi sakkā ekassa…pe…🔽vattu”nti. Anekasatisambhavāvabodhapasaṅgāti ekacittuppādena anekissā satiyā sambhavassa,🔽sati ca tasmiṃ anekāvabodhassa ca āpajjanato. Sakiccaparicchinneti attano kiccavisesavisiṭṭhe.
analyzed: kāya anupassi ādīnam catubbidhānam puggalānam vuttānam tena āha na hi sakkā ekassape  vattum ti aneka sati sambhava avabodha pasaṅgā ti eka cittuppādena anekissā satiyā sambhavassa  sati ca tasmin aneka avabodhassa ca āpajjanataḥ sa kicca paricchinnā iti attanaḥ kicca visesa visiṭṭhe
translated: … to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.”🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.

original: Dhammabhedenāti ārammaṇabhedavisiṭṭhena dhammavisesena. Na dhammassa dhammo kiccanti
analyzed: dhamma bhedena ati ārammaṇa bheda visiṭṭhena dhamma visesena na dhammassa dhammo kiccanti
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.

original: ekassa dhammassa aññadhammo kiccaṃ nāma na hoti tadabhāvato. Dhammabhedena dhammassa🔽vibhāgena. Tassa bhedoti tassa kiccassa bhedo natthi. Tasmāti yasmā nayidha dhammassa
analyzed: ekassa dhammassa añña dhammo kiccam nāma na hoti tad abhāvataḥ dhamma bhedena dhammassa  vibhāgena tassa bhedaḥ ti tassa kiccassa bhedaḥ natthi tasmā ati yasmā dhammassa
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.

original: vibhāgena kiccabhedo icchito, kiccabhedena pana dhammavibhāgo icchito, tasmā. Tena
analyzed: vibhāgena kicca bhedo icchito kicca bhedena pana dhamma vibhāgo icchito tasmā tena
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.🔽The meaning is that it is not possible to say of any one of them that he is contemplating the body in the body.

original: vuttaṃ “ekāvā”tiādi.
analyzed: vuttam ekāva tiādi
translated: “Alone” is said, etc.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhāṇavāra is finished.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra

original: 374. “Kāye kāyānupassī”ti idaṃ puggalādhiṭṭhānena satipaṭṭhānavisesanaṃ, tañca āgamanasiddhaṃ,
analyzed: kāye kāya anupassī ti idam puggala adhiṭṭhānena sati paṭṭhāna visesanam tat ca āgamana siddham
translated: “Contemplating the body as a body”: this is a distinguishing mark of the foundation of mindfulness that has a person as its object. And that is established by the coming in of the person.

original: aññathā tassa asambhavatoti āha “āgamanavasena…pe… desetvā”ti. Puggalaṃ anāmasitvāti
analyzed: aññathā tassa asambhavato ti āha desetvā iti puggalam an āmasitvā iti
translated: Otherwise it would be impossible, so it is said: “Having taught the foundation of mindfulness that has a person as its object by way of the coming in of the person, etc.”

original: “kāye kāyānupassī”ti evaṃ puggalaṃ aggahetvā. Tathā anāmasanato eva āgamanavisesanaṃ
analyzed: kāye kāya anupassī iti evam puggalam aggahetvā tathā an āmasanataḥ eva āgamana visesanam
translated: Without mentioning the person: without taking up the person in the way “contemplating the body as a body.”🔽And because it is not mentioned in that way, without making a distinction by way of the coming in of the person.

original: akatvā. Nayadvayeti anupassanānayo, suddhikanayoti etasmiṃ nayadvaye.
analyzed: a katvā naya dvaya iti anupassanā nayo suddhika nayo ti etasmim naya dvaye
translated: In the two methods: in the method of contemplation and the method of purification.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra is finished.

original: Satipaṭṭhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Satipaṭṭhānavibhaṅga is finished.

original: 8. Sammappadhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: sammappadhāna vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Vibhaṅga on the Right Strivings

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhāṇavāra

original: 390. Kāraṇasaddo yuttivācako “sabbametaṃ akāraṇaṃ vadatī”tiādīsu viya, tasmā kāraṇappadhānāti
analyzed: kāraṇa saddo yutti vācakaḥ sabbam etam akāraṇam vadati itiādīsu viya tasmā kāraṇa ppadhānā ti
translated: The word “reason” is a synonym for “cause,” as in such passages as “All this is said without reason” . Therefore, “having a reason” means

original: yuttippadhānā, anuppannapāpakānuppādanādikiriyāya anurūpappadhānāti evaṃ vā ettha
analyzed: yutti ppadhānā anuppanna pāpaka anuppādana ādi kiriyāya anurūpa ppadhānā ati evam vā ettha
translated: Or else the meaning here should be regarded as follows: “The meditation subject is the object of the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the footing for the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of footing that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the means to the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of means that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the condition for the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of condition that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the cause for the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of cause that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the foundation for the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of foundation that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the exertion for the meditation; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of exertion that is the meditation subject. The meditation subject is the non-arising of arisen evil, unprofit; the meditation is the act of steadying the mind on the meditation subject in such a way that it is in conformity with the kind of non-arising that is the non-arising of arisen evil, unprofit.”

original: attho daṭṭhabbo. Anuppannapāpakādīnaṃ anuppādādi anuppannapāpakānuppādādi.
analyzed: atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ anuppanna pāpaka ādīnam anuppāda ādi anuppanna pāpaka anuppāda ādi
translated: Non-arising of arisen evil, unprofit, etc., is the non-arising, etc., of arisen evil, unprofit, and so on.

original: 391. “Na añño dhammoti yathā taṇhāyanamicchābhinivesavāyamanasabhāvānaṃ taṇhādīnaṃ
analyzed: na aññaḥ dhammo ti yathā taṇhā ādīnam
translated: “No other idea”: just as craving, wrong view, conceit, and desire for being are ideas that are synonyms for craving, etc.,

original: chandapariyāyo aññadhammo nāma hoti kattukamyatāsaṅkhātassa chandaniyassa tesu abhāvā,
analyzed: chanda pariyāyaḥ añña dhammaḥ nāma hoti kattu kamya tā saṅkhātassa chandaniyassa tesu abhāvā
translated: and are called “other ideas” because of the absence of the kind of desire called “willing” in the case of craving, etc.,

original: dhammacchando pana taṃsabhāvattā aññadhammo na hoti. Tenāha “dhammacchandoti sabhāvacchando”ti.
analyzed: dhamma chandaḥ pana tad sabhāva ttā añña dhammaḥ na hoti tena āha dhamma chandaḥ iti sabhāva chandaḥ iti
translated: so desire for the idea is not an “other idea” because it has that same nature. That is why he said “Desire for the idea is desire for the nature of the idea.”

original: 406. Aṭṭhakathāyanti porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ. Vaṭṭānatthasaṃvattanatoti saṃsāradukkhasambhavato.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāyanti porāṇa aṭṭhakathāyam vaṭṭāna attha saṃvattanato ti saṃsāra dukkha sambhavato
translated: “In the old commentaries”: in the old commentaries on the Abhidhamma.

original: Na sakkontīti āha “santāya samāpattiyā parihīnā brahmacariyavāse santhambhituṃ na sakkontī”ti.🔽Tattha duvidhāyāti yojetabbaṃ. Uppannāyevāti uppannapubbā eva uppajjanti samudācārādivasena.
analyzed: na sakkonti iti āha santāya samāpattiyā parihīnāḥ brahmacariya vāse santhambhitum na sakkonti iti 🔽tattha duvidhāya ati yojetabbam uppannāya eva ati uppanna pubbāḥ eva uppajjanti samudācāra ādi vasena
translated: “She is unable to continue in the life of purity” means she is unable to continue in the life of purity by means of the attainment.🔽Herein, “of two kinds” should be construed with “arisen” . “Only arisen” means only arisen before, by way of occurrence, etc.

original: Sabbāsu avatthāsūti pakatattādiavatthāsu. Pakatattāvatthena hi sabbena sabbaṃ tāni
analyzed: sabbāsu avatthāsu iti pakata tta ādi avatthāsu pakata tta avatthena hi sabbena sabbam tāni
translated: In all the grounds: in the grounds of the ordinary man, etc. For all of them are included in the ground of the ordinary man, etc.

original: na caritabbāni. Itarāvatthena ca tadavatthāya tāni tāniyeva caritabbāni. Vattabbantiādīnīti
analyzed: na caritabbāni itara avatthena ca tad avatthāya tāni tāniyeva caritabbāni vattabba nti ādīni iti
translated: In all the cases: in the cases of the regular monk, etc. For in the case of the regular monk, none of them should be done with anyone at all. But in the other cases, those should be done with those in that case. “Should be done, etc.”:

original: ādi-saddena “na ekacchanne anāvāse vatthabbaṃ, na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā
analyzed: ādi saddena na eka channe anāvāse vatthabbam na eka channe āvāse vā anāvāse vā
translated: The word “etc.” includes “one should not stay in an uncovered place that is not a dwelling, one should not stay in a dwelling or in a place that is not a dwelling that is covered on one side,

original: vatthabbaṃ, na ekāsane nisīditabbaṃ, na nīce āsane nisinne ucce āsane nisīditabbaṃ,🔽na chamāyaṃ nisinne āsane nisīditabbaṃ, na ekacaṅkame caṅkamitabbaṃ, na nīce caṅkame
analyzed: vatthabbam na ekāsane nisīditabbam na nīce āsane nisinne ucce āsane nisīditabbam  na chamāyam nisinne āsane nisīditabbam na eka caṅkame caṅkamitabbam na nīce caṅkame
translated: one should not sit on the same seat, one should not sit on a high seat while the other sits on a low seat,🔽one should not sit on a seat while the other sits on the ground, one should not walk on the same walking-mat, one should not walk on a high walking-mat while the other walks on a low one,

original: caṅkamante ucce caṅkame caṅkamitabbaṃ, na chamāyaṃ caṅkamante caṅkame caṅkamitabba”nti
analyzed: caṅkamante ucce caṅkame caṅkamitabbam na chamāyam caṅkamante caṅkame caṅkamitabbanti
translated: one should not walk on a walking-mat while the other walks on the ground” .

original: imāni saṅgaṇhāti. Tesanti pārivāsikavuḍḍhatarādīnaṃ vasena. Sampiṇḍetvāti saṅkaḍḍhitvā.
analyzed: imāni saṅgaṇhāti pārivāsika vuḍḍhatara ādīnam vasena sampiṇḍetvā ati saṅkaḍḍhitvā
translated: “Those” refers to the senior probationer on probation, etc. “Combined” means “collected.”

original: Ekekaṃ katvāti navāpi ekamekaṃ katvā. “Abhivādanapaccuṭṭhānañjalikammasāmīcikammaṃ
analyzed: ekekam katvā iti nava api ekam ekam katvā abhivādana paccuṭṭhāna añjalikamma sāmīcikammam
translated: “Making each one” means making each of the nine “one.” “Bowing down, rising up, raising hands in respectful salutation, doing acts of respect,

original: na sāditabbaṃ, āsanābhihāraṃ, seyyābhihāraṃ, pādodakaṃ, pādapīṭhaṃ, pādakathalikaṃ,
analyzed: na sāditabbam āsana abhihāram seyyā abhihāram pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam
translated: He should not consent to a seat being brought forward, to the bringing forward of a couch, to the bringing forward of a stool, to the bringing forward of a resting place, to the bringing of water for washing the feet, to the bringing of a foot stool, to the bringing of a foot scraper,

original: pattacīvarapaṭiggahaṇaṃ na sāditabba”nti idaṃ sabbampi asādiyanasāmaññena ekaṃ. Dasāti
analyzed: patta cīvara paṭiggahaṇam na sāditabbanti idam sabbam pi a sādiyana sāmaññena ekam dasāti
translated: to the receiving of bowl and robe. All this is one because of the similarity of the consenting. Ten:

original: “na sīlavipattiyā, na ācāravipattiyā, na diṭṭhivipattiyā, na ājīvavipattiyā, na bhikkhū🔽bhikkhūhi bhedetabbā, na gihiddhajo dhāretabbo, na titthiyaddhajo dhāretabbo, na
analyzed: na sīla vipattiyāḥ na ācāra vipattiyāḥ na diṭṭhi vipattiyāḥ na ājīva vipattiyāḥ na bhikkhū  bhikkhūhi bhedetabbā na gihiddhajaḥ dhāretabbaḥ na titthiyaddhajaḥ dhāretabbaḥ na
translated: he should not be divided by a breach in virtue, by a breach in conduct, by a breach in view, by a breach in livelihood, by a breach in learning,

original: titthiyā sevitabbā, bhikkhū sevitabbā, bhikkhusikkhāya sikkhitabba”nti evamāgatā dasa.
analyzed: titthiyā sevitabbā bhikkhū sevitabbā bhikkhu sikkhāya sikkhitabbanti evam āgatāḥ dasa
translated: he should not wear a householder’s emblem, he should not wear an ascetic emblem, he should not associate with sectarians, he should associate with bhikkhus, he should train in the bhikkhu’s training.🔽The “action” mentioned in the words “and action whose result is not yet arisen” is a particular action.

original: “Kammañcā”ti paccattavasena vuttaṃ kammaṃ “avipakkavipākassā”ti ettha “kammassā”ti🔽sāmivacanavasena pariṇāmetvā yojetabbaṃ. Bhūtāpagatuppannanti vuttanti sambandho.
analyzed: kammañca āti paccatta vasena vuttam kammam avipakka vipākassa ati ettha kammassa ati  sāmi vacana vasena pariṇāmetvā yojetabbam bhūta apagata uppannan ti vuttam ti sambandhaḥ
translated: The construction is: “whose result is not yet arisen of that action.”

original: Idhāti imissā sammohavinodaniyā. “Evaṃ kate okāse vipāko…pe… uppannoti vuccatī”ti
analyzed: idha ati imissā sammoha vinodaniyā evam kate okāse vipāka ope uppannaḥ ti vuccati iti
translated: Here in this Dispelling of Relishing, when the opportunity has been created in this way, the result is said to be “arisen.”

original: vadanto vipākameva vadati. Tatthāti aṭṭhasāliniyaṃ. Maggena samucchinnā thāmagatā
analyzed: vadantaḥ vipākam eva vadati tattha ati aṭṭhasāliniyam maggena samucchinnā thāma gatā
translated: He is speaking of the fruition itself.🔽Herein, in the Eightfold Path, the lust for sense desires, etc., which have been cut off by the path and have gone to destruction are called “latent tendencies.”

original: kāmarāgādayo “anusayā”ti vuccantīti āha “anusayita…pe… maggena pahātabbā”ti.
analyzed: kāma rāga ādayaḥ anusayā ti vuccanti iti āha maggena pahātabbā ati
translated: That is why it is said: “The latent tendencies are to be abandoned by the path.”🔽How is the object like a tree with sap? By the act of apprehending the sign.

original: Āhatakhīrarukkho viya ārammaṇaṃ, kathaṃ? Nimittaggāhavasena. Tamevatthaṃ vivarati
analyzed: āhata khīra rukkhaḥ viya ārammaṇam katham nimitta ggāha vasena tam eva attham vivarati
translated: He explains that meaning:🔽“The object is apprehended by the act of apprehending the sign.”

original: “adhigata”ntiādinā. Tattha nimittaggāhavasena ārammaṇassa adhiggahitattā taṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: adhigata nti ādinā tattha nimitta ggāha vasena ārammaṇassa adhiggahita ttā tam ārammaṇam
translated: Herein, because the object is apprehended by the act of apprehending the sign, that object is called “apprehended”

original: anussaritānussaritakkhaṇe kilesuppattihetubhāvena uppattiṭṭhānato adhigatameva nāma
analyzed: anussarita anussarita khaṇe kilesa uppatti hetu bhāvena uppatti ṭṭhānataḥ adhigatam eva nāma
translated: in the sense of being a source of arising by becoming a cause for the arising of defilements in the moments of its repeated occurrence.

original: hotīti āha “adhigataṃ nimittaggāhavasenā”ti, taṃ ārammaṇaṃ pātubhūtakilesanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: hoti iti āha adhigatam nimitta ggāha vasena ati tam ārammaṇam pātubhūta kilesanti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that the object is a defilement that has become manifest.

original: Kilesuppattinimittatāya uppattirahaṃ kilesaṃ “ārammaṇaṃ antogadhakilesa”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kilesa uppatti nimitta tāya uppatti raham kilesam ārammaṇam antogadha kilesam ti vuttam
translated: The defilement that is a cause for the arising of defilements is called “the defilement included in the object.”

original: Tañca kho gāhake labbhamānaṃ gahetabbe upacaritvā, yathā nissite labbhamānaṃ nissaye
analyzed: tat ca kho gāhake labbhamānam gahetabbe upacaritvā yathā nissite labbhamānam nissaye
translated: And that is said figuratively in the sense of what is apprehended by the apprehender, just as the object of a thought is figuratively said to be known by the thought.

original: upacaritvā “mañcā ukkuṭṭhiṃ karontī”ti. Idāni upacāraṃ muñcitvā nippariyāyeneva atthaṃ
analyzed: upacaritvā mañcāḥ ukkuṭṭhim karonti iti idāni upacāram muñcitvā nippariyāyena iva attham
translated: and he said, “The bed is making a noise.” Now, having finished his figurative expression, he said the meaning literally,

original: dassento “nimittaggāha…pe… sadisā”ti āha. Vitthāretabbanti “yathā kiṃ? Sace khīrarukkha”ntiādinā vitthāretabbaṃ.
analyzed: dassentaḥ nimitta ggāhape sadisā iti āha vitthāretabbanti yathā kim sace khīra rukkha nti ādinā vitthāretabbam
translated: and he said, “The bed is making a noise.” Now, after abandoning the conventional meaning, he shows the primary meaning with “The sign’s taking, etc.,” and “The like.” “Should be expanded” means that it should be expanded with “What? If the milk tree, etc.”

original: Tidhāti atītādivasena tidhā. Ābhato upamāvasena. Appahīnatādassanatthampīti pi-saddena🔽“tidhā navattabbatādassanatthampī”ti vuttameva sampiṇḍeti. Evaṃ maggena pahīnakilesā
analyzed: tidhā iti atīta ādi vasena tidhā ābhataḥ upamā vasena appahīna tā dassana ttham pi iti pi saddena  tidhā nava ttabba tā dassana ttham pi iti vuttam eva sampiṇḍā iti evam maggena pahīna kilesā
translated: “In three ways” means in the past, etc., ways. “The simile is brought in” means that the simile is brought in by the words “As if a man were to see.” “In order to show that it is not abandoned” means that the word “also”

original: daṭṭhabbā magge anuppanne uppattirahānampi uppanne sabbena sabbaṃ abhāvato.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbāḥ magge anuppanne uppatti rahānam pi uppanne sabbena sabbam abhāvataḥ
translated: combines what is said with “In order to show that it is not produced in the three ways.” Thus the defilements abandoned by the path should be seen as not existing at all in any way when the path has arisen, and as not existing at all in any way when the path has not arisen, but as existing in the way stated when the path has arisen and when it has not arisen.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttas and the Minor Books is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā🔽427. Vīriyajeṭṭhikāya pana maggabhāvanāya na vattabbāni sammappadhānāni “maggādhipatīnī”ti
analyzed: vīriya jeṭṭhikāya pana magga bhāvanāya na vattabbāni sammappadhānāni magga adhipatīni iti
translated: The commentary on the questions🔽The right efforts are not to be called “predominant in the path” in the case of the development of the path with energy as the most important factor,

original: vā “namaggādhipatīnī”ti vāti vāti ettha paṭhamassa vīriyantarābhāvo, itarassa itarādhipatino,
analyzed: vā na magga adhipatīni iti vāti vāti ettha paṭhamassa vīriya antara abhāvaḥ itarassa itara adhipatino
translated: or in the case of the development of the path with faith as the most important factor. Herein, there is no other energy in the first case, and in the second case there is no other faith as the predominant factor,

original: namaggabhūtavīriyādhipatino ca abhāvo navattabbatāya kāraṇanti imamatthamāha “maggādhipatīnī”tiādinā.
analyzed: ca abhāvaḥ ca abhāvaḥ imam attham āha magga adhipatīni iti ādinā
translated: and the absence of the faculties of energy and of faith is the reason for their non-arising because they are not yet arisen. This is the meaning he is pointing to when he says “The faculties of energy and faith are the dominant condition” and so on.

original: Tadāti vīriyajeṭṭhikamaggabhāvanākāle.
analyzed: tadā ati vīriya jeṭṭhika magga bhāvanā kāle
translated: “Then”: at the time of developing the path with energy as the most important factor.

original: Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the questions is ended.

original: Sammappadhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sammappadhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the right efforts is ended.

original: 9. Iddhipādavibhaṅgo
analyzed: iddhi pāda vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Exposition of the Bases of Psychic Power

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Suttas in the Bhaddekaratta Division

original: 431. Paṭhamo kattuattho “ijjhatīti iddhī”ti. Dutiyo karaṇattho “ijjhanti etāyā”ti.
analyzed: paṭhamo kattu atthaḥ ijjhati iti iddhi iti dutiyaḥ karaṇa atthaḥ ijjhanti etāya ati
translated: The first is the meaning of the agent, “Psychic power is what is to be effected” . The second is the meaning of the instrument, “By this they are effected” .

original: Pajjitabbā iddhi vuttā “iddhiṃ pajjanti pāpuṇantī”ti kattusādhanassa iddhisaddassa🔽karaṇasādhanena pādasaddena samānādhikaraṇatāya asambhavato, ijjhanakassa ca atthassa
analyzed: pajjitabbā vuttā iddhim pajjanti pāpuṇanti iti kattu sādhanassa iddhi saddassa  karaṇa sādhanena pāda saddena samāna adhikaraṇa tāya asambhavataḥ ijjhanakassa ca atthassa
translated: The psychic power to be effected is called “the bases of psychic power” . The expression “they effect psychic power” is not a compound of the instrument case with the verb “to attain” ,🔽because it is impossible to make the word “base” , which is a compound of the verb “to attain” with the noun “attainment” ,🔽into a compound with the word “psychic power” , which is a compound of the verb “to effect” with the noun “effect” .

original: karaṇabhūtena pādena pajjitabbattā “iddhi eva pādo”ti saddayojanā na sambhavatīti
analyzed: karaṇa bhūtena pādena pajjitabba ttā id hi eva pādo ti sadda yojanā na sambhavati iti
translated: And because the meaning of the verb “to effect” is not possible as the meaning of the noun “base” ,🔽the construction of the words “the bases of psychic power” is not possible.

original: imamatthamāha “na ca…pe… vattu”nti. Iddhikiriyākaraṇenāti ijjhanakiriyāya karaṇabhūtena
analyzed: imam attham āha na vattum ti iddhi kiriyā karaṇena ati karaṇa bhūtena
translated: This is the meaning he is pointing to when he says “Nor is it possible to construe the words in the way beginning ‘The bases of psychic power are the bases of what is to be effected by psychic power’ ” .

original: atthena sādhetabbā ca iddhi pajjitabbāti yojanā. Dvinnaṃ karaṇānanti ijjhanapajjanakiriyākaraṇānaṃ🔽iddhipādatthānaṃ. Na asamānādhikaraṇatā sambhavati paṭisedhadvayaṃ pakatiyaṃ ṭhapetīti.
analyzed: atthena sādhetabbā ca id hi pajjitabbā ati yojanā dvinnam karaṇānam ti ijjhana pajjana kiriyā karaṇānam  iddhipāda tthānam na asamāna adhikaraṇa tā sambhavati paṭisedha dvayam pakatiyam ṭhapeti iti
translated: The two kinds of meaning are the meaning of ‘base’ and the meaning of ‘cause’.🔽So it is not possible to have a compound with a common base in the two meanings.🔽So because it is not possible to have a compound with a common base in the two meanings,

original: Tasmāti yasmā paṭhamenatthena samānādhikaraṇasamāso, dutiyena sāmivacanasamāso iddhipādasaddānaṃ🔽na yujjati, tasmā. Yathāvuttā vā paṭhamenatthena samānādhikaraṇasamāsavaseneva yojanā
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmā paṭhamena atthena samāna adhikaraṇa samāsaḥ dutiyena sāmivacana samāsaḥ iddhipāda saddānam  na tasmai yathā vuttā vā paṭhamena atthena samāna adhikaraṇa samāsa vasena iva yojanā
translated: the compound is resolved in the first way in the first meaning and in the second way in the second meaning.

original: yujjati pādassa pajjamānakoṭṭhāsabhāvato. Dutiyenatthena itarasamāseneva yojanā yujjati🔽pādassa ijjhanakaraṇūpāyabhāvato.
analyzed: yujjati pādassa pajjamāna koṭṭhāsa bhāvataḥ dutiyena atthena itara samāsena iva yojanā yujjati  pādassa ijjhana karaṇa upāya bhāvataḥ
translated: Or alternatively, the resolution in the first way in the first meaning is appropriate because the foot is a part of what succeeds. The resolution in the second way in the second meaning is appropriate because the foot is a means of causing success.🔽‘Some’ refers to the Elder Dhammapāla.

original: Kecīti dhammasirittheraṃ sandhāya vadati. Duvidhatthāyāti nibbattiatthāya, vuddhiatthāya
analyzed: keci iti dhammasiri ttheram sandhāya vadati duvidha tthāya ati nibbatti atthāya vuddhi atthāya
translated: In the two ways: in the way of production and in the way of development.🔽Visuṃ: apart from the compound ‘iddhi-pāda’.

original: ca. Visunti “iddhi eva pādo iddhipādo”ti imasmā visuṃ. Samāsayojanāvasenāti “iddhiyā
analyzed: ca id hi eva iddhi pādaḥ iddhi pādaḥ iti imasmai visum samāsa yojana avasena ati
translated: Samāsayojanāvasena: by the method of resolving the compound.

original: pādo iddhipādo”ti evaṃ samāsayojanāvasena. Yathāyuttoti kattukaraṇatthesu yo yo yutto.
analyzed: pādaḥ iddhipādaḥ iti evam samāsa yojanā vasena yathā yutto ti kattu karaṇa atthesu yaḥ yaḥ yutto
translated: “As they are used” means as each is used in the sense of agent or in the sense of instrument.

original: Paṭilābhapubbabhāgānanti visesādhigamataṃpubbabhāgānaṃ yathākkamaṃ kattiddhikaraṇiddhibhāvaṃ
analyzed: paṭilābha pubbabhāgānam ti visesa adhigama taṃ pubbabhāgānam yathākkamam
translated: “The acquisition and the prior part” : the prior part of the acquisition of distinction is the state of being the basis for success, respectively.

original: sandhāya vuttoti yojanā. Uttaracūḷabhājanīye “chandoyeva chandiddhipādo, cittameva,🔽vīriyameva, vīmaṃsāva vīmaṃsiddhipādo”ti vuttattā āha “uttaracūḷabhājanīye vā vuttehi
analyzed: sandhāya vuttā iti yojanā uttaracūḍa bhājanīye chandoyā iva chandi ddhi pādaḥ cittam eva  vīriyam eva vīmaṃsāva vīmaṃsiddhi pādo ti vutta ttā āha uttaracūḷabhājanīye vā vuttehi
translated: “In the Uttaraculavagga” : “Desire itself is the basis for success through desire. The mind itself is the basis for success through concentration.🔽Energy itself is the basis for success through energy. Investigation itself is the basis for success through investigation” .

original: chandādīhi iddhipādehī”tiādi.
analyzed: chanda ādīhi iddhipādehi itiādi
translated: Therefore it is said: “or the bases for success through desire, etc., mentioned in the Uttaraculavagga” .

original: Chandacittavīmaṃsiddhipādesu tāva yuttaṃ padhānasaṅkhāraggahaṇaṃ apubbattā, vīriyiddhipāde
analyzed: chanda citta vīmaṃsiddhipādesu tāva yuttam padhāna saṅkhāra ggahaṇam apubba ttā vīriya iddhipāde
translated: As for the bases for success through desire, the mind, and investigation, the inclusion of the formations consisting in strenuous practice is appropriate because it is not mentioned elsewhere.🔽But in the case of the basis for success through energy, it is asked: “Why is it mentioned?”

original: pana kathanti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “vīriyiddhipādaniddese”tiādi. Yadi dveyeva samannāgamaṅgāni,
analyzed: pana kathanti codanam sandhāya āha vīriya iddhi pāda niddesa itiādi yadi samannāgamaṅgāni
translated: “In the description of the basis for success through energy” . If there are only two factors of endowment,🔽what is the purpose of desire, etc.? It is said: “They are distinctions of concentration” .

original: chandādayo kimatthiyāti āha “samādhivisesanānī”ti. Na idha…pe… vuttā hoti atabbisesanattā.
analyzed: chanda ādayaḥ kim atthiyā ti āha samādhi visesanāni iti na vuttā hoti a tad visesana ttā
translated: Here, the four bases for success are not mentioned in the way beginning, “When a bhikkhu is possessed of virtue” , because they are not distinguished.

original: Yadipi samādhivisesanasamannāgamaṅgadassanatthaṃ dvikkhattuṃ vīriyaṃ āgatanti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: yadi api dvi kkhattum vīriyam āgatan ti vuttam
translated: Although it is said that the word “energy” occurs twice in order to show the possession of the distinction of concentration and the possession of the distinction of the factor of the path,

original: taṃ pana “vīriyasamādhisamannāgata”nti ettāvatāpi siddhaṃ hoti. Evaṃ siddhe sati
analyzed: tam pana ettāvatā api siddham hoti evam siddhe sati
translated: that is established by the words “endowed with concentration and energy.”🔽If that is so,

original: puna vacanaṃ vīriyantarasabbhāvaṃ nu kho dīpetīti kadāci āsaṅkeyyāti tadāsaṅkānivattanatthaṃ
analyzed: puna vacanam vīriya antara sabbhāvam nu kho dīpeti iti kadāci āsaṅkeyya āti tad āsaṅkā nivattana attham
translated: then it is asked: “Does the repetition of the word ‘energy’ indicate a different kind of energy?”

original: “vīriyañcā”tiādimāha. Chandādīhi visiṭṭhoti chandādīnaṃ adhipatipaccayatāvisesena🔽visiṭṭho. Teneva hi chandādimukheneva iddhipādā desitā. Tathā ca vuttaṃ “chandaṃ
analyzed: vīriyam ca atiādim āha chanda ādīhi visiṭṭhaḥ ti chanda ādīnam adhipati paccaya tā visesena  visiṭṭhaḥ tena iva hi chanda ādi mukhena iva iddhipādāḥ desitā tathā ca vuttam chandam
translated: “Distinguished by zeal, etc.,” means distinguished by the distinction of the condition of predominance of zeal, etc.

original: ce bhikkhu adhipatiṃ karitvā labhati samādhi”ntiādi. Taṃtaṃavassayanavasenāti tassa🔽tassa chandassa samādhino avassayatāvasena, paccayavisesatāyāti attho. Upāyatthena…pe…
analyzed: ce bhikkhu adhipatim karitvā labhati taṃ taṃ avassayana vasena ati tassa  tassa chandassa samādhinaḥ avassaya tā vasena paccaya visesa tāya ati atthaḥ
translated: For it is by way of zeal, etc., that the bases of success are taught. And it is said accordingly: “If a bhikkhu, making zeal predominant, obtains concentration and attains to absorption” , etc.🔽“By the predominance of each” means by the predominance of each of these kinds of zeal, etc. The meaning is: by the distinction of condition.🔽“By way of instrument” means by way of the instrument of attainment. The instrument of attainment is also the state of reliance.

original: vuttā hoti adhigamūpāyatāpi nissayabhāvoyevāti. “Tenevā”tiādinā yathāvuttaṃ chandādīnaṃ
analyzed: vuttā hoti adhigama upāya tā api tena iva ati ādinā yathā vuttam chanda ādīnam
translated: “Therefore” means because of the predominance of each of these kinds of zeal, etc., the bases of success are taught by way of the instrument of attainment.

original: iddhipādataṃ pāḷiyāyeva vibhāveti. Tattha tenevāti chandādīnaṃyeva upāyatthabhāveneva🔽iddhipādabhāvassa adhippetattā. Upāyiddhipādadassanatthamevāti chandādike dhure jeṭṭhake
analyzed: pāḷiyāya iva vibhāveti tattha tena iva ati upāya ttha bhāvena iva  iddhipāda bhāvassa adhippeta ttā upāyi ddhipāda dassana attham eva ati chanda ādike dhure jeṭṭhake
translated: He explains the basis for success in the text itself. Herein, “by that alone” : the state of being a basis for success is intended as the state of being a means to the success of will, etc.

original: pubbaṅgame katvā nibbattitasamādhi chandādīnaṃ iddhiyā adhigamūpāyatādassanaṃ upāyiddhipādadassanaṃ,
analyzed: pubbaṅgame katvā nibbattita samādhi chanda ādīnam iddhiyāḥ adhigama upāya tā dassanam upāya iddhipāda dassanam
translated: “For the purpose of showing the basis for success as a means” : the concentration produced by making will, etc., the chief, the foremost, the cause, the basis, the support, the forerunner, and the condition, is the showing of the basis for success as a means.

original: tadatthameva “tathābhūtassa vedanākkhandho…pe… viññāṇakkhandho”ti tattha tattha pāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: tad attham eva tathābhūtassa vedanā kkhandho upe viññāṇa kkhandho ti tattha tattha pāḷiyam
translated: “For that purpose” : the showing of the basis for success as a support in the text, “For him who is thus, the feeling aggregate is a basis for success… the perception aggregate… the volitional formations aggregate… the consciousness aggregate is a basis for success,” is done.

original: nissayiddhipādadassanaṃ kataṃ chandādivisiṭṭhānaṃyeva vedanākkhandhādīnaṃ adhippetattā.🔽Evañcetaṃ sampaṭicchitabbaṃ. Aññathā kevalaṃ iddhisampayuttānaṃyeva khandhānaṃ vasena
analyzed: nissaya iddhipāda dassanam katam chanda ādi visiṭṭhānam yeva vedanā khandha ādīnam adhippeta ttā  evam ca itam sampaṭicchitabbam aññathā kevalam iddhi sampayuttānam yeva khandhānam vasena
translated: For the aggregates of feeling, etc., distinguished by will, etc., are intended there.

original: iddhipādabhāve gayhamāne catubbidhatā na hoti visesakāraṇābhāvatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: iddhipāda bhāve gayhamāne catubbidha tā na hoti visesa kāraṇa abhāvato ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: If this is accepted, but not otherwise, then if the state of being a basis for success is taken as applying only to the aggregates associated with success, the fourfoldness does not occur, because there is no reason for distinguishing it. This is the intention.

original: 433. Tosanaṃ satthu ārādhanaṃ, sikkhāya vā. Thāmabhāvatoti thirabhāvato. Kulāpadese
analyzed: tosanam satthu ārādhanam sikkhāya vā thāma bhāvataḥ ti thira bhāvataḥ kula apadese
translated: 1. Satisfaction is the satisfaction of the Master or of the training. “By its firmness” means by its steadiness. “In the place of birth” means in the family.

original: jātimā purissaro hotīti “pubbaṅgamattā cittassa visiṭṭhajātisadisatā”ti vuttaṃ. Vicāraṇāpaññāhetukattā
analyzed: jātimā purissaraḥ hoti iti pubbaṅgama ttā cittassa visiṭṭha jāti sadisa tā ti vuttam vicāraṇā paññā hetuka ttā
translated: “He is a man of birth and a great man” is said because the mind is preeminent. The similarity to a special kind of birth is due to the cause, which is understanding consisting in keeping in being.

original: mantassa vīmaṃsāsadisatā suviññeyyāvāti na uddhaṭā.
analyzed: mantassa vīmaṃsā asadisa tā su viññeyyā avāti na uddhaṭā
translated: The similarity to investigation is easy to understand, so it is not mentioned.

original: Chandādiketi chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārā, vīriyacittavīmaṃsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārāti
analyzed: chanda ādikā iti chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhārā vīriya citta vīmaṃsā samādhi padhāna saṅkhārā ati
translated: “Desire, etc.”: the conditions consisting in desire, concentration, and impetus, and the conditions consisting in energy, cognizance, and investigation.

original: ime tayo tayo dhamme. Abhedato bhedaṃ akatvā abhinditvā iddhibhāvasāmaññena, iddhipādabhāvasāmaññena
analyzed: ime tayo tayo dhamme abhedataḥ bhedam a katvā a bhinditvā iddhi bhāva sāmaññena iddhipāda bhāva sāmaññena
translated: These three things, without making a division, without distinguishing, are included by the similarity of their state of being bases of success, by the similarity of their state of being roads to power.

original: ca saṅgaṇhitvā. Tenāha “sampiṇḍetvā”ti. Bhedanaṃ vā sambhedanaṃ missīkaraṇanti āha🔽“amissetvā”ti. Tathā hi “sesā pana sampayuttakā cattāro khandhā iddhipādāyevā”ti
analyzed: ca saṅgaṇhitvā tena āha sampiṇḍetvā iti bhedanam vā sambhedanam missīkaraṇan ti āha  a missetvā ti tathā hi sesā pana sampayuttakā cattāro khandhāḥ iddhipādāya eva ati
translated: Hence it is said “by combining” . Or “division” is “mixing” . So it is said “without mixing” .🔽For thus it is said that the remaining associated things, the four categories, are only roads to power,

original: iddhiiddhipāde amissetvāpi kathitaṃ. Visesenāti bhedena catūsu iddhipādesu asammissabhāvena
analyzed: iddhi iddhipāde a missetvā api kathitam visesena ati bhedena catūsu iddhipādesu asammissa bhāvena
translated: without mixing the roads to power with the powers. “By distinguishing” means by distinguishing the four roads to power as unmixed individual essences.

original: āveṇikattā. Āveṇikā hi chandādayo tassa tassa iddhipādassa. Avisesenāti abhedena,
analyzed: āveṇika ttā āveṇikāḥ hi chanda ādayaḥ tassa tassa iddhipādassa avisesena ati abhedena
translated: Without distinction: without differentiation.

original: caturiddhipādasādhāraṇabhāvenāti attho.
analyzed: catur iddhipāda sādhāraṇa bhāvena ati attho
translated: The meaning is: in the commonness of the four bases of success.

original: Chandiddhipādasamādhiddhipādādayoti ādi-saddena padhānasaṅkhāraṃ, vīriyacittavīmaṃsā🔽ca saṅgaṇhāti. Pādoti tehi sampayuttaṃ catukkhandhamāha. “Chandiddhipāde pavisantī”tiādinā🔽visiṭṭhesveva pavesaṃ avatvā. Catūsūti chando, samādhi, padhānasaṅkhārā, taṃsampayuttā
analyzed: ādi saddena padhāna saṅkhāram vīriya citta vīmaṃsā  ca saṅgaṇhāti pādo ti tehi sampayuttam catukkhandham āha chandi iddhi pāde pavisanti itiādinā  visiṭṭhesu eva pavesam avatvā catūsu iti chandaḥ samādhi padhāna saṅkhārā tad sampayuttā
translated: The zeal base, the concentration base, etc., etc. The word “etc.” includes the energy base, the investigation base, the concentration base, and the inquiry base.🔽The “four” are zeal, concentration, the formation of determination, and the aggregates associated with that.🔽The “four” are zeal, concentration, the formation of determination, and the aggregates associated with that.

original: khandhāti evaṃ catūsu. Chandahetuko, chandādhiko vā samādhi adhippetoti āha “chandavato
analyzed: evam catūsu chanda hetuko chanda adhikaḥ vā samādhi adhippeto ti āha chandavato
translated: The concentration that is the cause of zeal or is dominated by zeal is intended here.🔽That is why he says: “What concentration will not succeed for one who is zealous?”

original: ko samādhi na ijjhissatī”ti. Itīti evaṃ anena pakārena, yaṃ samādhibhāvanāmukhaṃ.
analyzed: kaḥ samādhi naḥ ijjhissati iti iti iti evam anena pakārena yam samādhi bhāvanā mukham
translated: In this way: in this manner, by this method.

original: Samādhibhāvanānuyogena bhāvitā khandhā samādhibhāvitā.
analyzed: samādhi bhāvanā anuyogena bhāvitā khandhā samādhi bhāvitā
translated: The aggregates that are developed by the practice of concentration are “developed by concentration.”

original: “Ye hī”tiādinā “abhinavaṃ natthī”ti saṅkhepato vuttaṃ vivarati. Tiṇṇanti chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārānaṃ.
analyzed: ye hi iti ādinā abhinavam natthi iti saṅkhepataḥ vuttam vivarati tiṇṇam ti chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhārānam
translated: “For” etc. explains in detail what was stated in brief in the words “there is nothing new” . “Three” : of zeal, concentration, and the requisite of effort.

original: Idanti “ime hi tayo”tiādivacanaṃ. Purimassāti “chando samādhī”tiādivacanassa. Kāraṇabhāvenāti
analyzed: idam ti ime hi tayā iti ādi vacanam purimassa ati chando samādhi iti ādi vacanassa kāraṇa bhāvena ati
translated: “This” : the words “these three things” . “The former” : the words “zeal, concentration” . “As a cause” :

original: sādhanabhāvena. Tenāti “ime hi tayo dhammā”tiādivacanena. Yasmā chandādayo tayo dhammā🔽aññamaññaṃ, sampayuttakānañca nissayabhāvena pavattanti, tasmā tesampi iddhipādabhāvo
analyzed: sādhana bhāvena tena ati ime hi tayaḥ dhammā ati ādi vacanena yasmā chanda ādayo tayaḥ dhammā  aññam aññam sampayuttakānam ca nissaya bhāvena pavattanti tasmā tesam pi iddhipāda bhāvaḥ
translated: as a means. “Therefore” : because of the words “these three things” . “Since these three things”

original: vutto. So pana nissayabhāvo sampayogāvinābhāvīti āha “tadantogadhattā”ti, sampayuttakantogadhattāti
analyzed: vuttaḥ saḥ pana nissaya bhāvaḥ sampayoga avinābhāvī iti āha tad antogadhattā ati sampayuttaka antogadhattā ati
translated: “occur as a support for each other and for the associated things” , therefore their state of being bases of success is stated. But that state of support is inseparable from association, thus he says “because of the inclusion of that” . The meaning is: because of the inclusion of the associated things.

original: attho. Chandādīnaṃ viya sampayuttakkhandhānaṃ sabhāvato iddhibhāvo natthīti āha “iddhibhāvapariyāyo
analyzed: attho chanda ādīnam viya sampayutta kkhandhānam sabhāvataḥ iddhi bhāvaḥ natthi iti āha iddhi bhāva pariyāyaḥ
translated: There is no state of success by individual essence in the associated aggregates as there is in zeal, etc. Thus he says “there is a mode of expression as success” .

original: atthī”ti. Tena vuttaṃ “sesā sampayuttakā…pe… na attano sabhāvenā”ti. Ekadesassāti
analyzed: atthi iti tena vuttam sesā sampayutta kāpe na attanaḥ sabhāvena ati eka desassa ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “The rest of the associated things … are not by their individual essences” . “A part” :

original: chandādīnaṃ. Catunnampi khandhānaṃ, chandādīnaṃ vā catunnaṃ. Punapīti “sampayuttakā
analyzed: chanda ādīnam catunnam pi khandhānam chanda ādīnam vā catunnam punapi iti sampayuttakā
translated: Of the four aggregates, or of the four beginning with zeal. Again, he says “associated” and so on referring to the four aggregates and the four beginning with zeal.

original: panā”tiādiṃ sandhāyāha. Iminā catukkhandhatadekadesānaṃ iddhibhāvadīpanena.
analyzed: pana ati ādim sandhāya āha iminā catukkhandha tad ekadesānam iddhi bhāva dīpanena
translated: By this he shows that the four aggregates and the four beginning with zeal are the footing for success.

original: Pubbe vuttato vacanakkamena aññanti āha “apubbanti katvā”ti. Kenaṭṭhena iddhi paṭilābho,
analyzed: pubbe vuttataḥ vacana kkamena aññanti āha apubbanti katvā iti kenaṭṭhena iddhi paṭilābhaḥ
translated: He says “taking the first as the first” because of the order of the words in the text.🔽In what sense is success a footing? In what sense is the first part the preliminary? The application is in the order.

original: kenaṭṭhena pādo pubbabhāgoti yathākkamaṃ yojanā. Yadi patiṭṭhānaṭṭhena pādo, nissayiddhipādoyeva🔽vutto siyā, na upāyiddhipādoti āha “upāyo cā”tiādi. Sabbatthāti suttantabhājanīye,
analyzed: kenaṭṭhena pādaḥ pubbabhāgaḥ ti yathākkamam yojanā yadi patiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena pādaḥ  vuttaḥ siyā na upāya iddhipādaḥ ti āha upāyaḥ ca atiādi sabbattha ati suttantabhājanīye
translated: If it is a footing in the sense of a foundation, then only the footing for success as foundation is stated, not the footing for success as means.🔽Therefore he says “and also as means” and so on.🔽Everywhere means in the Basket of Discourses and in the Basket of Higher Doctrine.🔽Therefore he says “in the Basket of Discourses” and so on.

original: abhidhammabhājanīye ca. Tenāha “suttantabhājanīye hī”tiādi. Samādhivisesanabhāvenāti
analyzed: abhidhamma bhājanīye ca tena āha suttanta bhājanīye hi itiādi samādhi visesana bhāvena ati
translated: As a distinction of concentration means that concentration is a distinction of concentration.

original: “chandādhipati, chandahetuko, chandādhiko vā samādhi chandasamādhī”tiādinā samādhissa
analyzed: chanda adhipati chanda hetukaḥ chanda adhikaḥ vā samādhi chanda samādhi iti ādinā samādhissa
translated: “Concentration born of zeal” is concentration that is dominant, caused by, or superior to zeal.🔽The reading is also “by the practice of concentration.”

original: visesanabhāvena. “Samādhisevanavasenā”ti ca pāṭho. Tattha samādhisevanavasenāti chandādhike
analyzed: visesana bhāvena samādhi sevana vasena iti ca pāṭhaḥ tattha samādhi sevana vasena iti chanda adhike
translated: Therein, by the practice of concentration means by the practice of concentration that is superior to zeal.

original: adhipatiṃ karitvā samādhissa āsevanavasena. Upāyabhūtānanti “chandavato ce samādhi
analyzed: adhipatim karitvā samādhiḥ āsevana vasena upāya bhūtānanti chandavato ce samādhi
translated: and the bases of success are the condition for concentration by repetition.

original: ijjhati, mayheva ijjhatī”ti samādhiāsevanāya upāyabhūtānaṃ.
analyzed: ijjhati mayheva ijjhati iti samādhi āsevanāya upāya bhūtānam
translated: The bases of success are the means for the concentration that is successful through desire,

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhājanīya is finished.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhājanīya

original: 444. Sādhipativārāni aṭṭhasatāni, tesu paccekaṃ cattāro iddhipādā na sambhavantīti
analyzed: sa adhipati vārāni aṭṭha satāni tesu paccekam cattāro iddhipādāḥ na sambhavanti iti
translated: There are eight hundred sets of bases of success. In them, the four bases of success do not occur separately.

original: āha “sādhipativārānaṃ paripuṇṇānaṃ abhāvā”ti. Tattha kāraṇamāha “na hi adhipatīnaṃ🔽adhipatayo vijjantī”ti. Yadi hi adhipatī siyuṃ sādhipatīti iddhipādabhedena dvattiṃsa
analyzed: āha sa adhipati vārānam paripuṇṇānam tattha kāraṇam āha na hi adhipatīnam  adhipatayaḥ vijjanti iti yadi hi adhipatī siyum sā adhipatiḥ iti iddhipāda bhedena dvattiṃsa
translated: Therefore it is said: “Because there are no complete sets of bases of success.” Herein, he gives the reason: “For bases of success do not occur as bases of success.”

original: nayasatāni, suddhikāni aṭṭhāti cattāri nayasahassāni bhaveyyuṃ, taṃ pana natthīti
analyzed: naya satāni suddhikāni aṭṭhāti cattāri naya sahassāni bhaveyyum tam pana natthi iti
translated: For if they were bases of success, there would be thirty-two hundred methods by way of the division of the bases of success as bases of success, and there would be four thousand methods in the simple form. But that is not so.

original: adhippāyo. Yattakā pana nayā idha labbhanti, taṃ dassetuṃ “ekekasmiṃ panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ yattakā pana nayāḥ idha labbhanti tam dassetum ekekasmin pana atiādi vuttam
translated: This is the intention. But in order to show how many methods there are here, it is said: “But in each of the four” and so on.

original: Suddhikāni aṭṭha nayasatāni sādhipatikānipi aṭṭhevāti catunnaṃ maggānaṃ vasena soḷasa nayasatāni.
analyzed: suddhikāni aṭṭha naya satāni sa ādhipatikāni pi aṭṭha iva ati catunnam maggānam vasena soḷasa naya satāni
translated: The eight hundred kinds of purity and the eight hundred kinds of purity together with the faculties make up the sixteen hundred kinds of path in the four paths.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Requisites of the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Questioner

original: Sayaṃ jeṭṭhakabhāvena pavattanato cattāro adhipatayo aññamaññaṃ garuṃ na karonti.🔽Tasmā “cattāro iddhipādā na maggādhipatino”ti vuttā. Tenāha “aññamaññassa pana adhipatayo
analyzed: sayam jeṭṭhaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ cattāraḥ adhipatayaḥ aññam aññam garum na karonti  tasmā cattāro iddhipādāḥ na magga adhipatino ti vuttā tena āha aññamaññassa pana adhipatayaḥ
translated: The four dominants are not mutually dominant because they occur by virtue of their own pre-eminence.🔽That is why it is said, “The four bases for success are not dominants of the path.” Hence it is said, “They are not dominants of each other” .

original: na bhavantī”ti. Etamatthanti “adhipatayo aññamaññassa adhipatī na bhavantī”ti etamatthaṃ.🔽Adhipatinoti adhipati bhavituṃ samatthassa. Adhipatiṃ na karontīti adhipatiṃ katvā
analyzed: na bhavanti iti etam attham ti adhipatayaḥ aññamaññassa adhipatī na bhavanti iti etam attham  adhipatino ti adhipati bhavitum samatthassa adhipatim na karonti iti adhipatim katvā
translated: This is the meaning: they are not dominants of each other.🔽“Dominants” : capable of being a dominant. “They do not make a dominant” : they do not occur giving predominance to any one of them.

original: garuṃ katvā nappavattanti. Adhipatīnaṃ sahabhāveti adhipatikiccakaraṇena sahapavattiyaṃ.
analyzed: garum katvā na ppavattanti adhipatīnam sahabhāve iti adhipati kicca karaṇena saha pavattiyam
translated: “In the presence of the dominants” : in the presence of the occurrence of the function of the dominants.

original: “Avīmaṃsādhipatikassa maggassa abhāvā”ti idaṃ “adhipatitāsamatthā dhammā adhipatibhāveneva
analyzed: a vīmaṃsā adhipatikassa maggassa abhāvā ti idam adhipati tā samatthāḥ dhammāḥ adhipati bhāvena iva
translated: “Because there is no path of non-reflection” : because there is no path that is not a reflection of the four noble truths.

original: pavatteyyu”nti dosāropanavasenāha, na yathādhigatavasena. Adhipatidhammānañhi pubbābhisaṅkhāre
analyzed: dosa āropana vasena āha na yathā adhigata vasena adhipati dhammānam hi pubba abhisaṅkhāre
translated: he said this by way of ascribing hate, not by way of what is actually obtained. For when there is a prior volition of the dominant ideas,

original: sati adhipatibhāvena pavatti, na aññathāti sahabhāvepi tadabhāvaṃ sandhāya visesanaṃ
analyzed: sati adhipati bhāvena na aññathā iti sahabhāve pi tad abhāvam sandhāya visesanam
translated: there is occurrence by way of the state of dominance, not otherwise. Therefore, although they are conascent, it is not proper to say that the distinction🔽should not be made, taking that absence into consideration.

original: na kattabbaṃ siyāti sakkā vattuṃ. Aññamaññādhipatikaraṇabhāveti aññamaññaṃ adhipatiṃ
analyzed: na kattabbam siyāti sakkā vattum aññamañña adhipati karaṇa bhāveti aññamaññam adhipatim
translated: As to the state of mutual dominance: in the occurrence by way of making each other dominant.

original: katvā pavattiyaṃ. Vīmaṃsādhipatikattavacananti vīmaṃsādhipatikabhāvassa vacanaṃ.
analyzed: katvā pavattiyam vīmaṃsa ādhipatika tta vacanan ti vīmaṃsa ādhipatika bhāvassa vacanam
translated: As to the statement of the state of dominance of investigation: as to the statement of the state of dominance of investigation.

original: Na vattabbaṃ siyā sabbesampi adhipatīnaṃ sādhipatikattāti adhippāyo. Sahabhāvo paṭikkhitto
analyzed: na vattabbam siyā sabbesam pi adhipatīnam sādhipatika ttā ti adhippāyaḥ sahabhāvaḥ paṭikkhitto
translated: It should not be said that it is the state of dominance of all the dominants. This is the purport. The conascence is rejected

original: eva sādhipatibhāvassa anekaṃsikatāvacanato.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: eva sa adhipati bhāvassa anekaṃsikatā vacanataḥ  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: because the state of dominance is stated as a plurality.🔽The commentary on the questions and answers is finished.

original: Iddhipādavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽10. Bojjhaṅgavibhaṅgo🔽1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: iddhipāda vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  bojjhaṅga vibhaṅgaḥ  suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The commentary on the analysis of the bases of success is finished.🔽The analysis of the factors of awakening🔽The sutta collection

original: Paṭhamanayavaṇṇanā
translated: The first method

original: 466. Patiṭṭhānaṃ idha saṃsāre avaṭṭhānaṃ, tassa mūlaṃ kilesāti āha “kilesavasena
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam idha saṃsāre avaṭṭhānam tassa mūlam kilesā ti āha kilesa vasena
translated: Here, the root of non-revolving in the round of rebirths is the defilements. Therefore it is said: “by way of the defilements.

original: patiṭṭhāna”nti. Patiṭṭhānāya pana byāpārāpatti kammanti vuttaṃ “abhisaṅkhāravasena
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam ti patiṭṭhānāya pana byāpāra āpatti kamman ti vuttam abhisaṅkhāra vasena
translated: and the act of establishing is the act of accumulating.

original: āyūhanā”ti. Yasmā kilesesu taṇhādiṭṭhiyo taṇhādiṭṭhicaritānaṃ visesato saṃsāranāyikā,
analyzed: yasmā kilesesu taṇhā diṭṭhiyaḥ taṇhā diṭṭhi caritānam visesato saṃsāranāyikā
translated: Since craving and views are the chief causes of the round of rebirths for those of craving-nature and for those of view-nature respectively,🔽and since the act of establishing is performed by kamma accompanied by defilements, not by kamma alone,

original: kilesasahitameva ca kammaṃ patiṭṭhānāya hoti, na kevalaṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ “taṇhādiṭṭhīhi…pe…
analyzed: kilesa sahitam eva ca kammam patiṭṭhānāya hoti na kevalam tasmā vuttam taṇhā diṭṭhī hipe
translated: it is said: “The act of establishing is by craving and views. …

original: āyūhanā”ti. Tathā taṇhāya bhavassādabhāvato, diṭṭhiyā vibhavābhinandanabhūtāya vibhavābhisaṅkharaṇabhāvato🔽“taṇhāvasena patiṭṭhānaṃ, diṭṭhivasena āyūhanā”ti vuttaṃ. Diṭṭhīsupi antomukhappavattāya
analyzed: tathā taṇhāya bhava ssāda bhāvataḥ diṭṭhiyāḥ vibhava abhinandana bhūtāya vibhava abhisaṅkharaṇa bhāvataḥ  taṇhā vasena patiṭṭhānam diṭṭhi vasena āyūhanā iti vuttam diṭṭhī supi antomukha ppavattāya
translated: The act of accumulating is by craving and views.” Since craving is the cause of the enjoyment of existence and views are the cause of the delight in non-existence, which is the cause of the formation of non-existence,🔽it is said: “The act of establishing is by craving, and the act of accumulating is by views.”

original: bhavadiṭṭhiyā visesato saṃsāre avaṭṭhānaṃ, yato olīyanāti vuccatīti āha “sassatadiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: bhava diṭṭhiyāḥ visesato saṃsāre avaṭṭhānam yatas olīyanā ati vuccati iti āha sassata diṭṭhiyāḥ
translated: Among the views, the eternalist view, which is the cause of the inward-looking view, is the chief cause of the non-breaking of the round of rebirths, since it is said that one “goes to the world beyond.”🔽Therefore it is said: “The act of establishing is by the eternalist view.”

original: patiṭṭhāna”nti. Bahimukhappavattāpi vibhavadiṭṭhi bhavābhisaṅkharaṇaṃ nātivattatīti
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam ti bahimukha ppavattā api vibhava diṭṭhi bhava abhisaṅkharaṇam na ativattati iti
translated: The annihilationist view, which is the cause of the outward-looking view, does not go beyond the formation of existence.

original: vuttaṃ “ucchedadiṭṭhiyā āyūhanā”ti. Layāpatti yathāraddhassa ārambhassa aniṭṭhānaṃ🔽antosaṅkocabhāvatoti āha “līnavasena patiṭṭhāna”nti. Uddhatāpatti anupāyabhūtā byāpārāpatti
analyzed: vuttam uccheda diṭṭhiyāḥ āyūhanā ati laya āpatti yathā āraddhassa ārambhassa aniṭṭhānam  āha līna vasena uddhata āpatti anupāya bhūtā byāpāra āpatti
translated: “The laying hold is by way of annihilationism” is said. The falling away is the non-completion of the undertaking of what has been begun,🔽because of the state of being slack and of being without fear. Therefore it is said: “The laying hold is by way of depression.” The agitation is the state of being without a means, the state of being busy,

original: asaṅkocabhāvatoti vuttaṃ “uddhaccavasena āyūhanā”ti. Tathā kosajjapakkhikattā ca🔽kāmasukhānuyogassa uddhaccapakkhikattā ca attakilamathānuyogassa tadubhayavasena
analyzed: asaṅkoca bhāvato ti vuttam uddhacca vasena āyūhanā ti tathā kosajja pakkhika ttā ca  kāma sukha anuyogassa uddhacca pakkhika ttā ca atta kilamatha anuyogassa tad ubhaya vasena
translated: because of the state of being without fear. Therefore it is said: “The laying hold is by way of agitation.” Likewise, because of the side of indolence,🔽the pursuit of sensual happiness, and because of the side of agitation, the pursuit of self-mortification, the laying hold and the laying hold are said

original: patiṭṭhānāyūhanā vuttā, itaraṃ vuttanayānusārena veditabbaṃ. Idhāti imissā sammohavinodaniyā.
analyzed: patiṭṭhāna āyūhanā vuttā itaram vutta naya anusārena veditabbam idha āti imissā sammoha vinodaniyā
translated: to be by way of both. The other should be understood by the method stated. Herein means in this clearing up of confusion.

original: Avuttānanti “kilesavasena patiṭṭhāna”ntiādīnaṃ vasena veditabbā patiṭṭhānāyūhanāti yojanā.
analyzed: avuttānam ti kilesa vasena patiṭṭhāna nti ādīnam vasena veditabbā patiṭṭhāna āyūhanā iti yojanā
translated: The not stated means the laying hold should be understood by way of the “laying hold by way of defilement” and so on. The construction is this:

original: Samappavatte dhammeti līnuddhaccavirahena samappavatte sampayuttadhamme. Paṭisañcikkhatīti
analyzed: sama ppavatte dhamme iti līn uddhacca virahena sama ppavatte sampayutta dhamme paṭisañcikkhati iti
translated: The state of being even is the associated states which are even because of the absence of depression and agitation. He reflects.

original: patirūpaṃ saṅkaleti gaṇeti tuleti. Tenāha “upapattito ikkhatī”ti. Tadākāroti paṭisaṅkhānākāro
analyzed: patirūpam saṅkaleti gaṇeti tuleti tena āha upapattitaḥ ikkhati iti tad ākāro ti paṭisaṅkhāna ākāro
translated: He considers, collects, and weighs them. Hence ‘he looks upon their origination’ is said. The mode of the reflection

original: upapattito ikkhanākāro. Evañca katvāti paṭisaṅkhānasabhāvattā eva upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa.
analyzed: upapattitaḥ ikkhanā ākāraḥ evam ca katvā iti paṭisaṅkhāna sabhāva ttā eva upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: is the mode of looking upon their origination. And when it is put like this, it is because equanimity as a factor of complete awakening has the nature of reflection.

original: Pacchimapacchimakāraṇabhāvoti pacchimassa pacchimassa kāraṇabhāvo. Purimaṃ purimañhi🔽pacchimassa pacchimassa visesapaccayoti.
analyzed: pacchima pacchima kāraṇa bhāvo ti pacchimassa pacchimassa kāraṇa bhāvo purimam purimam hi  pacchimassa pacchimassa visesa paccayo ti
translated: The state of being the cause of the last of the last is the state of being the cause of the last of the last. For the former is the specific condition for the latter.

original: 467. Aviparītakāyādisabhāvaggahaṇasamatthatāya balavatī eva sati. Paññā gahitā satinepakkenāti🔽attho. Evaṃcittoti evaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasannissitacitto. Cirakatavattādivasenāti
analyzed: a viparīta kāya ādi sabhāva ggahaṇa samattha tāya balavatī eva sati paññā gahitā satinepakkena ati  evaṃcittaḥ ti evam lābha sakkāra siloka sannissita cittaḥ cira katavat tā ādi vasena ati
translated: Because it is able to apprehend the nature of the body, etc., that is not upside-down, it is strong. The meaning is: it is apprehended by the mindfulness and the carefulness of wisdom.

original: cirakatavattādisīsena. “Vutto”ti imināpi “katvā āha kāyaviññattiṃ…pe… koṭṭhāsa”nti yojanā.
analyzed: cira kata vattā ādi sīsena vuttaḥ iti iminā api katvā āha yojanā
translated: With such a mind: with a mind dependent on gain, honour, and fame. By reason of his long practice, etc.: in the sense of his long practice, etc. By the word “said” the construction is completed in the way beginning, “having made bodily expression … a portion” .

original: Paresanti na anantarānaṃ. Sabbesaṃ…pe… yojetabbā “sabbe bojjhaṅgā sabbesaṃ paccayavisesā
analyzed: paresanti na anantarānam sabbesam pe yojetabbā sabbe bojjhaṅgā sabbesam paccaya visesā
translated: The others: not the next ones. All … should be construed in the way beginning, “All the factors of complete awakening are the specific conditions for all the factors of complete awakening.

original: hontiyevā”ti. Kāmetīti kāmo, assādanavasena āmasatīti āmisaṃ, kāmova āmisanti kāmāmisaṃ,🔽kilesakāmo. Vatthukāmo pana āmasīyatīti āmisaṃ. Evaṃ sesadvayampi. Tesu lokīyanti🔽ettha sukhavisesāti loko, upapattiviseso. Vaṭṭaṃ saṃsāro. Kāmassādavasena pavatto🔽lobho kāmāmisaṃ. Bhavavisesapatthanāvasena pavatto lokāmisaṃ. Vibhavo nāma kimatthiyo,🔽ko vā taṃ abhipattheyyāti vaṭṭānugedhabhūto lobho vaṭṭāmisanti ca vadanti. Tadārammaṇanti🔽tassā taṇhāya ārammaṇaṃ, rūpādi. Lokadhammā lābhādayo. Vuttāvasesā sabbāva taṇhā saṃsārajanako rāgo.🔽Paṭhamanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Dutiyanayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kāma iti iti kāmaḥ assādana vasena āmasati iti āmisam kāmaḥ uva āmisanti kāma āmisam  kilesa kāmaḥ vatthu kāmo pana āmasīyati iti āmisam evam sesa dvayam pi tesu  ettha sukha visesā ti lokaḥ upapatti visesaḥ vaṭṭam saṃsāro kāma ssāda vasena pavatto  lobho kāma āmisam bhava visesa patthanā vasena pavatto loka āmisam vibhavaḥ nāma kimatthiyaḥ  kaḥ vā tam abhipattheyya ati vaṭṭa anugedha bhūtaḥ lobhaḥ vaṭṭa amisanti ca vadanti tad ārammaṇanti  tassā taṇhāyaḥ ārammaṇam rūpa ādi loka dhammāḥ lābha ādayaḥ vutta avasesā sabbā ava taṇhā saṃsāra janakaḥ rāgaḥ            dutiya naya vaṇṇanā
translated: “He longs” : he longs for sense desires, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he savours, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man.

original: 468-9. Sabbe sattāti kāmabhavādīsu, saññībhavādīsu, ekavokārabhavādīsu ca sabbabhavesu
analyzed: sabbe sattā ati kāma bhava ādīsu saññībhava ādīsu ekavokāra bhava ādīsu ca sabba bhavesu
translated: He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man. He is a lustful man because he is a lustful man, thus he is a lustful man.
