original: sabbe sattā. Āhārato ṭhiti etesanti āhāraṭṭhitikā, paccayaṭṭhitikā. Yena paccayena
analyzed: sabbe sattāḥ āhārato ṭhiti etesanti āhāra ṭṭhitikā paccaya ṭṭhitikā yena paccayena
translated: All beings. They are maintained by nutriment because they are maintained by nutriment, that is, by conditions.

original: te tiṭṭhanti, so ekova dhammo ñātapariññāsaṅkhātāya “āhāraṭṭhitikā”ti abhiññāya abhiññeyyo.
analyzed: te tiṭṭhanti saḥ ekaḥ iva dhammaḥ ñāta pariññā saṅkhātāya āhāra ṭṭhitikā ati abhiññāya abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The one thing that should be directly known is the nutriment that maintains them, that is, the nutriment that is called full-understanding as a kind of direct knowledge, by means of which nutriment they are maintained.

original: Dve dhātuyoti saṅkhatāsaṅkhatadhātuyo. Tisso dhātuyoti kāmadhāturūpadhātuarūpadhātuyo.🔽Pañca vimuttāyatanānīti “idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṃ deseti aññataro
analyzed: dve dhātuyo ti saṅkhata asaṅkhata dhātuyo tissaḥ dhātuyo ti kāmadhātu rūpadhātu arūpadhātuyo  pañca vimutta āyatanāni iti idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno satthā dhammam deseti aññataraḥ
translated: Two elements: the formed and the unformed elements. Three elements: the element of sense desires, the element of the material, and the element of the immaterial.

original: vā garuṭṭhāniyo”tiādinā āgatāni vimuccanakāraṇāni. Anuttariyānīti dassanānuttariyādīni
analyzed: vā āgatāni vimuccana kāraṇāni anuttariyāni iti dassana anuttariya ādīni
translated: Five doors to deliverance: the reasons for deliverance stated thus: “Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu’s teacher teaches him the Dhamma, or an experienced and competent companion in the holy life teaches him the Dhamma, or he hears the Dhamma in an assembly that has come together, or he attends carefully to the Dhamma as he has learned it in an appropriate mood-chamber, or he arrives at the conclusion through reasoning.🔽Six unsurpassables: the unsurpassables consisting in seeing, etc.,

original: cha anuttariyāni. Niddasavatthūnīti yehi kāraṇehi niddaso hoti, tāni niddasavatthūni🔽nāma. Desanāmattañcetaṃ. Khīṇāsavo hi dasavasso hutvā parinibbuto puna dasavasso
analyzed: cha anuttariyāni niddasa vatthūni iti yehi kāraṇehi niddasaḥ hoti tāni niddasa vatthūni  nāma desanā mattam ca itam khīṇāsavaḥ hi dasa vassaḥ hutvā parinibbutaḥ puna dasa vassaḥ
translated: Six grounds for laying down: the reasons for which a rule is laid down are called “grounds for laying down.”🔽This is merely a statement of the teaching. For one whose cankers are destroyed who has attained final knowledge does not become one of ten years’ standing again after attaining Nibbāna, nor does he become one of ten years’ standing, nor of nine years’ standing … nor of one year’s standing, nor of one moment’s standing.

original: na hoti. Na kevalañca dasavasso, navavassopi…pe… ekamuhuttikopi na hotiyeva puna
analyzed: na hoti na kevalam ca eka muhuttikaḥ pi na puna
translated: Nor does he become one of ten years’ standing again after attaining Nibbāna.

original: paṭisandhiyā abhāvā, aṭṭhuppattivasena panevaṃ vuttaṃ. Tāni pana “idha, bhikkhu,
analyzed: paṭisandhiyāḥ abhāvā aṭṭhuppatti vasena pana evam vuttam tāni pana idha bhikkhu
translated: and because there is no rebirth-linking, it is said in this way by way of the arising of the eight. But these are found in the sutta itself thus: “Here, bhikkhu,

original: sikkhāsamādāne tibbacchando hotī”tiādinā sutte āgatāniyeva. “Sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa
analyzed: sikkhā samādāne tibba chandaḥ hoti iti ādinā sutte āgatāniyā iva sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa
translated: there is keen desire for the undertaking of the training.” The ten grounds for effacement are the following: “In a person with right view

original: micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hotī”tiādīni dasa nijjaravatthūni. Khandhādayoti khandhāyatanadhātādayo.🔽Vinandhananti “bhavādivinandhanaṭṭhena vānaṃ vuccati taṇhā”ti dasseti. Gamananti
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hoti itiādīni dasa nijjara vatthūni khandha ādayaḥ ti khandha āyatana dhāta ādayaḥ  vinandhananti bhava ādi vinandhana ṭṭhena vānam vuccati taṇhā ati dasseti gamanan ti
translated: wrong view is effaced” and so on. The aggregates, etc., are the aggregates, bases, elements, etc.🔽“Delight” : he shows that craving is called “delight” in the sense of delighting in existence, etc. “Going” :

original: assādanavasena ārammaṇe pavattimāha. Tena vuttaṃ “piyarūpasātarūpesū”ti.
analyzed: assādana vasena ārammaṇe pavattim āha tena vuttam piya rūpa sātarūpesu iti
translated: he refers to the occurrence in an object with relishing. Hence he said: “in what is likable and agreeable.”

original: Vipassanāsahagatanti veditabbaṃ viññattisamuṭṭhāpakattā. “Maggaṃ appattaṃ kāyikaṃ
analyzed: vipassanā sahagatanti veditabbam viññatti samuṭṭhāpaka ttā maggam appattam kāyikam
translated: It should be understood as associated with insight, because it instigates the intimation of knowledge. But because it is said, distinguishing it thus: “Bodily energy in one who has not reached the path,”

original: vīriya”nti visesetvā vuttattā pana lokuttaravīriyampi pariyāyena kāyikaṃ nāma atthīti dīpitaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vīriyam ti visesetvā vutta ttā pana lokuttara vīriyam pi pariyāyena kāyikam nāma atthi iti dīpitam hoti
translated: it shows that supramundane energy is also called bodily energy by implication.

original: Rūpāvacare pītisambojjhaṅgoti na vuccatīti āha “rūpāvacare…pe… paṭikkhittā”ti. Yathā
analyzed: rūpāvacare pīti sambojjhaṅgo ti na vuccati iti āha paṭikkhittā ati yathā
translated: It is not called the joy enlightenment factor in the fine-material sphere, thus he said: “In the fine-material sphere … are rejected.” As

original: vipassanāsahagatā pīti pariyāyena “pītisambojjhaṅgo”ti vuccati, evaṃ rūpāvacare pīti
analyzed: vipassanā sahagatā pīti pariyāyena pīti sambojjhaṅgo ti vuccati evam rūpāvacare pīti
translated: and the happiness associated with insight is called the happiness enlightenment factor by way of its being a condition for the enlightenment factors.

original: nibbedhabhāgiyā vattabbā siyā. Evaṃ labbhamānāpi alabbhamānaṃ upādāya na vuttā. “Avitakkaavicārā”ti
analyzed: nibbedha bhāgiyā vattabbā siyā evam labbhamānā api a labbhamānam upādāya na vuttā avitakka avicārā ti
translated: So it can be said of the happiness of the fine-material sphere too. But it is not mentioned because it is not mentioned in the way that the other is.🔽The qualification “free from thought and examination” is stated in order to show that the happiness is peaceful and sublime.

original: visesanaṃ santapaṇītāya pītiyā dassanatthaṃ. Bojjhaṅgabhūtāti pariyāyabojjhaṅgabhūtā.
analyzed: visesanam santa paṇītāya pītiyāḥ dassana attham bojjhaṅga bhūtā ati pariyāya bojjhaṅga bhūtā
translated: They are called enlightenment factors by way of being conditions for enlightenment.🔽The happiness free from thought and examination is not mentioned because it is accompanied by thought and examination.

original: Avitakkaavicāro pīti…pe… na vutto savitakkasavicārattā tassa. Na hi kāmāvacarā avitakkaavicārā pīti atthi.
analyzed: a vitakka avicāraḥ na vutto sa vitakka sa vicāra attā tassa na hi kāmāvacarā avitakka avicārā pi iti atthi
translated: For there is no happiness of the sense sphere that is free from thought and examination.🔽What is meant is: it is mentioned here by way of a simile.

original: Idha vutto pariyāyenāti attho. Maggapaṭivedhānulomanato vipassanāya viya pādakajjhānesupi
analyzed: idha vuttaḥ pariyāyena ati atthaḥ magga paṭivedha anulomanato vipassanāya viya pādakajjhānesu pi
translated: And just as the enlightenment factors are so called in the case of the basic jhāna too because they are favourable to the penetration of the path,🔽so too the mindfulness, etc., are called enlightenment factors in the kasiṇa jhānas, etc., too.

original: satiādayo “bojjhaṅgā”tveva vuccantīti āha “nibbedhabhāgiyattā na paṭikkhipitabbo”ti.
analyzed: sati ādayaḥ bojjhaṅgā tu eva vuccanti iti āha nibbedha bhāgiya ttā na paṭikkhipitabbaḥ ti
translated: This is the meaning of the words “because they are of the class of penetration they cannot be rejected.”

original: Evaṃ kasiṇajjhānādīsu bojjhaṅge uddharantānaṃ adhippāyaṃ vatvā anuddharantānaṃ adhippāyaṃ
analyzed: evam kasiṇajjhāna ādīsu bojjhaṅge uddharantānam adhippāyam vatvā an uddharantānam adhippāyam
translated: Having thus stated the intention of those who take the enlightenment factors out of the kasiṇa jhānas, etc., he now states the intention of those who do not take them out.

original: vattuṃ “anuddharantā panā”tiādimāha. Te hi āsannekantakiccanibbattīhi vipassanākkhaṇe🔽bojjhaṅge uddharanti, na jhānakkhaṇe tadabhāvato. Tenāha “vipassanākiccassa viya…pe…
analyzed: vattum an uddharantā pana ati ādim āha te hi āsanna ekanta kicca nibbattīhi vipassanā kkhaṇe  bojjhaṅge uddharanti na jhāna kkhaṇe tad abhāvato tena āha vipassanā kiccassa
translated: He says “But they do not extract them” and so on. For they extract the factors of enlightenment at the moment of insight by producing the several kinds of near-enemy knowledge,

original: na uddharantī”ti. Kasiṇanissando arūpānīti āha “tadāyattānī”ti.
analyzed: na uddharanti iti kasiṇa nissandaḥ arūpāni iti āha tad āyattāni iti
translated: but not at the moment of jhāna because that is devoid of that kind of knowledge. Hence he said, “They do not extract them, as it were, by the function of insight” and so on. He said “They are dependent on that” because the immaterial states are the outcome of the kasiṇas.

original: Dutiyanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya naya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second method is ended.

original: Tatiyanayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiya naya vaṇṇanā
translated: The third method

original: 470-1. Vossajjanaṃ pahānaṃ vossaggo, vossajjanaṃ vā vissaṭṭhabhāvo nirāsaṅkānuppavesoti
analyzed: vossajjanam pahānam vossaggaḥ vossajjanam vā vissaṭṭha bhāvaḥ nirāsaṅka anuppavesaḥ ti
translated: . The word “renunciation” is used for abandoning and for the state of being unencumbered, which is the state of being without concern for the five aggregates as objects of clinging.

original: āha “vossaggasaddo…pe… duvidhatā vuttā”ti. Vipassanākkhaṇe tadaṅgatanninnappakārena,
analyzed: āha vossagga sadda upe duvidha tā vuttā ati vipassanā kkhaṇe tad aṅga tad ninna ppakārena
translated: Hence it is said, “The word ‘renunciation’ is used in two senses” . At the moment of insight it is in the sense of the state of being unencumbered by the defilements that are abandoned by seeing.

original: maggakkhaṇe samucchedatadārammaṇakaraṇappakārena.
analyzed: magga kkhaṇe samuccheda tad ārammaṇa karaṇa ppakārena
translated: At the moment of the path it is in the sense of the state of being unencumbered by the defilements that are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: Tatiyanayavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tatiya naya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the third method is ended.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section of the text is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on the Abhidhamma

original: 472. Upekkhanamupekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa sabhāvo, so ca samādhivīriyasambojjhaṅgo viya
analyzed: upekkhanam upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa sabhāvo saḥ ca samādhi vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ viya
translated: . Equanimity is the nature of the equanimity enlightenment factor. And that is like the concentration and energy enlightenment factors

original: sampayuttānaṃ ūnādhikabhāvabyāvaṭo ahutvā tesaṃ anūnānadhikabhāve majjhattākārappavattīti
analyzed: sampayuttānam ūna adhika bhāva byāvaṭaḥ a hutvā tesam anūna anadhika bhāve majjhatta ākāra ppavattī iti
translated: It is the middle way because it occurs in a mode that is neither deficient nor excessive in the associated states, which are not deficient or excessive in the four noble Truths.

original: imamatthaṃ āha “upekkhanavasenā”tiādinā. Tattha upapattito ikkhananti paṭisaṅkhānamāha.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: imam attham āha upekkhana vasena ati ādinā tattha upapattitaḥ ikkhananti paṭisaṅkhānam āha  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: This is the meaning of the words “By means of equanimity” and so on. Herein, it is the reflection that is called “looking back” .🔽The commentary on the Abhidhamma basket is ended.

original: Bojjhaṅgavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bojjhaṅga vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the analysis of the factors of enlightenment is ended.

original: 11. Maggaṅgavibhaṅgo
analyzed: maggaṅga vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The analysis of the path factors

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽490. Abhidhammeti dhammasaṅgahe. So hi nibbattitābhidhammadesanā, na vibhaṅgadesanā
analyzed: abhidhamma iti dhamma saṅgahe saḥ hi nibbattitā abhidhamma desanā na vibhaṅga desanā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhamma basket🔽The Abhidhamma is the Dhammasanganī. For that is the teaching of the Abhidhamma as it was first enunciated, not the teaching of the Abhidhamma as it is analyzed in the Vibhaṅga, which is mixed with the method of the Suttanta.

original: viya suttantanayavimissā. Ariyopapadataṃ na karoti vināpi tenassa ariyabhāvasiddhito.
analyzed: viya suttanta naya vimissāḥ na karoti vinā api tena assa ariya bhāva siddhitaḥ
translated: It does not make it a noble arrival, because its noble character is established even without that.

original: Tenāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “yathā hī”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha aṭṭhakathā ayam yathā hi itiādi
translated: Hence it is said in the commentary: “Just as … ”

original: 493. “Lokiyakālenā”ti idaṃ pubbabhāgabhāvanānubhāvena kiccātirekasiddhīti dassanatthaṃ
translated: The words “in the time of the world” are said in order to show that the establishment of the excess of function is by the influence of the development in the prior stage.

original: vuttaṃ. Etesanti sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ. Appahāne, pahāne ca ādīnavānisaṃsavibhāvanādinā
analyzed: vuttam etesan ti sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam appahāne pahāne ca ādīnava anisaṃsa vibhāvanā ādinā
translated: “These” refers to right view, etc. In the non-abandoning and the abandoning, the revealing of the danger and the benefit, etc.,

original: visesappaccayattā sammādiṭṭhiādīni micchāvācādīni pajahāpentīti vuttāni. Micchāvācādito🔽nivatti sammāvācādikiriyāti vuttaṃ “sammāvācādikiriyā hi viratī”ti. Sammādiṭṭhiādayo
analyzed: visesa ppaccaya ttā sammādiṭṭhi ādīni micchāvācā ādīni pajahāpenti iti vuttāni micchāvācā āditaḥ  nivatti sammāvācā ādi kiriyā iti vuttam sammāvācā ādi kiriyā hi virati iti sammādiṭṭhi ādayaḥ
translated: Right view, etc., are said to “abandon” wrong speech, and so on, because they are the specific conditions for that.

original: viya na kārāpakabhāvena, taṃsamaṅgīpuggalo viya na kattubhāvena. Lokuttarakkhaṇepīti
analyzed: viya na kārāpaka bhāvena taṃ samaṅgī puggalaḥ viya na kattu bhāvena lokuttara kkhaṇe pi iti
translated: “Because abstention is the performance of right speech, and so on” means that abstention is the performance of right speech, and so on, not in the way that right view, etc., are abstention by being the state of no-doing, nor in the way that a person possessing right view, etc., is abstention by being the doer.

original: na kevalaṃ lokiyakkhaṇeyeva, atha kho lokuttarakkhaṇepi.
analyzed: na kevalam lokiya khaṇe iva iva atha kho lokuttara khaṇe pi
translated: “Even in the supramundane moment” means not only in the mundane moment, but also in the supramundane moment.

original: Khandhopadhiṃ vipaccatīti paṭisandhidāyikaṃ sandhāyāha. Tattha vipaccatīti pavattivipākadāyikaṃ.
analyzed: khandha upadhim vipaccati iti paṭisandhi dāyikam sandhāya āha tattha vipaccati iti pavatti vipāka dāyikam
translated: “It ripens the aggregates and the clinging” means that it gives rise to rebirth. “It ripens” means that it gives rise to the ripening of the process of becoming.

original: Ekekanti “tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhī”tiādinā ekekaṃ aṅgaṃ pucchitvā. Tassa tassevāti🔽ekekaaṅgasseva, na aṅgasamudāyassa. Saha pana pucchitvāti “tattha katamo pañcaṅgiko
analyzed: ekekam ti tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhi iti ādinā ekekam aṅgam pucchitvā tassa tassa iva ati  eka eka aṅgassa iva na aṅga samudāyassa saha pana pucchitvā ti tattha katamo pañcaṅgiko
translated: “Each” means that each factor is asked about in the way beginning, “What is right view?”🔽“That very one” means that each factor is answered, not the collection of factors.

original: maggo”ti pucchitvā. Ekato vissajjanapaṭiniddesattāti yadipi “tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhi?
analyzed: maggo ti pucchitvā ekatas vissajjana paṭiniddesa ttā ti yadi pi tattha katamā sammādiṭṭhi
translated: “But when asked together” means that when the five factors are asked about in the way beginning, “What is the five-factored path?”🔽“What is right view?

original: Yā paññā”tiādinā vissajjanaṃ kataṃ, “tattha katamo pañcaṅgiko maggo”ti pana ekato
analyzed: yā paññāti ādinā vissajjanam katam tattha katamo pañcaṅgikaḥ maggo ti pana ekatas
translated: But when the question is asked in the way beginning, “What is the fivefactored path? ”

original: katāya pucchāya vissajjanavasena paṭiniddesabhāvato na pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchāvissajjanaṃ🔽nāma hoti. Kasmā panettha pañcaṅgikavāre eva pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchāvissajjanaṃ kataṃ,
analyzed: katāya pucchāya vissajjana vasena paṭiniddesa bhāvataḥ na pāṭiyekkam pucchā vissajjanam  nāma hoti kasmā pana ittha pañcaṅgika vāre eva pāṭiyekkam pucchā vissajjanam katam
translated: the answer is given by way of the method of substitution, which is not a separate question and answer.🔽But why is the separate question and answer given only in the case of the fivefactored path and not in the case of the eightfactored path?

original: na aṭṭhaṅgikavāreti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “tatthā”tiādi. Ekekamukhāyāti sammādiṭṭhiādimukhāya.
analyzed: na aṭṭhaṅgika vāra iti codanam sandhāya āha tattha atiādi eka eka mukhāya iti sammādiṭṭhi ādi mukhāya
translated: The intention is that there is no development by way of right speech, etc.,

original: Tena vuttaṃ “ariyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhiṃ desessāmi saupanisaṃ saparikkhāra”ntiādi.
analyzed: tena vuttam ariyam vaḥ bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhim desessāmi sa upanisam sa parikkhāra nti ādi
translated: because it is said: “Bhikkhus, I shall teach you the Noble Right Concentration with its support and its requisite” ,

original: Pubbasuddhiyā sijjhanti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “pubbeva kho panassa kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ🔽ājīvo suparisuddho hotī”ti, tasmā sammāvācādimukhā bhāvanā natthīti adhippāyo. Tenāha
analyzed: pubba suddhiyā sijjhanti tathā hi vuttam pubbā iva kho panassa kāya kammam vacī kammam  ājīvo su parisuddhaḥ hoti iti tasmā sammāvācā ādi mukhā bhāvanā na atthi iti adhippāyaḥ tena āha
translated: and because it is said: “But his bodily action, his speech, and his livelihood have already been purified earlier” .

original: “na maggassa upacārenā”ti.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: na maggassa upacārena ati  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: That is why it is said, “not by way of the path’s proximity” .🔽The commentary on the section of the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: Maggaṅgavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: maggaṅga vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the factors of the path is ended.

original: 12. Jhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: jhāna vibhaṅgo
translated: 12. The exposition of the jhānas

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The sutta method

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā🔽508. Pātimokkhasaṃvarādīti ādi-saddena indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā,🔽satisampajaññaṃ, jāgariyānuyogoti evamādike saṅgaṇhāti. Asubhānussatiyoti asubhajhānāni,🔽anussatijhānāni ca. Sati samaṇabhāvakarapubbabhāgakaraṇīyasampattiyaṃ samaṇabhāvopi🔽siddhoyeva hotīti āha “suññā…pe… dassetī”ti. Kāraṇe hi siddhe phalampi siddhameva🔽hotīti. Sikkhāpadānaṃ sarūpaṃ, sikkhitabbākāraṃ, saṅkhepato vibhāgañca dassetuṃ “sikkhāpadesū”tiādi
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā  pātimokkha saṃvara ādi iti ādi saddena indriyesu gutta dvāra tā bhojane mattaññu tā  sati sampajaññam jāgariya anuyogo ti evamādike saṅgaṇhāti asubha anussatiyaḥ ti asubha jhānāni  anussati jhānāni ca sati samaṇa bhāva kara pubbabhāga karaṇīya sampattiyam samaṇa bhāvaḥ api  siddhaḥ yā iva hoti iti āha suññāpe dasseti iti kāraṇe hi siddhe phalam pi siddham eva  hoti iti sikkhāpadānam sarūpam sikkhitabba ākāram saṅkhepataḥ vibhāgam ca dassetum sikkhāpadesu utiādi
translated: The explanation of the mātikā

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha nāmakāyādivasenāti nāmakāyapadakāyabyañjanakāyavasena vuttesu. Iminā🔽sikkhāpadānaṃ sikkhāya adhigamūpāyabhūtapaññattisabhāvataṃ dasseti. Tesu sikkhitabbākāro
analyzed: vuttam tattha nāma kāya ādi vasena ati nāma kāya pada kāya byañjana kāya vasena vuttesu iminā 🔽sikkhāpadānam sikkhāya adhigama upāya bhūta paññatti sabhāva tam dasseti tesu sikkhitabba ākāraḥ
translated: The words “restraint by the Pāṭimokkha” include the other three kinds of restraint, namely, restraint by the body, restraint by the mind, and restraint by the Pāṭimokkha. The words “and so on” include the other three kinds of virtue, namely, virtue of restraint, virtue of accumulating, and virtue of purifying. The words “and the recollection of peace” include the other recollections, namely, the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dhamma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of virtue, the recollection of generosity, and the recollection of deities. The words “and the meditation subject beginning with mindfulness of the body” include the other meditation subjects, namely, the ten recollections, the ten kasiṇas, the ten impurities, the four divine abidings, the four immaterial states, and mindfulness occupied with the body. The words “and the jhāna of foulness” include the other jhānas, namely, the jhāna of the recollections, the jhānas of the immaterial states, and the jhāna of the divine abidings. The words “and the jhāna of mindfulness of breathing” include the other jhānas, namely, the jhāna of the recollection of peace, the jhāna of the recollection of death, the jhānas of the four elements, and the jhāna of the recollection of the Four Noble Truths. The words “and the jhāna of mindfulness occupied with the body” include the other jhānas, namely, the jhāna of the recollection of the Buddha, the jhāna of the recollection of the Dhamma, the jhāna of the recollection of the Saṅgha, the jhāna of the recollection of virtue, the jhāna of the recollection of generosity, and the jhāna of the recollection of deities. The words “and the jhāna of the recollection of peace” include the other jhānas, namely, the jhāna of the recollection of death, the jhāna of the recollection of foulness, the jhāna of the recollection of the four elements, and the jhāna of the recollection of the Four Noble Truths. The words “and the jhāna of the recollection of death” include the other jhānas, namely, the jhāna of the recollection

original: satthuāṇānatikkamoyevāti āha “vaca…pe… tabbesū”ti. Sikkhākoṭṭhāsesūti vuttappabhedesu🔽adhisīlasikkhābhāgesu. Tesu samādānameva sikkhitabbākāroti vuttaṃ “paripūraṇavasena
analyzed: āha tabbesu ti sikkhākoṭṭhāsesu ti vutta ppabhedesu  adhi sīla sikkhā bhāgesu tesu samādānam eva sikkhitabba ākāraḥ ti vuttam paripūraṇa vasena
translated: “In the training rules” : in the sections of the training, which are of the kinds already stated.🔽“In the training rules that should be trained in” : in the training courses of higher virtue, etc. Training is to be undertaken in them by fulfilling them.

original: sikkhitabbesū”ti. Sikkhāpadekadesabhūtāti sikkhāpadasamudāyassa avayavabhūtā. Bhikkhusikkhā🔽hi idhādhippetā “idha bhikkhū”ti vuttattā. Tathā hi vakkhati “sesasikkhā pana atthuddhāravasena
analyzed: sikkhitabbesu iti sikkhāpada eka desa bhūtā ati sikkhāpada samudāyassa avayava bhūtā bhikkhu sikkhā  hi idha adhippetāḥ idha bhikkhū iti vutta ttā tathā hi vakkhati sesa sikkhā pana attha uddhāra vasena
translated: “In the training rules that are the bases of the training” : in the component parts of the collection of training rules.🔽For the training of bhikkhus is intended here, since it is said “here the bhikkhus.”

original: sikkhāsaddassa atthadassanatthaṃ vuttā”ti.
analyzed: sikkhā saddassa attha dassana attham vuttā iti
translated: For he says: “The other training rules are stated for the purpose of showing the meaning of the word ‘training’ by way of the explanation of the meaning.”

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the mātikā is finished.

original: Niddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the niddesa

original: 509. Diṭṭhattāti sayambhūñāṇena sacchikatattā. Khantiādīsupi eseva nayo. Sayambhūñāṇena
analyzed: diṭṭha ttā ati sayambhu ñāṇena sacchikata ttā khanti ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ sayambhu ñāṇena
translated: “Seen” : because of being realized by his own knowledge. The same method applies to “approved” and the rest.

original: sacchikaraṇavaseneva hi bhagavato khamanaruccanādayo, na aññesaṃ viya anussavākāraparivitakkādimukhena.
analyzed: sacchikaraṇa vasena iva hi bhagavato khamana ruccana ādayaḥ na aññesam viya anussava ākāra parivitakka ādi mukhena
translated: For the Blessed One’s approval, etc., are only by way of realization by his own knowledge, not by way of hearsay, conjecture, etc., as in the case of others.

original: Aviparītaṭṭho ekantaniyyānaṭṭhena veditabbo. Sikkhiyamānoti sikkhāya paṭipajjiyamāno.
analyzed: a viparīta ṭṭho ekanta niyyāna ṭṭhena veditabbo sikkhiyamānaḥ ti sikkhāya paṭipajjiyamānaḥ
translated: The meaning of non-deprivation should be understood as the meaning of the sole outlet. “One who is training”: one who is undertaking the training.

original: Sikkhitabbāni sikkhāpadānīti sikkhāpadapāḷiṃ vadati. Khandhattayanti sīlādikkhandhattayaṃ.
analyzed: sikkhitabbāni sikkhāpadāni iti sikkhāpada pāḷim vadati khandhattayanti sīla ādi khandhattayam
translated: “Things to be trained in”: he is referring to the text of the training rules. “The three aggregates”: the three aggregates beginning with virtue.

original: “Sabbapāpassa…pe… buddhāna sāsana”nti vacanato āha “anusāsanadānabhūtaṃ sikkhattaya”nti.
analyzed: sabba pāpassape buddhāna sāsananti vacanataḥ āha anusāsana dāna bhūtam sikkhattayan ti
translated: “The three trainings”: he says this because of the words “The teaching of the Buddhas is for the sake of training in the three trainings” .

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā paccayattāti maggasammādiṭṭhiyā ekantahetubhāvato. Ettha ca sammādiṭṭhīti🔽kammassakatāsammādiṭṭhi, kammapathasammādiṭṭhi ca. Phalakāraṇopacārehīti phalūpacārena
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyā paccaya ttā ati magga sammādiṭṭhiyāḥ ekanta hetu bhāvato ettha ca sammādiṭṭhī iti  kammassaka tā sammādiṭṭhi kammapatha sammādiṭṭhi ca phala kāraṇa upacārehi iti phala upacārena
translated: “The condition for right view”: because it is the sole cause for the right view of the path. And here “right view”🔽is the right view of kamma and its fruits and the right view of the courses of kamma. “By figurative application of effect to cause”

original: sammādiṭṭhipaccayattā, kāraṇūpacārena sammādiṭṭhipubbaṅgamattā. Kusaladhammehi attano
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paccaya ttā kāraṇa upacārena sammādiṭṭhi pubbaṅgama ttā kusala dhammehi attanaḥ
translated: because of the figurative application of the effect, namely, the right view of the path, to its cause, namely, the right view of kamma and its fruits. “By figurative application of cause to effect”🔽because of the figurative application of the cause, namely, the right view of kamma and its fruits, to its effect, namely, the right view of the path. “By things that are wholesome and are a part of oneself”

original: ekadesabhūtehīti sammādiṭṭhidhamme sandhāyāha. Kusalapaññāviññāṇānaṃ vā pajānanavijānanavasena
analyzed: eka desa bhūtehi iti sammādiṭṭhi dhamme sandhāya āha kusala paññā viññāṇānam vā pajānana vijānana vasena
translated: he says this referring to the things that are right view. “By the understanding and the knowing of wholesome understanding and consciousness”

original: dassanaṃ diṭṭhīti. Tena avayavadhammena samudāyassa upacaritataṃ dasseti. Vinayanakiriyattāti🔽desanābhūtaṃ sikkhattayamāha. Dhammenāti dhammato anapetena. Avisamasabhāvenāti avisamena
analyzed: dassanam diṭṭhī iti tena avayava dhammena samudāyassa dasseti vinayana kiriya ttā ti  desanā bhūtam sikkhattayam āha dhammena ati dhammataḥ an apetena avisama sabhāvena ati avisamena
translated: ‘Seeing’ is view. He shows by this analysis of the component parts that the term is used figuratively for the whole. ‘The act of training’ is the three trainings, which are the subject of the teaching. ‘By the True Idea’ is by the True Idea without exception. ‘By the uniform nature’ is by the uniform nature, the meaning is, ‘by the nature that is not uneven’.

original: sabhāvena, samenāti attho.
analyzed: sabhāvena samena ati atthaḥ
translated: ‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.

original: 510. Anaññatthenāti garahādiaññattharahitena sakatthena. Bhinnapaṭadhareti bhikkhusāruppavasena pañcakhaṇḍādinā chedena chinnacīvaradhare.🔽Bhedanapariyāyavasena vuttaṃ, tasmā kilesānaṃ pahānā kilesānaṃ bhedā bhikkhūti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: anaññatthena ati garaha ādi aññattha rahitena sakatthena bhinna paṭadhare iti bhikkhu sāruppa vasena pañca khaṇḍa ādinā chedena chinna cīvara dhare  bhedana pariyāya vasena vuttam tasmā kilesānam pahānā kilesānam bhedā bhikkhū iti vuttam hoti
translated: ‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.🔽‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.

original: Guṇavasenāti sekkhadhammādiguṇānaṃ vasena. Tena bhāvatthato bhikkhusaddo dassito hoti.
analyzed: guṇa vasena ati sekkhadhamma ādi guṇānam vasena tena bhāva tthataḥ bhikkhu saddo dassitaḥ hoti
translated: ‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is meant.

original: Idaṃ dvayanti “ettha cā”tiādinā parato saṅgahadassanavasena vuttaṃ “sekkho”tiādikaṃ🔽vacanadvayaṃ. Imināti “sekkho bhikkhu bhinnattā pāpakāna”nti padānaṃ atthadassanena.
analyzed: idam ettha ca ati ādinā paratas saṅgaha dassana vasena vuttam sekkha uti ādikam 🔽vacana dvayam iminā ati sekkhaḥ bhikkhu bhinnattā pāpakānan ti padānam attha dassanena
translated: ‘By the meaning that is not other than that’ is by the meaning that is not other than that, namely, blame, etc.; ‘by the meaning that is its own’ is what is

original: Na sameti sekkhaasekkhaputhujjanāsekkhadīpanato. Tadidanti paṭhamadvayaṃ. Nippariyāyadassanaṃ
analyzed: na sameti sekkha asekkha puthujjana asekkha dīpanataḥ tat idam ti paṭhama dvayam nippariyāya dassanam
translated: and it does not coincide with the two kinds of trainers and the ordinary man, since it shows the trainer and the non-trainer and the ordinary man. That is to say: the first pair.

original: ariyānaṃ, asekkhānaṃyeva ca sekkhabhinnakilesabhāvadīpanato. Vuttoti paṭiññāvacanaṃ,
analyzed: ariyānam asekkhānam yeva ca sekkha bhinna kilesa bhāva dīpanataḥ vuttaḥ ti paṭiññā vacanam
translated: The noble ones’ is the seeing of the supramundane. It is only the non-trainer’s, since it shows the state of defilements’ destruction in the trainer. “Said” is the word for “promise” .

original: saccaṃ vuttoti attho. Na pana idhādhippeto atthuddhāravasena dassitattā.
analyzed: saccam vuttaḥ ti attho na pana idha adhippetaḥ attha uddhāra vasena dassita ttā
translated: The meaning is “true,” but it is not intended here, since it is shown by the word-commentary.

original: Bhagavato vacananti upasampadākammavācamāha. Tadanurūpanti tadanucchavikaṃ, yathāvuttanti
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vacanam iti upasampadā kamma vācam āha tad anurūpam iti tad anucchavikam yathā vuttam iti
translated: “The Blessed One’s word” is the ordination formula. “In accordance with that” is in accordance with that, in conformity with that; the meaning is “as stated.”

original: attho. Parisāvatthusīmāsampattiyo “samaggena saṅghena akuppenā”ti iminā pakāsitāti
analyzed: atthaḥ parisā vatthu sīmā sampattiyaḥ samaggena saṅghena akuppena ati iminā pakāsitā ati
translated: The success of the assembly, the success of the site, and the success of the zone are shown by the words “with a complete assembly, with a unanimous assembly” .

original: “ṭhānāraha”nti padassa “anūna…pe… avutta”nti ettakameva atthamāha.
analyzed: ṭhāna arahanti padassa an ūnape a vuttam ti ettakam eva attham āha
translated: So he mentions only this much as the meaning of the words “worthy of the place”: “not less than … not more than … not other than.”

original: 511. Avītikkamanaviratibhāvatoti avītikkamasamādānabhūtā viratīti katvā vārittasīlaṃ
analyzed: avītikkamana virati bhāvataḥ ti avītikkama samādāna bhūtā virati iti katvā
translated: Because it is the abstinence that is not to be transgressed: taking the abstinence as the abstinence that is not to be transgressed, the virtue of refraining is

original: patvā virati eva padhānanti cetanāsīlassapi pariyāyatā vuttā. “Nagaravaḍḍhakī vatthuvijjācariyo”ti
analyzed: patvā virati eva cetanā sīlassa api vuttā nagara vaḍḍhakī vatthu vijjā cariyā ti
translated: said. If it is thought that the abstinence that is not to be transgressed is the very best, then the virtue of intention is also included. “Like a city planner and a master-builder” .

original: idaṃ idhādhippetanagaravaḍḍhakīdassanaṃ. Vatthuvijjā, pāsādavijjāti duvidhā hi vaḍḍhakīvijjā.
analyzed: idam idha adhippeta nagara vaḍḍhakī dassanam vatthu vijjā pāsāda vijjā ati duvidhā hi vaḍḍhakī vijjā
translated: This is the kind of town-planner intended here. Town-planning is of two kinds: the art of geomancy and the art of building.

original: Lehitabbanti sāyitabbaṃ. Cubitabbanti pātabbaṃ.
analyzed: lehitabbanti sāyitabbam cubitabbanti pātabbam
translated: To lick: to drink. To suck: to drink.

original: Indriyasaṃvarāhārattāti indriyasaṃvarahetukattā. Pātimokkhasīlaṃ sikkhāpadasīlaṃ🔽na pakatisīlādikena gayhatīti āha “pātimokkhato aññaṃ sīlaṃ kāyikaavītikkamādiggahaṇena
analyzed: indriya saṃvara āhāra ttā ati indriya saṃvara hetuka ttā pātimokkha sīlam sikkhāpada sīlam  na pakati sīla ādikena gayhati iti āha pātimokkhataḥ aññam sīlam kāyika avītikkama ādi gahaṇena
translated: Because it is the cause of restraint of the faculties: because it is the cause of restraint of the faculties. The virtue of the Pāṭimokkha and the virtue of undertaking training precepts.🔽It is not included by the virtue of natural morality, etc. Therefore it is said: “The virtue other than the Pāṭimokkha is included by the inclusion of the non-transgression of body and speech.”

original: gahita”nti. Taṃ pana pātimokkhasīlena na saṅgayhatīti na sakkā vattuṃ, kāyikavācasikasaṃvarassa
analyzed: gahitam ti tam pana pātimokkha sīlena na saṅgayhati iti na sakkā vattum kāyika vācasika saṃvarassa
translated: But it cannot be said that it is not included by the virtue of the Pāṭimokkha, because the restraint of body and speech is a product of that.

original: tabbinimuttassa abhāvatoti dassento “iminā adhippāyena vutta”nti āha.
analyzed: tad binimuttassa abhāvato ti dassentaḥ iminā adhippāyena vuttan ti āha
translated: Showing this, he says: “This is the meaning intended.”

original: Tattha pātimokkhasaddassa evaṃ attho veditabbo – kilesānaṃ balavabhāvato, pāpakiriyāya
analyzed: tattha pātimokkha saddassa evam atthaḥ veditabbaḥ kilesānam balava bhāvataḥ pāpa kiriyāya
translated: Herein, the word Pāṭimokkha should be understood to have this meaning: because of the strength of defilements, because of the ease of doing evil,

original: sukarabhāvato, puññakiriyāya ca dukkarabhāvato bahukkhattuṃ apāyesu patanasīloti
analyzed: sukara bhāvataḥ puñña kiriyāya ca dukkara bhāvataḥ bahu kkhattum apāyesu patana sīlaḥ ti
translated: and because of the difficulty of doing merit, one is prone to fall into the states of loss many times.

original: pātī, puthujjano, aniccatāya vā bhavādīsu kammavegakkhitto ghaṭiyantaṃ viya anavaṭṭhānena
analyzed: pātī puthujjanaḥ aniccatāya vā bhava ādīsu kamma vega kkhittaḥ ghaṭiyantam viya anavaṭṭhānena
translated: The worldling is called “one who falls” because he is hurled by the force of kamma into the states of existence, which are impermanent, or because he wanders about helplessly, like a ball cast into the air.

original: paribbhamanato gamanasīloti pātī, maraṇavasena vā tamhi tamhi sattanikāye attabhāvassa
analyzed: paribbhamanataḥ gamana sīlaḥ ti pātī maraṇa vasena vā tamhi tamhi satta nikāye atta bhāvassa
translated: Or he is called “one who falls” because he falls into the various states of existence in the course of death and rebirth.

original: pātanasīloti pātī, sattasantāno, cittameva vā. Taṃ pātinaṃ saṃsāradukkhato mokkhetīti🔽pātimokkhaṃ. Cittassa hi vimokkhena sattopi “vimutto”ti vuccati. Vuttañhi “cittavodānā
analyzed: pātana sīlo ti pātī satta santāno cittam eva vā tam pātinam saṃsāra dukkhataḥ mokkheti iti  pātimokkham cittassa hi vimokkhena sattaḥ api vimuttaḥ ti vuccati vuttam hi citta vodānā
translated: The “falling being” is the continuum of the aggregates or the mind alone. The Pāṭimokkha is that by which he is liberated from the suffering of saṃsāra.

original: visujjhantī”ti, “anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimutta”nti ca. Atha vā avijjādinā hetunā🔽saṃsāre patati gacchati pavattatīti pātī. “Avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ
analyzed: visujjhanti iti an upādāya āsavehi cittam ca atha vā avijjā ādinā hetunā  saṃsāre patati gacchati pavattati iti pātī avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam taṇhā saṃyojanānam
translated: For even one who has attained the path is called “liberated” because of the liberation of his mind. For it is said: “The defilements are purified by the purification of the mind” , and “His mind is liberated from the taints by nonclinging” .🔽Or alternatively, the “falling being” is one who falls, goes, or moves in saṃsāra by means of such causes as ignorance. For it is said: “Beings hindered by ignorance, fettered by craving,

original: sandhāvataṃ saṃsarata”nti hi vuttaṃ. Tassa pātino sattassa taṇhādisaṃkilesattayato
analyzed: sandhāvatam saṃsaratanti hi vuttam tassa pātinaḥ sattassa taṇhā ādi saṃkilesa ttayato
translated: wander and roam through the cycle of rebirths” . The Pāṭimokkha is that by which he is liberated from the three defilements of craving, etc.,

original: mokkho etenāti pātimokkhaṃ. “Kaṇṭhekāḷo”tiādīnaṃ viya tassa samāsasiddhi veditabbā.
analyzed: mokkhaḥ etena ati pātimokkham kaṇṭhekāḷa ti ādīnam viya tassa samāsa siddhi veditabbā
translated: of that falling being. The compound pātimokkha should be understood as having the same meaning as the compounds kaṇṭhekāḷa , etc.

original: Atha vā pāteti vinipāteti dukkheti pāti, cittaṃ. Vuttañhi “cittena nīyati loko, cittena
analyzed: atha vā pāteti vinipāteti dukkheti pāti cittam vuttam hi cittena nīyati lokaḥ cittena
translated: Or alternatively, it is a fall because it makes the mind fall into the states of loss, it makes it fall into suffering. For it is said, “The world is led by mind,

original: parikassatī”ti. Tassa pātino mokkho etenāti pātimokkhaṃ. Patati vā etena apāyadukkhe
analyzed: parikassati iti tassa pātinaḥ mokkhaḥ etena ati pātimokkham patati vā etena apāya dukkhe
translated: drawn by mind” . And deliverance is from that fall by means of this, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha. Or it is a fall because it makes one fall into the suffering of the states of loss,

original: vā saṃsāradukkhe vāti pātī, taṇhādisaṃkileso. Vuttañhi “taṇhā janeti purisaṃ, taṇhādutiyo
analyzed: vā saṃsāra dukkhe vāti pātī taṇhā ādi saṃkileso vuttam hi taṇhā janeti purisam taṇhā dutiyaḥ
translated: or into the suffering of the round of rebirths, thus it is a fall. And the defilements beginning with craving are a fall. For it is said, “Craving generates the person,

original: puriso”ti ca ādi. Tato mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ.🔽Atha vā patati etthāti pātīni, cha ajjhattikabāhirāni āyatanāni. Vuttañhi “chasu
analyzed: puriso ti ca ādi tatas mokkho ti pātimokkham  atha vā patati ettha ati pātīni cha ajjhattika bāhirāni āyatanāni vuttam hi chasu
translated: the person is subject to craving” , and so on. And deliverance is from that, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.🔽Or alternatively, it is a fall because it falls into the six internal and external bases. For it is said, “The world has arisen in the six,

original: loko samuppanno, chasu kubbati santhava”nti. Tato chaajjhattikabāhirāyatanasaṅkhātato🔽pātito mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ.
analyzed: lokaḥ samuppannaḥ chasu kubbati santhavanti tatas cha ajjhattika bāhira āyatana saṅkhātataḥ  pātitas mokkho ti pātimokkham
translated: in the six it makes contact” . And deliverance is from that, from what is called the six internal and external bases, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: Atha vā pāto vinipāto assa atthīti pātī, saṃsāro, tato mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ.
analyzed: atha vā pātaḥ vinipātaḥ assa atthi iti pātī saṃsāro tatas mokkho ti pātimokkham
translated: Or alternatively, it is a fall because it falls into that, thus it is a fall. And the round of rebirths is a fall. And deliverance is from that, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: Atha vā sabbalokādhipatibhāvato dhammissaro bhagavā “patī”ti vuccati, muccati etenāti
analyzed: atha vā sabba loka adhipati bhāvataḥ dhammissaraḥ bhagavā pati iti vuccati muccati etena ati
translated: Or alternatively, the Blessed One, as the Lord of Dhamma, is called “the fall” because he is the overlord of the whole world. And deliverance is by means of this, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: mokkho, patino mokkho tena paññattattāti patimokkho, patimokkho eva pātimokkhaṃ.
analyzed: mokkhaḥ patinaḥ mokkhaḥ tena paññatta ttā ati patimokkhaḥ patimokkhaḥ eva pātimokkham
translated: It is the deliverance of the one who is bound, thus it is deliverance for the one who is bound.

original: Sabbaguṇānaṃ vā mūlabhāvato uttamaṭṭhena pati ca so yathāvuttenatthena mokkho cāti
analyzed: sabba guṇānam vā mūla bhāvataḥ uttama aṭṭhena ca saḥ yathāvuttena atthena mokkhaḥ ca ati
translated: Or alternatively, it is the supreme root of all special qualities, thus it is the supreme. And it is deliverance in the sense already stated, thus it is deliverance for the supreme.🔽So it is deliverance for the supreme, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: patimokkho, patimokkho eva pātimokkhaṃ. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “pātimokkhanti mukhametaṃ🔽pamukhameta”nti vitthāro.
analyzed: patimokkhaḥ patimokkhaḥ eva pātimokkham tathā hi vuttam pātimokkham ti mukham etam  pamukham etat ti vitthāraḥ
translated: For this is said: “Pāṭimokkha” is the face, the front, of the Dhamma, the Blessed One said, the beginning, the root, the standard, the goal, the conclusion” .

original: Atha vā pa-iti pakāre, atīti accantatthe nipāto, tasmā pakārehi accantaṃ mokkhetīti🔽pātimokkhaṃ. Idañhi sīlaṃ sayaṃ tadaṅgavasena, samādhisahitaṃ paññāsahitañca vikkhambhanavasena
analyzed: atha vā paiti pakāre ati iti accanta atthe nipāto tasmā pakārehi accantam mokkheti iti  pātimokkham idam hi sīlam sayam tad aṅga vasena samādhi sahitam paññā sahitam ca vikkhambhana vasena
translated: Or alternatively, pā is a syllable, and ati is a word denoting excess; thus pāṭi means “in excess.” So it is the deliverance in excess, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: samucchedavasena ca accantaṃ mokkheti mocetīti pātimokkhaṃ. Pati pati mokkhoti vā
analyzed: samuccheda vasena ca mokkheti moceti iti pātimokkham vā
translated: For this virtue delivers in excess, in the ultimate sense, by means of its own special quality of being a requisite of enlightenment, and by means of the suppression and severing of the defilements together with their underlying tendencies, through being combined with concentration and insight respectively.

original: patimokkho, tamhā tamhā vītikkamadosato paccekaṃ mokkhoti attho, patimokkhoyeva pātimokkhaṃ.
analyzed: patimokkhaḥ tamhā tamhā vītikkama dosato paccekam mokkho ti attho patimokkhaḥ yā iva pātimokkham
translated: So it is the deliverance in excess, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, it is deliverance from each of the dangers of the kinds of offences, thus it is deliverance from each, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: Mokkho vā nibbānaṃ, tassa mokkhassa paṭibimbabhūtoti patimokkhaṃ. Sīlasaṃvaro hi🔽nibbedhabhāgiyo sūriyassa aruṇuggamanaṃ viya nibbānassa udayabhūto tappaṭibhāgo viya
analyzed: mokkhaḥ vā nibbānam tassa mokkhassa paṭibimba bhūto ti patimokkham sīla saṃvaraḥ hi  nibbedha bhāgiyaḥ sūriyassa aruṇuggamanam viya nibbānassa udaya bhūto tad paṭibhāgaḥ viya
translated: For restraint by the Pātimokkha is a condition for the attainment of Nibbāna, which is the supreme deliverance, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.

original: hoti yathārahaṃ kilesanibbāpanatoti patimokkhaṃ, patimokkhaṃyeva pātimokkhaṃ.🔽Atha vā mokkhaṃ pati vattati, mokkhābhimukhanti vā patimokkhaṃ, patimokkhaṃyeva pātimokkhanti.
analyzed: hoti yathāraham kilesa nibbāpanato ti patimokkham patimokkham yeva pātimokkham  atha vā mokkham pati vattati mokkha abhimukhanti vā patimokkham patimokkham yeva pātimokkham ti
translated: And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.

original: Idampi pātimokkhasaddassa mukhamattadassanameva. Sabbākaārena pana jinapātimokkho🔽bhagavāva anavajjapatimokkhaṃ pātimokkhaṃ saṃvaṇṇeyya.🔽513. Garubhaṇḍavissajjanakaraṇabhūtaṃ etassa atthīti garubhaṇḍavissajjanaṃ. Garubhaṇḍantarabhūtaṃ
analyzed: idam pi pātimokkha saddassa mukham atta dassanam eva sabba ākaārena pana jina pātimokkho  bhagavā ava anavajja patimokkham pātimokkham saṃvaṇṇeyya  garu bhaṇḍa vissajjana karaṇa bhūtam etassa atthi iti garu bhaṇḍa vissajjanam garu bhaṇḍa antara bhūtam
translated: And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.

original: thāvarādi. Ūnakaṃ na vaṭṭatīti phātikammaṃ vuttaṃ. Atirekagghanakaṃ, tadagghanakameva
analyzed: thāvara ādi ūnakam na vaṭṭati iti phāti kammam vuttam atireka ghanakam tad agghanakam eva
translated: And it is a condition for the attainment of the supreme deliverance of Nibbāna, as the rising of the sun is for the appearance of light, which is the supreme illumination.🔽And

original: vā vaṭṭatīti. Yathāvuttanti pokkharaṇito paṃsuuddharaṇādithāvarakammaṃ.
analyzed: vā vaṭṭati iti yathā vuttam ti pokkharaṇitaḥ paṃsu uddharaṇa ādi thāvara kammam
translated: and the like.

original: Dhāreti, poseti vā paresaṃ dārake.
analyzed: dhārā iti posā iti vā paresam dārake
translated: He supports, he nourishes, the children of others.🔽It is said to be done for householders, not for the Community, not for a group, is the meaning.

original: Gihīnaṃ kariyamānaṃ vuttaṃ, na saṅghassa, gaṇassa vāti attho. Piṇḍapaṭipiṇḍanti uttarapadalopaṃ,
analyzed: gihīnam kariyamānam vuttam na saṅghassa gaṇassa vā ati attho piṇḍa paṭipiṇḍam ti uttara pada lopam
translated: The word piṇḍa is a truncated form,🔽and the word paṭipiṇḍa is a truncated form of the first word.

original: purimapade uttarapadalopañca katvā niddesoti āha “piṇḍattha”ntiādi. Ayoniso vicāraṇaṃ ayāthāvapaṭipatti.
analyzed: purima pade uttara pada lopam ca katvā niddeso ti āha piṇḍa ttha nti ādi ayonisas vicāraṇam a yāthāva paṭipatti
translated: He is not a proper recipient, is the meaning.

original: 514. Gacchanti yathāsakaṃ visaye pavattantīti gāvo, cakkhādīni indriyāni.
analyzed: gacchanti yathāsakam visaye pavattanti iti gāvaḥ cakkha ādīni indriyāni
translated: They go to their respective objects and occur, thus they are cows, that is, the eye and the other faculties.

original: Vidhunanaṃ papphoṭanaṃ, pavāhananti attho.
analyzed: vidhunanam papphoṭanam pavāhananti attho
translated: Shaking is tossing, is the meaning of “shaking off.”

original: 515. Yathā karaṇattho karaṇīyasaddo, evaṃ vikiraṇatthopi hotīti āha “vikkhipitabbānī”ti,
analyzed: yathā karaṇa atthaḥ karaṇīya saddaḥ evam vikiraṇa atthaḥ api hoti iti āha vikkhipitabbāni iti
translated: Just as the word karaṇīya has the meaning of instrument, so it has the meaning of scattering, thus he said “should be scattered.”🔽The meaning is “should be dispersed.”

original: viddhaṃsitabbānīti attho. Saṃyamanīyāni vā saṃyamakaraṇīyāni, “na puna evaṃ karomī”ti
analyzed: viddhaṃsitabbāni iti attho saṃyamanīyāni vā saṃyama karaṇīyāni na punar evam karomi iti
translated: Or they should be restrained, should be controlled, “I will not do so again,”

original: attano dahanaṃ manasā adhiṭṭhānaṃ saṃyamanaṃ, saṃyamanakaraṇīyāni saṃvarakaraṇīyānīti
analyzed: attanaḥ dahanam manasā adhiṭṭhānam saṃyamanam saṃyamana karaṇīyāni saṃvara karaṇīyāni iti
translated: the burning of oneself by the mind, the determination, is the restraint, they should be restrained, they should be controlled,

original: cittamattāyattā eva saṃyamasaṃvarā ācariyena adhippetāti āha “anāpattigamanīyānī”ti.
analyzed: cittamatta āyattāḥ eva saṃyama saṃvarāḥ ācariyena adhippetā iti āha anāpatti gamanīyāni iti
translated: The restraint and the control are dependent on the mind alone, and the teacher has indicated this by the words “to be gone to for non-offence.”

original: Antevāsikatthero pana desanāpi cittuppādamanasikārehi vinā na hotīti desanāvisuddhiṃ nissaraṇaṃ vadati.
analyzed: antevāsika ttheraḥ pana desanā api cittuppāda manasikārehi vinā na hoti iti desanāvisuddhim nissaraṇam vadati
translated: But the Elder Antevāsika said that the purification of the teaching is the escape since the teaching is not without the mental-formation of consciousness.

original: 516. “Alaṅkato cepi…pe… sa bhikkhū”tiādīsu viya idhāpi guṇato bhikkhu adhippeto.
analyzed: sa bhikkhu iti ādīsu viya idha api guṇataḥ bhikkhu adhippeto
translated: As in the case of the passage beginning, “If he is adorned … he is still a bhikkhu” , so here too the bhikkhu is intended in the sense of a person possessed of special qualities.

original: Tathā ca vuttaṃ “idha bhikkhūti paṭipattiyā bhikkhubhāvadassanato evamāhā”ti. Yattakaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca vuttam idha bhikkhu iti paṭipattiyāḥ bhikkhu bhāva dassanataḥ evam āha ati yattakam
translated: And it is said accordingly: “Here the bhikkhu is so called in order to show that he is a bhikkhu by virtue of his practice” .

original: ekena puggalena asesetvā samādātuṃ sakkā, taṃ sandhāyāha “yena samādānena sabbāpi🔽sikkhā samādinnā hontī”ti yathā upasampadāpāripūriyā asesaṃ upasampannasikkhāsamādānaṃ.🔽Tanti samādānaṃ. Anekesūti visuṃ visuṃ samādānesu. Yathā samādinnāya sikkhāya sabbena
analyzed: ekena puggalena a sesetvā samādātum sakkā tam sandhāya āha yena samādānena sabbā api  sikkhā samādinnāḥ honti iti yathā upasampadā pāripūriyā asesam upasampanna sikkhā samādānam  tat ti samādānam anekesu iti visum visum samādānesu yathā samādinnāya sikkhāya sabbena
translated: The undertaking by which all the training precepts are undertaken is the undertaking by which all the training precepts can be undertaken without exception by a single person.🔽The undertaking is the undertaking of the training precepts.🔽The training precepts are the training precepts undertaken one by one.🔽The way of training is the way of training in the non-transgression of the training precepts as undertaken.

original: sabbaṃ avītikkamanaṃ sikkhitabbākāro, evaṃ sati vītikkame desanāgāminiyā desanā,
analyzed: sabbam a vītikkamanam sikkhitabba ākāraḥ evam sati vītikkame desanā gāminiyāḥ desanā
translated: If there is a transgression of the training precepts, then the confession is the confession of the transgression.

original: vuṭṭhānagāminiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ tadupāyabhūtaṃ pārivāsikavattacaraṇādīti vuttaṃ “avīti…pe…
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā vuṭṭhānam tad upāya bhūtam pārivāsika vatta caraṇa ādi iti vuttam avīti pe
translated: The clearing up is the means to the clearing up, namely, the carrying out of the duties of a wrong-doer, etc., which is why it is said, “The clearing up is the means to the clearing up.”

original: ākārenā”ti. Yaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ pamādena vītikkantaṃ, taṃ sikkhiyamānaṃ na hotīti sesitaṃ
analyzed: ākārena ati yam sikkhāpadam pamādena vītikkantam tam sikkhiyamānam na hoti iti sesitam
translated: The rest is what remains of the training rule that has been transgressed through negligence,

original: nāma hotīti āha “vītikkamanavasena sesassā”ti.🔽519. Cittaparisodhanabhāvanāti cittassa parisodhanabhūtā āvaraṇīyadhammavikkhambhikā
analyzed: nāma hoti iti āha vītikkamana vasena sesassa ati  citta parisodhana bhāvanā ati cittassa parisodhana bhūtā āvaraṇīya dhamma vikkhambhikā
translated: and it is called “the rest” because it is not being trained in.🔽The meditation that purifies the mind is the meditation on concentration and insight that purifies the mind by suppressing the states that obstruct it.

original: samādhivipassanābhāvanā cittaparisodhanabhāvanā. Suppapariggāhakanti niddāpariggāhakaṃ.🔽Idanti idaṃ abbokiṇṇabhavaṅgottaraṇasaṅkhātaṃ kiriyamayacittānaṃ appavattanaṃ suppaṃ
analyzed: samādhi vipassanā bhāvanā citta parisodhana bhāvanā suppa pariggāhakam ti niddā pariggāhakam  idam ti idam abbokiṇṇa bhavaṅga uttaraṇa saṅkhātam kiriya maya cittānam appavattanam suppam
translated: The good scrutinizer is the scrutinizer of sleep.🔽This is the good, called “the good,” which is the non-occurrence of the kinds of resultant consciousness called “the crossing of the threshold of the life-continuum.”

original: nāma. Ito bhavaṅgottaraṇato. Pubbe ito kiriyamayacittappavattito parañca natthi.
analyzed: nāma itas bhavaṅga uttaraṇataḥ pubbe itas kiriya maya citta ppavattito parañca natthi
translated: This is because it is the crossing of the threshold of the life-continuum. Before this there is the occurrence of the kinds of functional consciousness, and after this there is none.

original: Ayaṃ kāyakilamatho, thinamiddhañca etassa suttassa paccayo.
analyzed: ayam kāya kilamatho thinam iddham ca etassa suttassa paccayo
translated: This bodily fatigue and this sloth and torpor are the conditions for this sutta.

original: 522. Satipaṭṭhānādayoti satipaṭṭhānasammappadhānaiddhipādā, ekacce ca maggadhammā
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna ādayaḥ ti sati paṭṭhāna sammappadhāna eddhipādāḥ ekacce ca magga dhammāḥ
translated: The foundations of mindfulness, etc., are the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and the four bases for spiritual success, and also some of the path dhammas.

original: saha na pavattanti, tasmā pāḷiyaṃ na vuttāti adhippāyo. Ete tāva ekasmiṃ ārammaṇe🔽saha na pavattantīti na gaṇheyyuṃ, indriyabalāni kasmā na gahitānīti āha “pavatta…pe…
analyzed: saha na pavattanti tasmā pāḷiyam na vuttā ati adhippāyaḥ ete tāva ekasmin ārammaṇe  saha na pavattanti iti na gaṇheyyuṃ indriya balāni kasmā na gahitāni iti āha pavattape
translated: They would not be taken as not occurring together in a single object. Why are the faculties and powers not taken?🔽“They occur in the path” is said.

original: hontī”ti. Evampi saddhindriyabalāni bojjhaṅgehi na saṅgayhantīti kathaṃ tesaṃ tadantogadhatāti
analyzed: honti iti evam pi saddhi indriya balāni bojjhaṅgehi na saṅgayhanti iti katham tesam tad antogadha tā ati
translated: Thus the faith faculty and the faith power are not included among the enlightenment factors. How then are they included in them?

original: codanaṃ sandhāyāha “pīti…pe… vuttattā”ti.
analyzed: codanam sandhāya āha pītipe vutta ttā iti
translated: The question is answered: “Because of the statement of the three kinds of faith” .🔽“Everywhere” : in all the aspects, in all the goings forth, etc.,

original: 523. Samantatoti sabbabhāgesu sabbesu abhikkamādīsu, sabbabhāgato vā tesu eva abhikkamādīsu🔽atthānatthādisabbabhāgato sabbākārato. Sammāti aviparītaṃ yoniso. Samanti avisamaṃ,🔽iṭṭhādiārammaṇe rāgādivisamarahitaṃ katvāti attho.
analyzed: samantataḥ ti sabba bhāgesu sabbesu abhikkama ādīsu sabba bhāgataḥ vā tesu eva abhikkama ādīsu  attha anattha ādi sabba bhāgataḥ sabba ākārataḥ sammā iti aviparītam yonisaḥ samanti avisamam  iṭṭha ādi ārammaṇe rāga ādi visama rahitam katvā iti atthaḥ
translated: or in those same goings forth, etc., in all the aspects of profit, non-profit, etc.🔽“Properly” : unpervertedly, wisely.🔽“Evenly” : without partiality. The meaning is: without partiality due to lust, etc., for desirable, etc., objects.

original: Bhikkhā carīyati etthāti bhikkhācāro, bhikkhāya caraṇaṭṭhānaṃ, so eva gocaro, bhikkhāya
analyzed: bhikkhā carīyati ettha ati bhikkhācāraḥ bhikkhāya caraṇa ṭṭhānam saḥ eva gocaraḥ bhikkhāya
translated: “The resort for alms” is the resort for alms-gathering. That is the resort, the alms-resort. The alms-resort is the alms-resort. The alms-resort is the alms-resort. original: caraṇameva vā sampajaññassa visayabhāvato gocaro, tasmiṃ bhikkhācāragocare. So pana🔽abhikkamādibhedabhinnanti visesanavasena vuttaṃ “abhikkamādīsu panā”ti. Kammaṭṭhānasaṅkhāteti
analyzed: caraṇam eva vā sampajaññassa visaya bhāvataḥ gocaraḥ tasmim bhikkhācāra gocare so pana  abhikkama ādi bheda bhinnanti visesana vasena vuttam abhikkama ādīsu pana ati kammaṭṭhāna saṅkhātā iti
translated: Or else the resort is the domain of the act of adverting, which is the resort of the alms-round.🔽But that is divided into the kinds of going out, etc.,🔽and so it is said, “As regards the going out, etc.,”🔽and so on. As regards the meditation subject:🔽

original: yogakammassa bhāvanāya pavattiṭṭhānasaṅkhāte ārammaṇe, bhāvanākammeyeva vā, yogino🔽sukhavisesahetutāya vā kammaṭṭhānasaṅkhāte sampajaññassa visayabhāvena gocare. Abhikkamādīsūti🔽abhikkamapaṭikkamādīsu ceva cīvarapārupanādīsu ca. Asammuyhanaṃ cittakiriyāvāyodhātuvipphāravaseneva
analyzed: yoga kammassa bhāvanāya pavatti ṭṭhāna saṅkhāte ārammaṇe vā yogino  sukha visesa hetutāya vā kammaṭṭhāna saṅkhāte sampajaññassa visaya bhāvena gocare abhikkama ādīsu uti  abhikkama paṭikkama ādīsu ca iva cīvara pārupana ādīsu ca a sammuyhanam citta kiriyā vāyodhātu vipphāra vasena iva
translated: Or the meaning is that the resort is the resort for the practice of clear comprehension, which is the feet themselves, since they are the domain of clear comprehension. In the resort of the practice of going for alms:

original: tesaṃ pavatti, na aññathāti yāthāvato jānanaṃ.
analyzed: tesam pavatti na aññathā ati yāthāvataḥ jānanaṃ
translated: but that is divided into going out, etc., thus it is said in order to specify it, “In going out, etc.”🔽In the object called the meditation subject:🔽in the object called the foundation of the meditation since it is the resort for the practice of clear comprehension, which is the meditation subject, in the sense that it is the domain of clear comprehension, or in the meditation subject itself, which is called the foundation of the meditation since it is the cause for the special happiness of the meditator.🔽In going out, etc.,

original: Kammaṭṭhānaṃ padhānaṃ katvāti cīvarapārupanādisarīrapariharaṇakiccakālepi kammaṭṭhānamanasikārameva padhānaṃ katvā.
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānam padhānam katvā ati cīvara pārupana ādi sarīra pariharaṇa kicca kāle pi kammaṭṭhāna manasikāram eva padhānam katvā
translated: and in putting on the robes, etc.,🔽the occurrence of the act of understanding is only by means of the exercise of the co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental co-efficients of the mental

original: Tasmāti yasmā ussukkajāto hutvā ativiya maṃ yācasi, yasmā ca jīvitantarāyānaṃ dujjānataṃ
analyzed: tasmā ati yasmai ussukka jātaḥ hutvā mam yācasi yasmā ca jīvita antarā yānam
translated: “Therefore” : because you have become eager and are asking me very much, and because you say that the dangers to life are difficult to know,

original: vadasi, indriyāni ca te paripākaṃ gatāni, tasmā. Tihāti nipātamattaṃ. Te tayā. Evanti🔽idāni vattabbākāraṃ vadati. Sikkhitabbanti adhisīlasikkhādīnaṃ tissannampi sikkhānaṃ
analyzed: vadasi indriyāni ca te paripākam gatāni tasmāt nipāta mattam te tayā evanti  idāni vattabba ākāram vadati sikkhitabbam ti adhi sīla sikkhā ādīnam tissannam pi sikkhānam
translated: and because your faculties are ripe, “therefore” is merely a particle. “You” : you should train thus.

original: vasena sikkhanaṃ kātabbaṃ. Yathā pana sikkhitabbaṃ, taṃ dassento “diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ🔽bhavissatī”tiādimāha.🔽Tattha diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattanti rūpāyatane cakkhuviññāṇena diṭṭhamattaṃ. Yathā hi cakkhuviññāṇaṃ🔽rūpe rūpamattameva passati, na niccādisabhāvaṃ, evaṃ sesataṃdvārikaviññāṇehipi me
analyzed: vasena sikkhanam kātabbam yathā pana sikkhitabbam tam dassentaḥ diṭṭhe diṭṭha mattam  bhavissati iti ādim āha  tattha diṭṭhe diṭṭha mattam ti rūpa āyatane cakkhu viññāṇena diṭṭha mattam yathā hi cakkhu viññāṇam  rūpe rūpa mattam eva passati na nicca ādi sabhāvam evam sesa taṃdvārika viññāṇehi pi me
translated: “Should train” : training should be done in the three trainings beginning with the higher virtue. But showing how one should train, he says “In the seen there will be only the seen” , etc.

original: ettha diṭṭhamattameva bhavissatīti sikkhitabbanti attho. Atha vā diṭṭhe diṭṭhaṃ nāma
analyzed: ettha diṭṭha mattam eva bhavissati iti sikkhitabbanti atthaḥ atha vā diṭṭhe diṭṭham nāma
translated: Herein, in the seen there will be only the seen : only the seen in the visible form base by eye-consciousness. For just as eye-consciousness sees only the visible form as visible form, not as permanent, etc., so too, in the case of the other sense-cognitions, the meaning is that one should train thus: “In this there will be only the seen for me by these.” Or alternatively, “In the seen there will be only the seen” means:

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, rūpe rūpavijānananti attho. Mattāti pamāṇaṃ. Diṭṭhaṃ mattā etassāti
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam rūpe rūpa vijānananti atthaḥ mattā ati pamāṇam diṭṭham mattā etassa ati
translated: Eye-consciousness: the meaning is that it discerns visible data. Just: the measure. He has seen just that:

original: diṭṭhamattaṃ, cakkhuviññāṇamattameva me cittaṃ bhavissatīti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti
analyzed: diṭṭha mattam cakkhu viññāṇa mattam eva me cittam bhavissati iti attho idam vuttam hoti
translated: he has seen only that. The meaning is that my consciousness will be eye-consciousness only. What is meant is this:

original: – yathā āpāthagate rūpe cakkhuviññāṇaṃ na rajjati na dussati na muyhati, evaṃ rāgādivirahena
analyzed: yathā āpātha gate rūpe cakkhu viññāṇam na rajjati na dussati na muyhati evam rāga ādi virahena
translated: just as eye-consciousness, when a visible datum has come into focus, is not greedy, or is not full of hate, or is not deluded,

original: cakkhuviññāṇamattameva me javanaṃ bhavissati, cakkhuviññāṇappamāṇeneva naṃ ṭhapessāmīti.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa mattam eva me javanam bhavissati cakkhu viññāṇa ppamāṇena iva nam ṭhapessāmi iti
translated: so too my impulsions will be eye-consciousness only, free from greed, etc., and I shall keep to the measure of eye-consciousness only.

original: Atha vā diṭṭhaṃ nāma cakkhuviññāṇena diṭṭharūpaṃ. Diṭṭhe diṭṭhaṃ nāma tattheva uppannaṃ
analyzed: atha vā diṭṭham nāma cakkhu viññāṇena diṭṭha rūpam diṭṭhe diṭṭham nāma tattha eva uppannam
translated: Or alternatively, what is seen is visible data seen by eye-consciousness. What is seen in what is seen is the three states of consciousness called receiving, investigating, and determining, which arise there.

original: sampaṭicchanasantīraṇavoṭṭhabbanasaṅkhātaṃ cittattayaṃ. Yathā taṃ na rajjati na dussati
analyzed: sampaṭicchana santīraṇa voṭṭhabbana saṅkhātam cittattayam yathā tam na rajjati na dussati
translated: Just as that is not greedy, or is not full of hate, or is not deluded,

original: na muyhati, evaṃ āpāthagate rūpe teneva sampaṭicchanādippamāṇena javanaṃ uppādessāmi,
analyzed: na muyhati evam āpātha gate rūpe tena iva sampaṭicchana ādi ppamāṇena javanam uppādessāmi
translated: so too I shall cause impulsions to arise in regard to visible data that has come into focus only to the extent of the receiving, etc.,

original: nāssa taṃ pamāṇaṃ atikkamitvā rajjanādivasena uppajjituṃ dassāmīti evamettha attho
analyzed: na assa tam pamāṇam atikkamitvā rajjana ādi vasena uppajjitum dassāmi iti evam ettha atthaḥ
translated: and I shall not allow them to arise by being greedy, etc., exceeding that measure. This is the meaning here.

original: daṭṭhabbo. Esa nayo sutamutesu. Mutanti ca tadārammaṇaviññāṇehi saddhiṃ gandharasaphoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbo esa nayaḥ suta mutesu mutam ti ca tad ārammaṇa viññāṇehi saddhim gandha rasa phoṭṭhabba āyatanam
translated: The “sensed” is the sense-bases of odour, flavour, and tangible data together with the consciousnesses that have them as their objects.🔽The “cognized” is the object cognized by the mind-door adverting.

original: veditabbaṃ. Viññāte viññātamattanti ettha pana viññātaṃ nāma manodvārāvajjanena viññātārammaṇaṃ,🔽tasmiṃ viññāte. Viññātamattanti āvajjanappamāṇaṃ. Yathā āvajjanaṃ na rajjati na dussati
analyzed: veditabbam viññāte viññāta mattam ti ettha pana viññātam nāma manaḥ dvāra āvajjanena viññāta ārammaṇam  tasmin viññāte viññāta mattanti āvajjana ppamāṇam yathā āvajjanam na rajjati na dussati
translated: The “cognized as cognized” is the extent of the adverting.

original: na muyhati, evaṃ rajjanādivasena uppajjituṃ adatvā āvajjanappamāṇeneva cittaṃ ṭhapessāmīti
analyzed: na muyhati evam rajjana ādi vasena uppajjitum a datvā āvajjana ppamāṇena iva cittam ṭhapessāmi iti
translated: The meaning is this: “Just as the adverting does not lust after the object, does not hate it, does not deceive itself about it, so too I shall keep my mind steady on the object to the extent of the adverting, without causing the mind to go beyond the extent of the adverting by lust, etc.”

original: ayamettha attho. Evañhi te bāhiya sikkhitabbanti evaṃ imāya paṭipadāya tayā bāhiya🔽tissannaṃ sikkhānaṃ anupavattanavasena sikkhitabbaṃ. Iti bhagavā bāhiyassa saṃkhittarucitāya🔽chahi viññāṇakāyehi saddhiṃ chaḷārammaṇabhedabhinnaṃ vipassanāvisayaṃ diṭṭhādīhi
analyzed: ayam ettha atthaḥ evam hi te bāhiya sikkhitabban ti evam imāya paṭipadāya tayā bāhiya  tissannam sikkhānam an upavattana vasena sikkhitabbam iti bhagavā bāhiyassa saṃkhitta rucitāya  chahi viññāṇakāyehi saddhim chaṭṭha ārammaṇa bheda bhinnam vipassanā visayam diṭṭha ādīhi
translated: “Thus, Bāhiya, should you train yourself” means that he should train himself by not transgressing the three trainings in this way.🔽So the Blessed One, having shown him the object of insight, which is distinguished by the six bases of consciousness together with the six objects, by dividing it into four parts beginning with “seen,”

original: catūhi koṭṭhāsehi vibhajitvā tatthassa ñātatīraṇapariññaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: catūhi koṭṭhāsehi vibhajitvā tatthassa ñāta tīraṇa pariññam dasseti
translated: showed him the three kinds of full-understanding, namely, that due to direct-knowledge, that due to abandoning, and that due to realization.

original: Kathaṃ? Ettha hi rūpāyatanaṃ passitabbaṭṭhena diṭṭhaṃ nāma, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ pana saddhiṃ
analyzed: katham ettha hi rūpa āyatanam passitabba ṭṭhena diṭṭham nāma cakkhu viññāṇam pana saddhim
translated: How? Herein, the visible-data base is called “seen” in the sense of being seen;

original: taṃdvārikaviññāṇehi dassanaṭṭhena, tadubhayampi yathāpaccayaṃ pavattamānaṃ dhammamattameva,
analyzed: taṃdvārika viññāṇehi dassana ṭṭhena tat ubhayam pi yathāpaccayam pavattamānam dhamma mattam eva
translated: eye-consciousness together with the consciousnesses of the faculties and of the bases that accompany it is “seeing” in the sense of the act of seeing. Both are mere states occurring according to conditions,

original: na ettha koci kattā vā kāretā vā. Yato taṃ hutvā abhāvaṭṭhena aniccaṃ, udayabbayapaṭipīḷanaṭṭhena
analyzed: na ettha koci kattā vā kāretā vā yatas tam hutvā abhāva ṭṭhena aniccam udaya bbaya paṭipīḍana ṭṭhena
translated: and there is no doer or feeler here. Since they are non-existent after having been, they are impermanent in the sense of non-existence after having been;

original: dukkhaṃ, avasavattanaṭṭhena anattāti kuto tattha paṇḍitassa rajjanādīnaṃ okāsoti
analyzed: dukkham avasavattana ṭṭhena anattā ati kutas tattha paṇḍitassa rajjana ādīnaṃ okāsaḥ ti
translated: since they are oppressed by rise and fall, they are painful in the sense of oppressing; since they are not one’s own, they are not-self in the sense of being unable to be made into one’s own. So how can there be any room for a wise man to delight in them, etc.?

original: ayañhettha adhippāyo. Esa nayo sutādīsupi.
analyzed: ayam ha ittha adhippāyaḥ esa nayaḥ suta ādīsu pi
translated: This is the intention here. The same method applies to the heard, etc.

original: Idāni ñātatīraṇapariññāsu patiṭṭhitassa upari saha phalena pahānapariññaṃ dassetuṃ🔽“yato kho te bāhiyā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha yatoti yadā, yasmā vā. Teti tava. Tatoti
analyzed: idāni ñāta tīraṇa pariññāsu patiṭṭhitassa upari saha phalena pahāna pariññam dassetuṃ  yatas kho te bāhiyā atiādi āraddham tattha yatā uti yadā yasmai vā tati tava tatā iti
translated: Now, in order to show the kind of full-understanding of abandoning that comes with fruition, which is higher than the full-understanding of defining that has been established,

original: tadā, tasmā vā. Tenāti tena diṭṭhādinā, diṭṭhādipaṭibaddhena vā rāgādinā. Idaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: tadā tasmai vā tena ati tena diṭṭha ādinā diṭṭha ādi paṭibaddhena vā rāga ādinā idam vuttam
translated: the following sutta is begun: “When, Bahiya, with regard to these six bases of sense contact” . Herein, when, means at the time when, or because of which. Your, means of you. Then, means at that time, or because of that. By that, means by that seeing, etc., or by the greed, etc., bound up with the seeing, etc. This is what is said:

original: hoti – bāhiya, tava yasmiṃ kāle, yena vā kāraṇena diṭṭhādīsu mayā vuttavidhiṃ paṭipajjantassa🔽aviparītasabhāvāvabodhena diṭṭhādimattaṃ bhavissati, tasmiṃ kāle, tena vā kāraṇena🔽tvaṃ tena diṭṭhādipaṭibaddhena rāgādinā saha na bhavissasi, ratto vā duṭṭho vā mūḷho🔽vā na bhavissasi pahīnarāgādikattā, tena vā diṭṭhādinā saha paṭibaddho na bhavissasīti.🔽Tato tvaṃ, bāhiya, na tatthāti yadā, yasmā vā tvaṃ tena rāgena vā ratto, dosena vā
analyzed: tava yasmin kāle yena vā kāraṇena diṭṭha ādīsu mayā vutta vidhim paṭipajjantassa  aviparīta sabhāva avabodhena diṭṭha ādimattam bhavissati tasmin kāle tena vā kāraṇena  tvam tena diṭṭha ādi paṭibaddhena rāga ādinā saha na bhavissasi rattaḥ vā duṭṭhaḥ vā mūḷhaḥ  vā na bhavissasi pahīna rāga ādika ttā tena vā diṭṭha ādinā saha paṭibaddhaḥ na bhavissasi iti  tato tvam na yadā yasmai vā tvam tena rāgena vā rattaḥ dosena vā
translated: then at that time, for that reason,

original: duṭṭho, mohena vā mūḷho na bhavissasi, tadā, tasmā vā tvaṃ tattha diṭṭhādike na bhavissasi,🔽tasmiṃ diṭṭhe vā sutamutaviññāte vā “etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā”ti taṇhāmānadiṭṭhīhi
analyzed: duṭṭhaḥ mohena vā mūḷhaḥ na bhavissasi tadā tasmai vā tvam tattha diṭṭha ādike na bhavissasi 🔽tasmin diṭṭhe vā suta muta viññāte vā etam mama esaḥ aham asmi esaḥ me attā ati taṇhā māna diṭṭhīhi
translated: you will not be with passion, hatred, or delusion, you will not be with passion, hatred, or delusion, you will not be with passion, hatred, or delusion, you will not be with passion, original: allīno patiṭṭhito na bhavissasi. Ettāvatā pahānapariññaṃ matthakaṃ pāpetvā khīṇāsavabhūmi
analyzed: allīnaḥ patiṭṭhitaḥ na bhavissasi ettāvatā pahāna pariññam matthakam pāpetvā khīṇāsava bhūmi
translated: up to this point the knowledge of abandoning has been brought to its culmination and the plane of those whose cankers are destroyed has been shown.

original: dassitā. Tato tvaṃ, bāhiya, nevidha, na huraṃ, na ubhayamantarenāti yadā tvaṃ, bāhiya,
analyzed: dassitā tatas tvam bāhiya na ividha na huram na ubhayam antarena ati yadā tvam bāhiya
translated: Then, Bahiya, neither here nor there nor in between the two: when you are not caught up in this or that,

original: tena rāgādinā tattha diṭṭhādīsu paṭibaddho na bhavissasi, tadā tvaṃ neva idha loke,
analyzed: tena rāga ādinā tattha diṭṭha ādīsu paṭibaddhaḥ na bhavissasi tadā tvam na iva idha loke
translated: then you will not be here in the world,

original: na paraloke, na ubhayattha hosi. Esevanto dukkhassāti kilesadukkhassa, vaṭṭadukkhassa
analyzed: na para loke na ubhayattha hosi esevantaḥ dukkhassa ati kilesa dukkhassa vaṭṭa dukkhassa
translated: nor in the world beyond, nor in between the two. This is the end of stress.

original: ca ayameva anto ayaṃ paricchedo parivaṭumabhāvoti ayameva hi ettha attho. Ye pana
analyzed: ca ayam eva antaḥ ayam paricchedo parivaṭuma bhāvo ti ayam eva hi ettha atthaḥ ye pana
translated: This is the end, this is the limit, this is the all, this is supreme Nibbāna. For this is the meaning here:

original: “ubhayamantarenā”ti padaṃ gahetvā antarābhavaṃ nāma icchanti, tesaṃ taṃ micchā. Tattha
analyzed: ubhayam antarena ati padam gahetvā antarābhavam nāma icchanti tesam tam micchā tattha
translated: But those who take the words “neither here nor there nor in between the two” to refer to the intermediate existence are wrong.

original: yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ parato antarābhavakathāyaṃ āvi bhavissati.
analyzed: yam vattabbam tam paratas antarābhava kathāyam bhavissati
translated: What should be said about that will be said later in the discussion of the intermediate existence.

original: Etesanti atiharaṇavītiharaṇānaṃ.
analyzed: atiharaṇa vītiharaṇa anam
translated: “In this way”: in the way of carrying off and carrying away.

original: “Tattha hī”tiādinā pañcaviññāṇavīthiyaṃ puretaraṃ pavattaayonisomanasikāravasena
analyzed: tattha hi iti ādinā pañca viññāṇa vīthiyam puretaram pavatta ayoniso manasikāra vasena
translated: “Therein” : by means of improper attention occurring earlier in the five-door process of adverting.

original: āvajjanādīnaṃ ayoniso āvajjanādinā iṭṭhādiārammaṇe lobhādippavattimattaṃ hoti, na
analyzed: āvajjana ādīnam ayonisas āvajjana ādinā iṭṭha ādi ārammaṇe lobha ādi ppavattimattam hoti na
translated: The mere occurrence of greed, etc., in regard to a desirable object, etc., through wrong reflection, etc., is what is shown by the words “in the case of the five doors.”

original: pana itthipurisādivikappagāho, manodvāreyeva pana so hotīti dasseti. Tassāti “itthī,
analyzed: pana itthi purisa ādi vikappa gāhaḥ manaḥ dvāreya iva pana saḥ hoti iti dasseti tassa ati itthī
translated: But the apprehending of the individual forms of woman, man, etc., is shown by the words “in the mind door” only.

original: puriso”ti rajjanādikassa. Bhavaṅgādīti bhavaṅgaāvajjanadassanāni, sampaṭicchanasantīraṇavoṭṭhabbanapañcadvārikajavanañca.
analyzed: purisaḥ ti rajjana ādikassa bhavaṅga ādi iti bhavaṅga āvajjana dassanāni sampaṭicchana santīraṇa voṭṭhabbana pañcadvārika javanam ca
translated: “In the case of the life-continuum, etc.”: the life-continuum, reflection, seeing, receiving, investigating, determining, and the five-sense-door adverting and impulsions.

original: Apubbatittaratāvasenāti apubbatāittarabhāvānaṃ vasena.
analyzed: apubbata ittara tā vasena ati apubbata aittara bhāvānam vasena
translated: “In the sense of prior and subsequent”: in the sense of prior and subsequent states.

original: Atiharatīti mukhadvāraṃ atikkamitvā harati. Taṃtaṃvijānananipphādakoti tassa tassa🔽pariyesanādivisayassa, vijānanassa ca nipphādako. Yena hi payogena pariyesanādi nipphajjati,
analyzed: atiharati iti mukha dvāram atikkamitvā harati taṃ taṃ vijānana nipphādakaḥ ti tassa tassa  pariyesanā ādi visayassa vijānanassa ca nipphādakaḥ yena hi payogena pariyesanā ādi nipphajjati
