translated: “It carries on”: it carries on beyond the mouth door.🔽“The producer of the respective kinds of cognition”: the producer of the respective kinds of search, etc., and of the cognitions of the objects of search, etc.🔽For the act by which search, etc., are produced is also called the producer of the cognition of the object of search, etc.

original: so tabbisayaṃ vijānanampi nipphādeti nāma hoti. Sammāpaṭipattinti dhammesu aviparītapaṭipattiṃ yathābhūtāvabodhaṃ.
analyzed: so tad visayam vijānanam pi nipphādeti nāma hoti sammā paṭipattim ti dhammesu aviparīta paṭipattim yathā bhūta avabodham
translated: “Right practice”: right practice in regard to ideas, which is the understanding of ideas as they really are.

original: Gamanepīti gamanapayogepi. Atiharaṇaṃ yathāṭhitasseva kāyassa icchitadesābhimukhakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: gamane pi iti gamana payoge pi atiharaṇam yathā ṭhitassa iva kāyassa icchita desa abhimukha karaṇam
translated: The act of conveying is the act of turning the body that is standing towards the place intended.🔽The act of going is the arrival at a different place.

original: Gamanaṃ desantaruppatti. Vakkhamānoti “abhikkante paṭikkanteti…pe… addhāgamanavasena
analyzed: gamanam desa antara uppatti vakkhamāno ti abhikkante paṭikkanta itipe addhā gamana vasena
translated: The difference is stated thus: “In the case of the phrase ‘in going forwards and in going backwards’ …🔽it is stated in terms of the going by way of the distance traversed.🔽In the case of the phrase ‘in the act of looking straight on and in the act of looking away’ …

original: kathito. Gate ṭhite nisinneti ettha vihāre cuṇṇikapāduddhārairiyāpathavasena kathito”ti vakkhamāno viseso.
analyzed: kathitaḥ gate ṭhite nisinne ti ettha vihāre cuṇṇika pāduddhāra airiyāpatha vasena kathito ti vakkhamāno viseso
translated: it is stated in terms of the postures of standing, walking, sitting, and lying down.”🔽In the occurrence of the material and immaterial states: in the occurrence of the material and immaterial states in walking and so on.

original: Pavatteti caṅkamādīsu pavatte rūpārūpadhamme. Pariggaṇhantassa aniccādito.
analyzed: pavatta iti caṅkama ādīsu pavatte rūpa arūpa dhamme pariggaṇhantassa anicca āditaḥ
translated: In the discerning of impermanence, etc., in them: in the discerning of impermanence, etc., in the material and immaterial states.

original: Kāyikakiriyādinibbattakajavanaṃ phalūpacārena “kāyādikiriyāmaya”nti vuttaṃ. Kiriyāsamuṭṭhitattāti pana kāraṇūpacārena.
translated: The javanas that produce the bodily and other kinds of action are called “consisting in bodily and other kinds of action” figuratively, by reason of their proximity to the fruit.🔽In the devotion to the meditation subject: in the development of the meditation subject.

original: 526. Kammaṭṭhānaupāsanassāti kammaṭṭhānabhāvanāya. Yogapathanti bhāvanāyoggakiriyāya pavattanamaggaṃ.
analyzed: kammaṭṭhāna aupāsanassa ati kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanāya yogapathanti bhāvanā yogga kiriyāya pavattana maggam
translated: In the path of practice: in the path of practice of development.

original: 537. Kāyādīsūti kāyavedanācittadhammesu. Suṭṭhu pavattiyāti asubhānupassanādivasena
analyzed: kāya ādīsu iti kāya vedanā citta dhammesu suṭṭhu pavattiyā ti asubha anupassanā ādi vasena
translated: In the body, etc., and in the occurrence: in the body, in feeling, in consciousness, and in mental data, and in the occurrence of insight in them by means of contemplation of the foul, etc.,

original: pavattiyā. Niyyānasabhāvo sammāsatitā eva. Upaṭṭhānanti satiṃ kiccato dasseti. Ettha🔽ca yathāvutto pariggaho jāto etissāti pariggahitā, taṃ pariggahitaṃ niyyānabhūtaṃ
analyzed: pavattiyāḥ niyyāna sabhāvaḥ sammāsati tā eva upaṭṭhānam ti satim kiccataḥ dasseti ettha  ca yathā vuttaḥ pariggahaḥ jātaḥ etissa ati pariggahitā tam pariggahitam niyyāna bhūtam
translated: and occurrence. The state of outlet is simply right mindfulness. “Establishment” shows mindfulness by its function.

original: satiṃ katvāti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: satim katvā iti atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: And here the meaning should be understood as follows: “having made that mindfulness, which is established by the way already stated, the outlet.”

original: 542-3. Pakuppanaṃ idha vikārāpattibhāvo.🔽550. Tappaṭipakkhasaññāti thinamiddhapaṭipakkhasaññā. Sā atthato tadaṅgādivasena🔽thinamiddhavinodanākārappavattā kusalavitakkasampayuttasaññā, tathābhūto vā cittuppādo
analyzed: pakuppanam idha vikāra āpatti bhāvaḥ  tad paṭipakkha saññā ti thinamiddha paṭipakkha saññā sā atthataḥ tad aṅga ādi vasena  thinam iddha vinodana ākāra ppavattā kusala vitakka sampayutta saññā tathābhūtaḥ vā cittuppādaḥ
translated: “Breaking up” is the state of coming to alteration here.

original: saññāsīsena vuttoti veditabbo.
analyzed: saññā sīsena vuttaḥ ti veditabbaḥ
translated: “Perception of the opposite of sluggishness”: perception of the opposite of stiffness and torpor. That is, in the sense of its being the means of removing stiffness and torpor, perception associated with profitable applied thought. Or the occurrence of consciousness itself in that way should be understood as stated under the heading of perception.

original: 553. Sārambhanti ārambhavantaṃ, sahārambhanti attho. Nirāvaraṇābhogā thinamiddhandhakāravigamena nirāvaraṇasamannāhārasaññā. Vivaṭā appaṭicchādanā.
analyzed: ārambhanti ārambhavantam saha ārambhanti attho nirāvaraṇa ābhogā thinam iddha andhakāra vigamena nirāvaraṇa samannā āhāra saññā vivaṭā appaṭicchādanā
translated: “With instigation”: instigating, is the meaning of “with instigation.” “With unremitting attention” is perception of unremitting attention, which is the perception of unremitting exercise of concentratedness, which is the perception of unremitting exercise of the sign of serenity. “With perception of relinquishment” is with perception of giving up. “With perception of abandonment” is with perception of casting out.

original: 564. Tattha tatthāti “iminā pātimokkhasaṃvarena upeto hotī”tiādīsu.
analyzed: tattha tattha ati iminā pātimokkha saṃvarena upetaḥ hoti itiādīsu
translated: “There, there” in the passages beginning, “He is endowed with this restraint of the Pātimokkha” .

original: 588. Yathā kenaci nikkujjitaṃ “idaṃ nāmeta”nti pakatiñāṇena na ñāyati, evaṃ sabbappakārena
analyzed: yathā kenacid nikkujjitam idam nāma etat ti pakati ñāṇena na ñāyati evam sabba ppakārena
translated: Just as what is turned upside down is not recognized by one who knows it in its normal state, so too, the deep is as if turned upside down, since it is not known in any way.

original: aviditaṃ nikkujjitaṃ viya hotīti āha “sabbathā aññātatā nikkujjitabhāvo”ti. Niravasesaparicchindanābhāvoti
analyzed: a viditam nikkujjitam viya hoti iti āha sabbathā aññāta tā nikkujjita bhāvaḥ ti niravasesa paricchindana abhāvaḥ ti
translated: That is why it is said that “the state of being turned upside down is the state of being not known in every way.”

original: duviññeyyatāya niravasesato paricchinditabbatābhāvo, paricchindikābhāvo vā. Ekadeseneva
analyzed: du viññeyya tāya niravasesataḥ paricchinditabba tā abhāvo paricchindika abhāvaḥ vā ekadesena iva
translated: The state of being not cut off without remainder: because of being hard to see, it is not to be cut off without remainder, or it is not to be cut off at all.

original: hi gambhīraṃ ñāyati.🔽Ācikkhantītiādito paribyattaṃ kathenti. Desentīti upadisanavasena vadanti, pabodhenti🔽vā. Paññāpentīti pajānāpenti, saṃpakāsentīti attho. Paṭṭhapentīti pakārehi asaṅkarato
analyzed: hi gambhīram ñāyati  ācikkhanti itiāditaḥ paribyattam kathenti desenti iti upadisana vasena vadanti pabodhenti  vā paññāpenti iti pajānāpenti saṃpakāsenti iti attho paṭṭhapenti iti pakārehi a saṅkarato
translated: For the deep is seen by a mere fraction.🔽They explain: they tell it in a manner that is not confused from the beginning. They teach: they speak by way of advice, or they awaken.

original: ṭhapenti. Vivarantīti vivaṭaṃ karonti. Vibhajantīti vibhattaṃ karonti. Uttānīkarontīti
analyzed: ṭhapenti vivaranti iti vivaṭam karonti vibhajanti iti vibhattam karonti uttānīkaronti iti
translated: They make known: the meaning is, they cause to be known, they cause to be fully understood. They reveal: they make it clear. They expound: they make it clear in detail. They make plain: they make what is not plain, what is deep, plain, clear.

original: anuttānaṃ gambhīraṃ uttānaṃ pākaṭaṃ karonti. Ettha ca “paññāpentī”tiādīhi chahi padehi
analyzed: anuttānam gambhīram uttānam pākaṭam karonti ettha ca paññāpenti iti ādīhi chahi padehi
translated: And here, by the six terms “they make known,” etc.,

original: atthapadāni dassitāni. “Ācikkhanti desentī”ti pana dvīhi padehi byañjanapadānīti
analyzed: attha padāni dassitāni ācikkhanti desenti iti pana dvīhi padehi byañjana padāni iti
translated: The words of the meaning have been shown. “They expound, they teach” are the two words of the phrasing.

original: evaṃ atthabyañjanapadasampannāya uḷārāya pasaṃsāya pasaṃsanaṃ dasseti. Yaṃ panetesu
analyzed: evam attha byañjana pada sampannāya uḷārāya pasaṃsāya pasaṃsanam dasseti yam pana etesu
translated: Thus he shows the praise with the high praise that is endowed with the words of the meaning and the words of the phrasing. But what should be said about these

original: atthabyañjanapadesu vattabbaṃ, taṃ nettiaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vitthārato vuttameva, tasmā
analyzed: attha byañjana padesu vattabbam tam netti aṭṭhakathā ayam vitthārataḥ vuttam eva tasmā
translated: words of the meaning and the words of the phrasing has been said in detail in the Netti Commentary. Therefore

original: tattha vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: it should be understood in the way stated there.

original: 602. Ettheva yojetabbaṃ tassa heṭṭhābhūmisamatikkamanamukhena bhūmivisesādhigamupāyadīpanato.🔽Sabbatthāpīti “rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā, ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samatikkammā”ti sabbesupi
analyzed: ettha iva yojetabbam tassa heṭṭhā bhūmi samatikkamana mukhena bhūmi visesa adhigama upāya dīpanato  sabbattha api iti rūpa saññānam samatikkamā ākāsa ānañca āyatanam samatikkamma ati sabbesu pi
translated: . It should be applied here too, because it shows the means of attaining the special stage by way of the surmounting of the lower stage.

original: samatikkamavacanesu.🔽610. Taṃyeva ākāsaṃ phuṭaṃ viññāṇanti taṃyeva kasiṇugghāṭimākāsaṃ “ananta”nti manasikārena
analyzed: samatikkama vacanesu  tam yeva ākāsam phuṭam viññāṇanti tam yeva kasiṇugghāṭim ākāsam anantanti manasikārena
translated: In all cases means in all the expressions of surmounting, “with the surmounting of perceptions of matter,” “with the surmounting of the base of infinite space.”

original: phuṭaṃ pharitvā ṭhitaṃ paṭhamāruppaviññāṇaṃ “anantaṃ viññāṇa”nti manasi karotīti
analyzed: phuṭam pharitvā ṭhitam paṭhama āruppa viññāṇam anantam viññāṇam ti manasi karoti iti
translated: . He makes that space pervaded by consciousness means that he makes the kasiṇa-pervading space, which is the first jhāna consciousness arisen on the plane of the base of infinite space, “infinite consciousness” by giving his attention to it as “infinite consciousness.”

original: attho. Dutiyavikappe pana sāmaññajotanā visese tiṭṭhatīti “phuṭa”nti iminā viññāṇameva
analyzed: atthaḥ dutiya vikappe pana sāmañña jotanā visese tiṭṭhati iti phuṭanti iminā viññāṇam eva
translated: In the second case, the word “pervading” is taken as a particular instance of the general term “pervading” .

original: vuttanti phuṭaṃ viññāṇanti paṭhamāruppaviññāṇamāha. Tañhi ākāsassa sapharaṇakaviññāṇaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam ti phuṭam viññāṇanti paṭhama āruppa viññāṇam āha tat hi ākāsassa sa pharaṇaka viññāṇam
translated: So the first immaterial-sphere consciousness is what is meant by “pervading consciousness.” For that is the consciousness that pervades infinite space.

original: Viññāṇenāti ca karaṇatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, tañca dutiyāruppaviññāṇaṃ vadatīti āha “viññāṇañcāyatanaviññāṇena🔽manasi karotī”ti. Tenāti paṭhamāruppaviññāṇena. Gahitākāranti anantapharaṇavasena🔽gahitākāraṃ. Manasi karotīti dutiyāruppaparikammamanasikārena manasi karoti. Evanti
analyzed: viññāṇena ati ca karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam tat ca dutiya āruppa viññāṇam vadati iti āha viññāṇam ca āyatana viññāṇena  manasi karoti iti tena ati paṭhama āruppa viññāṇena gahita ākāram ti ananta pharaṇa vasena  gahita ākāram manasi karoti iti dutiya āruppa parikamma manasikārena manasi karoti evam ti
translated: And “by means of consciousness” is a locative of instrument. And that is the second immaterial-sphere consciousness. So he said “He gives attention to the base consisting of boundless consciousness” .🔽By means of that: by means of the first immaterial-sphere consciousness. The aspect of what is apprehended: the aspect of what is apprehended by the pervading of infinite space.

original: yathāvuttākāraṃ kasiṇugghāṭimākāse paṭhamāruppaviññāṇena anantapharaṇavasena yo gahitākāro,
analyzed: yathā vutta ākāram kasiṇugghāṭim ākāse paṭhama āruppa viññāṇena ananta pharaṇa vasena yaḥ gahita ākāraḥ
translated: He gives attention: he gives attention by means of the second-jhāna attention consisting in the preliminary-work for the second immaterial-sphere jhāna. Thus: in the way described. The aspect of what is apprehended: the aspect of what is apprehended by the pervading of infinite space by the first immaterial-sphere consciousness.

original: taṃ manasi karontaṃyeva. Taṃ viññāṇanti taṃ dutiyāruppaviññāṇaṃ. Anantaṃ pharatīti
analyzed: tam manasi karontam yeva tam viññāṇan ti tam dutiya āruppa viññāṇam anantam pharati iti
translated: He gives attention to that: he gives attention to that second immaterial-sphere consciousness. Pervades what is infinite:

original: “ananta”nti pharati, tasmā dutiyoyevattho yuttoti. “Yañhī”tiādinā yathāvuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: tasmā tasmā yuttaḥ ti yat hi itiādinā yathāvuttam attham
translated: “Endless” is the meaning that is appropriate. “That he directs his mind to” he makes clear the meaning stated thus.

original: pākaṭaṃ karoti. Taṃpharaṇākārasahitanti tasmiṃ ākāse pharaṇākārasahitaṃ. Viññāṇanti
analyzed: pākaṭam karoti tam pharaṇa ākāra sahitanti tasmin ākāse pharaṇa ākāra sahitam viññāṇam ti
translated: Together with the mode of its direction: together with the mode of its direction in that space.

original: paṭhamāruppaviññāṇaṃ.🔽615. Pubbeti dutiyāruppaparikammakāle. Yaṃ “anantaṃ viññāṇa”nti manasi kataṃ, taṃyeva
analyzed: paṭhama āruppa viññāṇam  pubba iti dutiya āruppa parikamma kāle yam anantam viññāṇam ti manasi katam tam yeva
translated: Consciousness: the first jhāna consciousness.🔽Before: at the time of the second jhāna’s prenascence.🔽That he directs his mind to is the first jhāna consciousness itself.🔽For that is what is called “endless consciousness.”

original: paṭhamāruppaviññāṇameva. Taṃyeva hi abhāveti. Ārammaṇātikkamavasena hi etā samāpattiyo laddhabbāti.
analyzed: paṭhama āruppa viññāṇam eva taṃ yeva hi abhāve ti ārammaṇa atikkama vasena hi etāḥ samāpattiyaḥ laddhabbā ti
translated: For it is by surmounting the object that these attainments are obtained.

original: Niddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the jhāna is ended.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽623. Catukkanaye dutiyajjhānameva yesaṃ vicāro oḷārikato na upaṭṭhāti, yesañca upaṭṭhāti,🔽tesaṃ vasena dvidhā bhinditvā desitanti catukkanayato pañcakanayo nīhatoti āha “uddhaṭānaṃyeva
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā         catukka naye dutiya jhānam eva yesam vicāraḥ oḷārikataḥ na upaṭṭhāti yesam ca upaṭṭhāti  tesam vasena dvidhā bhinditvā āha
translated: The commentary on the Suttas is ended.🔽The Abhidhamma🔽In the fourfold system the second jhāna is taught as twofold by dividing it according to the grossness and subtlety of applied thought, which is why the fivefold system is derived from the fourfold one.

original: catunnaṃ…pe… dassanato cā”ti.
analyzed: dassanato ca ati
translated: That is why it is said, “because the fourfold system is stated by dividing the second jhāna in two according to the grossness and subtlety of applied thought” .

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the “Basket of the Abhidhamma” is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā🔽640. Tīsūti paṭhamādīsu tīsu. Catukkanayena hi taṃ vuttaṃ. Evaṃkoṭṭhāsikāti appamāṇāti
analyzed: tīsu iti paṭhama ādīsu tīsu catukka nayena hi tam vuttam evaṃkoṭṭhāsikā ati appamāṇā ti
translated: . Commentary on the “Questioning”

original: vuttā. Tenāha “lokuttarabhūtā evāti adhippāyo”ti. Paricchinnākāsa…pe… catutthānaṃ
analyzed: vuttā tena āha lokuttara bhūtāḥ evā ti adhippāyo ti
translated: . In the three: in the first, etc., three. For it is stated in the fourfold method. Thus classed: stated as immeasurable. Hence he says: “The intention is that they are supramundane only.” In the limited space, … the fourth:

original: vaṭṭavipassanāpādakattā “sabbatthapādakacatutthe saṅgahitānī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vaṭṭa vipassanā pādaka ttā sabbattha pādaka catutthe saṅgahitāni iti vuttam
translated: because it is the basis for insight into the round of existence, it is said that “they are included in the fourth which is the basis for all.”

original: Ayaṃ kathāti parittārammaṇādikathā. Heṭṭhimo ariyo uparimassa ariyassa lokuttaracittāni paṭivijjhituṃ na sakkotīti vuttaṃ “na ca…pe… sakkotī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kathā ati paritta ārammaṇa ādi kathā heṭṭhimaḥ ariyaḥ uparimassa ariyassa lokuttara cittāni paṭivijjhitum na sakkoti iti vuttam na cape sakkoti iti
translated: This talk: the talk on limited object, etc. The lower noble one is not able to penetrate the supramundane states of the higher noble one. Thus it is said: “And the lower … is not able.”

original: “Kiriyato dvādasanna”nti ca pāṭho atthi. Saha vadati lokuttaraphalacatutthatāsāmaññenāti
analyzed: kiriyataḥ ca pāṭhaḥ atthi saha vadati lokuttara phala catuttha tā sāmaññena ati
translated: There is also the reading “from the function, twelve.” Together with the supramundane fruit of the fourth:🔽the intention is that it is similar to the fourth. Here, although it is impossible for the word all to have the meaning of “all in a part” because of the meaning of “all in every place,” the state of being the basis for all

original: adhippāyo. Idha sabbasaddassa padesasabbavācibhāvato ekadesassa asambhavepi sabbatthapādakatā
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ idha sabba saddassa padesa sabba vāci bhāvataḥ ekadesassa asambhave pi sabbattha pādaka tā
translated: The intention is this: although it is impossible for a part to be all, because the word all has the sense of a part as well as the whole, it is a basis for the whole.

original: eva veditabbāti dassetuṃ “sabbattha…pe… daṭṭhabba”nti āha. Paricchinnākāsakasiṇacatutthādīnīti
analyzed: eva veditabbā iti dassetum sabbattha pe daṭṭhabbanti āha paricchinnā kāsa kasiṇa catuttha ādīni iti
translated: The fourth jhāna, etc., with a limited space as its object:🔽the word “etc.” includes the fourth jhāna, etc., with in-breaths and out-breaths as its object.

original: ādi-saddena ānāpānacatutthādayo saṅgahitā. Navattabbatāyāti navattabbārammaṇatāya.
analyzed: ādi saddena āna apāna catuttha ādayo saṅgahitāḥ navattabba tāya ati navattabba ārammaṇa tāya
translated: Because of the non-existence of a ninth: because of the non-existence of a ninth jhāna with Nibbāna as its object.

original: Nibbānañcāti vattabbaṃ tadārammaṇassāpi bahiddhārammaṇabhāvato.🔽“Sasantānagatampī”ti idaṃ rūpa-saddena, kamma-saddena ca sambandhitabbaṃ “sasantānagatampi
analyzed: nibbānam ca ati vattabbam tad ārammaṇassa api bahiddhā ārammaṇa bhāvataḥ  sa santāna gatam pi iti idam rūpa saddena kamma saddena ca sambandhitabbam sa santāna gatam pi
translated: And Nibbāna should be mentioned too, because its object is also external.

original: apākaṭaṃ rūpaṃ dibbacakkhu viya sasantānagatampi apākaṭaṃ kammaṃ vibhāvetī”ti. Pākaṭe
analyzed: apākaṭam rūpam dibba cakkhu viya sa santāna gatam pi apākaṭam kammam vibhāveti iti pākaṭe
translated: “Even though it is in one’s own continuity”: this should be construed with the words “materiality” and “kamma.” “Even though it is in one’s own continuity, obscure materiality is discerned by the divine eye, and obscure kamma by the knowledge of kamma’s result.”

original: pana sasantānagate rūpe, kamme ca abhiññāñāṇena payojanaṃ natthīti “apākaṭa”nti visesetvā vuttaṃ.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pana sa santāna gate rūpe kamme ca abhiññā ñāṇena payojanam natthi iti apākaṭam ti visesetvā vuttam  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: But when the materiality and the kamma are in one’s own continuity and are evident, there is no purpose in using the higher knowledge of the divine eye or knowledge of kamma’s result, and so it is said by way of distinction that “obscure” .🔽The commentary on the questions and answers is ended.

original: Jhānavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jhāna vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the analysis of the jhānas is ended.

original: 13. Appamaññāvibhaṅgo
analyzed: appamaññā vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Analysis of the Measureless States

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Mode of Conveying an Expression of the True Idea in the Mode of Conveying a Requisite in a Thread

original: 642. Disādesodhināti “ekaṃ disa”ntiādidisodhinā, vihāragāmanigamanagarajanapadarajjādidesodhinā
analyzed: disā desodhinā ati ekam vihāra gāma nigama nagara janapada rajja ādi desodhinā
translated: 1. As to direction-determiner: as to the determining of the direction as “one direction” and so on, and as to the determining of the village, town, city, country, kingdom, and so on.

original: ca. Sattodhināti “sabbā itthiyo, sabbe purisā, ariyā, anariyā”tiādivasappavattena
analyzed: ca sattodhināti sabbā itthiyaḥ sabbe purisāḥ ariyāḥ anariyā atiādi vasa ppavattena
translated: 2. As to being-determiner: as to the being-determiner consisting in the description of all women, all men, noble ones, and so on.

original: sattodhinā. Etassāti etassa padassa, padatthassa vā. Anuvattakanti adhikāravasena
analyzed: etassa ati etassa padassa padatthassa vā anuvattakanti adhikāra vasena
translated: 3. As to the repetition: as to the repetition by way of the function.

original: pavattakaṃ. Taṃ dvayanti tathā-saddo, iti-saddoti ubhayaṃ. “Tathā dutiya”nti hi vutte
analyzed: pavattakam tam dvayanti iti saddo iti ubhayam tathā dutiyanti hi vutte
translated: 4. As to the two: as to the two, namely, the word “so” and the word “thus.” For when it is said “so a second time,”

original: “tathā-saddo yathā mettāsahagatena cetasā puratthimādīsu ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati,
analyzed: tathā saddaḥ yathā mettā sahagatena cetasā puratthima ādīsu ekam disam pharitvā viharati
translated: the word “so” signifies the meaning “just as he dwells pervading one direction with his heart endued with loving- kindness,

original: tathā dutiyampi disaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharatī”ti imamatthaṃ dīpeti.
analyzed: tathā dutiyam pi disam mettā sahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharati iti imam attham dīpeti
translated: so he dwells pervading a second time a second direction with his heart endued with loving-kindness.”🔽The same method applies in the case of the remaining two words.

original: Sesadvayepi eseva nayo. Yasmā itīti ayaṃ iti-saddo pakāratthe, evanti vuttaṃ hoti,
analyzed: sesa dvaye pi esā iva nayaḥ yasmai iti iti ayam iti saddo pakāra atthe eva nti vuttam hoti
translated: 5. As to the manner: the word “thus” has the meaning of “in this way,”🔽so it is said “in this way he dwells pervading one direction with his heart endued with loving-kindness,

original: tasmā “yathā mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ, dutiyaṃ, tatiyaṃ, catutthaṃ disaṃ pharitvā
analyzed: tasmai yathā mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam dutiyam tatiyam catuttham disam pharitvā
translated: a second time with his heart endued with loving-kindness, a third time with his heart endued with loving-kindness, a fourth time with his heart endued with loving-kindness.”

original: viharati, evaṃ uddhaṃ, adho, tiriyaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharatī”ti
analyzed: viharati evam uddham adhas tiriyam mettā sahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharati iti
translated: He dwells pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, measureless, free from enmity, and free from affliction’ .

original: imamatthaṃ dīpeti. Tena vuttaṃ “mettā…pe… taṃ dvaya”nti. Tassāti dvayassa. Pharaṇantarādiṭṭhānanti
analyzed: imam attham dīpeti tena vuttam mettāpe tam tam tassa āti dvayassa
translated: This is the meaning illustrated: ‘Loving-kindness … and that pair’ . ‘His’ : of the pair. ‘The place for the occurrence of what is other than the pervasion, etc.’

original: pharaṇato aññaṃ pharaṇantaraṃ, taṃ ādi yassa, taṃ pharaṇantarādi. Pharaṇantarañhetaṃ🔽mettābhāvanāya, yadidaṃ vipulatā. Ādi-saddena bhummantarapaguṇabhāvādi gayhati, tassa
analyzed: pharaṇataḥ aññam pharaṇantaram tam ādi yassa tam pharaṇantara ādi  mettā bhāvanāya yat idam vipula tā ādi saddena bhumma antara paguṇa bhāva ādi gayhati tassa
translated: is the place for the occurrence of what is other than the pervasion, which is the beginning of the pervasion. For this is the beginning of the pervasion,🔽which is the extension of the development of loving-kindness. The word ‘etc.’ includes the different stages and the different special qualities, etc.,

original: pharaṇantarādino ṭhānaṃ ṭhānabhūto “vipulenā”tiādinā vuccamāno mettābhāvanāviseso.🔽Vuttappakāramattaparāmasanassa tassa dvayassa aṭṭhānaṃ anokāsoti. Iti katvā iminā
analyzed: ṭhānam ṭhāna bhūtaḥ vipulena ati ādinā vuccamānaḥ mettā bhāvanā viseso  vutta ppakāra matta parāmasanassa tassa dvayassa aṭṭhānam anokāsaḥ ti iti katvā iminā
translated: of the pervasion. The difference in the development of loving-kindness that is stated in the passage beginning ‘With a mind filled with loving-kindness’ is the place for the occurrence of what is other than the pervasion, etc.

original: kāraṇena na vuttaṃ taṃ dvayanti attho.
analyzed: kāraṇena na vuttam tam attho
translated: Because of that, ‘there is no scope for that pair’ . The meaning is: for that reason it is not stated.

original: 643. Rāgassāti kāmarāgassa. Sinehassāti puttasinehādisinehassa. Vipattiyāti rāgasinehasaṅkhātāya mettābhāvanāya vipattiyā vināsassa. Anuppattito hirottappabalena anuppajjanato.
analyzed: rāgassa ati kāma rāgassa sinehassa ati putta sineha ādi sinehassa vipattiyā ati rāga sineha saṅkhātāya mettā bhāvanāya vipattiyā vināsassa anuppattitaḥ hirottappa balena anuppajjanato
translated: “Of greed”: of sense-desire greed. “Of affection”: of affection such as that for children. “Of calamity”: of the calamity, the destruction, of the loving kindness that is called “greed” and “affection.” “Of non-arising”: because of non-arising through the power of shame and moral dread.

original: 645. Adhimuñcitvāti bhāvanācittaṃ ārammaṇe suṭṭhu vissajjetvā, taṃ panettha adhimuccanaṃ
analyzed: adhimuñcitvā ati bhāvanā cittam ārammaṇe suṭṭhu vissajjetvā tam pana ittha adhimuccanam
translated: “Having resolved upon it”: having released the consciousness of development well upon the object. But this resolving upon it

original: yasmā pharaṇavaseneva hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “suṭṭhu pasāretvā”ti. Yasmā pana ārammaṇe
analyzed: yasmā pharaṇa vasena iva hoti tasmā vuttam suṭṭhu pasāretvā iti yasmā pana ārammaṇe
translated: is done by means of pervading, so it is said, “having extended it well.” But since this resolving upon it by means of development

original: suṭṭhu asaṃsappanavaseneva taṃ mettābhāvanāya adhimuccanaṃ hoti, tasmā “balavatā
analyzed: suṭṭhu a saṃsappana vasena iva tam mettā bhāvanāya adhimuccanam hoti tasmai balavatā
translated: is done by means of not letting it slip back from the object,

original: vā adhimokkhena adhimuccitvā”ti ca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā adhimokkhena adhimuccitvā iti ca vuttam
translated: so it is said, “having resolved upon it with strong resolution.”

original: 648. Etesaṃ padānaṃ sabbena sakalena disādesādibhedena avadhinā. Sabbāvadhidisādipharaṇākārehīti sabbāvadhibhūtadisādesapuggalapharaṇappakārehi.
analyzed: etesam padānam sabbena sakalena disā ādesa ādi bhedena avadhinā sabba avadhi disā ādi pharaṇa ākārehi iti sabba avadhi bhūta disā ādesa puggala pharaṇa ppakārehi
translated: “In all its aspects”: in all its aspects of direction, location, etc., without exception. “In all its modes of pervasion of directions, etc., without exception”: in all its modes of pervading directions, locations, and persons without exception.

original: 650. Vighātavasenāti vikkhambhanavasena.
analyzed: vighāta vasena ati vikkhambhana vasena
translated: “By suppression”: by suppression of annoyance.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the “Basket of Conduct” is ended.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: 3. The commentary on the questions

original: 699. Kathitānaṃ kusalādidhammānaṃ. Imasmiṃ pana appamaññāvibhaṅge kathitā appamaññā,
analyzed: kathitānam kusala ādi dhammānam imasmin pana appamaññā vibhaṅge kathitā appamaññā
translated: . Of the profitable, etc., ideas mentioned. But in this Vibhaṅga of the measureless the measureless mentioned

original: tā ca sabhāvato lokiyā eva, na khandhavibhaṅgādīsu kathitā khandhādayo viya lokuttarāpīti🔽ekaṃsato sabbāsaṃ appamaññānaṃ lokiyabhāvameva dīpetuṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “imasmiṃ panā”tiādi
analyzed: tā ca sabhāvataḥ lokiyāḥ eva na khandha vibhaṅga ādīsu kathitā khandha ādayaḥ lokuttarā api iti  ekaṃsatas sabbāsam appamaññānam lokiya bhāvam eva dīpetum aṭṭhakathāyam imasmin pana atiādi
translated: are, in their individual essences, only mundane, not supramundane like the aggregates, etc., mentioned in the Vibhaṅgas on the aggregates, etc.🔽So in order to show that all the measureless are mundane in the sense of being one-sided, the commentary says “In this case” , etc.

original: vuttanti imamatthaṃ dassento āha “imasmiṃ pana…pe… hotī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam ti imam attham dassentaḥ āha imasmin pana pe hoti iti
translated: The meaning is this: in order to show that all the measureless are mundane in the sense of being one-sided, the commentary says “In this case” , etc.

original: Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the questions is ended.

original: Appamaññāvibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: appamaññā vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vibhaṅga of the measureless is ended.

original: 14. Sikkhāpadavibhaṅgo
analyzed: sikkhāpada vibhaṅgo
translated: The exposition of the training precepts

original: 1. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Abhidhamma

original: 703. Sikkhāsaṅkhātānaṃ kusaladhammānaṃ pañca sīlaṅgāni nissayabhāvena vā patiṭṭhā
analyzed: sikkhā saṅkhātānam kusala dhammānam pañca sīlaṅgāni nissaya bhāvena vā patiṭṭhā
translated: The five training precepts are either a footing for profitable ideas called “training” in the sense of a support or a foundation,

original: siyuṃ, upanissayabhāvena vāti tadubhayaṃ dassento āha “sampayogavasena, upanissayavasena ca okāsabhāvenā”ti.
analyzed: siyum upanissaya bhāvena vā ti tat ubhayam dassentaḥ āha sampayoga vasena upanissaya vasena ca okāsa bhāvena ati
translated: or else they are a proximate cause for them. So in order to show both of these the commentator says “in the sense of a proximate cause and in the sense of a footing” .

original: 704. “Kammapathā evā”ti niyamassa katattā vuttaṃ “asabbasādhāraṇesū”ti. Na hi sakkā
analyzed: kamma pathāḥ eva ti niyamassa kata ttā vuttam asabba sādhāraṇesu iti na hi sakkā
translated: “In those not common to all” is said because the restriction is made to the courses of kamma only. For it is not possible

original: indriyādisādhāraṇakoṭṭhāsavasena niyamaṃ kātuṃ. Kammapathakoṭṭhāsikā eva, na jhānādikoṭṭhāsikā.
analyzed: indriya ādi sādhāraṇa koṭṭhāsa vasena niyamam kātum kammapatha koṭṭhāsikā eva na jhāna ādi koṭṭhāsikā
translated: to make the restriction by way of the faculties, etc., which are common to all. They are only the constituents of the courses of kamma, not the constituents of the jhānas, etc.

original: Kammapathabhāvena āgatanti vadanti, duggatiyā, tattha uppajjanadukkhassa ca pavattiupāyabhāvatoti
analyzed: kammapatha bhāvena āgatanti vadanti duggatiyā tattha uppajjana dukkhassa ca pavatti upāya bhāvato ti
translated: They say that they are called courses of kamma because they are stated as courses of kamma. The intention is that they are the means of occurrence of the suffering that arises in the unhappy destinies.

original: adhippāyo. Assa surāpānassa. Upakārakattaṃ sabbesaṃ. Sabhāgattaṃ micchācārassa.🔽Tathāgahitasaṅkhārārammaṇatāyāti “sattaṃ avaharāmi, satte vippaṭipajjāmī”tiādinā
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ assa surā pānassa upakāraka ttam sabbesam sabhāga ttam micchācārassa  tathā gahita saṅkhāra ārammaṇa tāya ati sattam avaharāmi satte vippaṭipajjāmi itiādinā
translated: The helpfulness of all is in the drinking of wine. The similarity is in sexual misconduct.

original: sattākārena gahitasaṅkhārārammaṇatāya, na pana sattapaññattiārammaṇatāyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: satta ākārena gahita saṅkhāra ārammaṇa tāya na pana satta paññatti ārammaṇa tāya ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that they are objects of formations that are apprehended in the way of a being, not that they are objects of the description of a being, as in “I shall steal a being,” “I shall misbehave with a being.”

original: “Pañca sikkhāpadā”tiādinā tamevatthaṃ vivarati.
analyzed: pañca sikkhāpadāti ādinā tam eva attham vivarati
translated: He explains that same meaning in the passage beginning, “The five training precepts” .

original: Tassa tassāti yassa yassa byasanatthāya. Sayaṃ vā usuādiṃ khipati, opātakhaṇanādiṃ
analyzed: tassa tassa ati yassa yassa byasana atthāya sayam vā usu ādim khipati opāta khaṇana ādim
translated: “For this or that” means for whatever misfortune. Either he himself throws the spear, etc., or he digs a pitfall, etc.,

original: karoti, tādisaṃ mantaṃ parijappati, kammajaiddhiṃ vaḷañjeti, aññena vā taṃ sabbaṃ
analyzed: karoti tādisam mantam parijappati kamma ja eddhim vaḷañjeti aññena vā tam sabbam
translated: he has it made, he recites a spell over it, he makes a charm, or he has all that done by another.

original: kāretīti āha “nissaggiya…pe… dve eva gahitā”ti.
analyzed: kāreti iti āha nissaggiya pe dve eva gahitā ati
translated: “The two are included in the relinquishment” is said.

original: Yadipi koṭṭhāsavāre virati sarūpena nāgatā “yevāpanā”tveva vuttā, bhajāpiyamānā pana
analyzed: yadi pi koṭṭhāsa vāre virati sarūpena na āgatā vuttā pana
translated: Although abstinence is not stated in the same words in the section on parts, it is nevertheless included in the word “relinquishment.”🔽But when it is distributed, it is distributed as a part of the path.

original: maggabhāvaṃyeva bhajatīti āha “viratisīlaṃ pana maggakoṭṭhāsika”nti. Sesasīlānanti
analyzed: magga bhāvaṃya iva bhajati iti āha virati sīlam pana magga koṭṭhāsikam ti
translated: “But abstinence virtue is a part of the path” is said.

original: sesaavītikkantasīlānaṃ.
analyzed: sesa a vītikkanta sīlānam
translated: The remaining virtues are the remaining virtues of non-transgression.🔽The impossible states are killing living beings, etc.

original: 712. Abhabbaṭṭhānāti pāṇātipātādayo. Yathā pāṇātipātādayo verahetutāya veraṃ, evaṃ🔽tadaññepi akusalāti vuttaṃ “taṃsabhāgatāya verabhūtāna”nti. Viratīnaṃ uppatti na
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādayaḥ yathā pāṇa atipāta ādayaḥ vera hetutāya veram evam  tad aññe pi akusalā ti vuttam taṃsa bhāga tāya viratīnam uppatti na
translated: Just as killing living beings, etc., are enmity because they are a cause of enmity, so too are the other unwholesome states.🔽It is said, “Because they are similar to enmity.”🔽The arising of the abstinences will not be non-existent in the trainers.

original: na bhavissati sekkhānanti yojanā. “Akusalasamuṭṭhitāni cā”tiādināpi sekkhānaṃ ubhayena
analyzed: na bhavissati sekkhānam ti yojanā akusala samuṭṭhitāni ca ati ādinā api sekkhānam ubhayena
translated: “And those originated by the unwholesome” and so on also only distribute the non-existence of the abstinences in the trainers by both ways.

original: viratisabbhāvaṃyeva vibhāveti. Tassattho – yāni akusalasamuṭṭhitāni kāyakammādīni,
analyzed: virati sabbhāvaṃ yeva vibhāveti tassa atthaḥ yāni akusala samuṭṭhitāni kāya kamma ādīni
translated: The meaning is this: those bodily actions, etc., originated by the unwholesome,

original: tāni tesaṃ sekkhānaṃ kāyaduccaritādīnīti verāniyeva, tehi verehi tesaṃ sekkhānaṃ
analyzed: tāni tesam sekkhānam kāya duccarita ādīni iti tehi verehi tesam sekkhānam
translated: and abstentions from these are possible for those in training.

original: viratiyo sambhavantiyeva. Yatoti yasmā pāṇātipātādiviramitabbanippariyāyaverābhāvepi
analyzed: viratiyaḥ yato ti yasmā
translated: Because, although there is no absence of enemies in the ultimate sense in the mere abstention from killing living beings, etc.,

original: kāyaduccaritādiveramattato sekkhānaṃ viratisambhavato. Naphalabhūtassāpīti yathā🔽phalassa maggapaṭibimbabhūtattā maggasadisaṃ sattaaṭṭhaṅgikatā siyā, evaṃ aphalabhūtassāpi🔽sakadāgāmimaggādikassa yato viratisambhavato aṭṭhaṅgikatā hoti, aññathā pañcaṅgiko
analyzed: sekkhānam virati sambhavataḥ na phala bhūtassa api iti yathā  phalassa magga paṭibimba bhūta ttā magga sadisam satta aṭṭhaṅgika tā siyā evam aphala bhūtassa api  sakadāgāmi magga ādikassa yatas virati sambhavataḥ aṭṭhaṅgika tā hoti aññathā pañcaṅgiko
translated: abstention is possible for those in training because of the mere absence of enemies in the form of bodily misconduct, etc.

original: eva siyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: eva siyāti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that just as the eight factors are similar to the path because the fruition is a reflection of the path, so too the eight factors are so because abstention is possible for the once-returner path, etc., which is not a fruition, otherwise it would be only five factors.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the “Basket of the Abhidhamma” is finished.

original: 2. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the “Questions”

original: 714. Yathāviramitabbatoti yo yo pāṇātipātādi viramitabbo, tato virativasena.
analyzed: yathā viramitabbāt ti yaḥ yaḥ pāṇātipāta ādi viramitabbaḥ tatas virati vasena
translated: As to what is to be abstained from: as to abstention from what is to be abstained from, from killing living beings, etc.

original: Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the “Questions” is finished.

original: Sikkhāpadavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sikkhāpada vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the analysis of the training precepts is finished.

original: 15. Paṭisambhidāvibhaṅgo
analyzed: paṭisambhidā vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Patisambhidāmagga

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The “Basket of Discourses”

original: 1. Saṅgahavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgaha vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: 1. The section on the method of inclusion

original: 718. “Eseva nayo”ti dhammādīsu kato atideso saṅkhepato tesaṃ dassanaṃ hotīti āha
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ ti dhamma ādīsu kataḥ atidesaḥ saṅkhepataḥ tesam dassanam hoti iti āha
translated: “The same method” : the inclusion of the terms dhamma, etc., is shown in brief by the method stated in the case of the term “dhamma” .

original: “saṅkhepena dassetvā”ti. Tesaṃ niruttipaṭibhānānaṃ visayā tabbisayā, tesaṃ, niruttipaṭibhānavisayabhūtānanti
analyzed: saṅkhepena dassetvā ti tesam nirutti paṭibhānānam visayā tad bisayā tesam nirutti paṭibhāna visaya bhūtānan ti
translated: “Having shown them in brief” : the scope of the terms nirutti and paṭibhāna is the things that are the scope of those terms, i.e., the things that are the scope of the terms nirutti and paṭibhāna.🔽This is the meaning.

original: attho. Paccayuppannādibhedehīti paccayuppannanibbānabhāsitatthādibhedehi.
analyzed: atthaḥ paccaya uppanna ādi bhedehi iti paccaya uppanna nibbāna bhāsita ttha ādi bhedehi
translated: “By the division of the arisen, etc.” : by the division of the arisen, the unarisen, the arisen and unarisen, the past, the future, the present, the conditioned, the unconditioned, etc.

original: Dukkhahetuphalajātādidhammajarāmaraṇāni dukkhādīni. Saccahetudhammapaccayākāravāresu🔽dukkhasamudayādipariyāyena āgato phalanibbattako hetu, saccapaccayākāravāresu ariyamaggo,
analyzed: dukkha hetu phala jāta ādi dhamma jarā maraṇāni dukkha ādīni sacca hetu dhamma paccaya ākāra vāresu  dukkha samudaya ādi pariyāyena āgataḥ phala nibbattakaḥ hetu sacca paccaya ākāra vāresu ariya maggo
translated: “The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽“The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽“The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽“The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽“The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: pariyattivāre bhāsitaṃ, abhidhammabhājanīye kusalaṃ, akusalanti evaṃ pāḷiyaṃ vuttānaṃyeva
analyzed: pariyatti vāre bhāsitam abhidhamma bhājanīye kusalam akusalanti evam pāḷiyam vuttānam yeva
translated: “The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are the aggregates of suffering, the aggregates of the cause of suffering, the aggregates of the cessation of suffering, the aggregates of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: vasena pañca dhammā veditabbāti imamatthamāha “tathā dhammā cā”ti iminā.
analyzed: vasena pañca dhammā veditabbā ti imam attham āha tathā dhammā ca ati iminā
translated: “The things that are the aggregates of suffering, etc.” : aging-and-death, etc., which are

original: Nibbattakahetuādīnanti nibbattakasampāpakañāpakānaṃ. Purimoti pavattanattho. Tasminti magge. Pacchimoti pāpanattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: nibbattaka hetu ādīnam ti nibbattaka sampāpaka ñāpakānam purimaḥ ti pavattana atthaḥ tasmin ti magge pacchimaḥ ti pāpana atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: ‘The reason for arising, etc.’: the reason for the arising, the reason for the fulfilment, and the reason for the manifestation. ‘The former’: the meaning of occurrence. ‘In that’: in that path. ‘The latter’: the meaning of removal should be seen.

original: Aviparītaniruttīti buddhādīhi āciṇṇā tassa tassa atthassa vācakabhāve niruḷhā yāthāvanirutti.
analyzed: aviparīta nirutti iti buddha ādīhi āciṇṇā tassa tassa atthassa vācaka bhāve niruḷhā yāthāva nirutti
translated: ‘Unerring language’: the language that is used by the Buddhas, etc., and is established in the expression of this or that meaning as it really is.

original: Yasmā viññattivikārasahito saddo paññattīti attano adhippāyo, tasmā paramatato taṃ
analyzed: yasmā viññatti vikāra sahitaḥ saddo paññatti iti attanaḥ adhippāyo tasmā parama tatas tam
translated: Since the speaker’s intention is that the word is a designation accompanied by intimation and modification, he therefore

original: dassento “avacanabhūtāyā”ti visesetvā “keci vaṇṇayantī”ti āha. Evaṃ satīti evaṃ niruttiyā
analyzed: dassentaḥ avacana bhūtāya ati visesetvā keci vaṇṇayanti iti āha evam sati iti evam niruttiyā
translated: says, ‘Some describe it as not being a word,’ specifying it in order to show it in the ultimate sense. When it is so,🔽when the language is a designation,

original: paññattibhāve sati. Paññatti abhilapitabbāti āpajjatīti vutte, hotu, ko doso tassā🔽vacanīyabhāvatoti kadāci vadeyyāti āsaṅkanto āha “na ca vacanato…pe… uccāretabbaṃ
analyzed: paññatti bhāve sati paññatti abhilapitabbā ati āpajjati iti vutte hotu kaḥ doso tassā  vacanīya bhāvato ti kadāci vadeyya iti āsaṅkantaḥ āha na ca vacana tope uccāretabbam
translated: if it is said that the designation is what should be spoken, then let it be so, what is the harm?🔽Since it is what should be spoken, it might be said that it is sometimes spoken. Anticipating this, he says, ‘But it is not to be uttered by reason of its being a word, etc.’

original: atthī”ti. Tesaṃ atthadhammānaṃ. Na vacananti avacanaṃ avacanasabhāvaṃ. Evaṃpakāranti
analyzed: atthi iti tesam attha dhammānam na avacanam avacana sabhāvam evaṃpakāram ti
translated: of those meanings and ideas. ‘Not a word’: not a word, not having the nature of a word. ‘Such as this’:

original: evaṃvidhaṃ evaṃ niyataliṅgavisesajotanākāraṃ.
analyzed: evaṃvidham evam niyata liṅga visesa jotana ākāram
translated: of such a kind, having such a fixed grammatical gender and case-ending.

original: Paratoti parabhāge anantaramanodvāre. Saddaggahaṇānusārena gahitāya nāmaniruttiyaṃ
analyzed: paratas ti parabhāge anantara manaḥ dvāre sadda gahaṇa anusārena gahitāya
translated: They say that the discrimination of language occurs in the name-group and the phrase-group that are apprehended by the apprehension of sound.

original: niruttipaṭisambhidā pavattatīti vadanti. Yadi evaṃ kasmā pāḷiyaṃ “niruttipaṭisambhidā
analyzed: nirutti paṭisambhidā pavattati iti vadanti yadi evam kasmai pāḷiyam nirutti paṭisambhidā
translated: If that is so, why is it said in the text, “The discrimination of language has present objects”?

original: paccuppannārammaṇā”ti vuttāti āha “nirutti…pe… sandhāya vutta”nti. Pacchā jānananti🔽saddaggahaṇuttarakālaṃ nāmaniruttiyā jānanaṃ. Evanti evaṃ saddaggahaṇato pacchā nāmaniruttiṃ
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇā iti vuttā iti āha nirutti pe sandhāya vuttanti pacchā jānananti  sadda gahaṇa uttara kālam nāma niruttiyāḥ jānanam evam ti evam sadda gahaṇataḥ pacchā nāma niruttim
translated: He says, “The discrimination of language is stated … with reference to the knowledge of the name corresponding to the sound.”🔽“The knowledge of the name corresponding to the sound” is the knowledge that occurs after the apprehension of the sound, having the name corresponding to the sound as its object.

original: ārabbha pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidāti gayhamāne. Evaṃ niruttiyā nāmapaññattipakkhe🔽pāḷiyā, aṭṭhakathāya ca virodhaṃ dassetvā saddapakkhe tadabhāvaṃ dassento “yathā🔽panā”tiādimāha. Taṃtaṃsaddavibhāvakanti yathā tassa tassa saddappabhedanicchayassa
analyzed: ārabbha pavattam ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā ti gayhamāne evam niruttiyāḥ nāma paññatti pakkhe  pāḷiyā aṭṭhakathāya ca virodham dassetvā sadda pakkhe tad abhāvam dassentaḥ yathā  pana ati ādim āha tat tat sadda vibhāvakam ti yathā tassa tassa
translated: When it is said that the discrimination of language is the knowledge that occurs in this way after the apprehension of the sound, having the name corresponding to the sound as its object,🔽then it is shown that there is a contradiction between the text and the commentary in regard to the naming of the name-group and the phrase-group.🔽But in order to show that there is no such contradiction in regard to the sound, he says, “But the knowledge of the divine ear,” etc.🔽“The knowledge of the divine ear” is the knowledge that is the condition for the desire to know the various kinds of sound.

original: paccayabhūtaṃ dibbasotañāṇaṃ saddārammaṇameva taṃ taṃ saddaṃ vibhūtaṃ karoti, evaṃ
analyzed: paccaya bhūtam dibba sota ñāṇam sadda ārammaṇam eva tam tam saddam vibhūtam karoti evam
translated: It makes the various sounds clear by making sound its object.

original: niruttippabhedanicchayassa paccayabhūtaṃ niruttisaddārammaṇameva niruttipaṭisambhidāñāṇaṃ
analyzed: nirutti ppabheda nicchayassa paccaya bhūtam nirutti sadda ārammaṇam eva nirutti paṭisambhidā ñāṇam
translated: The knowledge of the discernment of language is the discernment of language itself, which is the condition for the desire to discern the classification of terms.

original: taṃ vibhūtaṃ karotīti tassa paccuppannārammaṇatā vuttā. Saddaṃ pana vibhāventaṃ ekantato
analyzed: tam vibhūtam karoti iti tassa paccuppanna ārammaṇa tā vuttā saddam pana vibhāventam ekantato
translated: It is said that it has a present object because it makes that clear. But when it discerns sound,

original: saddūpanibandhaṃ paññattimpi vibhāvetiyeva, yato sabhāvāsabhāvavisesavibhāvanaṃ sampajjati.🔽Aññathā hi saddamattaggahaṇe visesāvabodho eva na siyāti porāṇā paññattivibhāvanampi
analyzed: saddūpa nibandham paññattim pi vibhāvetiyā iva yatas sabhāva asabhāva visesa vibhāvanam sampajjati  aññathā hi sadda matta ggahaṇe visesa avabodhaḥ eva na siyāti porāṇā paññatti vibhāvanam pi
translated: it discerns also the expression that is bound up with the sound, since the discernment of the individual essences and the non-individual essences becomes established.🔽Otherwise, if it were to apprehend only the sound, there would be no discernment of the distinction.🔽So the ancients wanted to include the discernment of the expression too.

original: tassa icchanti. Taṃvibhāvakanti niruttisaddavibhāvakaṃ. Na pāḷivirodho hotīti yadipi
analyzed: tassa icchanti tam vibhāvakam ti nirutti sadda vibhāvakam na pāḷi virodhaḥ hoti iti yadi pi
translated: The meaning is: that which makes the discernment of the expression of the sound. There is no contradiction with the texts.

original: abhidhammabhājanīye “yāya niruttiyā tesaṃ dhammānaṃ paññatti hotī”ti vuttaṃ, tampi
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīye yāya niruttiyā tesam dhammānam paññatti hoti iti vuttam tam pi
translated: For although it is said in the Abhidhammabhājaniya: “By whatever language the description of those ideas is made” ,

original: sabhāvaniruttisaddena dhammānaṃ pabodhanameva sandhāya vuttaṃ, na tabbinimuttaṃ paññattinti
analyzed: sabhāva nirutti saddena dhammānam pabodhanam eva sandhāya vuttam na tad vinimuttam paññattiṃ ti
translated: that is said with reference to the mere arousing of the ideas by means of the individual essence and the sound of the language, not with reference to the description that is dependent on that.

original: “niruttisaddārammaṇā niruttipaṭisambhidā”ti vuccamāne pāḷiyā virodho na hotīti attho.🔽“Paccavekkhantassā”ti vuttattā saddaṃ gahetvā pacchā gahitāya paññattiyā paccavekkhaṇena🔽bhavitabbanti āsaṅkeyyāti tadāsaṅkānivattanatthamāha “taṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ saddaṃ
analyzed: nirutti sadda ārammaṇā nirutti paṭisambhidā ti vuccamāne pāḷiyā virodhaḥ na hoti iti atthaḥ  paccavekkhantassa ati vutta ttā saddam gahetvā pacchā gahitāya paññattiyā paccavekkhaṇena  bhavitabban ti āsaṅkā iyyā ti tad āsaṅkā nivattana attham āha tam sabhāva niruttim saddam
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction with the text when it is said, “The discrimination of language is the sound of language as object.”🔽Since it is said, “When he reviews,” there is the assumption that it must be by reviewing the description apprehended subsequently to the apprehension of the sound.

original: ārammaṇaṃ katvā”tiādi. Sabhāvaniruttiṃ vibhāventaṃyevāti sabhāvaniruttivisayassa
analyzed: ārammaṇam katvā atiādi sabhāva niruttim vibhāventam yeva ati sabhāva nirutti visayassa
translated: So he says, “Having made the sound, that is, the language of individual essences, its object,” etc., in order to avert that assumption.🔽It occurs only in one who is discerning the language of individual essences,

original: sammohassa pageva viddhaṃsitattā atthasādhanavasena abhiññāñāṇaṃ viya taṃ vibhāventameva
analyzed: sammohassa pagā iva attha sādhana vasena abhiññā ñāṇam viya tam vibhāventam eva
translated: because the confusion about the language of individual essences has already been dispelled, just as the knowledge of the discernment of meaning occurs only in one who is discerning the meaning.

original: pavattati. Tenāha “niruttiṃ bhindantaṃ paṭivijjhantameva uppajjatī”ti. Pabhedagamanañcettha
analyzed: pavattati tena āha niruttim bhindantam paṭivijjhantam eva uppajjati iti pabheda gamanam ca ittha
translated: So he said, “It arises only in one who is discerning, who is penetrating the language.”🔽And here the “penetration of the classification” is the knowing of the classification of language without remainder. So too in the case of the rest.

original: anavasesato niruttivibhāgajānanaṃ. Tathā sesesu. Sakkaṭanāmādīti sakkaṭavasena vuttanāmākhyātādi.
analyzed: anavasesataḥ nirutti vibhāga jānanam tathā sesesu sakkaṭa nāma ādi iti sakkaṭa vasena vutta nāma ākhyāta ādi
translated: The “name ‘chariot’ and so on” is the verbal description given in terms of the chariot.

original: Nipātapadaṃ nāmādipadāni viya atthaṃ na vadati, atha kho byañjeti jotetīti “byañjana”nti vuttaṃ nipātapadaṃ.
analyzed: nipāta padam nāma ādi padāni viya attham na vadati atha kho byañjeti joteti iti byañjanam ti vuttam nipāta padam
translated: The word nipata is not a word that expresses a meaning like the first words of a sentence; it is called “a word that expresses by indication” because it indicates, it illuminates.

original: Bodhi ñāṇaṃ maṇḍabhūtaṃ etthāti bodhimaṇḍo, mahābodhiṭṭhānaṃ. Tenāha “paṭhamābhisambuddhaṭṭhāne”ti. Aññena pakārenāti uggahādippakārena.
analyzed: bodhi ñāṇam maṇḍa bhūtam ettha ati bodhimaṇḍaḥ mahā bodhi ṭṭhānam tena āha paṭhama abhisambuddha ṭṭhāne iti aññena pakārena ati uggaha ādi ppakārena
translated: The Bodhi tree is the place of the Great Enlightenment; it is so called because the knowledge of enlightenment is the basis there. He says “in the place of the first enlightenment,” by another name, that is, by the name “Nipata.”

original: Aññathā hontīti purisayuge purisayuge ekadesena parivattantā kālantare aññākārā bhavanti.
analyzed: aññathā honti iti purisa yuge purisa yuge eka desena parivattantā kāla antare aññākārāḥ bhavanti
translated: They would be different: they would be of a different form at a different time, turning by one part after another in each pair of men.

original: Vinassantīti taṃtaṃbhāsānaṃ manussānaṃ vināsena na paññāyanti, manussānaṃ duruggahaṇādinā
analyzed: vinassanti iti taṃtaṃbhāsānam manussānam vināsena na paññāyanti manussānam duruggahaṇa ādinā
translated: They would be lost: they would not be known because of the loss of the languages of the various peoples.

original: katthaci kadāci parivattantīpi brahmalokādīsu yathāsabhāveneva avaṭṭhānato na sabbattha,
analyzed: katthaci kadāci brahmaloka ādīsu yathā sabhāvena iva avaṭṭhānataḥ na sabbattha
translated: They would not turn everywhere, at all times, in every way, because they do not turn in the Brahma-world, etc., in accordance with their nature, though they turn somewhere, sometime, in some way, because of the difficulty of learning them by the people there.

original: sabbadā, sabbathā ca parivattati. Tenāha “kappavināsepi tiṭṭhatiyevā”ti. Etassa niruttipaṭisambhidāñāṇassa.
analyzed: sabbadā sabbathā ca parivattati tena āha kappa vināse pi tiṭṭhatiyā iva āti etassa nirutti paṭisambhidā ñāṇassa
translated: Therefore he says, “They would not last even through the world-dissolution.” This is said of the knowledge of the discernment of language.

original: Atthādīsu ñāṇanti atthapaṭisambhidādi. Atthadhammaniruttivasena tīsu. Atthadhammaniruttipaṭibhānavasena
analyzed: attha ādīsu ñāṇam ti attha paṭisambhidā ādi attha dhamma nirutti vasena tīsu attha dhamma nirutti paṭibhāna vasena
translated: As to “knowledge of meaning, etc.,” the knowledge of the discernment of meaning, etc., is what is meant. In the case of the three, it is in terms of meaning, law, and language.🔽Or in the case of the four, it is in terms of meaning, law, language, and the explanation of language.

original: catūsupi vā. Atthadhammādinā attanā jotetabbena saha atthenāti sātthakāni. Sabbo🔽atthadhammādiko attho visayabhūto etassa ñāṇassa atthīti sabbatthakaṃ. Sabbasmiṃ🔽atthādike visaye khittaṃ attano paccayehi ṭhapitaṃ pavattitaṃ. Arahattappattiyā visadā
analyzed: catūsu pi vā attha dhamma ādinā attanā jotetabbena saha atthena ati sa atthakāni  attha dhamma ādikaḥ atthaḥ visaya bhūtaḥ etassa ñāṇassa atthi iti sabbatthakam sabbasmin  attha ādike visaye khittam attanaḥ paccayehi ṭhapitam pavattitam arahatta ppattiyā
translated: “Having meaning” is that which has meaning together with the meaning, the law, etc., that should be illuminated by oneself.🔽“Having all meanings” is that which has all meanings, the meaning of the law, etc., as its domain.🔽“Dispersed” is that which is placed, set up, by its own conditions in all the domains of meaning, etc.🔽“Clear” is that which is clear by the attainment of Arahantship, because all opposing states have been completely destroyed.

original: honti paṭipakkhadhammānaṃ sabbaso viddhaṃsitattā. Pañcannanti adhigamapariyattisavanaparipucchāpubbayogānaṃ.
analyzed: honti paṭipakkha dhammānam sabbasas viddhaṃsita ttā adhigama pariyatti savana paripucchā pubbayogānam
translated: “Five” is the five, namely, the five kinds of direct knowledge, namely, the direct knowledge of states, the direct knowledge of penetration of minds, the direct knowledge of recollection of past lives, the direct knowledge of the far-reaching knowledge of the devas, and the direct knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: Yathāyoganti yaṃ yaṃ yassa puggalassa visadatāya yujjati, tathā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: yathāyogam ti yam yam yassa puggalassa visada tāya yujjati tathā yojetabbam
translated: “As appropriate” is that which should be applied in the case of any person in accordance with his clarity.🔽“Discussion that occurs because of questioning” is said to be “questioning” .

original: Paripucchāhetu pavattā kathā paripucchāti vuttāti āha “pucchāya…pe… paripucchāti vuttā”ti.
analyzed: paripucchā hetu pavattā kathā paripucchā ati vuttā ati āha pucchāyape paripucchā ati vuttā ati
translated: “Discussion that occurs because of questioning” is said to be “questioning” .

original: Tehīti maggehi. Paṭilābho nāma pubbayogasampattiyā atthādivisayassa sammohassa samucchindanaṃ,
analyzed: tehi iti maggehi paṭilābhaḥ nāma pubba yoga sampattiyāḥ attha ādi visayassa sammohassa samucchindanaṃ
translated: ‘By those’: by the paths. ‘Attainment’ is the severing of the delusion about the meaning of the four noble truths, etc., which comes about through the possession of previous practice.

original: taṃ pana maggakiccamevāti āha “so lokuttaro”ti. Atthādīnaṃ pabhedato sallakkhaṇavibhāvanavavatthāpanā
analyzed: tam pana magga kiccam evā ti āha saḥ lokuttaraḥ ti attha ādīnam pabhedataḥ sat lakkhaṇa vibhāvana vavatthāpanā
translated: But that is the function of the path itself, so it is said: ‘That is supramundane.’ The ‘analysis’ of the four noble truths, etc., is the discerning, the distinguishing, the defining,

original: yathārahaṃ parittakusalamahākiriyacittavasena hotīti vuttaṃ “pabhedo kāmāvacaro”ti.
analyzed: yathāraham paritta kusala mahā kiriya citta vasena hoti iti vuttam
translated: according to what is proper, by means of the limited wholesome consciousnesses and the great functional consciousnesses. That is why it is said: ‘The analysis is of the sense sphere.’

original: Yathā pubbayogo adhigamassa balavapaccayo sabhāvahetubhāvato, na tathā pabhedassa
analyzed: yathā pubba yogaḥ adhigamassa balava paccayaḥ sabhāva hetu bhāvataḥ na tathā pabhedassa
translated: The previous practice is a powerful condition for the attainment because it is a natural condition. But the analysis is not so.

original: asabhāvahetutāya, paramparapaccayatāya cāti adhippāyo. Pariyattiādīnaṃ pabhedassa
analyzed: asabhāva hetu tāya parampara paccaya tāya ca ati adhippāyaḥ pariyatti ādīnam pabhedassa
translated: The intention is that it is not a natural condition and it is a condition by way of a roundabout condition. The analysis of the learning, etc.,

original: balavapaccayatāya, adhigamassa ca tadabhāve eseva nayo. Tatthāti nimittatthe bhummaṃ,
analyzed: balava paccaya tāya adhigamassa ca tad abhāve esa iva nayaḥ tattha ati nimitta atthe bhummam
translated: is a powerful condition for the attainment. And in the absence of that, the same method applies. ‘There’ is a locative of cause.

original: tāsu pariyattisavanaparipucchāsu nimittabhūtāsūti attho. Yaṃ vuttaṃ hotīti “etesu
analyzed: tāsu pariyatti savana paripucchāsu nimitta bhūtāsu iti atthaḥ yat vuttam hoti iti etesu
translated: The meaning is: ‘among those, the learning, the hearing, and the questioning, which are the causes.’ What was said?

original: panā”tiādinā aṭṭhakathāvacanena yaṃ atthajātaṃ vuttaṃ hoti. Taṃ dassentoti taṃ niddhāretvā🔽dassento. “Pubbayogādhigamā”ti vatvā “dvepī”ti vacanaṃ adhigamasahitoyeva pubbayogo
analyzed: pana ati ādinā aṭṭhakathā vacanena yam attha jātam vuttam hoti tam dassento ti tam niddhāretvā  dassento pubba yoga adhigamā ti vatvā dve pi iti vacanam adhigama sahitaḥ yā iva pubba yogaḥ
translated: and so on. “Pointing out that” means pointing out that matter which is stated in the commentary beginning with the words “The prior effort and the attainment.”🔽After saying “The prior effort and the attainment,” the words “the two” are used in order to show that the prior effort is a condition for the distinction only when it is accompanied by the attainment, not by itself.

original: pabhedassa balavapaccayo, na kevaloti dassanatthaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “dvepi
analyzed: pabhedassa balava paccayaḥ na kevalaḥ ti dassana attham tena vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam dve pi
translated: Therefore it is said in the commentary: “The two together.”

original: ekato hutvā”ti. “Dvepi visadakāraṇā”ti vutte pubbayogassāpi visadakāraṇattaṃ labbhatevāti
analyzed: ekatas hutvā iti dve api visada kāraṇā ati vutte pubba yogassa api visada kāraṇa ttam labbhateva āti
translated: When it is said that “the two are the cause for the distinction,” it follows that the prior effort is also the cause for the distinction.

original: āha “dvepi visadakāraṇāti…pe… vutta”nti.
analyzed: āha dve pi vuttan ti
translated: Therefore it is said: “The two are the cause for the distinction. … are stated.”

original: Saṅgahavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Saccavārādivaṇṇanā🔽719. Kālattayepīti atītādīsu tīsupi kālesu. Hetuphaladhammā hetūnaṃ phalabhūtā dhammā,
analyzed: saṅgaha vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā          kāla ttaye pi iti atīta ādīsu tīsu pi kālesu hetu phala dhammāḥ hetūnam phala bhūtāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: The explanation of the section on inclusion is finished.🔽The explanation of the section on the three truths, etc.🔽In the three times: in the past, etc., the three times. The states that are causes and effects are the states that are the effects of the causes.

original: paccayanibbattāti attho. Tesañca hetudhammāti tesaṃ hetuphalānaṃ paccayanibbattānaṃ
analyzed: paccaya nibbattā ti atthaḥ tesam ca hetu dhammā ti tesam hetu phalānam paccaya nibbattānam
translated: The meaning is: “are produced by conditions.” And the states that are causes of those: the states that are the causes of those states that are produced by conditions,

original: hetubhūtā dhammā “dhammā”ti vuttāti yojanā. Vineyyavasenāti tathāvinetabbapuggalajjhāsayavasena.
analyzed: hetu bhūtāḥ dhammāḥ dhammā iti vuttā ati yojanā vineyya vasena āti tathā vinetabba puggala jjhāsaya vasena
translated: “According to the disciples”: according to the inclinations of the persons to be trained.🔽“Arisen, arisen,” etc., is not said.

original: Uppannā samuppannātiādi na vuttanti uppannā samuppannā uṭṭhitā samuṭṭhitā paccuppannātiādi🔽na vuttaṃ ekantapaccuppannasseva saṅgāhakattā. Taṃnibbattakāti tesaṃ atthabhāvena🔽vuttānaṃ nipphādakā. Dhammāti vuttā dhammabhāvena kathitā.
analyzed: uppannā samuppannā itiādi na vuttanti uppannā samuppannā uṭṭhitā samuṭṭhitā paccuppannā itiādi  na vuttam ekanta paccuppannassa iva saṅgāhaka ttā tad nibbattakā ti tesam attha bhāvena  vuttānam nipphādakā dhammā ti vuttā dhamma bhāvena kathitā
translated: “Arisen, arisen,” “occurred, occurred,” “present, present,” etc., is not said because only the present is included.🔽“Produced by them”: produced by those states that are called “states” and are mentioned as having the nature of states.

original: Saccavārādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sacca vāra ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Truths, etc., is ended.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suttantabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Suttantabhajanīya is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽725. Sāmaññena vatvā visesena avuttattāti “tesaṃ vipāke”ti yathāvuttakusalavipākatādisāmaññena
analyzed: sāmaññena vatvā visesena a vutta ttā ti tesam vipāka iti yathā vutta kusala vipāka tā ādi sāmaññena
translated: The explanation of the Abhidhammabhajanīya🔽“In general” : after stating in general the profitable result, etc., of the profitable, etc.,🔽he did not state it in particular as “with root-cause” and “without root-cause,” etc.,

original: vatvā sahetukāhetukādivisesena avuttattā, sarūpena niddhāretvā avuttattāti attho.
analyzed: vatvā sa hetuka ahetuka ādi visesena a vutta ttā sarūpena niddhāretvā a vutta ttā ati attho
translated: the meaning is, he did not state it by specifying it in its individual essence.🔽“Because they are not results”: because they are not states that are results.

original: Avipākattāti avipākadhammattā. Yadi evanti paccayabhāvato labbhamānopi dhammabhāvo
analyzed: avipāka ttā ti avipāka dhamma ttā yadi evam ti paccaya bhāvataḥ labbhamānaḥ api dhamma bhāvaḥ
translated: “If that is so” : although the nature of states is obtained as a condition,

original: avipākadhammatāya kiriyānaṃ yadi na vutto, evaṃ sati. Satipi paccayuppannabhāve avipākabhāvato
analyzed: avipāka dhamma tāya kiriyānam yadi na vuttaḥ evam sati sati api paccayuppanna bhāve avipāka bhāvato
translated: If the state of being a result is not stated of the functional because of its being a state not to be experienced as result, then the state of being a state of being is not to be stated of it either, because of its not being a state to be experienced as result.

original: atthabhāvopi na vattabbo. Tenāha “vipākā na hontīti atthabhāvo ca na vattabbo”ti.
analyzed: attha bhāvaḥ api na vattabbo tena āha vipākāḥ na honti iti attha bhāvaḥ ca na vattabbo ti
translated: That is why he says: “The state of being a state of being is not to be stated” .

original: Evañceti yadi paccayuppannattā kiriyānaṃ atthabhāvo vutto. Nappaṭisiddho icchitovāti
analyzed: evam ca iti yadi paccaya uppanna ttā kiriyānaṃ attha bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ na paṭisiddhaḥ icchitaḥ uvā ti
translated: If, in this way, the state of being a state of being of the functional is stated because of its being present, then the state of being a state of being of the resultant is also stated because of its being present.🔽The meaning is: “The state of being a state of being is not denied, it is intended.”🔽If it is so, why is it not stated? He says: “But the state of being a result” , and so on.

original: attho. Yadi evaṃ kasmā na vuttoti āha “vipākassa panā”tiādi. Tesanti kusalākusalānaṃ,🔽vipākakiriyadhammānañca. Atthadhammatāti vuttanayena labbhamānopi yathākkamaṃ atthabhāvo,
analyzed: atthaḥ yadi evam kasmā na vuttaḥ ti āha vipākassa pana atiādi tesan ti kusala akusalānam  vipāka kiriya dhammānam ca attha dhamma tā ti vutta nayena labbhamānaḥ api yathākkamam attha bhāvaḥ
translated: The profitable and unprofitable are “those” .🔽The resultant and functional dhammas are “those” .🔽The state of being a state of being and the state of being a dhamma, though obtainable in the way stated, are not stated.🔽The state of being a condition and the distinction of presence are to be brought to presence together with the result.

original: dhammabhāvo ca na vutto. Paccayabhāvaṃ sattivisesaṃ sanipphādetabbatanti padattayenāpi
analyzed: dhamma bhāvaḥ ca na vuttaḥ paccaya bhāvam satti visesam sa nipphādetabba tat ti padattayena api
translated: He says only the state of being a result, taking the word “state” as a collective.

original: vipākadhammatamevāha. Sā hi vipākānaṃ hetubhāvato paccayabhāvo, taduppādanasamatthatāya
analyzed: vipāka dhammatam eva āha sā hi vipākānam hetu bhāvataḥ paccaya bhāvaḥ tad uppādana samattha tāya
translated: For that is the state of being a condition of results because of its being their cause. It is a distinction of presence because of its being able to produce them.

original: sattiviseso, tehi sagabbhā viya hotīti “sanipphādetabbatā”ti ca vuccati. Taṃ passantī
analyzed: satti visesaḥ tehi sa gabbhā viya hoti iti sa nipphādetabba tā ati ca vuccati tam passantī
translated: It is called “to be brought to presence together with them” because it is as if it were pregnant with them. Seeing that,

original: nipphādakavisesāpi nipphādetabbāpekkhā hoti dhammapaṭisambhidā. Taṃsambandhenāti
analyzed: nipphādaka visesā api nipphādetabba apekkhā hoti dhamma paṭisambhidā tad sambandhena ati
translated: The specific kind of producing is dependent on the kind of product to be produced.🔽By the dependence of the kind of product to be produced.

original: nipphādetabbasambandhena. Dhammapaṭisambhidaṃ vadantena atthapaṭisambhidāpi vuttā.
analyzed: nipphādetabba sambandhena dhamma paṭisambhidam vadantena attha paṭisambhidā api vuttā
translated: When he says “the discrimination of language,” he also says “the discrimination of meaning.”

original: Sabhāvadhamme paññatti sabhāvapaññattīti āha “na sattādipaññattiyā”ti. Sabhāvena, niruttiyeva vā sabhāvapaññattīti vuttāti āha “aviparītapaññattiyā vā”ti.
analyzed: sabhāva dhamme paññatti sabhāva paññatti iti āha na satta ādi paññattiyā ati sabhāvena niruttiyā iva vā sabhāva paññatti iti vuttā ati āha aviparīta paññattiyā vā ti
translated: The designation of the individual essence is the designation of the individual essence. He says, “not by the designation of a being, etc.” The designation of the individual essence is either by the individual essence itself or by the language itself. He says, “or by the undeluded designation.”

original: 746. Vohārabhūmiṃ, adhigamabhūmiñca ekajjhaṃ katvā āha “kāmāvacarā, lokuttarā ca bhūmi bhūmī”ti. Cittuppādā vā pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato bhūmi.
analyzed: vohāra bhūmim adhigama bhūmiñca ekajjham katvā āha kāmāvacarā lokuttarā ca bhūmi bhūmi iti cittuppādāḥ vā pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ bhūmi
translated: The plane of usage and the plane of attainment are taken together and he says, “the plane is the plane of the sense-desire and form- less worlds and the supramundane plane.” Or the plane is the plane of the arising of consciousness because it is the basis for occurrence.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhamma basket is finished.

original: 3. Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the questioner

original: 747. Sabbañāṇārammaṇatāyāti paṭisambhidāpaṭisambhidāñāṇārammaṇatāya. “Suttantabhājanīye
analyzed: sabbañāṇa ārammaṇa tāya ati paṭisambhidā paṭisambhidā ñāṇa ārammaṇa tāya suttanta bhājanīye
translated: By having all-knowledge as its object: by having as its object the knowledge of the discrimination of the Patisambhidā.

original: pana…pe… siyā”ti idaṃ abhidhammabhājanīyena virujjhati, tassa vā sāvasesadesanatā
analyzed: siyā iti idam abhidhamma bhājanīyena virujjhati tassa vā sa avasesa desanā tā
translated: But in the Suttanta basket, etc., it is said, “it may be.” This contradicts the Abhidhamma basket, or it shows that the teaching there is incomplete.

original: āpajjatīti codanaṃ manasi katvā āha “abhidhammabhājanīye”tiādi. Niravasesakathananti🔽asesetvā kathanaṃ. Tena cittuppādasaṅgahite atthe asesetvā desanā idha abhidhammabhājanīyassa
analyzed: āpajjati iti codanam manasi katvā āha abhidhamma bhājanīya itiādi niravasesa kathanan ti  a sesetvā kathanam tena cittuppāda saṅgahite atthe a sesetvā desanā idha abhidhamma bhājanīyassa
translated: “Without remainder” means

original: bhāro, na sabbañeyyadhammeti dasseti. Yathādassitavisayavacanavasenāti dassitappakāravisayassa🔽kathanavasena, dhammatthavasena dassite taṃtaṃcittuppāde tattha dhammaniruttābhilāpena
analyzed: bhāraḥ na sabba ñeyya dhamma iti dasseti yathā dassita visaya vacana vasena ati dassita ppakāra visayassa  kathana vasena dhammattha vasena dassite taṃ taṃ cittuppāde tattha dhamma nirutta abhilāpena
translated: without leaving anything out. So he shows that the burden of the Abhidhamma Pitaka here is the teaching without leaving anything out of the things included in the cognizance that arises, not that of all knowable things.

original: ñāṇassa kathanavasenāti attho. Aññārammaṇataṃ na paṭisedheti atapparabhāvatoti adhippāyo.🔽Na niravasesena kathanaṃ acittuppādapariyāpannassa visayassa akathitattā. Evaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāvisayassāpi
analyzed: ñāṇassa kathana vasena āti atthaḥ añña ārammaṇa tam na paṭisedheti a tad para bhāvataḥ ti adhippāyaḥ  na niravasesena kathanam a cittuppāda pariyāpannassa visayassa a kathita ttā evam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā visayassa api
translated: “By means of the statement of the province as seen” means by means of the teaching of the province in the way seen. The meaning is that it is by means of the teaching of the knowledge of the phrasing of the True Idea in that and that cognizance that arises in regard to the things seen under the headings of ideas and meanings.🔽He does not deny that it has other objects, since it has the second jhana, etc., as its province.🔽It is not a teaching without remainder because the province that is not included in the cognizance is not taught. So too, the teaching of the province of the discrimination of perspicuity is not without remainder.

original: na niravasesena kathananti suttantabhājanīye avisesavacanena sabbañāṇārammaṇataṃyeva
analyzed: na niravasesena suttanta bhājanīye avisesa vacanena
translated: So by the words “in the Suttanta Pitaka” without distinction he shows that it has all knowable things as its object.

original: paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya patiṭṭhāpeti. Tathā tisso paṭisambhidātiādipañhapucchakapāḷiyāpi.
analyzed: paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya patiṭṭhāpeti tathā tisso paṭisambhidā ati ādi pañha pucchaka pāḷiyā api
translated: and he establishes the analytical knowledge of inspired speech in the three kinds of analytical knowledge. And likewise in the passage beginning, “Three kinds of analytical knowledge” , which is a question passage.

original: Tissoti atthadhammapaṭibhānapaṭisambhidā. Niruttipaṭisambhidā hi “parittārammaṇā”teva vuttā.
analyzed: tissaḥ tissaḥ ti attha dhamma paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā nirutti paṭisambhidā hi vuttā
translated: Three kinds: the analytical knowledge of meaning, of Dhamma, and of inspired speech. For the analytical knowledge of language is said to have only a limited object.

original: Yadipi siyā na tassā mahaggatārammaṇatāti sambandho. “Na hi maggo paccayuppanno na
analyzed: yadi api siyā na tassāḥ mahaggata ārammaṇa tā ati sambandho na hi maggaḥ paccaya uppannaḥ na
translated: Although it may be, it is not the object of the higher-than-human-knowledge analytical knowledge.

original: hotī”ti iminā “atthapaṭisambhidā na maggārammaṇā”ti vacanassa yathāvuttatthasādhakataṃ🔽vibhāveti. Tassāti paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya na mahaggatārammaṇatā sambhavati nanu🔽nayaṃ anussarantassāti adhippāyo. Dvepīti “atthapaṭisambhidā na maggārammaṇā, tisso🔽paṭisambhidā siyā parittārammaṇā, siyā mahaggatārammaṇā, siyā appamāṇārammaṇā”ti
analyzed: hoti iti iminā attha paṭisambhidā na magga ārammaṇā ti vacanassa yathā vutta ttha sādhaka taṃ  vibhāveti tassa ati paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya na mahaggata ārammaṇa tā sambhavati nanu  nayam anussarantassa ti adhippāyaḥ dve pi iti attha paṭisambhidā na magga ārammaṇā tisso  paṭisambhidā siyā paritta ārammaṇā siyā mahaggata ārammaṇā siyā appamāṇa ārammaṇā ti
translated: The meaning of the statement “The analytical knowledge of meaning is not the object of the path” is confirmed by the words “The path is not a post-ensuing state” .🔽As to the words “The analytical knowledge of inspired speech is not the object of the higher-than-human-knowledge analytical knowledge,” the intention is this: “It is not possible that the analytical knowledge of inspired speech should have a higher-than-human-knowledge object.”🔽Two passages: “The analytical knowledge of meaning is not the object of the path. The three kinds of analytical knowledge may have a limited object, they may have a measureless object, they may have an immeasurable object” .

original: ca dvepi etā pāḷiyo. Tāsu balavatarāya ṭhānassa, itarāya adhippāyamagganassa ca upāyadassanamukhena
analyzed: ca dve pi etā tāsu balavatarāya ṭhānassa itarāya adhippāya magganassa ca upāya dassana mukhena
translated: These are the two passages. In the first the object is the plane of the path, and in the second the object is the path of intention. The meaning of the words “The analytical knowledge of inspired speech is not the object of the higher-than-human-knowledge analytical knowledge” is confirmed by the words “The path is not a post-ensuing state” .

original: tāsaṃ aññamaññaṃ avirodhaṃ dassetuṃ “kusalākusalānaṃ panā”tiādimāha. “Nippariyāyā
analyzed: tāsam aññamaññam avirodham dassetum kusala akusalānam pana ati ādim āha nippariyāyā
translated: In order to show that there is no contradiction between them, he says, “But as to the profitable and unprofitable, etc.”

original: tattha dhammapaṭisambhidā”ti etena tattha atthapaṭisambhidāya pariyāyabhāvamāha.
analyzed: tattha dhamma paṭisambhidā ti etena tattha attha paṭisambhidāya pariyāya bhāvam āha
translated: Herein, the words “The discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽Similarly, the words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.

original: Tathā vipākakiriyānantiādi yathādhippetassa atthassa visadisūdāharaṇadassanaṃ. Ubhayenapi🔽“atthapaṭisambhidā na maggārammaṇā”ti vacanaṃ suttantanayānugataṃ nippariyāyatthassa
analyzed: tathā vipāka kiriyā ananti ādi yathā adhippetassa atthassa ubhayena api  attha paṭisambhidā na magga ārammaṇā ti vacanam suttanta naya anugatam nippariyāya atthassa
