translated: The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.

original: tattha adhippetattāti dīpeti. Kiñci pana ñāṇantiādi “tisso paṭisambhidā”tiādipāḷiyā🔽samatthakaṃ. Yathādhippetassa atthassa paṭibhānaṃ dīpanaṃ paṭibhānaṃ. Tenāha “ñeyyappakāsanato”ti.
analyzed: tattha adhippeta ttā ti dīpeti kiñci pana ñāṇa ntiādi tisso paṭisambhidā ati ādi pāḷiyā  samatthakam yathā adhippetassa atthassa paṭibhānam dīpanam paṭibhānam tena āha ñeyya ppakāsanataḥ ti
translated: The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.🔽The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is not by way of synonyms in the discrimination of perspicuity.

original: Iti yā “tisso paṭisambhidā”ti pāḷi, tassā balavabhāvavibhāvanena itarāya adhippāyamagganaṃ
analyzed: iti yā tisso paṭisambhidā ati tassā balava bhāva vibhāvanena itarāya adhippāya magganaṃ
translated: The words “The profitable and the unprofitable, etc.,” show that the discrimination of perspicuity is

original: katanti veditabbaṃ. Nippariyāyāti pariyāyarahitā ujukaṃ sarūpeneva pavattā. Nippariyāya…pe…
analyzed: katam ti veditabbam nippariyāyā ati pariyāya rahitāḥ ujukam sarūpena iva pavattāḥ nippariyāya pe
translated: In the literal sense…

original: pavattiyanti ekantikaatthārammaṇaṃ ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā, ñāṇārammaṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāti gahetvā desanāyaṃ.
analyzed: pavattiyanti ekantika attha ārammaṇam ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā ñāṇa ārammaṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti gahetvā desanāyam
translated: … occurrence: knowledge with a meaning as its object is the discernment of meaning, and knowledge with knowledge as its object is the discernment of perspicuity, it being taught in this way by taking them thus.🔽That itself: the sound of another’s speech itself.

original: So evāti parassa abhilāpasaddo eva. Anuvattamānatā cassa niruttipaṭisambhidā paccuppannameva
analyzed: saḥ eva ati parassa abhilāpa saddaḥ eva anuvattamāna tā cassa nirutti paṭisambhidā paccuppannam eva
translated: Its conformity is the discernment of language, which takes only the presently arisen sound as its object.

original: saddaṃ ārammaṇaṃ karontī, saddaṃ sutvā “ayaṃ sabhāvanirutti, ayaṃ na sabhāvaniruttī”ti
analyzed: saddam ārammaṇam karontī saddam sutvā ayam sabhāva nirutti ayam na sabhāva nirutti iti
translated: Having heard the sound, it knows “This is the natural language, this is not the natural language,”

original: jānantīti ca ādivacanavasena veditabbo.🔽Pañhapucchakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jānanti iti ca ādivacana vasena veditabbaḥ  pañha pucchaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: and so on.🔽The commentary on the questions is ended.

original: Paṭisambhidāvibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭisambhidā vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Discrimination of States is ended.

original: 16. Ñāṇavibhaṅgo
analyzed: ña aṇ vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Description of Knowledge

original: 1. Ekakamātikādivaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the First Section in the Single Triad

original: 751. Sampayuttānaṃ nissayapaccayatāya, ārammaṇassa pavattiṭṭhānatāya okāsaṭṭho veditabbo.
analyzed: sampayuttānam nissaya paccaya tāya ārammaṇassa pavatti ṭṭhāna tāya okāsaṭṭhaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning of “place” should be understood as the condition being of the nature of support for the conascent states, and as the object’s being the basis for the occurrence of the object-concomitant states.

original: Nahetādīti ādi-saddena “ahetukā”tiādikaṃ sabbaṃ ekavidhena ñāṇavatthuṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: na heta ādi iti ādi saddena ahetuka ati ādikam sabbam ekavidhena ñāṇa vatthum saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “With non-causation, etc., as the first” : the word “etc.” includes all the other terms such as “without cause” as a single field of knowledge.

original: Ekaṃ nahetūti nahetutāya ekaṃ pañcaviññāṇaṃ nahetūti vuttā tesaṃ nahetutā. Ekantāhetubhāvena
analyzed: ekam na hetu uti na hetutāya ekam pañcaviññāṇam na hetu uti vuttā tesam na hetutā ekanta a hetu bhāvena
translated: “One is non-causation”: the single field of knowledge called “non-causation” is the five-sense-door-adverting consciousness, which is called “non-causation” because it is non-causation. For it is of one kind in the sense that it is exclusively non-causation.🔽“Another”: without cause, etc.

original: hi te ekappakārāvāti. Aññampīti ahetukādi. Avitathasāmaññayuttanti teneva ahetukatādinā🔽yathābhūtena samānabhāvena yuttaṃ. Ñāṇārammaṇanti ñāṇassa ārammaṇaṃ yathāvuttapañcaviññāṇādi.
analyzed: hi te eka ppakārau āti aññam pi iti ahetuka ādi avitatha sāmañña yuttanti tena iva ahetuka tā ādinā  yathābhūtena samāna bhāvena yuttam ñāṇa ārammaṇanti ñāṇassa ārammaṇam yathā vutta pañcaviññāṇa ādi
translated: “Conjoined with the commonality of non-falseness”: conjoined with the commonality of being as it really is in the sense of being without cause, etc.🔽“The object of knowledge”: the object of knowledge is the five-sense-door-adverting consciousness, etc., as already described.

original: Vatthuvibhāvanāti pañcaviññāṇādikassa ñāṇavatthussa yathāvuttavisesena vibhāvanā pakāsanā paññā.
analyzed: vatthu vibhāvanā ti pañca viññāṇa ādikassa ñāṇa vatthussa yathā vutta visesena vibhāvanā pakāsanā paññā
translated: “The analysis of the field”: the knowledge that is the analysis, the demonstration, of the field of knowledge, the five-sense-door-adverting consciousness, etc., according to the distinctions already described.🔽“The last two lines”: of the stanza “Knowledge that reveals the meaning, knowledge that has the meaning revealed” .

original: Osānadukassāti “atthajāpikā paññā, jāpitatthā paññā”ti imassa dukassa. Dukamātikā dhammasaṅgaṇiyaṃ vuttadukamātikāti āha “dukamātikaṃ anissāyā”ti.
analyzed: osāna dukassa ati attha jāpikā paññā jāpita atthā paññā ati imassa dukassa duka mātikā dhammasaṅgaṇiyam vutta duka mātikā ti āha duka mātikam a nissāya ati
translated: “The two lines of the stanza”: the two lines of the stanza given in the Dhammahadaya as the basis for the analysis of the knowledge aggregates in the Dhammasangani.

original: “Cintāmayā paññā”tiādikā tikamātikaṃ anissāya vuttāti āha “evaṃ tikānurūpehīti etthāpi
analyzed: cintā mayā paññāti ādikā tika mātikam a nissāya vuttā iti āha evam tika anurūpehi iti ettha api
translated: “The three lines of the stanza”: the three lines of the stanza beginning “Knowledge that is thought out” .

original: daṭṭhabba”nti. Yadipi jāpa-saddo byattavacane, mānase ca pavattati, jananatthepi
analyzed: daṭṭhabbanti yadi pi jāpa saddaḥ byatta vacane mānase ca pavattati janana atthe pi
translated: and should be seen as such. Although the word jāpa is used in the sense of speaking and thinking,

original: pana daṭṭhabboti dassento āha “anekatthattā dhātusaddāna”ntiādi. Kusalapaññā vipākasaṅkhātassa,🔽kiriyapaññā parikammādibhūtā attanā nibbattetabbaphalasaṅkhātassa atthassa nibbattanato🔽atthajāpikāti vuttāti āha “atthajāpikā kāraṇagatā paññā”ti. Vipākapaññā, kiriyapaññā
analyzed: pana daṭṭhabbaḥ iti dassentaḥ āha aneka attha ttā dhātu saddānaṃ ti ādi kusala paññā vipāka saṅkhātassa  kiriya paññā parikamma ādi bhūtā attanā nibbattetabba phala saṅkhātassa atthassa nibbattanato  attha jāpikā iti vuttā iti āha attha jāpikā kāraṇa gatā paññā ati vipāka paññā kiriya paññā
translated: he shows that it should be seen in the sense of producing, saying “because of the many meanings of the words of the Dhamma.”🔽The wholesome understanding is called “producing the meaning” because it produces the meaning called the fruit to be produced by itself, which is called the result of kamma.

original: ca sahajātādipaccayavasena taṃtaṃvipākādiatthaṃ jāpeti janetīti āha “jāpito janito🔽attho etissāti jāpitatthā”ti. Satipi sahajātānaṃ paccayabhāve vipākakiriyapaññā na
analyzed: ca sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena taṃ taṃ vipāka ādi attham jāpeti janeti iti āha jāpitaḥ janitaḥ  atthaḥ etissa ati jāpita atthā ati sati pi sahajātānam paccaya bhāve vipāka kiriya paññā na
translated: The kamma-resultant understanding and the functional understanding produce the meaning of the respective result, etc., by way of the condition of conascence, etc. Therefore it is said: “The understanding that is the cause is the understanding that produces the meaning.”

original: kusalā viya vipākānaṃ nippariyāyena kāraṇavohāraṃ labhatīti āha “kāraṇapaññāsadisī”ti.
analyzed: kusalāḥ viya vipākānam nippariyāyena kāraṇa vohāram labhati iti āha kāraṇa paññā sadisī iti
translated: Although the conascent states are a condition, the kamma-resultant and functional understandings do not obtain the designation of cause in the primary sense, as do the wholesome states. Therefore it is said: “similar to the cause-understanding.”

original: Vibhāvanatthena paññā ārammaṇaṃ viya sampayuttepi pakāsetiyevāti vuttaṃ “phalappakāsanabhūtā”ti.
analyzed: vibhāvana atthena paññā ārammaṇam viya sampayutte pi vuttam phala pakāsana bhūtā ti
translated: Because of the meaning of manifestation, understanding manifests the associated states as well as the object. Therefore it is said: “it is the manifestation of the fruit.”

original: Yato sā ālokobhāsapajjotapariyāyehi vibhāvitā.
analyzed: yatas sā āloka ubhāsa pajjota pariyāyehi vibhāvitā
translated: and it is illuminated by the terms “light,” “manifestation,” “flame,” and so on.

original: 10. Dasakamātikāvaṇṇanā🔽760. “Jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ. Atītampi🔽addhānaṃ jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ.
analyzed: dasaka mātikā vaṇṇanā  jāti paccayā jarā maraṇanti ñāṇam asati jātiyā natthi jarā maraṇanti ñāṇam atītam pi  addhānam jāti paccayā jarā maraṇanti ñāṇam asati jātiyā natthi jarā maraṇanti ñāṇam
translated: The tenfold analysis🔽“Knowledge that aging-and-death has birth as its condition, knowledge that without birth as condition aging-and-death does not occur, knowledge that in the past too aging-and-death had birth as its condition, knowledge that without birth as condition aging-and-death did not occur,

original: Anāgatampi addhānaṃ jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti
analyzed: anāgatam pi addhānam jāti paccayā jarā maraṇanti ñāṇam asati jātiyā natthi jarā maraṇanti
translated: knowledge that in the future too aging-and-death will have birth as its condition, knowledge that without birth as condition aging-and-death will not occur,

original: ñāṇaṃ. Yampissa taṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ, tampi khayadhammaṃ vayadhammaṃ virāgadhammaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇam yam pi ssa tam dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam tam pi khaya dhammam vaya dhammam virāga dhammam
translated: knowledge that the knowledge of the stability of dhammas is subject to destruction, subject to vanishing, subject to fading away, subject to cessation, knowledge that the same applies to the conditionality of formations, etc., down to:

original: nirodhadhammanti ñāṇaṃ. Bhavapaccayā…pe… avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā…pe… nirodhadhamma”nti
analyzed: nirodha dhammanti ñāṇam bhava paccaya āpe avijjā paccayā saṅkhāra āpe nirodha dhammanti
translated: knowledge that the knowledge of the stability of dhammas is subject to destruction, subject to vanishing, subject to fading away, subject to cessation.”

original: evamāgatāni sattasattati ñāṇāni. “Jarāmaraṇe ñāṇaṃ, jarāmaraṇasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, jarāmaraṇanirodhe
analyzed: evam āgatāni satta sattati ñāṇāni jarā maraṇe ñāṇam jarā maraṇa samudaye ñāṇam jarā maraṇa nirodhe
translated: These are the seventy-seven kinds of knowledge. “Knowledge of aging-and-death, knowledge of the origination of aging-and-death, knowledge of the cessation of aging-and-death,

original: ñāṇaṃ, jarāmaraṇanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ. Jātiyā ñāṇaṃ…pe… saṅkhāresu ñāṇaṃ…pe…
analyzed: ñāṇam jarā maraṇa nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇam jātiyā saṅkhāresu
translated: knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of aging-and-death; knowledge of birth … of formations …

original: paṭipadāya ñāṇa”nti evamāgatāni catucattārīsaṃ ñāṇāni. Sutamayañāṇādīni anāvaraṇañāṇapariyosānāni🔽paṭisambhidāmagge āgatāni tesattati ñāṇāni. Tenāha “tesattati pana…pe… na saṃyuttake”ti.
analyzed: paṭipadāya ñāṇanti evam āgatāni catucattārīsam ñāṇāni suta maya ñāṇa ādīni anāvaraṇa ñāṇa pariyosānāni  paṭisambhidā magge āgatāni tesattati ñāṇāni tena āha tesattati panape na saṃyuttaka iti
translated: The forty-four kinds of knowledge beginning with that of the heard-prop- erty of knowledge and ending with unobstructed knowledge are given in the Patisambhidāmagga.🔽The seventy-seven kinds of knowledge beginning with that of the heard-property of knowledge and ending with unobstructed knowledge are given in the Saṃyutta Nikāya.

original: “Saṃyuttake”ti vā idaṃ “sattasattati ñāṇānī”ti iminā sambandhitabbaṃ, na “tesattatī”ti
analyzed: saṃyuttakā iti vā idam satta sattati ñāṇāni iti iminā sambandhitabbam na tesattati iti
translated: “Seventy-seven” should be connected with “kinds of knowledge” and not with “forty-four.”

original: iminā. Aññattha nikkhepakaṇḍādīsu. Yathā sammāpaṭivedhābhāvato micchāñāṇādi thusarāsimhi
analyzed: iminā aññattha nikkhepa kaṇḍa ādīsu yathā sammā paṭivedha abhāvataḥ micchā ñāṇa ādi thusa rāsimhi
translated: In other places, such as the Nikkhepa Kanda of the Dhammasaṃgaṇī,

original: nikhātakhāṇuko viya ārammaṇe cañcalaṃ hoti, na evaṃ hoti yathābhūtāvabodhakaṃ ñāṇanti
analyzed: nikhāta khāṇukaḥ viya ārammaṇe cañcalam hoti na evam hoti yathā bhūta avabodhakam
translated: it is like a ploughshare thrown into a heap of chaff because it does not penetrate correctly. It is not so with knowledge that understands as it really is.

original: āha “yāthāvapaṭivedhato sayañca akampiya”nti. Adhibalakaraṇaṃ upatthambhananti taṃ
analyzed: āha yāthāva paṭivedhataḥ adhi bala karaṇam tam
translated: Therefore it is said: “Because of penetration according to actuality, it is unshakable by itself” .🔽“Making strong” is “supporting.”

original: puggale āropento āha “puggalañca…pe… karotī”ti. Visabhāgadhammesu vā akampiyattho,
analyzed: puggale āropentaḥ āha puggalañcape karoti iti visabhāga dhammesu vā akampiya tthaḥ
translated: Referring to a person, he says: “And it makes a person … strong.”

original: sabhāgadhammesu upatthambhanattho veditabbo.
analyzed: sabhāga dhammesu upatthambhana atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: Or the meaning of “unshakable by itself” should be understood in the case of dissimilar states, and the meaning of “supporting” in the case of similar states.

original: Abhimukhaṃ gacchantīti “upagacchantī”ti padassa atthavacanaṃ. Upagamanañcettha sabbaññutāya🔽paṭijānanamevāti vuttaṃ “paṭijānanavasenā”ti. Aṭṭha vā parisā upasaṅkamantīti etthāpi
analyzed: abhimukham gacchanti iti upagacchanti iti padassa attha vacanam upagamanam ca ittha sabbaññutāya  paṭijānanam eva ati vuttam paṭijānana vasena ati aṭṭha vā parisāḥ upasaṅkamanti iti ettha api
translated: “Approaching” is the meaning of the word “approaching” . Herein, “approaching” is the declaration of omniscience.🔽“By the declaration” means by the declaration of omniscience.

original: paṭijānanavasena sabbaññutanti yojetabbaṃ. Aṭṭhasu parisāsu dassitaakampiyañāṇayuttoti sambandho.
analyzed: paṭijānana vasena sabbaññu tanti yojetabbam aṭṭhasu parisāsu dassita akampiya ñāṇa yuttaḥ ti sambandho
translated: “Approaching the eight assemblies” means that the connection is with the knowledge shown in the eight assemblies, which is endowed with the declaration of omniscience.

original: Phalasampattipavattīti sappurisūpanissayādīnaṃ kāraṇasampattīnaṃ phalabhūtāya patirūpadesavāsaattasammāpaṇidhiādisampattiyā
analyzed: phala sampatti pavattī iti sappurisa upanissaya ādīnam kāraṇa sampattīnam phala bhūtāya patirūpa desa vāsa atta sammāpaṇidhi ādi sampattiyā
translated: “The occurrence of the success in the attainment of the fruit” means the occurrence of the success in the attainment of the fruit, which is the success in the proper dwelling in a suitable place, in the right aspiration, etc., that is the cause of the success in the support of good people, etc.

original: pavattanaṃ. Ādi-saddena suttasesā saṅgahitā. Tattha sappurisūpanissayādike. Kasmā
analyzed: ādi saddena sutta sesā saṅgahitā tattha sappurisa upanissaya ādike kasmā
translated: The rest of the sutta is included by the word “etc.” Herein, in the support of good people, etc.,

original: panettha samāne atthakicce paṭivedhañāṇassa viya desanāñāṇassāpi yāva arahattamaggā
analyzed: pana ittha samāne attha kicce paṭivedha ñāṇassa viya desanā ñāṇassa api yāva arahatta maggā
translated: why is it that, in the case of the knowledge of teaching, as in the case of the knowledge of penetration, its arising up to the path of arahantship is not stated, although the function is the same?

original: uppajjamānatā na vuttāti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “paṭivedhaniṭṭhattā”tiādi. Paṭivedhaniṭṭhattāti
analyzed: uppajjamāna tā na vuttā iti codanam sandhāya āha paṭivedha niṭṭha ttā atiādi paṭivedha niṭṭha ttā iti
translated: The answer is given in order to remove this doubt: “Because of the completion of penetration” .

original: paṭivedhassa pariyosānattā. Tenāti paṭivedhapariyosānabhūtena arahattamaggañāṇena.
analyzed: paṭivedhassa pariyosāna ttā tena ati paṭivedha pariyosāna bhūtena arahatta magga ñāṇena
translated: because the penetration has reached its end. ‘By that’: by the knowledge of the path of arahatship, which is the end of penetration.

original: Tadadhigamena hi sampattasakalasabbaññuguṇo bhagavā anantapaṭibhāno anupamāya buddhalīḷāya🔽dhammaṃ desetuṃ samattho ahosi. “Paṭiladdhassāpī”ti iminā sabbathā labhāpakassa paṭivedhānurūpatā
analyzed: tad adhigamena hi sampatta sakala sabbaññu guṇaḥ bhagavā ananta paṭibhānaḥ anupamāya buddha līḷāya  dhammam desetum samatthaḥ ahosi paṭiladdhassa api iti iminā sabbathā labhāpakassa paṭivedha anurūpa tā
translated: For when he had attained that, the Blessed One, who had all the qualities of omniscience, with his infinite radiance,🔽was able to teach the Dhamma with the incomparable play of a Buddha. ‘Even though he had already attained’: this shows that the knowledge of teaching is not to be undertaken in all ways by one who is engaged in penetration,

original: desanāñāṇassa asakkuṇeyyāti dīpeti, tena ca paṭivedhanamattenettha atthasiddhīti
analyzed: desanā ñāṇassa a sakkuṇeyya ati dīpeti tena ca paṭivedhana mattena ittha attha siddhi iti
translated: and that the meaning is established here only by the penetration.

original: dasseti. Tenāha “desanāñāṇassā”tiādi.🔽Hānabhāgiyadhammanti vā hānabhāgiyabhāvassa kāraṇaṃ. Kāmasahagatasaññādidhammanti🔽kāmaguṇārammaṇaṃ saññāmanasikārādiṃ. Pubbeva katābhisaṅkhārādinti “cande vā sūriye
analyzed: dasseti tena āha desanā ñāṇassa atiādi  hāna bhāgiya dhammanti vā hāna bhāgiya bhāvassa kāraṇam kāma sahagata saññā ādi dhammanti  kāma guṇa ārammaṇam saññā manasikāra ādim pubbe eva kata abhisaṅkhāra ādim ti cande vā sūriye
translated: Therefore he says: ‘the knowledge of teaching’ and so on.🔽Or ‘ideas partaking of diminution’ is the cause of the state of partaking of diminution. ‘Ideas associated with sense desires’ is perception and attention, etc., with the strands of sensual desire as their object.

original: vā ettakaṃ gate vuṭṭhahissāmī”tiādinā samāpajjanato pubbe pavattacittābhisaṅkhāraparikammādiṃ.
analyzed: vā ettakam gate vuṭṭhahissāmi iti ādinā samāpajjanataḥ pubbe pavatta citta abhisaṅkhāra parikamma ādim
translated: ‘Previous determinations, etc.’ is the preliminary work of the volition and the mental activities that occurred previously to the attainment, such as the determination ‘When the moon or the sun has gone so far I shall arise from the attainment.’

original: Tadabhāvaggahaṇenāti kilesāvaraṇābhāvaggahaṇena. Ṭhitinti atthibhāvaṃ. Tabbiparītāyāti
analyzed: tad abhāva ggahaṇena āti kilesa āvaraṇa abhāva ggahaṇena ṭhitim ti atthi bhāvam tad biparītāya ati
translated: The state of being, the existence.🔽By the opposite of that,🔽by the wrong view “There is no giving” and so on.

original: “natthi dinna”ntiādikāya micchādiṭṭhiyā. Ṭhānābhāvanti appavattiṃ, natthibhāvaṃ vā.
analyzed: natthi dinna nti ādikāya micchādiṭṭhiyāḥ appavattim natthibhāvam vā
translated: The absence of a footing, the non-occurrence, the non-existence.🔽Above, immediately after this discussion of the order of the powers.

original: Uparīti imissā balānaṃ anukkamakathāya upari anantarameva. Vipākāvaraṇābhāvadassanādikassāti
analyzed: upari iti imissā balānaṃ anukkama kathāya upari anantaram eva vipāka āvaraṇa abhāva dassana ādikassa ati
translated: By the demonstration of the absence of the result-obstacle and so on,

original: ādi-saddena kammāvaraṇābhāvadassanaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Itaranti adhigamassa aṭṭhānadassanaṃ.🔽Taṃsahitānaṃ dhātūnanti rāgādisahitānaṃ sabhāvānaṃ. Vemattatā ca tesaṃ paccayavisesasiddhena
analyzed: ādi saddena kamma āvaraṇa abhāva dassanam saṅgaṇhāti itarat ti adhigamassa aṭṭhāna dassanam  tad sahitānam rāga ādi sahitānam sabhāvānam vematta tā ca tesam paccaya visesa siddhena
translated: by the word “and so on” the demonstration of the absence of the kamma-obstacle is included. The other, the demonstration of the footing of the realization.🔽The elements together with that, the individual essences together with greed and so on. And the state of being deluded should be understood by the distinction of the different stages that are accomplished by the distinction of the different conditions.

original: avatthādivisesena veditabbā. Cariyāhetūnanti rāgādicariyākāraṇabhūtānaṃ dhammānaṃ.
analyzed: avattha ādi visesena veditabbā cariyā hetūnam ti rāga ādi cariyā kāraṇa bhūtānam dhammānam
translated: The reasons for the conduct, the states that are the causes of the conduct of greed and so on.

original: 1. Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Description of the Single Terms

original: 761. Ayaṃ visesoti samānepi nayadvayassa tesaṃ ahetubhāvādidīpane ekassa hetubhāvādipaṭisedhatā,
analyzed: ayam visesaḥ ti samāne pi naya dvayassa tesam ahetu bhāva ādi dīpane ekassa hetu bhāva ādi paṭisedha tā
translated: This is the difference: although the two methods are alike in showing the non-existence of a cause and so on, one denies the existence of a cause and so on,

original: itarassa rāsantarāsaṅgahoti idaṃ nānākaraṇaṃ. Ekāya jātiyāti ādānanikkhepaparicchinnassa
analyzed: itarassa idam nānākaraṇam ekāya jātiyā ati ādāna nikkhepa paricchinnassa
translated: The difference between the two is that the former is a collection of aggregates, while the latter is a collection of aggregates and the life-continuum.🔽‘Of one kind of birth’: of one becoming delimited by the taking up of the next rebirth-linking and the laying down of this life.🔽‘Because of the continuity of destiny’: because of the continuity of the destiny.

original: ekassa bhavassa. Tadantogadhatāyāti gatiantogadhatāya. Tattha tatthāti taṃtaṃgaticutibhavesu.
analyzed: ekassa bhavassa tad antogadha tāya ati gati antogadha tāya tattha tattha ati taṃ taṃ gati cuti bhavesu
translated: ‘In this and that’: in this and that destiny, death, and rebirth-existence.

original: 762. Tathāti aññadvārārammaṇatāya. Khīrādīnaṃ…pe… vilakkhaṇatāti yathā khīrassa dadhibhāvena,🔽dadhino takkabhāvena vilakkhaṇatāpatti, na evaṃ pañcaviññāṇānaṃ nahetubhāvādito aññassa
analyzed: tathā ti añña dvāra ārammaṇa tāya vilakkhaṇa tā ti yathā khīrassa dadhi bhāvena  dadhinaḥ takka bhāvena vilakkhaṇa tā āpatti na evam pañca viññāṇānam na hetu bhāvāt itas aññassa
translated: ‘In the same way’: by means of a different door and object. The meaning is that, just as milk, etc.,

original: sabhāvāpatti atthīti attho.
analyzed: atthi iti
translated: do not acquire a different individual essence by acquiring the state of curd, etc., so too the five consciousnesses do not acquire a different individual essence by acquiring the state of a cause, etc.

original: 763. Mahattepīti puthuttepi. Bahubhāvavācako hi ayaṃ mahā-saddo “mahājano”tiādīsu
analyzed: mahatte pi iti puthutte pi bahu bhāva vācakaḥ hi ayam mahā saddaḥ mahā janaḥ ti ādīsu
translated: ‘Even though great’: even though separate. For this word mahā is a word for many, as in such passages as ‘a great crowd’ .

original: viya rūpasaṅghāṭassa adhippetattā. Aññathā sabhāvadhammassa kā mahantatā, sukhumatā
analyzed: viya rūpa saṅghāṭassa adhippeta ttā aññathā sabhāva dhammassa kā mahanta tā sukhuma tā
translated: Otherwise, what greatness or subtlety could there be in a real entity?

original: vā. Cakkhuviññāṇassa vacanaṃ katvā vuttattā āha “cakkhupasāde mama vatthumhī”ti.
analyzed: vā cakkhu viññāṇassa vacanam katvā vutta ttā āha cakkhu pasāde mama vatthumhi iti
translated: He said, ‘In my field, the eye faculty,’ because he was speaking of eye consciousness.

original: Issariyaṭṭhānanti issariyapavattanaṭṭhānaṃ. Tathā hi naṃ aññattha bhāvitaṃ vibhāventameva
analyzed: issariya ṭṭhānam ti issariya pavattana ṭṭhānam tathā hi nam aññattha bhāvitam vibhāventam eva
translated: ‘Place of sovereignty’: the place of the exercise of sovereignty. For when it is developed elsewhere it is only as though it were exercised there.

original: tiṭṭhati, aññaviññāṇāni ca tena dinnanayāneva tattha pavattanti, api dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ,
analyzed: tiṭṭhati añña viññāṇāni ca tena dinna nayānā iva tattha pavattanti api dibba cakkhu ñāṇam
translated: And the other kinds of knowledge, such as the knowledge of the divine eye,

original: yato taṃ andhassa na nipphajjati.
analyzed: yatas tam andhassa na nipphajjati
translated: proceed by the same method, since that does not arise in one who is blind.

original: 764. Vavatthitānampīti aññamaññaṃ asaṃkiṇṇānampi. Paṭipāṭiniyamo niyatānupubbikatā. Tenāti “abbokiṇṇā”ti vacanena.
analyzed: vavatthitānam pi iti aññam aññam a saṃkiṇṇānam pi paṭipāṭi niyamaḥ niyata ānupubbika tā tena ati abbokiṇṇā ati vacanena
translated: ‘Even though they are defined’: even though they are not mixed up with each other. ‘Orderly arrangement’: regular succession. ‘By that’: by the words ‘unmixed.’

original: 766. Āvaṭṭanabhāvo āvajjanakiccatā.
analyzed: āvaṭṭana bhāvaḥ āvajjana kicca tā
translated: ‘The function of adverting’: the state of adverting.

original: Tesanti rūpādīnaṃ. Etesañhi rūpādīnaṃ pañcahi viññāṇehi samāgamo. Abhinipatitabbāni
analyzed: tesanti rūpa ādīnam etesam hi rūpa ādīnam pañcahi viññāṇehi samāgamaḥ abhinipatitabbāni
translated: ‘Those’: the visible-data, etc., ‘Their’: the visible-data, etc., ‘meeting with the five kinds of consciousness’: the visible data, etc., should be recognized by the five kinds of consciousness.

original: ālambitabbāni, vijānitabbānīti attho. Tenāha “ārammaṇakaraṇena paṭivijānitabbānī”ti.
analyzed: ālambitabbāni vijānitabbāni iti atthaḥ tena āha ārammaṇa karaṇena paṭivijānitabbāni iti
translated: The meaning is that they should be struck at, should be seized upon, should be discerned. Hence he said ‘by making them objects’ .

original: Kusalākusalacetanāya, taṃsampayuttānañca yathāvuttānaṃ “manopubbaṅgamā…pe… akusalaṃ
analyzed: kusala akusala cetanāya tad sampayuttānam ca yathāvuttānam manaḥ pubbaṅgam āpe akusalam
translated: ‘By profitable and unprofitable choice’: the choice is profitable or unprofitable according as it is associated with non-greed or with greed, etc.,🔽and the visible data, etc., are what should be recognized in the way stated in the passage ‘Mind-preceded, mind-led, mind-made are these phenomena’ .

original: vā”ti evaṃ vuttānaṃ paṭivijānitabbānaṃ paṭivijānananti sambandho. Kammatthe hi etaṃ
analyzed: vā ti evam vuttānam paṭivijānitabbānam paṭivijānanam ti sambandhaḥ kamma atthe hi etam
translated: The construction is: ‘The recognition of those visible data, etc., that should be recognized by profitable and unprofitable choice and by the kinds of choice associated with them.’

original: sāmivacanaṃ. Sahajapubbaṅgamadhammenāti dassanādīhi sahajātaphassādinā pubbaṅgamena
analyzed: sāmi vacanam sahaja pubbaṅgama dhammena ati dassana ādīhi sahajāta phassa ādinā pubbaṅgamena
translated: “With the state that precedes it” means with the state that precedes it by being conascent with contact, etc., and by being the prior-to-last factor in the process.🔽“With the state that precedes it” means with the state that precedes it by being conascent with adverting, etc., and by being the prior-to-last factor in the process. “With a different function” means with a function different from seeing, etc.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from receiving, etc.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from determining, etc.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: āvajjanādinā. Kiccantaranti dassanādikiccato aññaṃ sampaṭicchanādikiccaṃ.
analyzed: āvajjana ādinā dassana ādi kiccataḥ aññam sampaṭicchana ādi kiccam
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: Avipākabhāvena kāraṇena, tena vā saddhiṃ. Aññanti rūpabhāvādiṃ. Bhāsanakaraṇakarāti
analyzed: avipāka bhāvena kāraṇena tena vā saddhim rūpa bhāva ādim bhāsana karaṇa karāti
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: viññattisamuṭṭhāpanavasena pavattakusalākusalacittuppādadhammā. Te eva kāyaṅgavācaṅgaṃ
analyzed: viññatti samuṭṭhāpana vasena pavatta kusala akusala cittuppāda dhammā te eva kāyaṅga vācaṅgam
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: acopetvā pavattā taṃsadisā. Pubbaṅgamapaṭivijānananti pubbaṅgamabhāvena vijānanaṃ🔽manodvārikajavanānaṃ purecarabhāvena gahaṇaṃ. Tatthāti pañcadvāre. “Na paṭisiddha”nti
analyzed: a ca upetvā pavattā taṃsadisā pubbaṅgama paṭivijānanam ti pubbaṅgama bhāvena vijānanam  purecara bhāvena gahaṇam tattha ati pañca dvāre na paṭisiddhanti
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: vatvā svāyamappaṭisedho sāmatthiyaladdhoti dassetuṃ “na kāyakammaṃ…pe… anuññātattā”ti
analyzed: vatvā sāmatthiya laddho ti dassetum na kāya kammaṃpe anuññāta ttā ti
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.🔽“With a different function” means with a function different from the rest.

original: vuttaṃ. “Tathā”ti idaṃ yathā kāyavacīkammapaṭṭhapanaṃ, evaṃ kusalādidhammasamādānampi
analyzed: vuttam tathā ti idam yathā kāya vacī kamma paṭṭhapanam evam kusala ādi dhamma samādānam pi
translated: “With a different function” means with a function different from the

original: natthīti upasaṃharaṇatthaṃ veditabbaṃ. Yadi na bhavato cavati, kathaṃ pañcadvāre
analyzed: natthi iti upasaṃharaṇa attham veditabbam yadi na bhavataḥ cavati katham pañca dvāre
translated: It should be understood that the words “there is no” are stated for the purpose of concluding.🔽If it does not die when it is born, how is it said that there is death in the five doors?🔽He says, “It is not the death of the five doors … because it is the death of the mind door.”

original: cuti vuttāti āha “na pañcadvārika…pe… ataṃdvārikattā”ti. Tassā pāḷiyā. Āpāthamattanti
analyzed: vuttā iti āha na tassā pāḷiyā
translated: In the text.🔽The mere coming into the focus of consciousness, the mere state of being a condition by object.

original: āpāthagamanamattaṃ ārammaṇapaccayabhāvamattaṃ. Aññanti “rūpaṃ nīla”nti evamādidhammavisesaṃ.
analyzed: āpātha gamana mattam ārammaṇa paccaya bhāva mattam aññanti rūpam nīlanti evamādi dhamma visesam
translated: “Another” means a particular state of a phenomenon such as “blue” or “form.”🔽Therefore he says, “the individual essence of a state.”

original: Tenāha “dhammasabhāva”nti. Rūpanti ca na gaṇhātīti rūpārammaṇampi samānaṃ “rūpaṃ
analyzed: tena āha dhamma sabhāvanti ca na gaṇhāti iti rūpa ārammaṇam pi samānam rūpam
translated: And he does not apprehend “form”: although the object is form, he does not apprehend it as “this is form.”

original: nāmeta”nti na gaṇhāti. Tathā cāhu eke “cakkhuviññāṇasamaṅgī nīlaṃ vijānāti, no tu
analyzed: nāma etat ti na gaṇhāti tathā ca āhu eke cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgī nīlam vijānāti no tu
translated: And some say: “One who is endowed with eye-consciousness cognizes blue, but he does not cognize ‘blue.’”

original: nīla”nti. Rūpanīlādiākāro rūpārammaṇarūpādānākārapaññatti. Tajjāpaññatti hesā yathā
analyzed: rūpa nīla ādi ākāraḥ rūpa ārammaṇa rūpa ādāna ākāra paññatti hesā yathā
translated: The mode of apprehension of the object, form, as blue, etc., is the description of the mode of apprehension of the object, form, as “blue,” etc. For this is a description that arises from that,🔽like the description of impermanence, etc. It is superior because it is accompanied by applied and sustained thought.

original: aniccatādi. Sātisayaṃ savitakkasavicārattā. Tato aññanti saddārammaṇato aññaṃ nāmapaññattiārammaṇaṃ,
analyzed: anicca tā ādi sa atisayam sa vitakka sa vicāra ttā tatas aññanti sadda ārammaṇataḥ aññam nāma paññatti ārammaṇam
translated: “Another” means an object described by name, which is different from the object of sound,

original: aññathā sahuppattipaṭisedho na sambhaveyyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: aññathā sahuppatti paṭisedhaḥ na sambhaveyya ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: the intention being that the impossibility of their simultaneous arising could not be established in any other way.

original: Manodvārepīti na pañcadvāreyeva dutiye moghavāre, atha kho manodvārepi. Āvajjanaṃ dvattikkhattuṃ…pe… daṭṭhabbaṃ ekacittakkhaṇikassa āvajjanassa uppattiyaṃ tathā asambhavato.
analyzed: manaḥ dvāre pi iti na dutiye moghavāre atha kho manaḥ dvāre pi āvajjanam dvatti khattuṃpe daṭṭhabbam eka citta khaṇikassa āvajjanassa uppattiyam tathā asambhavato
translated: The adverting should be seen as occurring twenty-eight times, and so on.

original: Tassāti yāthāvakavatthuvibhāvanāya paññāya.
analyzed: tassa ati yāthāvaka vatthu vibhāvanāya paññāya
translated: His: of the understanding that discerns the meaning as it actually is.

original: Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ekaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  duka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section in brief is ended.🔽In the bases: in the meanings of the words.

original: 767. Adhikaraṇesūti padatthesu. Aññatra sabhāvaṃ gahetvāti atthasaddassa tattha pavattanākāradassanaṃ,
analyzed: adhikaraṇesu iti padatthesu aññatra sabhāvam gahetvā ti attha saddassa tattha pavattana ākāra dassanam
translated: Excepting the individual essence: this shows the way in which the word “meaning” occurs there.

original: tena atthasaddassa sabhāvatthataṃ dasseti. Adhikaraṇavasena liṅgaparivattiṃ gacchati.
analyzed: tena attha saddassa sabhāvattha tam dasseti adhikaraṇa vasena liṅga parivattim gacchati
translated: It shows that the word “meaning” has the individual essence as its meaning. It changes its gender according to the base.

original: “Abhidheyyānurūpaṃ liṅgavacanānī”ti hi saddavidū vadanti.
analyzed: abhidheyya anurūpam liṅga vacanāni iti hi vadanti
translated: For those who know grammar say that the gender and number of a word is determined by the meaning it stands for.

original: Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Tikaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  tika niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section in pairs is ended.🔽In the matured: in the accomplished.

original: 768. Paripācitesūti sādhitesu. “Vihitesū”ti ettha duddhādīsu viya bhūtakālatā nādhippetāti
analyzed: paripācitesu iti sādhitesu vihitesu iti ettha duddha ādīsu viya bhūta kāla tā na adhippetā ti
translated: Here the past tense is not intended in the word “developed” as it is in the word “milked” .

original: āha “visayavisesanamattamevā”ti. “Kammaṃ, sippa”nti paññā kāraṇūpacārena vuttāti
analyzed: āha visaya visesana mattam evā ti kammam sippanti paññā kāraṇa upacārena vuttā ti
translated: He says, “merely a distinction of province.” “Kamma” and “craft” are said by way of a cause-metaphor.

original: āha “paññā eva vā…pe… veditabbā”ti.
analyzed: āha paññā eva vāpe veditabbā ati
translated: He says, “Understanding is to be understood as …

original: Kusalaṃ kammaṃ sakaṃ ekantaṃ hitasukhāvahattā. Tappaṭipakkhattā itaraṃ akusalaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: kusalam kammam sakam ekantam hita sukha āvaha ttā tad paṭipakkha ttā itaram akusalam kammam
translated: Good kamma is one’s own because it is the sole cause of welfare and happiness. The opposite of that is bad kamma.

original: nosakaṃ. Saccapaṭivedhānulomanaṃ saccānulomanaṃ vuttanti āha “tappaṭivedhapaccayabhāvenā”ti.
analyzed: nosakam sacca paṭivedha anulomanam sacca anulomanam vuttanti āha tad paṭivedha paccaya bhāvena āti
translated: The conformity of the truths is said to be the conformity with the penetration of the truths. He says, “by way of the condition for the penetration of the truths.”

original: Maggasaccassa anulomanato vā saccānulomikatā, tathā paramatthasaccassa anulomanato.
analyzed: magga saccassa anulomanataḥ vā sacca ānulomika tā tathā paramattha saccassa anulomanataḥ
translated: Or, the conformity with the truths is because of the conformity with the path truth. In the same way, it is the conformity with the ultimate truth.

original: Tenāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “maggasaccassā”tiādi. Paññā vuttā paññāvisaye paññākiccassa🔽dassitattā. “Yogavihitesū”tiādinā vuttabhūminiddeso, “kammassakataṃ saccānulomika”nti
analyzed: tena āha aṭṭhakathā ayam magga saccassa ātiādi paññā vuttā paññā visaye paññā kiccassa  dassita ttā yoga vihitesu iti ādinā vutta bhūmi niddeso kammassakatam sacca ānulomikan ti
translated: Therefore, it is said in the commentary, “of the path truth,” and so on. Understanding is said because the province of understanding is shown by the function of understanding.🔽The description of the plane is said by way of “in what is arranged by yoga,” and so on. The description of the nature is said by way of “one’s own kamma, the conformity with the truths,”

original: vuttasarūpaniddeso, “rūpaṃ anicca”ntiādinā vuttappakāraniddeso ca yathāvuttā…pe…
analyzed: vutta sarūpa niddesaḥ rūpam aniccanti ādinā vutta ppakāra niddeso ca yathā vutta āpe
translated: and the description of the method is said by way of “impermanent is materiality,” and so on. The rest is as already stated. …🔽…

original: niddesā. “Yogavihitesu kammāyatanesu khantiṃ, kammassakataṃ khantiṃ, ‘rūpaṃ anicca’nti
analyzed: niddesāḥ yoga vihitesu kamma āyatanesu khantim kammassakatam khantim rūpam aniccanti
translated: The exposition. “Patience in the fields of action that are well defined, patience in the ownership of one’s action, patience in the impermanence of material form, etc.,”

original: khanti”ntiādinā khantiādipadehi yojetabbā. Olokanaṃ paccakkhakaraṇaṃ. Dhammā olokanaṃ
analyzed: khanti nti ādinā khanti ādi padehi yojetabbāḥ olokanam paccakkhakaraṇam dhammāḥ olokanam
translated: should be construed with the words “patience” and so on. “Seeing” is the making manifest. “The ideas”

original: khamantīti paññāya tadolokanasamatthatamāha.
analyzed: khamanti iti paññāya tadolokana samattha tam āha
translated: are the ideas that are seen. “Patience” means the ability to see them in that way through understanding.

original: 769. Muñcatīti pajahati. Ārabbha-kiriyāya adhiṭṭhānaṃ samaṅgibhāvo, adhikaraṇaṃ paṭṭhapananti āha “muñca…pe… vattuṃ yutta”nti.
analyzed: muñcati iti pajahati ārabbha kiriyāya adhiṭṭhānam samaṅgi bhāvaḥ adhikaraṇam paṭṭhapanam ti āha muñcape vattum yuttam ti
translated: “Gives up” means abandons. “The undertaking of the action of beginning” is the state of being furnished with the basis, the establishment of the legal question. “Gives up” is said with reference to that.

original: 770. Pañcasīladasasīlāni kammavaṭṭekadesabhūtāni sandhāya tesaṃ dhammaṭṭhitiyaṃ samavarodho🔽vutto. Satipi savaneti “idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako pāṇātipātā paṭivirato”tiādinā
analyzed: pañcasīla dasasīlāni kamma vaṭṭeka desa bhūtāni sandhāya tesam dhamma ṭṭhitiyam samavarodhaḥ  vutto sati pi savane ti idha bhikkhave ariya sāvako pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ tiādinā
translated: The restraint of them in the stability of the ideas is said with reference to the five precepts and the ten precepts, which are part of the field of action.🔽“Even though he hears” means that even though he hears it from the Tathāgata in the way beginning, “Here, bhikkhus, a noble disciple abstains from killing living beings” ,

original: tathāgatato savane satipi. Bhikkhuādīnampi taṃ vuttaṃ adhisīlapaññāpanaṃ viya na buddhāveṇikanti.
analyzed: tathāgatato savane sati pi bhikkhu ādīnam pi tam vuttam adhi sīla paññāpanam viya na buddha āveṇikam ti
translated: it is not unique to Buddhas, like the announcement of the higher virtue of bhikkhus and so on.

original: Adhipaññānibbattesūti ṭhapetvā adhipaññaṃ tadaññesu maggaphaladhammesu. Tadadhiṭṭhānesūti tassā adhipaññāya adhiṭṭhānesu vipassanādhammesu.
analyzed: adhipaññā nibbattesu ti ṭhapetvā adhipaññam tad aññesu magga phala dhammesu tad adhiṭṭhānesu ti tassāḥ adhipaññāya adhiṭṭhānesu vipassanā dhammesu
translated: In the higher understanding’s production: in the states of path and fruition except for the higher understanding. In the states that are its support: in the states of insight that are the support for that higher understanding.

original: 771. Apāyuppādanaṃ avaḍḍhinibbattanaṃ. Tasmiṃyeva ṭhāneti tasmiṃyeva khaṇe.
analyzed: apāyuppādanam avaḍḍhinibbattanam tasmiṃ yeva ṭhāne iti tasmiṃ yeva khaṇe
translated: Non-production of death: non-increase of death. In that same place: in that same moment.

original: Tikaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tika niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the explanation of the triad is ended.

original: 4. Catukkaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the explanation of the tetrad

original: 793. Paritassanaṃ parittāso, cittutrāso cāti “na paritassatī”ti padassa “na pattheti na uttasatī”ti atthamāha.🔽796. Ariyasaccesu dhammasaddo “diṭṭhadhammo”tiādīsu viya. Ariyamaggo, tassa ca phalaṃ🔽dhammo yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipanne apāyesu apatamāne dhāretīti. Tattha paññāti tasmiṃ
analyzed: paritassanam parittāsaḥ cittutrāsaḥ ca ati na paritassati iti padassa na pattheti na uttasati iti attham āha  ariya saccesu dhamma saddo diṭṭhadhammaḥ ti ādīsu viya ariya maggo tassa ca phalam  dhammaḥ yathānusiṭṭham paṭipanne apāyesu a patamāne dhāreti iti tattha paññā ati tasmin
translated: Perturbation is perturbation of the mind, fear of the mind. The words “does not tremble” mean “does not long, does not fear.”🔽The word “state” in the phrase “in the noble truths” is like the word “state” in the phrase “one who has seen the state” . The noble path and its fruit

original: ariyamaggaphale nissayabhūte paññā. Tenāha “taṃsahagatā”ti. Aviditaṃ viditaṃ viya
analyzed: ariya magga phale nissaya bhūte paññā tena āha tad sahagatā ati aviditam viditam viya
translated: The state bears the one who practices in accordance with the teaching, preventing his falling into states of loss. Therein understanding: in that noble path and its fruit, which are the support for understanding. Hence it is said “accompanied by that” . Unknown as if known

original: neti ñāpetīti nayo, anumānaṃ, tassa nayanaṃ pavattanaṃ, taṃ pana visuṃyevekaṃ ñāṇuppādananti🔽āsaṅkāya nivattanatthamāha “na añña…pe… viseso”ti. Attano hi adhigamānusārena parādhigatānaṃ
analyzed: na iti ñāpeti iti nayaḥ anumānam tassa nayanam pavattanam tam pana visuṃ yeva ekam ñāṇa uppādanam ti  āsaṅkāya nivattana attham āha na visesaḥ ti attanaḥ hi adhigama anusārena para adhigatānam
translated: “He causes to be known” is the method, the inference, the occurrence of that, and that is a separate production of knowledge.

original: kālattaye maggādīnaṃ pavattiākārānumānaṃ nayanayanaṃ. Anuminanākārameva hissa sandhāya
analyzed: kāla ttaye magga ādīnam pavatti ākāra anumānam naya nayanam anuminana ākāram eva hissa sandhāya
translated: In order to avert the doubt, he says, “No other, etc., distinction.” For the method of inference is the occurrence of the path, etc., in the three times by way of the disciple’s own realization of the path, etc., in conformity with the Master’s realization.🔽And it is said that “the distinction in the occurrence of knowledge” is only the mode of inference,

original: vuttaṃ “ñāṇasseva pavattiviseso”ti. Kāraṇañca nayanayanassa saccesu paccakkhapavattanato.
analyzed: vuttam ñāṇassa iva pavatti visesaḥ ti kāraṇam ca naya nayanassa saccesu paccakkha pavattanato
translated: and the reason is that the method of inference occurs in the truths by way of direct experience.

original: “Tathā”ti iminā yathā maggañāṇato aññāpi “iminā dhammenā”ti vattuṃ yuttaṃ, tathā
analyzed: tathā ti iminā yathā magga ñāṇataḥ aññā api iminā dhammena ati vattum yuttam tathā
translated: “Thus” — by this he concludes the meaning thus: Just as it is proper to say “by this state” even though it is not a knowledge of the path,

original: pakārantarenapi “iminā dhammena ñāṇenā”ti ettha attho yujjatīti imamatthaṃ upasaṃharati.
analyzed: pakāra antarena api iminā dhammena ñāṇena ati ettha atthaḥ yujjati iti imam attham upasaṃharati
translated: so it is proper to take the meaning of “by this knowledge” in the other section also.

original: Tenāti tasmā ñāṇena ñātato sampayogehi nayanayanato. Ñāṇavisayabhāvenāti paṭivedhañāṇassa
analyzed: tena ati tasmā ñāṇena sampayogehi naya nayanataḥ ñāṇa visaya bhāvena ati paṭivedha ñāṇassa
translated: “Therefore” — for that reason, because of what is known by that knowledge and because of the method of inference by way of the associated states,🔽and because of the state of being the object of knowledge by the penetrating knowledge,

original: visayabhāvena. Ñātena paṭividdhena catusaccadhammena, ñāṇasampayogena vā ñātena jānitvā
analyzed: visaya bhāvena ñātena paṭividdhena catu sacca dhammena ñāṇa sampayogena vā ñātena jānitvā
translated: By way of the object: by the four noble truths known and penetrated, or by the known, that is, by the knowledge associated with the truths.

original: ṭhitena maggaphaladhammena.
analyzed: ṭhitena magga phala dhammena
translated: By the established: by the states of the path and fruit.

original: Sabbena sabbanti sabbappakārena sabbaṃ, anavasesanti attho. Addhattayapariyāpannañhi🔽sabbaṃ tebhūmakasaṅkhāragataṃ sammasīyati. Nayanatoti nayaggāhato. Anurūpatthavācako
analyzed: sabbena sabbam ti sabba ppakārena sabbam anavasesam ti atthaḥ addha ttaya pariyāpannam hi  sabbam tebhūmaka saṅkhāra gatam sammasīyati nayanataḥ iti naya ggāhataḥ anurūpa attha vācakaḥ
translated: All in all: in every way, all, without exception, is the meaning. For all that is included in the three planes and comes under formations is penetrated by him.

original: vā kāraṇasaddo “kāraṇaṃ vadatī”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: vā kāraṇa saddo kāraṇam vadati iti ādīsu
translated: By the guide: by the guide’s grasp. Or the word “guide” is a reason word in the sense of “suitable object,” like the words “reason” in such passages as “The reason speaks” .🔽The knowledge of the way is said to have a special kind of object-contemplation because it occurs as the cause of the knowledge of the end.

original: Anvayañāṇassapi pariyogāhetvā pavattanato saviseso visayāvabodhoti vuttaṃ “dhamme🔽ñāṇa…pe… abhāvā”ti. Visayobhāsanamattajānanasāmaññenāti asatipi abhisamecca gahaṇe🔽visayavibhāvanasaṅkhātaavabodhasāmaññamattena. “Ñāṇa”nti sammatesūti “ñāṇa”nti voharitesu
analyzed: anvaya ñāṇassa api pariyogāhetvā pavattanato sa visesaḥ visaya avabodho ti vuttam dhamme  ñāṇape a bhāva ati visaya ubhāsana matta jānana sāmaññena ati a satipi abhisame ca gahaṇe  visaya vibhāvana saṅkhāta avabodha sāmañña mattena sammatesu iti
translated: By the mere knowing of the object’s proclamation: although there is no apprehending by reviewing, still there is mere similarity of knowing, that is, of contemplation,🔽in the mere knowing of the proclamation of the object.🔽In those called “knowledge”: in those called “knowledge” in the sense of “they are spoken of as knowledge” .

original: laddhañāṇavohāresu. Sammutivasenāti dhammañāṇādi viya samukhena visaye appavattitvā
analyzed: laddha ñāṇa vohāresu sammuti vasena āti dhamma ñāṇa ādi viya samukhena visaye
translated: By the mere convention: without occurring with regard to the object by way of a collective total, as does the knowledge of states, etc.

original: paññattimukhena pavattaṃ. Avasesanti sammutiñāṇamevāha. Itarañāṇattayavisabhāganti
analyzed: paññatti mukhena pavattam sammuti ñāṇam eva āha itara ñāṇa ttaya visa bhāgam ti
translated: and that which occurs by way of the designation is the rest, namely, the knowledge of convention.

original: dhammañāṇādiñāṇattayavidhuraṃ.
analyzed: dhamma ñāṇa ādi ñāṇa ttaya vidhuram
translated: It is devoid of the three kinds of knowledge, namely, knowledge of law, etc.

original: 797. Kāmabhavadhammeti kāmabhavasaṅkhāte dhamme.
analyzed: kāma bhava dhamma iti kāma bhava saṅkhāte dhamme
translated: The state of things called the sensual-desire becoming is the state of things called the sensual-desire becoming.🔽The understanding of the first jhana is the understanding of the first jhana.

original: 798. Sāti paṭhamajjhānapaññā. Vītarāgabhāvanāvatthassāti “vītarāgo hotī”ti evaṃ vuttassa.
analyzed: sā ati paṭhama jhāna paññā vīta rāga bhāvanā vatthassa ati vīta rāgaḥ hoti iti evam vuttassa
translated: The state of one who has had the development of the signless deliverance is the state of one described thus “He becomes dispassionate” .🔽The sixth knowledge is the sixth knowledge.

original: Tanti chaṭṭhābhiññaṃ. Maggañāṇañhi kiccato maggasaccampi paṭivijjhati. Itarāti heṭṭhimamaggapaññā.
analyzed: tat ti chaṭṭha abhiññam magga ñāṇam hi kiccataḥ magga saccam pi paṭivijjhati itarā ti heṭṭhima magga paññā
translated: For knowledge of the path penetrates the truth of the path in the sense of function. The rest is the understanding of the lower path.

original: Tadupanissayattāti tassā chaṭṭhābhiññāya, tassa vā paṭivijjhanassa upanissayattā
analyzed: tad upanissaya ttā ti tassā chaṭṭha abhiññāya tassa vā paṭivijjhanassa upanissaya ttā
translated: Because it is a condition for that is because it is a condition for that sixth knowledge or for the penetration of that .

original: paṭivijjhati nāma. Yathānurūpanti diṭṭhāsavādīnaṃ yathānurūpaṃ. Āsavakkhayeti āsavakkhayapariyāye
analyzed: paṭivijjhati nāma yathānurūpam ti diṭṭha āsava ādīnam yathānurūpam āsava khaya iti āsava kkhaya pariyāye
translated: It is called “penetrates” in the way beginning “The penetration of the taints’ destruction” .🔽The expression “the penetration of the taints’ destruction” is a cause-description.

original: kāraṇūpacārena. Taṃnibbattanatoti tassa āsavakkhayasaṅkhātassa phalassa nibbattanato.
analyzed: kāraṇa upacārena tad nibbattanato ti tassa āsava kkhaya saṅkhātassa phalassa nibbattanato
translated: Because it is the source of that is because it is the source of that fruit called the destruction of the taints.

original: Idañca “āsavānaṃ khaye ñāṇaṃ chaṭṭhābhiññā”ti sutte āgatattā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam ca āsavānam khaye ñāṇam chaṭṭhā abhiññā iti sutte āgata ttā vuttam
translated: And this is said because of the text’s occurrence thus: “Knowledge of the destruction of the taints is the sixth knowledge” .

original: 801. Abhivisiṭṭhena vā ñāṇena pākaṭaṃ karontassāti adhigamavasena pakāsaṃ vibhūtaṃ karontassa.
analyzed: abhivisiṭṭhena vā ñāṇena pākaṭam karontassa ati adhigama vasena pakāsam vibhūtam karontassa
translated: By means of knowledge that is pre-eminent: by means of knowledge that is made evident by the attainment of distinction.

original: 802. Vasitāpañcakarahitaṃ vasibhāvaṃ apāpitaṃ paṭiladdhamattaṃ. Paṭipadārammaṇasahagatā paññā paṭipadārammaṇasambandhinīti āha “paññāya paṭipadārammaṇuddesenā”ti.
analyzed: vasitā pañcaka rahitam vasi bhāvam a pāpitam paṭiladdha mattam paṭipad ārammaṇa sahagatā paññā paṭipad ārammaṇa sambandhinī iti āha paññāya paṭipad ārammaṇa uddesena ati
translated: The state of mastery is not yet fully developed, but it is merely obtained. The understanding associated with the object of the path is called “connected with the object of the path.”

original: Catukkaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catukka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the fourfold classification is finished.

original: 5. Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽804. Tameva paññaṃ “dvīsu jhānesu paññā pītipharaṇenā”tiādinā vibhajati. Abhisandanaparisandanaparipūraṇānipi
analyzed: tam eva paññam dvīsu jhānesu paññā pīti pharaṇena ati ādinā vibhajati abhisandana parisandana paripūraṇāni pi
translated: The exposition of the fivefold classification

original: parippharaṇaṃ viya pharaṇāpītiyā, taṃsahagatasukhassa ca kiccavisesabhūtāni adhippetānīti
analyzed: parippharaṇam viya pharaṇa apītiyā tad sahagata sukhassa ca kicca visesa bhūtāni adhippetāni iti
translated: He classifies that same understanding in the fivefold classification as “understanding in two jhānas, by means of the pervasion of happiness” and so on. The pervasion of happiness is intended here as the state of being pervaded by happiness, and the states of being sprinkled, bathed, and filled with it are intended as the different functions of the happiness associated with it.

original: āha “abhisandetīti…pe… veditabba”nti. Ādinā nayenāti “abhisandetī”tiādinā sutte āgatanayena.
analyzed: āha abhisandeti itipe veditabbam ti ādinā nayena ati abhisandeti iti ādinā sutte āgata nayena
translated: That is why he says “It is to be understood that it is sprinkled, etc.,”

original: Pharaṇañcettha pītisukhasamuṭṭhitapaṇītarūpehi kāyassa abhibyāpanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ārammaṇeti
analyzed: pharaṇam ca ittha pīti sukha samuṭṭhita paṇīta rūpehi kāyassa abhibyāpanam daṭṭhabbam ārammaṇe ti
translated: Herein, the pervasion should be regarded as the suffusing of the body with the exquisite materiality originated by happiness and pleasure. As object:

original: pītipharaṇatāsukhapharaṇatāsīsena vuttānaṃ tikadukajhānānaṃ ārammaṇe. Tāti pītipharaṇatāsukhapharaṇatā.
analyzed: pīti pharaṇa tā sukha pharaṇa tā sīsena vuttānam tika duka jhānānam ārammaṇe tāti pīti pharaṇa tā sukha pharaṇa tā
translated: The meaning is that of the three tetrads and the tetrad of jhāna stated in terms of the pervasion of happiness and the pervasion of bliss, the pervasion of happiness and the pervasion of bliss is the object.

original: Samādhimukhenāti samādhiṃ mukhaṃ pamukhaṃ katvā, samādhisīsenāti attho, samādhipamukhena
analyzed: samādhi mukhena ati samādhim mukham pamukham katvā samādhi sīsena ati samādhi pamukhena
translated: By the means of concentration: having made concentration the means, the front, the lead, is the meaning; by the means of concentration,🔽or by the means of the announcement and the indication. Other defilements: such as views and conceit.

original: vā uddesaniddesena. Aññe kilesā diṭṭhimānādayo. Appayogenāti jhānavimokkhādīnaṃ viya
analyzed: vā uddesa niddesena aññe kilesā diṭṭhi māna ādayo appayogena ati jhāna vimokkha ādīnam viya
translated: Without effort: without the effort that is the preliminary work for producing jhāna and the liberations, etc.

original: uppādanīyaparikammapayogena vinā. Āvajjanāsadiso hi phalasamāpattiattho sammasanacāro.
analyzed: uppādanīya parikamma payogena vinā āvajjana asadisaḥ hi phala samāpatti atthaḥ sammasana cāro
translated: For the meaning of the attainment of fruition is like the adverting, and its occurrence is like the process of absorption.

original: Ṭhapitattāti pavattitattā. Satibahulatāyāti satiyā abhiṇhuppattiyā. Paricchindanasatiyā
analyzed: ṭhapi tattā ati pavatti tattā sati bahula tāya ati satiyā abhiṇhuppattiyā paricchindana satiyā
translated: Because it is placed: because it occurs. Because of the abundance of mindfulness: because of the frequent occurrence of mindfulness.

original: kālassa satoti dassetīti yojanā.
analyzed: kālassa sato ti dasseti iti yojanā
translated: The meaning is that he shows the time by means of the mindfulness that defines it.

original: Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the description of the pentad is ended.

original: 6. Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the six

original: 805. Visuddhibhāvanti visuddhiyā sabbhāvaṃ. “Dibbacakkhuñāṇekadesattā”ti idaṃ tassa
analyzed: visuddhi bhāvanti visuddhiyā sabbhāvam dibba cakkhu ñāṇa eka desa ttā ti idam tassa
translated: Purification of knowledge and vision: the actuality of purification. “Because it is a part of knowledge of the divine eye” is said.

original: paribhaṇḍañāṇattā vuttaṃ. Tathā hi pāḷiyaṃ “sattānaṃ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṃ abhinīharati
analyzed: paribhaṇḍa ñāṇa ttā vuttam tathā hi pāḷiyam sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhinīharati
translated: Thus, in the text, beginning with “he directs his mind to the knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings”

original: abhininnāmetī”ti ārabhitvā “so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dibbassa
analyzed: abhininnāmeti iti ārabhitvā so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atiādi vuttam dibbassa
translated: and ending with “with the divine eye which is purified and surpasses the human,” it is said.

original: tirohitavippakaṭṭhādibhedassa, itarassa ca rūpāyatanassa dassanasamatthassāpi dibbacakkhuñāṇassa
analyzed: tirohita vippakaṭṭha ādi bhedassa itarassa ca rūpa āyatanassa dassana samatthassa api dibba cakkhu ñāṇassa
translated: The divine eye, which is able to see the divine, which is of the nature of the hidden, the manifest, etc., and the visible form base,

original: sikhāpatti cavamānopapajjamānasattadassananti āha “muddhappattena cā”tiādi.
analyzed: sikhāpatti cavamāna upapajjamāna satta dassananti āha muddhappattena ca atiādi
translated: the knowledge of the divine eye, which is able to see the passing away and arising of beings, is called “the knowledge of the divine eye.”

original: Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: chakka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section on the six kinds of knowledge is finished.

original: 7. Sattakaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the seven kinds of knowledge

original: 806. Chabbidhampi paccavekkhaṇañāṇanti “jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇa”ntiādinā vuttaṃ🔽paṭiccasamuppādaṅgānaṃ paccavekkhaṇavasena pavattañāṇaṃ. Saha gahetvāti ekajjhaṃ
analyzed: chabbidham pi paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam ti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇanti ñāṇa nti ādinā vuttam  paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgānam paccavekkhaṇa vasena pavatta ñāṇam saha gahetvā ati ekajjham
translated: The knowledge of the survey of the six kinds is the knowledge that occurs by way of the survey of the factors of dependent origination, which is stated thus: “The knowledge that aging and death have birth as condition”🔽and so forth. Having taken together means having taken together

original: gahetvā vipassanārammaṇabhāvasāmaññena ekattena gahetvā. Saṅkhipitvā vuttenāti pubbe
analyzed: gahetvā vipassanā ārammaṇa bhāva sāmaññena ekattena gahetvā saṅkhipitvā vuttena ati pubbe
translated: having taken as one by way of the similarity of being the object of insight. Having abbreviated the statement means having stated

original: chadhā vuttaṃ viya dassitaṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇanti evaṃ saṅkhipitvā vuttena. “Khayadhamma”ntiādinā🔽pakārena dassananti sambandho. Pavattañāṇassāti “jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇa”ntiādinā🔽pavattassa ñāṇassa, pavatte vā saṃsāravaṭṭe ñāṇassa. Ñāṇārammaṇā vipassanā ñāṇavipassanā.
analyzed: chadhā vuttam viya dassitam dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam ti evam saṅkhipitvā vuttena khaya dhamma nti ādinā  pakārena dassananti sambandho pavatta ñāṇassa ti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa nti ādinā  pavattassa ñāṇassa pavatte vā saṃsāra vaṭṭe ñāṇassa ñāṇa ārammaṇā vipassanā ñāṇa vipassanā
translated: The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .🔽The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .🔽The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .

original: Vipassanāti ca “jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇa”ntiādinā paccayapaccayuppannadhamme vibhāgena🔽dassanato dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ idhādhippetaṃ. Tassa khayadhammatādijānanaṃ paṭivipassanā.
analyzed: vipassanā ti ca jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa nti ādinā paccaya paccaya uppanna dhamme vibhāgena  dassanataḥ dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam idha adhippetam tassa khaya dhamma tā ādi jānanam paṭivipassanā
translated: The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .🔽The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .🔽The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .

original: Tenāha “vipassanāpaṭivipassanādassanamatta”nti.
analyzed: tena āha vipassanā paṭivipassanā dassanam attam ti
translated: The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging are subject to destruction, fall, break-up, and cessation” .

original: Evamettha aṭṭhakathādhippāyavasena pāḷiyā atthaṃ dassetvā idāni attano adhippāyavasena🔽dassetuṃ “pāḷiyaṃ panā”tiādimāha. Sabbatthāti addhattaye paccayavisesena paccayuppannavisesaniddhāraṇe.
analyzed: evam ettha aṭṭhakathā adhippāya vasena pāḷiyāḥ attham dassetvā idāni attanaḥ adhippāya vasena 🔽dassetum pāḷiyam pana ati ādim āha sabbattha iti addhattaye paccaya visesena paccaya uppanna visesa niddhāraṇe
translated: The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is shown in the way stated in the sixfold method, that is, in the way stated in brief as follows: “The knowledge of the stability of dhammas is the knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging

original: Ñāṇavacanenāti “jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇa”ntiādinā ñāṇassa gahaṇena. Aṅgānanti sattasattatiyā
analyzed: ñāṇa vacanena ati jāti paccayāḥ jarā maraṇa nti ādinā ñāṇassa gahaṇena satta sattatiyā
translated: The factors: of the seventy-seven factors .

original: aṅgānaṃ. Itisaddenāti “nirodhadhamma”nti ettha vuttaitisaddena. Pakāsetvāti ñāṇassa
analyzed: aṅgānam iti saddena ati nirodha dhamman ti ettha vutta eti saddena pakāsetvā iti ñāṇassa
translated: By the word “is”: by the word “is” in the phrase “is subject to cessation” .

original: pavattiākāraṃ jotetvā. Tena dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇato aññaṃyeva pariyosāne vuttaṃ ñāṇanti
analyzed: pavatti ākāram jotetvā tena dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇato aññam yeva pariyosāne vuttam ñāṇan ti
translated: Having shown: having illuminated the mode of operation of knowledge. He thus shows that the knowledge stated at the end is different from the knowledge of the stability of dhammas .

original: dasseti. Tenāha “vipassanāñāṇaṃ sattamaṃ ñāṇa”nti. Ayameva cettha attho yuttoti dassento
analyzed: dasseti tena āha vipassanā ñāṇam sattamam ñāṇan ti ayam eva ca ittha atthaḥ yuttaḥ ti dassento
translated: Therefore he says, “The seventh knowledge is insight knowledge.” Showing that this is the only proper interpretation here,

original: “na hī”tiādimāha. Tattha “tampi ñāṇanti sambandho na hotī”ti evaṃ sambandho na yutto
analyzed: na hi iti ādim āha tattha tat pi ñāṇam ti sambandhaḥ na hoti iti evam sambandhaḥ na yuttaḥ
translated: he says, “But that is not so.” Herein, the construction is not proper in the way beginning, “That knowledge is not so,”

original: aṅgantarabhāvassa avibhāvanatoti attho. Tena vuttaṃ “taṃñāṇa…pe… anadhippetattā”ti.
analyzed: aṅga antara bhāvassa a vibhāvanato ti attho tena vuttam taṃñāṇape an adhippeta ttā ti
translated: because no difference in meaning is discerned. Therefore he says, “Because that knowledge is not mentioned separately, etc.”

original: Na hi visuṃ visuṃ vuttameva ekajjhaṃ vacanamattena atthantaraṃ hotīti. “Khayadhammaṃ…pe…
analyzed: na hi visum visum vuttam eva ekajjham vacana mattena atthantaram hoti iti
translated: For what is stated separately is not given a different meaning merely by being included in a collective statement.

original: cā”ti iminā purimasmiṃ pakkhe upacayena dosamāha.
analyzed: ca ati iminā purimasmin pakkhe upacayena dosam āha
translated: By the phrase “subject to destruction, etc.,” he points out the fault in the first alternative by way of increase .

original: Sattakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sattaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the explanation of the seven groups is finished.

original: 8. Aṭṭhakaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭhaka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: 8. Description of the eights

original: 808. Paccanīkadhammeti nīvaraṇādipaccanīkadhamme. Dukkhanti samāpajjane asati uppajjanakadukkhaṃ.
analyzed: paccanīka dhamme ti nīvaraṇa ādi paccanīka dhamme dukkham ti samāpajjane asati uppajjanaka dukkham
translated: “Adverse qualities”: the adverse qualities beginning with the hindrances. “Pain”: the pain that arises when there is no attainment.

original: Aṭṭhakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the eights is ended.

original: 10. Dasakaniddeso
analyzed: dasaka niddeso
translated: The description of the tens

original: Paṭhamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽809. Na ṭhānanti aṭṭhānaṃ, anupalabbhanattho ayamakāroti āha “avijjamānaṃ ṭhānaṃ
analyzed: na ṭhānam ti aṭṭhānam an upalabbhana atthaḥ ayam akāraḥ iti āha avijjamānam ṭhānam
translated: The first section

original: aṭṭhāna”nti. Abhāvattho vā, na aññapaṭipakkhādiatthoti āha “natthi ṭhānanti vā aṭṭhāna”nti.
analyzed: aṭṭhānanti abhāva tthaḥ vā na añña paṭipakkha ādi attho ti āha natthi ṭhānanti vā aṭṭhānanti
translated: “Not a ground” is non-ground, non-availability. The word “ground” is used in the sense of “non-existence,” he says, “non-existence of a ground is a non-ground.” Or it is used in the sense of absence, not in the sense of the opposite of something else. He says, “Or a non-ground is not a ground.”

original: Ko panetassa atthadvayassa visesoti? Paṭhamo hetupaccayehi anupalabbhamānataṃ vadati,
analyzed: kaḥ pana itassa attha dvayassa visesaḥ ti paṭhamaḥ hetu paccayehi anupalabbhamāna tam vadati
translated: But what is the difference between these two senses? The first states that it is non-available through causes and conditions.

original: dutiyo sabbena sabbaṃ abhāvanti ayametesaṃ viseso. Taṇhupādānādīnampi sukhato upagamanassa
analyzed: dutiyaḥ sabbena sabbam abhāvanti ayam etesam visesaḥ taṇhā upādāna ādīnam pi sukhataḥ upagamanassa
translated: The second states that it is completely and totally absent. This is the difference between them. Because of the perversion of view, which is the cause for the acceptance of craving, assuming, and so on, as pleasant,

original: hetubhāve diṭṭhivipallāsassa so sātisayo asukhepi daḷhaṃ pavattāpanatoti āha “diṭṭhivipallāsova…pe…
analyzed: hetu bhāve diṭṭhi vipallāsassa so sa atisayaḥ asukhe pi daḷham āha diṭṭhi vipallāsa uvape
translated: it is firmly established even in what is not pleasant. Therefore he says, “The perversion of view … is the cause for the acceptance of what is not a ground as a ground.”

original: adhippeta”nti. “Attadiṭṭhivasenā”ti kasmā visesetvā vuttaṃ, nanu ariyasāvakassa sabbāpi
analyzed: adhippetanti atta diṭṭhi vasena ati kasmā visesetvā vuttam nanu ariyasāvakassa sabbā api
translated: “With the view of self.” Why is this specified? Is not all the view of the ariyasāvaka

original: diṭṭhiyo natthīti? Saccaṃ natthi, attadiṭṭhisannissayā pana sabbadiṭṭhiyoti dassetuṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhiyaḥ natthi iti saccam natthi atta diṭṭhi sannissayā pana sabba diṭṭhiyaḥ ti dassetuṃ
translated: “With the view of self.” Why is this specified? Hasn’t the noble disciple no views at all? It is true that he has none, but all views are shown to have the view of self as their support.🔽“With the view of self” means with the view of supremacy.

original: “attadiṭṭhivasenāti padhānadiṭṭhimāhā”ti vuttaṃ. Bhedānurūpassa vatthuno. Bhedānurūpena
analyzed: atta diṭṭhi vasena āti padhāna diṭṭhim āha ati vuttam bheda anurūpassa vatthunaḥ bheda anurūpena
translated: The basis is in accordance with the division. The basis is in accordance with the division

original: “adhamme dhammo”tiādinayappavattena.
analyzed: adhamme dhamma uti ādi naya ppavattena
translated: “in the non-Dhamma as the Dhamma,” etc.

original: So evāti yo liṅge aparivatte tasmiṃ attabhāve bhavaṅgajīvitindriyappabandho, so eva.
analyzed: saḥ eva ati yaḥ liṅge a parivatte tasmin atta bhāve saḥ eva
translated: That same: the continuity of the life faculty in the life-continuum in that existence, when the sign is not reversed.

original: Tañhi upādāya ekajātisamaññā, na cettha bhāvakalāpajīvitindriyassa vasena codanā🔽kātabbā tadaññasseva adhippetattā. Tañhi tattha avicchedavuttiyā pabandhavohāraṃ
analyzed: tat hi upādāya eka jāti samaññā na ca ittha bhāva kalāpa jīvitindriyassa vasena codanā  kātabbā tad aññassa iva adhippeta ttā tat hi tattha aviccheda vuttiyā pabandha vohāram
translated: For the designation of a single birth is made on the basis of that. But here the life faculty and the aggregates of existence should not be taken as the object of the accusation,

original: labhati, itarampi vā bhāvānupālanatāsāmaññenāti anokāsāva codanā.
analyzed: labhati itaram pi vā bhāva anupālana tā sāmaññena ati codanā
translated: because something else is intended. For that is called a continuity because it continues without interruption there, or the other is called a continuity because it has the same nature of maintaining existence. Therefore the accusation is out of place.

original: Sapattavasena yojetabbanti “sapattaṃ māremīti abhisandhinā sapattena nipannaṭṭhāne
analyzed: sa patta vasena yojetabbanti sa pattam māremi iti abhisandhinā sa pattena nipanna ṭṭhāne
translated: It should be construed with the word “rival.” “I will rival the rival” means that the rival is lying down in a place.

original: nipannaṃ manussabhūto manussabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ pitaraṃ vā mārento”tiādinā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: nipannam manussa bhūtaḥ manussa bhūtam mātaram pitaram vā mārento ti ādinā yojetabbam
translated: and “a human being killing a human mother who is lying down” should be construed in the same way.

original: Sabbatthāti catūsupi vikappesu. Purimaṃ abhisandhicittanti pubbabhāgiyo maraṇādhippāyo.🔽Appamāṇaṃ tena atthasiddhiyā abhāvato. Puthujjanasseva taṃ dinnaṃ hotīti ettha yathā
analyzed: sabbattha ati catūsu pi vikappesu purimam abhisandhi cittam ti pubbabhāgiyaḥ maraṇa adhippāyo  appamāṇam tena attha siddhiyāḥ abhāvataḥ puthujjanassa iva tam dinnam hoti iti ettha yathā
translated: In all four instances: in all four kinds of application of the rule. The intention to kill in the prior stage: the intention to kill in the prior stage of the path of action.🔽It is immeasurable, because there is no success in the purpose.

original: arahattaṃ patvā paribhuttampi puthujjanakāle dinnaṃ puthujjanadānameva hoti, evaṃ
analyzed: arahattam patvā paribhuttam pi puthujjana kāle dinnam puthujjana dānam eva hoti evam
translated: It is given only to worldlings: here, just as when one who has reached Arahantship makes use of a gift given to him in the worldling stage, it is still a gift given to a worldling,

original: maraṇādhippāyena puthujjanakāle pahāre dinne arahattaṃ patvā teneva pahārena mate
analyzed: maraṇa adhippāyena puthujjana kāle pahāre dinne arahattam patvā tena iva pahārena mate
translated: so too, when a blow is given in the worldling stage by one who intends to kill, and the victim dies through that blow after the giver has reached Arahantship,

original: kasmā arahantaghātoyeva hoti, na puthujjanaghātoti? Visesasambhavato. Yathā hi dānaṃ🔽deyyadhammassa pariccāgamattena hoti, na evaṃ vadho. So hi pāṇo, pāṇasaññitā, vadhakacetanā,
analyzed: kasmai hoti na puthujjana ghāto ti visesa sambhavataḥ yathā hi dānam  deyya dhammassa pariccāga mattena hoti na evam vadho saḥ hi pāṇaḥ pāṇa saññitā vadhaka cetanā
translated: why is it still a killing of an Arahant and not a killing of a worldling? Because of the possibility of distinction. For just as a gift is so called merely because of the giving up of an object to be given,🔽so killing is not. It is only when there is fulfilment of the five factors, namely, a living being, the perception of a living being, the thought of killing, an effort to kill, and the death of the victim,

original: upakkamo, tena maraṇanti imesaṃ pañcannaṃ aṅgānaṃ pāripūriyāva hoti, na apāripūriyā.
analyzed: upakkamaḥ tena maraṇanti imesam pañcannam aṅgānam pāripūriyā ava hoti na a pāripūriyā
translated: and not when there is no fulfilment of these factors.

original: Tasmā arahattaṃ pattasseva maraṇanti arahantaghātoyeva hoti, na puthujjanaghāto.🔽Yasmā pana “imaṃ māremī”ti yaṃ santānaṃ ārabbha māraṇicchā, tassa puthujjanakhīṇāsavabhāvena
analyzed: tasmai arahattam pattassa iva hoti na puthujjana ghāto  yasmai pana imam māremi iti yam santānam ārabbha māraṇa icchā tassa puthujjana khīṇāsava bhāvena
translated: So it is only the murderer of an Arahant that is a murderer of an Arahant, not the murderer of an ordinary man.

original: payogamaraṇakkhaṇānaṃ vasena satipi santānabhede abhedoyeva. Yadā ca atthasiddhi,
analyzed: vasena yadā ca
translated: But since the intention to kill is in regard to the continuity of aggregates in the case of an ordinary man or an Arahant,🔽there is no difference in the intention to kill, though there is a difference in the continuity, according to whether the murderer’s effort and the death occur while he is an ordinary man or while he is a candi- date for the state of an Arahant.🔽And when the purpose is accomplished, then the murderer is an Arahant. So it is only the murderer of an Arahant that is a murderer of an Arahant.

original: tadā khīṇāsavabhāvo. Tasmā arahantaghātova hotīti nicchitaṃ. Kathaṃ panettha vadhakacetanā
analyzed: tadā khīṇāsava bhāvo tasmai arahanta ghātaḥ uva hoti iti nicchitam katham pana ittha vadhaka cetanā
translated: But how can the volition of the murderer have as its object what is present?

original: vattamānavisayā siyāti āha “vadhakacittaṃ paccuppannārammaṇampi…pe… pavattatī”ti.
analyzed: vattamāna visayā siyā iti āha vadhaka cittam paccuppanna ārammaṇam pipe pavattati iti
translated: So he said, “The mind of murder has as its object what is present … and so on up to … it occurs” .

original: Tattha pabandhavicchedavasenāti yena pabandho vicchijjati, tādisaṃ payogaṃ nibbattetīti
analyzed: tattha pabandha viccheda vasena ati yena pabandhaḥ vicchijjati tādisam payogam nibbatteti iti
translated: Herein, by the words “by the severance of the bond” is meant that it produces the effort that severs the bond.

original: attho. Tena yadā pabandhavicchedo, tadā arahāti yathāvuttaṃ arahantaghātaṃ patiṭṭhāpeti.
analyzed: attho tena yadā pabandha vicchedo tadā arahā ati yathāvuttam arahanta ghātam patiṭṭhāpeti
translated: So when the severance of the bond occurs, then the murderer is an Arahant. He thus establishes the murder of an Arahant as stated.🔽But it is not so with the volition of one who has gone over to the other side.

original: Na evanti yathā kālantarāpekkhakiccasiddhaṃ vadhakacittaṃ, na evaṃ cāgacetanā. “Sā
analyzed: na evanti yathā kāla antara apekkha kicca siddham vadhaka cittam na evam cāga cetanā sā
translated: The volition of one who has gone over to the other side is not like the mind of murder that has as its object the success of its function by looking to a time in the future.

original: hī”tiādinā cāgacetanāya kālantarānapekkhakiccasiddhitaṃyeva vibhāveti. Aññasakakaraṇanti
analyzed: hi iti ādinā cāga cetanāya vibhāveti
translated: And by the words “and the other is not” he distinguishes the mere success of the function of the giving without regard for a future result.

original: attato vinimocetvā aññassa dakkhiṇeyyassa santakabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Tassāti cajitabbassa🔽vatthuno. Yassāti yassa puthujjanassa. Tasseva taṃ dinnaṃ hoti, sacepi arahattaṃ
analyzed: attataḥ vinimocetvā aññassa dakkhiṇeyyassa santaka bhāva karaṇam tassa ati cajitabbassa  vatthunaḥ yassa ati yassa puthujjanassa tassa iva tam dinnam hoti sace pi arahattam
translated: “Making it another’s property”: making it the property of another worthy recipient by transferring it from oneself.🔽“To him”: to the person from whom it is to be given up.

original: patvā tena paribhuttanti attho.
analyzed: patvā tena paribhuttanti attho
translated: “To him alone it is given”: the meaning is that it is given to him even if he has attained arahatship and uses it.
