original: “Kappavināse”ti idaṃ “saṇṭhahante kappe”ti vuttattā mahākappavināsaṃ sandhāya vuttanti
analyzed: kappa vināsa iti idam saṇṭhahante kappa iti vuttattā mahā kappa vināsam sandhāya vuttam iti
translated: “In the destruction of an aeon”: this is said with reference to the great destruction of an aeon, because it is said “when the aeon is dissolving.”

original: āha “kappaṭṭhakathāya na sametī”ti ettha āyukappassa adhippetattā. Āyukappo cettha
analyzed: āha kappa ṭṭhakathāya na sameti iti ettha āyu kappassa adhippetattā āyu kappo ca ittha
translated: Therefore it is said, “it does not agree with the statement about the duration of an aeon.” For the duration of an aeon is intended here.

original: avīciyaṃ nibbattasattānaṃ antarakappaparimāṇaṃ paramāyu veditabbaṃ. Tañhi sandhāya
analyzed: avīciyam nibbatta sattānam antara kappa parimāṇam parama āyu veditabbam tat hi sandhāya
translated: The maximum life-span of beings reborn in Avīci Hell is to be understood as the duration of an intermediate aeon.🔽For it is with reference to that that it is said:

original: “ekaṃ kappaṃ asītibhāge katvā tato ekabhāgamattaṃ kāla”nti vuttaṃ. Tayidaṃ “ekaṃ
analyzed: ekam kappam asīti bhāge katvā tatas eka bhāga mattam kālanti vuttam ekam
translated: “One aeon is divided into eighty parts, and the duration of an intermediate aeon is one of these parts.”

original: kappa”nti yadi ekaṃ mahākappanti attho, tathā sati vīsatiantarakappaparimāṇo eko
analyzed: kappanti yadi ekam mahā kappanti attho tathā sati vīsati antara kappa parimāṇaḥ ekaḥ
translated: If the meaning is “one great aeon,” then it would be said that the asaṅkhyeya aeon is the measure of twenty intermediate aeons.

original: asaṅkhyeyyakappoti vuttaṃ hoti. Atha ekaṃ asaṅkhyeyyakappanti attho, sabbathāpi “catusaṭṭhi🔽antarakappā”ti vacanena virujjhatīti vīmaṃsitabbaṃ. Yathā pana kappaṭṭhakathāya ayaṃ
analyzed: asaṅkhyeyya kappo ti vuttam hoti atha ekam asaṅkhyeyya kappanti attho sabbathā api catusaṭṭhi  antara kappā ti vacanena virujjhati iti vīmaṃsitabbam yathā pana kappaṭṭhakathāya ayam
translated: But if the meaning is “one asaṅkhyeya aeon,” then it is to be investigated whether it is contradicted by the statement that there are sixty-four intermediate aeons.

original: aṭṭhakathā sameti, taṃ dassetuṃ “kappavināseyevāti panā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā sameti tam dassetum pana ati ādim āha
translated: But in order to show how this commentary agrees with the Kathāvatthu, he says, “But in the destruction of the aeon,” etc.

original: Pakatatto vā apārājiko. Samānasaṃvāsako kammaladdhīnaṃ vasena anānāsaṃvāsakoti evamettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: pakatattaḥ vā apārājikaḥ samāna saṃvāsako kamma laddhīnam vasena anānāsaṃvāsakaḥ iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: Or he is one who has attained maturity. He is one who is not a defeated person. He is one who is not of a different affiliation by reason of the acquisition of the schism in the Order. This is the meaning to be understood here.

original: Niyatassa puggalassa vijjamānataṃ paṭisedhetvāti yojanā. Tattha paṭisedhetvāti “puggalo
analyzed: niyatassa puggalassa vijjamāna tam paṭisedhetvā ati yojanā tattha paṭisedhetvā ati puggalo
translated: The construction is: “having denied the existence of a person who is fixed.”

original: pana niyato nāma natthī”ti evaṃ paṭisedhetvā. Tattha kāraṇamāha “micchattasammattaniyatadhammānaṃ
analyzed: pana niyataḥ nāma natthi iti evam paṭisedhetvā tattha kāraṇam āha micchatta sammatta niyata dhammānam
translated: There, having denied: having denied in this way, “But there is no person who is fixed.” There, he gives the reason: “because of the uncertainty of the nature of right and wrong views,” etc.

original: viya sabhāvato”ti. Paññattimattañhetaṃ micchattasammattaniyatadhammanissayaṃ, yadidaṃ
analyzed: viya sabhāvato ti paññattimattam ñha etam micchatta sammatta niyata dhamma nissayam yat idam
translated: and it is only a concept, dependent on the dhammas that are fixed as right or wrong.🔽This is the meaning here. ‘Fixed person’: this is a person who is fixed in the three paths.🔽‘As asked’: in the way asked, ‘Does a fixed cause fix?’

original: niyato puggaloti. Yathāpucchitanti “kiṃ pubbahetu niyametī”tiādinā pucchitappakāraṃ
analyzed: niyataḥ puggalo ti yathā pucchitanti kim pubba hetu niyama iti ādinā pucchita ppakāram
translated: ‘Fixing cause’: the cause that fixes.🔽‘By which’: by the knowledge of insight into the three higher paths.

original: niyāmakahetuṃ. Yenāti yena uparimaggattayavipassanāñāṇena. Niyatāniyatabhedanti sotāpannādiniyatabhedaṃ,🔽sattakkhattuparamādianiyatabhedañca. Sotāpanno eva hi eko sattakkhattuparamo nāma
analyzed: niyāmaka hetum yena ati yena upari magga ttaya vipassanā ñāṇena niyata aniyata bhedam ti sotāpanna ādi niyata bhedam  satta kkhattu parama ādi aniyata bhedam ca sotāpannaḥ eva hi ekaḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ nāma
translated: ‘Fixed and unfixed’: fixed as a stream-enterer, etc., and unfixed as one who will attain after seven existences at the most, etc.🔽For only one of the stream-enterers is called one who will attain after seven existences at the most, another one who goes from family to family, and another one who makes an end after one rebirth.

original: hoti, eko kolaṃkolo nāma, eko ekabījī nāmāti sotāpannassa niyatabhāvo vuttoti āha
analyzed: hoti ekaḥ kolaṃkolaḥ nāma ekaḥ ekabījī nāma ati sotāpannassa niyata bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti āha
translated: The stream-enterer’s being fixed is stated thus.🔽‘The fixed stream-enterer’—the word ca here has the sense of addition.

original: “sotāpanno ca niyato”ti. Byatirekattho hi ayaṃ ca-saddo. Tato pubbeti sotāpattimaggato🔽pubbe. “Pubbahetukiccaṃ natthī”ti idaṃ sotāpannassa niyatatāya vuttattā vakkhamānañca
analyzed: sotāpannaḥ ca niyataḥ iti byatireka atthaḥ hi ayam ca saddaḥ tatas pubbe iti sotāpatti maggato 🔽pubbe pubba hetu kiccam na atthi iti idam sotāpannassa niyata tāya vutta ttā vakkhamānam ca
translated: ‘Before that’: before the path of stream-entry.

original: dosaṃ hadaye ṭhapetvā vuttaṃ. Uparimaggānaṃ saupanissayatte paṭhamamaggassāpi saupanissayatā
analyzed: dosam hadaye ṭhapetvā vuttam upari maggānam sa aupanissaya tte paṭhama maggassa api sa aupanissaya tā
translated: and he said it with hatred in his heart. The first path’s having a supporting condition is established by the fact that the higher paths have a supporting condition.

original: siddhā evāti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “yadi hī”tiādi. Tañca niyatattaṃ. Assāti sotāpattimaggassa.
analyzed: siddhāḥ evā iti codanam sandhāya āha yadi hi itiādi tat ca assa iti sotāpatti maggassa
translated: With reference to the objection he says “If the first path” and so on. And that certainty is in the case of the stream-enterer’s path.

original: Teneva khīṇāti sotāpattimaggeneva khīṇā. Kāraṇupacchedena hi phalupacchedo siyā.
analyzed: tena iva khīṇā ati sa utāpatti maggena iva khīṇā kāraṇa upacchedena hi phala upacchedaḥ siyā
translated: “By that”: by the stream-enterer’s path. “Cut off”: cut off. For the cutting off of a fruit can be by the cutting off of its cause.

original: Tatoti sattakkhattuparamādito. Sāti sattakkhattuparamāditā. Pavattitoti vipākappabandhato.
analyzed: tatas ti satta kkhattu parama ādito sā ati satta kkhattu parama ādi tā pavattito ti vipāka ppabandhato
translated: “From that”: from the maximum of seven times. “S”: the maximum of seven times. “From the occurrence”: from the occurrence of the result.

original: Tenāti sotāpattimaggena. Vuṭṭhāneti vuṭṭhāne sati. Kāraṇena vinā phalaṃ natthīti🔽āha “sakkāya…pe… bhavitabba”nti. “Nāmakaraṇanimittato”ti iminā nāmakaraṇahetutāya
analyzed: tena ati sotāpatti maggena vuṭṭhāne iti vuṭṭhāne sati kāraṇena vinā phalam natthi iti  āha bhavitabbanti nāmakaraṇa nimittato ti iminā nāmakaraṇa hetutāya
translated: “By that”: by the stream-enterer’s path. “If there is emergence”: if there is emergence. For without a cause there is no fruit.🔽Therefore he says “it is not possible that the seven times” and so on. “From the sign of the naming”: he distinguishes the determining by the sign of the naming,

original: niyāmakataṃ vibhāveti ekabījiādisamaññānaṃ anvatthasaññābhāvato. Tenāha “vipassanā…pe… sandhāya vutta”nti.
analyzed: niyāmaka tam vibhāveti ekabīji ādi samaññānam anvattha saññā bhāvato tena āha vipassanāpe sandhāya vuttan ti
translated: by the fact that it is the cause of the naming. For the names “single-seeded” and so on are not the names of the kinds of rebirth. Therefore he says “with reference to the insight” and so on.

original: Ādi-saddena “ekomhi sammāsambuddho, sītībhūtosmi nibbuto”tiādīni saṅgayhanti. Ettha🔽ca “sadiso me na vijjati, ekomhi sammāsambuddho. ‘Atthetarahi aññe samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā🔽vā bhagavatā samasamā sambodhiya’nti evaṃ puṭṭho ahaṃ, bhante, ‘no’ti vadeyya”ntiādi🔽vacanehi imissā lokadhātuyā viya aññassa buddhassa aññissā lokadhātuyā uppādo nivāritoti🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ. Na hi vijjamāne “sadiso me na vijjatī”tiādi sakkā vattuṃ. Yaṃ pana vadanti
analyzed: ādi saddena ekaḥ amhi sammāsambuddhaḥ sītībhūtaḥ asmi nibbutaḥ ti ādīni saṅgayhanti ettha  ca sadisaḥ me na vijjati ekaḥ amhi sammāsambuddhaḥ attha itarahi aññe samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ  vā bhagavatā samasamā sambodhiyanti evam puṭṭhaḥ aham bhante no ti vadeyya antiādi  vacanehi imissā lokadhātuyā viya aññassa buddhassa aññissā lokadhātuyā uppādaḥ nivārito ti  daṭṭhabbam na hi vijjamāne sadisaḥ me na vijjati itiādi sakkā vattum yam pana vadanti
translated: The word “etc.” includes such passages as “I am the one and only one perfectly enlightened one” and “I am cool and quenched. ”🔽And here the passage beginning thus: “There is no one equal to me, I am the one and only one perfectly enlightened one” should be understood as denying the arising of another Buddha in this world or in any other world,

original: “lokadhātuvisesāpekkhāya vutta”nti, tampi natthi tathā visesanassa abhāvato, buddhānubhāvassa
analyzed: lokadhātu visesa apekkhāya vuttan ti tat pi natthi tathā visesanassa abhāvataḥ buddha anubhāvassa
translated: for one cannot say “There is no one equal to me” if there is another. But it is said that the passage was spoken with reference to a particular world system.

original: ca asamatthabhāvavibhāvanato. Āṇākhettakittanañcettha dhammatādassanatthaṃ. Sakkoti
analyzed: ca asamattha bhāva vibhāvanataḥ āṇā khetta kittanam ca ittha dhamma tā dassana attham sakkoti
translated: That is not so, because there is no such distinction, and because the passage is intended to show the incomparable power of a Buddha.🔽The glorification of the Buddha’s command is intended to show the nature of his power, for the Blessed One can exercise his command wherever he wishes.

original: hi bhagavā yattha yattha icchati, tattha tattha āṇaṃ vattetuṃ. “Ekissā lokadhātuyā”ti
analyzed: hi bhagavā yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha āṇam vattetum ekissā lokadhātuyā ati
translated: “In one world system” means in one world consisting of four continents, one small chiliocosm, one dichiliocosm, and one trichiliomegacosm.

original: ca idaṃ buddhakhettabhūtāya lokadhātuyā dassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Tatthāyamattho – buddhakhettabhūtā
analyzed: ca idam buddha khetta bhūtāya lokadhātuyāḥ dassana attham vuttam tattha ayam atthaḥ buddha khetta bhūtā
translated: and this is said for the purpose of showing the world-sphere that is the field of a Buddha. Herein, the meaning is this:🔽this one world-sphere is the field of a Buddha.

original: ekāvāyaṃ lokadhātu. Tattha ekasmiṃ kāle eko eva sammāsambuddho uppajjatīti. Tenāha
analyzed: ekā ava ayam lokadhātu tattha ekasmin kāle ekaḥ eva sammāsambuddhaḥ uppajjati iti tena āha
translated: In it a single Perfect Buddha arises at one time. That is why it is said:

original: “buddhakhetta…pe… adhippāyo”ti.
analyzed: buddha khetta pe adhippāyo ti
translated: “The intention of the Blessed One was this: ‘The world-sphere is the field of one Buddha only’” .

original: Tasmāti yasmā upasampadādhīnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ, upasampadā ca pabbajjādhīnā, tasmā. Pātimokkhe
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmai upasampadā adhīnam pātimokkham upasampadā ca pabbajjā adhīnā tasmai pātimokkhe
translated: Because: since the virtue of the Pāṭimokkha is dependent on the higher ordination, and the higher ordination is dependent on the going forth, therefore

original: siddhe, siddhāsu tāsu pabbajjūpasampadāsu. Tato paraṃ vinaṭṭhaṃ nāma hotīti pacchimapaṭivedhato
analyzed: siddhe siddhāsu tāsu pabbajjūpasampadāsu tatas param vinaṭṭham nāma hoti iti pacchima paṭivedhato
translated: when the Pāṭimokkha is established, the going forth and the higher ordination are established too. After that, what is called “destroyed” is

original: paraṃ paṭivedhasāsanaṃ, pacchimasīlabhedato ca paraṃ paṭipattisāsanaṃ vinaṭṭhaṃ nāma
analyzed: param paṭivedha sāsanam pacchima sīla bhedato ca param paṭipatti sāsanam vinaṭṭham nāma
translated: the dispensation of the Path after the final extinction of the last of the disciples who have penetrated to the four paths and fruits, and the dispensation of practice after the final extinction of the last of the disciples who have entered on the way to the four paths.

original: hotīti sāsanabhāvasāmaññena pana ubhayaṃ ekajjhaṃ katvā dassento “pacchima…pe… ekato katvā”ti āha.
analyzed: hoti iti sāsana bhāva sāmaññena pana ubhayam ekajjham katvā dassento pacchima pe ekatas katvā iti āha
translated: But showing both of them together as one by the common characteristic of being a dispensation, he said: “The last … and so on … together” .

original: Paridevanakāruññanti paridevanena karuṇāyitabbatā karuṇāyanā.
analyzed: paridevana kāruññanti paridevanena karuṇāyitabba tā karuṇāyanā
translated: Mourning and pity: the state of being pitied by mourning is pity .

original: Dhammānaṃ sabhāvaviseso na sakkā dhāretuṃ, yato pāramīpavicayādīsu udakapariyantaṃ🔽katvā mahāpathavīkampo ahosi, abhisambodhidivase ca ṭhapetvā pubbuttaradisābhāge
analyzed: dhammānam sabhāva visesaḥ na sakkā dhāretum yatas pāramīpavicaya ādīsu udaka pariyantam  katvā mahā pathavī kampaḥ ahosi abhisambodhi divase ca ṭhapetvā pubbuttara disā bhāge
translated: The specific nature of ideas cannot be borne, so that when the investigation of the Perfections was being made, the great earth quaked to its ocean boundary,

original: bodhirukkhamūle bhūmibhāgo mahāpurisaṃ dhāretuṃ nāsakkhi, aññadatthu ekapasse pakkhittaatibhārabharitanāvā🔽viya cakkavāḷagabbho viparivatto. “Samuppādikā”ti vattabbe sa-kāre a-kārassa ā-kāro,
analyzed: bodhi rukkha mūle bhūmi bhāgaḥ mahā purisam dhāretum na asakkhi añña datthu eka passe pakkhitta ati bhāra bharita nāvā  viya cakkavāḷa gabbhaḥ viparivattaḥ samuppādikā ati vattabbe sakāre akārassa ākāraḥ
translated: and on the day of the Supreme Enlightenment the earth in the north-east quadrant under the Bodhi Tree could not bear the Great Man,🔽but the world-element turned over like a ship that is overloaded on one side.

original: ekassa ca pa-kārassa lopo katoti dassento āha “samaṃ uddhaṃ pajjatīti sāmupādikā”ti.
analyzed: ekassa ca pakārassa lopaḥ kataḥ iti dassentaḥ āha samam uddham pajjati iti sāmupādikā iti
translated: The reading ‘samupādinna’ is to be taken as ‘samuppādinna’ , and the ‘a’ in ‘samupādinna’ is the ‘a’ of the negative ‘na’ and the ‘pa’ is omitted, as is shown by the words ‘Samupādinna means “rising evenly upwards” ’.

original: Samaṃ upādiyatīti vā samupādā, samupādā eva sāmupādikā, samupāhinīti attho.
analyzed: samam upādiyati iti vā samupādā samupādā eva sāmupādikā samupāhinī iti attho
translated: Or alternatively, ‘samupādinna’ is the same as ‘samupādā’ , which is the same as ‘samupādinna’ , the meaning being ‘that which is taken up together’.🔽‘In the sense of continuity and in the sense of moment’: the ‘in the sense of continuity’ is the state of being associated with accumulation;

original: Santatikhaṇavasenāti santativasena āyūhanasamaṅgitā, sapubbapacchābhāgassa gahaṇavasena
analyzed: santati khaṇa vasena ati santati vasena āyūhana samaṅgi tā sa pubba pacchā bhāgassa gahaṇa vasena
translated: the ‘in the sense of moment’ is the state of being associated with the volition that apprehends the prior and subsequent parts.

original: cetanākkhaṇavasena cetanāsamaṅgitāti yojetabbā. Ekasmiṃ upaṭṭhite paccayavasena tadaññassa
analyzed: cetanā khaṇa vasena cetanā samaṅgi tā ti yojetabbā ekasmin upaṭṭhite paccaya vasena tad aññassa
translated: ‘In the sense of condition’: in the case of one that has arisen, the other is not apprehended by means of a condition.

original: upaṭṭhānaṃ parivattanaṃ.
analyzed: upaṭṭhānam parivattanam
translated: and the turning round of the basis.

original: Paṭhamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The first section on the powers is finished.

original: Dutiyabalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya bala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The second section on the powers

original: 810. Bhoge bhuñjituṃ na jānāti, vināsetīti yojanā.
analyzed: bhoge bhuñjitum na jānāti vināsā iti iti yojanā
translated: The construction is: he does not know how to enjoy his wealth, he squanders it.

original: Lahuparivattitāya jīvitassāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: lahu parivatti tāya jīvitassa ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because of the swiftness of the change in life.

original: Na adāsi payuttavācāya uppannanti adhippāyena.
analyzed: na adāsi payutta vācāya uppannanti adhippāyena
translated: The meaning is: because of the non-giving, the non-dispersal, of the speech that has arisen.

original: Sammāpayogenāti sammāpaṭipattiyā.
analyzed: sammā payogena ati sammā paṭipattiyā
translated: By right exertion: by right practice.

original: Dutiyabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya bala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The second section on the powers is finished.

original: Pañcamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The fifth section on the powers

original: 813. Dhātusabhāvoti bhūtādisaṅkhātadhātūnaṃ sabhāvo. Sabhāgavasena phalabhūtena.
analyzed: dhātu sabhāvaḥ iti sa bhāga vasena phala bhūtena
translated: The nature of the elements: the nature of the elements called “earth” and so on. By way of the similar. By way of the fruit.

original: Ajjhāsayadhātuparicchindanatoti ajjhāsayasabhāvassa “hīnaṃ, paṇīta”nti vā paricchijja
analyzed: ajjhāsaya dhātu paricchindanato ti ajjhāsaya sabhāvassa hīnam paṇītam ti vā paricchijja
translated: By discerning the element of inclination: by discerning the nature of inclination as “inferior” or “superior,”

original: jānanato, vuṭṭhinimittena viya mahoghena uparimeghavuṭṭhiyā.
analyzed: jānanataḥ vuṭṭhi nimittena viya mahā oghena upari megha vuṭṭhiyā
translated: like the discerning of the rain from the clouds above by the sign of the wind.

original: Pañcamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The fifth section on the powers is finished.

original: Chaṭṭhabalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chaṭṭha bala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The sixth section on the powers

original: Saddattho sambhavati samāsanteneva tathā saddasiddhito. Tesanti paroparānaṃ visadāvisadānaṃ
analyzed: sambhavati samāsa antena iva tathā
translated: The meaning of the word is possible only with the compound, because the word is established thus: “The higher and lower of the higher and lower” and “the clear and unclear of the clear and unclear” and “the superior and inferior of the superior and inferior” are established by the compound.

original: saddhādiindriyānaṃ. Evañca katvāti āsayādito indriyaparopariyattassa, indriyaparopariyattato
analyzed: evam ca katvā ati āsaya āditas
translated: and the faculties of faith, etc.

original: ca adhimuttibhedassa visiṭṭhasabhāvattā eva.
analyzed: ca adhimutti bhedassa visiṭṭha sabhāva ttā eva
translated: “In this way” means in the way stated above, namely, that the distinction of faculties is due to the differences in temperament, etc., and that the distinction of dispositions is due to the difference in faculties.

original: 815. “Ke pana te ariyāvāsā”ti pucchitvā te sutteneva dassento “idha, bhikkhave”tiādipāḷiṃ
analyzed: ke pana te ariya āvāsā ti pucchitvā te suttena iva dassento idha bhikkhave ti ādi pāḷim
translated: “But what are the noble abodes?” The Exalted One, having asked this, shows them with the sutta itself, beginning with the words “Here, bhikkhus.”

original: āharitvā “evaṃ vuttā”ti nigametvā puna maggādhigameneva tesaṃ adhigamaṃ dassento
analyzed: āharitvā evam vuttā iti nigametvā puna magga adhigamena iva tesam adhigamam dassento
translated: Having shown them with the words “Thus spoken of,” he again shows their attainment by the attainment of the path,

original: “etesū”tiādimāha. Tattha itareti chaḷaṅgasamannāgamaekārakkhāsaṅkhāyapaṭisevanādayo.
analyzed: etesu itiādim āha tattha itarā iti chaṭṭha aṅga samannāgama eka ārakkhā saṅkhāya paṭisevana ādayaḥ
translated: saying “In these.” Herein, “the others” are the six factors, the single protection, the guarding of the doors of the sense faculties, etc.

original: 816. Ārammaṇasantānānusayanesūti ārammaṇānusayanaṃ, santānānusayananti dvīsu anusayanesu.🔽Yathā hi maggena asamucchinno rāgo kāraṇalābhe uppajjanāraho thāmagataṭṭhena santāne
analyzed: ārammaṇa santāna anusayanesu iti ārammaṇa anusayanam santāna anusayanam ti dvīsu anusayanesu  yathā hi maggena asamucchinnaḥ rāgaḥ kāraṇa lābhe uppajjana arahaḥ thāma gata ṭṭhena santāne
translated: “In the proclivities in the object and in the continuum”: in the two proclivities, the proclivity in the object and the proclivity in the continuum.🔽For just as lust, which is not cut off by the path, is said to “lie along the path” in the sense that it is present in the continuum,

original: anusetīti vuccati, evaṃ iṭṭhārammaṇepīti tassa ārammaṇānusayanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Taṃ
analyzed: anuseti iti vuccati evam iṭṭha ārammaṇe pi iti tassa ārammaṇa anusayanam daṭṭhabbam tam
translated: so too in regard to a desirable object. The proclivity in the object should be understood in this way.

original: panassa anusayanaṃ uppattiyā pākaṭaṃ hotīti dassetuṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “yathā nāmā”tiādi
analyzed: panassa anusayanam uppattiyā pākaṭam hoti iti dassetum aṭṭhakathā ayam yathā nāma atiādi
translated: and its underlying tendency is evident in its occurrence. In order to show this, the commentary says, “As though it were a name.”

original: vuttaṃ. “Āciṇṇasamāciṇṇā”ti etena iṭṭhārammaṇe rāgassa ciraparibhāvanaṃ vibhāveti.
analyzed: vuttam āciṇṇa samāciṇṇā ti etena iṭṭha ārammaṇe rāgassa cira paribhāvanam vibhāveti
translated: By “repeatedly and continuously” he shows the long-continued development of lust for desirable objects.

original: Yasmā pana evaṃ ciraparibhāvitaṃ pariveṭhetvā viya ṭhitaṃ hoti, tasmā “samantato
analyzed: yasmai pana evam cira paribhāvitam pariveṭhetvā viya ṭhitam hoti tasmai samantataḥ
translated: But since it is as though it were lying there having been developed for a long time,

original: veṭhetvā viya ṭhitabhāvena anusayitataṃ dassetī”ti vuttaṃ. Tathā hi udake nimuggasadiso🔽udāhaṭo. “Sabbepi tebhūmakā dhammā kāmanīyaṭṭhena kāmā”tiādipāḷivasena bhavarāgassāpi
analyzed: veṭhetvā viya ṭhita bhāvena dasseti iti vuttam tathā hi udake nimugga sadisaḥ  sabbe api tebhūmakā dhammā kāmanīya ṭṭhena kāma ati ādi pāḷi vasena bhava rāgassa api
translated: it is said that “he shows that it lies underlying by lying all round it.” For this is like the simile of the man drowning in the water.🔽And the object-desire should be understood as the lust for existence too, according to the passage: “All states whatever that are in the three-strand classification are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensually enticing, sensual, and coveted” .

original: vatthukāmatā veditabbā. Rāgavasenāti ārammaṇarajjanavasena.
analyzed: vatthu kāma tā veditabbā rāga vasena ati ārammaṇa rajjana vasena
translated: By “lust” is meant the lust for the object.

original: 818. Indriyaviseso vineyyānaṃ indriyaparopariyattaṃ.
translated: The superiority of faculties is the superiority of the faculties of those to be trained.🔽The first is that which is to be abandoned,

original: 819. Pahātabbena upaddutanirodhanatthaṃ pahāyakaṃ pariyesatīti paṭhamaṃ pahātabbaṃ,
analyzed: pahātabbena upadduta nirodhana attham pahāyakam pariyesati iti paṭhamam pahātabbam
translated: because it is sought by the seeker of the abandoning of the suffering due to the abandoning.

original: pacchā pahāyakanti ayaṃ pahātabbapajahanakkamo pahānakkamapadena vutto. Yassāti pahātabbassa.
analyzed: pacchā pahāyakam ti ayam pahātabba pajahana kkamaḥ pahāna kkama padena vuttaḥ yassa ati pahātabbassa
translated: “Afterwards, what is to be abandoned” is the order of what is to be abandoned and the abandoning. “What” is what is to be abandoned.

original: Tanti pahātabbaṃ. Paṭhamaṃ vuccatīti pahānavicāraṇānaṃ paṭhamaṃ vuccati. Tato pacchā
analyzed: tat ti pahātabbam paṭhamam vuccati iti pahāna vicāraṇānam paṭhamam vuccati tatas pacchā
translated: “That” is what is to be abandoned. “Is said first” is said first of the kinds of reflection on what is to be abandoned. Afterwards

original: appahātabbaṃ yathā taṃ dassanattikādīsu.
analyzed: a ppahātabbam yathā tam dassa nattika ādīsu
translated: what is not to be abandoned is said, as in the case of seeing, etc.

original: 826. Tanti bhavaṅgaṃ. Tassāti lokuttarassa. Pādakanti antimabhavikassa bhavaṅgaṃ sandhāyāha.
analyzed: tat ti bhavaṅgam tassa ati lokuttarassa pādakam antimabhavikassa bhavaṅgam sandhāya āha
translated: “That” is the life-continuum. “Its” means that of the supramundane. “Foot” is said with reference to the life-continuum of one in his last existence.

original: Chaṭṭhabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: chaṭṭha bala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the explanation of the sixth power is ended.

original: Sattamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sattama bala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: Explanation of the seventh power

original: 828. Samāpannomhīti maññatīti attho.
analyzed: samāpannaḥ aham iti maññati iti attho
translated: The meaning is: he thinks “I have attained.”

original: Samādhi vā tassa ārammaṇabhūtaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ vā cittamañjūsāti yojanā. Ṭhapetunti yathāparicchinnaṃ kālaṃ samāpatticittaṃ pavattetuṃ.
analyzed: samādhi vā tassa ārammaṇa bhūtam kammaṭṭhānam vā cittamañjūsā ati yojanā ṭhapetum ti yathā paricchinnam kālam samāpatti cittam pavattetum
translated: The application is: concentration or the meditation subject that is the object of that is the mind’s delight. “To set aside” is to cause the consciousness of attainment to continue for the time determined.

original: Tehīti saññāmanasikārehi. Taṃsabhāvatāti kāmādidutiyajjhānādianupakkhandanasabhāvatā. Paguṇavodānaṃ paguṇabhāvasiddhā jhānassa paṭipakkhato visuddhi.
analyzed: tehi iti saññā manasikārehi tad sabhāva tā ti kāma ādi dutiya jhāna ādi anupakkhandana sabhāva tā paguṇa vodānam paguṇa bhāva siddhā jhānassa paṭipakkhataḥ visuddhi
translated: “By those” is by the kinds of perception. “That state” is the state of not being adjacent to the second jhāna, etc., beginning with the first. The “arousing of what is profitable” is the purification of the jhāna from its opposite by establishing the profitable.

original: Sattamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sattama bala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Description of the Seventh Power

original: Dasamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Description of the Tenth Power

original: 831. Paññāva vimuttīti rāgādīhi vimuttibhūtā paññāva vimuttīti yojanā. Kammantarassa🔽vipākantaramevāti attho vipākantarajānanasseva dutiyabalakiccattā, kammantarajānanassa
analyzed: vimutti iti rāga ādīhi vimutti bhūtā paññā ava vimutti iti yojanā kammantarassa  vipāka antaram evā ti atthaḥ vipāka antara jānanassa iva dutiya bala kicca ttā kamma antara jānanassa
translated: “Understanding is the deliverance”: the construing is “understanding is the deliverance that is the deliverance from lust, etc.”🔽“The interval of kamma is the interval of kamma’s result”: the meaning is that the interval of kamma’s result is the interval of kamma’s result. Because the second power has the function of knowing the interval of kamma’s result, and the third power has the function of knowing the interval of kamma.

original: ca tatiyabalakiccattā. Balasadisatanti ekaccabalasadisataṃ. Kasmā panettha balañāṇakicce
analyzed: ca tatiya bala kiccattā bala sadisa tanti ekacca bala sadisa tam kasmā pana ittha bala ñāṇa kicce
translated: “The resemblance to a power”: the resemblance to a certain power.

original: vuccamāne jhānādiabalañāṇaṃ udāhaṭanti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “yadipī”tiādi. Tadantogadhanti
analyzed: vuccamāne jhāna ādi abala ñāṇam udāhaṭanti codanam sandhāya āha yadi pi itiādi
translated: “But why is the knowledge of jhāna, etc., mentioned when the functions of the powers and the kinds of knowledge are being given?”—This is a question asked by way of a criticism. The answer is given in the words “Although it is not a power, etc.”🔽“Included in that”: included in the seventh power, which is the knowledge of reviewing jhāna, etc.

original: tasmiṃ jhānādipaccavekkhaṇāsabhāve sattamabalañāṇe antogadhaṃ. Evanti jhānādiñāṇaṃ
analyzed: tasmin jhāna ādi paccavekkhaṇa a sabhāve sattama bala ñāṇe antogadham jhāna ādi ñāṇam
translated: “In the same way”: like the knowledge of jhāna, etc.

original: viya. Appetuṃ, vikubbituñcāti attanā vuttākāraṃ sandhāyāha. Samudayappahānādiekaccañāṇakiccampi
analyzed: viya appetum vikubbitum ca ati attanā vutta ākāram sandhāya āha samudaya ppahāna ādi ekacca ñāṇa kiccam pi
translated: “To make it disappear and to alter it”: the words “to make it disappear” and “to alter it” are said with reference to the mode of expression used by the commentator.

original: akarontaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ kathamappanādikaṃ jhānādikiccaṃ kareyya, balañāṇehi pana
analyzed: a karontam sabbaññu tad ññāṇam katham appanā ādikam jhāna ādi kiccam kareyya bala ñāṇehi pana
translated: “How can the knowledge of omniscience, which does not perform the function of knowing some things such as the abandoning of origination, etc., perform the function of making disappear, etc., which is the function of the knowledge of the powers?”

original: jānitabbaṃ, tato uttariñca jānantampi yasmā ekaccabalakiccaṃ na karoti, tasmā aññāneva🔽balañāṇāni, aññaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇanti dassanatthaṃ “etesaṃ pana kiccaṃ na sabbaṃ karotī”tiādi
analyzed: jānitabbam tatas uttariñca jānantam pi yasmai ekacca bala kiccam na karoti tasmai  bala ñāṇāni aññam sabbaññuta ññāṇan ti dassana attham etesam pana kiccam na sabbam karoti itiādi
translated: and although it knows more than that, still it does not perform the function of the power of knowledge of omniscience.🔽So it is said in the commentary, “It does not perform all the functions of that power” .

original: aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha yathā sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ abalakiccaṃ ekaccaṃ na karoti,
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam tattha yathā sabbaññuta ññāṇam abala kiccam ekaccam na karoti
translated: Herein, just as the knowledge of omniscience does not perform the function of the power of knowledge of omniscience,🔽so too it does not perform the function of the power of knowledge of the recollection of past lives, etc.,

original: evaṃ balakiccampīti udāharaṇadassanavasena “tañhi jhānaṃ hutvā appetu”ntiādi vuttanti🔽dassetuṃ “atha vā…pe… daṭṭhabba”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evam bala kiccam pi iti udāharaṇa dassana vasena tat hi jhānam hutvā appetuṃ tiādi vuttanti  dassetum atha vāpe daṭṭhabbanti vuttam
translated: and it does not perform the function of the power of knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: Dasamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dasama bala niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the ten powers is ended.

original: Ñāṇavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ñāṇa vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of knowledge is ended.

original: 17. Khuddakavatthuvibhaṅgo
analyzed: khuddaka vatthu vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The Analysis of Minor Matters

original: 1. Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽843-4. Atthipaṭiccaṃ nāmāti atthitā paṭiccattho nāma, asatipi sahajātapurejātādibhāve
analyzed: atthi paṭiccam nāma ati atthi tā paṭiccatthaḥ nāma asati pi sahajāta purejāta ādi bhāve
translated: The Description of the Uncles🔽“The meaning of ‘with the existence of this, that exists’”: the meaning of ‘with the existence of this, that exists’ is the existence of the condition.🔽Even though there is no such thing as ‘conascence’, ‘precedence’, etc.,

original: yasmiṃ sati yaṃ hoti, so tassa paccayoti katvā yathā tathā atthitāmattaṃ idha paṭiccatthoti
analyzed: yasmin sati yam hoti saḥ tassa paccayaḥ ti katvā yathā tathā atthi tā mattam idha paṭiccattho ti
translated: still, when this exists, that comes to be, and so it is because of that that the mere fact of existence is here called ‘the meaning of condition’ in such passages as ‘With ignorance as condition there are formations’ .

original: attho. Taṃ pana paṭiccatthaṃ byatirekamukhena pākaṭataraṃ kātuṃ “yathā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: attho tam pana paṭiccattham byatireka mukhena pākaṭataram kātum yathā iti ādim āha
translated: The meaning is this. But in order to make the meaning of the clause “because of” more evident by the method of the reverse order of exposition, he said “as follows.”

original: Tattha nissayādipaccayabhāvena paṭiccāti vuttanti nissayādipaccayabhāvato paccayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: tattha nissaya ādi paccaya bhāvena paṭicca ati vuttan ti nissaya ādi paccaya bhāvataḥ paccaya bhūtam
translated: Herein, “because of” is said because of the state of the conditions of support, etc.;

original: cakkhādi “paṭiccā”ti vuttaṃ. Ekissā seṇiyāti aṭṭhārasasu seṇīsu mayaṃ amukāya seṇiyā
analyzed: cakkha ādi paṭicca iti vuttam ekissā seṇiyā ti aṭṭhārasasu seṇīsu mayam amukāya seṇiyā
translated: the eye, etc., are called “because of” because of the state of the conditions of support, etc., and because of the state of being a condition.

original: jātāmha, na aññe viya appaññātāti evamettha atthaṃ vadanti.
analyzed: na aññe viya appaññātā ti evam ettha attham vadanti
translated: “In one army” : we are born in such and such an army, not in another, as if we were known, is the meaning here, they say.

original: Purato karaṇaṃ pamukhabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Nidhānarāsīti nidahitvā ṭhapitadhananicayo. Yasoti
analyzed: puratas karaṇam nidhāna rāsi iti nidahitvā
translated: “The state of being in front” is the state of being in the forefront. “The store of treasure” is the store of wealth laid by. “Glory” is

original: issariyaṃ. Taṃ pana yesu vattati, tesu paṭṭhāpakaāṇākaraṇehi pākaṭo hotīti “paṭṭhāpakamado,
analyzed: issariyam tam pana yesu vattati tesu paṭṭhāpaka āṇa akaraṇehi pākaṭaḥ hoti iti paṭṭhāpaka madaḥ
translated: sovereignty. But that is evident in those who are the instigators and the doers of the instigation, so it is said “the intoxication of being an instigator,

original: āṇākaraṇamado”ti ca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca vuttam
translated: the intoxication of being a doer of the instigation.”

original: 845. Vatthunāti jātiādipavattihetunā.
analyzed: vatthunā ati jāti ādi pavatti hetunā
translated: “The state of being a basis” is the state of being a basis for the occurrence of birth, etc.

original: 846. Patiṭṭhābhāvoti kusalakammesu patiṭṭhānābhāvo, so pana yasmā kusalakiriyāya
analyzed: patiṭṭhā bhāvo ti kusala kammesu patiṭṭhāna abhāvo so pana yasmai kusala kiriyāya
translated: “The state of non-establishment” is the non-establishment in profitable action. But that is evident in those who are the instigators and the doers of the instigation, so it is said “the intoxication of being an instigator,🔽the intoxication of being a doer of the instigation.”

original: ṭhānaṃ na hoti, tasmā “kusalakaraṇe aṭṭhāna”nti āha. Pamādasaṅkhātassa atthassa evamādiko
analyzed: ṭhānam na hoti tasmā kusala karaṇe aṭṭhānan ti āha pamāda saṅkhātassa atthassa evamādiko
translated: The method of interpretation is as follows: “The meaning of negligence, etc., is the method of interpretation of the words of the verse beginning with ‘negligence.’ “

original: pariyāyoti yojanā. Ādi-saddena “vacīduccarite, manoduccarite cittassa vossaggo, makkho,
analyzed: yojanā ādi saddena vacī duccarite manaḥ duccarite cittassa vossaggaḥ makkhaḥ
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include verbal misconduct, mental misconduct, the relinquishing of the mind, conceit,

original: paḷāso”ti ca evamādikassa saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. “Pamādo pamajjanādī”tiādiko tadatthappakāsako,
analyzed: paḷāsaḥ iti ca evamādikassa saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo pamādaḥ pamajjana ādi iti ādiko tad attha ppakāsako
translated: and insolence. The method of interpretation of the meaning of the words beginning with “negligence” is as follows: “Negligence is the non-performance of what is wholesome, etc.”

original: “cittassa vossaggo vossaggānuppādana”ntiādiko tappariyāyappakāsako byañjanapariyāyo🔽ca apariyantoti sambandho. “Cattāro khandhe dassetī”ti iminā sativossaggākārappavattā
analyzed: cittassa vossaggaḥ tad pariyāya ppakāsakaḥ byañjana pariyāyo  ca apariyantaḥ ti sambandho cattāraḥ khandhe dasseti iti iminā sati vossagga ākāra ppavattā
translated: The method of interpretation of the words beginning with “the relinquishing of the mind” is as follows: “The relinquishing of the mind is the non-arising of relinquishment.”🔽The connection is as follows: “The four aggregates” is connected with “the relinquishing of mindfulness.”

original: cattāro akusalakkhandhā pamādoti vadati.
analyzed: cattāro akusala kkhandhā pamādaḥ ti vadati
translated: By this, he says that the four unprofitable aggregates, which occur in the mode of the relinquishing of mindfulness, are negligence.

original: 847. Anivātavuttitāya hetubhūto cittasampaggaho mānaviseso.
translated: The special kind of conceit, which is the cause of the state of being unfirm, is the relinquishing of the mind.

original: 848. Uttarabhāvo uttariyaṃ, karaṇena uttariyaṃ karaṇuttariyaṃ, sārambhena parassa kiriyato uttarikiriyā.
analyzed: uttara bhāvaḥ uttariyam karaṇena uttariyam karaṇuttariyam sa ārambhena parassa kiriyataḥ uttari kiriyā
translated: The state of being superior is the superior state. The superior state of action is the superior state of action. The superior action is the action that is superior to the action of another by means of exertion.

original: 849. Neruttikavidhānenāti i-kāracca-kārānañca ra-kāratāpādanena.
analyzed: neruttika vidhānena ati rakāra tā āpādanena
translated: By the method of the negative particle: by making the i and the c into the r.

original: Attahitaṃ attāti uttarapadalopena niddesamāha yathā “rūpabhavo rūpaṃ, bhīmaseno bhīmo”ti ca. Ādinno, patto vā attho attāti niruttinayena padasiddhi veditabbā.
analyzed: atta hitam attā iti uttara pada lopena niddesam āha yathā rūpa bhavaḥ rūpam bhīmasenaḥ bhīmaḥ iti ca ādinnaḥ pattaḥ vā atthaḥ attā iti nirutti nayena pada siddhi veditabbā
translated: The meaning of the compound is given by ellipsis of the word “self” in the first term, as in the expressions “materiality is form” and “Bhīmasena is Bhima.” The word “self” is to be understood as the meaning of the compound in the sense of the negative particle, as in the expression “the meaning of the compound is ‘not other than self.’”

original: Mudditassāti aṅkitassa.
analyzed: mudditassa ati aṅkitassa
translated: Marked: branded.

original: 850. Jānantasseva mahājanassa. Upādānādipaccayeti indhanudakacīvarādike pāripūrihetuke.
analyzed: jānantassa iva mahājanassa upādāna ādi paccaye iti indhan udaka cīvara ādike pāripūri hetuke
translated: Of the great multitude that knows: of the multitude that knows the cause for the completion of the requisites such as fuel, water, robes, etc.

original: 851. Gaṇṭhikā sayaṃ gaṇṭhikaraṇato. Patirūpavacanato, aññesaṃ gaṇṭhibhedato ca gaṇṭhibhūtā.
analyzed: gaṇṭhikā sayam gaṇṭhi karaṇato pati rūpa vacanataḥ aññesam gaṇṭhi bhedato ca gaṇṭhi bhūtā
translated: The knot: it is a knot because it is tied by oneself, because it is a suitable expression, and because it is a knot that is different from others.

original: 852. Abhejjantaratāya samāsevitatāya suṭṭhu āsevitatāya.
analyzed: a bhejjantara tāya samāsevita tāya suṭṭhu āsevita tāya
translated: Not to be untied: not to be untied because of being well used.

original: 853. Cirakālaparibhāvitattena temanakaraṇaṃ allabhāvakaraṇaṃ, lobhavasena avassavananti attho.
analyzed: cira kāla paribhāvita ttena temana karaṇam alla bhāva karaṇam lobha vasena avassavanam ti attho
translated: Because it is long-developed: because it is long-developed, it is the making of a rut, the making of a wet place; the meaning is: because of the flowing of greed.

original: Evaṃ sante kathaṃ khīyananti niddesoti āha “khīyananti cā”tiādi.
analyzed: evam sante katham khīyana nti niddeso ti āha khīyana nti ca atiādi
translated: If that is so, how is it said to be “the wasting away” in the description?

original: 854. Cīvaramaṇḍanādīnanti cīvaramaṇḍanā pattamaṇḍanā senāsanamaṇḍanāti imesaṃ. Idāni taṃ visesanabhāvaṃ yojetvā dassetuṃ “cīvarena hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: cīvara maṇḍana ādīnam ti cīvara maṇḍanā patta maṇḍanā senāsana maṇḍanā ati imesam idāni tam visesana bhāvam yojetvā dassetum cīvarena hi itiādi vuttam
translated: “In the case of the embellishment of robes, etc.”: the embellishment of robes, the embellishment of bowls, and the embellishment of resting places. Now, in order to show the difference by connecting it, it is said: “With robes, etc.”

original: 855. Sabhāgarahito, sabhāgapaṭipakkho vā asabhāgo, ananukūlānaṃ paṭikkūlatā vā. Tenāha “mānathaddhatā, virodho vā”ti.
analyzed: sabhāga rahitaḥ sabhāga paṭipakkhaḥ vā asabhāgaḥ ananukūlānam paṭikkūla tā vā tena āha virodhaḥ vā iti
translated: “Dissimilar” is either devoid of similarity or the opposite of similarity, or else the unsuitability of unsuitable things. Hence he said: “The state of being hard and stiff, or else opposition.”

original: 856. Saṅkampanā ukkaṇṭhanāvasena anavaṭṭhānaṃ, anavadhānaṃ vā. Tassa tassa ārammaṇassa taṇhāyanā.
analyzed: saṅkampanā ukkaṇṭhanā vasena anavaṭṭhānam anavadhānam vā tassa tassa ārammaṇassa taṇhāyanā
translated: “Unsettledness” is non-steadiness by way of anxiety and restlessness, or else inattention. “Craving for” is the desire for this or that object.

original: 857. Kāyassāti nāmakāyassa. Tasmiñhi avipphārike rūpakāyopi avipphāriko hoti.
analyzed: kāyassa ati nāma kāyassa tasmin hi avipphārike rūpa kāyaḥ api avipphārikaḥ hoti
translated: “The body” is the mental body. For when that is not pliable, the material body also is not pliable.

original: 860. Rāgādīnanti rāgamohaahirikānottappavicikicchādīnaṃ.🔽861. Tividhampi kuhanavatthuṃ dassetunti sambandho. Tatthāti mahāniddese. “Tattha
analyzed: rāga ādīnam ti rāga moha ahirika anottappa vicikicchā ādīnam  tividham pi kuhana vatthum dassetun ti sambandhaḥ tattha ati mahāniddese tattha
translated: “Lust, etc.”: lust, delusion, lack of shame, lack of fear, doubt, etc.

original: katamā kuhanā lābhasakkārasilokasannissitassā”tiādinā idha khuddakavibhaṅge āgataṃ
analyzed: katamā kuhanā lābha sakkāra siloka sannissitassa ati ādinā idha khuddaka vibhaṅge āgatam
translated: The construction is: “in order to show the three kinds of grounds for hypocrisy.” “There” is in the Mahāniddesa. “Therein, what is hypocrisy? That which, depending on gain, etc.” is stated in the Khuddakavatthu of the Abhidhamma as follows:

original: desanānayaṃ nissāya mahāniddesadesanā pavattāti āha “nissayabhūtāya imāya pāḷiyā”ti.
analyzed: desanā nayam nissāya mahāniddesa desanā pavattā ati āha nissaya bhūtāya imāya pāḷiyā ati
translated: The Great Discourse on the Nidana is given in the form of a teaching, and so he says, “with this text as the basis.”

original: Antarahitānīti antavikalāni chindantāni.
analyzed: anta rahitāni iti anta vikalāni
translated: “With gaps” means with gaps, with interruptions.

original: Lābhasakkārasilokahetu sambhāvanādhippāyena saṃyatākāradassanaṃ kohaññanti āha “pāpicchatāya
analyzed: lābha sakkāra siloka hetu sambhāvanā adhippāyena saṃyata ākāra dassanam kohaññanti āha pāpa icchatāya
translated: “Malice” is the showing of a controlled appearance for the sake of gain, honour, and fame, with the intention of being respected. He says, “Malice is the desire for evil.”

original: niratthakakāyavacīvipphandaniggahaṇaṃ koraja”nti. Yo saṃvegabahulo kukkuccako pubbenāparaṃ🔽attanopi kiriyaṃ parisaṅkanto paccavekkhamāno tiṭṭhati, tādisaṃ viya attānaṃ dassento
analyzed: niratthaka kāya vacī vipphanda niggahaṇam korajanti yo saṃvega bahulo kukkuccako pubbena aparam  attanaḥ api kiriyam parisaṅkantaḥ paccavekkhamāno tiṭṭhati tādisam viya attānam dassento
translated: “Foolish talk” is the restraint of purposeless bodily and verbal contortions.🔽“Over-scrupulous” is said to be one who, like one who is full of anxiety, is remorseful, and who stands reflecting on his own actions, suspecting them.

original: “atiparisaṅkito”ti vutto.
analyzed: atiparisaṅkito ti vutto
translated: “Over-scrupulous” is said to be one who, like one who is full of anxiety, is remorseful, and who stands reflecting on his own actions, suspecting them.

original: 864. Pasaṃsāmukhena nindananti pasaṃsāvatthuto khipanaṃ bahi chaḍḍanaṃ yathā “adāyakaṃ aho dānapatī”ti.
analyzed: pasaṃsā mukhena nindanam ti pasaṃsā vatthutaḥ khipanam bahi chaḍḍanam yathā a dāyakam aho dānapati iti
translated: “Disparaging by way of praise” is the throwing away of the basis for praise, the casting out, as if saying, “He is not a giver, he is a lord of giving.”

original: 865. Gavesanakammanti appakena lābhena mahantassa pariyesanakabyāpāro.
analyzed: gavesana kammanti appakena lābhena mahantassa pariyesanaka byāpāraḥ
translated: “The act of seeking” is the great effort of seeking for much gain with little gain.

original: 866. Pokkharaṃ vuccati sundaraṃ, vaṇṇassa sundarabhāvo vaṇṇapāripūrī hotīti āha “vaṇṇapāripūrī vā vaṇṇapokkharatā”ti.
analyzed: pokkharam vuccati sundaram vaṇṇassa sundara bhāvaḥ vaṇṇa pāripūrī hoti iti āha vaṇṇa pāripūrī vā vaṇṇa pokkhara tā ti
translated: “Beauty” is what is called “beautiful” . The fulfilment of beauty is the perfection of beauty, thus he said “fulfilment of beauty, perfection of beauty” .

original: 879. Seyyamānādiniddesesūti “tattha katamo seyyassa ‘seyyohamasmī’ti māno”tiādinā🔽niddiṭṭhesu navasu mānaniddesesu. “Seyyādipuggalo”ti idaṃ tattha pāḷiyaṃ seyyādīnaṃ🔽navannaṃ puggalānaṃ āmaṭṭhattā vuttaṃ. Idha pana puggalāmasane sati seyyapuggalo
analyzed: seyyamāna ādi niddesesu ti tattha katamo seyyassa seyyā uham asmi iti māno ti ādinā  niddiṭṭhesu navasu māna niddesesu seyyā ādi puggalo ti idam tattha pāḷiyam seyyā ādīnam  navannam puggalānam āmaṭṭha ttā vuttam idha pana puggala āmasane sati seyya puggalo
translated: In the description of the nine kinds of conceit beginning thus “Herein, what is conceit? ‘I am superior’—conceit” ,

original: ca āmasitabbo siyā. Tenevāha “seyyamānabhāvepī”ti. Seyyamānabhāvepīti pi-saddo ākaḍḍhako🔽aseyyamānaniddesepi puggalāmasanassa katattā. Yassa kassacīti seyyādīsu yassa kassaci puggalassa.
analyzed: ca āmasitabbaḥ siyā tena iva āha seyyamāna bhāve iti seyyamāna bhāve iti pi saddaḥ ākaḍḍhakaḥ  a seyyamāna niddese pi puggala amasanassa kata ttā yassa kassaci iti seyya ādīsu yassa kassaci puggalassa
translated: in the passage “one who is superior, etc.,” the nine kinds of persons beginning with the superior are mentioned in the text because they are to be touched. But here, if there is a touching of persons, a superior person might be touched. Hence he said “in the state of being touched as superior,” etc. The word “also” in the phrase “in the state of being touched as superior, etc.,”🔽is meant to include the description of the conceit of being inferior.🔽“Of anyone at all” : of any person at all among the superior, etc.

original: 880. Purimamānassāti pubbe pavattassa sadisamānassa, hīnamānassa vā, sadisamānavaseneva pana pāḷi āgatā.
analyzed: purima mānassa ati pubbe pavattassa sadisa mānassa hīna mānassa vā sadisa māna vasena iva pana pāḷi āgatā
translated: “Of the conceit that occurred before” : of the conceit that occurred previously, which was similar to the conceit that occurred before, or of the conceit that was inferior. But the text occurs in the way it does because of the similarity of the conceit.

original: 881. “Migānaṃ kotthuko anto, pakkhīnaṃ pana vāyaso”ti vacanato āha “pakkhijātīsu vāyaso anto lāmako”ti.
analyzed: migānam kotthukaḥ antar pakkhīnam pana vāyasaḥ iti vacanataḥ āha pakkhi jātīsu vāyasaḥ antar lāmakaḥ ti
translated: “The bird’s is the air,” he said, because of the words, “The bird’s is the air, the deer’s is the wood” .

original: 882. Virāganti arahattaṃ.
analyzed: virāganti arahattam
translated: “The heart’s is Nibbāna” : the heart’s is the heart’s concern, that is to say, arahatship.

original: 883. Mānasampayuttacchando taṇhāchando. Mānasabhāvaṃ anugato seyyādito sampaggaṇhanavasena pavatto mānasampayuttakattukamyatāchando vā mānacchando.
analyzed: māna sampayutta chandaḥ taṇhā chandaḥ mānasa bhāvam anugataḥ sampaggaṇhana vasena pavattaḥ māna sampayutta kattu kamyatā chandaḥ vā māna chandaḥ
translated: “The heart’s longing” is craving associated with the heart. Or the heart’s longing is the desire to will associated with the heart, which occurs as taking delight in what is good, and so on.

original: 884. Tatthāti tasmiṃ vilambane nipphādetabbe. Yuttaṃ anucchavikaṃ. Muttaṃ vissaṭṭhaṃ. Siliṭṭhaṃ sahitaṃ, atthadvayavibhāvakaṃ vā.
analyzed: tattha ati tasmim vilambane nipphādetabbe yuttam anucchavikam muttam vissaṭṭham siliṭṭham sahitam attha dvaya vibhāvakam vā
translated: “Is fitting” : is suitable. “Is free” : is unfettered. “Is well-knit” : is coherent, or it is connected with the two meanings.

original: 888. Anuddayassevāti mettāyantassa viya anukampantassa viya vikappanāti āha “sahananditādikassā”ti,
analyzed: anuddayassa iva iti mettāyantassa viya anukampantassa viya vikappanā ati āha saha nandita ādikassa ati
translated: “As if with compassion” : as if with loving-kindness. “Imagining” : he said “the heart’s longing for the same delight, etc.,”

original: mettādipatirūpena pavattagehasitasinehassāti attho. Tenāha “tādiso rāgo”ti. Attho
analyzed: metta ādi patirūpena tena āha tādisaḥ rāgaḥ ti attho
translated: meaning that it occurs as if it were loving-kindness, etc., and as if it were affection for the person. Hence he said “such desire” .🔽The meaning is fitting.

original: yujjatīti evampi “tatthā”ti pāḷipadassa attho yujjati. Parānuddayatāhetuko hi parānuddayatāsahito so vitakkoti.
analyzed: yujjati iti evam pi tattha ati pāḷi padassa atthaḥ yujjati parānuddaya tā hetukaḥ hi parānuddaya tā sahitaḥ saḥ vitakkoti
translated: Thus the meaning of the words “the heart’s longing” is fitting too, for that thought is accompanied by compassion and has compassion as its cause.

original: 890. Kāmaguṇapāripūriyā yebhuyyena loko sambhāvetīti āha “anavaññattatthameva kāmaguṇe ca patthetī”ti.
analyzed: kāma guṇa pāripūriyā yebhuyyena lokaḥ sambhāveti iti āha anavaññatta ttham eva kāma guṇe ca pattheti iti
translated: He is honoured by the world for perfecting the strands of sensual pleasure, thus it is said: “He seeks the strands of sensual pleasure for the sake of non-remorse only.”

original: Ekakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ekaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on single terms is finished.

original: 2. Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on double terms

original: 891. Bandhatīti kujjhanākāraṃ bandhati ghaṭeti. Upanāho hi āghātavatthunā cittaṃ bandhanto viya hoti, yato aññathā pavattitvāpi avidite upanāhe āghātavatthusannissitova hoti.
analyzed: bandhati iti kujjhana ākāram bandhati ghaṭa iti upanāhaḥ hi āghāta vatthunā cittam bandhantaḥ viya hoti yatas aññathā avidite upanāhe āghāta vatthu sannissito va hoti
translated: He binds: he binds, he causes to be bound, the mode of annoyance. For annoyance is like a binding of the mind by a basis for annoyance, since it is only when there is no annoyance that the mind occurs otherwise.

original: 892. Dantehi chinditvāti dantehi chinditvā viya ekadesaṃ apanetvā ekadesaṃ gahetvāti adhippāyo.🔽894. Accayaṃ katvāti vītikkamaṃ katvā. Paṭicchādaneti attanā katassa accayassa paṭicchādane.
analyzed: dantehi chinditvā ati dantehi chinditvā viya eka desam apanetvā eka desam gahetvā ati adhippāyaḥ  accayam katvā ati vītikkamam katvā paṭicchādane iti attanā katassa accayassa paṭicchādane
translated: He tears with his teeth: the intention is that he tears off a part as if he were tearing with his teeth, and he holds on to a part.🔽Having made an accusation: having made an offence. In concealing: in concealing what he has done.

original: Vocchindanaṃ vītikkamakiriyāya appaṭijānavasena upacchindanaṃ, vocchindanena chādanā vocchindanachādanā.
analyzed: vocchindanam vītikkama kiriyāya appaṭijāna vasena upacchindanam vā ucchindanena chādanā vā ucchindana chādanā
translated: Concealing is the concealing by not admitting the offence. Concealing by concealing is the concealing by concealing the offence.

original: Asammābhāsane saṭha-saddo loke niruḷhoti āha “yo na sammā bhāsati, so saṭho”ti. Saṭhassa
analyzed: a sammā bhāsane saṭha saddo loke niruḷhaḥ ti āha yaḥ na sammā bhāsati saḥ saṭho ti saṭhassa
translated: The world’s usage of the word “deceitful” for “one who does not speak rightly” is referred to in the words “one who does not speak rightly is deceitful.”

original: yakkhasūkarasadisataṃ dassento “kucchi vā piṭhi vā jānituṃ na sakkā”ti āha, indajālasadiso vā eso daṭṭhabbo.🔽Yo sabbathā vipannajjhāsayopi samāno kāyavacībhedamattena attānaṃ sampannaṃ viya
analyzed: yakkha sūkara sadisa tam dassento kucchi vā piṭhi vā jānitum na sakkā iti āha inda jāla sadisaḥ vā eso daṭṭhabbo  yaḥ sabbathā vipanna jjhāsayaḥ api samānaḥ kāya vacī bheda mattena attānam sampannam viya
translated: The simile of the yakkha and the pig is given to show that the deceitful person is like a pig in that his belly and back cannot be known. Or he can be regarded as like a net of Indra.🔽Though his inclinations are all perverted, he shows himself as though perfect by means of mere bodily and verbal distinctions, and he deceives the world by speaking otherwise than he thinks.

original: dassetvā lokaṃ vañcento aññathā santaṃ aññathā pavedeti. Tenāha “tenetaṃ sāṭheyyaṃ🔽māyāto balavatarā vañcanāti daṭṭhabba”nti. Santadosapaṭicchādanameva hi māyā. Tenevāti
analyzed: dassetvā lokam vañcentaḥ aññathā santam aññathā paveda iti tena āha tena itam sāṭheyyam  māyātaḥ balavatarā vañcanā ati daṭṭhabbanti santa dosa paṭicchādanam eva hi māyā tena iva ati
translated: Therefore it should be regarded as a deception more deceitful than a deception,🔽for a deception is merely the concealing of one’s true feelings. Therefore,

original: balavataravañcanābhāveneva. Daḷhakerāṭiyañhi “parikkhatatā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: balavatara vañcanā bhāvena iva daḷha kerāṭiyam hi parikkhata tā ti vuttam
translated: because of its being a deception more deceitful than a deception. For the word “parikkhatatā” is said to be like a strong rope.🔽Even though there is no such thing as a deception more deceitful than a deception,

original: 908. Abhāvepīti pi-saddena “ko pana vādo bhāve”ti dasseti. Yadipi hi puthujjanānaṃ,
analyzed: abhāve pi iti pi saddena kaḥ pana vādaḥ bhāve ti dasseti yadi api hi puthujjanānam
translated: the word “pi” shows that there is no need to speak of its existence. For even though it is not found in ordinary men,

original: ekaccānañca sekkhānaṃ yathārahaṃ attābhinivesādīhi katūpakāraṃ rūparāgādisaṃyojanakiccaṃ
analyzed: ekaccānam ca sekkhānam yathāraham attā abhinivesa ādīhi katu upakāram rūpa rāga ādi saṃyojana kiccam
translated: in some disciples in training, and in some of those beyond training, still it is said to be found in the Buddha’s Dispensation, which is rich in wonders.

original: sādheti, ekaccānaṃ pana vinā eva tehīti kassacipi kilesassa avikkhambhitattā kathañcipi
analyzed: sādha iti ekaccānam pana vinā eva tehi iti kassacipi kilesassa a vikkhambhita ttā kathañcipi
translated: and some are established by means of these three alone. But because some defilement is not suppressed in some, some kind of …

original: avimutto kāmabhavo ajjhattaggahaṇassa visesapaccayoti “ajjhatta”nti vuccati, tadabhāvato🔽“bahiddhā”ti laddhavohāre rūpārūpabhave kevalampi saṃyojanakiccaṃ sādhentaṃ pavattatīti,
analyzed: avimuttaḥ kāma bhavaḥ ajjhatta gahaṇassa visesa paccayaḥ ti ajjhattan ti vuccati tad abhāvato  bahiddhā ati laddha vohāre rūpa arūpa bhave kevalam pi saṃyojana kiccam sādhentam pavattati iti
translated: is not liberated. The sensual-desire realm is called “internal” because it is a special condition for the internal grasping. Because it does not exist,🔽the form and formless realms are called “external.” It occurs accomplishing the function of fettering only.

original: tato eva rūpārūpāvacarasattānaṃ bahiddhāsaṃyojanabhāvahetajātanti ca “bahiddhāsaṃyojana”nti
analyzed: tatas eva rūpa arūpa avacara sattānam ca
translated: Therefore it is called “external fetter” because it is the cause for the external fettering of beings in the form and formless realms.

original: vuccatīti imamatthamāha “sakkāyadiṭṭhādīnaṃ…pe… yojanaṃ nāmā”ti.
analyzed: vuccati iti imam attham āha yojanam nāma ati
translated: This is the meaning of the words “The fetter called embodiment-view, etc., is … called ‘internal’ and ‘external.’“

original: Dukaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: duka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on the dyads is finished.

original: 3. Tikaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tika niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on the triads

original: 909. Avijjābhavataṇhāhi viya issāmacchariyadomanassādisahāyabhūtena dosenapi bhavābhisaṅkharaṇaṃ hotīti “akusalamūlāneva vaṭṭamūlānī”ti. Tenāha “tīhi…pe… kathito”ti.
analyzed: avijjā bhava taṇhāhi viya issā macchariya domanassa ādi sahāya bhūtena dosena api bhava abhisaṅkharaṇam hoti iti akusala mūlāni eva vaṭṭa mūlāni iti tena āha tīhipe kathitā iti
translated: Just as with ignorance and craving for being, so too with the roots of the unprofitable, for the formation of being is also done by the roots of the unprofitable together with their associates, such as envy, avarice, and grief. That is why it is said that “the roots of the unprofitable are the roots of the round.” That is why it is said that “the round is stated with the three … “.

original: 919. Rūpārūpāvacaravipākānaṃ santapaṇītabhāvena uḷāratamattā tattha sātisayo bhavarāgo vutto.
analyzed: rūpa arūpāvacara vipākānam santa paṇīta bhāvena uḷāratama tā tattha sa atisayaḥ bhava rāgaḥ vutto
translated: Since the resultant kinds of materiality in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming are more and more sublime, craving for becoming is said to be more and more intense there.

original: 920. Mānena ṭhapanāti mānena seyyādivasena attano ṭhapanā. Ṭhapanāti ca dahanā, paggaṇhanā vā.
analyzed: mānena ṭhapanā ati mānena seyyā ādi vasena attano ṭhapanā ṭhapanā ati ca dahanā paggaṇhanā vā
translated: “By conceit, by placing”: by placing oneself as better, etc., by conceit. “Placing” is making to be high or making to be foremost.

original: 921. Taṃsampayuttāti dosasampayuttā.
analyzed: tad sampayuttā ati dosa sampayuttā
translated: “Associated with that”: associated with hate.

original: 922. Tesaṃ vaṇṇabhedanti tesaṃ jīvānaṃ vaṇṇavisesaṃ, tesaṃ vā tathā kathentānaṃ sutvā.
analyzed: tesam tesam jīvānam vaṇṇa visesam tesam vā tathā kathentānam sutvā
translated: “Their colour’s difference”: the difference in the colour of those living beings, or after hearing those who speak thus.

original: Byāpīti sakalalokabyāpī, sakalasarīrabyāpī vā. Parimaṇḍaloti paramāṇuppamāṇo hutvā
analyzed: byāpī iti sakala loka byāpī sakala sarīra byāpī vā parimaṇḍalaḥ ti paramāṇu ppamāṇaḥ hutvā
translated: “Pervading”: pervading the whole world, or pervading the whole body. “Round”: having become the size of an atom, it is round.

original: parimaṇḍalo. Ādi-saddena aṅguṭṭhappamāṇo vayappamāṇotiādikaṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: parimaṇḍalaḥ ādi saddena aṅguṭṭha ppamāṇaḥ vaya ppamāṇaḥ ti ādikam saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The word “etc.” includes the size of a thumb, the size of a finger, and so on.

original: 923. Utuvipariṇāmajo sītādiutuviparivattajāto. Opakkamiko attano, parassa vā tādisaupakkamanibbatto.
analyzed: utu vipariṇāma jaḥ sītā ādi utu viparivatta jātaḥ opakkamikaḥ attanaḥ parassa vā
translated: “Caused by change of temperature”: born of the change of temperature, cold, etc. “Caused by impact”: produced by one’s own or another’s impact of that kind.

original: Visamaparihārajo cirāsanaciraṭṭhānādinā kāyassa visamapariharaṇato jāto. Sannipātajo
analyzed: visama parihāra jo cira āsana cira ṭṭhāna ādinā kāyassa visama pariharaṇataḥ jāto sannipāta jo
translated: “Caused by uneven bodily behaviour”: born of uneven bodily behaviour, such as sitting too long, standing too long, and so on. “Caused by a combination”

original: sañcayato paṭṭhāya paccekaṃ visamākārato dosattayasamodhānato jāto. Kammasamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: sañcayataḥ paṭṭhāya paccekam visama ākārataḥ dosa ttaya samodhānataḥ jātaḥ kamma samuṭṭhāno
translated: and from the time of the accumulation of kamma onwards, it is born from the combination of the three roots of unprofit, which are the cause of the disease.🔽Kamma-born is that which arises from kamma without the change of temperature, etc., as a primary cause.

original: utuvipariṇāmādīhi vinā kammato samuṭṭhito. Pittasemhavātasamuṭṭhānā pana pittādīnaṃ
analyzed: utu vipariṇāma ādīhi vinā kammato samuṭṭhitaḥ pitta semha vāta samuṭṭhānā pana pitta ādīnam
translated: But those born of bile, phlegm, and wind are so called because of the predominance of bile, etc.,

original: adhikabhāveneva vuttā. Sabbassāpi hi rogassa dosattayaṃ āsannakāraṇaṃ dosappakopena🔽vinā abhāvato. Kammaṃ padhānakāraṇaṃ katokāse eva tasmiṃ uppajjanato, itaraṃ pana
analyzed: adhika bhāvena iva vuttā sabbassa api hi rogassa dosattayam āsanna kāraṇam dosa ppakopena  vinā abhāvataḥ kammam padhāna kāraṇam kata ukāse eva tasmin uppajjanataḥ itaram pana
translated: for the three roots of unprofit are the proximate cause of all diseases, since they are not without the arousing of the unprofitable roots.🔽Kamma is the primary cause since it is the cause of the arising of the disease in the place where it is to be, but the other two are to be regarded as its contributory causes.🔽And this is rejected by those who maintain that the cause of disease is past kamma.

original: tassa sahakārikāraṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tayidaṃ pubbekatahetuvādino paṭikkhipanti. Upapajjavedanīyaphalampi
analyzed: tassa sahakāri kāraṇam daṭṭhabbam tayidam pubbekata hetuvādino paṭikkhipanti upapajja vedanīya phalam pi
translated: The fruit of kamma to be experienced in some future existence

original: pubbekatahetukapakkhikameva atītaddhikattā kammassāti arucisūcanatthaṃ kira-saddaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: pubbekata hetuka pakkhikam eva atīta ddhika ttā kammassa ati aruci sūcana attham kira sadda ggahaṇam
translated: is included in the past kamma theory too, since kamma is effective in the past. The word “also” is given

original: karoti “upapajjavedanīyañca kira paṭikkhipantī”ti.
analyzed: karoti upapajja vedanīyam ca kira paṭikkhipanti iti
translated: in order to show that they reject the fruit of kamma to be experienced in some future existence.

original: 924. Dāhakāraṇatāyāti rāgādidasavidhaggidāhassa, narakaggidāhassa ca kāraṇatāya.
analyzed: dāha kāraṇa tāya ati rāga ādi dasavidha aggi dāhassa narakaggi dāhassa ca kāraṇa tāya
translated: As a cause of burning: as a cause of the burning of the various kinds of fever such as bile fever, etc., and of the burning of the hells.

original: 926. Puthunimittasabhāvesūti puthu nānākilesādīnaṃ kāraṇasabhāvesu.🔽931. Addanaṃ addā maddavo, anekatthattā dhātūnaṃ tappaṭikkhepena anaddāti āha “amudutā vā anaddā”ti.🔽936. Ayonisomanasikārahetukattā āvajjanāya akusalānukūlakiccatā daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: puthu nimitta sabhāvesu iti puthu nānā kilesa ādīnam kāraṇa sabhāvesu  addanam addā maddavaḥ anekattha ttā dhātūnam tad paṭikkhepena anaddā iti āha a mudu tā vā anaddā iti  a yoniso manasikāra hetuka ttā āvajjanāya akusala anukūla kicca tā daṭṭhabbā
translated: In the various causes of the many kinds of defilements, etc.,

original: Tikaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Catukkaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽939. Evaṃ-saddenāti nidassanatthena evaṃ-saddenāti adhippāyo. Bhavo eva abhivuddho🔽abhavo yathā “asekkhā dhammā”ti. Dutiyasmiṃ pakkhe bhavābhavasaddena sampattivipattiyo,🔽vuddhihāniyo vā vuttāti veditabbā.🔽Agatiyāti ayuttagatiyā, appatirūpakiriyāyāti attho.🔽Kodhūpāyāsa…pe… mātugāmā vā ūmiādibhayanti yojanā. Pañcakāmaguṇamātugāmaggahaṇeti pañcakāmaguṇaggahaṇe, mātugāmaggahaṇe ca.
analyzed: tika niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽      🔽evaṃsaddena ati nidassana atthena evaṃsaddena ati adhippāyaḥ bhavaḥ eva abhivuddhaḥ 🔽abhavaḥ yathā asekkhāḥ dhammā ti dutiyasmin pakkhe bhava abhava saddena sampatti vipattiyaḥ 🔽vuddhi hāniyaḥ vā vuttā ati veditabbā 🔽agatiyā ti ayutta gatiyā appatirūpa kiriyāya attho 🔽mātugāmāḥ vā yojanā pañca kāmaguṇa mātugāma ggahaṇa iti pañca kāmaguṇa ggahaṇe mātugāma ggahaṇe ca
translated: is the meaning. ‘ Stiffness’ is stiffness of the body; ‘rigidity’ is rigidity of the mind. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being rigid; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being stiff. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unpliant; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unmalleable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rigidity’ is the state of being rigid, the state of being unworkable. ‘ Stiffness’ is the state of being stiff, the state of being unworkable; ‘rig

original: “Sayaṃkataṃ sukhadukkha”ntiādikā diṭṭhi yadipi aññesampi diṭṭhigatikānaṃ attheva,
analyzed: sayaṃkatam sukha dukkha nti ādikā diṭṭhi yadi pi aññesam pi diṭṭhi gatikānam atthā eva
translated: Though the view “Pleasure and pain are self-made” and so on is found among other theorists,

original: timbaruko pana tathādiṭṭhiko bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchīti sā diṭṭhi “timbarukadiṭṭhī”ti
analyzed: timbarukaḥ pana tathādiṭṭhikaḥ bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā pucchi iti sā diṭṭhi timbaruka diṭṭhī iti
translated: it was Timbaru who held that view and came to the Blessed One and asked the question. So the view is called “Timbaru’s view.”

original: vuttā. Tenāha “timbaruko…pe… āgatattā”ti.
analyzed: vuttā tena āha timbaru kope āgata ttā iti
translated: That is why it is said “because of Timbaru’s coming.”

original: Catukkaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catukka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the tetrad is ended.

original: 5. Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the pentad

original: 940. Āgamanassa paṭisandhiggahaṇavasenāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: āgamanassa paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning intended is that it is by the taking of rebirth-linking.

original: 941. Upacayanatoti vaḍḍhanato. Aññathāti lābhato takkanato ca aññappakāro gahitoti
analyzed: upacayanato ti vaḍḍhanato aññathā ati lābhato takkanato ca aññappakāraḥ gahito ti
translated: By growth: by increase. Otherwise: the meaning is that it is taken in another way, that is, by gain and by reasoning.🔽To show that he said “By faith, approval, etc.”

original: taṃ dassento “saddhāruciādīhī”ti āha. Anussavato hi saddahanaṃ, ruccanaṃ pana jātissarañāṇatopi
analyzed: tam dassentaḥ saddhā ruci ādīhi iti āha anussavataḥ hi saddahanam ruccanam pana jāti ssara ñāṇato pi
translated: For there is approval by faith in what is reported, and approval also by knowledge of the past lives of the Buddha, etc.

original: hoti. Ādi-saddena khantiādīnaṃ saṅgaho.
analyzed: hoti ādi saddena khanti ādīnam saṅgahaḥ
translated: The word “etc.” includes acquiescence, etc.

original: 942. Akkhanti mūlaṃ etesanti akkhantimūlakā. Dukkaṭadubbhāsitatādidosā tādisāni kāyavacīmanoduccaritāni.
analyzed: mūlam etesanti akkhanti mūlakāḥ tādisāni kāya vacī manaḥ duccaritāni
translated: They have non-acquiescence as their root: non-acquiescence is their root. Such bodily and verbal misconduct and such wrongness of cognizance as are due to such causes as anger.

original: 943. Udaggatāsaṅkhāto avūpasamo na uddhaccasaṅkhātoti pītiyā eva savipphārikatāsaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: udagga tā saṅkhātaḥ avūpasamaḥ na uddhacca saṅkhātaḥ ti pītiyāḥ eva sa vipphārika tā saṅkhātam
translated: The state of non-pacification called “arousing” is not the state of non-pacification called “agitation” .🔽He says that the state of non-pacification is the state of instability called “dispersal” of happiness itself.

original: asantasabhāvaṃ āha. Avūpasamahetubhūtoti vikkhepahetubhūto. Pītiyā ākāroti pītiyā pavattiākāro.
analyzed: asanta sabhāvam āha a vūpasama hetu bhūto ti vikkhepa hetu bhūto pītiyāḥ ākāraḥ iti pītiyāḥ pavatti ākāro
translated: The cause of non-pacification is the cause of distraction.🔽The mode of the occurrence of happiness is the mode of occurrence of happiness.

original: Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the description of the pentad is finished.

original: 6. Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the six

original: 944. Tenāti kodhādīnaṃyeva vivādamūlattā.
analyzed: tena ati kodha ādīnaṃyā iva vivāda mūla ttā
translated: “By that”: because anger, etc., are the roots of disputes.

original: 945. Kusalānuyoge sātaccaṃ kusalānuyogasātaccaṃ.
analyzed: kusala anuyoge sātaccam kusala anuyoga sātaccam
translated: “Steadfastness in undertaking the profitable”: steadfastness in undertaking the profitable.

original: Gaṇena sattasamūhena saṅgaṇi sannipatanaṃ yena saddhiṃ, tena saṅgati gaṇasaṅgaṇikā. Kassaci ghāsacchādanādikassa.
analyzed: gaṇena satta samūhena saṅgaṇi sannipatanam yena saddhim tena gaṇa saṅgaṇikā kassaci ghāsa chādana ādikassa
translated: “Association with society”: the meeting together with a group, with a collection of seven or more.

original: 946. Upavitakketīti ārammaṇaṃ upecca takketi.
analyzed: upa vitakketi iti ārammaṇam upecca takketi
translated: “He speculates”: he speculates by going beyond the object.

original: 948. Adhiccasamuppannikoti “adhiccasamuppanno attā ca loko cā”ti evaṃvādī.
analyzed: adhiccasamuppannikaḥ ti adhicca samuppannaḥ attā ca loko ca ati evaṃvādī
translated: “He is a theorist of fortuitous origination”: he is one who holds the view “The self and the world have arisen fortuitously.”

original: Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: chakka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the description of the six is finished.

original: 8. Aṭṭhakaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭhaka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the eight

original: 952. Osīdanākārenāti kattabbakamme anussahanākārena.
analyzed: osīdana ākārena ati kattabba kamme anussahana ākārena
translated: “By the mode of subsiding”: by the mode of urging on in the work to be done.

original: 958. Te abhinivesā asaññīvādā vadanti etehīti.
analyzed: te abhinivesāḥ asaññīvādāḥ vadanti
translated: They are the ‘asserters of non-percipient immortality’ because they assert that immortality is non-percipient.

original: Aṭṭhakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section of the Aṭṭhaka is ended.

original: 9. Navakaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section of the Navaka

original: 960-963. Dasamassāti aṭṭhānaghātassa.
analyzed: dasamassa ati aṭṭhānaghātassa
translated: ‘The tenth’ is the one who is not a ‘non-returner.’🔽‘Internally’ is intended as the internal objective field.

original: Ajjhattanti gocarajjhattaṃ adhippetaṃ. Etassa gāthāvacanassa. Niṭṭhapetvāti abhinivissa.
analyzed: ajjhattam ti gocara jjhattam adhippetam etassa gāthā vacanassa niṭṭhapetvā iti abhinivissa
translated: ‘Having settled down’ is having settled upon.

original: 964. Aññesaṃ phassādīnaṃ saṅkhatabhāve yathāsakaṃpaccayehi. Yenākārena mānassa sātisayā
analyzed: aññesam phassa ādīnam saṅkhata bhāve yathāsakam paccayehi yena ākārena mānassa sa atisayā
translated: In the case of the other states beginning with contact, it is by means of the respective conditions that they are formed.

original: pavatti, taṃ dassetuṃ “ahanti, asmīti cā”ti vuttaṃ. Attanoti diṭṭhigataparikappitassa
analyzed: tam dassetum aham ti asmi iti ca ati vuttam attanā ti diṭṭhi gata parikappitassa
translated: The words ‘I am’ and ‘I am this’ are said in order to show the mode of the conceit’s occurrence with its excess.🔽‘Of his own’ is of the self that is imagined by the views.

original: attano. Yathā mānassa sampaggahavasena, evaṃ taṇhāya mamattavasena, diṭṭhiyā niccādivasena
analyzed: attanaḥ yathā mānassa sampaggaha vasena evam taṇhāya mamatta vasena diṭṭhiyāḥ nicca ādi vasena
translated: Just as the conceit occurs with the mode of self-possession, so craving occurs with the mode of ‘mine-ness,’ and views with the mode of permanence, etc.,

original: pavatti visesavatī samānepi anāgatakālāmasaneti āha “bhavissantī…pe… vutto”ti. “Ahamasmī”ti
analyzed: pavatti visesavatī samāne pi anāgata kāla āmasane ti āha vutto ti aham asmi iti
translated: though the teaching is the same in the future. That is why it is said, ‘Will be … said.’

original: pana pavattamānasseva bhavatīti sabbapadasādhāraṇassa mānasseva vasena iñjitāditā🔽aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttā.
analyzed: pana pavattamānassa iva bhavati iti sabba pada sādhāraṇassa mānassa iva vasena iñjita ādi tā 🔽aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttā
translated: But the shaking, etc., are said in the commentary in terms of the conceit ‘I am,’ which is common to all the terms, since it occurs in the mode of ‘I am.’

original: Navakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: navaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the nine kinds of grounds is ended.

original: 10. Dasakaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dasaka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The ten kinds of grounds

original: 970. Saṅkappananti “kusalatā”ti vuttapadassa atthavacanaṃ. Tassā upāyacintāya. Micchābhāvo
analyzed: saṅkappanam ti kusala tā ti vutta padassa attha vacanam tassāḥ upāya cintāya micchā bhāvo
translated: The “reflection” is the meaning of the word “skill” stated. The “wrongness”

original: sāvajjabhāvo. Tadākāro mohoti yathāvuttākārena pavatte cittuppāde moho. Tassāpi yathāvuttapaccavekkhaṇāyapi🔽yathākatapāpepi. Adhimānasampayuttaṃ sañjānanaṃ pakatipurisantaradassanādivasena
analyzed: sāvajja bhāvaḥ tad ākāraḥ moho ti yathāvutta ākārena pavatte cittuppāde moho tassa api yathāvutta paccavekkhaṇāya api  yathā kata pāpe pi adhimāna sampayuttam sañjānanam pakati purisa antara dassana ādi vasena
translated: is the blameworthiness. The “delusion” is the kind of consciousness that occurs in the way stated. The “reviewing” of that is also

original: pavattaṃ diṭṭhisampayuttacittaṃ phalaṃ viya vimuttanti gahitaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: pavattam diṭṭhi sampayutta cittam phalam viya vimuttan ti gahitam daṭṭhabbam
translated: the “doing of evil” in the way stated. The “apprehending” associated with conceit is the consciousness associated with false view that occurs in the way stated, such as by seeing a man of low birth, etc., as superior. It should be regarded as “taken as freedom” as if it were a fruit.

original: Dasakaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dasaka niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the ten kinds of grounds is ended.

original: Taṇhāvicaritaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽973. Visesaṃ akatvāti anupanidhānaṃ, samato ca asamato ca upanidhānanti imaṃ vibhāgaṃ akatvā, yo “itthaṃ, evaṃ, aññathā”ti padehi pakāsito.
analyzed: taṇhāvicarita niddesa vaṇṇanā  visesam a katvā ati anupanidhānam samataḥ ca asamataḥ ca upanidhānam ti imam vibhāgam a katvā yaḥ ittham evam aññathā ati padehi pakāsitaḥ
translated: The exposition of the kinds of sensual-desire-related considerations🔽Without distinction: without making the distinction “without comparing” and “comparing equally and unequally.” The “consideration” is that shown by the words “thus, in this way, otherwise.”

original: Visesassāti “itthaṃ, evaṃ, aññathā”ti yathāvuttasseva visesassa. Diṭṭhiyāti diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: visesassa ati ittham evam aññathā ti yathā vuttassa iva visesassa diṭṭhiyā iti diṭṭhiyā
translated: The “distinction” is the distinction of the very same “thus, in this way, otherwise” stated. The “view” is the view

original: gahitāya tadavinābhāvinī taṇhā dassitā. Sīsasīsamūlakehīti catūhi sīsehi, dvādasahi
analyzed: gahitāya tad avinābhāvinī taṇhā dassitā sīsa sīsa mūlakehi iti catūhi sīsehi dvādasahi
translated: and craving, which is invariably concomitant with it, is shown. With the four heads and the twelve

original: ca sīsamūlakehi. Sayameva ca taṇhā dassitāti yojanā. Yadi diṭṭhimānagāhopi idhādhippeto,
analyzed: ca sīsa mūlakehi sayam eva ca taṇhā dassitā ati yojanā yadi diṭṭhi māna gāhaḥ api idha adhippeto
translated: And craving, which is inseparable from the grasping, is shown by the words “with its head and its crest.” “With its head” means with its four heads; “with its crest” means with its twelve crests. The construction is: “Craving is shown by itself.” If the grasping of views and conceit are also intended here,

original: yato “taṇhāmānadiṭṭhivasena samūhagāhato”ti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ, kathaṃ “taṇhāvicaritānī”ti
analyzed: yatas taṇhā māna diṭṭhi vasena samūha gāhato ti aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam katham taṇhā vicaritāni iti
translated: then why is it said in the commentary, “because of the grasping of the mass by way of craving, conceit, and views,” and why is it said in the text, “the wanderings of craving”?

original: vacananti āha “diṭṭhimānesū”tiādi. Taṃmūlakattāti taṇhāmūlakattā.🔽974. Na avakkarīyatīti anavakārī, taṃ anavakāriṃ katvā, taṃ padantarena vibhāvento
analyzed: vacananti āha diṭṭhi mānesu utiādi taṃ mūla kattā ati taṇhā mūla kattā  na anavakārīyati iti anavakārī tam anavakārim katvā tam padantarena
translated: To answer this he says, “In the case of views and conceit,” etc. “Because they have craving as their root” means because they have craving as their root.

original: “anavakkari, taṃ katvā”ti āha. Vikkhepanaṃ avayavato vibhāgo. Attato avinibbhujitvāti🔽yvāyaṃ diṭṭhigatikaparikappito attā, tato avisuṃ katvā.
analyzed: anavakkari tam katvā iti āha vikkhepanam avayavataḥ vibhāgaḥ attataḥ a vinibbhujitvā iti  yvā ayam diṭṭhigatika parikappitaḥ attā tatas avisum katvā
