translated: “It does not break” means it does not break up; having made it not break up, distinguishing it by another word, he says, “having made it not break up.” “Breaking up” means dividing into parts. “Without separating it from itself” means without making it different from that self which is imagined by the theorists.

original: 976. Bahikatāni rūpādīni upagantvā pavattā taṇhā upādāyāti vuttāti yojanā.
analyzed: bahikatāni rūpa ādīni upagantvā pavattā taṇhā upādāya ati vuttā iti yojanā
translated: Having gone out to the external objects such as visible forms, etc., and having occurred, craving is called clinging. This is the construction.

original: Ekaccassa puggalassa ekasmiṃ attabhāve kassaci taṇhāvicaritassa asambhavo, kassacideva sambhavoti āha “kassaci sambhavadassanatthaṃ vutta”nti.
analyzed: ekaccassa puggalassa ekasmin atta bhāve kassaci taṇhā vicaritassa asambhavo kassaci deva sambhavaḥ ti āha kassaci sambhava dassana tham vuttan ti
translated: In the case of some person in a single existence some of the ways of occurrence of craving are impossible and some are possible. So he said “in order to show what is possible for some” .

original: Taṇhāvicaritaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: taṇhāvicarita niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the ways of occurrence of craving is ended.

original: Khuddakavatthuvibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khuddaka vatthu vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the Minor Collection is ended.

original: 18. Dhammahadayavibhaṅgo
analyzed: dhamma hadaya vibhaṅgo
translated: The Analysis of the Heart of the Dhamma

original: 1. Sabbasaṅgāhikavāravaṇṇanā🔽978. Dhātusambhava…pe… saṅgahitattāti ettha khandhādīnaṃ kāmadhātuādidhātūsu sambhavabhedabhinnānaṃ
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhika vāra vaṇṇanā  dhātu sambhava pe ettha khandha ādīnam kāmadhātu ādi dhātūsu
translated: The Description of the Chapter on Inclusion

original: niravasesato saṅgahitattāti vibhāgena yojanā, tathā sesesupi pariyāpannapabhedabhinnānantiādinā.
analyzed: niravasesataḥ saṅgahita ttā ati vibhāgena yojanā tathā sesesu pi
translated: As regards the words “because of the inclusion without remainder of the aggregates, etc., in the sense sphere, etc.,” the exposition should be construed thus: “because of the inclusion without remainder of the aggregates, etc., which are divided into those that have come into existence and those that have not, in the sense sphere, etc.” Likewise in the case of the rest.

original: Tattha “niravasesato saṅgahitattā”ti iminā “sabbasaṅgāhikavāro”ti ayamassa atthānugatā
analyzed: tattha niravasesataḥ saṅgahita ttā ti iminā sabba saṅgāhika vāraḥ ti ayam assa attha anugatā
translated: Herein, by the words “because of the inclusion without remainder” he shows that the name “Chapter on Inclusion” is appropriate to this chapter,

original: samaññāti dasseti. Yasmā cettha khandhādīnaṃ dvādasannaṃ koṭṭhāsānaṃ anavasesasaṅgaho,
analyzed: samaññā iti dasseti yasmā ca ittha khandha ādīnam dvādasannam koṭṭhāsānam anavasesa saṅgaho
translated: since it is the inclusion of the twelve sections beginning with the aggregates without remainder.

original: tasmā evaṃ dutiyavārādīnañcettha anuppaveso veditabbo. Khandhādīnameva hi tesaṃ sambhavādivicāro
analyzed: tasmai evam dutiya vāra ādīnam ca ittha anuppavesaḥ veditabbaḥ khandha ādīnam eva hi tesam sambhava ādi vicāraḥ
translated: Therefore the second and subsequent sections should be understood to be introduced in this way. For it is proper to say that the investigation of origination, etc., is only in regard to the aggregates, etc.,

original: uppattānuppattidassanavāroti vattuṃ yuttoti yojanā. Anuppattidassanañcettha atthāpattisiddhaṃ
analyzed: uppatta anuppatti dassana vāro ti vattum yuttaḥ ti yojanā anuppatti dassanam ca ittha atthāpatti siddham
translated: and that the demonstration of the arisen and the unarisen is a mere device. And the demonstration of the unarisen should be understood to be established by the meaning,

original: veditabbaṃ. Na hi tattha “kati khandhā na pātubhavantī”tiādipāḷi atthi.
analyzed: veditabbam na hi tattha kati khandhāḥ na pātubhavanti iti ādi pāḷi atthi
translated: for there is no such text as “How many aggregates are not manifest?”

original: 979. Pucchānurūpanti yenādhippāyena pucchā katā, tadanurūpaṃ. Avitathabyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: puccha anurūpam ti yena adhippāyena pucchā katā tad anurūpam avitatha byākaraṇam
translated: “In accordance with the question”: in accordance with the intention behind the question.🔽The Buddha’s unique ability to answer questions without error

original: nāma buddhānaṃ eva āveṇikaṃ, aññesaṃ taṃ yādicchikaṃ sutakkharasadisanti āha “sabbaññuvacanaṃ viññāya katattā”ti.
analyzed: nāma buddhānam eva āveṇikam aññesam tam yādicchikam su takkhara sadisanti āha sabbaññu vacanam viññāya kata ttā ti
translated: is not shared by others, who may answer as they please, like a parrot.

original: Sabbasaṅgāhikavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhika vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section that includes all the questions is finished.

original: 2. Uppattānuppattivāravaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the arisen and the unarisen

original: 991. “Kāmabhave”ti idaṃ okāsavasena vatvā puna sattasantānavasena vattuṃ “kāmadhātusambhūtānañcā”ti
analyzed: kāma bhava iti idam okāsa vasena vatvā punar satta santāna vasena vattum
translated: After stating the question in terms of the plane of existence, he states it again in terms of the continuity of a single being, saying “and of those born in the sense-desire element.”🔽The meaning of the question is shown by the words “by supernormal power … the meaning.”

original: vuttanti tamatthavisesaṃ dassento “iddhiyā…pe… attho”ti āha. “Na vattabbaṃ siyā”ti
analyzed: vuttam ti tam attha visesam dassentaḥ iddhiyāpe atthaḥ ti āha na vattabbam siyā ti
translated: “It should not be said that it may be so”

original: kasmā vuttaṃ, yadipi asaññasattānaṃ acakkhukattā rūpāyatanaṃ accantasukhumattā heṭṭhimabhūmikānañca🔽agocaro, samānabhūmikānaṃ pana vehapphalānaṃ, uparibhūmikānañca suddhāvāsānaṃ cakkhāyatanassa
analyzed: kasmā vuttam yadi pi asañña sattānam acakkhukattā rūpa āyatanam accanta sukhuma ttā heṭṭhima bhūmikānam ca  agocaraḥ samāna bhūmikānam pana vehapphalānam upari bhūmikānam ca suddhāvāsānam cakkha āyatanassa
translated: Why is it said? Although the material form base is not the domain of the non-percipient beings because they are without eye, and is also not the domain of those in the lower planes because it is extremely subtle,

original: gocaro hotīti āyatanādikiccaṃ karotiyevāti sakkā vattuṃ. Yaṃ panettha vitthārato🔽vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttameva. “Heṭṭhato avīcinirayaṃ pariyantaṃ katvā uparito
analyzed: gocaraḥ hoti iti āyatana ādi kiccam sakkā vattum yam pana ittha vitthārato  vattabbam tat heṭṭhā vuttam eva heṭṭhatas avīcinirayam pariyantam katvā uparitas
translated: it is the domain of the Vehapphala gods of the same plane and of the Suddhāvāsa gods of the higher plane, and so it performs the function of a base, etc., as well. But what should be said in detail here has already been said above.

original: paranimmitavasavattideve antokaritvā yaṃ etasmi”ntiādinā vuttapadesā kāmāvacarādiokāsā.
analyzed: para nimmita vasavatti deve antokaritvā yam etasmin tiādinā vutta padesā kāmāvacara ādi okāsā
translated: The sense-desire-element, etc., are the places stated thus beginning with “What is the sense-desire element? It is the ten sense-desire bases beginning with visible-form base and ending with mind-object base” .

original: Te sattanikāyā ca dhātūti vuccanti samudāyassa avayavādhārabhāvato yathā “māsapuñjo
analyzed: te satta nikāyā ca dhātu uti vuccanti samudāyassa avayava ādhāra bhāvataḥ yathā māsa puñjo
translated: And they are called “the realms of beings” because they are the abodes of the parts of the mass of beings, just as a “month” is the parts of the mass of a month .

original: māso”ti. Sattā uppajjanti etthāti sattuppatti, uppajjanaṭṭhena sattāva uppatti sattuppattīti
analyzed: māsaḥ ti sattāḥ uppajjanti ettha ati sattuppatti uppajjana ṭṭhena satta āvā uppatti satta uppatti iti
translated: “The arising of beings” is the arising of beings; the arising is the arising of beings, thus it is the arising of beings .

original: evaṃ okāsasattalokadvayassa sattuppattipariyāyo veditabbo. Sattabhāvena uppatti,🔽na anupādinnakkhandhā viya saṅkhārabhāvenevāti adhippāyo. Ke pana teti āha “sattāvāsavasena…pe…
analyzed: evam okāsa satta loka dvayassa satta uppatti pariyāyaḥ veditabbo satta bhāvena uppatti  na anupādinna khandhāḥ viya saṅkhāra bhāvena iva ati adhippāyaḥ ke pana te ti āha
translated: This is how the method of the arising of beings should be understood in the case of the two kinds of world, that is to say, the world as container and the world of beings.🔽The intention is that the arising is by way of the seven, not by way of formations only, as is the case with the unappropriated aggregates.🔽But what are they? He said: “According to the abodes of beings …🔽…🔽

original: upādinnakakkhandhā”ti. Taṃtaṃpariyāpannānanti taṃtaṃsattāvāsapariyāpannānaṃ sattānaṃ,🔽saṅkhārānameva vā. Sadisādhiṭṭhānabhāvenāti sadisākārena pavattamānānaṃ khandhānaṃ
analyzed: upādinnaka khandhā ti taṃ taṃ pariyāpannānam ti taṃ taṃ sattā vāsa pariyāpannānam sattānam  vā sadisa adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena ati sadisa ākārena pavattamānānam khandhānam
translated: So the way in which the two kinds of world, that is to say, the world of location and the world of beings, come to be should be understood. The intention is that the arising is as beings, not as formations, as the unapprehendable aggregates are. But who are they? He said: “As to the abodes of beings … the unapprehendable aggregates.” “In the various abodes”: in the various abodes of beings that are included in the various abodes.🔽Or in the various abodes of formations.

original: patiṭṭhānabhāvena. Yebhuyyena hi tasmiṃ sattāvāse dhammā samānākārena pavattanti.
analyzed: patiṭṭhāna bhāvena yebhuyyena hi tasmin sattāvāse dhammā samāna ākārena pavattanti
translated: “As the basis for the like”: as the basis for the aggregates that occur in a like aspect. For in the various abodes of beings the states occur in a like aspect for the most part.

original: Uppattānuppattivāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uppatta anuppatti vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the “arisen and not-yet-arisen” is ended.

original: 3. Pariyāpannāpariyāpannavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: pariyāpanna apariyāpanna vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the “included and not included”

original: 999. Tattha, aññattha cāti tasmiṃ, aññasmiñca bhave, okāse ca. Paricchedakārikāya kāmāditaṇhāya paricchijja āpannā gahitāti pariyāpannāti taṃtaṃbhavādiantogadhā taṃtaṃpariyāpannā.
analyzed: tattha aññattha ca ati tasmin aññasmin ca bhave okāse ca pariccheda kārikāya kāma ādi taṇhāya paricchijje āpannā gahitā ati pariyāpannā ati taṃ taṃ bhava ādi anta gadhā taṃ taṃ pariyāpannā
translated: Herein, “in another kind of becoming, etc.,” means in that kind of becoming and in another kind of becoming, and in the world of location. They are “included” because they are included, that is, taken, by craving for sense desires, etc., as their delimitation. They are “included in the various kinds of becoming, etc.,” because they are included in the various kinds of becoming, etc., that are delimited by that craving.

original: Pariyāpannāpariyāpannavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽6. Uppādakakammaāyuppamāṇavāro
analyzed: pariyāpanna apariyāpanna vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  uppādaka kamma āyu ppamāṇa vāro
translated: Description of the included and the not-included concluded.🔽The section on the kamma that generates and on the measure of life-span

original: 1. Uppādakakammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uppādaka kamma vaṇṇanā
translated: The kamma that generates

original: 1021. Dhātuttayabhūtadevavasenāti kāmādidhātuttaye nibbattadevānaṃ vasena.
analyzed: dhātuttaya bhūtadeva vasena ati kāma ādi dhātuttaye vasena
translated: . “According to the gods in the three planes”: according to the gods reborn in the three planes beginning with the sense-sphere plane.

original: Uppādakakammavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uppādaka kamma vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Description of the kamma that generates concluded.

original: 2. Āyuppamāṇavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āyu pamāṇa vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the measure of life-span

original: 1026. Suparimajjitakañcanādāsaṃ viya sobhati vijjotatīti subho, sarīrobhāso, tena subhena kiṇṇā vikiṇṇāti subhakiṇṇā.
analyzed: su parimajjita kañcanā dāsam viya sobhati vijjotati iti subhaḥ sarīra ubhāsaḥ tena subhena kiṇṇā vikiṇṇā ati subha kiṇṇā
translated: . “The radiance of the body shines and glitters like a well-polished gold mirror, thus it is ‘beautiful’ . It is ‘strewn’ with that, scattered with that, thus it is ‘strewn with beauty’ .

original: 1027. Taṃtaṃmanasikāranti parittapathavīkasiṇādigatamanasikāraṃ. Appanākkhaṇepīti🔽pi-saddena pubbabhāgaṃ sampiṇḍeti. Chandanaṃ ārammaṇapariyesanaṃ chando, kattukamyatāchando.🔽Paṇidhānaṃ cittaṭṭhapanā paṇidhi, saññāvirāgādīhi ārammaṇassa visesanaṃ tathāpavattāya
analyzed: taṃ taṃ manasikāram ti paritta pathavī kasiṇa ādi gata manasikāram appanā khaṇe pi iti  pi saddena pubba bhāgam sampiṇḍeti chandanam ārammaṇa pariyesanam chando kattu kamyatā chando  paṇidhānam citta ṭṭhapanā paṇidhi saññā virāga ādīhi ārammaṇassa visesanam tathā pavattāya
translated: ‘The attention given to this or that’: the attention given to the limited earth kasiṇa, and so on. ‘Even at the moment of absorption’:

original: bhāvanāya ārammaṇakaraṇameva.
analyzed: bhāvanāya ārammaṇa karaṇam eva
translated: the word ‘even’ includes the prior stage. ‘Desire’ is the desire to seek the object. ‘Resolve’ is the fixing of the mind. ‘Rapture’ is the gladdening of the mind. ‘Happiness’ is bodily pleasure. ‘Concentration’ is unification of mind. ‘Contemplation’ is insight. ‘The act of looking on’ is the act of seeing. ‘The act of reviewing’ is the act of investigating. ‘The act of determining’ is the act of discerning. ‘The act of resolving upon’ is the act of making the object special by means of the fading of lust, etc., and the act of making it the object of development that occurs thus.

original: Vipulaṃ vuccati mahantaṃ, santabhāvopi mahanīyatāya mahantamevāti āha “vipulā phalāti vipulasantasukhāyuvaṇṇādiphalā”ti.
analyzed: vipulam vuccati mahantam santa bhāvaḥ pi mahanīya tāya mahantam eva ati āha vipulā
translated: “Extensive” is said to be great. The state of peace is also great because of its greatness. Therefore it is said: “Extensive fruit: the fruit of extensive peace, happiness, life, beauty, etc.”

original: 1028. Yaṃ cātumahārājikānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, sañjīve eso eko rattidivo, tāya rattiyā🔽tiṃsa rattiyo māso, tena māsena dvādasamāsiko saṃvaccharo, tena saṃvaccharena pañca
analyzed: yam cātumahārājikānam āyu ppamāṇam sañjīve esaḥ ekaḥ ratti divaḥ tāya rattiyā  tiṃsa rattiyaḥ māso tena māsena dvādasa māsikaḥ saṃvaccharo tena saṃvaccharena pañca
translated: The life-span of the Cātumahārājika devas is one day and night in Sañjīva.🔽Thirty of their days make a month. By twelve such months a year is reckoned. By that year

original: vassasatāni sañjīve āyuppamāṇaṃ. Yaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, eso kāḷasutte eko🔽rattidivo…pe… tena saṃvaccharena vassasahassaṃ kāḷasutte āyuppamāṇaṃ. Yaṃ yāmānaṃ🔽āyuppamāṇaṃ, eso saṅghāte eko rattidivo…pe… tena saṃvaccharena dve vassasahassāni
analyzed: vassa satāni sañjīve āyu ppamāṇam yam tāvatiṃsānam āyu ppamāṇam esaḥ kāḷasutte ekaḥ  tena saṃvaccharena vassa sahassam kāḷasutte āyu ppamāṇam yam yāmānam  āyu ppamāṇam esaḥ saṅghāte ekaḥ ratti divope tena saṃvaccharena dve vassa sahassāni
translated: five hundred is the life-span in Sañjīva. The life-span of the Tāvatiṃsa devas is one day and night in Kāḷa-sutta. …🔽By that year one thousand is the life-span in Kāḷa-sutta. The life-span of the Yāma devas is one day and night in Saṅghāta. …

original: saṅghāte āyuppamāṇaṃ. Yaṃ tusitānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, roruve eso eko rattidivo…pe… tena
analyzed: saṅghāte āyu ppamāṇam yam tusitānam āyu ppamāṇam roruve esaḥ ekaḥ ratti divope tena
translated: By that year two thousand is the life-span in Saṅghāta. The life-span of the Tusita devas is one day and night in Roruva. …

original: saṃvaccharena cattāri vassasahassāni roruve āyuppamāṇaṃ. Yaṃ nimmānaratīnaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ,
analyzed: saṃvaccharena cattāri vassa sahassāni roruve āyu ppamāṇam yam nimmāna ratīnam āyu ppamāṇam
translated: By that year four thousand is the life-span in Roruva. The life-span of the Nimmāṇarati devas is one day and night in

original: mahāroruve eso eko rattidivo…pe… tena saṃvaccharena aṭṭha vassasahassāni mahāroruve
analyzed: mahāroruve eso ekaḥ ratti divope tena saṃvaccharena aṭṭha vassa sahassāni mahāroruve
translated: The life-span in Mahāraurava is eight thousand great eons.

original: āyuppamāṇaṃ. Yaṃ paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, tāpane eso eko rattidivo…pe…
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇam yam paranimmitavasavattīnam devānam āyu ppamāṇam tāpane esaḥ ekaḥ ratti divope
translated: One day and night in Tāpana is the measure of a life of beings in Tāpana. …

original: tena saṃvaccharena soḷasa vassasahassāni tāpane āyuppamāṇaṃ. Mahātāpane upaḍḍhantarakappo.
analyzed: tena saṃvaccharena soḷasa vassa sahassāni tāpane āyu ppamāṇam mahātāpane upaḍḍhantara kappo
translated: The life-span in Tāpana is sixteen thousand great eons. Mahātāpana is half an eon.🔽Avīci is one eon.

original: Avīciyaṃ eko antarakappo ca āyuppamāṇanti vadanti. Devānaṃ adhimuttakālakiriyā viya
analyzed: avīciyam ekaḥ antara kappo ca āyu ppamāṇam ti vadanti devānam adhimutta kālakiriyā viya
translated: Just as the gods die in a state of satisfaction,

original: tādisena puññabalena antarāpi maraṇaṃ hotīti “kammameva pamāṇa”nti vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tādisena puñña balena antarā api maraṇam hoti iti kammam eva pamāṇam ti vuttan ti veditabbam
translated: so too, it should be understood, death occurs in the midst of the power of kamma.

original: Evañca katvā abbudādiāyuparicchedopi yuttataro hotīti.
analyzed: evam ca katvā abbuda ādi āyu paricchedaḥ api yuttataraḥ hoti iti
translated: And thus the limitation of the life-span of beings in the Avīci hell, etc., is also more reasonable.

original: Kiṃ jhānanti aṭṭhasu jhānesu kataraṃ jhānaṃ. Bhavasīsānīti bhavaggāni, puthujjanabhavaggaṃ
analyzed: kim jhānanti aṭṭhasu jhānesu kataram jhānam bhava sīsāni iti bha aggāni puthujjana bhava aggam
translated: What jhāna? In the eight jhānas. What is the best? The best of the worlds of existence is the world of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The world of the ordinary man is the world of the ordinary man.

original: ariyabhavaggaṃ sabbabhavagganti vehapphalādīnaṃ samaññā. Kassaci sattāti puthujjanassa,
analyzed: ariya bhava ggam sabba bhava ggam ti vehapphala ādīnam samaññā kassaci sattā ati puthujjanassa
translated: The world of the noble ones is the world of the noble ones. The world of all is the world of all. The designation of the Vehapphala gods is the world of all. The life-span of some beings is a hundred years.

original: kassaci pañcāti sotāpannassa, sakadāgāmino ca, kassaci tayoti anāgāmino vasena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kassaci pañca ati sotāpannassa sakadāgāmino ca kassaci tayo ti anāgāmino vasena vuttam
translated: “Some in five” means in the five beginning with the base consisting of boundless space. “Some in three” means in the three beginning with the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: Tasmā so brahmakāyikādīhi cuto arūpaṃ upapajjanto veditabbo. “Navasu brahmalokesu
analyzed: tasmā saḥ brahmakāyika ādīhi cutaḥ arūpam upapajjantaḥ veditabbaḥ navasu brahmalokesu
translated: Therefore he should be understood as one who, having died among the Brahmā-order gods, etc., is reborn in the formless worlds.

original: nibbattaariyasāvakānaṃ tatrūpapattiyeva hoti, na heṭṭhūpapattī”ti ayaṃ aṭṭhakathāpāṭhoti
analyzed: nibbatta ariya sāvakānam tatru upapattiyā iva hoti na heṭṭhu upapatti iti ayam aṭṭhakathā pāṭhaḥ ti
translated: This is the reading of the commentary: “The noble disciples reborn in the nine Brahmā worlds are reborn there and nowhere else below.”🔽With this in mind it is said: “But it is said” , etc.

original: adhippāyena “yaṃ panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Tatrūpapattipi hoti uparūpapattipi, na heṭṭhūpapattī”ti
analyzed: adhippāyena yam pana atiādi vuttam hoti uparu upapatti pi na heṭṭhu upapatti iti
translated: But the reading is: “They are reborn there and in the higher , nowhere else below.”🔽So there is no point in the words “only rebirth below is excluded” , etc.

original: pana pāṭhoti tena “heṭṭhūpapattiyeva nivāritā”tiādivacanena payojanaṃ natthi. Arūpadhātūpapatti
analyzed: pana pāṭhaḥ iti tena heṭṭhu upapattiyā iva nivāritā ati ādi vacanena payojanam natthi arūpa dhātu upapatti
translated: The connection is this: “Rebirth in the formless worlds is not excluded.”

original: ca na nivāritāti sambandho. Arūpadhātūpapatti na nivāritā “matthake ṭhitova parinibbātī”ti🔽niyamassa anicchitattā.
analyzed: ca na nivāritā ati sambandhaḥ arūpa dhātu upapatti na nivāritā matthake ṭhitaḥ iva parinibbāti iti  niyamassa anicchitattā
translated: Rebirth in the formless worlds is not excluded because it is not intended to be limited by the statement “he attains Nibbāna with exertion” .

original: Aññatthāti kāmaloke. Tatthāti rūpaloke. Ayaṃ aṭṭhakathāti “paṭhamajjhānabhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: aññattha āti kāma loke tattha ati rūpa loke ayam aṭṭhakathā ati paṭhama jhāna bhūmiyam
translated: “Elsewhere” means in the sense-desire world. “There” means in the fine-material world. “This is the commentary” means that the statement “in the plane of the first jhāna” is not intended to be limited.

original: nibbatto…pe… parinibbātī”ti evaṃ pavattā aṭṭhakathā. Tenevāti yasmā rūpadhātuyaṃ
analyzed: nibbatta upe parinibbāti iti evam pavattā aṭṭhakathā tena iva ati yasmā
translated: “He is reborn … he attains final Nibbana” .

original: upapanno adhippeto, na upapajjanāraho, teneva kāraṇena. Tassāti yathāvuttassa rūpadhātuyaṃ
analyzed: upapannaḥ adhippetaḥ na upapajjana araho tena iva kāraṇena tassa ati yathā vuttassa rūpadhātuyam
translated: “Since”: because the one who is reborn in the fine-material sphere is intended, not one who is about to be reborn.🔽“His”: the noble disciple’s, as described above,

original: upapannassa ariyasāvakassa. Yena rūparāgena tattha rūpabhave upapanno, tasmiṃ arūpajjhānena🔽vikkhambhite sammadeva diṭṭhādīnavesu yathā kāmarūpabhavesu āyatiṃ bhavābhilāso na
analyzed: upapannassa ariya sāvakassa yena rūpa rāgena tattha rūpa bhave upapanno tasmin arūpa jjhānena  vikkhambhite sammad eva diṭṭha ādīnavesu yathā kāma rūpa bhavesu āyatim bhava abhilāsaḥ na
translated: who is reborn in the fine-material sphere. When that fine-material jhana has suppressed the fine-material greed by which he was reborn in that fine-material sphere,🔽then, just as in the case of the sensual-sphere and fine-material-sphere existences, so in the case of the immaterial-sphere existence too,

original: bhavissati, evaṃ arūpabhavepīti dassento āha “puna…pe… bhavissatiyevā”ti. Tattha
analyzed: bhavissati evam arūpa bhave pi iti dassentaḥ āha tattha
translated: the desire for existence will not arise again in the future. Showing this, he said, “Again, when a noble disciple … there will be no more …” .🔽Herein, “he is reborn” means he is reborn in the fine-material sphere.

original: nibbattoti rūpadhātuyaṃ upapanno. Ariyamaggaṃ bhāvetvāti heṭṭhimaṃ ariyamaggaṃ sampādetvā.
analyzed: nibbatto ti rūpadhātuyam upapannaḥ ariya maggam bhāvetvā ati heṭṭhimam ariya maggam sampādetvā
translated: “Having developed the noble path”: having perfected the lower noble path.

original: Nibbattabhavādīnavadassanavasenāti tasmiṃ rūpabhave nibbattopi tattheva ādīnavadassanavasena.
analyzed: nibbatta bhava ādīnava dassana vasena āti tasmin rūpa bhave nibbattaḥ api tattha iva ādīnava dassana vasena
translated: “By seeing the danger in the rebirth existence”: by seeing the danger in that fine-material rebirth existence.

original: Anivattitabhavābhilāsoti upari arūpabhave avissaṭṭhabhavapatthano, yato arūpadhātuyaṃ
analyzed: a nivattita bhava abhilāsaḥ ti upari arūpa bhave a vissaṭṭha bhava patthanaḥ yatas
translated: “The desire to return to existence”: the wish to go to the immaterial-sphere existence above, from which he has not yet turned away.

original: upapajjanāraho. Tassa vasenāti tādisassa ariyasāvakassa vasena. “Kassaci pañca, kassaci
analyzed: upapajjana arahaḥ tassa vasena ati tādisassa ariya sāvakassa vasena kassaci pañca kassaci
translated: and he is one who is due to reappear. “By his”: by the noble disciple of such a kind. “Some have five, some have

original: tayo anusayā anusentī”ti ayaṃ yamakapāḷi pavattā.
analyzed: tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti iti ayam yamaka pāḷi pavattā
translated: three underlying tendencies” is the text of the pair of verses.

original: Āyuppamāṇavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the measure of life is ended.

original: 7. Abhiññeyyādivāravaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the section on what is to be directly known, etc.

original: 1030. “Ruppanalakkhaṇaṃ rūpaṃ, anubhavanalakkhaṇā vedanā”tiādinā sāmaññalakkhaṇapariggāhikā. “Phusanalakkhaṇo phasso, sātalakkhaṇaṃ sukha”ntiādinā visesalakkhaṇapariggāhikā.
analyzed: ruppana lakkhaṇam rūpam anubhavana lakkhaṇā vedanā ati ādinā sāmañña lakkhaṇa pariggāhikā phusana lakkhaṇaḥ phassaḥ sāta lakkhaṇam sukham ti ādinā visesa lakkhaṇa pariggāhikā
translated: The kind that discerns the general characteristics is that beginning, “The characteristic of the formed is alteration; the characteristic of feeling is experience” . The kind that discerns the specific characteristics is that beginning, “The characteristic of contact is contacting; the characteristic of pleasure is agreeableness” .

original: “Cattāro khandhā siyā kusalā”tiādīsu idha yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ khandhavibhaṅgādīsu🔽vuttaṃ, tasmā tattha vuttanayeneva gahetabbanti adhippāyo. Sesaṃ yadettha na vuttaṃ,
analyzed: cattāro khandhāḥ siyā kusalā ati ādīsu idha yat vattabbam tam khandha vibhaṅga ādīsu  vuttam tasmā tattha vutta nayena iva gahetabbanti adhippāyaḥ sesam yat ettha na vuttam
translated: In the passages beginning, “The four aggregates may be wholesome” , what should be said here has been said in the Description of the Aggregates, etc.,

original: taṃ suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: tam su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: and so it should be taken in the way stated there. The rest here is easy to understand.

original: Abhiññeyyādivāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: abhiññeyya ādi vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the section on what is to be directly known, etc., is ended.

original: Dhammahadayavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhamma hadaya vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the Dhammasanganī is ended.

original: Iti sammohavinodaniyā ṭīkāya līnatthavaṇṇanā
analyzed: iti sammohavinodaniyā ṭīkāya līnatthavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the words in the Minor Readings,

original: Vibhaṅga-anuṭīkā samattā.
analyzed: vibhaṅga anuṭīkā samattā
translated: The sub-commentary on the Vibhaṅga is finished.
